review_content: I loved this at first, fresh, dewy realistic…the dry down not soo much. It’s still realistic but I’m getting jasmine on a cold windy day and the scent has become masculine on me.

jasmine used to be one of my favourite scents. this one smells pure and honest - i hate when they taint jasmines with sweet notes like vanilla or disco sugar or some shit. it's not a bouquet, but a corsage. it'd go well with your cool-toned complexion, sensible lunch order, and an office job in a male-dominated field that you need a masters degree for.

I'm loving this. A dewy and green sweet jasmine. Not unique, but wonderful. It truly smells like the plant. It's just indolic enough to smell realistic without being headache inducing. I like it a lot 8/10
It’s blooming jasmine with the stem and leaf thrown in. Kinda dewy green jasmine.
linear jasmine that is great for layering. does just smell like jasmine + a fixative tho
Lovely complex Jasmine at first, but sadly dried down very (baby) powdery & babywipelike on me. I love jasmine scents & would give this another try if the opportunity presents itself!

A plain innocent jasmine. A delicate white flower on it's bush of lush green leaves. It's soft, airy and a bit sappy. All the things you would expect from a soliflore. The scent is linear and simple, making it a great layering option.

I love jasmine. There is NOTHING that I don't like about a jasmine scent. This is the perfect layering option to incorporate a simple jasmine into the scent. It's like laying down in a bed of blooms and covering yourself in it. Beautiful.
This is Southern California in late spring. Everywhere you go, you smell the jasmine blooms. Incredibly photorealistic

For me this sent is pretty straightforward and a bit old-fashioned. Smells sweet with a little hint of black pepper on me. Sits close to the skin, quite long lasting though. Wouldn’t use it, but if you like good old jasmine it may be your go to

Lovely airy jasmine. I could see it being layered over a nice tea scent to up the earthy florals I associate with jasmine, or cheriosa 59 to amp up this sweet sensual vibe. Nothing much else to say just a solid white floral.

I own Jasmine sambac & marigold by jo melone and jasminum sambac chloé , first one smells jasmine on my skin and it's really lovely but second one smells more tuberose on my skin and it's not the one that i have expected.it's fresher than jo melone.Maybe it's better to try it before purchasing a 50 ml format.I sell mine (50ml) in EU which i used just 2 sprays.

I have been really impressed with this collection from Chloe. So far I have Vanilla Planifolia (which I absolutely love), Jasmin Sambac, Ylang Cananga, Herba Mimosa, Magnolia Alba and Cedrus (the only one I’m unsure of). I find them very light, airy, delicate and feminine.

Jasmin Sambac has a beautiful, soft, freshness to it. It actually reminds me a bit of Angeli di Firenze by Santa Maria Novella, which is one of my favourite spring scents. This is softer and not as soapy, but overall this is a beautiful scent. I’m pleased to have it in my collection. It’s a perfect freshie for spring and summer.
@jasonx smells 100% pure Jasmin Sambac. Tuberose is totally something else.
I feel like it kinda smell's like jo malone's wild bluebell in the opening, then the sweet fruityness goes away and leave a really nice airy jasmine :D
This is such a beautiful Jasmine perfume. Very demure, light and airy. Doesn’t last the whole day, maybe 3-4 hours, and it’s very intimate but such a beautiful floral 😍 love it
Yum, tried at SFO duty free and LOVE. So light and airy and femme, like walking by the jasmine bush on my street at its most delicious and fragrant
This doesn't smell like Sambac Jasmin at all. Instead it smells like tuberose, very similar to Do Son by Diptyque but much lighter.

I rarely write reviews, but I felt compelled to add my thoughts for this beautiful youthful jasmine.
It isn't complicated, it is just pure , white, fresh jasmine. Chloe have captured the real essence of a jasmine bush here, beautifuly done. Fresh, green, sweet and airy. It has a very clean aura. I plant jasmine wherever I have lived and I aways place my garden chair underneath it. I will happily sit out there on a warm summer evening and just inhale all of her glorious sweetness as I gaze at the stars. I have searched everywhere for such a realistic jasmine perfume. But they always lean towards the heady, skanky, creamy blend of jasmine that you find in most floral fragrances. Well, I can now end my search! Chloe have absolutely nailed this one. I am sitting here in my English garden, in 32⁰C heat. A cold glass of white wine in hand and beautiful aura of jasmine all around me. I feel fresh, beautiful and feminine. I suppose you could combine this with any of your other fragrances to add some sparkle and sweetness, but she is quite naturally beautiful all by herself!
A Very pretty, elegant fragrance. Well done chloe.

I have an Arabian jasmine bush in my bedroom that I adore, I could smell the blooms forever and ever. So, of course, I searched for a perfume that smelled the same. After months of searching and plenty of samples purchased, I blind bought this perfume. I don't regret it one bit. This is the closest any Jasmine Sambac perfume I've tried has come to the real thing. This is a gorgeous, fresh jasmine bloom in a bottle. Perfect for layering or wearing alone :)

After sampling over 20+ fragrances in search of the perfect Jasmine scent for Spring, I have finally found it! Jasminum Sambac by Chloé is the most beautiful portrayal of Jasmine. It is airy, soft, bright, fresh, dewy and clean, evoking the sensation of strolling through a blooming jasmine garden on a cool, crisp morning. The scent lingers delicately on the skin throughout the day without overwhelming the senses. The sillage is moderate, projecting just enough to leave a subtle trail without being overpowering. As it settles, hints of delicate citrus notes emerge, adding a refreshing twist. The dry down reveals a very soft, subtle, woody undertone, grounding the fragrance and giving it a delicate depth. This fragrance truly embodies the essence of springtime and is a perfect choice for those who appreciate the pure beauty of jasmine without any hint of the indolic sourness or heaviness so often found in Jasmine scents. It's a delightful olfactory journey. Absolutely beautiful!

I've never been a jasmine fan, I found all of the mass market fragrances to be too sweet and cloying and they effectively all smell the same to me. I recently went for a Kobido face massage and my esthetician used jasmine oil on my face and I was immediately hooked. It's currently really hot where I live and the green aspect of this simple jasmine scent felt wonderfully refreshing. Once I was out of the spa, I started looking for a clean jasmine perfume and chose this one. It's fabulous! Clean, green, shiny, a little watery - smells like Tata Harper beauty products. It's simple but you can feel some dimension overtime. It stays on for a good few hours. It's my new go to fragrance for those hot summer days. Recommended.

This is beautiful! Soft, floral delicate goodness! A bit of jasmine and a lot of tuberose, the green kind. I was about to turn back to the shop and buy it, when it hit me: it smells just like Roger & Gallet Tubereuse Hedonie, which I have and love. I’m glad I don’t need to buy it :)

This perfume is a pure jasmine delight! It's so lovely and realistic smelling, with a lovely white floral freshness and indolic character to it. I could imagine Princess Jasmine from Aladdin really loving this perfume. It's super feminine and exotic smelling, which I love.

I feel like a princess when I wear this and it makes me feel so beautiful and sophisticated, but youthful at the same time. I think men would love the smell of this on a woman for sure. It would make the perfect perfume to wear on a date, whether it be on the first or the third. I could imagine wearing it to a party or a ball as well. It's very multi-purpose!

It has moderate strength and wear and it lasts about 5 hours on me. I feel like I'm in a beautiful jasmine garden in India or Sri Lanka when I wear this and I could imagine patting my own pet tiger just like Princess Jasmine did in Aladdin, ready to find my own prince charming.

This is on my want list. I love the opulent clean smell of jasmine but don’t think I like tuberose. Does everyone get this smell? I’m selling my bottle of linterdit that I’ve only just bought as I decided after the fact I cannot tolerate tuberose for a length of time. It’s I want the purity of this jasmine but do not want tuberose to overshadow it? Is it just because they're both strong white florals?
My every day scent! Even though it’s just one note, I still think it has depth (much like fresh jasmine does!). Definitely doesn’t smell cheap and works great on its own or layered over other scents

Given to me on a blotter as I left Selfridges.. I just looked it up n it's now out of stock on the website.. I guess they managed to sell it all off after pushing it yesterday then. Ah well. Husband loved it the most out of all the samples n blotters I brought back. This is always the way. It is/was, a lovely fresh non-indolic (or v v lightly, first hit maybe) jasmine, slightly sparkly quality. Beautiful, recommend.
The dried down is so beautiful, like a real jasmin sambac flower. that's all.

The initial spray instantly reminded me of Guerlain Lys Soleia, but less creamy/yellow floral, and more green/dewy. Then I looked at the "Reminds me of..." section and I saw Jo Malone Wild Bluebell and thought "No way. That's far from Lys Soleia", but then I kept smelling it and realized that, in deed, it is very close to Wild Bluebell.

I'd describe this scent as a combination of Wild Bluebell and Lys Soleia. I own both, so I don't see a need to purchase this. This is a great scent, nevertheless. Light and versatile. Reminds me of summer vacation in Southeast Asia. It's office appropriate as well.

I love the bottle design and texture of the cap.

This is Exquisite ! Smells like the new born white blossom on the morning, with moist dew and leaf.
The scent is very light and airy, in the same time maintains good projection and longevity which is impressive.
But the big problem for me is Jasmine is only a supporting role in here 0_0
Towards the dry-down, the white floral scent mostly provided by Tuberose.

Strongly agree with comments below:
1. Don't blind buy it if you hate Tuberose 2. It is a light version of Do Son

A beautiful creation from Chloe. Although I am not an ardent devotee of jasmin this is an exquisitely light and fresh version of this note. It surprised me pleasantly and it felt like I was walking through a Parisian garden after a light midsummer rain. It embodies the romantic, laid back-hobo style of Chloe brand, I really enjoyed testing this fragrance.

I love it. It’s very strong and very long lasting. It lasts more than 14 hours on me. It’s beautiful and not shrill, but I smell an awful lot of Tuberose in here! I love Tuberose so I’m happy with this perfume but be forewarned if Tuberose is not your thing! Not blind buy safe.

I only smell wet grass. I’m so upset and disappointed. I’m glad I didn’t cave and blind buy a full bottle and instead I just went for a 5ml decant. The amount of times I put the bottle in my cart and took it out…haha. Man. This sucks. I had such high hopes.
The only floral perfume that my boyfriend like on me. It’s fresh and light.
This is a very nice smell with a Do Son vibe but with slightly lighter.
Wonderful smell of bright and fresh jasmine. Got many compliments.
Intensely feminine red rose.
Isn't this a limited edition from 2011 (and then replaced by Roses De Chloe in 2013)? Are we sure these reviews are about the right fragrance?

This is extremely elegant, refined, dignified to my nose because of how the florals are balanced with the amber and the woods. The sweetness is derived only from the natural sweet of the fresh florals, no added overdone saccharine sweetness, the rose melds beautifully with the magnolia and the lily so that the scent is open and heady without being screechy, high pitched or soapy detergent like. The amber is discreet and not overbearing, adding a touch of sensual grounding without weighing down the florals and smothering them in any way, it warms the scent and keeps it from being icy cold within the floral freshness. The cedar is also restrained and serves to ground everything above without suffocating anything in a hamster cage shaving way. It gives enough complexity without covering any floral freshness. So then that is why I consider the incredible balance achieved in this particular fragrance to make it very refined and graceful and dignified. Nothing is jarring, nothing is shocking or grating or irritating even when smelling a long time through complete dry down.

I love the way this fragrance lasts and projects. Ladylike, a modern rose, polished and fresh floral. Layered today by adding ROSEFIRE by Hermetica and EVELYN ROSE by Crabtree & Evelyn. Rose lover dream.

It's nice and lasts about 4 hours on my skin which is good for a perfume. But it's a dead ringer for Balenciaga Florabotanica. Not Rosabotanica. Florabotanica.
I'm wearing each on a different arm and they are identical. Chloe is a bit softer. That's the only difference on me. That being said, it's a pretty green scent with the rose coming through just enough to know it's there. A good choice for Summer and muggy weather. It also fades much faster than Florabotanica which lasts 5 plus hours on me.
The verdict? I won't buy again until I can no longer find The Florabotanica. It's been discontinued and this is a very good replacement when the other is no longer available.

What a luscious, fresh bouquet with a hint of green in the background coming from the lovely lily-of-the-valley. This is an amazing spring scent especially on a rainy day. When I wear it, I really feel as if I had been transported to the Parisian rose gardens. Makes me feel pretty no matter what and definitely a compliment gatherer! Too bad this was a limited edition launch--the very similar-looking Roses de Chloe is more rosy, less fresh and not as fantastic.

I have never been able to properly describe the Chloe EDP which this perfume is based upon, so excuse my lack of artistry with words. I describe this as just like the original Chloe EDP but take away some of the fruity-candy sweetness and replace it with a rose scent. The rose here is not very green, like a fresh rose, but still very identifiable as rose.
rose rose an old rose- not complex, it's very simple and old fashioned smell - the rose in it is heavy and something that my granny would like.
This was a beautiful rich deep rose. Very elegant and special. Pity it was limited.

I sprayed a generous amount of this, couldn't smell it, and sprayed a lot more, and then still couldn't smell it. I've been accused of ruining my sense of smell by all the perfums I wear. But I've sprayed the following fragrances on today and smell them loud and clear: Escada Rockn' Rio, Jil Sander Sun, and Very Irresistible. If you have the same problem with the Chloe Rose, check out my profile since I have many in-your-face roses. My favs are Montale Aoud Queen Roses, DSH American Beauty, Diptyque Eau Rose, the Rosines, Lady Vengeance ... oh and my absolute fav Guerlain Rose Barbare.

YES YES YES!
Every chloe perfume starts a bit old lady like smell but after half an hour "you are transfered" in a garden,sprintime, full of flowers the very first moments that sun starts caressing them full of humidity and liveness so divine, so ....
I am not a fun of floral perfumes but my nose tells me different when i smell those great perfumes!
The best floral perfumes in the market!....

This is the third Chloe I own and I have to say that there is something very "Chloe" about this rose edition. I find it to be more on the sharp side like Chloe Eau de Chloe with the green ribbon. I also don't get much rose from it, as I think the magnolia and amber blunt it. It is a very breezy and fresh scent. Certainly nothing overtly rosy or powdery about it. I believe the cedar in it makes it smell a bit sour on my skin. This will be the perfect rose scent for those who are looking for something easy and breezy and fresh, or those who are just now exploring rose fragrances who are leery of a full blown, blousey rich rose.
Sillage is moderate.
Longevity is long lasting.

$59 at Marshalls for the EDP, CHLOE ROSE EDITION smells like the pretty girl at sleepaway camp, the one with the best bedding and hair. She's the girl you grew up wanting to be and the woman who you can be now. What a wonderful reminder.
This one was good from what I remember, but I really prefer the new 2013/2014 version of Roses De Chloe, IMO.

I like this in the beginning: the rose is very well balanced between rose, fresh and mildly sweet. Then the rose smell almost goes away on me and I'm left with mostly fresh, which smells much like the cold freshness in Marry Me by Lanvin. I'm not a big fan, but I still like it. My boyfriend think this perfume is really nice though, and he almost never likes perfumes. To me this is like a mix between Marry Me an Aqua Allegoria Flora Rosa, which also has that tea rose, but it also has a little bit of sourness, which this doesn't have.

I never write reviews but I wanted to point out that this is by no means the same as the EDP in another bottle. This is a different scent that keeps a similarity to it's predecesor.
To me this is the perfected version of the EDP, less peppery, less powdery, fresher yet still classy and not a water-downed version of the original.

I found the original a bit overpowering because of its "powdery-ness" at times. This is what I wanted the EDP to be all along. Too bad it's not permanent. A shame.

Love it.

This perfume is breathtaking and classic. I personally love rose, but I know that some people tend to think it's too "old ladyish". There is just a hint of it in this perfume which allows for it to still be light and flirty.

I'm in love. I'm so glad I got this. It's the perfect little pre college graduation present to myself :)

Chloe Rose Edition is similar to the original Chloe EDP, yet slightly different. I feel like this version really does have a bit of a heavier emphasis on the rose note. However, it has been quite a while since I have tested the original.

A soft sweet bouquet of roses is what I smell when I wear this. It is not a dark deep red rose bouquet, more like a lighter mixture or pink and yellow roses. Chloe Rose Edition is young, light hearted, and just the right amount of sophistication not to be deemed childish. It is a sweet rose, yet it manages to be fresh and clean. The amber in this version seems to be a little powdery and compliments the rose perfectly, while allowing the note to last longer on the skin. Cedar is present here but it so faint that it is almost difficult to even pick up on it. Nothing too crazy going on here, but it is pleasent and extremely easy to enjoy.

I’m really enjoying this version of Chloe, though the Intense version will always be my true love. Chloe Rose Edition is great for when I want to wear something lighter and a little more girly. The lasting power it pretty good. It does not have a heavy sillage, but it is present and is more quiet and subdued fragrance to me. I have a feeling if you have the original EDP that a person might not necessarily need this version as well. Though it you have the intense version and want something a little lighter, but is still Chloe then I recommend this. Also if you have the EDT and are looking for something heavier this is a great choice.

I might update this is I ever get around to doing a proper comparison with the original EDP. ^_^

This is a very beautiful rose scent. I find it different from the Chloe EDP, which I did not like, and here is why. This rose edition lacks the peony and freesia notes and the litchee of the original Chloe EDP which made it a bit too sweet for me. This one, with just the rose, magnolia, amber and cedar is a lighter, fresher scent that I like very much. I wish it weren't quite so rose-centric since it does make you smell a bit like a bouquet of roses for the first 2 or 3 hours (not necessarily a bad thing) but the other notes come out to play and blend nicely after about 4 hours and it remains a gorgeous fresh ambery rose and magnolia with a soupcon of cedar for the rest of the day. Longevity of this one on my skin is very good. This fragrance lasts a good 8 hours on my skin with some sillage and a nice skin scent thereafter.

I still like the Chloe Chloe EDP Intense best of all the Chloe flankers, but this is very lovely as well.
if you already own the edp, don't bother with this....unless you really like the pink ribbon. same juice...different ribbon
If someone has this for swap please contact me. Thank you :-)
i think it smells much more better than the original, although i do adore the original, and it has a nicer dry down. a sweeter base which is, i find, more long lasting
Nice soft floral with notes of original and intense Chloe. Light with longevity, good for hot summer days.

This perfume is similar to the original chloe with a rosey note piercing through. I recently purchased a bottle for my Mom's Wedding anniversary gift in 6 months...at $30 how could I resist!!!

Impression: the original chloe sweept through a bush of roses

Office safe: yes
Timing: all year long / days and evenings
Cost: $49 - $30 (red tag sale) for 50 ml / 1.69 oz at Winners / TJ Maxx

Disclaimer: my experience may be different from your experience based on my skin type, the season, and my personal tastes
Even though I don't like perfumes with a strong dominant rose note,this one has caught my attention..Smells like a pure , high quality rose oil. The scent is very deep ,it lasts the whole day!

LOVE this so much but I cannot bring myself to part with the original as it is the first perfume I fell in love with and was like..this is it this is my scent. but this is a very close second.

Unique, classy, sophisticated with a vintage feel. For the girl who has her own style, an edge, who is girly and lovely and loves flowers and all things natural.

Beautify and yummy scent!!!!! xoxoxoxo

AMAZING!


- - end of story - -

I am going to take back what I said about this being soapy and old lady. It is intensely fresh, lovely, clean, and soft. I love love love it. I get so many compliments on it. It is one of the few fragrances without warm accords in it that I own and it wears wonderfully. Lasts quite a while. I am a convert!
Cheira a nada com coisa alguma. Não: na realidade cheira a folha de papel ofício. Muito alarde por nada, e extremamente decepcionante...

At last I was able to get a bottle of Chloe Rose Edition. I am not disappointed at all.
Rose and Magnolia... Magnolia being one of my favorite flowers. I think that rose edition suits me much better than the original Chloe EDP. On my skin Chloe EDP develops a metallic note which highly annoys me. It might be litchi, because I noticed this happened with several fragrances containing litchi.
But Chloe Rose Edition is absolutely perfect. It's an everyday fresh, elegant and easy-to-wear fragrance.
I think it shares similarities with my beloved Florabotanica, though the latter is a much spicier and original thanks to carnation and mint.
Anyway sometimes despised flankers reveal much better than their originals... that's just my humble opinion of course!

Rose, rose everywhere! - is the best way to describe this perfume. Its very similar to Chloe by Chloe EDP, but NOT the same. Rose is bright, like bulgarian rose, and I can feel amber right next to it. Absolutely YES! for rose lovers. Charming!

This is certainly not the same as the original. It's the bottle design that is the same, not the fragrance. This fragrance smells a bit more youthful than the original [I'm 23 and the original is a bit too 'grandmother-y' for my taste]. I love rose so I had to try this one. It's a light floral with rose notes and I really enjoy it.
it's better than the original. can't love it more!!!

Compared to the EDT version, I prefer this one. It's softer and has less of that peppery sharp note. Ironically, the staying power is better with the EDT, while Chloe Rose Edition doesn't last that much.

It's very much like original Chloe but with a stronger rose note. I really like it. Staying power is great. Unforitunately my husband is allergic to all Chloes - just all of them, maybe it's some component not sure which. But I wear it anyway, just staying in a different room :)

Tested on my skin yesterday and found it EXACTLY the same as the original Chloe EDP. I have a mini Chloe EDP and I think it doesn't work with my chemistry, it becomes sharp and generic on my skin and sometimes it gives me a headache. Therefore, all I have to say is that if reformulation is needed, then it must be done properly-a change in the concentration of the initial ingredients is the first thing that has to be done.
This one has the same intensity and the same feeling as the Chloe EDP. Too bad !

The Rose edition is the EDP, so the reviewers who say this is a different scent maybe are familiar with the EDT? To my nose, the EDP and EDT are distinctly different. Also, different jasmine crops, rose-growing seasons, etc. may account for others noticing a different fragrance in Rose. Perfume formulations change all the time. I wish I hadn't missed trying this Rose edition for myself.

..o my.... this is the SAME EXACT SCENT. straight off the nordstrom website:
"Celebrate the enchanting and sensual essence of spring with the original Chloé Eau de Parfum, in this limited-edition packaging tied with a rose-colored bow"

they added a friggin bow to it people, the smell is the same. *le sigh

It is not the same as the original. I love the original but somehow cant wear it, smells like grandma on me, TOO floral. But i like it when my friend wears it. But rose edition is MY chloe:D great as an office perfume.

This version is still quite sophisticated but also really creamy and a tad soapy. I can imagine in a hot country it would become cloying so I would keep this one for the cooler months. Its pretty but I'm im just not a fan of magnolia in anything - maybe that's what puts me off. A well made fragrance but not for me! :)

I thought this smelled exactly like the original. when I first saw the pink ribbon I thought maybe it was for breast cancer awareness or something..
A pretty scent.. just like the original.

Chloe Rose Edition smells rather similar to the original Chloe. I was a bit disappointed at first to be completely honest. I guess I expected something more rosy and fresh rather than soapy and strong.

I wasn't a fan of the original Chloe, so I'm finding it difficult to enjoy this flanker. The roses are of course more pronounced in this fragrance, however I tend to smell a lot of peony and freesia too. It smells too much like stuffy floral-scented soaps for my liking.

As a child I used to use a rose-scented talcum powder after my baths, and in some ways Chloe Rose Edition reminds me of that smell. It's not a cringe-worthy scent, but to my nose it comes across as being dusty and ancient. It's what I'd imagine a period-style house smelling like.

I prefer roses when they're more jammy and concentrated; not so clean and pristine. However I have no doubt that this fragrance will have many fans, as many as the original has. Chloe Rose Edition is just not for me.

The longevity was impressive, and the sillage somewhere between cloying and being acceptable. It's a pretty straight-forward scent, so I'd advise only to approach if you liked the original 2008 release of Chloe EDP.

There is something quite sweet about this version of Chloe. Although everything pretty much lines up with the Original Eau De Parfum- from the First initial burst of rose to the sweet and faint drydown but there is a sweetness about this scent that makes it quite innocent and feel like its quite young in a sense and i say that because when I smell this I think of innocent girls running through fields of flowers and getting their white cotton dresses dirty. I like the earthy element of this edition although it is essentially the Original scent with a new pretty bow. But I couldnt resist purchasing this edition of Chloe. That bottle is just to beautiful not to have (again)
Even though it is vey simillar to the original perfume, it is not the same. But if you love the original Chloe, you will probably love this one, too. I love it, and I'm wearing it right now. :)
lighter, fresher, more rosy, and not as long lasting as the edt or edp.

As posted on the Nordstrom website:

"Celebrate the enchanting and sensual essence of spring with the original Chloé Eau de Parfum, in this limited-edition packaging tied with a rose-colored bow."

Same juice, new bow.
I adore this. It's slightly stronger and sweeter than the original Chloe, and the smell of rose stands out a little more. I have switched this one to my signature.

This perfume is EXACTLY THE SAME as the Edp.

I saw this at Nordstrom and asked if they had a tester. The salesperson grabbed the regular bottle and was about to spray me, but I said, "No! I want to try the rose edition. Do you have a tester of that?" He said the fragrance is exactly the same as the original, but they put a pink bow on it as a special edition for Spring.

Nordstrom's description says this is the "original Chloe Eau de Parfum," which means it's the exact same liquid as the regular EDP, and the description also specifically says "limited edition packaging."

This version of Chloe is pretty close to the original, it just seemed a tad fresher and more likely to catch the heart of those who didn't fall for Chloe and the intense EDP. Or is this the placebo effect of the pink bow? I usually stray from scents that showcase the rose, but this is actually a very tender wet type of rose surrounded by other buds here and there. The opening is fresh and juicy, I believe there must be some red fruit involved. The middle is deeper, flowery and rosey. I'm amazed by how amber stood out on my skin towards the drydown, but thats what happens when I wear the original. It really adds some serious depth to the scent and rounds out the watery feeling of the floral mid-stage. The aquatic notes are bordering an artificial feeling, but it's barely detectable. This is a potent perfume and the lasting power is very good.I'm starting to like it a lot, because it doesn't have this melancholic vibe of the original version, which I love. A very cheerful fragrance.

For me, the original EDP and EDT were rosy enough as is. The beauty of these fragrances was exactly in the un-mundane interpretation and framing of the rose element. Here, in the new 'rose' version, you can definitely feel the added rose, but it's a straighforward rose scent that I think just simplifies the entire fragrance and takes away everything we love about this line of Chloe. I just can't get why they decided to go and ruin a what was already a great thing. Dissappointing!

I was so excited to try this new one because I have loved the original Chloe EDP for a few years now, and I'm also loving the more recent Love, Chloe. (Love, love, love! Over-use of the word, but justified in this case.) They both work beautifully with my chemistry -- they have never turned sour or over-sweet on me the way so many others have done.
So I eagerly sprayed some on my wrist, thinking "Yay! Another Chloe to love!!".
But it smelled just like the original on me: lovely, smokey-rosey, rich in both senses of the word -- and I already have it. Sigh.
At least I saved my $90 plus tax.

I haven't tried the original, so I can't compare them, but I liked it. First I couldn't notice the rose which I desire to sniff ,I think because of the other scents in the store. When I got out for fresh air, I realized the rose. It's elegant and visible but not striking.

I tested this today after recently buying the original and I can tell the difference but it's very subtle and I think the original is far more balanced. The rose that's been emphasised in this one is more like synthetic rose talc than a pure heady rose and that seems to dominate the other notes, so I'm very pleased I went for the original.
Like lucifera said, its the same Chloe fragrance in a slightly different packaging :/

I had the change to try this, IMHO its just like the original but they just put a pink ribbon on the bottle instead of the original, didn't smelled the rose..
i'd stick to the original ;-)

a midnight summer's dream...its so beautiful and dreamy. i imagine lying down on pillows on a roof and storytelling in marrakech. this scent inspired something in me. good blend of spice, vanilla, floral...i cant pinpoint any note clearly. beautiful creation
This is gorgeous. A modern day TF velvet orchid but the performance is abysmal!
Immediate love, masterfully blended. I blind bought a full bottle and it is wonderful. Performance is below average, however.

tried a tester of this on a whim and fell immediately in love. spritz on my wrist, inner elbows, and behind my ears, and i was getting compliments all day. felt absolutely fabulous. very warm, sweet scents, subtle powder notes which i absolutely love. it leans a little more feminine but the musk notes kind of bring it more towards unisex for me. unfortunately quite spenny so i'm dropping hints to friends and family for gift ideas.

Beautiful Beautiful boozy vanilla. Such a sophisticated, elegant and evening vanilla. So so good!

Vanilla galore with rum and a hint of styrax (almost cookie like).

Patchouli is almost nonexistent on my skin but rounds the scent perfectly.

Cold weather scent for sure!

Orchidee de Minuit by Chloe is what I call a masterfully executed, mass appealing and super likeable warm, ambery, vanilla based perfume with floral, boozy and patchouli nuances. It’s nothing special as far as the notes listed are, but the scent smells super appealing and addictive. It’s very designer like, nothing in it that makes me think it’s worth the price, performance including, but I find it so elegant and beautiful that I would consider buying it.

It has something very catchy and interesting in the way it has been composed, that I find very beautiful and classy.

Despite being nothing new, it has that addictive smell that I find myself drawn to. There are some perfumes that are nothing groundbreaking but smell so good to me that I can’t stop thinking about them. Orchidee de Minuit falls in this category!

100% a feminine scent. All ages appropriate, excluding teens because of its price, don’t think many could afford to buy it. Dumb reach type of perfume that feels appropriate for most occasions.

One of my favorites in my 100 perfume collection, definitely top 3. The scent is very unique and at the same time extremely wearable, i have used up 1/2 of the bottle already and bought a back up yesterday. Good price, good scent, highly recommended.

Well blended Oriental floral - a soft boozy floral, more balanced take in the vein of TF Black Orchid which is too dry for me, I don't see a resemblance to Black Opium. I really enjoy ODM thus far, to me this is something I'd wear on a night out. A well composed fragrance, if this was a colour, it would be amethyst. It reminds of fragrances from yonder past in a good way.

This opens with a very vintage smell. I don’t know what notes I’m smelling but it’s not to my taste. The dry down is a bit better and it does become a skin scent relatively quickly, but there’s a note that just doesn’t agree with me. I find this scent really dry and a bit nauseating. Maybe it’s the styrax and cloves, I’m not sure but it’s a hard pass for me.

Midnight velvet, heavy with secrets, has unfurled with a rich swirl of dark rum and balsamic sweetness. It clings to the air—to The Tendril of your being—like candle wax dripping down its candelabra, dense and unwavering. The vanilla, if you can even call it that, pulsing beneath it all (and there is no better word to describe this than ALL) is thick and heady, unyielding and sultry, in an almost animal-like carnality. This is what I imagine dark room full of whispered confessions would smell like—feel like. Like a weight that lingers long after it’s gone, like a depth perhaps a sliver intoxicating, but in the way spirits are to an alcohol intolerant. Too bold, too heavy, too much. For me, this midnight bloom is more a shadow I’d rather leave behind, fearful of its tendencies to suffocate and veil.

Such a beautiful scent for all seasons
but weak performance😞

A ravishing ambery vanilla, Orchidée de Minuit cocoons you in gauzy layers of spice with a delicate floral undertone. It is translucent and warm, threaded through with tantalizing cloves (and a hint of nutmeg) against a backdrop of rum poured over a creamy vanilla. Vanilla pulls dark and languid on my skin, its piquant sweetness reminding me of French custard but with a sheer ambery glaze, like a mix of eclairs and creme brûlée, the gourmand tones offset by the smoky ambered patchouli.

The orchid brings a velveteen floral dimension, its balmy aroma a fantasy of plush, enveloping notes. It softens the styrax, benzoin and vanilla accord, lending the scent a suave, powdery texture. It also sets off the mysterious, carnal darkness of the base, making the flambéed quality of the ambery and woody notes come through in all their glory. The rum is present throughout, adding a voluptuous boozy nuance, which, to me, reminds of the boozy notes in my other date night staple—Voyage A Paris.

To me, Orchidée de Minuit is the ideal Friday night fume—voluptuous, sultry and ever so tempting. And while not exactly a powerhouse, it creates a diffuse cloud of scent, cloaking you in the most delicious aroma that lingers for the entirety of the night.

Ambery and warm spicy, prominent patchouli in the base. It is transparent and has just a tad of sweetness. It is nice but I would have preferred more vanilla in the base. Feminine leaning to my nose. Projection and longevity are quite weak and close wearing. Had really high hopes but I will pass.

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content: very thin very weak smelling, its so faint , old sample tested

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content:
Soft but strong, sweet but sexy.
Si Belle tell another story compare to the original version. This one reminds me of a confident woman who is fearless and ready to open any door to see the new world.
It's a pretty floral scent with a twist. Birch leaf gives some dusty feeling to the floral and creamy base is so gorgeous. Unfortunately, it's limited edition so I cannot wear it as much as I want. Common, Chloe!! Why did you do that to all of your amazing fragrances?!

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content:
I don’t get any white florals in this even after the dry down.
On initial spray you get .. Citrus , Bitter orange , with faint woody amber notes
On the dry down you’re left with only the citrus .. sourness ?
Personally don’t like the sour notes for the summer🥲 because in my country we get so much humidity so I prefer more fresh light perfumes.

I currently use it for layering with other perfumes.

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content: Very pretty scent. I fell in love with Chloe because of this scent. It smells like a clean rose fragrance and I’m here for it.

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content: It is more than avarage floral fruity perfumes out there. The birch gives it some smokiness. The notes are blended well and it is quite a classy type of clean floral fruity smell.

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content: Induced a headache for me instantly.

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content: Kinda strong for me really. Its very overwhelming. Thid is one that will prolly give me a headache. The top notes are too strong

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content:
It is a very nice floral scent! It opens up with white flowers- gardenia, jasmine and they are quite dominant here in a beautiful way. I do not feel any chemical scent here. Perfume really has oils of those flowers..feels like in a flower shop when you sniff the gardenia flowers there. But I do not feel rose here, neither vanilla. Perhaps there is a scent of an orange blossom, its just mixes and creates a trio: gardenia-jasmine-orange blossom. Birch leaf is really here.
It is enough for to spray it couple of times, or even 1 time (do not apply it on the neck or too close to the nose although,it can occur light flowery dizziness.) and then for awhile you gonna feel this white flowery bomb! Lasts quite for a long time, several hours, on the hair till you wash them.

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content: I've had this for three years after blind-buying it from the clearance section of Marshall's. I have to admit I knew very little about fragrance at the time and this was probably the third fragrance I'd ever bought. I've come to love this one, even though I was initially repulsed by the combination of leather and extreme greenness. However! That, as well as the admittedly very strong gardenia, have kept me coming back to this scent time and time again, although I could never use it daily. It's just too strong and even sharp for that. Mentally, I've labeled it my bad-bitch perfume, and it's really done wonders for my sanity in periods where I've felt heartbroken or uncertain about what I'm doing, which is often, to be honest. I'm so glad I picked it up.

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content:
I adore Chloe as a brand and enjoy the majority of their fragrances, particularly Love, Chloe and my signature Narcisse with its rich, syrupy pitted fruits and its decadent spiced floral sweetness. Si Belle, however, makes my skin crawl and my stomach turn and is the first perfume I have EVER scrubbed from my skin.

I'm so sorry, but this is nothing but screechy, awful artificial gardenia with a pungent, astringent, nose hair burning greenness reminiscent of a cheap air freshener or something equally horrifying. I am so upset because I tried to like this, but I simply can't deceive myself.

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content: This is a clean and elegant scent. The opening is slightly fruity, but not too much; the heart is floral (gardenia mixed with neroli), but not overpowering. It's very well-balanced with green notes, which give it a nice freshness. The dry-down shows some wood and musk, but it's still airy. All in all, it's a very balanced and well-made perfume that is also versatile: daytime and evening wear. Sillage is good and has good staying power (on the skin and on clothes).

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content: Once again I find myself at Marshall's in their beauty department. As I'm doing a walk-by of the perfume tower, I saw this one and I bought it thinking it was the original See by Chloe. When I got home I saw at the bottom of the box the SI BELLE and I said what?? How did I miss that!? I've been able to use it twice and I must say it is very nice. It is a scent that I believe can be worn by a variety of ages and it fit so well without being labeled too young or too old. On me it is woody and looking at the notes it's probably that birch leaf in it. It is floral for sure. When I smell it straight from the bottle it also has a clean scent to it almost like a very expensive laundry detergent. I'm probably crazy though and the only one that thinks that. The bottle is super cute! It is in the shape of a birdhouse and has orangey pink stripes running down it. So was it worth $24.99? Yep, smells good to me!

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content: Dancing white floral combo on a bed of citrus. Very appealing and feminine. Perfect for an outdoor summer party.

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content: It's a heavily floral scent that floral lovers might love, but not so much floral lovers would find a bit overpowering. Something in this fragrance makes you think it's an old lady scent. You should spray it really lightly to enjoy it. It's a "little bit on the wrist and a drop on the neck" kind of perfume. I found it very similar to Wisteria from Crabtree&Evelyn. I totally feel the reviews on love&hate. This is the kind of perfume that might give headaches to some. Risky for a blind buy.

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content:
This reminds me of a leather jacket drenched in rose-dominated floral perfume. I'm a huge gardenia fan and why I can't smell it in this fragrance, I'm not sure. This was a blind buy but I don't regret it. I realize rose and leather aren't a big part of the composition but it's almost all I get!

It was quite bitter when I first sprayed it. I don't find it subtle! I find it to evoke a dominant and perhaps somewhat standoffish femininity. I want to wear it when it is bitterly cold - in the heat it would be too suffocating. After a few hours on my skin, it loses a great deal of its bitter edge and becomes a more inviting floral. There is just a hint of warm spiciness that comes out under the flowers, which is a lovely sensation. It hasn't lost its potency and it definitely won't let me forget that I'm wearing it.

This fragrance is far more dominant than I prefer most of the time, but I am growing into this one. It wasn't what I was looking for, but it's what I wanted... if you can make sense of that!

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content: It nice but quite strong on me. I prefer to wear it on a night out.

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content:
A fresh and "clean" scent, perfect for daytime or office. Light, Airy Gardenia mixed with Neroli and Orangeblossom. In base nice musk. The Birch makes it feel less syrupsweet in a good way. Timeless - perfect for teenagers and adult - who just likes white flowers/musk scent.

En fräsch och "ren" doft. Perfekt för dagtid eller kontoret. Lätt, luftig Gardenia i mix med Neroli och Apelsinblomma. Musken framträder i basen. Björken tonar ner de sirapssöta noterna från blommorna, vilket är bra. Tidlös - perfekt doft för både tonåringen och den vuxna kvinnan. En doft för personer som gillar vita blommor/musk-iga dofter.

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content: I agree with the previous comment. I have a love/hate relationship with it, similar to Flower by Kenzo and me before. I have tested it over and over, but haven't bought a bottle, as I am afraid to find later that I dislike it, after all (which is what happened between me and Flower by Kenzo). Hmmm... Should I buy it? Oh, well.

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content:
This perfume does so many strange things with me ;)
I like it and I don´t. I love it, I don´t love it at all. I put it in the darkest corner of my room and then hysterical try to find it again. I smell myself like lunatic and then hate it on my skin. I chase it away and then miss it. It has to be a real love he he

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content: The opening is a floral smack in-your-face, lol. So so strong, I can definitely detect gardenia in there, but birch leaf and cucumber make this girl just a liiiiiitle bit more green. Then jasmine and orange blossom kicks in, creating this divine floral cloud over my skin. The dry down on me is a bit green but still very florally, jasmine and orange blossom are still there and they stay with you all the way to the end. Wearing this little beauty makes me feel like I'm taking a tour in a well groomed opened flower garden that has just recently stopped raining. However the flowers are not fully bloomed, somes are just buds, somes are starting to bloom. It is pleasant indeed, floral but not too overpowering. Very refreshing and absolutely lovely. Great for everyday especially spring.

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content:
To those who remember Absolutely Irresistible by Givenchy, this is very similar but with far less sweetness. I actually find it slightly bitter.

First tried it today, didn't like the opening but the middle notes and dry-down are amazing. Might also be one of the few leather scents that actually suit me well. :D Big like.

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content: oh what a wonderful scent. Got it yesterday and I am absolutely in love with. It`s so feminin and pretty nice, sweet (but not too) and fine, elegant and young, but also for Ladys in the higher ages. If you love Happy from Clinique, you will like this too.

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content: a perfect white floral perfume! doesnt smell like an old lady fragrance, its just perfect .

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content: It reminds me Roberto Cavalli so much, it's nice but not a love.

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content: When I tested it in Sephora I thought it too light and without much character. My skin amplifies all the flowery notes though and it became quite heavy on me, with orange blossom and gardenia and the inevitable bitter edge that's so Chloe. I'm not sure I care for the composition, but it's of higher quality than a lot of recent premieres from the light&clean category. It disappears withing 5-6 hours, and has moderate to heavy sillage.

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content: Okay this smells EXACTLY like a flower shop or a lush garden. I would recommend this to someone who loves the smell of fresh cut flowers, or works in a flower shop... I think people would think you got this scent from real flowers, since it's not too enormous and offensive. The scent is very pure white flowery, not soapy. Very nice.

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content: A wonderful interpretation of gardenia !!!!

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content: At first it smells quite greenish, is it a birch leaf? :) But after a while I can smell fresh floral notes, nice and refreshing. All in all, it's pleasant fragrance for green scents' lovers.

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content: sweet sweet SWEET!!!! Soooo adorable!!! It made me kind of dizzy at first,as if puting my nose into very very pleasant flower...Felt like i was a bee,couldt stop smelling again and again! Definatelly want it!!!

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content: Very White floral, and all about The gardenia.

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content:
I generally like everything there is about See by Chloe. This is not similar to other flankers, but I like it too.
It's rather well-composed considering, it's all about white flowers. I sense all of them: neroli, gardenia and orange blossom.
It could be really sharp and bitter, but it's not at all.
I find it subtle and elegant. More of a daytime scent of a serious business woman.
The birch note is really interesting. I sense it intensely for some reason and it reminds me of sauna at the countryside.
Totally wearable great white floral!

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content:
When i sprayed this i was like i know this scent...this is definitely not something new. I had Elizabeth Taylor's Gardenia and still have Pacificas Tahitian Gardenia. This is very sweet and the drydown is definitely musky with just a hint of citrus. Not for me unfortunately! Its a nice enough choice for spring for those who don't already have a gardenia
laden scent. BTW where oh where is the leather?

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content:
Ok this is a gardenia bomb , very floral and a bit sharp if you overspray
The Drydown is creamier , no neroli I can detect .
I is like Hollywood by Kors , nothing bad but a bit linear for my taste!?
Nothing like the original this is totally different
Classy vibe and if you don't like florals don't bother with it!'
I expected different it isn't bad at all but not for me!!

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content:
I did NOT expect to love this one, but I do!
What a pleasant surprise, one of my favourite new launches of 2015. Has very little to do with the original, and, that's great. Sure, there are 'tons of white florals' and 'boring orange blossoms' and a lot of things are not original - but hey, I have a gardenia-radar, and in mainstream scents gardenias are not trending at the moment. Not many new launches with this note. I keep my eye out on EVERYTHING new with Gardenias.

Opens very fresh, as if there were some citrus or abstract 'apple blossoms' in it (however, there isn't), transforms into something in the likes of Chloe, Love Story for a while and then goes straight into creamy, massive, gardenia with heavy, smooth, velvety petals. Gorgeuous. This creamy, beautiful gardenia reminds me of the very drydowon of Marc Jacobs Woman or Collection Extraordinaire Gardenia Petale from Van Cleef & Arpels.

If you are into gardenias, like I am, and non-heady white florals, thiswill be just lovely to you. Well done, Chloe.

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content: I totally agree with @marcelo19, I was hoping that in the version eau fraiche prevail water hyacinth, but unfortunately only at the beginning, it smells nice on water hyacinth, after half an hour again apple blossom and the scent is ruined. I hope that this version will be more beautiful.

product_name: See by Chloé Si Belle Chloé
review_content: Hopefully this will be better than the original, the apple blossom in that fragrance was way too much, but there is no apple blossom here, so this may be better.
Wearing this non-stop now through Christmas. One of the best things I’ve ever smelled.
Bought a 50 mL bottle but this scent is definetly not for me :(. Selling it for 40 € from Portugal, if anyone is interested
I love this classic. Although the smell is not for everyone. Its very strong. Lasts forever. Not a youthful smell nor seductive. It just smells good.

Juice of Mirabelle plum soaking into wood and moss. Stunning and mysterious and beautiful. If you happen to be someone who has smelled the original Nomade and thought it was too simple, Nomade Absolu is a different avenue entirely. Love love love. This will be year round for me.

Sometimes I like this one, but sometimes it smells like a shop decorated for Christmas (cinnamon pinecones, spiced apple candles, potpourri, etc). I'll have to try this again in the fall when warming spices and stewed fruit don't feel so suffocating and out of place.

This smells like being in the wood section of a craft store, they had real Christmas trees as you walked in and nearby are some of those cinnamon pine cones

Also maybe like eating cinnamon rolls in a mossy forest
Both wonderful
I absolutely love this one. I get compliments on it all the time. I find this very unisex especially with that mossy undertone. It’s different and that’s why i love it. Addicting fragrance

I find this one to be so strange... but I like it...

I like the way it smells on the dabber, but not fond of it on my skin until it has dried down about 2-3 hours. It definitely has that curry/potpurri smell, which adds a warmth in the opening. I can pick up that sweet mirabel plum in the dry down. It's well balanced with just the right amount of sweetness from the mirabel plum in the dry down and is reminiscent of shaving cream, which I really like, but also quite odd. But I'm not crazy about the initial spray. Though odd, I'm holding onto it a bit longer because I find myself wanting to smell this profile every once in a while. It's woody, aromatic, earthy, sweet, and... fresh? I would have to agree that it is a modern take on a chypre. Need some more time with this one

Update: Got some more time with this and now I love it. Grew to love and will need to be purchasing a bigger bottle since it has been discontinued.

A sort of nectar-Chypre. It's a very soothing and grounding profile with some depth and density that feels intoxicating. The balance between the honeyed warmth and the mossy, animalic earthiness is masterfully done. It's a deeply self-assured kind of sexy. This is made for the lovers' embrace.

This is Nomade OG's sexier, older sister that you can't tell if you want to be friends with her, be her, or date her. I love how the Mirabelle plum is stronger in this flanker, it complements the oakmoss beautifully and provides an almost juicy and fresh duality to the whole fragrance.

I don't understand the curry, potpourri, etc. reviews for this fragrance... I guess I'm grateful I don't get those at all from this, I'd be so upset if I did.
I love this Absolu and Nomade OG SO DEARLY. Just screams effortless cool girl. Love letter to both of them loading.
Spicy and mossy, smells a bit like pot-pourri to me. Different and interesting, but not really my vibe.
How cruel from Chloé to take away this underrated gem from us! Deeply unfair.

I have to agree with sexy swamp description that Mandie731 used below. I pick up the oakmoss the most, with davana and sandalwood. Really smells like a lush green forest with moist ground. It has very noticeable aquatic base, which (to my nose) smells rather manly. But that’s just me.
Rest in Peace my Mossy, Powdery Friend;( You will be missed;(

私も最初はカレー粉を感じました。カレー粉が終わるとモスの香りと果物の素敵な香りに包まれます。
人工的な香りは一切ないです。飽き性なので一番大きなボトルを買ったのをちょっと後悔したけど、廃盤になるなら沢山入ってて安心です。

I also smelled curry powder at first. After the curry powder faded, I was enveloped in the lovely scent of moss and fruit. There's no artificial scent whatsoever. I get bored easily, so I regret buying the biggest bottle, but if it's going to be discontinued, I'm relieved to know there's a lot left.
My friend thinks this smells like Pears Soap. I think it smells like a sexy swamp. I guess different noses pick up different things.
I have a sample of this perfume. I usually like unisex fragrances, but for some reason this one is too masculine for my taste.
Ive always loved the top notes of this fragrance on all versions but did not favor the drydown. Wish the top notes stayed thru the entire wear.

So I’ve never actually smelled Chloe Nomade Absolu but I picked up some Middle Eastern concentrated perfume oil today, and I couldn’t find it here on fragrantica, so I did some digging on Google and saw it mentioned that it very much resembles Chloe Nomade Absolu. Looking at the notes I can see how. The oil is very, very nice and strong enough to fumigate a stadium three counties over so literally the tiniest tiny drop on each wrist. It’s called Noor Al Shams by Afnan. Of course I wouldn’t bother writing a review on the wrong perfume except I see it mentioned this one is being discontinued so it might be a nice alternative. Thought I’d mention it here.

Reading comments, I expected more moss and earthiness to come through.
This fragrance is strong! I get mostly a combo of sandalwood and mirabelle. The latter is slightly overwhelming.
It's very feminine on me.
@piahellgren I totally understand what you mean! It has an Indian food type smell. I think that might be the Davana because I have another perfume with Davana and it has a similar savory type smell.

Earthy, kind of salty, food-like. Burnt curry? I don’t get this. Where does that come from? I have many fragrances with musk and oakmoss, but this I have never smelled. And it cannot be the davana. Or can it? Does anybody know what I am referring to or has mine gone off?

I just stocked up a few bottles hearing that it is discontinued. So sad...A truly unique fragrance, mossy, earthy but at the same time warm, slightly spicy and just enough female-leaning for my taste. Coupled with good performance, what more to ask for.

It isn't like anything I have ever tried, and I tried A LOT! Wet-grass, earthy, mossy, and a little bit of sweetness.
It's unique compared to other female mainstream fragrances. It has a grounding effect without being overwhelming aromatic nor sharp.Whenever I put it, I feel a ZEN-like state as if I am connected to the earth for some reason. I wear it for that state of being rather than to smell good nor for any king of attention. Simply surrounded by nature. It has Great performance too

The antithesis of cliché. A very interesting and unique fragrance, but in a good way ♥.

The opening is quite harsh and overwhelmingly sweet for my taste (which must be the mirabelle top note I assume). But as the scent develops, within a couple of minutes it changes into something drastically different. A perfume that is mossy, woody and green. Wonderfully fresh and forest-y. This fragrance just seems so sophisticated, but at the same time bright and not overplayed. Almost hard to describe.. The eau de parfum of Nomade seemed kind of boring to me and did not blow me away, so this was a pleasant surprise.

As could be expected from an absolu de parfum the scent is very long lasting and the sillage is quite strong (making an entire car interior smell exactly like me ahah), but to me that's a plus. Without needing to reapply it when I come home I can still smell it on my wrist. Just the wonderful version that it dries down into - delightfully balsamic and herbal with a lovely base of deep musk and sandalwood. Such interesting notes instead of the usual florals.

Very versatile, suitable for almost any occasion, even just day-to-day. Perfect for both day and night wear, just maybe not for the summer dayz. I'd say it's decently unisex, but still leans feminine, just not in the "traditional" sense.

I understand why it might not be some people's cup of tea, as it is a very strong perfume with a unique composition, but it's right up my alley! Why did they discontinue it...? :( My only regret is buying a 30ml, I wish I had gotten a bigger bottle...! x

I understand the scent, but I hate it or maybe it’s just not for me. Too overwhelming — the sillage is crazy — and the longevity is too much to deal with. Even though it has the sweet subtlety from mirabelle (which makes the combination even worse), it leans towards masculine to my nose. I can’t think of any occasion I can wear this to. And weird enough, the perfume on my skin is super similar to Sweet Tobacco Spirits 18.21 Man Made despite their totally different notes.

It’s understandable why it is discontinued.

So I do like this fragrance... But the opening is a bit sharp/screechy, I think it's the musk, and maybe the Mirabelle? It's very citrusy to me in the beginning which I don't see any citrus listed. I'm not a citrus fan.

Once it chills for about 30-45 minutes I like it more. It becomes more mossy/woody, but not deeply, still bright and fresh. It's a pretty darn dry to me, with a tad bit of sweet/tart coming from the fruity aspect.

I think this was an ok blind buy for me, not something I'll reach for suuuuper often, but I could see how this could be a great signature scent for someone. Great, inoffensive scent. However, think I prefer my oakmoss and sandalwood fragrances, in a deeper, warmer, more complex way. Wish this was slightly less harsh in the opening.

I think we are unto an era where true creativity is to be found in designer fragrances, as opposite to niche which has lost it's way.
Anywho, Chloe's nomade absolu is a pleasant surprise of NOVELTY, yes! The opening is hard to describe and I suspect it will smell wildly different to different people, to my nose it has a sparkly weird cola vibe, but not to sweet and even a bit screechy, but in a interesting way. After awhile the moss and Quentin magic kick in and oh whatever, go smell it and buy it, support novelty with your money ladies! This will smell lovely on you, I am definitely getting this for my lady

I tested this fragrance many times because I was expecting something woody and forest as others described and I didn't get that for a long time. I tested during the winter and I just thought it was a somewhat sweet and creamy mish-mash of scents. I didn't get anything woody or fresh.
Finally early spring came and the magic happened. All I can smell now is oak moss and sandalwood, slight plum sweetness from the opening. This fragrance smells so natural and expensive.
It's down to earth, elegant mossy woody composition. I am loving it finally!
Absolu LOVE 💞

Chloe Nomade Absolu de Parfum greets its wearer with an unusual olfactory experience that closely mirrors the scent of a container of dried curry powder, sweetened slightly as if by a whisper. This distinctive opening sets a bold tone, but it's not one that everyone may appreciate.

As the fragrance unfolds, it veers away from its initial piquancy into a more subdued realm of soft woods and plush florals. While this evolution presents a journey from the exotic to the familiar, the transition might feel abrupt or disjointed for those used to more harmonious or traditional scents.

Nomade Absolu certainly makes a statement and could be appealing for someone seeking something out of the ordinary. However, its unique profile—from spicy beginnings to a mellowed dry down—suggests that it's a fragrance to be tested thoroughly before committing to a full bottle. Suitable for cooler days or evening wear, this perfume is a venture into a world of bold contrasts and unexpected turns that might not suit every palate.

Before adding it to your collection, consider whether its journey aligns with your olfactory desires. Chloe Nomade Absolu is not just a fragrance; it's an experience, one that might be too adventurous for some.
Mmm mossy and green, a whiff of something almost minty, and gets pretty sweet and musky in the dry down.

Am I the only one getting whiffs of Angels Share in this? Such a unique scent, except for that boozy undertone that Angels Share has. I wouldn't wear this every day, it's much more suited for special occasions, imo.

I smell a strong aromatic scent at the very beginning (bay leaf?) and then we arrive in an undergrowth where there would have been a violent downpour a few minutes earlier. Smells of moss and damp earth rise up from the ground through evaporation and there's a mirabelle plum tree in front of us, with ripe, tart fruit hanging from it and some that would have fallen to the ground during the downpour and already started to ferment.

Finishes several hours later with a very soft oakmoss and a traces of mirabelle plums that have become syrupy, giving a very warm rendering to the whole.

Perfectly unisex.

Obviously, I ordered a bottle while it was still available as it has been officially discontinued recently 🙁


Useful details : english is not my mother tongue and my opinions are copied and pasted from my personal notes, written on the fly after several phases of testing (tracking changes for several hours on blotters, then on my skin for a day).

A Quentin Bisch masterpiece, hidden (already lost) GEM. Discontinued, of course, because they realized the production costs (especially the materials chosen by Bisch) are too expensive for the "small" profit they consider in the end. So, as usual, what is exquisite and very good, disappear in a blink of en eye.
🌠
Crushed to see it’s discontinued. This is the closest thing I have to a signature scent. Classy, fresh and bright. Works for every occasion all year round.
apple pie
It's being discontinued?! Oh hell to the NO!! Why do they do this to us?! Ok, well....time to get a few backup bottles. What a damn shame.

My favorite fragrance in my entire collection of over two hundred perfumes. Chloe Nomade Absolu does something no other fragrance has been able to capture IMO....a modern chypre. Between the Mirabelle plum and the moss accords, I am in perfume heaven. Mirabelle plum is such an underrated gem of a note and it lends a sweetness to this Absolu version that it doesn't in the other flankers and OG. The moss gives it an earthiness yet it is still very much a feminine fragrance, in my opinion, just not feminine in the traditional sense of florals and fruity banality. This is anything but that. It's complex and sophisticated, it projects and envelops anyone within a couple feet radius with a beautiful and unique aroma. It is divine. Truly, divine. I have purchased my second bottle of this gem and, while I own all the other flankers and the OG Chloe Nomade, this Absolu version stands out on its own, bold and proud, confident and daring, sexy and alluring. I cannot get enough of this gem.

I gave this a positive review in autumn. I just fetched it out today and it’s so soft and mossy deep, like walking through the forest this time of year. It’s comforting and sensual and I could honestly wear it almost anywhere. It’s so good to have a spring perfume that isn’t all fruit and flowers.

As it’s being discontinued, if you want it I’d say snap it up while you still can.
Chloe made a huge mistake when they decided to discontinue this fragrance. It was so unique. So sad. Chloe, please bring this back.

This scent is very dry and mossy. It is very unusual for a designer scent. It feels more elegant and even niche. I love the drydown, it gets a little bit sweeter while remaining sophisticated. This is the type of scent that feels unique, classy and luxurious. Full bottle worthy. I saw someone said it is being discontinued...why? it is not fair.

Very classy perfume. The performance is out of this world. I sprayed it on myself on the drive home from work one day and a week later it’s still on my jacket and strong as ever! We aren’t allowed strong scents at work so I’ve had to put my jacket in my locker lol

Sophisticated and elegant. I like it for its depth and slight bitterness in a similar way I like black coffee and dark chocolate. After trying and liking the Chloe Nomade edp very much, I wanted to try a denser version of it as well. I’m glad, I did! I am in love with it. I was curious about the mirabelle plum note and blind bought both versions based on the scent profiles and reviews. Even if I don’t reach for it often, the notes combo in this one works very well for me.
Discontinued by Coty. Confirmed by the customer service of the brand by email 🥲

Am I losing my mind or is this just a sharp offensive perfume? I'm not really sure what this stuff is. not very pleasant,. Very odd. I can really smell the oak moss in this one. I don't believe there's much feminine about this. Definitely can smell the mirabelle and Davana. Seems to turn sour on the skin. long as it stays on the clothing. it's not horrible but it's still not great..

The opening is tart / tangy with the fruit - not my favorite kind of accord. In the background is a nice subtle smell like being on a coniferous woodland hike. On the dry down the fruitiness is more subdued and the musk amplifies. I like the dry down it's smoother and more balanced than the opening and I see the perfume being versatile for most occasions. Overall it's relatively sophisticated and unique for a designer fruity perfume but I think it's somewhat lacking in depth. I've been on the fence about buying it for a while now but ultimately it's a like not a love. That said this is my favorite of the Nomade line.

Christmas trees and sweet fresh plums. Great holiday fragrance but isn’t so specific that it can’t be worn at other times. But that davana really does smell like fresh evergreens!

I too ignored this line and most Chloe scents because I never hear anyone talking about them. I also am not typically into these nomads kind of scents/notes, so I never would have ventured into this line. But I’ve become an Uber fan of Quentin Bisch as his scents work with my chemistry in a way no others do, and was so surprised and impressed by the OG Nomade EDP, I had to add this and the EDT to my collection. I’d say I prefer this to the EDT currently, but the EDP is my fav.

The conifer tree note mellows out after 30min or so and the scent turns more into a gentle fruity top with a gentle fresh mossy base and slightly piney nuances. I think this is slightly more feminine leaning unisex after the Christmas tree opening, though anyone can wear whatever scent they’d like and I certainly wouldn’t think “girl perfume” if I smelled it on men.

This isn’t the strong overpowering scent some describe it as. It’s quite mellow, without feeling watered down or like it fades too fast. I initially lightly sprayed, only to come back 30 min later to finish my “normal” perfume application. It’s noticeable because it’s different, but not because it’s cloying or obnoxious. I also hoped for a touch of cinnamon or spice based on a review here but definitely no cinnamon, or any other spices as far as I can tell.

Fresh evergreen forest vibes with a delicate feminine fruity sweetness, though no review or description can do justice to this unique little treasure.

Side note-if this is what Chinese grandmas smell like, than they must be the best smelling grandmas in the world, lol. This has zero notes that make me think of any grandma scent I’ve encountered in the U.S.

Update: this is my wintertime workout scent. It’s nice and fresh and outdoorsy in the crispy cool desert winter air. A great scent for exercise and adventuring when you don’t want anything that can turn sour after hours of mixing with sweat! I hate many typical fruity body spray type scents and have been looking for something fresh and different to wear during cooler temps when Monoi/coconut white floral frags feel out of place. This scratches that itch for me.

The original EDP is still my favorite after many wears of it and the flankers.

Also, I read a fragrantica article reviewing the Nomade flankers that called Absolu the classiest due to a leather accord. I don’t see leather listed here nor have I ever gotten leather from this scent at all, thankfully, I don’t think I’d find leather to be complimentary in this blend as it would take it out of “freshie” territory and would definitely be challenging to wear when I’m running around in the sun for hours at a time.

I just sprayed this and the first thing I thought of that I now can’t unsmell is those sweet Chinese preserved plum candies my grandma used to have (in a blue and white wrapper). It doesn’t smell bad per se but it’s not what I was expecting based on the notes and reviews (blind bought btw). It’s a very weird association to have with a fragrance. That’s all I smell from opening-mid-end. I would not recommend for that reason alone but will let it sit and revisit with an update if that changes. Performance seems pretty good so no complaints there.

Somehow I ignored the Chloe Nomade range for years. Not on purpose, I just didn't hear much about it, and the notes didn't appeal to me (in theory).
About two weeks ago, the shops were very busy, I was dodging people left and right, and ended up in front of the Nomade tester bottles. The first one I sprayed was Absolu. And wow! What a nice surprise! I find it is quite unique for a designer fragrance. The fruity mirabelle plum note is light but prominent, not sticky, and the moss + sandalwood give a beautiful body to the fragrance. I'm not entirely sure how davana smells, but it seems to give a nice touch of greenness to the fragrance, which adds to it feeling unique. Definitely gives forest fairy vibes , as mentioned in other comments.
It stayed for a good 6 hours on my skin. Have to get my hands on a bottle soon!

Quite Dry, Mossy and Woody, like a dreamy forest.
Not my style tho.
Perfectly Unisex.
I think it's quite special in designer perfumes.
Chloe Absolu gives off forest fairy energy, I adore this fragrance.

I (blind) bought a 50ml bottle of this, because the plethora of reviews I’ve read and watched made it seem as if it was the “fall/winter” version of the original, which I loooove. However, I’m not loving it, but for $55, it was a steal. I think it’s the Davana I dislike, and I miss the really fruity opening of the OG. Is there a fragrance someone could think of to layer on top of this to give the fruity opening of the OG?

Edit: The opening smells very similar to Fireball Whiskey to me. Maybe I should let it sit for awhile?

Mirabelle opening is not bright and cheerful like in EDP. This is deep and heavy but not dark. It smells like chinese dried plums - Chen Pi Mei. IOW, it smells like a chinese grandma. It smells a little bit like rice too. Haha. All kidding aside, this is for a way more mature audience than the EDP.

So who is this for? If Nomade EDP is for the 20-40 something who's into boho chic, Nomade Absolu is for the real deal.

This is for the woman who grew up in the 60's and was actually part of the hippie movement, She attended Woodstock '69 and protested against the Vietnam War. She did her pilgrimage to India, following in the footsteps of John & Yoko, and once lived in Cambodia. She grew out of it as she grew older and got a corporate job. She made her money, moved to the suburbs and raised a family.

That said, deep down, she is still that radical, free-spirited bohemian girl all those years ago. That never went away.

This is for trailblazing women like Jane Fonda or Yoko Ono.

This is such a sensual, juicy chypre. It is so unique in the sea of boring designer fragrances, reminiscent of the gold age of designers in the 90s, but feels very modern. I absolutely love it, especially in cold weather. I also have Nomade edp but this is the one to go for nights out and the holiday season. It feels very festive but comforting at the same time. Wonderful!
A very elegant, earthy spin on fruity scents. Sweet and woody.
When I smelled it I felt leather note, definitely.
I get zero fruitiness, just mossy woody earthy sensual goodness. It really does project an air of confidence and self-assurance somehow. Really nice for fall/winter and it lasts FOREVER on skin.

I tried this on when I first got to town and spent two hours walking around, constantly lifting my wrists and smelling it. This is definitely a new love for me. It’s different from the rose-heavy scents I’ve been favouring in the warmer months (Delina La Rosée, Givenchy Irresistible EDT), but still very fresh, airy and woody. I didn’t know this was by Quentin Bisch when I bought it, but now I know it definitely makes sense, and I recognise that slightly fizzy / fresh note from his other creations. Time to fetch my beloved Valaya and Pure Poison back out for the season 🍂
Smell likes dried men sweat..regret to buy it
The original Nomade is so gorgeous. The absolu smells like eating celery for some reason. It’s not super off putting, but I much prefer the original because of this

I adore this formulation of "Nomade", my signature scent. To me, this is a deeper, woodier, sweeter and slightly syrupy scent that is extremely comforting and reminiscent of the holiday season! I love to wear the original Nomade in the Fall and bring this version out around Thanksgiving!

The first time I smelled Nomade Absolu, I liked it but didn't know what to make of it: it reminded me of a 90's perfume with a cinnamon note. The next few times, it smelled like a woody cherry cola. Finally, I "got" it: peach blossom and oakmoss! It's soft, warm, addictive, sophisticated, and pretty different from other designer fragrances. Good performance as well. This is a love for me!
No other perfume line has given me this level of self-integrity. Seriously, nothing in modern perfumery beats the Chloé Nomade collection. Period.

I am enamored by this fragrance - this was a random Nordstrom rack blind buy and I am so happy I picked this up. Its sophisticated, unique, clean/musky, sexy - something I think would work well as an all year round signature scent.
