It's quite long lasting and strong for a cologne, more like an edp. Yellow floral with something syrupy, definitely not aquatic. Very feminine, a little heavy, just like I was expecting looking at the color of the liquid inside, which is dark orange.
I think it would work for fall and winter... despite the fact fact that narcissus is a spring flower. I like it!
I am going to find and buy this one!

Chloe or cloying? Wow, for an EDC this stuff is both potent and overwhelmingly sweet. It's interesting that removing the small amount of bitter from the parent composition has turned this into a floral popsicle. It's mild in the sense of not a lot of notes but not in the sense of any kind of subtlety. Must. brush. teeth.

Projection: intrusive
Duration: scrubbed after 2 hours
Fabulousness: was Paris Hilton a consultant?
Value to Price ratio: meh
2/10

I was thinking that my favorite perfume in my younger years was the first one but after looking at the reviews im thinking it might have been this one because i liked fresher scents ive got to get this one...does anyone know what year this came out curious because i would have worn this in the 1986 - to 1990 when i graduated im dieing to figure out which one i wore in that time period!!! Thanks

I am really curious about this one!! I love the original, if it's anything like it, I'll love this too!
:-)

Thanks to a fantastic swapper, I got a sample of this one-unfortunately it has no hope on my skin!

I have had a craving lately for the narcisse note in fragrances-a flower that compares to no other, and embodies a lovely bright spring season.

Unfortunately, this is syrupy sweet. Where's the narcissus? Drowned in sugar-or even saccharine! I don't really smell anything besides sweetness with a clear artificial idea of narcisse masquerading in grand sillage. Leather? Oakmoss? Iris? Wouldn't they lend more smoothness, bitterness, even soapiness, to give it some, any nuance? I am glad I don't test unfamiliar fragrances when I have to go to work-this would have been a disaster to wear out. I wanted to try this edition as I thought it was supposed to be milder than Narcisse by Chloe...Oh well, it's been discontinued anyway-I'll just keep looking.
I dont like this oneone either.Mild,too floral smells like a knockoff.
Sharp, astute smell of narcissus. As Narcissus it wants to return on self without break note. It is really beautiful, strong, but, unfortunately -a bit crucifying.

The best Nomade so far. Very feminine and quite fresh. Perfect for the signature scent. I mainly smell ginger, orange blossom and vanilla. I wish this was a little more spicy, or have some depth. Still it's a beautiful scent, perfect for a gift. Safe for a blind buy as well.

I was so excited to try this after seeing the notes of myrrh, opoponax and kyphi, just to get a sample and find out it smells exactly of pastiera napoletana (a cake that uses orange blossom water, the same kind of blossom that produces neroli essential oil).
I like it, I just wasn't expecting something so gourmand-y. I'll certainly wear it around Easter!🤍🐇
Orange Blossom Cola
ISO a small decant of this in this US. Please message me if you’d like to do a trade!

I imagine this is how an Egyptian queen would have smelled like after a bath. It’s a well-balanced scent: clean, yet spicy and sweet. I got this recently and have been wearing it every single day instead of my usuals because I’m so obsessed with it!
I am actually surprised that I like this… The blend of notes is very harmonious ! I’ll add this to my collection soon.

This is a beautiful lady-like powdery yet creamy white floral. I get some bubblegummy facets, presumably from the orange blossom but it's not too much. Nothing groundbreaking but clean-smelling and likeable, a great designer flanker. It might be a bit of a departure from the original Nomade though as it lacks the green element from the oakmoss.

Beautiful and unique. On my last Sephora visit I tested a lot of perfumes and only this one caught my attention along with a few from Chanel. It's deep, sophisticated, sweet. Nothing in common with og Nomade. Love it and I bought my own bottle.

I got this for under $50 at one of the usual online resellers. Almost soapy, then you catch the warm spices and an almost nutty accord from the resins. The orange blossom stands out the most, and many hours later it’s close to the skin and smells akin to the late dry down of Love Don’t Be Shy. The push-pull of warm yet soapy is utterly intriguing yet comforting. It fits beautifully with these late summer days, where it’s cool in the morning and hot in the late afternoon. All in all, I’m obsessed!

This perfume is so calming, it made its way up to my signature. It's addicting, alluring, and creamy. The cinnamon and orange blossom are perfectly balanced and sweet but in an elegant and sophisticated way.
Reminds me of YSL Libre without lavender.
rich and exquisite. lasts all day and i really love it. chloé tbh always delivers

This scent is like a grown up version of Paco Rabanne’s Olympéa. Even if the notes on both of them aren’t exactly similar, that’s what it reminds me of. Cinnamon, orange blossom and vanilla are the most prominent notes to me in this fragrance.
I wish this lasted longer on skin, it does stick to fabrics quite well.
All things considered, this is a lovely fragrance and I will be purchasing a full bottle of it, it’s price point is fair for what it is.
It’s intoxicating. Very feminine - but not in a sultry way. It’s elegant and balanced. Sweet but not sickly, mature but not oldish or dated. Captivating but not decadent or loud.
Soft, ethereal, angelic and peaceful.

I got a tester out of curiosity and I still can't quite tell if I like this one or not. It immediately reminded me of the lemon tree my late grandmother had when I was a kid, which is why I went in and bought the whole bottle. However, there are some cons that even my nostalgia doesn't let me ignore. First of all, the opening citrus note seems a bit sharp and artificial but it dries down quickly and turns into - almost nothing? There is a barely-there sweet lemon cake scent that doesn't project much. Apparently the perfume is made with mostly natural ingredients which is great if you're into that but it could be messing with the performance. If you're looking for something bright yet discreet for those dry, hot summer days, give it a shot but don't expect a lot....

Though I loved this when I sampled it, the miniature bottle came and after 1 use I gave it away. I find it heavy, leaning toward a couple of classic Parisian perfumes that are not my thing. That said, when just the basenotes are left after 5 hours or so, It's revealing the intrinsic greatness of this scent. The soft powderyness that lingers is just sooo nice.

I wish they had named this Myrrhe d'Égypte, it would have been just as fitting. Myrrh is the soul of this fragrance, spiced with cinnamon and ginger, then sweetened by amber and vanilla. I am very surprised it doesn't have dates as a note. It holds an ancient, mythic quality that makes me think of golden dunes, sunlight reflected on the Nile, Cleopatra's last moments as she held the adder to her chest. Α scent that carries the history of thousand-year empires and the queens who watched them rise and fall.

it would make a really nice winter perfume. both spicy and sweet. i love the exotic character of this one and having a hard time choosing between the naturelle and this.
i don't agree with the comments that say it has nothing to do with the nomade family. the "nomade" family... they better be different from each other. every one of them belongs to a different story under the sun.

Quite similar to Libre Le Parfume, however more multidimentional.

Yes, it does smell like a potion from a vintage boudoir, yet cannot help but thinking of the majestic late Aaliyah wearing it on Queen of the Damned.

This is so rich - it smells exotic and reminds me of a vacation but not in the typical coconut caramel way!!

10/10
Couldn’t really detect any spices that it says it has in it. Just a very intimate floral smell with a bit of orange.

I was surpised by this, I thought it would smell middle easterny + orange blossomy (which i tolerate very badly) but it doesn't! Its very gentle, rich and not overpowering, and I really don't know how to explain it, the notes are confusing and mysterious to me but I can tell one thing.
THIS IS ADDICTING! the type where you keep smelling yourself addicting and wondering what is this? And why does it smell so good?
I can imagine wearing it on for night time occasionally, when its not too hot out.
I just love it and It smells so original and rich

The ultra-sweet, syrupy sister of the original Nomade. While the OG bursts open with freshness and sparkle, Nuit d’Égypte leans into warmth and depth but maybe a little too hard. With notes like myrrh, cinnamon, kyphi, vanilla, and opoponax, it’s meant to feel ancient, rich, and mysterious.

But on my skin? It’s overwhelmingly sweet, almost cloying at times. That bold contrast to the original’s balanced beauty makes this one feel a little too heavy, too indulgent. I admire the concept, but in execution, it doesn’t impress me as much. The original still reigns supreme.

– Bhavna Darira Chesan

I love a good vintage cosmetic aroma - there is definitely a fleeting element of that here!

For the first time in a while, I can say this one actually has three distinct stages for my nose, a bit of a lost art. Initially I was troubled - it didn’t grab me - but worked with it and was pleased with the smooth, luscious dry down. It’s full bodied, not linear.
When it settles down,it's very yummy

I really enjoy this perfume! It’s very amber-y and mature smelling without being too overpowering, though I really don’t think it’s as sweet as people are saying. To me the orange blossom and the myrrh are the strongest notes. It’s not going to last 24 hours, but it’ll definitely stay on throughout a day out or a dinner.

I read about the notes, I tested it and wanted to buy it. Now, a lot of you talk about soft and vanilla etc and all I can smell is orange flower and some other super sweet flower that is making me kind of sick. Where are the top notes, or even better base notes?? I can't smell any of them....Strangely this perfume reminds me of another super flowery one, could it be Burberry London for her (minus jasmine but instead another overpowering flower) ?
thick, warm, almost sickeningly sweet. the vanilla is good, but the thick floral adn cinnamon scent makes it 'too much'.

I have a hard time to like or even tolerate dominant orange blossom - not an easy starting point in an oversaturated market of white floral forward fragrances over all other floral olfactory types. I was randomly strolling around in a local drugstore as usual to get my fresh kick of sensory input, and it striked me that I immediately liked this one and wasn’t repelled by the particular flower I recognize very well - I seriously think this is orange blossom done right and captures that balsamic, slightly solar nature of it. The mildly resinous character of Nuit d’Egypte has a lot of potential to deepen, if it’s let to macerate and mature properly. I had the first Jasmin Naturelle release for a while because Chloé managed to encapsulate that Mediterranean vibe authentically and was able to lure me in, even though I don’t like heady white florals at all.

I was the original Nomade wearer after it came out, so I'm really familiar with its DNA. I always thought of it as a very modern, contemporary, unisex, open-minded, business environment-friendly scent, so I was a bit confused after sampling Nuit d'Egypte. What does it have to do with the Nomade range? This should have been its own release. The theme really asks for it.

Anyway - mind blowing fragrance. What I said about the original, this is everything opposite: ancient, deep, mysterious, drawing references to situational and historical frameworks. I was instantly teleported to an Egyptian temple that I love and the smell of myrrh and other ceremonial substances. I love ancient Egypt, and I believe this will go so well with wearing my ankh necklace. Very good longevity and projection, strong presence.

This is a standalone creation that draws on Egypt’s history. The myrrh is so opulent at the beginning, and it really brings the temple vibes - I wish it'd stay for longer though. There is kyphi as a middle note, which is an ancient Egyptian incense scent accord, that's why it's like nothing else, you'll hardly find this note in other fragrances. All notes just work so beautifully together, and more of them are unique, not just kyphi.

Rich, opulent, grounded, balsamic, meditative scent - absolutely sacred. I'm very impressed by this one, and I must have it in my collection.

its a cozy feminine vanilla cinnamon perfume. But unfortunately it doesn't last long, i can put 5-6 sprays and after couple of hours there is nothing left, this is not a perfume that will stick on your clothes the next day.

This fragrance has become one of my favorites, the opening notes almost combine with the mid notes initially and i can instantly smell the orange blossom which is smooth not sharp. The Kyphi is what does it for me being that it is warming and spicy yet not too heavy, pairing this with the vanilla is perfection. It will be perfect for those summer evenings snuggled in a blanket watching the night sky with a glass of Malbec.
It smells different to any other current fragrance on the high street which I like as many are just flankers of their former self.

I enjoy this scent very much. I sprayed it on my jacket and could still smell it the next day when putting it on. I also smelled it on my skin for more than 14+ hours although I admit I sprayed probably 6-8 sprays before leaving the house. I tried the original Nomade and liked that one well enough but I LOVE this version. I think my nose is broken because I don't smell the individual components like many others can. I do get a spiciness that cuts through the florals but nowhere near the way it does in the original Nomade. Definitely one I will be reaching for over and over this spring.

I adore all the Nomade flankers and this is no exeption. So sensual and seductive🥰
It really does remind of YSL Libre.

this was a really nice surprise, especially for a designer fragrance.

it smells very, very opulent and creamy. it's softly spicy, floral and oriental - i think the myrrh really stands out and makes it beautiful and rich smelling. it remains pretty linear throughout, and the performance is sub-par, but it smells really nice and different from most of the designer offerings, particularly those at its price point.

7/10
it's missing the 'wow' factor for me, but it's a breath of fresh air on the designer market. performance not the best but it's hardly super expensive - i think it's fair for it's price.

On my skin this perfume is at first whiff almost citrusy, then spicy and finally settles as a warm, spicy vanilla. I can understand those who says it reminds them of Libre. I actually thought of Libre Intense when I first smelled it on a paper strip. Not alike, but similar vibe. It has relatively good longevity. It is very nice during cold and winter. Have not tested in warm weather. Opinion so far: well made and beautiful. If you enjoy the likes of Eilish I believe you may enjoy Nomade Nuit d’Egypte as well.

I received a sample of it, and I fell in love with it. So unique and unexpected. Smells like nothing I have smelled before. So imagine it with me… You are sitting on the dunes of sand under the freezing desert night, over you there is nothing but stars, under you only warm sand, and summer breeze brings distant scent of jasmine and papyrus to your nose, and you feel chilly and wrap your cashmere shawl around your shoulders to warm up. That’s how this perfume smells like. Embrace of the cashmere, under the desert night.

I tend to avoid scents with vanilla note, not because I hate vanilla, but because it usually overshadows anything else there might be. This is exactly such a case. To me it's an identical twin of Almafolia (Giardini di Toscana), and both of them vaguely remmind of Aura Mugler. And the common feature is heavy, hot, spicy-sweet, suffocating vanilla. I could like it so much more without it.
A floral-spicy creation that fits into popular fragrances. It settles quite quickly, lying intimately close to the skin, where it can be subtly sensed.
Feminity

received a sample of this and I like it! very comforting to my nose, kinda delicate and feminine but gives you some of that "bosslady" energy. quite well balanced mix of different elements - it's soft, sweet, spicy and kind of powdery. not as special as I expected based on the notes. not as strong as I anticipated, the longevity is not the best either. wonder if someone from my past has worn something similar consistently since this is very familiar. enjoying my small sample!

edit: just remembered what this reminds me of - Gaultier's Classique EDT. Classique is stronger and heavier on the vanilla/amber whereas Nomade d'Egypte has more emphasis on the flowers, but these two are very similar.

I love this but it fades away within less than an hour...maybe better for summer nights...
Could cause mygrene

I'm 24 years old so I have to say this isn't a fragrance that suits me or my aesthetic at least. But it's a fragrance I will keep my eye on for when I get older and want a more mature and woman perfume. It's very bold, a bit too harsh for my liking, can give you a headache if you overwear. But it has such nice notes. It's fresh, the perfect amount of sweet and a little spicy. Would recommend. But don't blind buy. I feel like Nomades are love or hate perfumes. You can either find them perfect or too much.

A pretty fragrance which opens up with a mish mash of notes, before settling down.

I get ginger, cinnamon and myrrh quite strongly on the opening, so I don't find it very enjoyable until about 10 mins into the dry down, when the floral notes join the party and then the fragrance really comes into its own and I find it quite unique and sensual.

I keep putting my nose to the back of my hand to smell it and I really do like it. It's spicy, warm, slightly vanillic and sweet. Although I'm not sure where the sweetness is coming from.

I think that I would buy it, for days that I'm in an intimate setting as the only issue with it is the projection, which is quite close, but I don't mind reapplyling if I have to

I have a sample for which I cannot give a great review. I like to appreciate the fragrances well after several uses, but it was a crush at first smell, I am not a fan of Chloé mainly because of the way they treat the note of rose, is not my profile of fragrances but the Nomade line has magic, the hands and excellent nose of Quentin Bisch created the first three of the line and although this one has no point in common with those outside the name, you feel a fragrance of enormous quality although do not propose anything new, the orange blossom in its most enjoyable facet (to my personal taste) with a vanilla far from everything that is currently sold, here there are no excesses of sweet, nor anything lactonic and much less gourmand, this is a oriental vanilla and it cannot be otherwise because of the components that accompany it and give it an exceptional depth and maturity (myrrh, opoconaco and cinnamon) which are not protagonists nor are they felt individually but together with the vanilla with the orange flowers create a very pleasant fragrance and although it has points in common with many other things, it is not similar to anything that is in trend right now, the ginger gives an effusive touch to the dry down and a small touch of cypriol the woody touch but away from the facet of the Oud.
Nomade Nuit by Egypt is a fragrance that, although I admit, falls short of what we expected from its name (maybe a little more smoky or balsamic is missing) but it is not on a safe release, I like it because it is well made and who knows how to appreciate a fragrance well achieved, you cannot let it pass.

I'm not a fan of Chloe fragrances and this is the first one I bought and blind bought! Thank God it worked out because I'm not a fan of the brand in general. I had a feeling this was the Nomade flanker for me so when I got a 40% off coupon I went for it. This reminds me of Armani Code for Women which I own but that's fine. I love the orange blossom, jasmine, meets spices and resins theme here so this will get a lot of wear in my collection. A year round day or night fragrance. Pretty without being complicated or trying to hard. It smells like quality ingredients were used and it is heavy orange blossom floral. A very sweet floral but floral none the less. I wish they kicked up the incense but it is still nice but safe. This is a likeable easy to wear around others incense type of floral. Very sweet, a bit heady, friendly, but a touch sexy. Great first date fragrance. Girl/woman next door pretty. Just my style.

Nomade une Nuit d'Egypte is its own unique experience, do not expect it to be too similar to the original Nomade. It's a spicy orange with a warm, not overly synthetic amber base. Cinnamon in the opening along with the juicy orange, and amber and myrrh in the drydown - just not getting too much of the white floral. I have a thing for anything orange/neroli/petitgrain, plus I love the smell of myrrh, so this was a love at first sniff. Exactly what I would imagine, if someone said they had captured the essence of Egypt in a perfume, it plays into the fantasy so well.

While Nomade by Chloe is a boring disaster, Nomade Nuit d'Egypte is actually interesting.
In the beginning of it's journey, it smells like candied fruits from panettone and a bit like the panettone itself. It smells like vanilla baking powdered sugar (given by the vanilla note), candied fruits (given by the myrrh and cinnamon note) candied oranges (given by the orange blossom note) and a little bit like Egyptian incense.
I would actually consider buying this fragrance if it didn't lose it's panettone smell after the dry down. After it dries down, Nomade Nuit d'Egypte smells only like a soft vanilla powder.

Spicy, sweet and inoffensive scent.
I love orange blossoms and vanilla combo, but it was just ok.

I never tried other Nomade series of perfumes because most of them are having jasmine inside and i am seriously have some problem with it.

Longevity was 6hours+
With the price I expected something more special.
I loved this one initially but unfortunately my nose said No after a few months. Now it's just sweet. Waaayyy too sweet. Had to declutter it in the end.

A really interesting spicy amber white floral. A blend of opposites. Almost mystical feeling, like bright stars in a black desert sky.

Despite its unusualness this is a friendly fragrance, the spice very tame, and the florals subdued by ambery warmth. An alluring fragrance that keeps you engaged and enchanted. It’s not at all like the original Nomade fragrance (which is lovely in its own right); this version is deeper, darker, a distant cousin if it bears any relation at all.

I’ve never encountered a fragrance that so deeply embodied twilight. Nuit d'Egypte is that deep shade of blue the sky turns with night flowers opening beneath it, hints of incense wafting in from far away. A dark airiness but warm, enchanting. Deepens as it wears.

Soft vanilla-floral with a touch of spice. There’s orange blossom, of course, but also a hint of jasmine. The spice is very subtle, just the tiniest touch of ginger and resin incense. It has a beautiful ambery warmth also. There is no similarity to the original Nomade.

While I like this, it does feel a bit too safe. Its name suggests something deeper, darker, and a lot more intense, when in reality it’s a subtle and gentle (albeit very well blended) floral. This would make an ideal everyday fragrance; it projects reasonably but isn’t overpowering and lasts well also, ultimately fading away into a sweet vanilla skin scent.

Pretty, but somehow I expected more.

A warm oriental scent where the orange blossom and jasmine are the main stars. It is rather strong for being a Chloe and lasts at least six hours. After a few hours all you can smell is the vanilla. Not really my kind of scent though.
Rating 5/10

I got a tester of this not expecting to like it due to the reviews, but I was still curious because of the description. I don’t own and haven’t smelt any other Chloe perfumes so can’t compare. I mainly use Dolce & Gabanna.

The opening notes I find beautifully intoxicating. It completely draws me in. I really wish it would stay much longer because it smells absolutely divine. I love it so much!

The dry down I find confusing. I get a lovely powdery sensual warm vanilla type vibe on my right wrist and a horrible musty oud on my left which makes absolutely no sense. In fact my left wrist does smell like good girl, which I hate. Having sprayed it on different days, I still get the same outcome. That might put me off long term wear, unless I can find something to layer it with.

I’m undecided on this perfume. It is quite strong, which I think it could become quite nauseating or headache inducing if sprayed too heavily. I wouldn’t say it’s shy at all. It also lasts a good 6 hours on me. I have still purchased a full sized bottle, as it’s nothing like anything else I own. I mostly love this perfume, but hate that musty oud type end note which must be the cypriol oil. This is definitely not a safe blind buy. I’d recommend getting a tester first.

I'm a huge fan of Chloé, their perfumes are always so well-blended despite it being a designer brand.

Chloé nomade nuit d'egypte is shy, a bit too shy, which is a shame because she's beautiful! soft powdery and very subtle vanilla, orangeblossom, soft spices but definitely no spice bomb, I pick up on some fruitiness which isn't in the notes, it might be the orangeblossom-ginger combo which makes it smell a bit more citrussy than your usual white floral orangeblossom. There are also a lot of notes I've never heard of before so there might be ones I don't recognise.

It smells very unique, despite the recognisable notes like vanilla and orangeblossom. If only she'd last! she fades incredibly quickly on my skin
Why is no one saying tanning oil? Is it just me? It reminds me a bit of something like hawaiian tropic but less intense

To me Nuit d’Egypte is basically vanilla & orange flower with a sweet-balsamic backbone. Ginger, myrrh, cinnamon and everything is so well-blended and balanced that the fragrance shines in its dry-down. The performance is excellent, on me it lasts all day…and if I were to mention a vague similarity, I’d say Voce Viva.
I’m surprised Dior Addict is not in the « this perfume reminds me of » category. One thing is for sure the variations of the Nomade line is so diverse !

Nuit d’Egypte couldn’t be any more different to the original Nomade.

This opens with a sweet floral/vanilla/spice combination, with the latter becoming more prominent as it develops. I’m usually 50/50 on amber perfumes, but this one is combined very well with some of my favourite notes (namely orange blossom).

The opening bears some similarity to Armani Code, but that similarity proves to be superficial. On the drydown, it reminds more me of Good Girl, although I do like this better.

While it has some depth, it lacks the gravity to fully live up to its name “Nuit d’Egypte” which invokes way more mystery and intrigue than the scent itself.

Overall, it’s a very pretty and safe “oriental” perfume choice. It is a lovely scent, but not entirely unique or breathtaking. It has wide appeal and so I’d recommend as a blind buy or gift.

I’m surprised people don’t find this to be different. I’ve owned a lot of perfumes, and nothing I’ve ever had smells anything like this. It’s stunning, and it’s one of those perfumes that are so well blended that I don’t really know what I’m smelling.

This doesn’t smell anything like the original Nomad, which I also enjoy, but I like this better.

This somehow smells like Egyptian nights near the Nile. It sort of smells like jasmine, but not how we typically smell it in perfumes. There’s something interesting in here. I get a raw mastic/myrrh incense smell before it’s been burned, like you’re smelling it in the jar. I’m obsessed

I find that Chloe always knows how to blend florals very well and I can totally see this being a signature for me.
I don't get any sweetness out of it and it doesn't last on my skin :( Wanted to like it but it's meh.
Sweet floral with a touch of warm spices, in the same vein of YSL supreme bouquet but more floral, nice but definitely not unique to my nose.
Soft,slightly spicey orange blossom. Lightly oriental, not what you would expect from the name "nuit" in it, as it is more for a day perfume but very charming.

This is a beautiful perfume and I immediately got a full bottle after testing it for a few days.
It starts with a fresh flush of ginger, hint of cinnamon and then seamlessly melts into a vibrant orange blossom. Closely followed by broom, that has a Jasmin like character. After a few hours of floral delight, Kyphy and Oppoponax appear as a solid pair of lightly smokey duo to complete a beautiful fragrance.
I am wearing this scent in searing heat and considering it's an Hommage to Egyptian night, I feel like I'm doing this creation justice. Imho it is a very versatile perfume. Unisex to my nose. Easy to layer. When I needed some oomph at night, I layer it with Divine Vanille by Essential Parfums. This ads more depth with intense Myrre and a smokey vanilla.
My coworkers loved it on me (nurse here) and I love the incensey, creamy vanilla at the base with the resinous Kyphy, that gives a special sprinkle on top.
To my nose this Flanker has little to nothing to do with the originals. Which I like! In the previous Flankers there was oakmoss, that I detest in most fragrances, because it feels very dated to me. This one here is nothing short of beautiful. Crowd pleasing, yet still memorable at the same time due to Kyphi and Broom.
I know some who love the entire line will be disappointed, but everyone who hated the line might love this. Like I do!
This is going to be my fall/ winter fragrance for sure.

Reminds me of Fleur by Nina Ricci, but Fleur is getting more sour while fading. Nuit d' Egypte smells like a museum with kinda nautical notes, definitely in the Nile. However, it gets ordinary after a few minutes and doesn't last long enough. In comparison with the rest Nomade perfumes, this one differs. I like it, but I prefer what the rest express (animalic and leathery notes).

They managed to make the pyramid look more interesting than the perfume is in reality. This 90% orange blossom, the note that I personally dislike because I find it overly sweet, cloying and I associate it with old ladies. But if you are a lover of Orange Blossom - certainly go for it! Just do not have high hopes for spicy and animalic notes.

Dina_France (perfume reviews on YouTube)

The things this is being voted as similar to... 🤐
Wha...? 🫠

For me it smells like GOOD FORTUNE by V&R in the opening.
A touch richer and with a phantom bubblegum note.

Dries down to something raaather similar to BLACK DATURA by Miller Harris. Slightly earthy.

I prefer the base.
I was kind of put off by incense notes that they listed but upon buying it and wearing it, this is very light in a good way. It is very very plesant scent, easy to wear, easy to reach for.
I love it, I just wish the projection was stronger as it’s a fairly intimate perfume.

I thought I might like this one based on the notes, but Nomade Nuit d'Egypte is waaaay too sweet for me.
The first seconds of the opening were fresh, but after that it became dense and sweet and very linear throughout the wear. I can hardly get any of the notes separately, they're all blended together and indistinguishable to my nose, which makes me confused. Something about the scent seems very artificial, like I cannot believe anything real actually smells like this.
Longevity and sillage on me are great, two sprays on my wrist have lasted seven hours, and it still creates a strong and heavy cloud around me. Its presence has been like noise to me from opening to drydown, and is getting on my nerves. I haven't had this kind of negative reaction to a frag in a while. On the test on paper it seemed fresh, but on the skin it's overwhelmingly sweet, a little bit sickening. The only reason I didn't try to scrub it off yet, is that I wanted to share my impression with you guys first.
I don't think this is a bad perfume, but I do think it depends a lot on skin and preferences. Definitely not blind buy.
I love the Nomade Naturelle EDP, but this one is a pass.
The original is fruity, this one is flowery. Orange blossom but closer to jasmin in how it smells. Pretty, classy, soft, but the original is better. Just a summery wrist test.

Wow!! Just wow! I tried this and it blew my mind! I wasnt even eager to try it as I dont really found any nomade to like a lot before. But today i picked it up and smell the cap, and it was almost intoxicating, i rarely get that from smelling caps. I had to spray on my arm and it was sooo good. All the way back home, a 45 minute drive, I couldn stop smell my arm, and it created this nice comforting scent bubble around me in the car. Not to strong but not weak either. The orange blossom is there for sure, thats the main star, with some sweetness i guess from vanilla. It does not smell very vanillary though, but it does have a sweet side to it. The spicy notes are not spicy in any way, but probably create some depth and warmth, but I cant pinpoint any of the spicy notes at all. I regret not buying it, but will for sure grab it next time! Hard to describe, but easy to love!
What a beautiful scent, and the name feels spot on! Softly sweet, orange blossoms, with mild oriental spices. Very smooth.
So I take it this has little in common with the original Nomad? I didn't love that one, but this one sounds amazing, and it would have to be a blind buy.

I am in love with the scent, a bit sweet a bit spicy and balsamic, resinous, but performance is bad. I decided not to purchase because of it, skin scent - like a lovely lotion that evaporates from your skin in an instant.. Left me wanting more..

I sampled this at a perfumery and couldn't get it out of my mind for two months, so I bought a big bottle. It's a beautiful, unique fragrance, warm orange blossom, with a scent profile I have never smelled before, right up my alley. It doesn't remind a whole lot of the OG, but I far prefer this one.

It dries down into the most delicious vanilla after about 12 hours

Interesting notes
Good perfume but only for colder weather
Unique
Unoffensive
Sensual

There is oriental vibe here. I feel it. That makes it slightly more mature and deep. I like it. It reminds original Nomade BUT warmer, less fresh, but more sweet...like you would add something warm and cozy like drop of Shalimar or Samsara of Guerlain. I would compare this scent with some classic Guerlain fragrances bec it has also slight retro vibe and deepness.
I ordered a mini online and love it!it is unusual and exotic.i like that it doesnt smell like anything else out there.it is very sweet in an earthy way.
It’s too much sweetness, it appears I don't like orange blossom perfumes and I only smell orange blossom which is too sweet for my liking

To me, Nuit d'Egypte = best parts of Paco Rabane Fame + best parts of Prada Candy. I think that means I'm smelling a floral-forward scent with a perfect blend of resin (in this case, myrrh) and spice. Its attributes are perfect for a healthcare setting and this will be a long-time fav of mine, for sure. Love the way it develops on the skin, with the resinous aspect and vanilla coming out after a few hours, vs on clothing how the amber is more prominent and retains floral -- such a great combo. Sillage and longevity moderate with >4 sprays; otherwise, this is as others have remarked with slightly disappointing power for its price tag.

tested it today along with jasmin natural and i was slightly disappointed bc i think this bottle is beautiful but the scent is not for me. reminds me of the red scandal i can’t describe it but there’s a specific spicey note in it that gives me a headache and i can smell it here too
i do think this is a nice smell tho i just wouldn’t buy it for myself bc i prefer not to get headaches lol
3/5 good longevity

I’ve been collecting fragrances for around 25 years, and it’s not often anymore that I find something unique to my nose, but this is different to everything else in my collection. It reminds me of Arabian markets and a soft incense that is not cloying, but gently blended with vanilla and warm spices, and blossoms floating on the breeze. I am very pleased with this beauty, she’s making me want to leave England behind and for warm, romantic Egyptian nights with the love of my life.

I own this fragrance and Nomade Absolu, and I like this line a lot. I look forward to trying the others.

Nomade Nuit d’Egypte Chloé
(Store Test, King Power Airport, first visit).

I walk across the fragrance store and it names suggest something probably Florental.
So I put 2 sprays, 1 on paper and 1 on back of hand.

Nomade Nuit d’Egypte by Chloé is truly White Florental fragrance (specific - Orange Blossom).
At very first contract I do recall something in realm of L'interdit by Givenchy too.
But hang with me, this is not.

Nuit d’Egypte Flanker, open with White Floral beautifully. Soft Citrus and Fresh tone.
Do really lure me to think it as a fresher fragrance. It takes around 30 mins for this fragrance to release its amber experience.

This amber is denser as time pass, and I would say this is "late 201x florental style" amber.
Something like "Ange ou Demon Le Parfum". It is Sweet, Dense, Powdery amber to my nose.
It is also, add something to recreate animalic tone amber. The one that use in "CoCo" by Chanel.

When scent is reach final dry down.
it is powdery vanilla experience, with soft floral support.

I think this is lovely throw back time on Florental fragrance.
It is not keeping at fresh side of think like Atlas Garden by YSL.
It is not overly green at base tho, It is pretty much "Orange Blossom with Oriental Amber"

Cons, it might be too sharp as Orange Blossom can make you feel coiling.
With dense amber, it is combo for long-time white flower x amber user only.
It has tendency to knock you out.

Hey, if It hits discounter at 65-70 USD something.
I would probably keep this in collection.

It’s nice…very nice! Nice with a capital N. Cozy, smooth vanilla with orange blossom, on the powdery side. Softly spicy and resinous. Warm, but not so much that it can’t be worn on summer evenings. Sweet but clean smelling. Creamy, milky drydown. Versatile, and will work all year round and in various situations. It’s easy to wear. Better than YSL’s overhyped Babycat for me. Good for days and nights when you want to be low-key or subtle but still feminine and sensual. Will work in an office setting or an intimate date night. I imagine this is the type of scent men would love on their women, as it smells amazing up close, alluring and sensual but also cozy…’wife-material’ sort of scent I guess. Not an exciting one or a love at first sniff, but it grows on you, and that soft, creamy, lactonic vanilla drydown is addictive, eventhough it’s close to the skin (am I the only one getting that lactonic note??). Soft to moderate sillage and very good longevity on skin. Has the same vibe as one of my favorite cheapies (Guess Seductive, also compared to Armani Code), but more refined and complex with better notes. Don’t understand reviews comparing it to Libre or it’s flankers, I dislike them, they are harsh and veer into masculine territory on me, not a fan of lavender + orange blossom together in a fragrance. This one is smooth and cozy all the way, even the spices are smoothened.

I really like this. Lightly vanilla with spice and floral. Easy to wear. It’s not the most powerful but I’m a notorious over sprayer so works for me .
I just happened to be testing F&R. Hwy 190, the combo is incredible. That’s a happy little accident.
Overall 9/10

Sampled this on a hot summer day, it's an instant like. Smells like one of those incense sticks, bit of vanilla and I can feel just a bit of ginger. Mostly is myrrhe/incense, pleasant and interesting (not too much and not too little on cca 30 degrees). Nothing groundbreaking, I'm not a fan of other Chloe perfumes, but this one I like.
I'm beyond disappointed.. This is just a bland, sweeter version of Armani code for women

It has nothing to do with the OG. Upon the initial test, it immediately reminded me of L’interdit. But I was testing several other perfumes at the same time. My sense could be inaccurate. It’s warm. It doesn’t have the eartheness and dampness as the OG does.

Nuit d'Egypte debuts in a big way. A unique mix of vanilla resins, slightly ambery. It is exactly how you imagine the air would smell in an Egyptian night. A perfect combination, like a puzzle, between Eastern and Western trends in perfumery. But there's a just that... All this wonder doesn't last long. Its uniqueness easily dissipates like a mist in the sun's rays, the perfume evolves into a warm, slightly spiced amber and remains in this way, linearly, until the end.
It should be mentioned that it could be an independent perfume and not a flanker because it has nothing in common with the fruity cypres Nomade.
It has an excellent performance, nothing to say. It seems that the Chloe brand respects its customers and respects itself. It doesn't release perfumes countless, and when it launches something, quality represent a priority.
My only regret is that that absolutely sensational debut is not much more...
8/10

What a beautiful blended myrrh mixed with vanilla, cinnamon, opoponax, orange blossom and broom flower. Chloe Nomade Nuit d’Egypte smells like a warm, soft, cozy, enveloping scent that’s made for fall or early spring days when the weather is still cold but not too cold. Because unfortunately, as beautiful and smooth as it is, it’s not a very intense or good projecting scent.

And for that reason I would not get a bottle of Nuit d’Egypte until it becomes more reasonably priced because it is kind of lacking in performance. And it’s expensive.

Otherwise, I wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone, who’s looking for a creamy, ambery, sweet, resinous, balsamic vanilla heavy perfume with white florals and citrus nuances for cooler seasons. It’s beautifully done..

I just don’t get what this has to do with kyphi. It is an ambery orange blossom. It reminds me of sherbet for some reason. I was hoping for a deeper and spicier experience but no- this is very mainstream. Really unremarkable, so I’m pretty disappointed after all the kyphi hype. I’m giving this a miss
Honestly, this smells like I just walked into a beauty store. It smells like a bunch of perfumes all at once. Not in a bad way, just not in a memorable one either.

... I was just dtectaabout to write what "Violeteme" wrote.
Totally redundant flanker, completing the Nomade Naturel trio - the Jasmin and the Jasmin Intense.
While I like the original Nomade, this one is not understandable. It is such a vague mixture of undetectable notes...

This is really nice, I’m getting jasmine not listed and orange blossom and it’s quite citrus, it reminds me a bit of Libre, it’s really pretty and a lovely spring summer scent in my option. It’s quite unique. My fave is the Nomade Natural so far.. this one is unique and a good release, lasts a long time and has good strength.
To my nose this is extremely similar to other Nomade Naturelle versions. Seems absolutely redundant, if you already own one.

I love to smell it on my wife!!!
Beautiful, elegant sexy fragrance...

It has a note that none of the other (many) perfumes my wife has that makes me wanna sniff her all day, i believe is that kyphi note.

It's a spring/summer fragrance IMO...

I love it so much. It's not straight up orangeblossom. Yes, it's a crowdpleaser, but what's wrong with that? Performance could be better but still good. 4-5 hours on skin, on clothes, the whole day and then some. The sweetness is juuust perfect! And that drydown vanilla 🤤...

What does it smell like? Well, nothing like nomade, just a hint of the DNA far far in the background. Opening a blast of orangeblossom and candied fruit. Mmmmm. Zero cinnamon t.m.n. The ginger I got in the drydown, spicy peppery, so gooood, but you have to spray liberally!

Edit: I got the opoponax, aka incense, but it only showed itself on clothes and again I sprayed quite liberally.) Was driving and thinking why am I smelling incense on my jacket? Jup.

The drydown is VANILLA, Orange Blossom, iris, a hint of spicyness from the ginger, a hint of incense and some delicious sweetness of the fruits. I have no idea what Kyphi smells like. 🤷. What matters that it's utterly addictive.

This fragrance is very much misunderstood by first impression sniffers, which i get. Get yourself a sample or two, douce yourself incl clothes and get testing. This can stand next to niche orangeblossom fragrances quality and scentwise, imo. Performance on clothes is excellent and doesn't morph into something else, but the ginger and incense does show itself better. The amount used here is chef's kiss. Just adds a bit of interest but is not intrusive at all. The balance here is PERFECT. 10/10 I'm in love 🤩

Also, headscratch. imo....smells nothing like nomade naturelle tmn which i've tested twice on skin. It's way better and more modern then terracotta but still has that same vintage floral vibe in the drydown, like terracotta, which i don't love so that was a pass for me. But i do get why it's loved!

Nuit d'Egypte is all about fruity vanillic orangeblossom. Naturelle is about tropical-coconutty banana jasmine.
First impression reviews are just that, a first impression and should be taken with a big bag of salt, even more then the already very subjective opinion of someone who owns the fragrance.
I've said it before and I'll say it again. Fragrantica should really have a first impression button added. But maybe that's just me?

As an egyptian lady i knew i gonna like it, not only based on its name but for its notes espesially the Kyphi.
I have this kinda habit when i travel, i buy a new fragrance from the dutyfree and using it during my trip to be engaged to my memories.
So Nuit d'egypte is the title of my last work trip to Paris and it was glamorus during the spring cold rainy weather.
Outfit: Black or grey wool coat wz black leather boots- additional touch smocky eyes+ rose lipstick

Longetivity: 6 to 8 hours on my skin
Not a beast but it's really shopisticated & unique...

It's one of those scents that takes you to an exotic location, you are resting at the hotel balcony in your bathrobe, facing a garden of yellow, white flowers projecting their heady fragrances into the early evening air, mixing with the scent of the hotel shower soap that you just took a shower with, the bathrobe has a nice laundry detergent scent leftover too.

There's a creamy tropical edge to Nuit d'Egypte, which fits the yellow flowers theme but I do not get most of the resins and spices listed as notes. It still smells like a very shampoo-clean feminine floral designer scent, almost impossible to dislike but also not offering a marginal edge comparing to previous flankers.
Nothing special. There are way better perfumes. After 10+ sprays my husband still couldnt smell anything...i couldnt ether...really close to the skin smell. Disapointing... Sorry its a no from me 😥

A blend of sophistication and allure, with a touch of complexity that keeps it intriguing. A fragrance that is both delightful to the senses and effortlessly wearable is indeed a gem to find. The interplay between lightness and the warm, aromatic notes of spices and flowers creates a balanced and alluring scent profile. It's wonderful that it sits nicely on the skin, enhancing the wearer's presence in a subtle yet captivating way. I want to smell it again and again!

I love going to the store and smelling lots of different perfumes, but I am quite fussy with scents. This is honestly the MOST beautiful perfume that I have ever smelled. It is suchhhh a warm and pretty smell like a room of incense. I don’t normally leave reviews but this perfume is gorgeous it is rare to find a scent like it. I liked decadence Marc Jacobs and nigritella by bodyshop before those were discontinued which kind of had a warm oriental spice smell to them. But this is honestly the nicest I have found that smells warm and cosy but is still so feminine 🙂

If you love YSL Libre Le Parfum but think it's too intense sometimes, if you love Chloé Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum but its sweetness is a pinch too much, I wish I could suggest you to dive into Nuit d'Egypte, it is a lovely melange of the two.
Nuit d'Egypte is delicate and airy, the notes of the two perfumes above belong to it but in a light way.
Walking the path of life with discretion is a sublime art, I'm pretty sure you love it too.
Extremely dry floral, almost dusty one. Also has a vintage vibe. Smells like a fragrance that has been sitting in SEPHORA for two decades.

Rating: 🍋👖👱🏼♀️🤳🏼💅🏼🍟🍹
Do I like it: Yep, it transports me
Who it is: The popular girl in 2012 highschool
Smells I get: citrus/ginger, white florals, amber, myrrh, heap of sugary vanilla
Meyer's Briggs type: ESFJ, ESFP

I love it
I love it
I love it

If Dior Addict (citrus-white floral-vanilla) and grand soir (amber-vanilla) had a cheapie baby, this would be it. 🐥 It's intoxicating, very strong in sillage at first hour, then calms down to a skin scent. Quite sweet, quite ambery, deliciously citric and white floral.

Reminds me of early 2010s perfumes.

There is a memory I have tied to this scent, and a good one at that. I wonder what is it? Reminds me of one of my sister's cool friends, the times of watching Buffy the Vampire slayer 🦇 and of Cosmopolitan magazines.
It makes me wanna dress up and get my ducks in order, but in an late 2000s way. I also get bubblegum. 🧋

It doesn't smell expensive or last very long, but it is a fun blast from the past and makes me wanna get out of bed and live a life where "fetch" is gonna happen & I'm a Pretty Little Liars co-star.

Makes me feel young. 🌱

This is very nice, very safe for a blind buy, pleasant and little addictive, but still "office safe" and clean, soapy...
I wouldn't recommend reading just notes, they are quite misleading in this case.

I've loved chloe fragrances since my 20s, they always felt somehow unique in the designer category, loved the Nomade line, especially Naturelle and I feel like they couldn't really sell those so they decided to add more vanilla and make it more generic. Now this one, which sounded so promising, smells like any other department store 'feminine' fragrance. The vision was there and they suffocated it for profit, I guess.

I love the entire Nomade line, but I think this one has to be my least favorite. This seems so similar to Anamcara to me, which is lovely. I agree that this smells more generic, but it’s a nice fragrance nonetheless. Warm, comforting, and inoffensive.

Very underwhelmed - how does a fragrance with notes like this still manage to smell like a basic, vanilla designer scent? Just a bit of spice here and there, the classic artificial sweetness. Meh

The Jasmin naturelle is better.

Beautiful but once again..nothing new.
This is dupe of Girl of now Elie Saab which I actually prefer than Chloe and it is more affordable 😎

A lovely amber floral for spring/summer - my nose picks up jasmine buds, orange blossom, freesia, a touch of honey, a solar accord, tiare and a creamy ylang ylang.. These florals feel creamy, full of sun, so I'm getting positive, uplifting vibes here. A sunny scent!
In the very drydown it has something from Amarige by Givenchy.
Exotic vacation in a bottle, a great pairing with a feminine summer dress..
My YouTube channel: @SanneParf
Summertime. French Riviera. Sunset picnic. The beach. Salty hair. Bronzed skin. Linen dress. Happiness.

Nuit d'Egypte smells mainly of myrrh and honey (broom) with a hint of orange blossom. It's delicately balsamic, I really like it; it looks like an oriental ointment.

It reminded me of Opium and - be attentive - NOT at all because they really resemble each other (Opium is imposing and strong, this one rather light and sweet) but because of this resinous facet brought by the myrrh and the opoponax, almost "medicinal". It's more of a feeling than a real resemblance.

I find a little mysterious and oriental side to it which attracts me irresistibly and I think that - without being exceptional - it is a more original composition than what we find nowadays.

It's a shame that the staying power and sillage are so light, I would have liked it to be a little more daring.

This is a sweet floral scent with some resins. The orange blossom is slightly honeyed, reminiscent of Elie Saab and Classique, in a subdued way. The cinnamon and ginger are very soft. I was expecting more myrrh and opoponax from this scent. It is very pleasant, but I was expecting more. I think I am going to finish my sample but I won't buy a full bottle.

I own FBs of every Nomade besides this and jasmine naturelle. I hadn’t gotten around to JN yet when they released this. I thought this sounded way more interesting so I bought an official carded mini spray.

First, I’d recommend letting your bottle or sample sit and rest for a few days before sampling. This scent is a bit unstable and comes off different if it’s been shaken. When it arrived I did a wrist spray test and thought it opened up awesomely spicy but quickly faded into the strongest GRAPE jasmine I’ve ever come across (and I’m a white floral fan with a large collection, so I’ve tried a lot of jasmine). The grape was like purple Gatorade on my skin, synthetic, sweet, strong, strange. It felt like Nomade Naturelle with strong persistent fake grape juice. I actually double checked my vial to make sure I didn’t get a jasmine naturelle spray in a nuit d’egypt card. I then checked the notes again and was dumbfounded.

I put my sample aside to rest and retested a week later. Now, it smells mostly like the notes (the notes I’m familiar with). I’d describe this most simply as a spicy sweet orange flower scent. It’s pretty simple and straightforward if you’re familiar with orange flower scents. Definitely reminds me the most of Roberto Cavalli EDP with a touch of Gaultiers Classique Essence / intense (both discontinued) but sweeter and a bit spicier. I am familiar with some of the “reminds me of” scents here and most smell nothing like this to me besides Roberto Cavalli. Maybe Dior Addict as well but I need to retest that one. I’d say there’s a subtle reminiscence to Alien Fusion and Azzaro Wanted Girl, mostly with the gingery spices.

The spices don’t exactly feel as exotic or potent as I hoped. I mostly get a ginger, touch of cinnamon, and some subtle spicy aromatics in the background. If the only listed notes for this scent were “orange flower, vanilla, ginger, and cinnamon” I’d say “yup that’s what I smell!” I don’t get the other spices enough to distinguish them. As the scent dries down, I do feel like I’m getting an occasional subtle whiff of jasmine again, but it isn’t strong pure grape juice concentrate like before, it’s more gentle realistic white floral. I’m guessing one of the spices or notes I’m less familiar with are tricking me into thinking it’s jasmine.

I suppose that’s where the criticisms come from claiming this scent isn’t very unique. I think just about every fragrance line has an orange flower scent somewhat similar to this. But so what? I think Nomade Naturelle smells like monoi, which is not a new or unique scent at all, but the quality, composition, and performance set it apart so much that I chose it over other similar scents that didn’t smell as beautiful. Initially I wasn’t thrilled with Nuit D’Egypt when I thought it was too grapey. However now the orange flowers are coming out and I’m finding it so beautiful. Many orange flower scents do not last on my skin at all and/or I go nose blind to them rapidly. This unfortunate phenomenon led me to “declutter” several expensive perfumes that I couldn’t smell 15 minutes after spraying. However they changed the formula in this Naturelle line, somehow these orange flowers are lasting on my skin and I can keep smelling them. I only have a couple other orange flower fragrances that last and project with my chemistry, but those aren’t orange flower-centric and/or I end up pulling more of the other notes besides the flower when I wear them.

I’d recommend this for women looking for the ultimate spicy sweet orange flower fragrance. Bonus points for the natural ingredients. Overall very nice, I will likely add this to my collection down the road once I’ve finished up some of my other orange flower scents. I like this blend more! Ultimately, I have the same reaction I did when I got Nomade Naturelle. Neither have the most unique composition but both are excellent quality, very mass-pleasing blends and smell like it. I believe both stand out against similar fragrances as better compositions.

I’d say performance is similar to Nomade Naturelle in terms of silage and longevity.

I wouldn’t expect too much of an “exotic Egyptian” or “night” type of vibe. This scent can work at night but has a solar aspect that makes me want to wear it in the sunshine. There aren’t any real exotic spice notes that I can’t find elsewhere, and I don’t get incense, unfortunately, but it’s still a gorgeous scent.

Trying Chloé perfume for the first time, and I'm impressed. The spicy warmth of the aroma is uplifting, feminine, and subjectively quite universal. The scent of warm cinnamon and citrus notes lingered on my hand for hours after I put a tiny amount on my wrist while testing the aroma at the drugstore. I now seriously consider making it my new signature scent.

I was so looking forward to trying this. It sounded intriguing and mysterious and I hoped it would be a wondrous mix of light and smoke. On first spray I was hopeful, it reminded me somewhat of myrrh and tonka which I love, but this impression did not last long. The notes don't mention jasmine, but to my nose I can smell jasmine in amongst the powdery sweet orange blossom. At this stage, it reminds me of YSL Libre EDT. The first time I tried it, it faded down to an ever so slightly spicy, sweet drydown very quickly then was gone without trace from my skin. Even sprayed on fabric the longevity was pretty poor. On second try I decided to be a little more generous in my sprays- two on neck instead of one and both wrists and elbows. This was a mistake. Unfortunately there is something in the composition that comes out swinging when over sprayed. I don't know if it's the cinnamon, ginger or cypriol, or a combination of the three, but it caused headache and nausea. Luckily it still didn't last long and faded away within an hour or two. I was expecting something different and unusual from this fragrance but every time I smell it I have the vague feeling I have smelt this somewhere before. I'm disappointed it didn't meet my high expectations. It could be fairly pleasant lightly sprayed but it is not a love for me, and not worth the money for a full bottle when it is so fleeting. For now at least I am pleased I only have a decant. We shall see if it grows on me.

YSL Cinema is that you? I am currently Cinema wearing to work so very familiar with and was taken aback when I sprayed this.

Maybe if I was to choose between the two I would pick the Chloe as the base is marginally more complex but owning both would be ridiculously redundant.

A non gourmand orange vanilla. No myrrh and the cinnamon is buried deep.

So in summary I like it a lot as it is in my orange amber wheelhouse and so would wear it day to day happily but I am disappointed that it doesn’t live up to the scent pyramid which promised more.
This was a blind buy for me. Smells identical to Armani Code.

Sweet and spicy. A good blend of white and yellow florals. I get a light and syrupy sweetness and a warm balsamic tone. I can really feel the spices on my nose and tongue. Not too heavy, I think it would be appropriate for day or night. Fall through spring. Probably to sweet for very hot weather. I think it fits the Nomade line perfectly. Its very different than the others but still has that kinda upscale traveling hippie vibe of Nomade.
It's like smelling night blooming flowers on the breeze on a balmy night in some exotic location.
I'm happy to have it in my collection.

I must say that the original Nomade was a love at first sniff for me. What captivated me was the interplay of a lightly sweet fruitiness with woody notes. Therefore, I was eager to try Nuit d’Egypte, also because of the addition of orange blossom. However, I feel that this flanker is a pale version of the original: from the beginning to the end, I get mostly a transparent, dry and slightly sour muskiness. The orange blossom is hidden behind that veil of musk, peeking through from time to time. In my opinion, this fragrance has not much similarities with the original Nomade.

To be fair, I don't know the original Nomade, but I don't get any spices really, it's just artificial jasmine and white flowers. Very generic floral perfume to my nose, (I'm not much of a fan of florals as you can probably tell!)
Infer what you will from this, but to me this smells exactly like a Sephora
I really want to ask the parfume department of Chloe, why did you produce that one? Such a waste.. Very nice parfume stays only an hour max, silage is weak.. Why??

Got a 30ml today - I love Nomade Naturelle and was super excited to try this one! I’m fascinated by Egypt since I was very small, so I loved the story behind the fragrance and the notes looked like something I would be into. To me this fragrance smells like a huge bouquet of freesias. It’s floral and a tinny tiny bit spicy, it’s pretty and very wearable in my opinion, safe for office space and daily wear. I was expecting a more heavy perfume based on the notes listed, but this is very subtle. It matches the Nomade line, it’s a sweet addition, but unfortunately not what I thought it would be. I wanted something more mysterious, oriental, heavy and long lasting.

Edit: I’ve layered this with Armani Prive Indigo Tanzanite and it’s now everything I wanted from it. Suggest trying layering it with stronger, oriental and masculine leaning scents.
I love all the nomades in different ways, also this one even though it is weird ( to my nose ) . It actually smells a little like that smell you get when you sharpen a pencil…? 🫢
I love this flanker so much! It’s probably my favorite Nomad after the original Naturelle, it’s so gorgeous. So good!
It smells like Pure XS for her to me, but I like this one a bit more. But my favorite remains Nomade Naturelle.
This is 100% dupe of Roberto Cavalli! And unfortunately one of the notes here makes me genuinely sick :( Hard pass for me.

This is wonderful. Not as smoky or potent as the notes would suggest, but it’s got a spicy and creamy smoothness to it. It’s very sweet, well blended and unexpected. A successful blind buy and my favourite out of the Nomade line.

It’s just pretty. I was super hyped for this one because I adore Chloe Nomade and every flanker so far. This on doesn’t have any Nomade or Nomade Naturel DNA.

It will be a crowd pleaser like Paradoxe or Born in Roma or D&G The Only One Intense, but super disappointing from a huge Nomade fan hoping for something special and unique.
btw: it does not smell like Cinema and Roberto cavalli at ALL (I have both)

I just got it today:

So Im a lil a bit disappointed as I was looking forward to this one and tbh it kind of smell generic to me..
It smells like Elie Saab Girl of Now and Loverdose

I already have the nomade naturelle which I LOVE! and I was expecting something unique with this one. Unfortunately its a cute winter scent but nothing more.. :(

Finally a new designer release that seems to be more well thought and complex as far as the notes goes. I love Chloe Nomade Naturelle and I am really looking forward to trying this Nomade Nuit d’Egypte!

@gothicat idk about samples but makeupstore.com had all three sizes in stock on their US website a couple of weeks ago, though they’re sold out at the moment (https://makeupstore.com/product/786227/). I’m waiting for mine to arrive (they ship from Poland so it takes a minute). Might be worth checking their page every now and then to see if they restock; their prices were surprisingly reasonable, at least better than I expect full retail will be.
is it long lasting

Oh wow, I can see that people voted that it resembles 3 perfumes which i really love: Armani Code, Cinema and Roberto Cavalli. Can't wait to try it - will update once that's done!

Update on March 8th, 24: I've tested it briefly and sadly, it does not resemble any of the aforementioned frags to me..
It is an average, boring scent with a rather annoying note, however cannot pinpoint what that is. It is a pass for me.
This is the only release I am excited for!!! FINALLY something unique!
I want this so bad. Huge fan of Nomade Naturelle.

This is literally the only Quentin Bisch I like. I don't just like it though. I LOVE it. To me, this smells like straight up vanilla extract. I cant smell spices or flowers. Just vanilla, and I love it!

A very interesting take on vanilla. I recently got a 150 ml bottle after trying it at a Sephora store in Singapore. It’s very green and floral. It’s not loud, but has a decent longevity.

Really enjoyed layering this with J-Scent’s Black Leather.

It is one of the few perfumes that truly moves me...Vanilla Planifolia is everything I wanted it to be: soft, but unforgettable and addictive. As others mentioned, I get a green banana peel in the opening mixed with soft spices (probably cinnamon). The banana smells quickly dissipate and you're left with a delicate vanilla flower and incense. I find it mesmerizing and although some would say it sits too close to the skin, I think that's the intention here. It's delicate like a petal and feels like a loving hug.

I did not expect this. This is vanilla? 😀
It’s like the plant is added in its entirety to impart a dewy green scent. It is unusual but not unpleasant at all.
Beautiful , green but slightly gourmand but not cloying , quite unusual fragrance and one I keep reaching for
fluffy, airy, sweet, to me its gourmand somehow. i do kinda understand why poeple say it reminds them of play doh. but angelic and sweet for me!
This is giving me so much Tom Ford Soleil Neige vibes, with TF being more in-your-face and VP slightly more sweet, but the florals on these two are almost identical. Definitely not what I expected.

First sniff is green with a touch of spice — but spice in the sense that it piques your interest not in an overwhelming clove/cinnamon/gross way. It's a stunning and straightforward scent throughout. I got a compliment from a stranger on this. My favorite vanilla.

I wanted to really like this I’m glad I got to test it.. we’ll see if it grows on me but for right now it is a very green vanilla. You definitely pick up on the spices that I feel like ruined this fragrance for me. I love spices, but how it’s done with the type of vanilla that it has in here I think they should’ve just used pink pepper or even Coriander or saffron there’s definitely some notes missing. It’s simple but complex at the same time..
Had to come back and edit this it’s a great easy reach and now that it’s had time to sit for a little it’s deeper then it was you definitely get vanilla along with the spices I think it’s the vanilla orchid it has a little bit of a powderyness but it’s very well balanced I see it being well liked it’s nothing amazing but I can’t dislike it either. It does have that Chloe DNA to it.

It was hard to track down a sample of this one and I was so excited to finally get my nose on it. Kind of disappointing. It smells nice, but isn't unique or memorable. Very soft and mild. I sprayed heavily on skin and clothes and waited about an hour to run it by my husband. He said it was okay but very faint. Definitely not worth the money. We're both big fans of Chloe Lumineuse, which is much more beautiful and special in my opinion.

wonderful. this might become one of my all time favorite vanilla scents. It opens a tad green, but after 30 min or so it dies down, thankfully. Then you get a sweet vanilla, but not as basic as just vanilla extract. It has a bit of a spicy undertone, but it just ties the scent down instead of ruining it as black pepper can do in some other fragrances. Gucci Flora Gorg Orch is a bit fresher than this.
Opening is quite floral, quicky dries into a very papery, powdery vanilla like dehydrated petals. Quite mature, smells a bit like a grandma

I've been searching for a banana fragrance and a reviewer suggested this... I don't get any banana, but an ethereal version of Crème de Cuir from BDK Parfums.


it's beautiful, but my search for a beautiful banana fragrances continues…

Chloe Vanilla Planifolia starts off very green but also slightly sweet. It’s like a mixture of morning dew on freshly cut grass and unripe green bananas. It’s a bit strange but not quite unpleasant to me. After a little while, a soft powdery vanilla or tonka bean joins the mix. Then the banana becomes more of a banana pudding in the dry down. Sweeter and creamier than before. There’s still a greenness reminiscent of freshly cut grass and flower stems the whole time but it softens a little bit in that final stage of the dry down. It projects softly within arms reach. Unfortunately, this perfume is not for me. I don’t hate it but I also don’t like it. This isn’t something I ever see myself wearing. I might finish my sample but I will not be purchasing a full bottle.
A warm unique vanilla scent which is not too strong, more on a skin scent. Can wear on a hot weather which will not bother people around you. Like this one.

I smelt this in store recently and bought it to add to my collection of imaginary vanilla flower scents as I am tired of all of the woody vanillas which lean too gourmand or too spicy. I love eating vanilla and smelling vanilla and am always searching for something different that is not the dried fruit of the vanilla orchid, ie the dried pod.

To me, this is indeed what I want to believe a vanilla orchid flower could smell like. It is a gorgeous enveloping tropical scent (as after all vanilla orchids are tropical flowers!). Beautifully blended; a soft delicate vanilla which pulls ylang ylang to me; i say that having recently mixed ylang ylang essential oil with an unscented body cream which as the natural oil can only reveal, is warm and not loud like it is portrayed in so many perfumes.

I sprayed vanilla planifolia all over me before bed last night and woke warm and cosy; the fragrance gently remained on my skin. I don’t smell banana at all; this is sweet, but gently floral as it dries down. I like it ❤️

It is a delightful vanilla scent. I feel like it has green notes reminding of fresh banana. It creates an incredible, unique quality that sets these perfumes apart from other gourmand vanillas. It is not a typical gourmand. It is a fresh, clean, elegant scent while being appetizing and sensual. Close to the skin, with moderate projection but good longevity.
This is a very soft vanilla. It last 8+ hours but low projection. It’s sits close to the skin.

Careful this smells nothing like Celine Zouzou that tiktokers are trying to influence you and lie about. This smells very tropical banana-pineapple. Reminds me of a less sweet version of gucci’s orchid the yellow bottle. It’s really not milky not sweet not sexy. It’s BANANA literally. Green banana!!

This is the first Chloe in my collection, as in general this brand does pretty good, but not my cup of perfume :) However I had interest to this perfume once it was launched, because I love vanilla in it's all aspects. And I did not think too long, just 5 years and voila- this perfume is mine! :) I sprayed it just 10 min ago and can not say anything about it's technical characteristics, however this 'soliflor' (single flower) composition is unusual in a very good way. Same effect as Vanilla Planifolia from Guerlain- effect of deep thinking about what you feel when you sniff it. It's not the effect that you would expect from 'just vanilla'. I literally had an image of a refined beige-yellowish, delicate velvety surface that which at some point it suddenly gleams with a light green, smooth-satin surface. I literally have this visual image. Never happened to me. Now after 15 min I don't have this green satin glim, but it was interesting. I really like this perfume. It's really worth to try. Not a typical vanilla perfume.
If you want to know if it has some similarities with Guerlain Vanilla Planifolia. It's just similar name.
It reminds of walking through a glass butterfly habitat full of tropical plants. I pick up both banana and pineapple in addition to the vanilla. I don't detect any spicy notes.
subtle creamy vanilla, nothing paricularly special. Reminds me of a baby, a sort of intentionally mild and inoffensive biscuit or wafer scent. smells like maison margiela's afternoon delight.

Just tested this in store, horrendous on paper but better on skin. i’ve never been this conflicted from a scent, when i put my nose on the spot i sprayed it smells very cloying and “chemical” like but when i get whiffs from it from afar it smells lovely?? This has never happened to me, dk how i feel.

For me this is a very beautiful perfume that im in love at first sniff, an ethereal scent, that you can wear in any weather and occasion. light and creamy vanilla scent with a touch of soft floral scent. my best blind buy after versace crystal noir. love it so much! and the fact that this is a work of art by perfumer Quentin Bisch makes it even more special in my collection

Vanilla Planifolia is the name of the plant, native to Mexico, that this is based on. I wasn’t sure what to expect from some of the reviews, and was a bit unsure on the initial opening, but I love it! It’s a smell I recognise, walking along paths on a tropical island. The air is humid and you can smell the slightly sweet mix of plants and flowers. That’s the scent I pick up from this. It’s a fresh, green scent with some crisp, clean vanilla in the background. I find it quite comforting. It’s a soft scent to me, although my boyfriend could smell this before I even entered the room and he loves it. Very feminine and sophisticated. This is a scent that makes me feel put together. Perfect for all year round.

Shoot. I bought a sample of this thinking it really would rival Diptyque’s Eau Duelle based on hype reviews. Oh how I was let down.
Whereas Diptyque smells like natural vanilla reminiscent of vanilla extract on me, Chloe’s Vanilla is a synthetic sweet. It must be the Iso-e I am so sensitive to, because this is just one of too many plasticky fruity gourmands that’s instant hate. I can’t even really pick out the vanilla here, I just get the plastic sweet that hurts my sinuses after a few sniffs. Not sure why but it almost reminds me of cotton… like synthetic cotton? Orchid is usually also not a hit for me, so there’s that.

Overall so glad I got a full Eau Duelle.

This smells like Lush American Cream (the perfume). It's a softer version. Chalky is the key word to describe it. Chalky and herbal. Not my style.

This is on my skin, btw. On the card this is much nicer - similar to Gucci Flora (yellow one) but more vanilla and less "air freshener". Where is this on my skin?? It turns into a screechy chalky mess on me.
Very molecular fragrance, similar to Vanilla Vibes. Salty, a bit green, with a hint of a dry vanilla. Disappears quickly. I should have learned my lesson by now in regards to hyped fragrances.

Vanilla Planifolia is everything I wanted it to be and more. It opens with the juiciest, nectar-filled orchids—so vibrant and golden, they almost feel alive. They’re dripping in this creamy, thick vanilla milk, but it’s not your usual sugary vanilla. This one’s smooth and mellow, like the perfect amount of rich and gentle. It feels warm and cozy, but somehow airy, a richness that wraps without suffocating. After a bit, there’s this hint of spicy wood shavings just enough to add a bit of texture. But the woods don’t hang around for long, fading gently into the background and leaving the orchids and vanilla to take center stage. There’s this almost edible quality to it, too, gourmand but also juicy and floral in a way that keeps it bright and alive. Honestly, it’s addictive—god knows how many times I've sniffed my wrist—like a vanilla orchid dessert I’d happily drown in.
there’s an artificial, plasticky note that appears in the dry down that really cheapens the fragrance which is so unfortunate because the other notes are lovely and the opening was great

This is such a sweet, lovely fragrance, and I always love it for the first few minutes, but there's a thick syrupy play-doh note with my skin chemistry that eventually ends up driving me just a little bit crazy whenever I wear it (but I do still love love love layering this one)

Surprising ! Extremely green, extremely floral, almost unbearably so. I don't understand how this reflects the notes that are listed here. There is a tiny bit of vanilla here, but it's completely overpowered by the green and floral notes. This is not a true vanilla scent and definitely not for vanilla lovers.

If you do enjoy it though, the longevity is fantastic !

Notes look like this could be a good one, but I didn’t get any spices or woods. This is definitely in the family of light, “salty” vanillas like more refined jhag vanilla vibes, a less sweet gucci flora vanilla, and less interesting, flat and more generic Coueur vanille.
This was a weird one. Literally all I got was about 20 seconds of something that smelled like a green banana, and then it totally disappeared.

First 5 minutes were very promising , lightly sweet fluffy vanilla with touch of spice .. like passing by a bakery .. then it soon dries down and falls on the faint floral territory ..

Inoffensive but very forgetable and light no lasting power nor sillage , try other creations from the same line .. give violette a shot its so worth it :)

Vanilla Planifolia is the second perfume I have tried from the Atelier des Fleur collection and I like it better than Ylang Cananga. I find it again, a fairly light, airy orchid vanilla scent but at least this one has a bit of complexity and contrast. It’s not just bottled vanilla sold for more than 250 euros per bottle. Has some spicy, floral, woody facets that makes it more interesting and faceted.

But again, too light for the price! The bottles of this line look very classy and heavy with a minimalist style but the intensity of the scents really leaves me wanting more.

If money would be no issue, don’t get me wrong, I would like to have a bottle of these on my dresser. But I’m not there yet. I can’t justify spending so much for something so weak!
A very spicy vanilla

Chloe Vanilla Planifolia is very reminiscent of Initio's Absolute Aphrodisiac without the animalic civet note which can become annoying after a long wear and pull masculine on my skin sometimes.
