This fragrance is GORGEOUS and has outstanding longevity on my skin. Compliments galore!!!!
Currently obsessed with this. I layer it with the Herba Mimosa fragrance from the Chloe Atelier series and it's heavenly 😍😍 I sniff my wrists all the time because the scent makes me happy.

Pretty, slightly floral, slightly spicy vanilla. Not terribly sweet. Leans slightly feminine.
Pretty strong
Leans slightly Playdoh.
Not sure I'd want a full bottle

Actually this is Kayali Musk 12 with Playdoh
Not very vanilla forward in my opinion ,however, i thoroughly enjoy this one. It's light and airy. Not offensive at all! Just pure loveliness in a bottle.

I was so excited to try my decant after reading reviews on this. I almost blind bought it because I was convinced it Sounded perfectly up my alley. I smell NOTHING even after multiple sprays in the same spots. Definitely don’t blind buy as their may be some notes that are asomic for some people. Glad I tried a decant first.

It does smell like a lighter-ish version of Ca Boum from Teo Cabanel, but its the same smell. Also has the green dewy smell of Nishane Hundred Silent Ways X. I made the connection the moment that I smelled the scent in a mall in Madrid. Its light but has presence to it. Smells like a green - matcha style vanilla that is not my taste to be honest. This scent profile is NOT something I enjoy to wear or smell. Is it unique? I can say yes but is it so enjoyable? For me Nope. The bottle is classy though.
A strange tropical fruitiness about it that is seriously drawing me in. Doesn’t really smell like vanilla but I will enjoy my sample

Such a lovely opening but after 5 min it turns into a vanilla candle.
I will try it again some day and give it another chance because of that beautiful opening.
I love this scent! Soft green vanilla, perfect for colder or warmer weather. Elegant, sweet but not too sweet and the dry down? Lovely. Another inspired creation by Quentin Bisch.

it's devastating when you have an idea of what a perfume will be like in your head but it doesn't work out once you actually try it :( this is why I will never blind buy! vanilla planifolia is pleasant enough but I was so hoping that the combination of notes would be airy and light on the skin. I think the ambiguous spices are ruining it for me. I also agree with other people who are detecting something green on the skin, even though no green notes are listed. It's a perfectly good likeable fragrance, just not what I was hoping for and sadly not full-bottle worthy for me.

It's cookie dough, like I smell vanilla extract
and I can feel the dough on the back of my mouth(a bit dry), a spoonful of sugar, very crunchy... and a pinch of salt?
Floral note adds to it so this could be chai or chamomile flavored
Interesting gourmand but I was looking for something freshier, colder

Gorgeous. Worth every penny and the long wait for it to come back in stock.

Opens fresh and airy floral heavy gourmand with green notes, the plants, the stems, the petals. It feels edible when you spray, but the plant-ness of it makes it feel more in the family of a fresh lavender sugar cookie or French violet toffee candy. It almost feels like there’s a touch of mint in it. I think this is the banana scent others mentioned. Smells like a fresh green banana, unpeeled, not the candy fake banana flavor.

As it dries down, the greenness fades and it develops a sugar crystal cookie top with a sun baked tropical floral base. The florals felt more sharp and aquatic in the opening, like a few other “orchid” notes I’ve sampled, but as this dries down they transform to a soft beachy ylang type smell, maybe a little tuberosey, with a good amount of vanilla.

It’s lovely on its own or, as it was designed, can be layered nicely with other scents. Not ideal for someone looking for a straight simple vanilla gourmand or for people who don’t like floral scents. Smells expensive and well designed. It seems simple upon first test but the scent evolves very nicely. Perfect for easy days when you just want to feel pretty but don’t want a scent that demands the attention of the entire room. Or for dates in the park wearing a sun dress. I’m currently wearing in the winter and it smells very nice and not out of character for the season as well.

Doesn’t quite smell like anything else I’ve tried before. That doesn’t say much, but I can tell this is different. Very unique. I much prefer it to a lot of popular “vanilla” scents, but I also seem to fall in love with a lot of Quentin Bisch’s work way harder than I do for any others, it’s even happened with scents I didn’t realize he designed until later on.

I feel like this scent will probably be stored next to my beloved La Belle Fleur Terrible (same designer) as they feel similar though smell different. Both are vanilla heavy tropical florals. Chloe is light and chic and more gourmand. Fleur Terrible is heavier tropical and floral with a spicy woody vibe, not exactly edible. (Fleur Terrible is getting relaunched this year and will be renamed “La Belle Paradise Garden” btw for those curious). I wouldn’t say they are interchangeable at all or that owning both is redundant, they smell very different from each other to my nose.

I’ll definitely be buying a backup of this.

Not a good experience, doesn't really smells of vanilla. I was expecting an airy, comforting scent but it's nothing like that.
From the cap, I get a floral vanilic, airy, almost chamomile warm smell.
On skin and clothes it only smells like crystalized sugar from the get go till the end.
I cannot find a single good aspect of this perfume and unfortunately I could never wear it, not even one spray, that's how flat and just pure sugar it gets.
INLOVE WITH THIS!
this is one of the longest lasting in the collection airy sweet vanilla, the dry down reminds me a lot of Guerlain Baiser de Russie which isn't a bad thing!

love love love. this perfume was love at first sniff, it’s a fresh floral vanilla, i don’t really sense any spice on this, more of a fresh citrus vanilla smell. the dry down is sweet on my skin, my favorite chloe perfume by far.
I like green vanillas but this one is sooo sickeningly sweet, and very green to my nose, that I just can’t. Definitely selling mine.

What a delightful and wonderful surprise this fragrance took me by!! I was not expecting to smell something so “light” and airy as this…this was truly a great experience, one I wish many fragrances would make happen. But I digress.

Vanilla Planifolia smells airy and slightly green. Not the same green as Angélique Noire by Guerlain nor Ani by Nishane. It is its own. But it is “light”, airy and fresh and yet deliciously floral with a slight touch of warmth (the vanilla?). Does this make any sense? Probably not. I had to blind buy it as it came up on my notifications from Nordstrom and I rushed to get one of the few bottles they had left! This fragrance sells out very quickly and with good reason! This is a vanilla that is neither sweet nor gourmand and yet, it manages to take me to paradise when I spray it on my skin.

Longevity: surprisingly long!! 8+ hours on my skin!
Sillage/Projection: very mild, almost shy but I love it!!!
Season: anytime/anywhere! This is an easy one to wear!
Price: look, it’s a masterpiece! I don’t care how much it costs, and my ONLY regret is that I couldn’t get the 5oz bottle as it is difficult to find.
It’s backup worthy (in my humble opinion) and so well blended that I will sing its praises all the way to the Angels and back⭐️⭐️⭐️✨⭐️⭐️⭐️

Is Quentin Bisch a rockstar or what? Well done Quentin, very well done!!!🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

This is absolutely beautiful! A smooth, soft vanilla that isn’t blaring with overwhelming sweetness. This one is special. It’s a scent where those close to you will get a treat and want to linger near you. Definitely a “you smell incredible” moment when they hug you. I LOVE this!!

Oh hell no. From the cap it smells sensual. Just as described, but both on paper and on my skin its unbearable. Powdery, lactonic, salty, woodsy but not the way I like woods. I wish it wasn't this bad and smelled like how it does from the cap. Well. The downside of chemistry.
It's pleasant, but for some reason I get bananas from this. Like fresh bananas. Good if you like bananas which I do but steer clear if not as it can be a divisive scent.
I love Chloe but this is VERY powdery. Undoably powdery. More powder than vanilla. Hard pass for me.

This is Quentin Bisch's take on the (imaginary) scent of vanilla orchids and I get it. Real vanilla orchids have no smell but this is a bright, welcoming floral vanilla. Slightly velvety, reminiscent of the softness of orchid petals between one's fingers. Light, airy, but not fleeting-- this one stays present. It's super elegant yet feels so versatile you could wear it in any kind of situation.

This is a wonderful floral scent, once again. To me it's not a full-on gourmand vanilla even though it's slightly sweet. But it's sweet enough to make you want to smell it again and again. It's very warm weather appropriate. I can't wait to try it on a slightly windy weather, when sunny spring days will be back.

Simple, very elegant and optimistic. My favourite take on a floral vanilla.

Tropical Vanilla with banana touch, smell like fresh and creamy banana smoothie. Quite long lasting and definitely gourmand scent.
It's kind of unique compare to other vanilla woody scent. BIG like to love !

A refined, natural, fresh, expensive vanilla scent.
Smells unique and alluring
Has a touch of sour to it, not sure where its coming from though.
I definitely think its worth the price, I haven't smelt any other vanilla scents quite like this one.
Definitely something fresh and almost tropical about this, not a heavy winter vanilla whatsoever.

Very pretty fresh, but still sweet, vanilla. I get 4 hours with 6 sprays. It's nice, you could wear it in the summer and be safe. It also has a "green" aspect to it. Sillage is okay, as time goes it becomes a scent you have to be super close to to smell.

I have to say I'm underwhelmed by this. Very flat. Yes, there is vanilla, orchid, woody notes but this perfume is lacking depth and energy. It smells like a basic vanilla orchid body spray and not a fine expensive fragrance. And this line is expensive. I expect value for my money. A friend kindly sent me these samples I have been reviewing so I'm not out any $$$ but I just don't think this scent is worth the asking price. If you want a vanilla orchid perfume that has real depth and interest, try Vanilla Orchid by Precious Liquids. I have several samples of that and am considering a full size. I'm not a huge vanilla lover but that perfume will get you what you want in a floral/orchid vanilla fragrance. This one here falls flat.

Vanilla with a floral backgound and a hint of spices. Its nice but for this price you can find something in the niche realm that is much more unique. But still a very lovely fragrance. Simple yet stunning.

I second thingnanimose about the young wood and vanilla impressions. A facet of vanilla that we don't much get to experience, more floral and less edible. Although this is something that I would not wear, even as a vanilla lover, I can appreciate the uniqueness and quality of Bisch's work here.

Sickeningly sweet :( like cough syrup with vanilla touch
So chemical that i cant bear it
Woody salt? Salty wood? A skin chemistry disaster for me,, smells like some type of chemical.

I have been testing a decant for about 2 weeks now and I can't get past the Iso E Super. It just smells like a woody smelling cleaning product to my nose. BDK Velvet Tonka went that way for me, too. Really disappointing. Love vanillas and this sounded so amazing on paper. I wish the perfume industry could find another chemical molecule to add longevity. It evens overwhelms spices to my nose. I envy those of you who can wear this.

This is amazing! It is non-sweet vanilla, at least sweetness is not in the focus, but its delicate spiciness, its woodiness, its mysterious fresh floral hue and even freshness. It is also buttery. If you seek only gourmand side, this one might be a bit too spicy for you, but not for me. Spices make it cozy, a pinch of pepper in the top give this delicate vanilla a bit of texture. This is vanilla masterpiece. Do you remember Vanille Noire Yves Rocher? There is a familiar butter-fresh-woody nuance.

As a vanilla lover, this frag has a uniqueness that kept me smelling my wrist all afternoon. It almost has a slight saltiness at the opening. Then it blossoms into a gorgeous floral vanilla. Its sweet but not too sweet, floral but not headache-y, and serious enough for a 40 years old who wants to be seen as feminine but firm and young enough for a 80 year old to lure a flirty suitor. After two or three hours it melts into the skin offering a tease of vanilla here and there as you go about your day. By the fifth hour it becomes a skin scent that's a bit spicy but sweet enough that it leaves your partner wanting bite into you. This is the most unique vanilla I own and I am so glad I blind bought! I dare say that this could be a signature scent due to its lack of popularity. - just my two (s)cents. hehe

I love this! It smells so interesting it’s not your typical vanilla, I smell a pepper and green like watered down Angelica, soft woody, very sexy close up scent, not an over sweet vanilla has more character smells elegant not little girl

I’m so surprised with this perfume. Many people I know told me to skip it and go for Kayali or Vanilla Woods. I have yet to get my hands on Kayali but I can say this smells nothing like vanilla woods - thankfully. This to me smells like warm cookies from a French bakery but that’s not all it smells like, it also has smooth woody & floral notes. These do not smell like run of the mill floral notes. I assume this is the orchid that’s mentioned in the description. Although I said this smells like a cookie it doesn’t smell very sweet. I showered after trying this on and still smell it albeit a skin scent. I am definitely buying a full bottle of this and I’m not mad at the price point for a 5 oz bottle - you can tell the ingredients are high quality.

I blind bought this fragrance, because I couldn't find any reviews and not many notes are listed, that alone made this fragrance a mysterious one.

I think this fragrance is a flowery, spicy, clean yet a little bit animalic in the dry down.
In the opening I percive something green.....maybe green cardamom and some pepper .....and maybe I'm crazy but when I spray it I think it has the tiniest bit of pear mixed with dill and a citrus or something sour (this I get for only 5-7 min). The opening I don't like that much but after 10-15 min, I love it.
Then it has something flowery (I'm not saying it is magnolia, but something reminiScent to that.. like it says on the packaging .. "almost carnal flower") and maybe nutmeg and a little bit of cinnamon and then it turns into a mysterious, addictive and sensual fragrance(but also somehow with a sobriety to it)

There is something special in the dry down. It is mysterious, elegant with a hint of an animalic note and a little bit of sweetness .
It worked realy well with my skin and I could smell this fragrance for about 9 hours on my skin and in my hair even longer. For me it is a skin scent.

If it has vanilla pod, it is a subtle one and it is present in the dry down because it has a hint of sweetness it.(But it could also be tonka)

I percive something similar to the spices in "Intoxicated" by Kilian but Vanilla Planifolia is a skin subtle scent and could be worn throughout the entire year.(It is just similar to the spices)

The description on the packaging of the fragrance is spot on.

I'm happy that I bought it.
Can someone post a negative review so I don't blind buy this at Nordstrom please? Just saw they have it online...😅

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
The EDT is lovely. Fresh and considerably lighter than EDP and Eau Sensuelle - this is a perfect office/daytime/warm weather fragrance. There is nothing offensive here. This is a straightforward soapy floral that has that pretty Chloe trademark to it. I bought mine directly from Chloe so I know my bottle is authentic. If your EDT is a scrubber yet you love EDP I would consider questioning authenticity because the EDT is a safe blind buy and is very similar to the EDP just slightly more effervescent.

I have all 3 in the Chloe Love Story line and love to layer them. They compliment each other nicely. What's not to love?

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
I was today years old when I found out there was an EDT & an EDP. I had to go get my bottle to see what I had. I have the EDP, but I'm down a rabbit hole trying to find out the difference. Then I saw above where most don't see a difference. Hmmm...anyway, I've always said my EDP smells like gain detergent to me. In a good way. I do not get BBW Sweet Pea tho.
I have NEVER, NEVERRRR smelled such a complete difference in an EDT & EDP. EDT smells like rancid glue. NASTY! This should not have even been given the name "Love Story" b/c if someone tried this first, they would never in a million years try the EDP. This EDT was a scrubber & it was so bad I couldn't get it off of me & was scrubbing lotion into my skin. HORRID!

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
This is one of my best dumb-reach summer perfumes. I was disappointed when I got it initially, it seemed quite sharp at the opening and reminded me a bit of BBW's Sweet Pea fragrance. But as the weather warmed, I started to really enjoy it. I applied last week and even though it's very much winter, I kept getting lovely whiffs of it through the day. Very clean, soft after initial spray, and approachable. I feel put together when I wear it.
Edit: I love nasturtium and grow it en masse in my garden - I don't really detect it here - instead I get a staid and slightly sharp floral note that I associate with freesia - may be the plum blossom?

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
I received this perfume as a gift from my mother, who intended to buy the original Chloé. Even though I'm not a fan of Anne Flipo's fragrances, I'm not disappointed by this one. It's a fresh and light scent with peony, orange blossom and pear. It reminds me of l'eau d'Issey pure petale.
Very office friendly, safe to blind buy or as a gift.
Silage and longevity are not impressive, but that's expected with a scent profile like this. It's a good perfume for moments when you like to freshen up a bit (end of the day or after a shower before bed).

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: It's a fresh and slightly sweet floral. I want to use this in warm season

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This is a floral citrussy scent, slightly powdery and sweet too (but not gourmand sweet). It literally smells like a love story in paris to me. It’s youthful but still classy and just very nice. Sillage and longevity are pretty good too. Love it!

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: I love the musky drydown. But there is a synthetic note that is very sweet and would suit a younger, perhaps teenage girl. I am 39 and I find this scent very pretty, but do not love wearing it myself. It is long-lasting, 8 hours on skin, 12+ hours on hair.

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
This one is a little fresher and a little less "perfumey" than the EDP. It's a like, but not a love. I think for orange blossom, I'll stick to JPG Classique, JM Orange Blossom, or PdM Safanad (if I want to splurge). It's nice though for spring/summer days.
Edit: I really enjoy the drydown but still probably not enough for a FB. I sprayed about 2 hours ago and thought the initial blast was still rather "perfumey." I am getting whiffs of it now and it is really lovely.

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This is a really fresh and elegant floral scent, and perfect for spring/summer. This was actually one of the very first perfumes that caught my attention when I was smelling perfumes in a mall one time. It's not that complex, but that's also what I like about it. It's nothing too crazy but I think it smells more 'classic', like it can work over an extended period of time. A really pretty scent for sure!

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This smells exactly like Dahlia Divin Initiale! Very soft beautiful summer perfume! So sophisticated 😍

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Perfect rosy-cozy smell, warm, clean, simple. I love it!

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Lots of alcohol in the opening and then, for about 2 hours, the typical, "just-another-chloe-floral" vibe. However.. as I'm continuously sniffing the back of my hand now at 3 hours after spraying, there is something, a little "je ne sais quoi" about it.. I believe it's simply taking the musk, rose, and plum blossom this long to fully bloom on my skin - pun intended. This one really , like a good love story, needs you to be patient with it.. it's not a full on in your face kinda love. It's a story... and it has to have time to be told. It's worth it. ;)

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: A bit crisp and harsh when spraying, but within few hours it settles for nice clean bit soapy flowery 'expensive' smell. When you want to smell clean and 'just nice' and nothing coconutty exotic bubblegum oriental= just my cup of tea. It stays on clothes but it doesn't linger around.

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
I don't smell much of the listed notes in this. It's a very floral, clean scent, but it smells more like a abstract waxy white petal mix than realistic orange or plum blossoms. A little creamy, but unfortunately also a little scratchy. All on a base of laundry musk that intensifies in the drydown.

For my personal taste this fragrance is too clean, cold and nondescript. Not unpleasant, but not what I imagine when I think of a true "love story" - it's missing a spark of passion and excitement. It's more like an innocent crush that never leads anywhere.
This would be appropriate for days when you just want to smell clean and fresh, and it's relatively long-lasting for this kind of scent. But to be honest I think there are many better, equally easy-to-wear options in this category.
No idea how this compares to the EDP as I haven't tried it.

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
The opening is a bit alcoholic, them it turns into a warm and slightly sweet soap with a touch of powder. It’s the best from this line, but i am not really impressed. Chloè is really not my brand. If you like Chloè and perfumes like Glow by Jlo you will probably like this.
Final note: 6/10

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This smells just like nasturtium! Wow!

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Feminine but not too girly, at least not on my skin. Not the most sophisticated scent I own, but I quite enjoy it in the summer. It's nice. That's about it, in my opinion.

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: It smells like the edp, they are both strong and long lasting:)

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This to me is not worth the price at all. It turns so sour on me and doesn't last at all. Very disappointed and its going back to the store.

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
This fragrance has become a new found love for me. Being a fragrance lover and suffering from allergies and hay fever this summer has not been a good combo for perfume! Many fragrances regardless of how light have become nauseating, and have led to multiple sneezing which isn't pretty. I was sent a sample of the EDP and liked it, but felt something was missing. I generally have noticed that I tend to prefer EDT's mostly over EDP anyway. On a brave whim I bought Love Story EDT and boy am I happy!

Love Story EDT is as soft as a silk or cashmere scarf. Ever so lightly, it does not have heavy silage, but it's soft silage lasts a very long time which is just perfect for me. Bottled in a sleek bottle with a lovely pink bow tied to the side, this fragrance evokes the feeling of fresh clean white sheets to me. Orange blossom, rose, and musk create a long lasting sophisticated scent that is sure to grab you compliments from anyone who hugs you. I highly recommend x ❥

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
Foggy medical purity.

Fresh. Purity points towards clean linen and delicate
unscented washing-liquids of pharmacist.

Sensed a hint of grass or bambu in the 1st test. But not much.

Not weak, the scent surrounded me at least for an hour, noticably, when I applied some 4 squirts on me. An interesting, quite special scent.

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
Sprayed the EDT on my wrist and the EDP on the other for comparison, they are similar in a way but the EDT is more fresh, crisp and sweeter. For some reason, the EDT stayed longer than the EDP on my skin. I even had to respray the EDP to make sure I wasn’t wrong!! Hmm or maybe the EDP on the counter was an older one?! *shrugs*

I love anything Orange Blossom, and its the first note I could smell. This is a clean, bright happy fragrance, one that can definitely lift your spirits up. Great for an all around, everyday scent — work, errands, shopping with girlfriends, movie date with the boyfriend, lunch with the family. Bottle is absolutely gorgeous, very girly and pretty to be part of your collection!!

With that, this one next on my list.

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Eau de Toilette is more beautiful than the Eau de Parfum! If you like the floral parfums this is for you. Smell like sweet fresh flowers in water in vase. I smell the orange blossom and the citrus when I first spray and then rose and something like the geranium (nasturcia?). Fruity flower of plum blossom. In the dry down a clean musk. This parfum is clean and very simple easy to wear every day. Good for day time spring and summer. Such a pretty parfum and hard to find compared to the original Chloe Love Story Parfum. I found this in eBay. Such a pretty perfume!!!

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: More fresher and more floral than the original version. The scent is lighter version of Dior Pure Poison. This one definitely for day wear. I can wear it easily on day and work. What I don't like about this perfume is longevity, very poor longevity and plus it is expensive.

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
@The Swedish Girl

According to your reviews, EVERY perfume smells bad - like "toilet cleaner", "mildew", "ammonia", "melted plastic","indolic toilet paper"...

I'd take your reviews a lot more seriously if they were balanced and - occasionally - you could get through one without being derogatory about the fragrance you are testing.

I rest my case.

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
I thought this was going to be exactly the same as Love Story EDP, but I was WRONG. It's softer, sweeter, and prettier, in my opinion.

The EDP is beautiful, but it has a hint of the floral sharpness in the original Chloe (rose) that gives me a slight headache.

This one doesn't.

The opening is soft and sweet, like a toned-down (and slightly muskier) Prada Candy Florale. But as it dries down, the orange blossom that makes Love Story EDP so unique shines through. It's still sweet, but the citrusy white floral begins to warm up.

The dry down stays quite true to this sweet orange blossom, but melts into your skin with the most beautiful musk.

I would attribute the sweetness that sets this apart from the EDP to the Plum Blossom, and a sweet rose note.

Someone said this smells like Miss Dior Blooming Bouquet, which I also love. I disagree that they smell the same, at all, but there is a similar tone. Both are sophisticated, but in a gentle, floral, breezy way.

If you are a fashionista, this would pair beautifully with any of the airy Chloe dresses, especially in pink, rainbow, buttery yellow, pale green or cream.

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This is the best perfume in the world. I love you Love Story!

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Nice and feminine but I find it way too similar to Vanitas. Young white floral with a vague fruity aspect.

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
SA gave me a sample of this perfume. I saw the picture of the bottle and was excited. A bottle so pretty had to contain a good stuff, no?

Then I put it on, and waited. After a minute I realized that this is one of the weaker ones, so I'll have to sniff my wrist to check the progress of the scent.

At first I smelled overwhelming sweetness. I was waiting for some flowers to appear out of that, and eventually they did, but the sweetness lingered.

Unfortunately for Chloe Love Story EDT, I don't like overly sweet perfumes. I am able to overcome my dislike if the rest of the scent is really interesting. This one, however, isn't.

I tried it on a couple more times, just in case, but the verdict remained the same: this one is a pass for me.

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
I have it for just for few days, but so far I LOVE to wear it every day.
It is soft, clean and fresh and really pleasant fragrance, which is perfect for me to wear warm day.
On my skin it lasts more than half of a day, so I was surprised to read that it is weak.

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: First of all, this is very lovely! It's sweet flowery like natural nectar. It's sophisticated, not too girlish. Definitely one of my wishlist.

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Glad to see I'm not the only one who thinks this smells like Miss Dior Blooming Bouquet. Upon first spray I just thought it was nice but a few minutes later I kept sniffing my wrist. It smells so good I had to close my eyes to smell it just to take it all in. Then I thought this smells very similar to Blooming Bouquet. It's a soft feminine floral scent. Office safe. Something to wear on a day to day basis without offending anyone around you. I don't own it yet but it is on my wish list. I'm not in a hurry to buy because the few times I have tested it, it didn't last very long. Unfortunately, lasting power is as minimal as Blooming Bouquet. If I see it online for a decent price I'll be sure to grab it. For now I'll just enjoy it by stealing a few sprays when I visit the mall.

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
I got a sample of this yesterday and have been wearing it since. It was bugging me to no end that I recognized the fragrance but could't put my finger on it until I finally got it.

It's really similiar to Miss Dior Blooming Bouquet.

But while MDBB turns into a very sharp washing detergent smell on my skin, Love Story is more floral and fresh and not detergent-y at all.

But in the end, I still prefer the regular Chloé EdP. I would not buy a full bottle of Love Story, but would not say no if I was offered it as a gift.

EDIT: I cannot stop wearing this. I honestly don't want to wear anything else right now. Will buy a FB of this sweet floral gem.

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: LOVE story indeed. The perfume surround you in flower Shell without spreading their heavy sweetness. My skin keeps the orange blossom but most of all, the plum blossom. The feeling that lasts on me is a feeling of a creamy,hidratated skin. Unlike the EDP, EDT does not last as long but it opens much quickly as a smell and it îs very fresh. I won't mention the bottle which looks fantastic. Love Story is floral perfume for summer, playful and feminine. I recommend it.

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
I´m sorry but I´m in LOVE AGAIN!
On me the opening it´s harsh......yes,but sooo fresh floral opening with green notes,like a fresh cutt grass with orange blossom.After a few minutes the orange blossom is very intensive but there is somenthing creamyness which I like.My skin just love it.I have to say that it´s waaay better than Love Story EDP(on me of course).I feel like a real and beautiful women in a white lace dress in a meadow where Bella & Edward was(around me are flowers).I will buy a big bottle,because the bottle is just soo feminine,romantic,and it´s very Chloé.
Now I´m in love. <3 <3 <3

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Harsh bitter pointless floral with no redeeming features. Sophisticated interestingly styled bottle apparently containing floor-cleaner. Very faint hint of violet powder dry-down. I love all the Chloe bottle designs, I wish they would put something nice in them!

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
it was expensive and doesn't last on my skin. even it's very lasting on clothe but i still disappointed. the bottle is adorable but it's doesn't work, sorry to mention that. i think this perfume is for young sweet teenage girl

the good points are, i can imagination people wearing it for walk out, going to the park, going to the shopping mall, celebrating birthday, working in the office and wedding event.

a bit harsh in the opening and turn down after an hour. it sweet and flowery

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Why, oh why is this so weak?! No sillage, zero longevity. I would like the scent but so...

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
Got a sample of this edt.

Smells like a toilet air freshener. A rose scented spray one.

Painfully green, moldy and harsh.

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
This perfume is more like a cologne to me.. maybe because I immediately compare it to the EdP version.

In general, this is a nice scent but is too weak and lacks personality to be considered a perfume.

هذا العطر أشبه بالكولونيا من أن يكون عطر ... الأغلب لأنني
أقارنه بعطر البرفيوم

إجمالا, هي رائحة جميلة و لكنها تفتقر للثبات و الشخصية لتكون عطر شخصي

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Recently got a sample of this. I am definitely getting white flowers (predominantly orange blossoms) and some peary fruitiness after an initial spritz. A little bit of vanilla roundness and a peppery character adds to the flowers on the drydown. A hint of sweetness for additional youth and girliness. Smells like springtime to me, but it is as pretty as it is forgettable on my skin.

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
What a shame, what a shame! I love this pretty bottle, but I only like this nice scent. Not enough to buy it though.
It's truly pleasant, a bit sour, a bit floral, but it misses wow factor for me.

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
This is quite nice, I like it a lot!! It is a pleasant refined floral, I love orange blossom, and the plum gives it a bit more edge. It has also a certain sweetness, which makes me think I would love wearing it in spring!! I might get a bottle, this is very nicely done, elegant, casual, and I forgot to add , it smells great!!! I don't see how anybody could dislike this !?
Anne Flipo just has the nose for prettiness!!

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
To me its another regular pink floral. Of course not horrible, very safe and lovely really, but I wouldn't recommend if you want something different.

Edit: The dry down has actually got more interesting, I can smell the fresher accords, but then after that, it disappears.

product_name: Love Story Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
I remember how I disliked the EDP because of the overwhelming white floral bitterness. This one is not that bitter. It's mildly white floral.
I still don't like it. In my opinion, it's just not pleasant.
Hoped more from this, but what can you do.
Very strong floral. There’s an undercurrent of sourness that throws me off. Without that sourness and perhaps spices, I would like this.

Along with Poeme, Ysatis, Fifth Avenue and Sunflowers, Narcisse was one of the best and my most worn perfumes of the 90s. These were amongst my first perfume purchases when I started work in my early 20's and I could finally afford to buy "grown up perfume" in Boots or Superdrug.
A beautiful symphony of apricot, jammy florals and I get a greeness that turns what is essentially a bouquet of synthetic flowers into something quite magnificent.
Narcisse-along with all my 90s loves, I will really miss you.

The EDP version was my signature scent throughout the 90's an into the early 2000's until it was discontinued. This is a heady chypre floral fragrance, strong and long lasting like others from it's era. If you are looking for a very good dupe of the 90's EDP, the thefragranceshop . com makes an excellent oil/parfum version they call Narcisse Type for Women that is nearly indistinguishable from the original. I found it a few years ago and it opens/drys down exactly like the original every time!
In the UK, Perfume Parlour do an amazing dupe for Narcisse. It smells identical to me , and they call it Gorgeous 0143. As you can no longer buy Narcisse, it’s fantastic!

My love for life, together with Very Valentino edt and edp. I use it since I smelled it on my friend who sprayed it in her neck. 1993 I think it was. I wanted to walk behind her forever. It smells different on different parts of my body. And the best moment is when I shower, as then I get this voluptuous, sweet, full bodied blast of warmth around me due to Narcisse. Delicious.

I spray it on 20 minutes before I leave the door, otherwise I fumigate people. But in the morning when I think: ‘is today a Narcisse day…?’ I smell the nozzle, sigh, and if it is, I am in heaven for the rest of the day.
Also, a compliment getter, from women mostly. It gets better during the day, it softens.
But for the prices it sells now, I would not purchase it.

I am using the reformulated one at the moment, the darker brown one. It is different, but still a good rendition.

But honestly, spray lightly and with 10 inch away from the area you spray.

bought a mini version of this on a whim admittedly because the bottle is super pretty. turns out this is not my taste at all! if you like warm, floral and LOUD perfumes, this is for you. for me, this smells like a chic old lady which is not my vibe as i prefer fresh and clean fragrances. i can see my late grandma wearing this
They're selling the reformulated cheap versions for over $200...

Thick, ultra sweet and strong vanilla number with a weird menthol icy haze over it.
I cannot really smell any flower or fruit. The name is rather misleading.

I love this perfume, it really sucks that it has been discontinued and if your lucky to find one online it's majorly expensive.... used to be $40 and under at chemist warehouse now you would be lucky to find it less than $300 online! Anyway this brings back so many memories, hands down my favourite scent of all time. 10/10!

I adore this fragrance. I knew someone who wore this in the 90s and I promised myself that when I grew up, I would wear it too. Sadly by the time I was old enough, it was discontinued. Having studied perfume and it's history a bit, I can say that they don't make them like this anymore. Narcisse has lived in my olfactory memory for years and I never forgot it due to its beauty and sheer strength. I was extremely happy when I found an excellent clone (Perfume Parlour UK) that smells identical and performs like an absolute beast.

This is a stunning floral bomb with gorgeous honeyed fruits. It's luscious, syrupy and literally dripping in wanton suggestion. It's the smell of creamy white florals after a tropical downpour that leaves the air humid, heady and intoxicating. Definitely not for the weak.

In addition to the EdT I have the PARFUM version in a very small bottle. Wearing it now, and if you think the EdT is powerful the parfum is nuclear! Smells great, even better than the EdT. Stay away if you don’t like loud perfumes!

Es una obra arte. Es vintage pero en su justa medida, un floral polvoriento dulce, una aroma única que deja huella por dónde pasas… es una bomba intensa de narcisos tanto en duración como en proyección. Eso sí, no es apto para usar en verano, solamente en invierno, otoño y algunos veranos frios ya que es una aroma muy potente y con 2 atomizaciones en la piel diría que es más que suficiente porque es potente y puede causar náuseas por lo fuerte. De hecho es un perfume descontinuado desde hace años por esa razón pagué una suma bastante alta para tenerlo. Definitivamente es una joya muy preciada para mí.

This was my mother's fragrance. There is something maternal, cocooning and comforting about this scent to begin with. It's warm, floral, and feels like sunshine in the afternoon. This scent was so perfect for my Mom, her skin and chemistry really worked with this one and it will always be a comforting scent for me. Too bad perfume pirates have decided to rob us for a fragrance that has been discontinued. The people who bought this fragrance were not rich people who were going to spend $500 on a bottle of perfume so instead of letting people enjoy the last bottles of it, they're going to hoard them till they expire and be stuck with old, expired perfume that nobody wants and THEN they'll sell it to you for an appropriate amount. I get trying to ration the product and raising the prices but it's absolutely insane to jack it up 600%.
@candy613 European Perfumes has a dupe, I bought it for my mom and she said it was spot on!

I've been wearing narcisse since 1992. It definitely has different smells on different people but worked great for me. Still searching for a new scent as this has been my primary fragrance for over 30y 😭

My Winter Perfume, That I Keep Secret From Everyone; I Don't Even Remember How Many Times I Finished The Original; They Should Have Named It Addiction; A Complete Winter Perfume; Although I Have Difficulty Reaching It Now, I Can Still Access It Thanks To Its Equivalent Producers. Most People May Not Like This Perfume; It's Vintage and A Perfume Needs A Little Bit Age; However, After The Scent Settles, It Creates A Serious Spread Of Floral Fragrance Around You; In This Respect, It Leaves Behind Chopard's Casmir Perfume, Which I Love Very Much. It Would Not Surprise Anyone That Most Sugary Perfumes Have a Very High Diffusion And Persistence; but, This Perfume Captures the Surroundings And the Environment You Enter With A Dominant Floral Scent; İ Never Had Effective Diffusion And Persistence İn A Floral Perfume, Like This.
A rare gem, a true masterpiece. Like no other. The edp is in fact ab extrait. Extremely expensive nowadays but it makes sense. Stunning creation.

I have a .12 mini of this fragrance. Oh does this bring back the memories of my childhood. My childhood friend mother wore this on occasion and my mother herself wore big fragrance like Poison and Red Door. The 90’s fragrance were definitely big and beautiful. But this is so loud in a good way. Just a few dabs from the mini and the entire room lights up in a beautiful bouquet of flowers.

I was given a bottle of this as a wedding gift from my sister, I wore it on my honeymoon. I’m a very sentimental person so I absolutely love it. I still have over half a bottle and as it’s now discontinued and very expensive to buy on eBay, I ration it. It’s definitely a strong and vintage fragrance and not for everyone, but for some reason I’ve always had a fondness for those types of fragrances. I’m pretty sentimental and nostalgic person, so that’s probably why. We used to find it at Walmart for under $20. Hard to believe that now!

I have the best memories of this scent. I used to wear it exclusively and would get complements all the time. Now, however some of my old clothes that were doused in this scent smell like old grandma to me. I quit using it and never went back. But I remember the smell and it was heaven. It didn't smell like any other perfume out there and so hard to describe. Oh the luscious memories, RIP sweet Narcisse!
Absolutely stunning fragrance. The fragrance of my childhood and early adolescence. It makes me teary eyed to think of it, especially knowing it is now sadly discontinued.
This is my grandmas signature scent and my childhood in a bottle. It’s emotional for me that’s it’s discontinued. Should be a crime.
Instantly gave me a headache. I could smell it a mile away if worn. The awful memories!

One spray lasts all day! Beautiful but heavy and heady. Opens with syrupy apricot, and then develops into green florals (especially the daffodil/narcissus note). Green florals v. golden fruit. Nothing shy about this one. I do feel the similarities with Spellbound, but that one is sweeter while Narcisse is greener.

Nothing new today smells like Narcisse. It's so opposite to all that trends today...so of course I adore it. My bottle is at least ten years old, maybe older - I have owned it for ten years. Age improves this, so don't shy away from buying old stock. Sublime sweet floral, not cold and green the way narcissus typically smells, more sweet and green/gold. More like a candied narcissus. It's a gorgeous scent.

I have an extensive collection of this and I still have 2 full 100ml bottles bought 10 years ago when I used to wear this a lot as I adore it, then forgot about it but made sure I have a supply. It blew my mind to see this on amazon for £400!!!! This is insane, I think I paid about £12-15 for it at the time.
It is a beautiful perfume, lasts for ever, is spicy and floral and has amazing projection. But OMG the price now is insane.

My opinion about this perfume will never be objective: this was my first love's first gift to me. All those happy memories are engulfed in this scent. When that relationship ended, my teenage dreams also ended with it. That's why I never dared wearing this perfume again. But if I smell it, it all comes back and it is a magic cloud of happiness, just like the smell of Narcisse.
I still have my bottle that I purchased back in 2003. It still smells and performs the same. I wear it a couple of days a year.

For me, this is a beautiful fragrance. One that is like a power statement. I owned more than 5 bottles of this before it was discontinued because I would wear it almost every day. I still look for it in the hopes that maybe, just maybe I could pick up a bottle or two. *sigh*

Scored a bottle of this. Oftentimes with "legendary status" discontinued perfumes I'm skeptical of how true that remembrance might be.
Something being not readily available anymore or linked to joyful memories of the past might be not remembered as accurately and fall into the grandiose and ethereal field of descriptions from people when in reality that something was just "good", or "great". I'm guilty of doing that many times with many cosmetic products, not just perfume.

This is in fact quite gorgeous though. And subtly ethereal yeah, I'd say.

There is a lot of emphasis here on the strength of it and I can't say I think it is particularly "risky" to overspray or be obnoxious.
It is strong, it does last quite long, but unless I'm noseblind wearing it now, I mostly get wafts from my clothes when I do movements from time to time only, not really a dangerous or headachy scent I think. I sprayed about 8-10 times, maybe a little more.

There's a certain note, not really sure which one out of the lot that reminds a lot of 90's plastic dolls and such items. Novelty store smell. I don't mean that in any detrimental way though, it manages to be that and also quite classic and refined at the same time.

I can't make out any peaches or apricots. It is a rubbery-flowery smell basically, but zen, level headed and not cheap smelling.

I can't make out daffodil either, despite being the namesake of the perfume. It's just a nebulous kind of flowery. I think certain eraser pens from the 90s smelled a lot like this, if that perhaps helps you get a better idea of what I'm referring to.

I have never seen "tolu balsam" in any other pyramid, call me uncultured, but I guess that could be the rubbery effect I get? I guess resiny, balsamy applies as a descriptor too.

If anything I think I make out the carnation, it is a softened carnation, not pungent or overtly green or spicy, although I do enjoy that pungent-ness from a real life carnation. That's not present, for the relief of the many haters out there.
Other than that maybe the pineapple, but it's a borderline gone bad pineapple, you now sliiightly alcoholic, sweet.

It's a gorgeous scent, I lf I were limited to one word to describe it would be "charming"

found a vintage mini because i've been curious about this for awhile, though i probably unknowingly smelled it back in the day. i get lots of peach, spices and warm florals with sandalwood/amber. smells like a lot of other 90s perfumes. i like it, it's for certain specific occasions, but i like it and will add it to my plethora of other peachy 90s floral minis.
Duh! Is a women perfume. I just got it cuz is discontinued not to wear it.

Yes, it's a big 90s floral with beast mode sillage. I use a very light hand, and usually just wear it in the winter. I wear it far less often now, but still get unsolicited compliments every time. On me, it's a peach-jasmine vanilla musk.
Very loud and spicy at first. Then you will smell overpowering dryer sheet in dry down. Hard to wash off.

Fortune brought me an half full 200ml bottle of this lost beauty on eBay and it is like a warm weather version of Ostara by Penhaligon's. Ostara, however, starts with a photorealistic representation of the first daffodils of an early Spring morning; Chloe Narcisse starts out much more abstract then takes on the guise of a daffodil laden garden after a long dry hot day.

It's lovely, like the original Samsara EDP but much better on my skin. Worth hunting down if it's sitting in your memory bank waiting to be revived.

This is best enjoyed wafting in the air around you, similar vibe to Cabotine De Gres... Love this 💖 She's a firecracker 🧨 I love her strength, she's so intense and she's meant to cover up whiskey breath and cigarettes... She's a lovely lady 😚

I'm almost getting a Samsara (EDT in the red bottle) vibe off this. When I was newly pregnant with my son, Samsara on my skin degenerated into basically just musty peaches and cinnamon and sandalwood. My little mini of Narcisse pure perfume is also peach/apricot and sandalwood-heavy. Samsara and Narcisse also have some of the same background spice and floral noise. I like Samsara much better, though. These days, Samsara smells more like it's supposed to on me, while Narcisse smells like the interior of the old Salvation Army store in town before they moved into a modern building.

I was given a sample of this and was excited because I remember it being a big hit in the 90s. When I first sprayed it on it was very aromatic with a heavy dose of apricot & peach along with some spicy amber. It smells a bit dated but in a good way. I’m glad that I got to try it but I’d never spend hundreds of dollars on this fragrance. I can however see how some would love it!

This perfume is the first perfume I remember falling in love with when I was about 13 years old. My auntie wore it and my teacher wore it and it was one of those perfumes that was just instantly recognisable, you stood out from the crowd wearing this, it just smelt like heaven to me. I remember my auntie buying me a bottle for Christmas one year and the joy when I opened it, I finally had my very own bottle I was in awe of it lol I wore it every day for school and was the envy of everybody. It didn't last long and I remember saving all my pocket money and buying another bottle, then another and another, it became my signature Scent. You could get it in home and bargain for about £10 at the time and I stocked up. Fast forward nearly 10 years I forgot all about it until I was moving house and found a brand new unopened bottle and the memories came flooding back, it still smelled so good. By now I had a son and he used to cuddle up on my knee and sniff my jumper whilst going asleep and then started to spray it on his Teddy bear to cuddle when he went to bed he loved it as much as I did and then I ran out and tried to purchase a new bottle to find it had been discontinued 😭 I was devestated and I still am. I just recently came across a few over priced bottles on ebay, I'm currently saving up and going to treat myself for my birthday and even though my son is 21 now he still has that same Teddy bear he now uses as a pillow 😂 and I am going to spray the Teddy for him for old times sake 😂.
This perfume is intoxicating. Heady floral, creamy, warm and the smell literally fills the room. I think you either love it or hate it, it's a love for me even though it's nothing like anything else I wear. I now only usually buy gourmand perfumes but this will an exception. I just hope there are some still left online when I am finally able to purchase one x

When I was a kid, I begged my grandmother to please take this perfume off her! Now I keep half a bottle that belonged to her. She is still alive but sometimes I smell Narcisse to remember the happiest moments of my childhood with her.

found this for a steal on a discounter's website, bought it for nostalgia's sake, and i am SOOOO glad i did! as a teen, i loved this and wore it a bit, but often felt like it was too much for me. it probably was, back then. no more. it now fits me to a tee. spicy, green, warm, slightly sweet (but not at all gourmand), richly floral — simply intoxicating and delicious.
One of the best perfumes of all time

Reminds me of my first ever real perfume Tresor. It is so similar that if someone was wearing Narcisse I would think they are wearing Tresor. I did not appreciate that back in 90s as I found it so sharp and too little sweet. Narcisse is not my favourite. I think it smells very 90s.

Based on the notes, I should like this now, but I wouldn't shell out 500 dollars when the 50 dollars I spent some 30 years ago was a waste. That was real money back in the day. Not suitable for romantic or professional wear, loud and cloying. I probably threw it out. Eventually I learned to wear a fragrance for a couple of hours before I decide if I like it.

Wearing this tonight, layered with a bit of Jonquille de Nuit. I remember reading about this being discontinued, so googled it to see what it's selling for ... I only have half of my 50mL bottle left, and that makes me super sad. However, I don't wear it too often so I can be reasonably happy I still have ~30mL.

Chloé Narcisse is a 90s floral, through and through. It being discontinued isn't a total surprise as it isn't exactly "current" or "with it". I don't know how well it sells, but I imagine it wouldn't be as good a seller as it was; this is disappointing.

This is less a scent for warm spring days, and more a scent for cool autumn afternoons. Stone fruits, white and yellow flowers, and a woody vanilla dry down. Feels in line with fragrances like Charlie Gold (but a lot more refined). The comparisons to Diamonds and Emeralds/Sapphires are apt. A very similar vibe. I don't think there's a person that this is too old for, or too young for. This could very easily suit anyone. However, in saying that, anyone who wore this would probably need to appreciate that this isn't going to be the smell of 2022. Very lovely, but not timeless... let's not kid ourselves.

This was my first designer fragrance! I absolutely loved this fragrance and house. I received this as a 13th birthday gift upon launch--I had to have it! And...my parents obliged! So pretty, so soft, and so feminine. I kept this masterpiece in my collection until adulthood. I recently wanted to repurchase it, but to my dismay, it has been discontinued. What a shame!

I had a sample of this back in the 90s that my mom passed along to me because she didn't want it. I remember it as being very strong and exotic, maybe heady, in a way that I wasn't comfortable with then. If I could still get it, I'd try it again and see if I liked it better.

This was one of my "use up the sample/travel size/decant but don't buy more" fragrances; there've been a lot of those in my life!

I do remember that it lasted for quite a few hours on my dry, perfume eating skin. I don't remember if it was the EDT or the EDP, but I assume it was the EDP since it lasted so well.

RIP Narcisse!

Ok my old bottle of this has indeed turned & I suspect the majority cohort left of this one can't be far behind.. but why change the picture on here from the original box with bottle one with the correct colour of the scent as it was supposed to be, to this picture of it turned gone off & brown? Is Fragrantica going to change all old scents to a picture of them turned brown or faded from blue to green or gone cloudy with bits in or whatever? Heyday photo back please!??

I've worn this perfume since I was fourteen (I'm forty-two now), and it is my absolute favorite. It’s very femme fatale: sultry and mysterious, with incredible sillage. How I wish it hadn’t been discontinued!
Such a breath of fragrant fresh air, never goes out of style!

Looking for a replacement?
I've smelt the new Davidoff CoolWater Reborn for women and from what I remember it smells very similar even though the notes are completely different.

I get that there are those of us who enjoyed this fragrance and miss it, but is it really enough to justify the exorbitant prices at which it's being sold on EBay? Like others, I'm perplexed. Especially since it doesn't have a particularly high rating here.

This was my first "nice" perfume like a few others who've posted. Before this all I could afford was Body Shop oils and the odd travel-size sampler. ;-) I definitely bought it in large part because of the beautiful bottle. On me, I remember this being rich verging on too rich. A floral and fruity bomb. And even then, it was a bit too floral / sweet, without enough of something contrasting, to be a real love. But I liked it, and I don't know what happened to my bottle. Most likely I donated it to Goodwill at some point, which I'm now regretting. I'd love to smell it / try it out now and see what my reaction is. But at the prices it's going for, alas, looks like this won't be happening!

My very fist signature scent at 16. It may have been a bit heady for a teenager but I wore it everyday with abandon and confidence.

That spicy, sweet floral with a touch of powder was just IT for me. I layered with the shower gel, lotion and dusting powder. I'm sure you could smell me into next semester. But I was, and still am in love.

I'm not sure how many bottles of this I've been through. I remember being gifted extras at Christmas time during several different years back then.

I've got one large bottle I'm currently using and one small one stashed in the closet. I sometimes contemplate buying more at the ridiculous prices offered now as I just can't imagine not having this in my scent wardrobe.

I've got a million other scents these days, but Chloe Narcisse will always be my first fragrance love.

Thickly sweet peach & apricot on a bed of spicy florals. Projects beautifully through the scent's profile as it winds down to its balsamic vanilla base. Lasts for hours and hours, and creates a wonderful cocoon around the body.
Wears best in cool weather, really shines in autumn & winter.

I mourn the passing of 80s and 90s powerhouse Perfumes!!!! How I loved this beast and wore it until I ran out recently.

The first spray is harsh yellow flowers with spicy carnation and apricot, a sort of greenish spicy blast but the dry down on this is complex and unique, as well as very pleasing to the nose. Rose, yes, it's there, fruit, off course, white and yellow flowers and a yummy balsamic note. It is a confident scent which makes no excuses, no apologies and takes no prisoners. It can fill a room for hours. Spillage and longevity are amazing but, this used to sell as a low end scent. Now it is a sought after, niche, scent and will set you back a fair bit.

For those of us who grew up with Perfumes like these, Houbigant's Rafinee, Chloe Narcisse, Oscar de la Renta's Volupte, 'O' de Lancome, the original female Aqua de Gio, Dior Addict (original), Lancome's Magie Noir, the only man still standing is Calvin Klein's Obsession, which I still wear although reformulated and toned down a tad.

Wouldn't it be great to have some of the available, even as limited editions. Especially this confident lady!!!!!!!!

Guys when did this perfume become so expensive?? I remember buying this just 7 years ago for 20 bucks for a huge bottle. Now these bottles are hundreds of dollars. That’s scary. And a bit sad. I agree with the poster who said this smells like Rapture. Both juices have that heavy syrupy fruit smell that is so unique to the 90’s.

An exquisite fruit salad; a thick nectar of fresh orange and yellow fruits arranged on a pink flower bed.

Narcisse is truly distinctive in both its potency and '90s beauty. There is something synthetic about Narcisse's colourful bouquet which, in truth, I really quite like -- this elemental presence ties the rich variety of its notes rather harmoniously.

I was clumsy enough to spill several drops of this on a table surface, some years ago; it then saturated the better part of some fabric: the lingering aroma (dare I say that it never really disappeared?) is indelibly impressed in my olfactive memory like a luscious and syrupy stain. Chloe's vintage creation is everything that modern Chloe is not, and cannot be: boisterous, flamboyant, audacious and, above everything, unique.

8/10

I wore this one a lot in my early 20s, and oh boy, did I love this baby! And although it's unmistakably vintage, people would often tell me I smelled really nice.

So yeah, it's a classy late 80s / early 90s bold spicy floral, with such a rich composition and so many notes it's difficult to make out what they all are exactly. It's also kind of "dusty" and slightly medicinal in an intriguing way, that's really the part that makes it apparent which era it comes from.

In spite of its age, Narcisse doesn't feel "old" to me. It's retro but in a romantic and youthful way. It'll make you feel like you're a charming 80s film heroine, not like you're wearing your grandma's fragrance. A great choice for younger vintage lovers! As for myself, I think it used to fit my style and personality way better when I was 20, but fast forward 10 years, and now I'm just not a vintage girl anymore. I thoroughly enjoyed it back then, though. Good times, good times.

Update on 08.08.2022: What do you know, I'm into it again! Narcisse is just too beautiful to ever get over it, it seems.

Perfume Parlour make a clone of this if you’re in the U.K. It gets great reviews. I’m here to find an affordable replacement for our Penhaligons Orange Blossom hand wash. This looks similar and PP have it. I’ll give it a try

Probably the heaviest perfume I've ever come across, above preformulated Alien, above La vie est Belle. Blind bought it back when I was clueless about fragrances and didn't know what to expect, was in my early 20s and this perfume was wayy too mature for me, it's just too much in every way. It has a loud narcissus smell, accompanied by a heavy and dark sweetness. I've tried putting a tiny amount on my wrist to get more casual whiffs of it, but the scent itself is just heady. Before going to work I've sprayed this only twice, and my coworker who was driving me had to open the car window IN WINTER lmao, scent filled the entire car in minutes. So I ended up giving this to my mother who loves heavy loud perfumes, she used it up. If you get a headache easily, this isn't for you. However for those who do love this type of scent, this powerhouse is more than worth what you pay for it, and the botte is very lovely too.
To all the Narcisse lovers, Victoria’s Secret “Rapture” smells verrrryyyy similar to this. I’d consider it a less-sweet dupe. They sell it every semiannual sale 🧡

It finally occurred to me what my kenzo world power reminded me of… it’s Chloe Narcisse! If you want a fragrance that reminiscent of the 90s powerhouses, than try Kenzo World Power. It’s the yellow eye!!

Chloe Narcisse? Let’s sum it up in four words: stunning, flowery, unique, STRONG! 💖 This fragrance is one of the longest-lasting and most intoxicating scents in my collection, right up there with Dior's powerful Dune and Merveilles Hermès.

And let me tell you, layering it is a no-go—it’s so strong that it completely drowns out anything else. Is it like Tresor? Not even close! Tresor is all about that ripe apricot vibe, while Narcisse is a lush green daffodil flower infused in a sugary syrup elixir, with just a hint of apricot and peach. No other scent can match the room-filling sweet bomb that is Chloe Narcisse!

I’ve seen some comparisons floating around, and they are way off base. This beauty hasn’t found a serious clone yet! If I had to pick something that’s somewhat similar, I’d say Nicole Miller, but it’s more of a plum thing that misses the sugar heavy sweetness that Narcisse delivers. Liz Taylor’s Emeralds touches on some similar notes, but the overpowering gardenia takes over from start to finish.

This fragrance is one of a kind! I’ve got a stash of backup bottles I’ll never part with (never ever), thanks to my local chemist practically giving them away! The name Chloe Narcisse really fits—it’s practically an elixir! The strength of this EDT is a nod to the lost art of perfumery, like Byzance, Sicily, and the original Mania. I give it a full 20/10 for both scent and performance! I don’t throw those scores around lightly! 🌟

Wear what you want. No labels needed.

I can see why some reviewers compare Narcisse with Poeme, but i believe they start and go in different direction eventhough they share some similarities especially the sweet flower bomb notes.

Both Narcisse and Poeme are intense, complex, and definitely a statement. While Poeme started with strong yet delicate honeyed sweet floral, Narcisse would bomb you with flowers, spices, and balsamic note since the first spray. Head-aching, possibly. Apricot, peach, and pineapple joined the party later, when the spices and florals frenzy have calmed down a bit. The transition phase did remind me with my eternal love, Poeme, but without the game changer honey and mimosa.

Narcisse has a light powdery drydown, still super sweet, a bit spicy, slightly musky, and balsamic (the balsamic note’s always there all the time). Sandalwood’s presence only in the final phase.

I think it’s a grandeur floriental perfume, i really like it and appreciate its existence.

Ah, I'm so sad! I really did not like this perfume a few years ago. I had bought it and gave it away. Now, I really want to get my hands on it again! Then find it's sold out every where and discontinued. I've been craving this scent so, I'll have to find something else similar to it. I remember it was a strong scent of peaches, apricot, florals, spices, & musk. I'm really looking for that peach/carnation & spices combination.

Wow. This perfume is AMAZING! The 90s made the absolute best perfumes ever created and im just now finding this! This brings me back to sunny happy days as a child and i swear this smells just like 90s magazines. It is stunning and the feelings it invokes are from a time i have long forgotten about. This and spellbound are the best perfumes of all times.
I have this perfume if someone needs it.

Flowery-fruity scent. This is a true 90's scent when floral scent was quite fierce and strong. At some point it indeed makes me feel that I've bended my head into a huge narcissus bouquet. A bit synthetic, but this resembles me that naive, high school mindset (a time when I wore quite synthetic fragrances) when the World seemed to be missing me, I would never fail, my life would go only up for me, I would never face difficulties :). Maybe the resemblance of this positivity is why I love it so much... Considering Chloe as a brand this is the only perfume I truly like from them, as they are too earthy, ozonic, green for me.
Anyway, Narcisse would go in my "classy and feminine" perfume shelf along with Jean Patou "Joy", Guerlain's "Champs Elysees", Lalique's "Nilang" and Bill Blass "Nude".

Hey Chloe please bring this back or at the very least remake it and sell it to us immediately. It sells for high prices now on eBay. I remember when I could buy it from amazon for £12! So sad. Really need this back in my life please

This came out when I was around 11. My Mom bought it for me in junior high :-) I can't believe this is classified as an EDT because it is a beast. The quality knocked the wind out of me in such a good way. How do you describe this masterpiece? Sweet, zesty, honeyed floral. If perfumes had a goddess/higher power this would be it.

This was the perfume that brought me “on line” to perfume. I was 13 or 14 and only barely aware of the womanly world of perfume. I smelled this in one of those magazine ad flaps and saw the light.

I don’t think I ever had more than just samples of this, but it’s dear to my ❤️.

This is one of the few scents that I've had for over twenty years. It's a really strong, rich, spicy scent that I only wear in cold months. It's just too strong for warm weather, and I live in LA so I can't wear it often, but I really like it, and it's the only scent I've worn that men go wild for. I've had strangers (men) chase me down the street when I wear this. No, it's definitely NOT me, it's the perfume. It's just so heady and sultry and beautiful. I love it. But use it lightly. A little goes a long way (boy, I wish more frags were this strong). Also it's pretty cheap. I got my 200 ml bottle at CVS for like, $14. Okay, it was YEARS ago, but still.
CAN SOMEONE PLEASE tell me why this was discontinued? Big mistake HUGE.

This might be the most beautiful little bottle I have EVER seen!!

My mom was clearing out some old perfumes, and found a mini Parfum gift set of this. The body creme hasn't lasted the test of time, but the body lotion and body wash seem fine. I have never seen body powder with a gift set before--neat!!

The scent is lovely too--perfect for people who love classic floral scents. Alas, it's just too flowery for me! I couldn't wear something like this, but it's fine to sniff from the bottle!

Every time I try to add Patti LaBelle Patti LaBelle as a dupe , the site won't let me. I guess that's because once everyone notices it's a perfect replica; they can't rip people off with the high prices of Narcisse. Ladies Patti is a perfect replica at a fraction of the cost. It's not as powerful but, it's basically the same. Just spray a little more Patti; but, be careful not to overspray because Patti's no punk either.

I’ve had this is my collection for about 25 years and have worn it perhaps a dozen times. I’ve hung on to it mostly because of the cute bottle. I’ve always been intimidated by the opening. A bouquet of screechy flowers all vying for attention encased in a cheap plastic vase emitting petrol fumes. At least, that was my (partially true) long-held perception.
I was clearly missing out. The angry floral notes gradually calm down. The peach, which imparts a bit of the plastic quality, ripens right on the skin. This is a forerunner to Gucci Rush, less lactonic, more floral but full of tangy, peachy heft and smoothness. I agree with what many other reviewers have noted: it takes time to understand this one. Now that I’ve learned how to enjoy this, I will gladly wear it more often.

Drunk and screaming yellow flowers wrapped in plastic foil. This is quite the extreme scent on my skin.

I cannot make out the daffodils as such - just a generic smell of yellow flowers. If I had to guess, I would say it is mimosa. In nature, daffodils are sweet and fresh, but Narcisse shows no signs of freshness on me. While it certainly is very sweet, it is also quite oppressive. There is a sharp, almost piercing note to it, probably from the carnation and the spices. Also, a strong whiff of rum and of plastic. (I do not think my bottle has turned. I remember the smell from the 90s, and it was the same back then.)

Disclaimer: My skin is not apt for this kind of perfume, because carnation, yellow flowers and peaches often work against me. Narcisse is an intriguing and well-made scent with good sillage and longevity.
Try it and don't listen to me!

The first perfume I ever bought that was expensive, Feb or March 2000 (Myer, 30ml for $64) and it is still a long-time favourite. Have had a few bottles since then and am so glad I found the parfum and edp versions on eBay as well as a Karl Lagerfeld classic miniature set with Narcisse as part of it. I remember wishing I could afford Giorgio which was $156 for the 90ml size, and my mum and I were browsing and this ended up being the one for my 15-year-old self. Classy, sweet and for a lady. Love Chloe Narcisse like a best friend.

10/05/2020

I asked on here for a perfume with presence as I like obnoxious scents.
I was recommended this to try. Usually i would get a sample but this was proving hard to do with this one .

So as life is too short I've blind brought a 30ml that was going for auction on eBay.
I hope I like it!!
Will write an update to this when it arrives

15/05/2020

It arrived and I sprayed one spray on my wrist and 3 hours later I can still smell it, it warms up beautifully on the skin, For an EDT this beauty doesn't play no games. I can't describe the smell very well I just know that I really think I love this one. It's one of the best blind buys I've done in ages. I will happily rock this one. lord knows how strong the EDP must be if the EDT performs this well

This Chloe classic intimidates the hell out of me and I want to test her so badly. I can do vintage, but vintage yellow florals frighten me a little. Its decidedly deep golden juice in that petite, unassuming bottle with frosted lid with screams "established classic yellow bomb!" I've wanted a narcissus fragrance since late winter, just haven't decided which I'm ready to blind buy. Ostara, Jonquille De Nuit and Chloe Narcisse all sound very different from one another.

Wasn't this a drugstore cheapie not long ago? What I see online suggests it might be taking a turn down unicorn lane. Isn't that how it goes. I'll give my thoughts down the line if I decide to buy the darn thing already.

A little goes a long way. The first blast is heady and spicy-sweet. Like carnations dipped in apricot liqueur. Sweet and sour, then her dominant flower emerges. Narcisse is heady and “notice me,” like the iconic frags of the ‘80s. Nothing like the unisex or ozonic scents of the grunge and The Rachel era. Maybe she was a little late to the party but I find Narcisse the one you can’t wait to arrive: she is timeless, soigne, uplifting and memorable.

P.S. The drydown is so amazing you’ll be sniffing yourself all day.

I am testing Narcisse vtg parfum splash (flower bottle) for the first time and there is something of Madonna’s Truth or Dare tuberose in it. But Narcisse is far smoother, spicier and creamier than ToD. Beautiful. Not “too much” at all. Perfect for spring.

Edit: I prefer the Narcisse pure parfum to the EDT. Its longevity far surpasses that of the EDT. But the parfum is so rare as to be a unicorn nowadays.
Another classic I can't do without. Beautiful, intoxicating and womanly.

I love narcissus and this is one heady, intoxicating narcissus bomb. Luscious, honeyed and hyper feminine. It’s aided by a supporting cast of succulent peach/apricot (and pineapple), carnation, rose, gardenia, a touch of spice, and a dash of something bitter-green. There’s a beautiful vanilla in the drydown as well. Gosh, the trail of scent it leaves behind is just so seductive, alluring and unique. There is an addictive narcotic quality to the scent, I end up sniffing myself like a crazy person whenever I wear it. It envelops me in a sweet, heavenly scent cloud all day and I feel like everything is right with the world. Stock up if you come across it, because it is becoming increasingly hard to find. A must try for die-hard floral lovers. Narcisse is somewhat comparable to Poeme (that same honeyed floral sweetness), but Narcisse is more care-free and sensual, Poeme is her elegant older sister. Love them both, and they are on my ‘all-time favorites’ list, but I find that Narcisse has always been the better fit for my personality.
Edited to add: With the newer formulations, the sillage isn’t as enormous as it used to be. I got my first bottle as a gift from my aunt in 2008, I immediately loved it, but felt it too overpowering to comfortably wear back then, so it sat neglected at the back of my closet for a few years before I finally gave it away...so for me, the new formulation is a good thing! It still smells the same to my nose, still very potent, and it still projects very well. Longevity is still on point. I can still smell it on myself 12 hours later.

I can't explain any of the notes coherently for Narcisse; to me it smells just like rhubarb and custard boiled sweeties, and this is all I can smell. Very sunny and happy, and quite unusual in a good way. I bought my bottle in early 2019, just before it was dc and the price rocketed, and like many recent perfume iterations my bottle does not have impressive sillage. It lasts well though.

This perfume is dear to my heart. It was the first perfume I owned. My brother in-law who passed away in 2019 gave it to me when I was a teenager. (he told me it was a bribe for me to allow him to date my sister) I have been looking for it everywhere and I have not been able to find it. If anyone has one which you are not currently using, I would like to purchase it from you of swap. Please PM me. Thank you

A very nice and generous Fragrantica member was generous enough to gift an 11 mil of this perfume to me. I am still looking for a full 50/100 mil bottle.

I love floral perfume, but the day I found this beauty, I realized I especially love spicy florals. Just that extra zing to complement the floral. I realized I adore narcisse. I wish I could smell that flower in real life. This is extremely gorgeous in cold weather. I feel blessed living in New York. I get all 4 wonderful seasons and I get to experience all different sorts of fragrances bloom within the seasons. There is nothing like this beautiful perfume on a fluffy sweater on a cold day. Be careful though to not overspray. I love pressing the sprayer for some reason on all my bottles haha. One day I over sprayed this because I love it so much. The top apricot note turned very sour and stayed for a long time. Finally an hour or more later, the rest of the perfume, base notes, finally shined. This is an older perfume, but everyone should experience this. It may take a while to appreciate it, but when you finally do you will never want to be without a bottle of this.

Edit: what is going on? I happened to look for this online and now it’s going for ridiculous prices. It’s so upsetting as just a couple years ago this was so affordable. You could find it everywhere, even TJ Maxx. I’m devastated to know this is now discontinued and extremely expensive
