I understand the pen-ink similarity, but that's part of the apple blossoms' smell mixed with vetiver. Somehow true on paper, with some exaggeration, but I personally perceive that in a good way on the skin.

My bottle doesn't give a soapy smell (except during the final dry-down phase after 8 hours), but rather it gives a very light creamy make-up vibe.

If you need something overstated or head-turning, then this is NOT your perfect choice. This is an ideal choice for casual looks, during the day, yet it smells nice, expensive, and memorable.

Sadly, it's discontinued.

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content: Pen ink.. that's what it smells like to me sweet pen ink

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content: I regreted having tried this, it's just not my kind of perfume. Very very sweet, but floral sweet, not fruity. The floral sweetness was too much for me and the worst part is that it last all day with over the top sillage. Definetely not my cup of tea.

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content: I'm a huge See By Chloe fan, and was so excited for this. Apple blossom, hyacinth, vetiver, and jasmine are all favorites of mine. Unfortunately, I was disappointed when I received this bottle. All I smelled was soap. I couldn't pick up on any of the apple blossom, vetiver, jasmine, or hyacinth I'd been so excited for. It was just soap. A high-end soap, to be sure, but soap none the less. I've seen others describe it as an expensive creamy soap bar, and I think that is the perfect description for this fragrance. It's not offensive by any means, and if a creamy soap scent is what you're looking for than you may love this. However, to me it felt incredibly generic, and lacked the personality that makes me love See By Chloe so dearly.

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content:
I loved this fragrance at first, now i like it. It is in my opinion a little one-dimensional. It just doesn´t develop. You´re waiting for something to happen. but it doesn´t. Something is missing in the blend.

Still perfect for a sunny day, spring or summer or why not in the winter! It stays all day too!

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content: It turned into smth familiar. Cat Deluxe? I used to have it and with curiosity discovered that they have one nose behind them.

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content:
I tend to shy away from eau fraiche flankers, because I've always found them to be very sharp and synthetic. But this one manages to be crisp and clean without having that eau de cleaning fluid smell that some of them do. (To my nose at least!)

It's a fresh breath of apple blossom, perfect for a hot summer day, paired with a floral dress and your favorite sandals.

I'm torn between like and love.

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content: I was very excited when I first received the bottle but when I spent a day with it on, the smell kept coming to my nose and it gave me headache all day. It smells good at first but I do not recommend it if you don't like heavy smells.

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content: smells very pretty, rounded creamy bouquet of flowers. It's like the creamiest soap bar or a cream body wash, so clean & flowery & fresh. It's definitely a keeper & it's perfect for fresh carefree mornings when you go shopping or just for a coffee with friends at some nice coffee shop. It's one of the biggest hits this year for me along with miss dior blooming bouquet.

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content: A beautiful fragrance. I find this smells "younger" than the original See. On me, it's too powdery, and something in it veers on the "sharp" edge. It reminds me slightly of Burberry Brit Sheer. It's fresh, pretty, and light, but it just doesn't work for me!

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content: This beauty is a soft and subtile scent, and very safe for everyday use. And being and eau fraiche does not hold This one back:) it has massive longivity and radiant sillage.. I like it. IMO all age apropriate. The aopleblossom and The water Lotus Makes the scent stand out.

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content: Unique, nature, lovely

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content:
Very nice pink floral perfume, easy to wear, fresh.
Not as interesting or distinctive as See, and usually Fraiche versions are a bit more bland...Nonentheless, it is a nice soft scent, that smells pretty...the Jasmine dominates but in a subtle way ...nothing for me as it lacks sillage and projection, but for lovers of softer scents, this is a nice one! Plus the bottle is real pretty!! Similar to Prada Florale also
I think.

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content: A little simple, flowery and clean but overall very very nice. Easy and uncomplicated and it has a slight effervescent quality. Like the original See, but that one is a little heavy and syrupy. As much as I like it, I think See Fraiche is an improvement over the original. This one is a real crowd pleaser.

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content: Very fresh , it smells like spring ! I love it . The sillage, on me is significant and the longevity is moderate . This apple blossom mixed with water hyacinth is delightful . I found it to be a natural scent , feminine , not overly sweet , suitable for all ages and versatile . It is a re-apply type of fragrance, which is a bonus in this case ! I could re-apply this all day long ! This is very nice , this is a wonderful summer fragrance !

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content: Nice, light, fresh, suitable for a present. Very neutral. For my taste too light and short lasting.

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content:
Very light and fresh at first. It changes so much over time you can't even tell it's the same scent. It gets more sweet as the time passes. I see some similarities with the original.
I haven't smelled water hyacinth or apple blossom before but I think this is how they should smell.
This is very fashionable perfume. Glamorous and sexy.

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content:
Very youthful, light and gentle. Watery, not too sweet, suitable for daywear and warmer weather.

On my skin, however, it turns out so synthetic it quickly gives me a headache, so make sure you give it a good test before you buy if some perfumes tend to give you a headache too.

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content:
This is a keeper!

So easy to wear and nicer than the original See by Chloe in my opinion, I have nothing else like this and I find it so comforting yet lively and fresh.

My only criticism would be the longevity which is sadly almost non-existent on me, I'm lucky if I can still smell it after an hour, but then that does give me the excuse to apply more and get that heavenly blast again!

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content: Soft, light, very beautiful fragrance! I absolutely love it! The only thing that bothers me is that it doesnt last long- it lasts only couple od hours. I spray it three or four times a day all over again... Suitable for spring and summer, but since it is very light, you can wear it any time of year. I am finishing my second bottle... Love it!

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content: I love this fragrance! I had been searching for a fresh, sparkling apple scented perfume, and this is it. It is reminiscent of the original See by Chloe, but, as the name implies, is a brighter, fresher version of it. Despite the lighter composition, however, the longevity and sillage are impressive. I sprayed one spritz on my forearm and could still smell it the next morning. The dry down becomes slightly musky, but overall, this scent is quite linear, which is good because the freshness of the first spray is maintained all the way through. This is a beautiful, versatile, feminine fragrance that is perfect for special occasions or just casually hanging out with friends and family. Well suited for spring, fall, and hot summer days.

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content: too fresh for me, since this and the EDP are so close at their smell, the perfime is better.

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content: On my skin it smells like apple pie, it's almost disturbingly authentic.

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content: Light, delicate, floral-aquatic, much better than the original See Chloe (nothing in common, just the name), not offensive, if you like Issey Myakke style this one is right for you.

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content: We have this at my store (Lord & Taylor) and I do enjoy it- but while comparing it to the original See By Chloe, it just seems almost identical to the original and I cannot justify buying this one. However, if I find a tester on eBay for cheap, I will most likely get it but definitely not at full price.

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content:
Truly charming scent, gentle, delicate jasmine, with very sensual vetiver base note. Fresh floral all the time, so perfect for warm weather.

Update: I've bought it! I can tell you that it is ideal spring fragrance, fresh and alluring. My first Chloe.

Update2: the hotter weather, the better it smells.

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content: People who didn't like the vanilla and bergamot notes in the original See will probably enjoy this. Eau Fraiche has a similar base to the original, but the spicy and vanilla notes have been removed. The Eau Fraiche is a pink floral scent with musky and aquatic undertones. It's light and fresh, but generic. It would be an appropriate daytime scent to wear to work. The longevity is good. I got about six hours worth of silage before it became a skin scent, and 10 hours later I could still smell it when I put my nose to my wrist.

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content: Eau Fraiche version of See by Chloe lost all of its personality. Nothing special, quite faint. Original version is far better.

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content:
I wasn't a huge fan of the original since I thought it was a bit too harsh. So I was looking forward to this edition of eau fraiche.

The opening is beautiful as to be expected. A tinge of the original can be found throughout the heart. The jasmine which is so overpowering in the original is tame and more balanced in this edition.

All in all the scent is pleasant. Kinda soapy and reminds me strongly of Cacharel's anais anais. I thoroughly enjoyed this testing but I won't be purchasing a bottle, this scent is too timid for my taste.

Sillage is moderate. Lasting time: still very noticable after 5 hours. I recommend daywear and the age bracket is teenage to about thirty.

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content: I get a lot of similarities with original See by Chloe, but this one has no vanilla in it and is therefore lighter. I don't think it's common scent, pretty fresh but unique at the same time. Longivety is also just fine. Beautiful and on my wishlist!

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content: Just got it today . An unexpected gift!! Ok, very similar to the original, the apple blossom dominates, plus a pink edge to it...I prefer this version though, it is fresher, more springlike also...I think if you liked the original, you will like that one...easy to like, pretty soft scent...for me, I didn't find the original real appealing, so not too impressed with the Fraiche version..the lasting power is nice..

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content: Available everywhere already but I have not seem any reviews and I am afraid of blinding buying. looking forward to seeing some reviews!

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content: I want this! I have the first one, so this should be interesting- a fresh take on the original. Can't wait til it makes it to the U.S.

product_name: See by Chloé Eau Fraiche Chloé
review_content:
Hi, in Spain You can find it already, is a real interesting edition. Still has the Apple Blossom edge, but not as "honeyed", is fresher, modern. Previous one has a more serious vibe, maybe was the Ylang-Ylang, E. Fraiche is less dense.
The Water Hyacinth is noticeable, making it more floral and bright, feminine too. Lasting power despite being an edt, is quite good, same as edp.
Overall, really pretty!.

I'm torn between this and the Narcissus one i tried to spray it all over my body and voila! I mafe my decision i told the sales person to give me the 150 ml. Of this! The opening is so mesmerizing, i wish the longevity is better because i dont wanna keep spraying this special juice. Instant love!

This is a very special, pure hibiscus scent that I cherish deeply! It's so clean and crisp. I spray it on me and I instantly smile, like I spray it on me and suddenly I feel put together? Like I can tackle the day?????
similar to White tea ELIZABETH ARDEN

I was looking for a soft lavender scent, which is why I went to Chloe because there's an option for a single scent. While at the store, I also tried Hibiscus and fell in love with how light, airy, and cool the scent is. It is so fresh. When I mixed it with Chloe Lavanda, I got the same scent as the moonflower body mist by Bodyshop that discontinued long ago, around 19 years ago. Since there's a promotion of buy one 150ml size and get a free 50ml size, I decided to buy the Hibiscus in a 150ml bottle and the free Lavanda in a 50ml bottle.

I already have Chloe Tuberose and papyrus at home, and I will try mixing them with these scents to see if there are any surprises.

Edit: I use it too much and kept re-apply it, I think 150ml won't be enough for me. Will purchase it again, but only when they have another buy 1 get 1 promo again. This is a soft, airy, floral scent that I really love but I have to admit, the price are bit too high.

Also, I really like to use it in a humid weather, because whenever I get sweat, the scent become stronger on me
It's giving angelic vibes, and I'm all here for it. Airy, floral, yet very refined. For such a "light" fragrance, it's ridiculously long lasting too, which is definitely unique.
Sampled on a trip to NYC last summer and remember it as a lovely, fresh, lightly aquatic, rose, geranium, ambrette, lychee sort of thing. Lovely! I still think about it...

The opening of this one is so lovely, it's floral with a hint sweet fruitiness. On dry down it's pretty much all green notes. I wish the opening would hang around through the dry down. Still a pleasant fragrance though!

Light, green, and very slightly fruity. Nothing remotely remarkable, except for the fact that you can make a perfume of a flower that has no scent. But then again it’s been done before, like sakura for example. If you like light scent and want one the projects well enough despite being light, try this.
green, watery, fruity, ozonic, soft.

Soft, light and airy perfume. But so beautiful. You don, t need it to be denser or stronger because the floral softness is its beauty. It, s a cloud of softness in which only few notes are distinguishable. A flower, some musk and a touch of almond, which might be part of the flower. I love the bottle and the spray too.

Light floral scent, which to my norse i cant tell what flower this is from. Might be that i dont exactly know how hibicius smells like. While this is nice and mass appealing, i think it fails to impress me unlike this rest of the line. Not it mention it has terrible performance in both longevity and sillage. Lean feminine and mediocre at best - not worth the price tag.

This is a beautiful, fresh, watery floral scent. I was worried about the category of “fresh spicy” showing, but I shouldn’t have been. It’s not sharp or medicinal, just a lovely, uplifting, fresh dewy floral with a tropical location vibe. I absolutely love it and I have a hard time thinking of this as something anyone would be put off by.

This scent is great. It make me feel like floating in the air. Light floral but not too sweet. Its mood mixes between light floral and bitter of hibiscus. This makes this scent is so fantastic and unique. Even through I am male, I love it! I always wear this scent during daytime because it doesn’t make me feel like too feminine. Also Chloé Atelier Des Fleurs can layer with other scents so I always layer it with other men scent to make the scent more masculine if you like.

I thought I got some honeysuckle at first, along with the citrus and lily of the valley, but that doesn't last long. Soon (as another reviewer pointed out), I get the Mugler Cologne type synthetic ("S"/steam), and that of course generates a bit of a musky quality. I only used one spray to the chest and it seems light, but I get wafts of it now and then. This might be the kind of scent that is better under warm conditions, so that is worth looking into. I wouldn't pay current prices for it, but I can see the appeal.

it smells very fresh grass. Please do not blind buy if you expect Chanel 19, its a fourth cousin in the family. I got my bottle from a collector, who stores her perfumes very well and should say that I found no rotten notes. Longevity and projection are subtle. I should also admit that it is probably one of the greenest fragrances I tried.

After the spray I smelled something like rotten grass and regreted that I would put stuff like this on my skin. But I left it there, covered with sweater and came back to sniffing it after a couple of hours.

Let's just say it's very green citrusy scent, almost herbal. Definitely very unique with a bit of spiciness. There's certainly something about it. I can imagine having a hand soap smelling like this but wouldn't spray it on myself. I believe it has a lots of fans but it will have to remain as a dislike for me.

After reading all review I thought I will get Chanel no 19 or safari Ralph Loren it was blind buy it was cheap so I made purchase but what if it a very faint Lily of the valley and faint jasmine touch doesn't last and no comparison with no 19 0r safaris or any green petfume yes it has no longtivity may be 10 minute this true no fake
What a pity it is discontinued!

This is absolutely gorgeous when first sprayed.
It has a lovely green freshness to it, and it is quite unique.
However as a previous writer has noted,after 30 minutes there is nothing left: On me nothing at all.
Such a shame, and disappointing for an expensive fragrance.
I plan to return it for this reason.

I've been wearing this scent for about a week now. First this is a superb green scent!! There' aren't many reviews for Capucine so I'll try to write up a summary of what everyone said and touch up with my personal experience.

The Capucine experience is definitely about showcasing the raw qualities of galbanum, a type of grass resin. The scent opens with loud, prickly galbanum that evokes smell of fresh cut grass and crushed vegetation. The clary sage and juniper berries added vegetal spiciness to the galbanum, rounding and smoothing out the bitterness that would otherwise be overwhelming. During the several days of wear I have not noticed any citrus notes, so either they are very well blended with the other top notes (making it a "tea note" like other reviewers described), or that they are weak.

The fresh, energizing blast of green vegetation goes on about 1 hour before it dies down to a skin scent. This is the time that the white florals supposed to appear, but they don't (or at least I haven't detected them). The scent becomes a little more soapy from the rose-musk combo of Chloe's, but it's not recognizable unless I deliberately search from it after looking at the note pyramid. The pleasant grassy-musky skin scent then stays linear and finally disappear after 7, 8 hours on me. By hour 5 I'd be able to safely layer other scents on it. The overall experience is an understated, unisex but very elegant presence. I think it's a perfect scent for spring and summer, and would work extremely well on rainy days.

So, Capucine is simple. Yet I cannot emphasize enough that despite the lack of complex concept and development, Capucine is far from being a "boring" scent. It belongs to very niche category of green scents which, instead of capturing the instant beauty of blooming flowers, attempts to deliver a full picture of the natural history of the plant. I find the smell almost like paying a humble tribute to the great outdoors. It is for this exact reason I adore this big olive bottle in my wardrobe.

I am surprised at how similar Capucine is to Peace, Love, and Juicy on me. They are not an exact match but are definitely in the same vein, perhaps because they both have Amalfi lemon at the top, jasmine in the middle, and musk at the base. While I like Capucine, I love Peace, Love, and Juicy possibly because it has a touch more floral and better longevity. It's also interesting that they have both been discontinued. (Good heavens, what does this say about my taste in fragrance?) I agree with another reviewer who mentioned that the bottle design feels very niche. I think it looks beautiful on my vanity.

Wow! This is so different than scents I normally choose. I have a small coffret of this brilliant perfume trifecta & love to revisit them every Spring.
If you like Estée Lauder Private Collection or Mark Earth you will undoubtedly enjoy and appreciate this. It is grassy, pungent, soft, herbaceous, green, spicy & divine. You won't smell like anyone else around you wearing this. The dry down is the smell of your natural skin after spending a Spring day at the Park.
Cheers!
They have this on clearance at myperfumesamples right now. This is so beautiful for spring, and I love florals and green fragrances so this is right up my alley. Definitely stocking up :)

initial blast - grass oil, love it
30 minutes - totaly disappeared (maybe i was immune to whatever note surfaced)
1 hour - a very gentle and very clean skin scent *swoon*. i'm starting to notice that the house of Chloe very expertly combines rose and musk to achieve this lovely scent
10 hours - intoxicating soft musk drydown, sits very close to the skin

would wear this exquisite fragrance on an intimate date ;-)

A wonderful and classy scent with herbal and green rea notes. Smells natural throughout all the stages of this perfume, which makes me doubt any comparisons with Sisley freen scents - they smelled downright artificial in the drydown.
My Capucine starts with bergamot, sage and yummy green tea. Then green tea steeps and becomes stronger, with a touch of juniper berries. Out the notes of the pyramid that's all I get - no flowers at all - nicht, nada. Oh, and the most pronounced note of green tea is not indicated somehow…
This a beautiful well-balanced green and herbal scent that somehow makes me think of Yoga. Capucin has the same tranquility and closeness to nature as I associate with Yoga.
I'm very relieved that Louise Turner had decided to create a green scent without the watery aquatic notes, that are falsely tied with freshness and greenness. So what we have is a very wearable naturalistic green scent that is perfect for daytime in spring and summer. I sprayed my wrist once at 3 pm, and at 10 pm I have faint grassy drydown, but a couple of hours ago the scent was still noticeable when I waived the hand gesturing.

This one is very easy to love and wear, it's undemanding, but has character. A keeper.

Urban park in a bottle!!!

This scent is very fresh, light and smells better and better with time. It reminds me of urban parks for some reason.

Impressions:
Initial spritz - this smells like lime scented mosquito repellant
1 min - wow this smells like mosquito repellant mixed with freshly cut grass
5 min- still grassy and limey
20 min - good the harsh mosquito repellant note has begun to die down, the most prominent notes are green tea and lime
2 hrs later - this scent has really softened....it smells fresh, balmy, soft and feminine, and warm, the harsh green tea and lime tones have disappeared
11 hrs later - very soft, barely there, still fresh, slightly creamy and feminine
12 hrs later - what is left is creamy, soft and slightly floral...no musk on me yeah!!!

My skin type: oily / youthful
Projection: sits close to the skin
Potency: Light (5 or more sprays are necessary)
Longevity: 12 hrs
Office safe: Yes
Timing: spring & summer / anytime of the day
Price: $56 (red tag sale) for 100 ml / 3.38 oz at Winners/ TJ Maxx

Will I Repurchase: undecided

Disclaimer: my experience may be different from your experience based on my skin type, my chemistry, the season, and my personal tastes

I sampled this today and I found it very cold and metallic. It is not green in the manner in which I am used to (fresh, kind of zippy). I do not dislike it, but I do not like it enough to purchase it. Beautiful bottle - feels very niche.

What an odd creation Chloé EAU DE FLEURS CAPUCINE is! I was expecting something altogether different based on the reviews I had read. To my surprise, this perfume opens very similarly to EAU DE CARTIER. I am baffled, actually, as to how there could be no violet leaf listed among the notes!

Once I regained my balance from the blast of what I took to be violet leaf, I began slowly to notice other key components of this creation. First, neroli, then lily of the valley. After a few minutes and a real effort to identify what precisely it was that I was smelling, it dawned on me: the synthetic base of CAPUCINE smells very similar to Thierry Mugler MUGLER COLOGNE. It's got to be the laundry musk which ties them together, or peraps the synthetic ambroxan is helping, too. The proverbial "green notes" and neroli are probably not hurting the association either. Anyway, the last thing that I would call this composition is natural smelling, because the base is completely synthetic--and that is how it smells to me!

I do detect a fairly heavy dose of pepper (or reasonable facsimile) in this composition as well--also not listed among the notes. All in all, when all is said and sniffed, I must own that this is not a boring fragrance, although I cannot say that it is my favorite anything (floral green, LOTV, etc....). It certainly is the only perfume which reminds me as vividly in the opening of EAU DE CARTIER as it reminds me in the drydown of MUGLER COLOGNE. The color matches that of extra virgin olive oil.

In a word: weird.

Blind bought this... VEEEEERY green and natual ... unique smell, like green pepper... can't detect any floral... linear and very soft dry down (hardly noticeable)... weak lasting power... beautiful and elegant bottle... overpriced
OMG, is this one obselete from the market? I have been using this for some time, now i can't find an equipvalent. Louis Turner, please help me!

Very green opening. Contrary to melancholybab, I don't think that it fades quickly. It stays prevailingly green for quite a while until the floral notes softly take lead. After a few hours, I can smell a nettle. Perhaps there's pepper in it? This perfume has indeed some unisex potential.

I thought I liked it but then test-sprayed it (by now I usually do that always before I buy/especially with the expensive ones). While the opening is nice and floral, the drydown on me was so very green that I didn't think about purchasing it anymore.

I have to agree with Jae. This is indeed one of the nicer, more pleasurable green florals on the market today.

Eau de Fleurs Capucine is a green scent without the harsh watery and grassy accords. This fragrance opens simply with zesty bergamot and lemon, and an added hint of orange blossom, jasmine and lily of the valley. This fragrance is quite soft, hence the reason why it smells quite natural and pretty on the skin.

Towards the heart, this fragrance revels in revealing delicate and clean floral nuances, that are thankfully not too soapy nor too powdery. There's also a subtle touch of herbaceousness throughout this composition which gives this fragrance character.

It does have a slightly masculine feel, however that doesn't put me off the scent entirely. Eau de Fleurs Capucine reminds me of sunshowers and shy romances. It's pleasantly mellow and somewhat imaginative.

The sillage is intimate and very discreet. It brings me to conclude that this fragrance is very lady-like and reserved. I like it that way. I sometimes wonder why Chloe decided to make these fragrances limited editions which are relatively difficult to find. I much prefer the Eau de Fleurs series over and above the new Chloe and Chloe Love.

Wow... What a floral green this is!!! I LOVE it! The bonus is that this is totally unisex on my skin. I could name countless popular green fragrances that I prefer this one over, even Chanel No.19. This is one of THE best green perfumes I've ever had the pleasure of owning. The longevity is amazing and the sillage is excellent. It's so fresh, floral and green all at once. Of all gender-benders, this is one of my favorites. My Un Jardin Sur Le Nil finally has a green perfume worthy of standing next to it in my collection.

The splendid scent on the summer , the spring and sad days.
I chose him from among remaining of two sisters : Lavende , Neroli.It not was easily. But in this scent I have all : a little herbs , beautiful Neroli, the Galbanum. Not meeting well lies on my skin. I plan the purchase this in spring. I instruct trying all these of 3 scents. There are very original and elegant. I already chose : my Capucine :)
Bottle are very beautiful.
Lovely crisp green opening, which very quickly fades into a non-descript vague sweetness. Glad I tried before I bought! Definitely not an interesting scent.
as with Neroli, i am disappointed with this one too... again, it started lovely green with characters, but then the dry down was flat and so-so floral...

These are definitely interesting creations - however, too masculine smelling for ladies who prefer to smell like, well, ladies. Especially the Capucine one. In fact, when I mentioned this to the sales laday in the department store where I was tasting the new Chloe scents, she said she had a few men come in and purchase these for themselves. I understand, if I were a young stylish man I'd buy it. But I'm a woman and I'll look for more fiminine scents, thanks!

It’s ok for the first 3 minutes, very rosy, but then something weird comes up & after 7 minutes I can barely smell anything. This is kind of how all of the Chloe perfumes work on me - They smell OK but very faint and short lasting on me.
Citrus, with a sharp rose. A bit screechy so I used it up quickly. It was a like.

This was my first Chloé perfume that started my addiction to this flanker.. This is in my top 3 of best Chloé fragrances along with Chloé eau de parfum and Roses de Chloé. I don't think I will ever get tired of this, its fresh, floral and somehow deep and just comfortable. The verbena, citrus, peach and blackcurrant makes it just different enough from the OG. I was lucky to find an old stock and get a new bottle, but I am using it sparingly as I dread the day I will run out of it again, and I am considering getting one more just to stock it for later. I did write Chloé and they replied they would not bring this back into production unfortunately.

My all time favourite perfume and I’m never 100% sure why. It’s a very soft light citrus/floral smell and it’s the perfect mix of elegance and fresh. However it’s pricey and does not project very well. Despite all this it’s still my absolute ride or die and I will always back it as my personal favourite 10/10 if anyone knows where I can repurchase it lmk because they have heartbreakingly discontinued it and I don’t think I’ll ever recover if I never get to wear it again otherwise I’ll be saving the final drops for my wedding day

I got a free sample of this a long time ago. I don't remember much but I'm sure that I did give it a try and didn't like it.
I just now randomly try it again. Omg! I have to change my mind! The citrus scent luckily is not loud at all, it goes pretty smoothly right in the beginning. Then right away comes the floral rose scent, which is so lovely and very relaxing.
Interesting that it makes me feel like the smell of some luxury beach hotels in Vietnam during summer vacations somehow.
Wait, someone said this is discontinued, is that true?

It’s pretty but it’s basically exactly the same as the original Chloe which is fine. It’s a feminine springtime floral that’s easy to wear for any occasion, it’d be a great signature scent. It doesn’t last a very long time, 3 hrs tops. Overall it’s fine, I’m glad I got it as a gift and didn’t pay for it.

I've always loved the look of Chloe bottles but never found any of them likeable enough to own one until I smelt this. Floral, feminine, but nothing too odiferous. There's just something too stinky about the other Chloe perfums to me but this one comes across as airy, pleasant, and elegant. Dries down beautifully into a light musk that stays intimate to skin. Very safe for the office environment. As mentioned by another further below, the bottle tarnished really easily even though I've kept it in its box.
This is the optimal spring perfume according to me. However, I can’t find it anywhere anymore.

It’s best out of all Chloe perfumes, I’m my opinion.

Delicate, feminine. Reminds me of ballerina aesthetics a little bit. Reminds me of a brunch in a garden with flowers around. White chiffon dress and a hat. Summer day with a fresh wind. Very pristine.

I don’t like extreme citrus start. But after a few minutes it transforms into light floral scent with a generous drizzle of citrus skin.
Floral scent with delicate black currant, little bit of a peach on a musky base. Almost no citruses after time passes by.

After few hours it’s floral musky scent. Completely different sound comparing to first minutes and first hour.

Warm daytime. I appreciate this scent.

First of all, i don't know the original Chloe and usually i'm a gourmand lover and i don't really fall for aromatic-citrus and rose scents. But I got a decant from this as a gift, and for my biggest surprise i quite like it! The Verbena note is magical. It's fresh but on my skin it's more aromatic green verbena with a hint of citrus, and citrusy floral rose than just a plain fresh citrus scent. And the Rice note! That's really in the background but with the verbena it's really special. If u are bored by cologne like citrus scents, but likes the natural fresh line it's totally worth a try. It's office friendly but has some precious uniqueness in it. At first i want to give over it, but i'm going to keep it for this summer :D It can really brighten up a very natural but nice look and any white shirt- blue jeans combo (with a blaser too)

I definitely had an "I don't know what I expected" moment when trying this. It smells just like Chloe EDP but with citrus. The citrus dominates the rose in this flanker and I find it overall greener/more woodsy than Chloe EDP, almost veering towards Chloe Naturelle. I like this but I strongly prefer the original and I don't think anyone needs to own both.

Citrusy florals are my fav, but this one doesn't quite work. It's not "rotten" like the Chloe Rose Tangerine EDT, but it's also not "fresh" like the EDP. It exists somewhere in the middle, and I don't care for the spicy note that my skin smells to amplify. Wearable, but not very pleasant in me.

Update: It's discontinued (per Macy's rep), so get it while you can for those that adore it!

Nice! I prefer this to the original Chloe EdP/EdT (which I am not a huge fan of). It clearly has the same DNA but is brighter and fresher. The citrus in the opening is lovely. Young, innocent but at the same time classy and elegant.
smells like a more citrusy brighter version of original. still too floral for me as Im not a floral kin of person.

Allow me to introduce you to the original Chloe’s younger and more soft spoken sister. Just as lovely as her predecessor, she is lighter and fresher but also has a bad habit of leaving functions early. Despite the longevity which is lacking, and I own the original Chloe, (which I should add is probably my favorite scent of all time) I will probably purchase a full bottle, it’s just that lovely. That being said most people probably don’t need both, but I love the Chloe DNA and am a sucker for citrus scents, if you want something a little softer than the original Chloe, this is your girl!

Such a beautiful and versatile perfume, which is no surprise from Chloe. Very similar to original Chloe in the sense that its a very musky and feminine scent wrapped in white florals. One of my new favourite scents!

Simply a first class perfume by Chloe. It is soft, fresh, with an intense elegance and femininity that lifts your spirit. Long lasting. It is my favorite everyday perfume. I get so many compliments. Love it 💗

I get mainly citrus and rose with a bit of musk in the drydown - actually I get orange flower more than anything even though it's not listed in the notes. I can't really see the 'Fleur' in this to be honest, it somehow reminds me a bit of oldschool lipstick, in a nice way. The original Chloe is the real deal for me, I don't think I'd give it up for this,but it's a pleasant alternative.

Gosh,this is nice
A bit fresher chloe. Original has so massive perfume trail, it can be too much for daily basis. But this! Perfection, as a health worker i can easily wear this for work.it has a soft trail and stays long but close to the skin. Soft, flowery, clean. But if you love rather perfume that has a massive sillage and lastingpower, go for the original. For me i must have both.

I love the original Chloé EDP to the moon and back, so it’s no wonder I adore this one too (possibly even more than the original, but I still need a little more time with Fleur to decide lol). They’re very similar — if you thought Chloé EDP was fresh, this is the even fresher, soapier cousin; the rose takes a backseat in favor of the citrus. Fleur de Parfum is how a classy, smart young lady who has her life together would smell like. The only thing that has stopped me from getting a full bottle by now is the weak projection and poor longevity. A tragic 2+ hours on my skin; a bit longer on clothes (slight traces of it at the end of a workday); really disappointing compared to the original, which lasts for an eternity especially on clothing.

EDIT: One week later and I’ve made up my mind — I just love this so much (yes I finally decided I like it even more than Chloé EDP!) that I’ve placed an order for a full bottle; I don’t even care about the weakass sillage & longevity anymore!

I've always thought Chloé perfumes were weird and have never worn any of them. Yesterday I tested this and I could feel it later on the sleeve of my coat and felt that I have to have this now during a hectic period at work. I needed this uplifting, dry, elegant vibe that this perfume projects, it doesn't want to seduce its more like it makes you feel you know what you are doing. I think it's a nice daytime/work perfume.
Lovely fragrance. Floral but citrussy at the same time. I feel very femenine and classy wearing it. Lasted about four hours in my skin and stayed close.
A cool, minty rose is the best expression I have to describe this fragrance.

On me, this is the reverse of Chloe l'Eau, as it is heavy on citrus with just a hint of rose. Not being a fan of citrus intensive fragrances it's not going to become a favorite. It does balance more after dry down as time passes, but I'm still left with something very light and, frankly, not different from the many citrus florals out there. For me, if it had detectable base notes, maybe I'd have a different opinion. If you like mostly citrus with just a *hint* of rose and nothing too heavy, this could be for you.

Something about the combination of notes in this smells very similar to Elizabeth Arden Green Tea Fig. Perhaps the bergamot. It smells very close, albeit more floral and less tangy/sharp, lacking the ivy notes. I find Green Tea Fig a bit polarizing due to that sharp sour lime beer salt note but this one is much more wearable. I will try it again for a whole day's wear. This was for a few hours.

Although I like citrus and I'm slowly starting to be okay with many rose scents, this wasn't for me. Rose notes can smell very expensive and rich, but sadly they can also smell really cheap and off putting. This one just all in all feels too sharp and direct ... no playfulness, not well rounded.
I tried it in summer and first even liked it because of the citrus, as soon as the rose came forward, it felt wrong. Now I tried it in autumn and again as soon as I left the house, I felt uncomfortable smelling it.

To me it's just a very cold hearted and sharp scent that does nothing for me.

I love the original edp, and not always a fan of its flankers (except for the green bottled L'eau de chloé from years before and this one)
I am not sure which of notes does this as they are not listed, but to me this one smells like the original infused with more citrus and almonds and some orange flower

What I can smell I like, it’s fruity and a little spicy with berries coming through but to be honest I think I’m anosmic to both L’Eau and this one. I took paper testers and sprayed one on my hand and one on my arm and I can barely detect both fragrances. I decided to try the entire line because I have a roller ball of the Chloe EDP and fell in love with it. However upon trying these I can barely detect them. I also tried absolu and threw away the part because it seemed to have gone off. The only one I can smell is Rose de Chloe however the sillage and longevity is already very poor, not at all like the main Chloe fragrance. I would like a mini set perhaps to suss this out.

Pretty, feminine, simple, rose and citrus. The citrus is sharp at first but it settles into a fresh and flowery spring-summer scent. Although it's fairly new on the market, it has an old fashioned, conservative vibe to me. I like it but it's not a love. It would be well-suited to citrus lovers.

Fleur de parfum and chloe EDT 2015 are completely different to my nose. They share the common chloe DNA and a few citrusy top notes but that's about it. EDT is fresh bloom of white roses. Fleur de parfum, ironic to its name, has less fresh and floral quality. It's more like the quieter and more introverted sister of chloe EDP. They both share the sparkling, sweet , "dipped-in-honey" quality, but fleur de parfum is much softer with a touch of creaminess that smells starchy. I couldn't imagine how rice would smell as a perfume note but that must be it. It's undeniably pretty and feminine. People like me who like chloe EDP but feels it being too sweet at times would appreciate this one. Most people would probably consider this a spring/summer scent, but to me it's a fall scent due to its creaminess. If scents have temperature, EDP would be warm, EDT would be cool, and fleur de parfum would be luke warm. The sillage is soft and longevity is average. The much soapier EDT lasts longer on me.

A divine sommery rose. Absolutly beautiful.

My new scent for this summer.

It is done so nicely and the peony stays with me all day. I LOVE that. The rose is always in the background and this literally lasted me over 8 hours with just 4 sprays.

Lovely classy scent.

Absolutely beautiful, very feminine and fresh long lasting
The dry down is gorgeous.
I would give it 8/10

Smells like soapy clean roses with a twist of citrus. It's really refreshing and light. Nothing jumps out at you. I think this would make a lovely spring or summer scent. When worn on my skin the verbena jumped out a lot more to an almost overpowering degree. All I got was bergamot and verbenna. Kind screechy. Dry down gives me D&B Light Blue/Ghost Eclipse vibes.

I'm less excited by a visit to a "regular" perfume store with designer scents than I used to be when I first became interested in the world of perfumes, because I've spoiled my nose a little with a bigger variety of fragrances, but there are still lots of designer brands I enjoy exploring, and Chloé is definitely one of them. Their scents may not be spectacularly original, but they're always well-made and enjoyable to wear, which is no small thing.

This Fleur de Parfum confirms that impression for me. It's another hassle-free, feminine fragrance that's both elegant and comfortable: a nicely tart rose/citrus/verbena combination, with a rather green, botanical feeling to it, which is something I personally like a lot. When it settles down after an hour or so, the sweeter base notes come into play, which is also nice, though the opening is the best part to my nose. This is one of those that I would have loved if I'd discovered it before I started exploring perfumes in earnest and amassed a large (decant) wardrobe of scents I really adore, I think. As it is, I like it a lot!

I really love Chloe Fleur de Parfum. You do have to get past the sharp opening citrus notes. After that, however, it's this lemony-rosy-cherry blossom smell, which I find modern and refreshing. The cherry blossom note is distinct without being overly sweet. If I'm not wrong, the Chloe EDP does not have cherry blossom, so that is what makes this one unique.

I like the perfume. It smells rosy and citrusy all at the same time. I think it's great for work, I would go for something more strong and bold for night.I prefer it for spring and summer, not strong enough for winter. Overall, a great purchase :)
To me this smells simply of roses with a touch of rice. I love this

I was in love with the 5ml sampler because it was heavenly. But after purchasing the 30ml spray bottle, the scent is dramatically different. There are way sharper citrus notes that scream out loud upon the first spray, whereas using the sampler to dab on the inner wrists directly give me a more sweet and subtle opening. In a way, the 5ml sampler was more similar to the original Chloe parfum.
I love strong perfume.. But this one succesfully make me fall in love.. Smells like feminime and sexy.. My mom love it too!!
I just put it on for the first time and I am in love! It is so fresh and so unique. Citrus and floral notes. Super sexy and empowering! This may be my new signature!

I used up a sample vial of this alongside Chloe EDP and Roses de Chloe EDT. This one is like a less-good version of Chloe. It was too strong for me, personally. I used up the whole sample vial but it was just meh.

Chloe Fleur opens up with a high pitched floral that is quite indistinguishable to my nose. The top notes evoke a sense of open air on a cool morning, a blue sky and slightly cold breezes. The middle notes are leafy. Thanks to the black currant, the backbone of this scent is quite fresh and masculine, which sets this perfume apart from other floral perfumes. Overall impression is that it’s very wearable and inoffensive, but can be unique if the wearer notice the difference in details.
Note: This is a rewritten review. My previous review was not very in depth.
@socorrosouza Point taken! Btw I'm really disappointed that this doesn't work for me at all. I guess I'm just not into very 'clean' fragrances (or, rather, they're not into me!)
Dear Ladylva, never forget the qualifier "on my skin". On my skin (and many others, I believe) this is absolute perfection, a rosy green citrusy scent that has good longevity and sillage.

I’ve never worn any Chloe fragrances - Idk, I just never found them interesting or intriguing. Everything just screams ‘meh’ - from the bottles, to the colour of the juices, to the unoriginal ads... Anyway, I received a 2ml sample of Chloe Fleur de parfum with another purchase and decided to give it a try. And... meh. It’s very generic; smells like a rose scented shampoo or body wash, but it also contains a rather nauseating citric component that smells like a cheap laundry powder. Between shampoo and detergent, there’s nothing to get excited about. I guess this could only appeal to girls who are complete novices to the world of fragrances.

Very nice fragrance. A work colleage wears it everyday and i asked what it was. She said it was Fleur from Chloè and then i decided to test it today. On her, it smells like a slightly spicy white floral, i don't know if it is the verbena that makes this. On me, it is a bit fresher and less flowery and a bit powdery. It reminded me of the Boss Ma Vie line. On her, it projects much better than on me. I like it, i think it is good for spring.It is a nice and feminine perfume, but not something i would buy for me.

If I checked Chloe fleur's notes I probably wouldn't test it.I'm not into citrus dominant perfumes and I have more than enough rosey perfumes for someone who only sometimes craves rose.
I never had original Chloe,but I have Chloe intense which I don't like much and it has nothing to do with this one
Chloe fleur is a very refreshing scent of fresh florals and citruses.rose is definitely there,but it's not a warm and heavy rose and it doesn't resemble rose water.It makes a pretty and youthful floral accord hand in hand with cherry blossom.and yes,there's verbena which plays an important role in making chloe fleur unique and more appealing to me.this floral accord has a touch of fruity,spicy and a slight green undertone and it's followed by grapefruit and bergamot.it dries down to a clean,softly powdered lemony-floral scent which is pretty enough to make me add it to my wantlist but I have to test it once again on skin
I was shocked to see lots of negative reviews.It's so nice and lovely and easy to love but not generic.it doesn't smell much soapy on me.I can get where does the cleaning product refer comes from,yes I felt that a bit too,but I didn't find it unpleasant .I love how fizzy citruses,a hint of spicy,green note(probably verbena),a pretty,feminine rose with fruity undertone,something very clean and cool like newly washed linen are mixed together and the result while is rather comforting while being energizing and refreshing
If you're looking for a citrus scent which is also very feminine,a nice blend of citruses and florals(it's not heavily floral)and fruits(just a whisper of them),spice,green notes(but not grassy ones)and clean notes) make sure to try this one.it lasted for a good couple of hours on blotter so longevity seems to be pretty good but even if it's not that good on skin I don't care as long as I like how it smells .I'm usually into gourmands and warm,heavy,sweet fragrances so I'm glad to find a fresh and clean spring and summer scent that I really enjoy

Zingy & Zesty . Lemon flash anyone ?
Only kidding ....
it does have a cleaning product air about it though .. but it is still pretty .
It is really spritely and energising , the citrus never goes away .. it reminds me also of a lemon merringue.
It is Soapy and musky .. clean & fresh
I have a 5 ml tester ...
i dont know if i would buy it .. but i would certainly wear it if it was a gift .
UPDATE : it also vanishes after around an hour . Basically another fleeting perfume along with most of the current perfumes . What is it with them of lately??

Just have a tester of this and I’m having some fun trying out things that I may not usually seek out. I do love roses, grow many varieties and surprisingly this actually smells dead on like one of the species I grow. The scent (of the rose variety) is described as “citrusy and fresh” which perfectly coincides with the notes here. I can definitely smell the peach/fruity note a little further in as well. This is probably not a fragrance I would buy unless I stumble on it at a bargain. It’s really pretty, like something to wear on a beautiful summer day with a nice dress. My personal taste runs more towards sweet gourmands, but I appreciate the airy beauty of this floral.

Had they asked me, this would have been called Chloe Citrus.
It does share the same DNA as Chloe edp, but the rose is more in the background and topped of with a dose of lemon and bergamot. This makes the fragrance more summery and more 'fun', like sitting in the sun with a good beer.
Good times, but I personally prefer a little more depth. Or maybe it is just the citrus not developing at its best on my skin...
If you like Chloe and citrus notes, I can strongly recommend this fragrance. I'll stick to my original epd and edt.

btw: the ad with the naked lady holding the roses looks rather inconvenient...

The verbena is very intense in the opening and smells a lot like lemon pledge. After that settles, there is rose mixed with a little almondy cherry blossom. The dry down is soft rice and musk. I like it but don't love it. I don't think I would ever purchase it.

It’s nice but rather pointless as it smells 95% like Chloe EDP and 5% like something new. If you already own Chloe EDP then buying this would be like one of those superfans who already has the CD of their favorite artist but they go ahead and buy the special UK version even though it only has one difterent song and everything else is the same.

So if you’re a Chloe superfan, go for it. If you don’t already own Chloe, then feel free to do a side by side comparison and pick your favorite. I love my Chloe so I’m always looking for a new flanker but this is too similar.

This is so weird to my nose. It literally smells like the Chloe EdP fragrance mixed with those jelly candy orange slices and orange soda. From top to bottom it smells of this bizarre combination. I like Chloe and I like orange scents and I love gourmands but I do not like this.
It's pretty forgettable. Smells great but is a standard powdery floral that wears off after three hours. Only wear this to bed because my husband loves it.

A gentle truly lovely scent. Mostly rose at first, then a citrus blended with something I love, a happy time. Not sure what exactly - probably a mix of bergamot, cherry blossom, and cedar. I see rice in the list. Not sure what a pure rice scent would be. Very hard to beat a fragrance with a note that makes me think of a happy time.

For such a subtle fragrance it lasts a long time. On my wish list.

It’s similar to the original Chloé EDP with loads of citrus notes thrown in but not the same scent. If you like citrus with rose you might like this one. Even L’Eau de Chloé has citrus and green notes but it’s very different from Fleur. Personally, I don’t find this special enough for the price it commands. It’s a bit weird.... with verbena, bergamot, grapefruit, peach all thrown into the Chloé EDP. After the initial citrus fruit blast, it dries down to pretty floral notes but not the same as the original and also loses its strength much sooner.

Wonderful fragrance, just like the 2008 original version- it tones down just the same! As soon as the citrusy notes wear off, you can smell the same fragrance of the original Chloe EDP. Delicate, I think, is the best definition for this perfume. This is not a sweet one...not a 'bombshell fragrance'...so if you like scents like Hypnotic Poison, Flowerbomb or L Lolitta Lempicka, this is definitely not for you.
The combination of petals and slightly citrusy notes is perfect, a scent for elegant women and not at all overpowering- but still, you can smell it.I would say that you can wear anytime, day or night. It is also wearable for work- it won't disturb picky noses... I am a big fan of Chloe EDP and Love, I think both perfumes translate elegance and discretion at the same time. This one evokes really nice memories, and for me it is a must have- it is usually in my purse.

I initially hated this one because the top notes are intense like citrus floor cleaner. However, I love the original, so I sprayed some on and walked around. I'm so glad I did this, because the scent is AMAZING when it fades to it's base notes. This one's a keeper and is very long lasting.
Nice it's simple with blended notes of citrus and rose!
It really does smell like the original Chloe fragrance with a real citrusy twist, fresh and summery. Long lasting.

Chloe Fleur de Parfum is the first flanker that doesn't smell like a Chloe EDP clone. This fragrance is so fresh and citrusy that it barely resembles the original Chloe. For this reason alone, I am rather enjoying this new release.

Chloe Fleur de Parfum would be perfect for Spring and Summer. It opens with somewhat watered-down notes of bergamot and grapefruit, followed by a soapy rose, cherry blossom and peach blend. The overall scent is super clean and laundry-fresh.

This Chloe flanker comes in the form of an EDP and has excellent longevity and moderate sillage on my skin. At this present point in time I am enjoying this fragrance much more than the original, and even more so than her many subsequent flankers.

Sadly Chloe Fleur de Parfum hasn't been well received by fans of the original Chloe. It's a lot less rosy than its predecessors and more focused on crisp citrusy accords. It reminds me a little of another now discontinued Chloe flanker, L'Eau de Chloe.

All that matters from my perspective is that I have discovered a Chloe flanker that appeals to my tastes. Although I probably wouldn't buy a bottle of Chloe Fleur de Parfum at the price it is now in-store, I would love to own a bottle at some point in the future.

This is a little acidic, with a homeopathic level of spice and overall very light, which is probably a mercy because it's also synthetic and dull. It is as floral and elegant as a can of Glade. There's something stripping and detergenty about it, never mind clean. I never seem to get on with Chloe's, which is a shame as I quite like the bottles. The best I can say about this is it becomes similar to Givenchy's Jarden Precieux but without the sweetness.

I always try so hard to branch out away from my sweet perfumes. I love the boozy, rich vanillas and caramels, but I always dream of falling in love with a lovely floral.

I blind bought this on a whim after reading the notes. I had assumed the brighter, lighter opening would fit my needs. I always admired the original Chloe, but felt it unwearable to me.

The initial blast of citrus is a bit off putting, combined with the typical alcohol scent of fragrance, it takes a moment to settle before it becomes wearable. The citrus lingers through most of the day, but upon settling, the sweet, powdery rose starts to shine through.

I love how light, fresh, and easy this fragrance is. I find it extremely wearable, sweeter than the original, but still very floral. It's crisp and feminine. So happy to have this in my collection!

I'm a great fan of the original Chloe EDP, but after testing Chloe Fleur I found myself completely enchanted by the bright citrus and warm peachy notes atop the familiar Chloe clean/pink/rose scent. It doesn't have the same longevity, though, but improves its longevity really well when layered on top of Chloe EDP.

Chloe Fleur de Parfum is Jardin en Mediterranee with sugar. Its weird but its nice, i would wear that, has a hint of Chloe edp too.
Also has very strong resemblance to the 2015 edt which was more floral, and Fleur is more citrusy ( the irony)
This should be easy to wear in summer because of the citrusy notes, if you are Chloe fan but Chloe is too heavy in the heat.

Chloé Fleur de Parfum has been in my wardrobe for a while now. I went out to buy the original Chloé but that day my perfume shop ran out of stock. The nice sales lady suggested Chloé Fleur and on a whim I bought it. At first I was rather disappointed with Fleur, it was fresh and “nice” but not remarkable. It was designated to the “everyday/work/not in the mood for anything special” pile and thus it became a fresh, light, inoffensive fragrance I often wore to work. Is Chloé Fleur fresh, light and inoffensive? Absolutely. But there is so much more to this perfume than that. Recently I spritzed on some Fleur, then went about my day. I don't know if the climate, my hormones, mood and whatever else affects your skin chemistry miraculously aligned but suddenly I caught a whiff of a sweet and beautiful scent. I held up my wrist to my nose and yes, it was Chloé Fleur. Fleur came into full bloom for me (pardon the pun) on that day. Suddenly I could smell more than just the clean citrus opening. Beautiful aquatic rose peeked through the verbena and other citrus. Cherry blossom gave Fleur an exotic and almost earthy quality. The rice appeared giving Fleur a powdery quality, not a cosmetic powder but more of a slightly sweet gourmet powdery effect. It is beautiful. How did I overlook this dimension of Chloé Fleur? This is so much more than just a clean citrus scent, there is a beautiful sheer, aquatic and almost ethereal element to fleur. I think of sheer pink chiffon waving around in a warm summer breeze when I smell Fleur. Chloé Fleur is a whimsical innocent scent that displays it's ethereal beauty only in the right circumstances. This is a midsummer scent, it does well in hot weather. Do not dismiss Chloé Fleur too easily as I did, give it a fair trail and you might be pleasantly surprised. The silage is soft, it envelops you like your own little fairy dream hidden from the rest of the world. Chloé Fleur became my daily secret weapon, my portal to a summery meadow filled with flowers and joy.

On first spray I was definitely NOT a fan. The citrus was too synthetic and reminiscent of Pledge. I put Fleur down and decided to buy the original edp. However, as I continued browsing the duty-free shop, sniffing my wrist along the way, Fleur developed further. As the signature Chloe floral came through, the citrus became sweeter, fresher, and very complimentary. By the time 20 min had passed I was in love. While the two are reminiscent for sure, Fleur is certainly a fresher, more youthful take on the original.

I don't like it. Very fancy botle and price, but the scent itself is nothing special,quite boring. It reminds me of some cleaning product, too soapy for me. It's like L'occitane verbena shover gel. My relationship with Chloe perfumes ends here.
Smells like a soft combination of citrus and Rose type florals. Very subdued, not overpowering, but there's nothing that screams "buy this now!" to me.
It's like they turned the dial down just a tad on the original, and suddenly it is perfect for me. Might be FB worthy.

Smells very cheap like pure alcohol. Maybe it's the green citrus in the opening. I imagine animal urine. Like that accidental whiff of a dog urinating on a sidewalk as you walk by and the scent is lifted up in the air by an current. Not a fan of verbena & grapefruit. This scent comes off as a very inexpensive cologne rather than a smooth buttery fragrance that wraps around you like a warm embrace. If you are looking for luxury this is not it. If you enjoy the adventure of a gorgeous perfume as it transforms and takes you to another era in time with every change of notes this is not it. This like a fast shower when getting ready for work. Think drive through rather than sit down 3 course meal. Something maybe a tween would wear. Not worth the money.
Smells exactly like the regular Chloé EdP.

this is a very expensive bottle of cheap shampoo scent. or cheap hand cream. or cheap air freshener... any cheap cosmetic works, actually. feels quite watered down, but not in the immaculate, ellena-esque way; it's just synthetic, uninteresting and underwhelming. completely lacks the comforting complexity of rice which is allegedly a note here; it consists completely of of synthetic-feeling floral/herbal notes.

after reading about the launch on fragrantica a couple days ago, I came across a bottle of it at the new launches section of a cosmetics store yesterday. with the whole stress on "powdery beige and rice" in its PR, I had the hopes that this was an unofficial apology for love's discontinuation. upon spritzing some on my arm I was actually amazed by the fact that a commercial entity had the courage to bottle this up and sell it. I'm only hoping that their main goal is that this will be purchased as an unoffensive gift scent by confused fathers/boyfriends/males of the world.

should note that I am not a fan of chloe eau de parfum, but the house has had some big hits with me such as chloe love eau florale and roses de chloe; and I fit the brand's general aesthetic/spirit.

Hello Kon-nos91,

Awaiting your review update......

Surely there are more notes to Chloe Fleur de Parfum?
Agree with you regarding the "sillage/lasting power" "early voting", what an election year 2016 is!

P.S. I recently purchased Chloe Love Story (CLS). Honestly, am a little underwhelmed and do not know if would repurchase as lasting power on CLS is 2 to 4 hours in the Rocky Mountain summer climate.

Wow, am I the first who saw this? I never thought this could happen...it means I have to find it and review it, fate knows what to do and imagine it's my signature that I am searching like all of you for years haha ^_^

Promise to update my review when test it, not so sure that members will see it but I want to mention something tragic. When I first open Chloe Fleur de parfum, already 5 people have voted for it's sillage/lasting power when it's not even released. That's not fair people.
This sounds very good with cherry blossoms and rice can't wat to try it
Absolutely beautiful and very sadly discontinued. Please bring it back!

I LOVE this fragrance. It is so feminine and smooth, but long lasting. It daytime and evening wearable. Every time I wear I feel beautiful, sexy, feminine, and inspired. This is truly one of my top 5 fragrances! It’s hard to find, but when I do, I make sure to stock up on it;).
this is for sale on fragrancesandcosmeticsco.com right now. Just fyi. I am not affiliated with that store in any way aside from a customer.
This is just a perfect lavender scent - a modern and luxurious, like a most expensive soap bar... It's fresh, delicately herbal and very, very soft, simply beautiful, I want a big bottle NOW!!!!

I love it, but I can't find it anymore.
Does anybody know where can I buy it?
Thank you

I finally have my very own Givenchy - eau de Lavande ♡
Lovely citrus, Violet leaf, lavender , iris and musk.
A blend beyond compare , but got vibes from some really nice iris perfumes,
as well as Chanel Jersey but a small kick Vibe only.
I LOVE !
Relaxing aromatic lavender scent that I like to wear before going to sleep.

Chloe Eau de Fleurs Lavande was really peppery to my nose. This is surprising since there aren't any peppers listed. It immediately reminded me of an old fragrance my husband used to own (can't remember if it was by Hugo Boss or not) that smelled quite peppery to me. I'm not sure if it's the lavender that smells this way, because most of the lavenders I've tried before, never smelled like this. Whoever said this could be unisex, I totally agree with.

After the "peppery" first sniff, the next thought I had was "woodsy". There ARE woods in here, so I guess I was right in that aspect. I'm at a loss because I'm not sure what I would wear this to. I definitely don't own anything like Eau de Fleurs Lavande. At least it leans sort of "clean" (which I like in my fragrances), but the very woodsiness/pepperiness in it, definitely throws me off. After about 5 minutes, it dies down and turns into a powdery, close-to-the-skin scent; and what was once a powerful, almost-sneeze-inducing fragrance, actually turns into a more feminine and delicate one.
very feminine and ladylike. it is very soft, beautiful and powdery. definitely a classy fragrance, non offensive.

I like it but it makes me sneeze. A little goes a long way, I learned the hard way. I doused myself in this because it's EDT, my mistake. Still it's beautiful and aromatic like a lavender spice garden. It doesn't have the synthetic lavender smell you get from detergent or air freshener. It's quite lovely.
I love this fragrance... its awesome, like my second skin.. I don´t feel like I have a parfume, its in harmony with my own flavour ;)
very lovely perfume. it does smell like the lavender perfume by lavanila but better. i have moved on to other fragrances...so i am stuck with a almost full 3.4 oz bottle!
I LOVE this perfume :)
a very nice lavender, but nowhere near the magnificent Gris Clair by Serge Lutens!!! There the lavender is at its strongest and finest <3 !!

I feel very lucky to have found this scent when it was available. It is light, refreshing, and clean. It vaguely smells of lavender, but it's more of a sweet musky floral than a loud lavender. This is why I like this fragrance because, while I love the smell of lavender, I don't necessarily want it in a straight-up perfume. There is nothing offensive about this scent. I wish it was still available, but I might have to find a bottle online when mine runs out.

it is an excelent levender iris almond creamy balmy frag !!!i love from the first sniff,its too much perfect perfume but sooo expensive maybe 100 ml anyway i fall in love !!lovly soft feminine delicate,powdery absolut one off the best frag what i have!!!!

I purchased this scent at TJ Maxx for $59.99. A little on the high end for a "discount price" but boy was it worth it! I'm not crazy about lavender but in this fragrance it's not overpow
ering. I love it.

Can't pass up a good perfume on sale! I had sampled this one when it first came out and really liked it. However, I didn't make a purchase then as the price was kind of high which is never a deterrent if I really like something. This is Similar to Chloe EDP with a twist! This one can be unisex in my opinion. This is smells clean and has a feminine twist to it because it's kind of sweet but on the other side it's got some masculine aspects too with the vetiver and the lavender. I like lavender scents but had never encountered one that was modern that I liked. This is the exception such a beautiful scent you can really smell luxury here. It's got notes of bergamot which are prominent in the beginning. The violet leaf is also noticeable here. Almonds are perceived too but they kind of play in the background tying the whole composition. Then it turns to smells similar to Chloe but lighter with lavender as the center of the scent. Lavender just makes you feel clean. This will make you feel clean but sophisticated at the same time. You will be noticed but not in a loud kind of way. Silage is minimal and the staying power is rather weak in my skin. Great for all year round a versatile scent great for spring for summer for winter anytime of the day preferable although it can work perfectly for romantic nights too. You might want to run to your discount stores that end in XX as this appears to be discontinued.

really appreciate this fragrance a little bit less the price :-)
112 EUR for 100 ml is really expensive and even if I was surprised by the lavander note , really intensive but never disturbing , I think that the price is really too hight .
Ok Chloé is beneath this frangrance and you can recognize their signature..but on me the longevity of this fragrance is really poor.. nothing to see with Chloé Chloé eau de parfum.. on me the sillage is quite inexistant.
Any way I like it , in the top note I can fell some aromatic note.. like in eau de Cartier and even if there're no shared note with it, In the drydonw I found some similitude with Funny of Moschino.
Fleur de capucine is good also with a higher skin power stay .
One of my favourite fragrances to wear. I have the Neroli and the Lavende and I love them both. Worth trying - the Lavender is very contemporary and feminine.

Recently purchased a sample vial with this. It smells nice, but I can't shake the feeling that it reminds me so much of the lavender-scented bin liners we use in my house. Lmao. It's probably just my chemistry or maybe I haven't waited long enough for the fragrance to truly blossom. I only applied it about 10 minutes ago, after all. I can detect some soft, feminine elements starting to reveal themselves which I really like. :)

I find it's very easy for a lavender perfume to be similarly-scented to a disinfectant if one is not careful. This one, thankfully, steers away from that danger zone as it gradually unfolds.

If you like Lavender, this might be a good pick. I liked Capucine most of the range, but then again not enough to buy it. The price is quite expensive and you can get one-dimensional-floral-scents for much less.

I'm in two minds over this fragrance. Eau de Fleurs Lavande is beautiful in a discreet and natural fashion, however I think I'd prefer it much more if it was slightly stronger, like Eau de Lavande by Annick Goutal perhaps.

The top notes are when the lavender note is at its most prominent in the composition. It jumps off the skin in a feminine and watery way, somewhat aromatic, but also quite understated. I liked the opening the best.

The heart tended to become more discreet and airy, with subtle tea notes, zesty bergamot and fresh violet leaves complimenting the core. The rich lavender diminishes slightly, a little too soon in my opinion.

The sweet almond accord, although unique and pleasant, disappointed me as I wanted more aromatic lavender rather than sugared nuts. I think this fragrance is so focused on smelling elegant and refined that it loses a lot of its character and rawness.

Eau de Fleurs Lavande started off as my favourite from this series, however by the drydown it's my least favourite. It's just too fleeting for me and I grew tired of it far too quickly. I acknowledge its purity and softness, but for me it was a little boring and forgettable.

Oh my, this is such a perfect lavender scent! Nothing beats Gris Clair from Serge Lutens, but this is a whole different approach to this wonderful note.

It is subtle, woody, deep, and very, very chic and elegant. A perfect scent for wearing in the office or other workplaces demanding discrete scents, but at the same time it has got so much character! Smells professional, but can also reveal its romantic side. An office fragrance with fantasy. It gives a herbal-woody vibe, but there is also some softness and sweetness to it coming from almonds.

If only the price was not so high... (sigh)
WONDERFUL. I think this scent is the nicest out of the three in the collection. Powdery & floral. Not loud, just a modest beauty.
I love lavender, so was hoping this would be the one...but no. It smelt, quite frankly, of laundry soap and not much else...

I knew it!

The top note is beautiful luxurious lavender, really powerful and modern. Not the shy herbal flower you could expect ...

Then it smells VERY similar to Voyage en Mediterranee Mimosa de L`Esterel by L`Occitane en Provence.
This is it: violet leaf + almond!

Haven't looked at the price, but I think I prefer Chloe. It's a bit less sweet and kind of more refined.

Amazing, rich floral.
For me - the Queen of lavenders.
I'm stunned...
Beautiful fragrance...very soft, powdery, pleasant...wonderful!
Love from first sniff! The most interesting fragrance I have tried lately! It's harsh, but delicate, what I feel is mostly lavender, juniper and mastix. The other two are also on my wish-list.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: A win of a blind buy this was for me! Absolutely love it and it’s strong and long lasting and dries down to something soft vanilla sweet musky like. My tuberose plant just bloomed a few days ago for the first time ever and it smells just like this perfume, no joke. I brought this months ago but just wanted my two cents out there about this perfume. Out of all Chloe fragrances, the Nomade line is the most beautiful and interesting to me.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: This reminds me so much of M.Micallef Watch, especially in the opening, because of the juicy, bubblegum cloud effect (although this has no tuberose). It’s sweet, could verge on nauseating, but it still has that Chloé chicness. This feels more subdued than Watch (initially)—which demands your attention with its immense projection—and is slightly more powdery, but I prefer Watch more, and here’s why: the scratchiness from the jasmine and the dampness of the oakmoss start to appear in the dry down, and I’m getting whiffs of neroli, bergamot and mild BO. I also experienced migraine auras (flashing lights) from this. Therefore, I’m gonna keep Watch and most likely declutter this one. It’s also not what I expected from a Nomade flanker. I thought it would smell more nature-like and fresh, not a saccharine gourmand. It’s heavy and dense, so it should feel more like a Fall/Winter scent, but mood-wise it’s more of a Spring/Summer scent…maybe an all-year fragrance, then.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Another perfectly pleasant Chloe. Sweet, fresh, resinous toward the end of a whiff. It’s floral alright, but it has that slight playdoughy coconut I get semi often, and a hit of bitter from oakmoss. Chloe is just such a pleasant, boring house in my book. It’s for teenage girls on the beginning of their perfume journey, who want to smell clean, fresh, but also sweetly floral.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: A blind buy. I was overconfident this would be a true winner for me according to the notes and was instantly hooked by the concept of it being composed of 'all natural' ingredients'. However, I found it way too sweet and there's an accord in this fragrance I find off-putting, slightly nauseating. On my skin this fragrance projects well for five or six hours. I don't enjoy the opening or mid throughout the dry down, but I do find the resultant skin scent that remains for several more hours mildly pleasant. I've never tried the original Nomad on skin, I liked it on a test card but thought it too pricey at the time, perhaps I should give it a chance.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
This is unique

Have gotten so many compliments wearing this during the summertime. Literally anyone who hugged me said “you smell amazing”.

It’s the date note and it’s so delicious. This perfume is divine

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Smells dry, golden, and slightly dusty. Feels like slow travel through warm, open landscapes — grounded but distant.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
This is a very pleasant easy going scent that has a niche-like addictive twist with the date notes.
The smell of white florals is almost bright and juicy at first, but the magic is in the resinous semi dry dates finally bringing the scent down to a little earthiness with a long lasting honey-like natural sweetness which is not overly sweet- just as you would expect a date would taste.
I am not sure if this flanker is supposed to be the same with Jasmin Naturelle but when I smelled the jasmin vers. at the stores I immediately fell in love with the beautiful airy floral blast and didn't notice the dates as much as this one. Honestly I remember the jasmin to be more likeable but I am happy with this jem too.
When I wear this perfume, I am transported to a dry, sun-drenched desert or rooftop of a faraway market,- though it is hot, I am cooling in the shades of loosely draped white linen just casually lounging eating away decadent dried dates for dessert.

I am also looking forward to trying the lumiere vers. as the reviews are so good. It hasn't been released where I am hopefully it is out soon before the summer ends!

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
