review_content: I've been wearing this a lot lately! It's never too much of a sweet vanilla and white floral headache. It's magic and it's always just right! Also, if you really smell and think about it, it gives off a green vanilla vibe. CUTE!

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Very similar to Nomade Jasmin naturel. The difference is in the fact that in Naturelle, only natural ingredients are used. It does smell a little less like vanilla cake topping and more flowery - a bit 'warmer' I would say. But these two Nomades are very close sisters.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
I remember testing full ylang from the body shop 1 month after pre-ordering this and that one smelled hella delicious !! Some chloe nn reviews claimed that “it smelled more ylang” and left them quite disappointed but that gave me a spark of hope bc I was obsessed with full ylang 😭 and DUH i love ylang in my fragrances.

It’s also funny how full ylang was compared to m.micallef ylang in gold, guerlain terra cotta, and davidoff cool elixir bc chloe nn was also compared to the fragrances I mentioned.

Instead of snagging TBS full ylang, I patiently waited for this baby to come
home and finally

For the moment of truth, is the body shop full ylang and chloe nn similar? Hell yes they are AND I AM STUNNED.

I somehow enjoyed Chloé NN way better tho because it’s less sugar-sweet than TBS Full Ylang !! + TBS Full Ylang doesn’t develop quite as much as Chloé NN 🌼

Chloé NN starts off super bubblegummy + banana milkshake (yum) and as it develops, the white florals come into play, which surprisingly doesn’t overpower the peculiar, odd yet cute bubblegum banana scent. 🍌

It smells quite linear in its earlier stages but this perfume requires patience because in its full drydown? You are met with this gorgeous woody-peppery-smoky scent that gives it a leathery feel. These facets are also what makes this perfume surprisingly unisex !! 🧚

Weirdly enough, the scent reminds me of an aha.bha toner I used before that had tea tree oil lol but I don’t hate it as it gives the scent a unique fresh-green nuances despite it being all warm, dry, sweet, and woody. I think that’s what gives it its “unorthodox chypre” quality. 🌳

I’ve always wanted THAT kick of woods, smoke, and peppery-incense in my collection bc I mostly own dark feminine, medicinal, syrupy-sweet scents and this is a perfect new addition to my collection that checks all the qualities I look for in a woody perfume 🫶🏻

Proud to say that this is my 4th consecutive successful blind buy 🤭

Update: there’s something really buttery in between initial spray and mid-dry down and it’s SOOOOO GOOOOOD 😮💨

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Not so nice, the date is very syrupy but the jasmine is too much like soap for me.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: The original Nomade was underwhelming (like most Chloe perfumes to me), so I was sceptical about this one, but it's much better than I thought! Almost smells like honey and has an oriental touch. So sweet, feminine and uplifting! Given the history of the brand, this is what I would expect from their perfumes.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Sweet, nicely blended vanilla perfume. I get a hint of flowers but not much from the jasmine. I don't get much of the dates either, maybe just their sweetness and a tiny hint of oriental notes. There was something slightly sour in it, could be the plums? I could not pinpoint which notes exactly, but something in this reminds me of Spicebomb, but this one is much softer.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
i'm starting to fall in love with all nomade perfumes. i thought classic nomade had a modern and sort of masculine character. but this one!!!!
it's sweet but this is a fruity, yummy sweetness rather than sugar-sweet. vanilla and sandal feel almost creamy. white flowers balance out the whole warm notes, giving this a clean and powdery sense. perfect for the summer, absolutely girly and great <3

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Sticky sweet but not overwhelming. Love the dates in it.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Bu benim neşeli yaz ve tatil parfümüm. Sıcacık neşeli içimi ısıtan ve sanırım hep tatilde sıktığım için hindistancevizi notasından bana güneş kremi de kokan parfümdür. Daha beğenmeyen kimse olmadı, favorilerimden.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: This is my favourite perfume of all time but unfortunately I believe it has been discontinued, as it no longer appears on the official Chloe website. It is different from both "jasmin naturel" versions which are heavier on the floral notes and less sweet.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: I love it! I normally do not like sweet scents at all, but this one is different. It smells unique. I get smell of the dates the most and I normally dislike gourmand notes but I love this one. It gives off a pretty and genuine woman not seeking for others' approval vibe to me. Not in a rebellious but in a calm way. I wish the longevity and sillage was a little bit better but still would buy again.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Utterly BEAUTIFUL perfume! One of the best summer scents out there! Perfect balance between white flowers and sweetness. Coconut is creamy and in my opinion, the addition of dates on top of vanilla in summer perfumes creates a much sexier, alluring and unique result, it sticks to the skin and blends with your chemistry more naturally. Highly recommended for tropical beach vacation and sun-tanned night outs. Signature summer scent worthy

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: my friend told me this smells like piss and now i can’t unsmell it

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Something in here is coming off as ylang to me. So I’m mostly getting ylang and jasmine, so basically a beachy floral. I don’t get dates at all. Not what I expected and undecided how I feel about it.
It also reminds me of Madonna Truth or Dare.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: why does this have to be so expensive 🥲

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
This was a blind buy after I asked chat gpt to suggest perfumes with specific notes and drydown that I was after and this one was recomended. I bought it and it arrived the next day and Oh my goodness I dont know what I was expecting but this is DELICIOUS. I wouldn't say this perfume is sweet, or gourmand, or even floral. It is its own scent and nothing I have smelled before. its creamy, smooth, soft, intriguing. my new signature scent. I've seen some reviews sayinf it doesn't last but thats something I'm willing to compromise on as it just smells devine.
I think this smells just like those bubblegums from childhood that used to come with little fake tattoos for the skin. I am absolutely in love with it.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Against everything in my mind that told me, you'll hate this - it's just basic, jasmine, freesia, blah, blah - I clicked BUY. It arrived and I'd half forgotten - that's how sure I was it'd be a disaster of a blind buy. Oh my GOD! This is UNBELIEVABLE. It is soft and complex and sweet, earthy and almost a bit green. And, just when you think it's gonna go too sweet and basic vanilla blah as it starts to dry down, it turns to a nougaty type of softly green and very gently woody vanilla - I don't even know. It's amazing. After 2 days of non-stop wearing / repeated spraying (every level of this is gorgeous) i went and ordered a backup bottle. STOP IT it's so good. Ughhhhh

*Update 2/19 -- TWO backup bottles!

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
I hate jasmine and floral notes but this… this i like!

Didn’t get the hype it deserves

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Something in this reminds me of V&R Spicebomb.
Its divine.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Very sweet and creamy smelling, nothing sharp to it at all. Sweet dates and banana milkshake, almost has a tropical sunscreen vibe but there is no coconut (thank god). I like it and it's easy to get along with, though if you like complexity this isn't for you.
If you've been looking for a summery tanning oil/sunscreen scent with sweetness and zero coconut, you should try this.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: the date note is this piqued my curiosity and I’m not disappointed. This is a total pretty girl scent!! A sweet floral that’s youthful, fun, but also sophisticated. There’s just enough of a dash of flirtiness in this that it can easily transition from daytime to nighttime. Full bottle worthy? Yes

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
When I originally bought this I liked it, but wasn't blown away. I put it in the back of my closet to age and try again in the colder months, and now I'm wow'ed by this perfume! Upon initial spray, I'm getting a thick brown sweetness from the earthy dates. It is very very sweet, but not overpowering and not sickening. The gentle spiciness from the freesia is absolutely DIVINE. Combined with egyptian jasmine? Chef's kiss. You get the best part of the floral notes without this actually smelling like a floral perfume.

I'm a one-spray girly and let me tell you, the sillage is crazy on this perfume. For the most part, I don't smell it on me (which is my goal), but every time I turn my head, stand up, or bend over I'm blessed with a waft of warm, cozy fragrance that just makes me happy. Nomade Naturelle makes me want to snuggle up under a fuzzy blanket with a mug of something hot and binge on Hallmark movies.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: I really like this! It has a natural earthy quality... smooth.... soft....Mirabella plum and vanilla. Maybe it is the dates that gives that earthy feel to the perfume like a field of heather. Perfect for all day wear. I find this so comforting. I wear it while cozy in bed watching Sherlock Holmes solving a mystery somewhere on the Yorkshire Moors. Oh, I wish I could be there with Sherlock... wearing tweed, a deerstalker hat, and Nomade Naturelle! 😊

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: So confusing: is this the perfume that is now called Jasmin Naturel? Are they THE SAME perfume?

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: This smells sooooo good, its silky and smooth and im just in love!

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Was a blind buy, it was on a huuuge discount at a local store of mine and you got a little bag with it, that being said, I cannot say it is a bad or an ugly smelling perfume, it's pretty nice.
Actually, picture a blonde, white, British woman who has read everything there is too read about Middle East, watched all the films, loves the music, maybe even the food, the style, knows even a bit of Arabic, but has never actually been there. That's what this perfume smells like to me - like a hint, a love letter to the Middle East/Sahara tm but without a realisation.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Bought this by accident a while back and initially wasn’t a fan. Recently dug it out of the archives, and I am now completely smitten. Sweet, earthy, rich… and that jasmine is just exquisite. I don’t find it similar to the original Nomade (which I also own and love). This is probably my favourite of the entire line, and they’re all pretty amazing.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
This was lovely until I realized that it smells like bananas :D I sold it. I really don't want to smell like bananas. If you want something that is heavy on the sweet dates, go for Lattafa Khamrah - that perfume gave me what I wished for from this one.

(I accidentally posted my review on the Jasmin Naturelle Intense too)

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: I ordered a travel spray of this fragrance with other travel sprays and samples so maybe there was a mix up between the fragrances but this smells very middle eastern to me. Veeeery spicy, cinnamon and all, reminds me of fall and Christmas. Maybe it's the dates, because it's pretty similar to Khamrah to my nose, spices and sweet dates. I like it, since I like Khamrah a lot, but I just wasn't expecting this kind ot scent profile from this fragrance, so I am a bit disappointed.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: I’m so in love with this perfume. It became one of my favourites so fast. Such a shame I didn’t give it a try earlier. Everyone around me loved it as well. It’s very true to the notes and the name. Personally, I love it because it fits my personality and looks, which was the comment I got from my family and friends too. I just love it in a very sentimental way now.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: @Safira these are not the same perfume. They have different notes. And smell alike but not the same. I’m already buying for stock.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: The rave reviews have me anxious to test, but I can't seem to find it anywhere. Has it been discontinued?? There are other variations, but apparently they don't compare to this...

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
This is a beautiful perfume (period). I've smelled the Nomade line, and this one has a different DNA. It leans less woody and more towards an interesting sweet/summer vibe. It doesn’t smell like anything I've experienced before, I believe the dates+jasmin combo give it an unexpected twist. BUT it is not a floral leaning perfume. And it doesn't have that "perfumey smell" that 75% of stores smell like.
To be absolutely fair, the longevity isn't great. If you're only after the juice, I'd say it's a special, unique fragrance among designer perfumes, but 2 hours down the line, I cant smell it anymore on the skin. Still, an absolutely gorgeous fragrance.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Oh my.. This scent it so beautiful. Love at first spray, completely. I’m a redhead and I think this one suits me so well. Its warmth and spiciness 😻 I can’t wait to re-apply from the sample while I wait for my 50 ml to arrive (it was sold out in the shop but it was possible to order it home). But I’m too afraid the sample will get empty before it arrives 🤭😂

To me it smells expensive and feminine. The longevity and sillage isn’t as strong as I wish it was. I haven’t tested the intense version but will consider it when my naturelle bottle is empty.

Edit: I had to try the intense version and it’s not for me. I see many reviews about how alike they are but I do not agree. I tried spraying them on each arm without knowing which one was intense or naturelle. I liked naturelle the most because it’s more round, soft, coconut-like. I know it’s to be expected that an intense version is.. Yeah intense. But this one was not for me

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: The opening is almost exclusively fruity to me. I learned here it's Mirabelle. Belonging to the plum family this is a very juicy note. Very sweet, too, probably where the dates come into play. If it stayed like this, it would be a love. Unfortunately, those fresh fruity notes disappear after a short while and the fragrance drifts off into a powdery, sugary vanilla, that's just a little too intense and too basic for me to love it. It's not disgusting or anything like that, but there's other fragrances at this price point that will give me longer lasting joy.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: sweet, juicy, powdery, a tiny bit musky like incense all at once… i like it a lot but sillage is disappointing :( a good perfume for clubbing. perchance.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: i have fallen irrevocably in love with this perfume. it’s so sweet and youthful yet still somehow earthy and mature. it’s carolyn bessette kennedy on a beach trip. it’s the air-conditioned lobby of a remodeled jugend hotel. it’s the end of cleaning day, windows wide open to let the breeze in, defrosting a piece of cake to reward yourself. it’s a night in an ancient city with the heat from the busy day still lingering. it’s a forest after rain. it’s everything. made an account just for her

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
tested today bc i became slightly obsessed with the idea of this fragrance and i was like ‘no you’re going to smell it before you buy it!’ so i did. and it was nothing like i expected. this straight up smells like a banana milkshake or foamy bananas which i weirdly like a lot. it’s very sweet but has a warm comforting aura honestly it could be a ‘your skin but better’ scent. by the way it’s called ‘jasmin natural’ they renamed it idk why esp since it’s such a recent release no one even had time to get used to the original name.
anyway i think this might be a purchase. it’s an extremely safe blind buy,completely noninvasive,it just smells great. oh and it’s not alcoholy/sharp at all there’s a creaminess/softness to it that is lovely
i keep smelling it on my hand and i just smells good i can’t describe it any other way it’s just rly good like a sweet creamy body lotion

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: I like it very much, it's a really happy scent and it stays on skin for a long time, which is awesome nowadays when nothing lasts. It's a gem imo! I'd say it's a sophisticated fruity floral fragrance, never being too sweet nor cloying. It's a nice blend of dates, mirabelle and jasmine with a touch of sandalwood, which may resembles the coconut smell that many are talking about. I don't think it's similar to Terracotta Guerlain, this one is way more indolic and sultry.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
I've been wearing this fragrance for a year and a half now. It was a mostly blind buy. I smelt it on paper and instantly had to buy. Definitely lucky that it smelt the same on my skin, maybe even a bit better.

I'm not sure what I'm smelling, but something smells so earthy and mossy (must be the oakmoss?), but it's mingled with the vanilla (which always comes out very strong on me), but it's a beautiful scent. Some days freesia comes out very prominently and other days it's the Jasmine and I have no idea why, but regardless, I love how slightly interchangable the notes can be.

My bottle is coming to an end and I wasn't sure if I wanted to repurchase, but, after wearing this on vacation in a colder climate, I've fallen in love with this scent all over again.

Definitely a repurchase.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
While I like Nomade, I don't understand this perfume. To my nose this is a weird mixture. Mirabelle, dates, and jasmine somehow don't fit for my liking. Overall I smell fresh, green, very sweet, yet sour-bitter... something, with addition with something unnaturally plastic/synthetic.
Did they throw a strawberry bubblegum or tuberose in here as well???
I think if you are a fan of Mugler Allien, give it a sniff, they are a family.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Wow sadly this isn’t what I was expecting. I enjoy the nouveau chypre qualities of Nomade EDP and Nomade Absolu, but this gives me Estée Lauder x Tom Ford Bronze Goddess 2011 (which I enjoyed). I get no mirabelle, no dates, but a powdery, sweet, white floral, coconut bomb. I was expecting more of a bohemian vibe. Glad I opted for a decant.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
A lovely perfume.

I especially smell vanilla and sandalwood which gives a powdery and warm side to the whole. There is also a sweet side brought by the delicious mirabelle plum and the dates (even if I cannot perceive those last).

The name of the perfume reminded me of something quite heavy and spicy but in fact it is very soft. For all seasons in my opinion. On the other hand, I find the staying power quite weak and the sillage non-existent, which is a bit problematic for me.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
The ULTIMATE summer scent! I am in love with fragrance

Elegant, sweet, mysterious, warm and sexy! Definitely a woman scent

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
I blind bought this. The ai says to not do that but to me, this is a very likeable, crowd pleasing scent.
I think it's unique as far as perfumes go and I've gotten compliments on it but when i first smelled it all I could think was "this smells like walking into a Lush store". I don't think there are many perfumes like this but to me it still smells... generic if that makes sense. A bit boring. But I still like wearing it lol.

It's sweet but not too sweet, I definitely get the date note but I don't think this is a "fruity" fragrance.
It's a bit aromatic, kind of smells like a spa but if you add vanilla and sweetness.
It's definitely not your typical girly girl designer scent but I'd say it's feminine and very pleasant. It smells more like a free spirit kind of woman but still classy.
You could wear this all year round but it gives me spring vibes or maybe for summer evenings, but not in a going out clubbing type of way. More like sitting on the beach and watching the sunset.
Currently this is my daytime scent until I find something better.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: This is not very closely related to Nomade in my opinion. It does toe the line between chypre and gourmand, earthy and spicy and sweet all at once. You get a soft jasmine, syrupy date, cinnamon (?), and a faint oakmoss. It's very unique but I'm not a fan.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
I prefer this over classic Nomade EDP and its flankers. I smell a beautiful honeyed jam of dates and plums with a hint of jasmine. Sweet, delicious, uplifting, not cloying. The oak moss note is noticeable but not as overpowering as in Nomade EDP.
The projection is moderate, the longevity is ok. A bit overpriced. Beautiful, nonetheless.

Upd. Nevermind, the original Nomade’s DNA has grown on me, so I ended up getting Nomade EDT and Nomade Absolu, EDP is on the way as well. It just needs chilly and windy weather to really blossom. And Chloe’s Cedrus seems to have the same DNA, could’ve been one of the Nomade’s flankers easily.
Though Jasmin Naturelle, Naturelle and Nuit D’Egypt have less in common with the original Chloe Nomade’s DNA.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: This is such a wonderful summer scent and long lasting and strong. There has to be coconut in the notes even though it’s not listed. I also own the natural Jasmin intense version and I don’t see many people comparing the two. The jasmine intense has a heavier sweet / cinnamon note in the dry down and more Jasmine in the opening. Probably better for winter. This one the nonade Naturelle is COCONUT and it’s heaven, smells just like Estée Lauder Bronze Goddess eau fraiche but way stronger.👍 Both Nomade scents are very different to each other so you can happily own both, one for summer and one for winter 🙌

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: This is a jasmine fragrance. A pretty, non-indolic jasmine. Quite different than the first two nomads which are fresher and sharper. I like those but they can give a sour vibe in the dry down where this is all pretty girl all the time.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Because I’m obsessed with this Nomade line, I own every iteration. I can pick up on the sweeter notes in this fragrance, but there’s something that smells like cedar to me. It may be the sandalwood or just a combination of the various notes that gives me that impression. This one is distinct from the original, but it’s still quite lovely.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: This is so pretty! It's completely different from the OG which I don't particularly like so I opted to buy a decant first because the date accord was intriguing. Nomade Naturelle is what I wanted Valentino BIR Intense to be. This has creamy jasmine and doesn't come of as indolic like BIR Intense. I love the sweetness it has without being gourmand. This is on my list for a full bottle!

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
I've been so surprised by every thing about this. I got a tester of it with an order of something totally unrelated. I'm familiar with the original chloé perfume so I was expecting something sort of similar. Was also intrigued by what 'naturelle' would mean for the smell, I assumed (wrongly) it would mean it was citrus or herbal smelling, for some reason. Or maybe woody? I'm not 100% sure what I was expecting to be honest.
I was verrrrrrry surprised by my first sniff. First thing I thought was 'naturelle'? I don't think so... Right off the bat it is very sweet, as the notes would suggest. So I was caught off guard by that. I don't usually consider myself a fan of sweet fragrances at all, so I very quickly wrote it off thinking nope, not for me. But then, as I kept smelling it, I realised I had literally never smelled anything remotely similar to this composition before.

It's sweet like a piece of halva or maybe sweet like a perfect piece of fruit would be, how something is sweet because it has grown in abundant sunshine. Like the way honey sweetens tea, not sugar. And then it's floral, but not like shampoo or perfume, but like nectar or pollen, like walking past a jasmine bush in summer. It smells juicy. It's got warmth from the base of sandalwood and vanilla, which i usually am not a fan of much, but here same thing! It smells like a vanilla bean pod, not like vanilla ice cream. It smells like something not man-made.

As I caught whiffs of it, I realised I was becoming hooked, which is all I look for in a fragrance really. Despite it being very sweet and quite floral, it's never too much, not to me anyway. It's actually something I've been looking for for a long time; it's comforting and cosy, but it's also light and breezy. It's soft, it has no sharpness, still alive and interesting though.

Suffice to say, I was unexpectedly sold and I was so confused about it. It's what has been missing from my perfume collection, and despite this analysis I still can't put my finger on what exactly is so lovely to me about it. The comments I've had on it have all been positive, the worst being a friend telling me she loves it as a smell but wouldn't wear it on herself as it doesn't smell very 'perfumy'. Which as a molecule girlie (juliette has a gun, glossier you, another 13 etc.) I liked alot.

Imagery: Pink and yellow to me. Quite laid back. Whoever is wearing this eats whole foods, wears the same jewellery every day and lives at their own pace. Lots of cashmere and linen, long wool coats in winter. Plays chess perhaps, and has an apartment with big windows on a tree lined sunny street. She's an easy laugher and is beautiful in a way that makes you want to look not like her precisely, but more like yourself. Would literally be the perfect signature scent! Could not see this on a man but always willing to be proven wrong.

Also smells slightly like ski wax sometimes but that's quite specific.

Edit after a year: I go nose blind to this almost immediately so I save it for occasional use now and then

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: This perfume has changed name from Naturelle to Jasmin Naturel, which kind of makes sense with there being a Jasmin Naturel Intense. But it was slightly confusing when buying it!

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Wow, stunning. Simple, beautiful, well balanced sweet and summery. Smells quality. It’s a cold wet windy cloudy January day today and this smells like liquid summer sunshine in a bottle. Definitely more floral than sunscreen, but the florals are so soft and natural smelling, no sharpness to them at all. Slightly tropical. It isn’t wild or groundbreaking, and it isn’t the most unique fragrance, but truly beautiful and good quality. I smell tiare and gardenia somehow? I’m pretty into florals and have a garden full of jasmine and gardenia, this doesn’t smell like typical star jasmine to me, something more exotic. I’m used to freesia smelling more strong and sharp to me too, typically not my favorite floral in perfume, but I can’t quite detect it here. To me it has just the right amount of sweetness for an any day, any time grab. The tartness of the mirabelle is toned down compared to the other flankers, replaced with a light fresh vanilla. I can sometimes smell the dates but they’re pretty mellow. I get a lot of monoi vibes. I’ve had trouble finding a good performing quality monoi type scent but this blend really feels like what I’ve been looking for. May finally be able to declutter a few duds.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: At first, I love all the Nomade versions but the ones I've smelled always end up smelling like sweat in the dry-down, in this one it's probably the wood notes mixed with the moss. I even tried it on a blotter so it's not because of my skin, my nose just perceived it that way. Such a shame, as I love everything else about them.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
This juice was everything I was looking for in a perfume. I'm not crazy for overly floral perfumes, and I think the florals in this are perfectly balanced with the fruity and woody aspects in this iteration of nomade. A friend recommended this, knowing I'm a sucker for sandalwood and vanilla, and yet wanting something Sexier than your run of the mill basic scents. They purchased a sample for me, and it was immediately over. I had to have the full size.
Sweet, spicey, sexy, mature, yet I feel its not reserved to any one age group. I also feel this is appropriate for any time of day, or season. I'm in love!

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
The jasmine and freesia are dominant and almost overpowering on my skin. I just learned I'm not a big fan of the freesia jasmine combo.

I was really drawn to test this fragrance due to to the date and plum notes listed, however I can't smell them, other than to say they make the florals sweet. Not too sweet though, just a touch sweet.

This smells like pure summer, and my brain makes the jump to smelling coconut. This really reminds me of Rio de Janeiro's Rio Radiance, and will layer really well with that cream or a perfume which smells like coconut milk for summer.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: On me, this smells like a grown-up version of bazooka bubble gum....and I can't decide if that's good or bad. It's pleasant due to nostalgia, and it's inoffensive with close sillage and balanced notes. But can't imagine wearing it on a regular basis, so I won't buy a full size.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Nomade Naturelle is my favourite thing tight now. It's like if I had just been baking something sweet and nice. I don't like the head notes much, with a note that gives me something like musty damp clothes that I find in many perfumes, but it soon evaporates and leaves just goodness behind... i am only surprised it's a summery fragrance, I link it straight to Christmas! Maybe because I'm Italian and dates/plum/vanilla talk about Christmas to me? My Italian partner feels the same...

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Clean scents with hints of vanilla. Sort of reminds me to bbw warm vanilla sugar

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: You can use this perfume everyday and don't have to reapply throughout the day! I'd recommend you to layer this perfume with coconut body mists & lotions. This one doesn't give me headaches (I've been sensitive to oud and spicy scents lately). Some people said not to blind buy this but my god this is one of the EASIEST blind buy that you can ever make.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: This is my favorite fragrance of all time. I’m a perfume lover, I’ve been collecting since I was 8 years old. Until I got this fragrance, I had never found anything that could be my signature. I was looking for a clean, elegant, sweet fragrance that could work in every weather. I honestly didn’t think I would ever find what I was looking for but I stand corrected. The dates and mirabelle make the opening sweet and fruity, but not too loud. I have never found a fragrance with dates in it which adds to the uniqueness of this scent. The dry down is what truly made me fall in love with this fragrance though. Soft, feminine, pretty, and absolutely breathtaking. It’s exactly what I imagine comfort being if it were a scent. This fragrance stays with me all day and no one around me ever gets a headache from it including myself. I could not be happier with this purchase, and I intend on rebuying this for the rest of my life!

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
This smells wonderful - it’s a great all rounder & I feel it would suit all seasons. Its a recent purchase for me & the warm vanilla and oak moss lend itself to cold seasons but the fruitiness and jasmine could work well in warm weather too.

It’s sweet & fruity from the sticky dates and tangy mirabelle plums, floral from jasmine and freesia then dries down to a delicious woody warm vanilla.

I prefer this to the other Nomades, it smells so unique & its the kind of scent that could easily become your signature perfume.
Love.
(I’ve had 2 compliments from strangers whilst wearing this too!)

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Love it love it love it!! Was always looking for a sweet, woody and floral scent and I feel so lucky to have this in my collection. I don't understand how everyone's smelling banana because on me it just smells like jasmine and woody, drying down to just woody, it's absolutely lovely and exactly what I was looking for :)

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: I did a spray on a tester strip in duty-free then tucked it in my passport and forgot about it. When I came across it again, I was obsessed, but couldn't remember which perfume it was! I finally worked out it was this one, luckily re-tested to get the right Nomade as this is very different from the others. Reading the notes is quite interesting as I never thought I was a sweet perfume lover, I normally go for more androgynous wood scents. I instantly get coconut and sunblock and it's 100% a summer fragrance for me, I haven't worn it into Autumn and Winter. It makes me think of a golden sunset in the Med, a warm evening when you put on a long flowy dress for a relaxed dinner by the water. I layer it with the Nuxe Huile Prodigieuse body oil for longevity and the neroli scent compliments Nomade nicely.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: This one is interesting, it does not remind me the original Nomade at all. It smells sweet and summery, very pleasant. And I couldn't agree more - it is unique.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Am I the only one who thinks this is similar to Guerlain's Lui? Looking at the list of notes, they are very distant cousins, smelling them side-by-side they are sisters. In all honesty, I find neither a summery, outdoorsy scent - both are more autumnal, cuddly. Very intimate, comforting skin scents, though Lui is the older, louder sister. Nomade Naturelle is gentler: more unobtrusive, more wholesome. I must say I haven't really figured out the dates in this - if I wouldn't know I wouldn't have guessed in a million years. It is sweet though, and nutty, with a hint of almonds.

I bought this on the fly. Quite literally, at the airport. On the plane I kept sniffing my arm, thinking I had made a big mistake and pondering how to get at least some of my money back. Now, though, I am SO glad I hung on to it. With the cooler weather and the similarity to Lui, I am actually loving it. Considering Guerlain's prices and Chloe's, I'm even happier.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
It's different from the original Nomade. It reminds me of Nomade Absolu with the addition of sticky and sweet dates. It's really, really sweet and definitely not a safe blind buy, the OG is much "safer"
I'm not sure about its longevity on the skin, but on clothes, it lasts for a few days.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: This smells of faint whiskey aged in cedar and sprinkled with leaves and tiny white flowers. It's beautiful and expensive smelling. Lasts for hours and have a gorgeous veil of scent that flows in the air all around you. 10/10

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Superb fragrance! At first, I smell mostly a strong jasmine note with lots of sweet notes (vanilla/dates/mirabelle). The only thing that held me back was the drydown. There's something spicy about it, even a little bit medicinal (and I don't know why). After that, everyone has their own experience, but for me it's still very pleasant to wear!

8/10

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
This to me is not like the others in this line.

I find this to be a little "dental clinic", not a bad smell, I find it the same vibe a ysl yvresse 2011, and another ysl I can't put my finger on.

I will test again, I don't feel it's plum-like in the normal way and i can't recall smelling mirabelle plum.
It lasts well though, is soft in feel

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Interesting comparison just below with Portrayal. Coincidently, Portrayal is my current signature scent and NN one of my favs (I even have a back up bottle). However, I personally see no similarity between the 2. While Portrayal is a cold perfume, although it has sweetness from vanilla, the elemi note gives it a balsamic, almost minty, refreshing note, NN is extremelly warm and sweet.

I am not contradicting @mistrall below, I just find it very interesting how different perceptions may be sometimes. No matter how, both perfumes are really good ones and worth having and enjoying.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: This one reminds me of one of my favourite Amouage creations - Portrayal woman. A lovely composition around jasmine. Only this one is vanillic, and Portrayal is tobacco-ish. Chloe Nomade naturelle performs on par with many niche fragrances imo.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Eau Naturelle is one of the better gourmand perfumes of nowadays. It's very distinct, not mistakable with any other perfume, very unique. Potent and great sillage. Not my style, however, truly pleasant, adventurous, but also elegant perfume. It's dates and mirabelle, soft whispers of oakmoss and jasmine, enveloped by vanilla. The scent is very warm. I can't believe how unique this actually is. Not comparable with anything else, unless it's another Chloe - Jasmin Naturel Intense. They are very similar.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: To my East Asians, this smells EXACTLY like banana flavoured grass jelly 😍

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: I remember liking this in store and it reminding me of a designer version of M. Micallef Ylang in Gold but with that Mirabelle sweet slightly pear-ish fruit shining. Both can be worn all year round which is hard to do. It’s substantial and projecting enough to work in the cold and not cloying to work in the heat. It’s sweet but not too much and not your typical designer kind of sweet, but it is very wearable. The dates work well in this too and contributes to that natural sweetness lol and that ylang ylang/banana custard illusion.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
What kinda of sorcery is this? The blend of dates and mirabelles smells like banana!
This scent is a beautiful take on the bubblegum genre...usually they come as raspberry, strawberry, melon or grape focused (and often it is tuberose and other flowers that give the effect), but this one is certainly a banana bubblegum!
The jasmine in it is dirtied by the sandalwood which also results almost white chocolaty, and a crystal like oakmoss seals the deal with a classy twist! In the dry down you can almost smell a banana smoothie, and much powder! A very fluffy cloud of powder!
What a strange little concoction! Quite unique cosidering the brand portfolio.
It's like joy in a bottle! It will surely appeal to their audience, Chloe always had a romantic femininity, an elegance that we can define as delicate and light hearted. It smells joung and girly without being juvenile.

To tell it all, if you smell it carefully you can clearly understand that there is a date note in the perfume, their sweetness and texture is unmistakable...my father worked in Algeria and always brought back with him huge packs of dates, just picked. They were so so sticky, as full of honey, but that substance came directly from the dates...no additives. Never found that good quality again.
If you are curious about what kind of smell they can have in a perfume maybe this Nomade Naturelle version is a mediocre start, for a more pure and concentrated dates scent we have to go niche, but taken on his own Chloe Nomade Naturelle was a big surprise for me and a good one at that.

To pick it apart a little more I would say that the opening is extra fruity, with mirabelle and date quite recognisable, plus a general fruitiness that has something of yellow melon and peach too!
At this stage it is not much sweet, luckly, and it smells more like solid fruits then juice or watery, which again is less common to find.
The middle is still much fruity but the jasmine is potent, little by little becomes the major player and it smells creamy and little "dirtied" by the base of sandalwood. It is much similar to the jasmine in Trussardi Pure Jasmine (they share a lot this two perfumes), with a white chocolate tinge on it, airy but at the same time with a considerable weight and creaminess to it. I don't particulary smell the fresia, maybe it's just simply fruity? There is none of its greenness or spiciness, just airy florals.
The sandalwood in this perfume is complex smelling, specially in the final part of dry down. In this middle stage of the scent it is a little dirty but it also has something of coconutty, a characteristic that I much enjoy...and I find it almost lactonic (as if a proper milk/whipped cream accord were present), I am sure the sweet and woody vanilla helps a lot in this regard; the result is gourmand/cocktail verging between candy, beverage and fruity dessert! Before the effect becomes too edible or unberable here comes the okamoss in the base, well blended with the rest, you can not isolate the note, and it soffuses the sweetness and all the notes masterfully! It's not dry or airy at all this type of oakmoss, it is modern and almost crystalline.
Dry down is woody and powdery too...the powdery part is much fluffy and cloudy, like a mimosa effect, probably coming from the well blended vanilla, but to tell it all there is a vague yellow flower tinge in the composition.
At some point the dry down even smells a bit spicy, as if a light sprinkle of cinnamon could be in it...probably it is again the sandalwood that has complexity, it remainds me of some apple pie and Christmasy sweets, but it is not a central characteristic.
I have noticed that the flowers and the sandalwood smell a bit dirty, almost sweet smoked/incensed but in a very light, almost imperceptible manner, maybe something similar to styrax or honey could have been lightly used, or it is simply the sandalwood or the vanilla that has more then one undertone...it could even be the dates! In any case, dry down is addictive and persistent.


The mood of the fragrance is extra playful, filtry and feminine. It has the name Nomade but this Naturelle version has almost nothing of the Nomade original line, they probably share just the mirabelle, the florals and that crystal oakmoss, the original Nomade is ultra classy and elegant while still being lightly fruity, this one is trendy and girly.
I think it gives happy vibes, even vacation vibes...there is something slitghly tropical (we could even say beachy) more so then "nomade". The result is light hearted but posh, something I could see on a trendy woman, dressed colorfully and strolling around in a hot city during summer, enjoying shopping and fruity coktails!
It's so summery and solar this fragrance! And happy!

I don't think this suits my style that much but I like it a lot! Maybe I can wear it when I want to feel different...more happy and carefree, pairing it with some of those abstract black and white prints, a colorfull silky top and huge statements earring! Just to play around being someone else for a couple of hours...and while at it go shopping for some good candies, creating bubble with my chewing gum like a child...it could be fun!
You gotta love when perfumes inspire you to such things! It is a testament to their quality and artistry.

Sometimes, when a perfume is particulary well done or enjoyable it sends flashes of color in my head, as if I percive it in color and this time they range from light yellow to ocher to rusty tones of orange and sand, and some green too...very vivid more so then muted or "powdery" colors, the notes present speak true to their essence in this sense.

Performance wasn't the greatest in terms of both lasting and sillage, but it is for the best, had this been more potent I could have not wear it, I have only a 15ml decant but I don't like leaving perfume unused, so it plays in my favor.
Be careful of one thing though...this has to work with your chemistry, on my friend that banana accord (plus the milky parts) turned acid and it smelled like vomit (a bit) so if you can try it first!

EDIT: I heard rumors of a discontinuation but it is available on shop such as Sephora or Lookfanatstic that usually don't sell discontinued ones so I doubt it, it is also sold on the gray market for the standard price so I think it is still in production.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: I absolutely love it! I wore it everyday, especially in the evening during a trip to a greek island! All day with a caftan and sandals.. this smells heavenly, sweet but not over powering, like creamy coconut..At the dry down it is balsamic like i smell insence but not listed! Get your hands on it, i've been told it is discontinued. Well done Chloe.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
I love this perfume. It smells fresh, sweet and summery. But at the same time, there is something soothing and comforting about it that makes it also suitable during colder months.

Above all, the jasmine scent is most prominent. But it is soft and not that strong.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: My favorite for a year now! It smells like a summer day in the Mediterranean, like bottled honey and sunshine.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum by Chloé পারফিউমটি রিলিজের পর থেকেই আমার Wishlist-এ ছিল। তবে আমি Blind Buy করতে চাচ্ছিলাম না। গতবছর মালদ্বীপ এয়ারপোর্টে আমি পারফিউমটি প্রথম ট্রাই করি এবং it was love at first sniff 😍 আর অবশেষে এই বছর আমি পারফিউমটি আমার কালেকশনে add করতে পেরেছি আলহামদুলিল্লাহ।

পারফিউমটি রিলিজের আর্টিকেলে পারফিউমটির নোটগুলো দেখেই আমার মনে হয়েছিল Chloé Nomade Naturelle EDP অনেক সুন্দর এবং এই Lineup-এর অন্য পারফিউমগুলো থেকে একদম আলাদা হবে। Chloé Nomade Naturelle EDP -এর নোটগুলো হচ্ছে:

মূলতঃ Dates‌ ও Vanilla নোটের উপস্থিতি Chloé Nomade Naturelle EDP -কে Nomade লাইনআপের -এর অন্য পারফিউমগুলো থেকে আলাদা করেছে।

পারফিউমটি‌ স্প্রে করার পর সাথে সাথেই মিষ্টি Dates ও ফ্রেশ জুসি Mirabelle Plum -এর স্মেল পাওয়া যায়। এরপর আস্তে আস্তে Jasmine ও Freesia -এর স্মেলের সাথে হালকা Vanilla-এর স্মেল পাওয়া যায়। এখানে ফ্লোরাল নোটগুলো বেশ ফ্রেশ ও soothing যার ফলে পারফিউমটি Summer ও Spring -এ খুবই ভালো লাগে। Sandalwood ও Oakmoss পারফিউমটিতে earthy ও woody একটা vibe এনে দেয়। তবে পারফিউমটির সবচেয়ে noticeable নোটগুলো হচ্ছে Dates, Mirabelle Plum, Jasmine,Vanilla ও Sandalwood. যার কারনে এটি Chloé Nomade লাইনআপের অন্য পারফিউমগুলো থেকে একদম আলাদা একটি নতুন পারফিউম বলে মনে হয়। Brand -টি চাইলে এই পারফিউমটিকে নতুন কোন Bottle -এ একদম নতুন একটি পারফিউম হিসেবে রিলিজ করতে পারতো।

Chloé Nomade Naturelle EDP -এর স্মেল ফ্রেশ ও সুইটের পারফেক্ট ব্যালেন্স। এখানে Mirabelle Plum, Jasmine ও Freesia ফ্রেশনেস এড করেছে আর Dates ও Vanilla সুইটনেস এড করেছে। তাই এটি আমাদের দেশের summer ও spring -এর জন্য পারফেক্ট। বিশেষ করে যারা ফ্রেশ ফ্রুটি ফ্লোরাল কিন্তু মিষ্টি/সুইট পারফিউম পছন্দ করেন তাদের জন্য Chloé Nomade Naturelle EDP পারফেক্ট। অনেকেই এই পারফিউমটি থেকে Coconut-এর স্মেল পায়,তবে আমি পাইনি। আমার কাছে মনে হয়েছে এটির স্মেল ওপেনিং-এ কোন মজার মিষ্টি ফ্রুটি Dessert -এর মত এবং এরপর Jasmine ও অন্যান্য নোটের ব্লেন্ডিং থেকে ফ্রেশ Summer Beach টাইপের ভাইব পাই আমি। এক কথায় অসাধারণ ব্লেন্ডিং!
আমি এই ২০২৩-এ রিলিজ হওয়া Chloé Nomade Jasmine Naturelle Intense ও Chloé Nomade Naturelle EDP পাশাপাশি স্কীন টেস্ট করেছি এবং আমার কাছে ব্যক্তিগতভাবে মনে হয়েছে Chloé Nomade Naturelle EDP বেশি সুন্দর এবং আকর্ষণীয়। এটি আমাদের দেশের আবহাওয়ায় বেশি ভালো পারফর্ম করে। আর এটি একটি Signature Scent Worthy পারফিউম।

পারফিউমটি ব্যবহার করে আমি ৭-৮ ঘন্টার মত longevity পেয়েছি। তবে কাপড়ে স্মেল wash না করা পর্যন্ত ছিল। Chloé Nomade Naturelle EDP -এর প্রোজেকশন মডারেট। সাধারণত প্রথম কয়েক ঘণ্টা একহাত দুরত্ব পর্যন্ত এটি প্রোজেক্ট করে। এরপর আস্তে আস্তে স্কীনসেন্ট হয়ে যায়।

Chloé Nomade Naturelle EDP একটি Inoffensive পারফিউম তাই আপনারা চাইলে এটি Formal,Casual, Romantic সব পরিবেশেই ব্যবহার করতে পারেন। এটি বিশেষ করে আমাদের দেশের আবহাওয়ায় খুব সুন্দর পারফর্ম করে এবং আমি নিজেও বেশ কয়েকবার Chloé Nomade Naturelle EDP ব্যবহার করে Complement পেয়েছি।Chloé Nomade Naturelle EDP আমার মাইগ্রেন ট্রিগার করে না। তাই আশাকরি এটি সবাই ব্যবহার করতে পারবেন।

যারা Summer ও Spring -এ ব্যবহার করার জন্য একটি সুইট ফ্রুটি ফ্লোরাল পারফিউম খুঁজছেন যা অন্যান্য mainstream পারফিউম থেকে একদম আলাদা এবং sophisticated ও attractive তারা Chloé Nomade Naturelle EDP ট্রাই করতে পারেন। আশাকরি আপনাদের খুবই ভালো লাগবে। এছাড়া যারা Jasmine পছন্দ করেন এবং গরমকালে ব্যবহার করার জন্য fresh কিন্তু sweet টাইপের White Floral পারফিউম খুঁজছেন তারাও পারফিউমটি পছন্দ করবেন।

রিভিউ টি ভালো লাগলে কমেন্ট করে জানাবেন। আমি রিভিউটিতে আমার ব্যক্তিগত অভিজ্ঞতা ও মতামত শেয়ার করেছি। আমাদের সবার olfactory system বা ঘ্রাণেন্দ্রিয় একরকম না তাই আমার পছন্দের সাথে আপনার পছন্দ নাও মিলতে পারে।

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
I'm very surprised tuberose is not listed in this one as on me it's straight up bubblegum tuberose.
Super fresh, not too sweet, very likable and pretty.
I'm putting it in my wishlist.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Starts sweet and jasminy. Then comes a blast of...banana?!! This one smells too much tuberose, so its not for me. Tuberose can be tricky for me. But this perfume smells too peculiar and mature. Cloying.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: I first use the Body Shop Wild Argan body butter and then apply this perfume. The smells is cozy and heavenly ☺️

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Had a couple of wear tests and at first I found it to be very refreshing, slightly sweet and a little bit herbal even. Great for summer. But the more I wore it, the sweeter it got to the point it made me nauseated. Also, is it getting discontinued?? I see it less and less in stores and online where I live.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
This is beautiful, it's a sticky sweet jasmine but I don't find it sickly or cloying, or too sharp. The sticky sweetness is from the date note which is almost honey like in texture.
The dry down is beautiful, sweet, soft, vanilla, creamy with a gentle wave of jasmine.
As soon as I tested this I knew it was familiar and nostalgic but I couldn't place where I knew the scent from - it took me several hours to work it out, but it strongly reminds me of Batiste Blush scent of dry shampoo, but far more nuanced and complex. It drove me mad not being able to place it.
But if you enjoy the Batiste Blush scent in the pink bottle, you will probably enjoy this perfume very much! (Bear in mind that the last time I used Batiste was probably in 2007?! They may have changed the scent!)
Edit: I have very recently smelled Narciso Rodriguez Musk Noir on a tester strip and it reminded me of this, they share similar qualities. I've realised it must be the plum note in NR is reminding me of the Mirabelle plum note in here, I didn't realise that this is what plum smells like in perfumery! So it makes sense that this smells more fruity, I just didn't realise that it's a fruity plum note.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
I blind bought this based on hours of research and reading reviews. Absolutely LOVE IT!
It reminds me of a summer night out somewhere in the Mediterranean, close to nature with its sun touched, various trees and flowers, and a gentle sea breeze that brings all the combined scents in the air into one. Jasmine, soft, sweet, feminine and a tiny bit mysterious.
A gem. A little pricey but so worth it.
I am 40+ and very particular with my scents. :-)

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
I really like this perfume, i was however really surprised with the first sniff as it smelled nothing like i expected. To me it smells very woody to me which i don’t mind, it almost smells like miswak (teeth cleaning stick) which i also didn’t mind as it’s a very nostalgic scent.

I will say i’m very disappointed i don’t smell any dates, i used sticky dates body wash from lush and eat dates on the daily so the thought of smelling like a date was very appealing. I still really like the perfume and i’m starting to smell more of the vanilla as i keep trying it. Also i should note it doesn’t really last long on me i sprayed it on last night and didn’t smell it when i woke up, which usually isn’t the case with some of my other perfumes.

That’s all, i do recommend u smell it before buying it, it was a blind buy for me but i got lucky that i liked it. It’s a very unique scent and it may not be everyone’s taste so so smell it first!

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: I get a beachy vibe from it. I think this is more of a summer scent. It is very powerful, 2 sprays were more than enough for me. IMO, It is definitely better than the original. It’s a designer perfume but has niche quality. I don’t quite like oakmoss in the base, but it’s alright. I’ll repurchase!

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
This should have been a separate launch! I fell *hard* in love on the first sniff and bought my bottle after I finished my sample.
For me - it's a smooth jasmine scent with dates playing the "something different" note. It's feminine, gorgeous. I can smell it on the bride. Signature-scent worthy.
Only drawback is the lasting power. Could be a bit better but I don't mind to overspray.
Vibes: spring/summer jasmine, slightly but not sickly sweet, signature-worthy
Form: 2ml sample and 75ml bottle

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
I just confirmed with Chloe (via a boutique here in Los Angeles) that this has been discontinued. I'm so sad. It's such a lovely fragrance.

When I first smelled it last year, near the start of my fragrance journey, I thought it was just another sweet and kind of boring designer perfume. But as my nose has developed, I started to appreciate it more. For me now, it is a comforting blend of warm and sweet and exotic and creamy. I haven't smelled anything quite like it, maybe because of the date note. Speaking of that date note, I compared it with an actual bag of dates and it really does capture the depth and richness of that almost-musty sweetness.

I'm wondering if they just added in a bunch more jasmine and that's what we're getting with the Nomade Jasmin Naturel Intense new release? I really hope they used the same date accord and didn't drown it out with white florals (I love white florals but still). It's the same perfumer so I'm not giving up hope just yet!!

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
The more I wear it, the more I love it. It is a very sophisticated fragrance despite being very sweet. Not juvenile in the slightest, very sophisticated - have I mentioned this already? I would't call it mature, it is very modern but not mainstream. I did not receive compliments for it but I adore it and makes me feel classy and special.

Such a lovely discovery and great blind buy. At first I kinda liked it, then liked it more, then loved it, now I want a bigger bottle. All in a bit more than one week...

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
It’s a really good designer fragrance! Extremely wearable, it gives me warm day at the beach vibes, while eating a juicy, sweet piece of fruit.

The combination of dates and mirabelle plum is gorgeous, one gives the fragrance sweetness, while the other one keeps it juicy and summery.

I also get a bit of an oriental feel, probably because of the dates accord.

But what lives throughout the entire lifespan of this fragrance is its creaminess, which is what transported me to the beach. It’s like you’re enveloped in this luxurious lotion, while enjoying the juicy sweet fruit. I love it!

I also think a solar accord should have been mentioned in the list of accords for this fragrance. Beautiful, I have a feeling I’ll be wearing a lot of this one this summer! Very successful blind buy!

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Now, after a few days of wearing it, i can rightfully tell my opinion. This is a very nice, smooth fragrance, so well done, I've read about some coconutty feel to it and I totally agree. On the edge of being headache inducing but not effectively creating one. I've heard also about it's niche quality. I agree to that also.

Longevity is very good but sillagr is poor. No worries, you ypurself will feel it almost the whole day. I really really like it. I ve got the 30 ml cute little bottle and see if i miss it once it's over. But i seriously thinking about getting a bigger bottle already.

Really good one this Nomade flanker

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
I'm on the fence about this one.
I don't particularly care for the opening which kind of catches in my throat due to the fruity top notes that smell somewhat sticky and over ripe.
About an hour in, the fragrance smooths out and I get that coconutty vanilla smell but even more predominantly, the sandalwood which is generally nice but sometimes gives me whiffs of something a tiny bit fusty or unclean.
On the whole though this is a soft, gentle and pleasing fragrance.
I don't think however that I like it enough to consider upgrading my mini to a full bottle - that is, unless my opinion changes drastically with further wear.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
It's one of my sweetest and the most intriguing fragrances at the same time.
Although I don't like vanilla perfume this one is special. It's more like dates/honey/coconut vibe with a decent amount of incense in it. Love!
This fragrance has a holiday vibe, the name "Nomade" suits it. It feels like being in an oasis somwhere on the desert. There are palm trees, dates, but on the skin you can also feel the earthy smell of adventure and "everything that can happen on the journey into unknown".
Don't hesitate to try, even if you're not a fan of a Chloe brand and sweetnes in parfumes.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Very nice addition to my collection. I've hesitated for an year to blind buy it but i finally did.I smelled the intense version and I found it weigh too sweet but this one is fresher, more uplifting and more airy. Lovely! And different from everything that I own. I can't wait to wear it and see how it feels in the air the whole day but yeap..i'm happy i got it eventually

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: This is absolutely divine! This is a special fragrance. It’s an original among my collection, although I can get hints and whiffs of bubblegum sweetness much like BDK rouge smoking. Not sure which notes are bringing about the similarities. This is a top 10 for life.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
THIS SMELLS DIVINE! I blind bought a 75ml bottle after hearing that it smells like a niche perfume.

Love the bottle, first of all. The juice, tbh, at first I wasn't too crazy about. It smells very similar to those scented crayons we used to have when we were children. If you're in your late 20s, 30s, you'll know what I'm referring to. After using it for a couple weeks, yes, it still smells like scented crayons, BUT in the best way possible.

The fragrance smells warm and sweet and very floral. It is youthful, but not juvenile in the slightest. I cannot smell any fruitiness others were talking about, to me, it's straight up heavily floral, sweet, smooth and feminine but not at all fruity. It smells really natural, in a way doesn't smell like a perfume but some kind of extract from flowers. It doesn't smell like anything I have ever smelled before (but the crayons I swear) and I love that for me. But absolutely not a safe blind buy. I feel like people will either really love it, or really hate it. It doesn't smell like a designer perfume. I guess I love it simply for its uniqueness. Like, if people know this scent, they can tell that you're wearing it right away. It has the potential to be someone's signature scent.

Now, the downside. This perfume is pretty much linear, meaning it doesn't have layers. To my nose, all layers smell very similar. You can still tell there are some differences, but defo not clear. The date and jasmine notes are very prominent, and they are there throughout the whole experience. If you want your perfume to have many distinctive notes, this one isn't for you. But sometimes I want a perfume that just simply smells like one note throughout, and this one is that.

Despite being linear, this perfume is far from being boring, as the scent is interesting enough to enjoy the whole day. Oh yes, it lasts the whole day. You will need to spray a little more heavily compared to other designer EDPs though. But it's stronger than the usual EDTs. I spray around 10 times whenever I use it, which is the same with how I usually spray my EDTs. It projects but nothing too crazy, which I love. It can be a bit coying if you overspray and are in a small space since the scent is warm, but I don't find it heady or sneeze inducing like most other designer perfumes. Defo a scent for daytime, in spring or summer.

I usually love perfumes for how they make me feel. This one makes me feel like the prettiest, most unobtainable person in the room. It is office-friendly, again, if the office isn't too small and packed. It is a good date night scent as well I feel like, although I wouldn't personally wear it on dates because as I said, it smells like someone who's pretty and elegant, but so expensive she's unobtainable. Imagine a princess.

Overall solid 8.5/10. Worth the try and honestly, if you collect perfumes, this is worth blind buying as you probably haven't had anything like it in your collection.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Deep vanilla with dates and a hint of fruitiness plus a tinge of green notes but to my nose has a coconut type of whiff as well which it does not have in its blend.
It's very soft and very wearable but it seems to be a fragrance that should have stood alone and not put with the Nomade line. It has reasonable staying power about 6 hours and is very pretty for day wear mostly. It isn't majestic enough to hold a place as a night wear fragrance.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
I tested this on paper at the store, and also got a freebie sample. On paper it's quite strong, the jasmine is very prominent. On my skin, it opens up very jasmine-y but it's a sweet, vanillic jasmine which then kind of blends into a cozy, comforting, sweet, but not cloying scent. I do get a bit of a beachy vibe, but to me it's more of a "summer afternoon when the breeze carries the smell of the blooming flowers and you're dozing off at the porch" type of scent.

Unfortunately, even though I still smell a faint vanilla on my wrist after 10 hours if I bury my nose in it, the sillage is pretty intimate and I only get whiffs of it the first couple or hours.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
A slightly sour and sweeter take on the original Nomade. I really like the OG and I like this one as well.

This one smells brighter than the OG and it doesn't have this light masculine vibe that the original OG has. It still has that elegant quality imo. You also get that vegetal touch that's so characteristic to the OG, but it feels less prominent in Naturelle.

On my skin, I don't get much vanilla. Tbh, the scent's longevity is not as good as the OG Nomade, which lasts quite a long time.

Might be better on hot days, I fee like this is too underwhelming for winter.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Had high hopes on this based on what I had read. At first spray I was like...wait a minute. I liked it, but didn't love it. I was a bit underwhelmed.

Then, I tried it out again a few weeks later and oh my god. I get it now. I am so in love! It is unique in the best way possible. The woody notes mixed with the ultra-feminine sweetness reminds me of some kind of forest goddess.

On my skin it actually has very good lasting power. The sillage is ok.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Love at first spray. The dry down is awful on me.
Sample first.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
I’m so sad. I thought I would love this perfume.

On a card, this scent was light and pretty. Multi-dimensional and interesting.

On my skin, I got nothing but the faint smell of celery leaves.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Oh what an exquisite natural-origins fragrance! Like a soft sigh of jasmine and ylang-ylang combined with other soft florals and a tropical feel, this is gentle femininity and innocence in a solar semi-transparent scent that lingers like a lover's kiss on your skin. For when you enjoy soft scents, without any artificial feeling whatsoever, this fragrance, unlike the other Nomades, perfectly matches the mood of an early summer morning in the park. Wear with pleasure to work, to play, and to sleep: it's comforting, refreshing and is unlikely to bother anyone if sprayed lightly, even if you work as a nurse.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Do you love to smell amazing in a definitively feminine way- soft, vanillic, sweet but not cloyingly so? Yes? This is the perfume for you. Do you want to smell distinct from people in your surroundings? Yes? This is the perfume for you. Do you already have other Chloe Nomade flankers and are wondering if this is different enough to buy? Yes, it is. My take? Given that there’s only so many hours in the day to wear a fragrance and there are sooooo many beautiful perfumes out there, this gem is worth a spot in your life.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Lovely warm vanilla and dried fruits with a dash of wood. This is distinctly different from the other Nomades. Chloe Nomade EDP Naturelle is not a chypre but instead a sweet floral Oriental. I like the other Nomades but I also like this which is much more causal and easy going. I don't detect oakmoss here, only some mild woods.

I wouldn't say I smell dates not being exactly sure of the smell of dates. On me the initial fruity quality strikes me as apricots or even prunes (dried plums). Once it dries down it's heavily vanillic. I don't really get the tropical, suntan lotion vibes others are getting but maybe I'm still recovering from COVID.

I think this is a cozy and joyous scent. Very warm, very sweet and very vanillic. Longevity and sillage seem moderate. I think any age can wear this, it's not overly teenager sweet. Overall it isn't unusual; it's pretty basic and mainstream, but it's well done and actually smells a bit more natural as opposed to synthetic (yes, I know everything is actually synthetic, but sometimes things smell more realistic/natural). This is a blind buy I'm not mad about! I like it a lot.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: It’s a good scent, powerful with a good projection and longevity. It smells sweet dates, and to me it’s a bit headache inducing. I like the smell but cannot wear it myself because it becomed sickening sweet after some time. Not a safe blind buy.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: The date and vanilla combo is smoothly blended in a way that creates the illusion of smelling a tiare pudding. It envelops you in a cosy way all while maintaining sweet and creamy floral qualities. This is an elegant holiday scent but you can definitely use it year round.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: trying a sample of this i received complimentary with another purchase. super fruity, sugary, and sweet. it’s nice and what i think of as traditionally “girly” but kind of undescript. i also think this iteration of dates is throwing me off a bit. i will say it’s better at the dry down (once some of the sugar fades/tones down). overall, pretty, but not my jam.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Extremely sweet

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Wow. I am impressed.
I loved the original Nomade, but I could detect chemicals in it that deterred me from wanting it.
This one however is the perfect Nomade.
Feminine, pleasant, joy-inducing.
I loved my sample so much that on my to-buy it goes.
Thanks for this change Chloe.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Sampled this in store. To me it smelled like dried dates/figs with a vanilla base.
Its dense and sweet. Even a bit musky. The drydown smells a bit like a mans cologne.

I would describe this as a warm dense date/fig fragrance. I don't think this is a good summer scent nor so good for office.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Apricots. Sweet apricots under the beach sun with vanilla and woody base. Two hours on my skin and that's it, unfortunately. Gives such a happy vacation vibe.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: From all of the Nomades, this one is my favorite. Perfect combination of sweet, woody, and just something out of the ordinary. Stands out among all the other modern scents. Strong and long lasting. Definitely worth the money!

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Really unique scent, fruity but fresh, powdery hut not boring!I regret I didn’t buy it a duty free when I got a chance :( the prices online are more expensive, but I am hopeful I will get it later🙆🏻♀️

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Purely from the description of the fragrance, "Nomade Naturelle" sounds like a fragrance that I should like.Date and vanilla is amazing combo.The emphasis here is on "should".
Sweet, fruity, sour and it is accompanied by a vanilla sweetness. It's sweeter than you might expect - candied. It's also fairly linear, getting slightly creamy after an hour but never changing too much.The fruity and sour note remains throughout the fragrance.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Don't blind buy it! I am glad I've ordered a sample first, it's a sweet, creamy scent, got this beachy vibe, just a bit sickly though, completely different to the other Nomade flankers. It's a no from me...

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: My grandmother would like it for sure. It's the kind of fragrance she used to wear. And I know why I don't like it so much: Vanilla. Strong Vanilla 😑

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: When I first tried this I loved it. Its unusual and opens with a sour citrus bergamot mixed with sugary dates. The jasmine and sandlewood combo with vanilla is gorgeous and really addictive. However, on my skin it quickly becomes a skin scent and the dry down is a bit dull. I wish the opening lasted longer. I'll give this another go in the summer and see how it performs then 👍

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
An absolute pass for me. It's almost gourmand with some flower notes, it smells like cake (i am not a fan of vanilla, especially when it's that prominent). I understand shy someone would like this however, it's warm and sophisticated.
I sprayed before leaving for work in the morning it almost gave me a headache (sweet perfumes can do that to me) but it smoothed out after 30 min.
I get vanilla, dates and a liiittle bit of jasmin. I would love to smell this combined with some leathery notes.

If it was a girl, she would have long hair, lots of brown items in her closet, a love for 90s fashion and music. Coffee addict, definitely the leader of her friend group loves Saturday morning walks in the city, where she gets to showcase her sunglasses collection.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Predominant note is Egyptian Jasmine, Im surprised that people have voted dates as the predominant note. Anyway, I love it, super orgasmic. Makes me smile all day. A great sweety scent that actually projects beautifully in a hot climate. Its like Narciso Ambree but sweeter, projects stronger and lasts longer.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Incredible how I absolutely…. Smell …. Zero.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: I'm not fond of the original version, and find this rendition glorious. A little bit like Bronze Goddess that I also enjoy, and very faraway from the og. I'd call it a monoi scent.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Really disappointed, I really like the original edt and edp but this has no connection to those at all. Horribly sweet with a vaguely sour undercurrent, I want to wash it off :(

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
I am so in love with this unusual scent! Initially, I was very indifferent, but was rebounding with this fragrance. I started wearing it in September, it is such a lovely cosy scent for early Autumn!

It is powdery, sweet from the dates, the plum is not sour. I do not detect any vanilla. It does remind me of Bronze Goddess - it must be the creaminess of sandalwood. Overall it is soft, smooth and well rounded. An exceptional scent for a designer perfume.

I'll keep on wearing it before I can smell it on everyone!

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: I was quite surprised that I liked it because I'm not into sweet perfumes. So, this is a sweet perfume, the sweetness coming mostly from the dates but it's not sticky sweet. After half an hour or an hour the perfume gets creamy, Jasmine starts to show and after a while it becomes a very nice and creamy sandalwood perfume. I think it's quite original, the quality is very good and it is a very likeable perfume the projection is moderate. I wouldn't say that it's very close to other nomade perfumes, for me the only connection is the mirabelle and maybe some moss. I have read somewhere that it smells like a expensive sunscreen I could related although it does have more depth and interesting facets. I recommend!

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
This perfume should have had its own name.

(FOR ME:) Mirabelle (yellow plum) is a sour plum; Freesia is a white flower that is fresh and has some citrusy notes. These two blend well with citruses and aquatic notes in Nomade eau de toilette. Nomade Naturelle is a different kind of Nomade.

This one does not have this sour-citrus-fresh vibe. It's a yummy gourmand perfume with a lot of sweetness from A to Z. This sweetness can be tricky though and it had many nuances within 2 hours just on my skin:
- dates,
- coconut (very distant, but not like sunscreen for me),
- sugared dried papaya
- sugared dried purple plums (naturally very sweet plums vs sour mirabelle)
- sugared chestnuts towards the dry down.

Dina France

Chestnuts, Sandalwood and Vanilla sound like a simplified version of Noir Exquis. Overall, great value for the price!

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
To me this it's the fall/vinter version of Nomade.
The Nomade Naturelle is not similar to the original Nomade, this is sweet, cosy, warm and not as earthy as the OG.
I get a warm, sweet and spicy vanilla with dates and i really enjoy it.
Can't wait to put on a big cozy cardigan, doze myself in this and snuggle down to a movie when the weather turns colder.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Not mass appealing at all, and that’s why I love it. It’s special.
I imagine this would be the scent of an oasis in the desert.
When o first try it on the store it last all day long, after I got the bottle I don’t feel the same lasting power, but that’s maybe because my nose got familiar.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: To be honest, I'm not big fan of this new version of Nomade. To me, this frangrance smells more like a luxury sunscreen - so I can imagine pulling it off on holiday, somewhere by sea, but not on other occassions. It's not bad, but nothing breathtaking or memorable. It's definitely more sweeter than the original EdP, so I'm sure that plenty of people will like Naturelle more over other releases from this line. And good for them. :)

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: My experience with this fragrance (tried twice) is very different for the ones mentoined in the other reviews. skin chemestry tricks, I assume . As far as I like Nomade absolou with its cyphre ispired dark earthness, this one is a big no for me. I am able to smell only the sweet - too much sweet - fruity in the opening. Stop.
