I grow tired and slightly sickened after the first istants and the fragrance didn't evolve at all after this.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: This is adorable. It smells fun and carefree and has that "last days of Summer" vibe. The date note is sweet yet soft. I find it is a very balanced and round fragrance. Longevity is not great, not on my skin at least but I think I'll purchase a small bottle in the future.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: I absolutely love the way this smells, but it doesn’t last at all. Maybe and hour. I don’t even notice a lingering scent on my skin.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: The opening is a bit too sweet and too synthetic for me. But that quickly disappears and a very warm sweet vanilla with dates notes start to develop. It’s a really cozy scent, with a hint of jasmine and spices. I would wear it during the autumn 😍

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Beautiful, although very unexpected. I have expected a similar scent to the OG, but lighter, something closer to the EDT, but this is totally different. It could be branded as its own separate perfume.

Very summery, "solar" type of a fragrance. It starts very yummy, sweet and fruity, and dries down into intoxicating, warm florals. Without reading the notes, I would have bet that it has ylang-ylang in the heart, but the warmness must come from the sandalwood. I don't smell the oakmoss. It's very tropical, an amazing choice for summer.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
I tried so hard to love this one because I'm huge OG nomade fan and I adore dates but this is definitely my least favourite of the line. I gave it a proper time to reveal its self as usually I end up loving most of my blind buys but it has been months and the more I wear it the less I like it, the opening is too sharp and synthetic for a natural fragrance and the dry down although quite nice but boring and generic. It has a moderate lasting power and weak sillage and I have never received a single compliment on it. Blind buy fail.

Edit: maceration magic happened again, I don't get anymore the harsh synthetic opening, the scent is much smoother and addictive although I get mainly jasmine and not at all date (at least not the one cultivated in my country) and the dry down is really lovely, summer holidays in bottle. I like it a lot.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: This is so stunning!! I blind bought this as I knew I would love it, I currently use the absolute version and love the earthy sweetness but I love this one even more it's been what I was looking for many years. I mature grown up earthy semi sweet creamy warmed up sunlotion skin but without coconut, smells like the hot air in the dessert/ abroad walking through the streets, hot tarmac and the beach sand blowing in the air it's simply gorgeous!! Have just bought a 75ml and hope they never discontinue! The lasting power is around 4/5 hour mark longer on clothes it's beautiful lovely date and vanilla earthy notes it's not overly girly which I love please no one else get this I need it for myself 🤣😁

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: This is actually kinda gross? Smells like burning woods in the opening. I'm guessing that is the sandalwood. It comes across very smoky. The dry down is slightly more tolerable as the sweetness of the vanilla and florals push through. It is long-lasting (5+ hrs), albeit with poor projection. Alas, back to the store this goes. Do not blind buy!

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
-I can't tell what Naturelle aspires to be. It's one messy blend with no direction.
-There's a fresh sweet-sour opening. It dries down to reveal coconut notes.
-Is it supposed to be summery? I much prefer the Chloe Nomade original... (-)

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
I want to bathe in it !!!!
And I can cuz unfortunately…..no projection or lasting power.
Almost zero 😔😔😔😔

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Absolutely amazing, and just about the only perfume with sandalwood, I can stand nowadays, simply because I can't smell that particular note in there. Thank God 😁 Gorgeous!, feminine, alluring jasmine, juicy mirabelle, siruppy dates, smooth, warm, sensual vanilla and a touch of oakmoss to add some depth and uniqueness to this beauty. I simply can't get enough of this scent. It makes me feel so good wearing this. I have to reapply a couple of times during the day, but I'll do that without complaining because from top to base, this is an absolute joy. A new favorite 💕

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
This is addictive!! I especially love the sweet woody aspect, it's truly intoxicating and it makes me want to sniff my wrist every 5 seconds 😆. I have never cared for the original but this one and the absolu are amazing❣
This is my favourite of the two and it is now in my top five 💗 Can't recommend this enough!

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Love it, and love the date note. It's a comforting summery smell, something between a summer tiaré and a woody oriental.
It reminds me of the smell of the Mamounia Marrakech, it's a signature home scent that you can buy when visiting (I use it as a bedroom scent). They have in common one ingredient: the date.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
I adore Nomade Naturelle.
That sweet nuance, unexpected from a Nomade, is the detail that I like the most.
Seemingly elusive. Instead it may surprise you when at the end of the day you find its trace for a quick sniff on your wrist. It is still there, warm and comforting.
This creation makes me dream of a thousand and one nights of muffled opulence, the tinkling sparkle of warm breeze caressing the face.
Subtle, tactile and soft elegance. Infinite sophisticated sweetness, like the unique and unmistakable flavor of the first warm summer evenings, as the sun goes down.
Gorgeous.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Dear @Daebrack, it’s my thought that everyone, each of us deserves to wear any perfume. It is a pure heart that makes every earthly difference, and this makes a person deserving to wear the most sublime of essences.
So indulge yourself with this treat you desire and that you certainly earned, if you love its aroma, awesome and from the Arabian Nights.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: This fragrance is the feeling of luxury in a bottle. It smells like the rich ladies in the chique boutiques you go to when you need a fancy dress for occasions like prom or a wedding. Those stores where the salesladies are honest and genuinely helpful, and costumers seem to have their shit together. I feel like I don't deserve to wear this one yet, like I need to earn it.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
This may not be a very valuable review, but I figure when there is something new on the market, any comment might be useful at that point. I am also not very familiar with the rest of Nomade range. I have tested the first from the range, was left completely indifferent and never returned to it by now. I admit, I was now intrigued by the "natural ingredients" and decided to test it on my wrist and spend a day with it.
So once again I don't care very much for the scent, there is something sweet and woody like a coconut or a fig (tree), that I should have liked more. I wouldn't invest in it for the very fragrance, but I am honestly amazed how long it stayed with me yesterday. I left my home in the morning with my "Croisiere" J'adore, In Joy, which felt like a perfect pick for the hot day at the seaside. Only it has left my side completely by the time I visited the perfume shop where I tested this Nomade (some 3h later). However, Nomade stayed with me by the rest of the day and afternoon, and I certainly have not expected it from Naturelle, the fragrance marketed and named for the high rate of natural raw material. It doesn't even smell particularly natural to me, it has a certain car freshener type of choking sweetness. I actually prefer D&G Light Blue Sun, the limited edition from the popular line, which has a distinctive coconut-sweet, subdued beach vibe. I kind of put these kind of fragrances in the same box, but admittedly Nomade Naturelle beats it in terms of longevity by far. Maybe if I haven't had already the Light Blue Sun and Guerlain's Limon Verde, I would have considered N. Naturelle.
I'm gonna pass it though, but I highly recommend it just for the sake of its resilient presence, even in hot climates. I should point out that it stays close to the skin, but stubbornly so.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Without reading any reviews or notes my impression was sweet creamy intoxicating jasmine, vanilla and coconut. Like a very high end sun product that smells familiar yet not mainstream. I see I am not the only one. Absolutely addictive and performs well on me. Very far from the other Nomades, this is not a Chypre but a floral gourmand. I’m surprised dates and mirabelle are listed, did not get mirabelle like in the others.

Love at first sniff because of the quality and scent and definitely high on my wishlist!

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Intoxicating.
Addictive.
Do not buy this, you may be enchanted by its sorcery. You may spray just for that next fix. That high becomes all you can think about. If you want to be high then yes go ahead sniff at your own peril.
But, Seriously this is something else.
A Unique potion 🧪
It makes me nostalgic for something and takes me to a time and place I can’t remember.
It reminds of something so potently, but what?
It does that something to me.
This is bewitching stuff.
I think I’m in love.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Bought for my girlfriend. I love it love it love it! The opening is okay, the dry down OMG!!!! I couldn't stop sniffing on the tester paper and I kept it for more than 10 hrs.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
To be honest I am not huge fan of original Chloe Nomade, but when I received sample of the Naturelle I couldn’t stop smelling my wrists. Their is something so addicting to this fragrance, I knew I needed a bottle. The Jasmine is so creamy with soft sandalwood. I can’t detect specific note of dates but the whole fragrance is very well put together. It dries down to a soft, pretty, addicting, woody vanilla while that Jasmine note still lingering on the skin giving that sun warmed up lotion leathered skin but better. After some hours on my skin, the vanilla was pulling the most and reminded me a lot of Van Cleef & Arpels Orchidee Vanille but only at deepdry down.
If you were not into original Chloe Nomade, please don’t pass on this one, give it a try.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Love at first sniff a month ago. Now the weather is beginning to be warmer here in The Netherlands, I find it to be to full/powdery. Tried to top it of with Ralph Lauren Ralph (the 2000 blue one) to freshen it up. This combination turns out to be heaven

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: I don’t like any of the other Nomades. It leans too masculine for my taste. This could easily pass as Unisex in my opinion. Smells somewhat similar to Replica Whispers in the Library if you concentrate on the vanilla and woody notes. I like it. Add to wish list.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Bought it 30 seconds after I sniffed it for the first time. It's been a few continuous days of wearing it now, and my opinion hasn't changed. It's a lovely, warm, and kind of outdoorsy adventurous scent. I smell a lot of honey, some wide open air, and that teensiest hint of a woodworker in his atelier who has long hair and his shirt off lol. It's that heavenly slightly sporty, slightly woodsy scent that is just amazing. It makes me want to jump on a horse and gallop away across a beach with my hair flowing dramatically in the wind. The sillage is great, and longevity is surprisingly good, especially for a Chloé fragrance. Strong contender to become one of my favourites.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: This is absolutely gorgeous - the date makes it special and gives a warm, cozy vibe. But since it is a natural fragrance, it does go down to a skin scent after about 2 hours. But it is good enough that I don’t mind reapplying. A total love.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
I am a huge Nomade fan but I have to admit that this release let me down.

The scent is not bad in any way. It felt like a very nice tropical floral for summer but there are so many better picks for this category out there. The lasting power on my skin was also less than 2 hours which for this price is just not worth it. It lacks the oomph and uniqueness the original has.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
I love this on paper, when I smelled it I was sure this was a good candidate for being my signature scent. Unfortunately, the lovely scent just disappears on my skin in less than 1h. I had to really sniff my nose to my arm in other to smell anything, which I would not mind, but the smell left there was not good or similar to the one on paper.
I'm not sure if I have to overspray this one, I'll test one more time next time I go to the store.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
I went to the Chloe stall to finally get my hands on the Vanilla Planifolia from their collab with Atelier des Fleurs and the lady at the counter gave me a sample of this. All I can say is, I love my perfumes but I have never in my life been so awestruck by a perfume like I did with this. It was love at first smell.

After purchasing this, I sprayed it on myself and actually teared up! I was so emotional. Even my sister can’t stop smelling it. She calls it a “kind scent.”

I saw a comment on here that said they got banana from the first opening and I totally agree! Though my initial impression was of mango.

The only thing though is that I don’t think it lasts very long :( It probably has to do with the fact that it is a *natural* perfume. It does last longer on clothing but disappears within an hour on the skin. The sillage is incredible for about an hour, and it’s definitely a smell that makes itself very present even with masks on (I’m from Hong Kong and we still all have to wear masks 24/7)

Edit: This scent completely transforms in humid weather. It smells so strongly of bourbon, which is a scent I'm very fond of!!

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Wow! Tested this today and it’s beautiful!

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: I really like the mirabelle note in this and it smells sweet, playful and approachable. I think the date is an interesting touch as well. I can smell some floral, but to me it smells more fruity than floral. There is also something that feels slightly powdery but in a good way, I'm not sure what it is but I like it. It's a more unique scent out of the ones by Chloe that I smelled. I like this more than the original Nomade. The original smelled a bit sour in comparison.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: This is crazy well blended, love it!

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Does anyone else get banana in the opening ?

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Got a sample of this a couple of days ago. The best way to describe it is as warm and cosy but at the same time I get this sunlotion and tropical summer in Spain vibe. It's sweet and you definitely get the date and vanilla but it almost smell like coconut after a while. I absolutely love this as it reminds me of walking through the streets of Malaga Spain while wearing sunlotion and smelling the sweetness from all the nougat shops! I think this will be a good fragrance for winter (cozy) and summer!

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Yes its different from the other perfumes in the nomade line, but it still suits the theme. If I imagine mulan wearing the other nomades this would be a perfume for Jasmine in Aladdin. Compared to nomade absolu this one is definitely warmer, sweeter and more feminine on my skin. Would be a beautiful spring/summer wedding perfume. On me I get jasmine sweetened with a touch of sun warm fresh dates!

Except from Jasmine in Aladdin I also imagine that Missandei in game of thrones would smell like this.

Edit: now after standing on my shelf for a while this smells quite different. Opening is the same - magical and unique sweetness of the dates and jasmine. However after that it dries down quite woody quickly! I like woody perfumes so really don’t mind but I believe that’s the reason people find it quite unisex

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: I think this perfume is absolutely beautiful. It would work just as well on men as on women. It's sexy!! I imagine people with tanned skin and dark hair when I smell this. It's natural smelling with good sillage and longevity. It's sweet, warm, kind of "tropical" and powdery. It's like a summery scent without coconut or tiare. Amazing.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: This is coming across masculine because of the spicy aspect. It's also minty and I don't know why. Is it the sandalwood or jasmine? Reminds me of a diluted mouthwash or gentle toothpaste. If you're a guy and like sweet & spicy fragrances, give this a try.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Oh, my, second time testing this today in Sephora and definitely made it to the top of my wishlist! Very natural, reminds me a lot of NR Musc Noir, but with better performance overall! I would expect for a natural fragrance to not leave a trace but this certainly does. Feminine and airy, love it!

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Holy vaches au pâturages naturelles! This hit online discounters quickly! I smelled it and liked it a month ago when it first hit the shelves, but reasoned I might pop for it when the price comes down. Well today the 75ml popped up in Europe for a song. Well, still 70 bucks but not 140! Swiss High Street pricing! I don't think it's worth 70, but I like it!

It reminds me of Colonia Futura Acqua di Parma which is also natural molecules. Doesn't smell the same, but it's obviously "natural" smelling, cheerful and energetic. That also means they both somewhat remind me of homemade hippy dippy good smelling bug spray or room spray. This is gritty and not "French style" perfumery, alas. I think the Italians do this a bit better. The only thing not to like is the price, as this would be a delight at 15 bucks in a brown glass apothecary bottle.

Nose Caroline Dumur did Pure XS Night which is a gorgeous fragrance though I don't wear it simply because I have too many already.

1) I would like some mainstream upscale house to do a "naturelle" with non IFRA molecules and some real oomph, though I realise it's only a pipe dream, now.

2) It somewhat irks me that upscale and luxury products are wading into "natural" perfumery commodities, yet I can't buy a 20 buck barbershop or fougere that is 100% natural. Am I the only one? I'm thankful for Chloe's gesture, nevertheless. Sorry not sorry, I expect to smell this in Saint-Tropez and other watering holes filled with riche bobos. But of course I DO like the fragrance.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Next to Bronze Goddess or Monoi it’s not the same yet that is the feeling I get. Coconut, Tiare holiday vacation. Yet I also get warm cozy blanket. How is this possible?? I can see myself wearing this year round.

I literally could spray myself from head to toe. I cannot get enough of this fragrance. It’s the only thing I want to smell🥰

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: @PippiStitches, It is not vegan, they are testing on animals.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
This is heaven ! I love this natural beautiful feminine vegan scent ! The best one for winter time !!!!!!!!
Tame Impala - Instant Destiny, This song goes well with the vibe of this scent, if you are curious!

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: As mentioned below, I get the same “suede“ note as I get from Narciso Rodriguez Musc Noir. Its only in the very dry down I get this comparison - but the perfume lasts for an eternity so you'll get that same suede vibe for quite some time. I much prefer this to Soleil Blanc cause I smell something screechy in SB. This one is like summery, but not beach kinda.. it's more like the sun and the sand in the desert. The campaign for the original nomade suit this version much better than the original, which is much more oak mossy, while this one is so natural sweet (not sugary, sweet from the dates and mirabelle plum). I really love this one, it's so worth a visit! Just keep in mind that this one does not smell like the rest of the line, it's something summery and new. It would still use it in spring and fall though, that's just how lovely it smells.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
I really don’t get any of the above comparisons with Chloe naturelle.. It’s not even close to Terracotta, Soleil Blanc or Monoi!

I do get a suede note which is not listed but it’s the same as in Musc noir. It also has this sparkly opening as MN but Chloe has this grainy feel together with the sparkly opening. After the sparkly opening the notes mingel together and it becomes quite linear from that point on.

It’s a nice fragrance but they should have brought it out as a new stand alone fragrance and not flanker Imo.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
This is very different from the other Nomades. I don't understand why brands create a flanker when it has nothing in common with the original...(I guess the answer is to save cost and capitalize on something that works well - still, not really satisfying for the customer)
The smell: the date accord is strong in the opening, then the florals take over. I dont get a distinctive floral note as it is well blended. Overall it gives an exotic, even tropical vibe bordering beachy. Definitely not what I have expected.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: I tried this and on my skin and I quite liked it. This is a very powdery and sweet scent on me, also it's quite different from the original Nomade . As far as performance goes this is great 8+ hours, with moderate sillage for about 5 hours. This is a nice perfume if you enjoy sweet powdery scents

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: I agree with SailorV. First of all, Nomade Naturelle doesn't smell anything like other Nomades. I sense a creamy, coconutty natural jasmine and some sweetness or a bubblegummy tuberose. Reminds me of Mancera Velvet Vanilla, Guerlain Terracotta, Yves Rocher Monoi. And it's Nomade Naturelle I like the most. Sometimes white flowers have that indolic note which I can't stand. Luckily, It's not present here. It's also quite fresh and a little bit airy. Now in the Winter Nomade Naturelle is great and I think in the Summer it's going to be even better.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
This has nothing in common with the other Nomades, but I still find it quite fitting for the name and the wanderlust image of this line. This scent reminds me of sun and sands, beaches and exotic flowers.

I don't know how what the requirements to sell a perfume as "100% natural origin" are, but I do think this smells like something made with natural oils, blended in a smooth, designer-ish way. The jasmine has an especially oily feel to it, it has a bit of a monoi vibe (even though it doesn't smell like tiare) mixed with bubblegummy white floral sweetness. I definitely get some fruity tones, but as fruit notes can't be extracted naturally, I think this must mostly come from the jasmine. Chloe calls it a "date accord" on their website, so they don't pretend they used some precious essence extracted directly from dates. I can also clearly smell a woodsy note, but I don't find it pronouncedly sandalwoody. That's the dry part of the scent that conjures images of desert sand dunes in my mind.
In the drydown the vanilla really comes out and warms everything up. At this point I understand the user below who just wrote "cinnamon banana" as the whole review, it does kind of smell like that... In a perfumey, not-so-edible way though.

All in all this is a nice scent and I might retry it when it's warmer, as I think this is essentially a summery, beachy floral with a warmer vanilla base.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: If you like Poison by Dior, will probably like it.This perfume has nothing in common with the previous ones.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: It's a sweet synthetic mess. Easily forgotten and it doesn't hold a candle to EDP and absolu.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: If you like Kilian`s -Moonlight in Heaven, you`ll like this.Same vibe, not as complex and sweet, very light and airy summer perfume. Moonlight in Heaven doesnt last long on me wither and doesnt project much, this is very similar at a fraction of the price

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Nomade Naturelle has nothing in common with Vanilla Fields or Orchid Soleil. It is sweet and fruity by combining notes of dates and mirabelles, but not gourmand. Basically, the sandalwood feels very good in the dry down, so the perfume becomes a woody fruit fragrance with a hint of vanilla and oakmoss. The name seems well chosen and suitable for the perfume and what it represents. Flower power, boho style ...
Its a fragrance of free spirits, close to nature.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: I was so happy for the new release and I have already tested it three times and .... no, I will stick with edp. Original nomade edp has character and I am not bored with it even after few years of usage, I did not love Nomade from the first sniff, so I tried this new flanker 3 times. I expected that it will be a purchase for me, but not. Too sweet in an annoying way and smells syntetic.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: this is the scent of vanilla fields (coty) perfume.. I've been looking for a replacement for so long and here it is! happy...

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Delightful, sweet and very long-lasting perfume. I love it!

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
Just tested it in a shop today. It's cold here in Europe and the scent is cozy and warm. I can smell some milky/creamy notes together with dates which is pretty nice. I have both edp & edt and this one smells different. It's kind of similar somehow but not a flanker in my opinion. Fruity notes come first, then white flowers with sweet undertones as the fragrance evolves. Vanilla is like a soft cloud, the silage is pretty decent, projection good and I had just 2 sprays. I have a tester so will give it a proper day long test to see if it's worth a full bottle. For now it's a strong like leaning to love 😊
Edit: it's a love, just bought 75 ml bottle 😊

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content:
I like the previous Nomades (edt, edp, absolue) but somehow they don’t smell pleasant on me. Maybe the oakmoss?
Anyway, I tried the new Nomade naturelle in store today. And wow, this is a surprise! It smells nothing like its predecessors. Why they called it Nomade is a mystery to me. It’s quite sweet and tropical, like creamy coconut? Very girlie at the start. After 2 hours a faint woody accord comes through, making it more interesting. But it stays sweet and tropical. Don’t know what to think of it.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: cinnamon banana

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Can’t wait to try this! I get more compliments on Chloe Nomade EDP than on any perfume I’ve ever worn. It’s unbelievable. People smell it on me all day but I only wish I could smell it better on myself.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: Oh the irony of Naturelle being in the name, with Oakmoss listed as a note. Nice try IFRA.

product_name: Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum Chloé
review_content: I was intrigued when i read the date note especially because I live in a town where we have the best type of dates and both my mom's and dad's sides cultivates them, I immediately went to my fridge grabbed some dates and sniffed them , I think they gonna add some dry sweetness and maybe an earthy note. Can't wait to smell it i have nomade edp and i love it somuch 😍
Smells like my grandma

Your typical floral scent, with a touch of greeny scent (like a leaf). I dont smell any fruity note here. Just straight floral. Not really my fav, but it's a mass pleasing scent. I wear this to the office as the scent is inoffensive to the crowds.

Have had this bottle in storage for years. Tried it on this week and remembered why I haven't used it. It stays on incredibly well taking into consideration that it's a edt. That of course would be perfect, if it didn't give me a horrible headache 😣. Had to immediately wash every fabric I touched while wearing this because the scent seemed to linger and follow me everywhere 🫣
It’s me again: DOES ANYONE SELL THIS 2009 VERSION? pls msg me then…i‘m on a desperate search
I appreciate this scent, I tried a mini that comes with a larger edp bottle. It has the perfect balance of being youthful and sophisticated.

One of my wife's Favorite Perfume as she says she has Memories attached to this Perfume.

Strong Rose, White Flowers & Jasmine Whips which resembles Women Cosmetics in some way along with Fruity Top notes, Dry Down is good.

Ajmal Aretha smells almost similar to this perfume

I personally don't like it as Induce headache to some as I too get headache if I smell it from near, me in both Chloe and Aretha if I smell long.

This Perfume is for Mature Noses and not for New Perfume Lovers my Opinion

Does anyone know where I can buy this 2009 Version?? The new edt is different. Chloe EDP has been my Signature scent for more than 10 yrs but unfortunately they reformulated it and since then I‘ve been on a desperate search (for Like 3 yrs) for dupes or old versions. I‘m so done with the dupes as none of them smells like the good old and beautiful Chloe 😭
i wasnt expecting to like this but i adore it- it really just smells beautiful, fresh, floral, very womanly. smelling this makes me really happy and confident.

I am not a fan of strongly floral perfumes, however Chloé is unique.

The watermelon opening is impressing. It is sappy and with sparkling tangerine a perfect introduction for the roses.
Chloé presents everything we love about roses: elegant, feminine, graceful.
Fresia and iris are very soft: makes the roses the main start, just chime in.

It is truely adorable. Airy, young, classy.
No doubt Chloé is admirable.

I tried this on my skin the other day...very soft and round. This could be a great office scent, sitting so close and inoffensive. It smelled so familiar, then I realized it was a bubble bath scent from my youth. Clean floral...I can see why this is so popular.

Very literal perfume.

Smells like female hygiene products. Those in hot pink packages with the flower designs.

Too teen!

This used to be my signature scent 8-7 years ago. I haven’t smelled it since, so I don’t feel confident describing it. I do remember it being VERY similar to the original Chloé EDP, though I actually found this version even better. I’d probably still prefer it. It’s a shame it’s discountinued :(

Chloe EDT was my favourite scent in the early twenties. I own both the EDT and EDP, but I much prefer the EDT because it's lighter, fresher and younger. I agree with earlier reviews that it is a very clean scent. Unfortunately now that I'm in my late twenties, I'm slowly growing out of my Chloe phase. It's still a lovely perfume, but too innocent and girlish for my liking.

Oddly enough i started to like this now after having smelt it almost a hundred times in the stores.... it is not going to sweep you off your feet right away however it will make you want to come back to it ever so often, and also it smells so effortlessly glam

This Chloe EDT feels like it's a little bit more on the mature side than the Chloe EDP. Sandalwood mixed with tonka gives Chloe EDT its dusty musky feeling. A hint of watermelon and pink pepper create a lightness in the opening. Then freesia, rose and iris blend into a rich powder sweetened by mandarin. Overall, Chloe EDT is beautiful, lasts longer than the EDP on my skin, and is perfect for daytime office wear. It's a clean, light scent that wafts around you off and on during the day. Feminine, projects about 12 inches, and lasts on my skin for 6 hours easily. Great gift for any woman of any age.

I really like this version. It's very fresh, floral, and clean. Less powdery than the EDP. It also lasts quite long for an EDT. I also have the EDP and Absolu version which I also love. I find this perfect for hot days as it's got a very refreshing clean scent -- definitely something that's right outta the shower kind of fresh. It doesn't smell soapy to me, not like detergent like how some are saying.

I also find that it's a perfect everyday scent. It's inoffensive. I use this when I get "tired" from my stronger scented perfumes.

Definitely love this, I have the 30mL bottle and will definitely get a bigger one when the opportunity comes.
This is so much better than the atrocious dryer sheet smelling current formulation. Pink pepper and rose dominate.

I loved this in my 20s, when it first came out there wasn't anything like it. Chloe is with a very sharp and clean note in the middle of a soft dreamy innocence hum of florals. The cleanness is especially pronounced at the beginning and it's almost cutting through like a blaze.
It smells fresh and youthful, a bit like a flower that is about to bloom, or a bud of it. I think this scent is for younger women, maybe for somebody who is freshly starting her career, and I wouldn't be interested in wearing this anymore. But it is such a lovely and innocent scent.

Well, i must have the aprox 2008 version. Whte box, pink beige Chloe font.
Crystal like clean antique feeling comes to mind. A scent almost of days gone by. Slightly adelydic throughout. And although it is... that watery juicy fruit sweet note shines through, but not in the now traditional fruity perfumed way. You would, in fact, not pick it perhaps at all.
Definitely a soapy persistence with a soapy clean rose that shines softly, hidden like.
Sweet '- not gourmand. Chivalrous, perhaps? Almost of the days when it would bring a man to his knees type perfume.

I got it at an old perfume bunch sale. Was not really interested in this particular one, but eventually found it very nice. It is light white floral citrus. Non offensive at all. Classy. Not fruitchully. Very lady like day scent. I normally like character fragrances, but this one is like a expensive thin silk scarf. It is one good to have when you don't want to think which fragrance to wear. Reliable day duty fragrance.

Opens with sharp alcohol and rose notes, then dries down to headache inducing floral notes. The alcohol note remains throughout the life of this fragrance, which is fairly long. Sillage is less than average.
I suppose C edt could pass for a fresh fragrance, but there is a strange fuzzy quality about the scent. Maybe it's the iris or the tonka bean, notes I tend to have a hard time liking. There's no fruit in C edt, as far as I can tell. There is a good bit of sandalwood, however it's a shortlived note, well gone while the rose continues.
C. is an office safe feminine fragrance for those who like modern florals.

I have been collecting perfumes that I think I will like (based on notes and reviews) since I quit smoking a year ago. I now have collected hundreds of beautiful fragrances. Way too much, but I want lots of options, and have a wide-ranging taste in fragrances.

Out of all of the perfumes I have purchased, many niche and other expensive frags that are beautiful, Chloe remains my all-time favorite and signature scent.

I am not good at describing notes yet, but I know I like a soapy rose for sure. Both this one and the EDP, probably leaning towards the EDT, is the best thing I have ever smelled in my life. That's saying a lot since I am almost 49!

I am told I have young taste in perfumes for my age, but that is because I feel 20. It seems like I was 20 just yesterday and woke up today 48 years old!

This is so awesome that it literally makes my mouth water as soon as I apply. The EDT is especially fresh and vibrant. This really agrees with my skin I guess. Sadly (for my husband) he tells me it smells like something his grandmother would wear. Even that has not changed my mind. I cannot begin to tell you how GREAT this scent makes me feel. CHloe EDP and EDT are the first two purchases I made when I quit smoking, and a year later, still the best ever. I even bought a couple of back ups (just in case).

I know that everyone that ends up with a perfume addiction of sorts, buys for various reasons. My reason is because of the way a scent has the power to change your day, at least change your mood or outlook. Even wakes me up when I am having a hard morning getting ready for work. I cannot believe I wasted all those years smoking. I didn't really wear perfume while I smoked bc that would be useless. Now that I don't leave home without it, and in fact is my favorite part of every day (selecting the frag), I know I will never smoke again!

Perfume in my opinion should be worn based on the way in which the particular scent makes you feel inside. So long as you're not wearing offensive frags to an office or closed environment with people, it is all about you.

This is a nice smelling scent but not for me. It is pleasant and unlikely to offend anyone but its a bit too clean and antiseptic almost reminds me of cleaning products. I know a few people who wear it but its just not my style. If you like very clean, fresh white florals try it.

I would describe this version of Chloe as 'nice'. It's not very original and it's quite watered down. The projection didn't really impress me either. I would recommend this if you like soft floral scents.

i got this as a present! It's a hit perfume. Lasts long, smells good, clean and fresh! But i haven't fallen in love with it. Maybe is because i think that i would suit better on a woman that's more classic than me. I want that something else, not only flowers. not only class, but sexiness too.

My sister in law wears this, EDT. It's cuddly and cold at the same time. I think freesia is the brightest flower on her skin. When it comes to new perfumes in the market, I am sceptical. But Chloe represents something timeless.

A beautiful, slightly retro perfume, perfect for summer (especially in Australia).
Sadly it has been discontinued! ☹️

A beautiful fragrance, very delicate, subtle but with one stronger note. Perfect for me to a delicate outfit every day. Lovely bottle - very elegant. Efficient - to feel it you do not have to pour a lot on yourself;) Fairly durable. I recommend it, but it's better to try it before.

I LOVE this! It’s fresh/clean/floral. Just beautiful! I’ve had this for maybe 5 or 6 years? Had it hidden away in the back of my closet and felt like I just discovered a new scent when I found it. I sprayed it on my clothes as I was about to walk out the door and was hit by a powerful BO scent. I had just showered not ten minutes before. Changed my shirt, sprayed again and once again BO! It was my beloved Chloe that smelled like BO! I’ve noticed a lot of my fresh scents turn a little off and smell like BO after a few years even when kept in dark, cool spaces. Luckily I sprayed a few times in the air and smelled my beloved Chloe again. May have just been bad perfume from the plastic spray nozzle thing. . I’m gonna be using this a lot this year because I think it’s time to finish the bottle. Just FYI this perfume is long lasting! I will spray and 8-10 hours later will catch a whiff as I move around. The next morning when I get up from bed I can smell Chloe strongly on my body. I just repurchased the new Chloe EDT. Hopefully it’s just as beautiful and long lasting.

This is a clean smelling scent, maybe too clean. Lily, rose, soap, green. While I don't dislike it it's not my taste. I wish it had a bit more warmth or sweetness. I prefer the original Chloe or Chloe Nomade.

I always thought I owned the eau de parfum, but was recently surprised to see mine labeled as eau de toilette. Although I've had it for a few years, it still has the same scent whenever I wear it. This edt lasts a long time, nearly 12 hours and I can still smell it on me.

I get mostly roses, powder, and something sweet (the tonka bean?). The longer it stays on my skin, the sweeter it gets. Sometimes I find it cloying, but the rose helps to ground the overall scent.

Like to wear this during the day in spring/summer.

I have had this perfume for about 8+ years, and never realised that it contained rose notes. Looking at the notes I would imagine a more floral scent, but the flowery notes blend together and do not read floral to me. Instead it seems like a juicy sweet pear, but not bountiful, more subdued, like mixing it with laundry drying in the cooler early spring.
It is quite anonymous compared to more mature and sophisticated scents, but is nice to wear when I want to smell feminine but not womanly. It has a girliness and youthfulness that makes it seem more innocent. It can be worn by younger women, but also has a romantic sweeter and more rounded smell that pair well with women who are a bit older than that.
Overall it is like taking summery things like elderflower, wild flowers, pear and a slight hint of older fabric/laundry and putting it in a watery lemonade (no citrus though), then adding some rounded sweetness (from rosehip flower leaves) and depth to it. It is fresh but not zesty, just mild, watery, sweet, softish, rounded, elegant and chic.
I feel like a french girl would wear this on days where she wants to seem more coy, low-key and feminine.
My husband told me it smelled like bug spray.. I think it's because its very lemony

I hate rose fragrances. I have Lancome La Nuit Tresor Midnight Rose and Nina Ricci Madamoiselle Ricci which are both rose heavy perfumes and I am so repulsed by them. It smells like boob sweat mixed with some random perfume you wore at the beginning of the day with a few crushed rose petals to me...

BUT!

This is an absolute delight. It's refreshing and so so beautiful. It smells like a bride blushing away on her wedding day in a beautiful garden in the beginning of spring! It smells like her bouquet of white roses kissed by the early morning dew!

This without a doubt is what I will wear on my wedding day :)

I'm writing this as someone who loves Chloe EDP and wears it almost every day. I love this scent as well and wish I had it in a bigger bottle but it's been very hard to find. To me this is lighter, fresher, and greener than the EDP (which I think of as less green and more pink). Chloe EDT is a very clean scent, very right-out-of-the-shower whereas the EDP, while still fresh and lush, is more sweet than clean. When I smell Chloe EDT I think of sparkling dew in a very well-manicured English lawn. Extremely feminine and very inoffensive.

This parfum makes me travelling in the time. I imagine it as THE SUBTLE fragrance in Mr Selfridge's luxurious fashion store in London in the 1910s.
The lightness of watermelon quickly overwhelmed by the sharp rose scent.
Like a fragile glass vase in a soft pink colour.
A pretty rose. This scent does not inspire me to write a longer review.

I can always tell when someone is wearing Chloe. I personally find it overbearing, cloying and very synthetic. Definitely not a perfume I like at all, which is unfortunate since everyone and their dog seems to be wearing it these days ;)

I like this perfume, not love just like, and I wouldn't buy a full bottle of this.
It's a fresh cut roses fragrance, but there is something in this perfume that catches in the back of my throat and almost makes me feel like I'm going to have a sore throat just before a full fledge flu. A little to sharp for me, almost like a sparkling rose dish detergent.
It lasts a good 5 to 6 hours on my skin, but not for me.

Just like the EDP, I smell freshly baked bread, warm and moreish and so fresh. It is definitely airier and more wearable than the EDP but yet still has amazing longevity and sillage for an EDT.
I can detect a faint aquatic note in the background and I guess that's what makes it lighter, I don't normally like aquatics but here it is acceptable as I cant really discern any separate notes just a delicious meld... yum! :D
For those of you with tarnished bottles, Scrub the tarnished metal with some toothpaste using a toothbrush. Takes less than a minute and your bottle will be good as new!

Bought a used bottle for a steal. The bottle appears to be rather old, the ribbon tatty. I suspect this was not correctly stored and has turned. :( I get no rose. Only an annoying burnt vinyal or burnt sugar note on my skin. Raspberries and a few other berries seem to have that effect on my skin. I love rose fragrances but truly detect not an ounce of rose. Will need to try a fresh tester of this and report back.

I’ve been searching lately for something similar to Chloe edp but with less rose, and i ordered a sample of edt just to see whether it was different enough and in hope it will have less rose. Well, it is very similar to edp to my nose. It has the same coziness and retro vibe that I loved in Chloe edp, but it is also romantic, delicate, floral and as much roses, all the things I did not like so much in Chloe edp.
You probably buy any Chloe if you already like roses, i assume. For someone like me, who likes Chloes due to other reasons, it is a different way to go.

Chloe edt is lovely, fresh, floral, delicate scent. Opens a bit more watery, airy and fresher as edp, but as it dries down, they are very similar to my nose. It is really lovely, but not for me at the moment.

Good longevity, the same as edp on my skin. It lasted about 5-6 hours on me and then I went to bed.

There's a pleasant green aura in this one. Lightly floral (mostly rose, but discreet and airy), powdery but not dry. There's also a fruity element, but it's not citrus. Instead I'd describe the fruit in this as watery and sweetish. I seem to detect some benzoin and iris in the mix, too. Innocent, pleasant, pretty. Not ground-breaking, and quite safe. Clean, innocent floral powder might be a good blurb for this one.

I have a feeling they are pulling this one from the stores. It's getting less and less available in the perfume stores. Only been seeing the big bottle or in some stores it's no part of the chloe signature collection at all anymore.

Just thought I let you know!

Chloe is green, floral, lightly powdery, rosy and not outdated in an unpleasant way. This is spry, mature and classy. The longevity is remarkable (as it is with most of Chloe's fragrances), but so far the eeriest spring scent I've come across.
My mind is connecting that's indelibly alarming, particularly at night. It's probably just cognitive to me personally, but that's what I think.
Sillage is heavy, & easily lasts 12 hours.
Un-yeilding and subduing, very much of a sunny scent. Simply doesn't match night time.
Smells fabulous in the morning.
7.5/10

I have never reacted to a perfume as I reacted to this one. I tried it on my skin and within a few minutes I was feeling weird and sick! I was walking around the mall- waiting for it to dry and trying to ignore it, but keep feeling progressively worse. I was nauseous and just icky all over. It took me some time to realize that it was the perfume that made me feel this way. I found a bathroom and washed it off. Only then did I start to feel better. Surprisingly, no headache. I Thought I would love this one as I had smelled it on others and liked it. But, boy, was I wrong. Chemistry is a strange thing.
An old fashioned rose, powdery, ever so slightely ambery and sweeter than most. It has beyond average sillage. The bottle is beautiful. Too " regular" , too unsurprising for me.

Chloe Chloe Edp is my temptation. I want it so bad.
This one is also great, a lighter version of the EDP.
I love that kind of rose scents. Impressive.
Still, as I can't buy all of them, I would choose EDP over this one.
It is perfect!

I absolutely loved Chloe EDP and it was my signature for half a year. I loved the sophisticated feeling it gives off, and I thought i would love it forever. However, one day I tried it again, but there was something so chemical at the beginning that makes it screeching and overwhelming. I couldn't wear the EDP after that.

Then I came across Chloe Eau de Toilette. My impression of any EDT before is that it is a lighter edition of the EDP. However, Chloe Eau de Toilette is the younger, sweeter, more innocent sister of the EDP. All the goodness of the EDP is still there, but this time without the loudness and overwhelming scent that the EDP sometimes carries. I usually had to spray the EDP on me half an hour before going anywhere because it was too powerful. However, with the EDT, I can enjoy Chloe without being afraid that my perfume is too loud.

Chloe EDT is surprisingly long-lasting for an EDT. It lasts about 12 hours on my skin, probably the same longevity as the EDP. To everyone who dislikes Chloe EDP, try the EDT, you may be genuinely surprised.

A bit spiky on me at first, with peppery green notes over the florals, but after an over-sweet middle, it dries to a nicely watery freesia and creamy florals with the barest hint of sandalwood. My husband, who seldom says he likes anything at all, likes this one.
I just broke the bottle at the gym today,it was almost full bottle, TT.TT 3, I am going to buy a new one asap, I can't live without this perfume, it was so beautiful.
this has to be the best rose scented perfume out there,its fresh with a little citrus and pretty much all rose till the end,nice cosy scent much lighter than the edp

Very sharp green floral. Was very disappointed to see it is the exact same smell as avons new kyoto flower. Or maybe vis versa anyway there is nothing different I couldn't even tell them apart. It still smells wonderful but I hate having to of the exact same smells. Which I do think the avon bottle is cuter. Well and a 1/4 of the price.

Chloe Eau de Toilette is the sort of perfume I would wear to meet my boyfriend's parents. It is clean, fresh, feminine and not overpowering. Very fancy soap that lasts all day.I can't imagine this bothering anyone. Sometimes you don't want to make an entrance, you just want to smell nice. This is it.

Hmmm it didn;t let me sleep and I must write few words about this. I once enjoyed a day all alone and was walking in city center and wanted to test some fragrances. I went for Chloe, this sheer bottle was hidden between all the Chloes on the shelf. I took this because I was curious what;s inside. I sprayed it and felt like it;s spring in a green garden full of small pink roses around, sheets were hanging and the wind blew into them. I smelled also something like roots of the roses. Sunrise, wind, the grass was wet because there was still a morning dew. I breath the fresh air from mountains. And than SLAP, I went from the store, the city was full of tourists and suddenly I woke up from a dream in the mountains and was in a dirty city. This fragrance symbolizes (for me) cleanness, nature, romantic moments, something little shy but with a big personality. I love roses and it;s here all about them. This will stay in my heart. I;ve found my signature... That;s enough.. So in love

As a die-hard oriental/gourmand fragrance wearer, it take a lot for me to praise a soapy floral scent like Chloe, which should tell you how fabulous it is. This is one of my favorite perfumes to smell on others. It is both soft and inviting without erring on the cloying or headache-inducing powdery side. I find peony and magnolia to be the dominant notes and most evident in the initial spray. The drydown yields more of a honeyed finish that is very cozy and a little unexpected. It is definitely evocative of clean linens or pricey bar soap. I find the bottle to be just beautiful, the type of thing you want gracing your vanity. This is probably a good scent for those picky folks who hate "perfumey" qualities (musk, amber, etc.) but want a little something to spritz. Elegant and modest.

I wanted to write a review about this sheer beatiful gem. But I can;t ruin the job of EmiliM because I can;t do it better. It says everything. No need to say more, read her review, try to understand and just LOVE! :-)

Wow, this perfume is amazing! I can't really pick out individual notes because it blends so well! Energizing. Would wear this for any spring day. Reminds me of Easter. I'm not usually a fan of perfumes with Rose notes but it's barely noticeable. Love it!!!

Im a nurse and I can smell it everyday on someone. I like this scent a lot, but it seems that everyone wears it..so, im not into buying this one. I dont like when people can recognize the fragrance so easy and this fragrance is one of them.
I loved the floral bouquets of this fragrance...until everyone on the street seemed to be using it.

I had this scent and did appreciate it very much. I used a whole bottle of it until I got tired of the freshness without any further depth to it. I can see why people love this scent, as it is pretty nice, but for me it just got boring after a while.

I don't understand why a lot of people describe this as 'old lady-ish'...probably the rose??

Personally I find this fragrance youthful and innocent. It's very clean airy and not as heavy as the EDP and a little more sweet.

To me, rose and iris are the most prominent notes and although I don't detect the watermelon or citrus so much, I am guessing they help to freshen it up and lift the fragrance so that it isn't old ladyish.

I love love love it!

Strawberries, cherries and an angel's kiss in spring
My summer wine is really made from all these things


Chloe wears a white sundress. Chloe is a white sundress.
Chloe is the prettiest perfume you will ever smell. She's not complicated. She's simply pretty. She is addictive. She takes over your mind and the flowers in her hair occupy your thoughts and you hear her angelic voice singing about happiness.

I love Chloe in spring. I love Chloe in summer. I love Chloe in autumn. I love Chloe in winter.

I love Chloe.

Gorgeous!! Like a beautiful spring morning after a rainy night. So clean, green and fresh. Lasting power seems to be good as well because I've been wearing this for about 4 hours and its still going strong. This to me is the smell of happiness and freedom :)

I just want to cuddle myself when i wear this it is so endearing and comforting, it is a cosy perfume that soothes and heals and calms. It is ideal for everyday wear it offers simplicity freshness and modesty. I love the floral mixed with rose it's absolutely divine, i just think its delicious, If the apple Eve had bitten had a scent it would be this, due to the fact despite its non brashness and lack of intensity it draws you in and captivates you with such sensuality. Its a feel good perfume, it smells of roses, champagne, shampoo and bubble bath, no complexity of notes just natural and beautiful. It doesn't try to portray an image of a rockstar or a femme fatale or anything else like you get with intense perfumes. It just is what it is innocent simple & natural which captivates with such sensuality. It lingers and impacts everyone it contacts due to the naturalness & purity it offers.

Classy. Elegant. Timeless. Modest.= Simply Beautiful.

Beautiful.
Smells classy and elegant with a fun vibe.

Chloe EDT is all about happyness.
It's so vivacious.
It's citrus but powdery.
The rose is here very soft, young, smells fresh and somehow 'green'.
Great combination.

I don't know EDP or Intense version but this little beauty has stolen my heart.

I normally like just about any fragrance. I'm really hard-pressed to hate anything. But I HATE this fragrance. It is an insult to a rose to say this is a rose fragrance. It is piercingly high-pitched like Lauder's "Pleasures," and instead of a drydown, I get an unfolding abrasion that scrubs my nostrils like sandpaper. Ugh. My eyes burn just thinking about the memory of it. Awful.

I just want to cuddle myself when i wear this it is so endearing and comforting, it is a cosy perfume that soothes and heals and calms. It is ideal for everyday wear it offers simplicity freshness and modesty. I love the floral mixed with rose it's absolutely divine, i just think its delicious, If the apple Eve had bitten had a scent it would be this, due to the fact despite its non brashness and lack of intensity it draws you in and captivates you with such sensuality. Its a feel good perfume, it smells of roses, champagne, shampoo and bubble bath, no complexity of notes just natural and beautiful. It doesn't try to portray an image of a rockstar or a femme fatale or anything else like you get with intense perfumes. It just is what it is innocent simple & natural which captivates with such sensuality. It lingers and impacts everyone it contacts due to the naturalness & purity it offers.

Classy. Elegant. Timeless. Modest.= Simply Beautiful.
Lovely--it smells like spring!

Been my signature since I met Nicki Minaj in 2011. I gave her a huge hug and the smell rubbed off on me I couldn't get over it! Mind you I had no idea what she was wearing until I tested about every perfume in Sephora. Since that time I constantly get compliments and people ask what's that smell you always wear.. at that point I realized I was my signature smell. I love the rose in it never dull and always fresh.

A fresh floral bouquet of freshly picked roses with freesia flowers adding more freshness & some iris adding a crisp powdery note. The watermelon in this gives it a slight aquatic nuance. Refreshing, elegant and feminine.
classy and elegant, love it!

I prefer EDT over EDP as EDP contains too much pepper. This one is more feminine, it reminds me of something a woman should wear on her wedding day. Clean, powdery, fresh and classy. The longevity is all right about 5 hours, I think it has a moderate sillage. Like this one, quite original.
love it very pure, very BCBG style, young and preppy too. for girly and classy girls who love gentle men only
I tried the EDT today. While it is similar to the EDP, it isn't as nice a fragrance. I didn't smell the watermelon in this which disappointed me.
É delicioso! Um floral fresco levemente doce, com nota de muitas rosas com a frescura da melancia ao fundo. É sofisticado, chique e jovial. Cheiro de moça rica.
Very floral! Sweet and powerdy. Feminine. 7/10
Nice. A rose dominated, floral-clean fragrance. Very light, and perfect for spring days.
Nice, fresh scent. I prefer it to the EDP. Its lasting power isn't the best, but it's very clean and lovely. The watermelon and roses come out most strongly in this EDT. Perfect for summer days.
I like this, it's just how the spring in a park smells, this way smells picnics in a fresh grass, just-opened flower shops, it's so tendre...... But it just doesn't suit myself.

I felt I need to post a comment because I discovered something new. If anyone f you is wondering what the difference between edp and edt is, I am going to answer you now the best I can.
First of all, many people say that edt smells the same like edp. I am sorry but not on wrist either a paper, they are not the same. It is not about how heavy they are. I think it depends on the personal skin type. The basic difference is, that they belong to the same scent family but:
edp is way more flowery, rosy,peony and fruits, sweeter, creamy.
edt instead, is a pure powder, freshness melon, It is like the nicest spring wash smell ever. So imho, I would use edp as the joyful more flirty one and edt as the "pure" adveturous and incredibly brave and a bit stubborn one. Both fit independent and carefree women. This is how I assosiate it. But I will never say that edt is the lighter version of edp in this case. they are just different. I love both and staying power and silage are good in both.
It is very simmilar to a Softener DUEL SOFT LOTUS

Chloe is an elegant fragrance, light and feminine.
Reminds me of a pretty girl, self assured, cheerful and charming.

Although eau de toilette, lasts pretty good. For me it is very important that a scent with you for hours.

If you want a perfume that makes you feel special this is a good choice :)

Sillage: 9/10
Longevity: 9/10

****

Chloe, es una fragancia elegante, ligera y femenina.
Me recuerda a una chica guapa, segura de si misma, alegre y encantadora.

Aunque sea eau de toilette, tiene una duración bastante buena. Para mí es muy importante que un aroma te acompañe durante horas.

Si quieres un perfume que te haga sentir especial este es una buena opción :)

Sillage: 9/10
Longevidad: 9/10

I can smell them from 50 meters away. The smell is disturbing and gives me headache every single time, but somehow I can't say they smell bad - weird! Strong, heavy, sweet and I believe they last long.

i can smell it on me even after 12 hours and too strong
may be chanel lovers will like it more

This is better than the edp for sure. Scent is softer. This is one of my favorites bec staying power is good. Maybe need to spray in the middle of the day then you are good to go until evening. Scent is so good. I keep wanting to smell myself got good feedbacks from other people when I use it. Worth it

I prefer this one over the EdP. I don´t know why but the EdP is just too much for me. The EdT is airy, breezy and more fruity and soft. The EdT is a powdery rose while the EdP is more intense. The EdT has that lovely, classic appeal without beeing too strong. A fresh spring and summer scent. Great fragrance, it´s an must have!!!!!

Jag föredrar den här framför Chloe EdP. Jag vet inte varför, men Chloe EdP är bara för mycket för mig. EdT:n är lätt och luftig, samtidigt mer fruktig och mjuk. Den doftar pudrig ros medan EdP är mer intensiv. Den har det vackra, klassiska över sig utan att bli för stark. En fräsch vår och sommar doft. Fantastisk och en måste ha!!!
Beware of migraines! This sharp, fruity rose gave me one for sure!

Smells like bug killer powder.
I tried several times and still....
:(

Wow, simply wow!
It has a beautiful classic bottle with an adorable ribbon. The bottle is made with genuine silver plating, which is a nice touch (but beware! the colour may vary over time and it's completely normal).
I definitely smell the sweetness of melon when I first spray it and the rose notes are not as prominent in EDT. It smells clean, airy and has this sort of retro chic and "je ne sais quoi". This fragrance is for a modern confident lady who knows what she wants and leaves a lasting impression. Yes, you WILL NOT be missed when you wear this scent! Every time I use it, women and men ask me what I am wearing and I get TONS of compliments!!
It's a must have for me, and a must try if you haven smelled it yet.
This is my favorite, a classic to me. Very clean, light and fresh. It stays all day and i love the way it holds on my scarfs and shawls. When i wear it i often get complements. Makes me happy!

I'm usually not friend with these hyped design scents. I call them the "luxury girls", because they cost 2 thunders and a half for 50ml and you end up smelling like 80% fashion or wannabe-fashion girls.
Anyway I wanted to try this EdT and I'm glad I did, because it smells nice and highly wearable in spring.
Honestly I cannot think of it as a sandalwood perfume. The dominance is all about melon, fruit and freesia or a similar flower.
Not my usual kind of perfume, but very nice, quite fresh and elegant/refined for daytime with a modern chic outfit.
The lasting power and sillage are very good. It reminds me a little bit of Lanvin Marry Me! which is much louder and floral and more casual.
I could wear this if someone gave it to me as present, but it's not special enough to spend 80 euro for 50ml! This is crazy price!
To me it is a definition of spring! white flowers in bloom, warm wind caressing, my hair flying in the air and me, running barefoot on the grass. May 2012 will belong to Chloe.
I generally like this smell a lot!But i have noticed that sometimes it smells great on me but other times it doesnt.
love love this one

I get a big rose and melon from this but it's neither overly floral nor overly fruity. The powder must keep things under control. It has great sillage. A gorgeous fragrance that's appropriate for just about every occasion.

Chloe is a fragrance for young ladys with a classic sense of style. Its a perfume you can wear all year around in every situation I believe. I love to wear it in jeans and wool sweater but also in a night gown. I tested the EDP and I also think its a little bit to strong, in the line of Agent Provocatuer rose, but the EDT has the perfect amout of rose with a hint of sweet melon that gives this fragrance an airy vibe. Perfect for vintage lovers as the scent has this 60' vibe, but not in an old lady way.
Another good point is the lasting power and sillage that is extremelly good, Mugler sillage good!
Pretty amazing, I will also buy the other Chloe because I'm very impressed with this house.
9/10

Who compared this to Paris perfumes???? What??? INSANE. Anyway, I fell in love with this perfume about 2 months ago and finally decided to go for it and buy a bottle about 3 weeks ago. I cannot stop wearing it! I'm usually WAY more into woody and floral orientals, but this perfume blows me away! I love how light, how fresh, and how "pretty" I smell when I wear it. I get compliments ALL the time.

For those saying it smells old-ladyish, also insane. To me, it smells totally the opposite....fresh, young, playful, delicate, and virgin.

Love this one, it's a keeper!
Like it a lot, very classy scent. Unfortunately no staying power in edt. Have to reapply every couple of hours.
Its a good thing I got this as a free sample. To much Rose and Freesia. Gave me a headache. Won't be buying the full bottle.
I made my mind.. And I prefer this one instead of the EDP..

Sad to say this reminds me of an air freshener. Light and unoriginal. I tried to get something else more positive as it dried down but the best I can do is fabric softener sheets to toss in the dryer after washing chothes. I guess that's better than air freshener. So sorry :(

i hate this smell. i remembered studying in the library once and a girl wearing this perfume came to sat behind me, i cant concentrate after that, the smell stinks so much, i leaved and look for another place to sit. i dont understand why is this perfume so popular, it irritates me alot.
I think is just like the EDP but not so strong.. I dont know wich one i should purchase..
Just tried this one today and I am so going back for it. I love the fresh, clean smell and my boyfriend says it smells amazing too :)

I adore this perfume, and prefer it to the EDP as I find it to be lighter and airer. The EDT still definitely has lasting power; even when sprayed on early morning, I find it still to be lingering well into the night.

3 words to describe this perfume: classic, romantic and delicate.
EdP smells like fine sweet roses. Poor lasting power on me. Nothing unusual to smit you. Boring.

A positive surprise. It smells very classic and I can imagine it for business as well as for going out. The staying power is good too. It's very strong first but then turns into a more decent scent after around 2 hours on me. It has something soapy in it and reminds me in the drydown of Tovas Signature. I can still smell it on my wrists the next day.
Just got a mini today - blind purchase and absolutely ADORE it! This is exactly how a classy lady should smell like :-)

this reminds me of an antique bedroom with the smell of dried flowers and powder sachets in clothes drawers. powdery, musky, and dried flowers. but among this "antique" feeling, there's some fresh, green crisp flowers.. roses. and maybe something watery in there too. Very pretty, good for someone who loves beauty and fantasizes about romantic things.
I would describe this scent as pretty and delicate. A very romantic perfume that is light and somewhat clean, it won't offend anyone.
Much much more wearable than the EDP!!! Light airy and femeinine perfect 4 everyday or a night out... The EDP is a scrubber in my opinion lol...

I bought Chloe EDT when I was looking for something with that fresh linen smell. This definitely has that quality to it BUT I also detect a cold, metallic note that just doesn't agree with me and never leaves. I did give this one a chance but sadly we are not meant to be. On the right person I can see how this would be just beautiful.

Pathetic. I tested this recently. I remember the original Chloe from the 70s. I loved it. It was rich, multi-layered, complex. Sweet, yet incensey. Feminine, romantic, yet strong.

*This* is wimpy and weak, simple, even simplistic. This bears no relationship to the original and does not deserve to bear the name Chloe. It is a pale gentle floral with a little of the same old ubiquitous fruity scent so common and commonplace today.

I would not feel so strongly if this had a different name, but it is pretending to be something it is not. The original Chloe stood out in a crowd. This one tries to hide in it.
Smells better than edp version on my skin. I like it, suitable for summer nights.
love it...delicate scent, fresh and very classic!
Chloe EDP doesn't work for me,it's very strong!But i find the EDT more fruity,soft,delicate,fresh,like a powdery rose water...

I've been out Christmas shopping and have decided on Chloe Edt for both my mum and my sister! I am touting this as a great Christmas pressie and not just because it has a cutesy ivory bow around its neck!

This smells so English, they might as well have called it Chloe English Country Cottage.

The opening is beguiling and lovely. They have left some peonie and lily-of-the-valley in with the freesia and roses. I am thinking carefully wrapped soaps in the cottage bathroom, looking out of the leaded windows across a perfectly manicured lawn, morning dew, dappled sunshine.

It soon settles into a powdery iris sandalwood base, the rose still there but now sharp and dry. It never strikes me as 'old lady' or dated but it does have that classic vibe. The movie reference? Lol, that's easy. Helena Bonham Carter in a Merchant Ivory production of 'A Bathroom with a View'.

The best way I can describe this fragrance is eau de rose soap. It has a pleasant, light, airy smell and the rose is most prominent, though I do smell a bit of the orange as well. It's nice enough and I can see how some people like it, but it's not really my cup of tea. It smells like something I've smelt a million times before, somewhere or the other. I'm going to give it another chance, though, because both my brothers, who hate most perfumes, seem to really like it.

While the original Chloe and Chloe Intense didn't rock my boat, Chloe EDT somehow manages to do so.

I find this version much sweeter, less heavy on the rose note and a tad fruitier. It still has that lovely, classic appeal that reminds me of old-fashioned, Arts and Craft stores with rose scented lotions and candles displayed on every counter in the shop.

Chloe EDT is Spring-like; bright, sunny and energetic. It is less like soap and more like a lightly scented powder or a scented hankerchief that your Grandmother so lovingly gave you many years ago.

I like its overall freshness. The melon and litchi notes stand out to my nose, giving this fragrance an interestingly light and fruity quality. The rose and freesia counteract with one another well, creating a slightly creamy, lotion-type texture.

I'm rather glad that I took the opportunity the test this, because if I hadn't I may have missed out on something so very lovely and delicate.

At the beginning.. i did not like this scent. ACTUALLY. i did think it was old lady-ish ^_^..and too overpowering

but..

i changed my mind ever since i smelt this on a nice lady and i had to smell as elegant..

so i bought it ..


i got nice compliments..i will never stop buying this perfume. i love it!

goooooooooo chloe!

I didn't like the bottle at first but then I found a sample in a magazine.It lasts a lot and make you feel that you have just had a shower.Sooo fresh.For spring and summer it's perfect.I must note that I hate Melon but in this perfume I cannot detect it.
Oh, no! Rose doesn't work well with my skin chemistry. It suddenly turns into an artificial smell(something similar to air freshener)...

Got a sample of this yesterday, and wore it today because I had a training thing and wanted summat fresh-ish and subtle.

I wouldn't say it was that subtle, but it was pretty fresh. And even though it is pretty unique I think I've smelled it on a million women before because it seemed familiar.

Yes it's just a nice fresh floral, made me feel a bit tooooo girly though! :-) nice for summers day perhaps? or on holiday sure it'd bring back some lovely memories because of its uniqueness.

Lasts a looong time too. nice!

Have to say its feminie & so alluring yet mysterious, without being harsh or loud. It is lighter than the original EDP but not as wholesome or deep.
However, that is what makes them both so special & balanced cz they completely different, yet they are quite similar.

My suggestion would be to use the EDT for day & EDP for nights, (although either are not restricted to day/night use), so then you will appreciate both within there own rights.

i am more into heavy strong scent kind of person coz living in the country where its mostly hot all year round, someone needs a perfume that will lasts on hot days..but it doesnt mean that i dont like light perfumes. :-)
anyways, i got a mini tester of this perfume in a fashion magazine just 2 days ago..i can say that its really a very light perfume and very feminine..its like smelling the early morning air in a floral garden.
very soothing...
very relaxing...
its almost like dreaming..
and another good thing about this perfume is it lasts long.

i dont like it. many people like it, even the magazines wrote that this is a very sexy scent. but when i try it today, it far from sext. or i can say not sexy at all. there is no specialty for this one. the smells is too common and i have to say, smells like cheap perfume.

Orientals are not my taste.
Florals are accepted in subtle doses.

Chloe EDT?
Light, likable, lasting.
Fluffy, feminine, fairy.
Pure, clear, virgin.

Since Im visiting Fragrantica I got disappointed numerous times, surprised everyday how happy some scents make me feel, fell in love several times.

Enchanted only once. By Chloe EDT.

I was looking forward to testing this for months, but when I did it was a disappointing. First of all, there are not many differences between this and the EDP. Secondly, it is not as strong, which is what you'd expect from an EDT. And thirdly, when it says "lighter" it means getting rid of the honey, and adding a whole lot of lemon. Although, I think there are more flowers.

If anything, I find the "obnoxious" note even stronger. The major reason I didn't like this compared to Chloe EDP, is that the EDP settles into a deep, sweet, comfortable smell, whereas the EDT is sharper. I also think the EDP is more complex.

I still find the Chloe EDP too strong, and quite frankly, obnoxious (but that's my personal opinion). However, after an hour or two it becomes hypnotizing - addictive - spellbinding - mesmorizing - I'm not really sure of how to describe it - but I really want it, just not the icky first hour or two. Therefore I'm guessing that Chloe EDT might be the way to go. Finally it has come to my local department store - but they don't have a tester - so let's hope that I'm right :)
I had a bottle back in 2015 and recently felt like I want to back to my perfumes I used around those years. Sad to learn this one discontinued, would be perfect for summer.

I found L'Eau de Chloé at the airport back in probably 2014-2015. Upon first smell I fell in love, but unfortunately I didn't get a bottle. I kept dreaming about having this perfume, but I was in a time of my life where there was no budget for such expensive things. I am devastated that its discontinued now, and just kept dreaming about this one.

I recently managed to find a sealed "new" 50ml bottle second hand. First I thought it had gone off, since the bottle was so old, because it wasn't the same fresh smell that I remembered. Its very patchouli heavy, unisex and slightly masculine, but it mellows down after an hour or so, and becomes a bit more like I remember it (but still lots of patchouli there). Layering this with a fresh citrusy scent like Clinique Happy takes me somewhat back to what I remember, but I guess it will never be the same. I want to like it, I think I don't though.

Dupe:
I read in here that Japanese Rituals by Tesori d'Oriente is a cheap dupe, so I got that one as well, and since its a new bottle, I could maybe get the fresh scent that I remembered from L'Eau de Chloé back in the day, just in case my bottle had in fact gone bad because of age.
I was surprised to see that my old bottle of L'Eau de Chloé and the new fresh bottle of Japanese Rituals by Tesori d'Oriente smell completely identical. Honestly no difference what so ever. I guess my L'Eau de Chloé didnt go bad, I might have just changed my preference in fragrance since then. Its just the patchouli that ruins it for me I think.

My favorite of the Chloe EDP flankers. It smells like you've sprayed on the EDP and gone for a walk on a cool spring day just as flowers are starting to bloom. Then you walk by a house where someone's fresh laundry is in the dryer and all the scents intermingle in the happiest way. So sad this one is gone.
Why oh why did they discontinue this version! The new version totally lacks the fresh, sparlky, clen fragrant smell of the 2012 one.

green dryer sheets. something about this is dull; the freshness is trying too hard to be fresh and it veers into forgettable artificiality. makes sense that it's discontinued.

the small teeny tiny tester bottle i got in a swap, however, is so cute.

This is an epitome of spring and summer mornings. Enjoying it very much in this time of the year! And don't be put off by the patchouli note, it isn't cloying here, I promise!
