On me - for less than an hour. I have experimented with different ways to increase longevity. I’ve sprayed it into non-scented lotion and lathered it on. That extended the scent for a short time. The best was to directly spray it on clothes.

But one of it’s charms seems to be that it is a light scent you can spray on anytime without fear of over spraying; so I will use it for before bed time and anytime I want that lovey tea rose fragrance for a short time. But I will not be purchasing another bottle. Hopefully, this perfumery can figure out a way to make this into an EDP with increased silage and longevity. That would really be something special.
This and the original Chloe rose are the most underrated frags! I hear no one talking about them. Every time I revisit. Not a single thing unharmonious about this composition.

This perfume is wonderful. At first smell all I got was rose. But as it progressed, it blossomed. Fresh cut rose with sour orange upon arrival, sweet soapy rose next, finishing to a musky dry down. Lemon is also ever-present. It’s not too heavy or old ladylike as other rose perfumes can be. Moderate longevity. Can definitely be layered, but I prefer it on its own. The projection is great on me and I have dry skin. This may be my new spring perfume. I’ll have to stock up before they discontinue it.

This is a beautiful, bright, dewy rose fragrance. It's one that can be worn year round. It doesn't smell mature or heavy; I can see younger or youthful ladies enjoying this fragrance.

The longevity isn’t great as it becomes a skin scent after a couple of hours on me. It’s great for casual wear or even in work settings as the projection and silage are moderate.

This is it. This is The Rose Fragrance for me. I can’t even describe how lovely it is. It is like picking a rose off the bush. It’s so wonderfully graceful and pleasant and always lifts my mood. I wish it lasted longer and projected more, or it would be my everyday signature.

I bought this after smelling it on a colleague. Wasn’t sure to start with as it seemed to make me (and my husband) sneeze a lot. So left it for a
few months.
However now we are in full rose season in the garden somehow I found myself craving this fragrance. For two weeks now I can’t get enough of it! It it’s extremely long lasting on my skin, on spray and I can smell it on myself for hours and then I can still smell for the rest of the day when I bring my wrist to my nose.
The following day it is still on the skin as a soft gentle gorgeous musk.
Funny I disliked it immediately after buying, but now i could drink it now that it’s summer season.
I didn't love it initially. It felt dated and not nearly as delicate as the OG Chloe EDP. As it dried I began to appreciate this soapy rose, but it isn't something I'd repurchase

Oh... my beloved is long gone now. My mother just gifted me a 50mL bottle of this a few weeks ago and I must say it is heavenly. I already adored the og signature Chloe but this is, certainly, the best.

Imagine a fresh field of roses, soaked in dew as it dries in the sun. Precisely how it smells to me after it dries down.

I suppose my generation is very fearful of rosy perfumes, probably due to the heavy stigma of old woman enjoying the smell. Do not mistake this for any dated smell of roses or even cemetery flowers you have smelt in the past. It is entirely *fresh*. The roses smell as though as just harvested, almost as if you crunched a blossom in your hands and the residue remained there for hours still, enveloping you with it's background flowers and musks.

In my humble opinion Chloe should not shy away from this fragrance whatsoever, as it pleases both the young and the old costumers of the house. The first because of it's modern spin with the added lemon and green notes at first - smelling youthful and crisp. And as for the second due to it's robust rosy body, an ingredient sure to make the elder swoon because of how refreshingly modern it made such an usual scent feel.

Needless to say - it smells just as clean as can be. Highly recommed to those prone to headaches/migraines as it does not smell even the least bit sweet to me. Suitable for the office, a casual date during the day, informal situations of all kinds in both spring and summer alike. Hard to be disliked. RIP. 🎀

Love this perfume so much! The best rose scent for me, it's not too strong, is like a rose without thorns, making people think you are soft and is not that fierce and hard to approach. Very recommended to wear it on a date.

I used to have this to use during hot days. It was cute enough on first spray but there was something very unpleasant in the drydown. Can’t really pinpoint what, since I like the base notes. Can’t really say I miss this one.
Hidden gem. The goat of rose fragrances. Really classic and simple. 10/10. It's discontinued but I'm not sure if I will repurchase it since my bottle is still almost full.

I really need to stop being so impulsive. I tested this at Sephora and loved the initial spray.... so I bought a travel size. I’m searching for something light and pretty I can wear every day. As it dried down it now smells EXACTLY like Amazing Grace Ballet Rose..... and I stopped liking that one. Granted, it was only $30, but still. I’m not sure what about it I’m not wild about. Maybe I’m just not a rose person. It’s ok, and I’ll use it occasionally, but not what I’m looking for.

Thin, short lived, unsatisfying, costly (for what it is), and ultimately boring.

I wish there was a better conclusion, but there you have it! No offense intended to Chloe Rose lovers. I'm sure you smell good and that your taste is good. I expect more performance, sillage, and panache at this level.

If it helps any, I also feel this way about a great many other designer rose based releases. They lack character and substance and the promise of a lovely soliflore rose dies as the fragrance rapidly fades.... Little to no projection or longevity is common with 'modern' rose, alas, or else it is extended and amplified with patchouli or fruits, thus making it not a soliflore at all.

The answer? There is no holy grail rose for me yet, but for a modern rose the best I could ever hope for is Paul Smith Roses! It is everything I'd ever hoped the mainstream designers would release and then some. Airy, long lasting, strong sillage, pink, and lovely. It is Chloe Roses Done Right.

I fell in LOVE with this perfume the first time I ever smelled it on a friend! And every other time I saw her! It PROJECTS on her! This is a fresh rose scent that lasts HOURS on me. It's the only Chloe perfume I like. It's girly and flirty without trying too hard. The only downside is the bottle rusts/tarnishes SO much.

This fragrance opens with green lush petals, freshness of a garden at springtime. Very rosy - not a huge fan. Even though the roses are elegant it´s too much for me at this point. After a while it settels down and gets moore clean and soapy, still very springtime crisp and fresh – accually I think I will prefer this as a summer scent, though it´s fresh and crisp it´s also very soft and feminin, perfekt for summer in my taste. I like it alot!
This is for the Rose lovers out there, I am one of them. This is a perfect modern floral for spring and summer, classy realistic rose-floral with moderate performance! Love it!

I hate this perfume so much...I have a mini of this and wanted to love it but sadly it's a big NOPE!!

All I get from this perfume is nasty musky dirty roses and PICKLES!!! lol Seriously gross and I've even tested this in the stores a few times because I thought maybe I had a bad mini perfume and nope I still get the same dirty roses and pickles....when I wear it I get compliments oddly enough. I can't get passed the horrendus scent and thankfully its almost gone .
Really heady rosy perfume that isn't much on its own but great for layering if you want to add florals to another scent.

At first spray, Chloe Roses smells exactly like a fresh bouquet that has just been removed from a flower shop refrigerator. Cool, a bit green, fresh tea roses scent blooms and grows stronger as the bouquet warms to room temperature. At this point, projection is moderate and remains so for about 2 hours before fading slowly into a close to skin scent. Not powdery. A touch of lightweight white musk gently floats like a soft cloud around these roses. Tarragon and wood notes make me think of a garden bed and keep the scent from being too sweet. On my skin, Chloe Roses lasts about 4 hours. Pretty, fresh, realistic flower shop bouquet that can be worn by anyone, anywhere, any time of year.
Absolutely love this great perfume. Very pretty, clean, fresh and long lasting scent. Smells like a bouquet of natural roses! It’s the best perfume from this brand. MASTERPIECE!
I wanted to love this, but it induces a migraine with vomiting every time I wear it.

A fresh, soapy rose scent that reminds me of hanging sheets to dry on a crisp spring day. I prefer this to the original Chloe but it nonetheless feels cluttered - the peach note feels completely out of place, too sexy for the rest of the composition. Admittedly, I wear this often because it is nice and relatively inoffensive but after this bottle I don’t think I’ll buy another. It gives off a pretty, youthful, plain aura - sweet, but not a head-turner. Great for the office, or a first date picnic, not so much for compliments or head-turning. I will say that it seems to strike some people as muskier - I have an extremely sensitive nose and doesn’t strike me as a particularly strong scent, but my mother thinks it’s too musky.

Perfect rose scent, simple but good. Not many notes to pick up besides rose, but there is a freshness and lightness contributed by the subtler details here, it is more wearable and versatile than other rose scents. I have this as a travel roller and it has been my go-to default vacation perfume. Sad to see that it is discontinued.

It’s a decent perfume I have to say. It smells rosy, feminine and it does not smell cheap. But, for people who don’t like rose, I don’t recommend it because it’s like you’re smelling rose petals and that’s it. It’s quite boring, actually.

First blast of super sweet screechy citrusy roses and musk; there's a definite sense of rubbing alcohol right in the opening so best to let this one breathe a bit before heading out. The musk turns into warm velvet during the drydown turning cozy over time; quite a change from that bright fruity opening, actually. That super sweet bright note is very much gone now and left behind the velvety rose petals in its wake. The drydown of this is much better than the opening but you've got to be a fan of musk, first and foremost. Nice but not my style. Feminine and best for cold weather.

Lovely, clean, fresh pink roses. That’s all. Feels great to wear when I just want to have a low key, classic, pretty, clean scent on. Love! Does remind me a lot of Philosophy Ballet Rose-although I think ballet rose does last longer /:

This scent was my go-to this spring and summer. I like it more than the original chloe. It's an airy and clean rose and it reminds me of a rose soap bar. Very airy, feminine and soft. Not as fruity and heavy as the original. So sad it is discontinued. Ideal for work places, spring and summer days, very refreshing, upliftining and even sporty scent. Big love.

The first thing you get with Roses de Chloé is a noseful of the most beautiful red roses in full bloom. After 10 minutes, it becomes a trite red rose with maybe some red berries it it. While not being all bad, it reminds me of red gummi bears. I don't hate it, but it also does not excite me as well.

1 hour in, the rose turns pink and the fragrance becomes dewy and nice. This is hands down a very beautiful stage of this perfume where it slightly reminded me of Stella by Stella McCartney.

2 hours after the initial application, the pink dewy rose dries down to a classic rose with warm undercurrents. The berry notes are gone. At this point, although not unique, this rose scent is still nice. It remains like this for two more hours until the big let-down. This is when the rose turns all musty and unpleasant. I got a strong musk note that, while probably being synthetic, does carry a bit of an animalic component which I don't love.This is where the fragrance remains until after six hours, the scent is gone without a trace.

Roses de Chloé is an unisex fragrance leaning in the feminine direction. I find it appropriate for many age-groups, although compared with the classic Chloé EdP it feel approximately 10 years younger and is best worn by people from their 20s to their late 40s.

All that being said, I don't think I can recommend this fragrance. I do not think it is an altogether awful perfume, but it just isn't that great either. This is the thing with rose fragrances: there are just so many great alternatives. Especially given its rather awful final few hours, Roses de Chloé is just too much of a rollercoaster ride for me.

TL;DR: red, dewy gummy bear rose, turns musty on some skin.

The perfect rose scent for me, the rose is not the main star, but it's perfectly compliment other notes. This smells heavenly. Most of us will say its smells generic, but its the most beautiful generic scent for me lol! I've always come back to this (gone through 3 bottles of this), my everyday scent. I can depend on this always. The only thing I have to complain is that its longevity is weak! Still, one of my favourite perfume!

A bouquet of supermarket roses tossed in a chlorinated swimming pool.

But hey, if that's what you're looking for, then you do you.

am i the only one who thinks that this smells like expensive sunscreen??
on my skin at least 😂 what is it? the musk? the powdery notes? lmao
on paper it’s really lovely, but not sensational.. it really is a clean, green natural rose like mentioned in previous reviews. love it!!!
overall okay.. an 8/10 from me tbh, but it’s not FBW. especially with it’s weak longevity :( only bought this one because i got it for a great deal online. i think there are cheaper offers out there for rose perfumes like this one

This is a no-fuss rose. Clean, mildly soapy, but the rose is absolutely the star of the show. This is a fresh and green rose, there's almost no sweetness. Totally inoffensive and perfect if you're looking for something simple, feminine, and easy to wear. I do feel this is a tad overpriced for how simple it is. It reminds me of many other non-designer rose scents, like BBW Rosewater and Ivy or some of the rose offerings from The Body Shop. You're really just paying for the bottle with Roses de Chloe (but let's be honest, it's quite a cute bottle!)

Edit: Had to change this from like to love. This is my favorite rose ever, a very soapy, freshly laundered linen rose. I hate how pathetic the performance is, this is one of the weakest fragrances I've ever tried, it's undetectable within 2 hours.

The more I wear this, the more it resembles me of Delina PdM.
A true scent of natural rose with a bit of cleanness (a little bit soapy which I absolutely love) and some sweetness of fruits. My untrained nose picks up rose, a hint of magnolia, and the musk.

I have bought the smallest bottle and it's the cutest thing ever! The longevity is reasonable and the people around me notice this scent very well. My headaches tell me I cannot overspray this, but the 4 sprits (2 in each arm) are enough for me to scent this all day. The dry down is beautiful, a clean rose that sits very well on the skin.

If you like Delina but don't want to splurge like me, give this a sniff!

This is my favorite from the Chloe lineup. I enjoy the complimentary notes to the rose in this; it keeps it from being boring or too heavy. I feel like this is a well balanced fragrance, but the longevity, like many other Chloe scents, is not there. I only get about 3 hours of this before it becomes purely a skin scent. It's pretty, dainty, girly, and worth purchasing if you're not paying full price.

Roses de Chloe is what I wanted Philosophy's Ballet Rose to be... the two are very similar, sharing the same beautiful rose/litchi/musk scent profile, but RdC is deeper, more nuanced (more fruit and wood accords), and lasts longer.

Ballet Rose is (or was, rather, since I've swapped it away) completely gone off my skin in about 2 hours. RdC sticks around for about 4-5 hours on me.

It's easy to like and enjoy, as are the rest of the Chloes that I've tried, but I know I don't like them nearly enough to pay full retail. I received a sample and a partial bottle of RdC in two separate swaps as freebies, and I purchased Chloe EDP at a significant discount. They're enjoyable, easy to like scents, but the MSRP is laughable. Get them at a discount and take 'em for a spin--there's very little to dislike about the line.

This smells heavenly...for about 15 minutes. :( It opens with delightful rose notes, and then dries down to a lighter, very clean scent, but after a half hour or so, and for hours afterwards, ALL I can smell is musk. It's not unpleasant, but if I only wanted to smell musk, there are much cheaper options. :(

I smelled this on paper and it was lovely. It's more complex than the original Chloe, sweeter, more rounded and more appealing. I didn't like this on myself, however. Something about Chloe's rose scents just don't work with me, and all I get on myself is rose-scented baby powder. I get a very innocent and polite vibe from this, so it's a safe blind buy if you know and love Chloe's style of rose, but it's really not for me.

This is my favorite, favorite perfume. It's sweet and rosy, and doesn't give me any type of headache or smell too perfumey. HOWEVER, the sample I got did not last very long on me at all. That with the price, I kinda just gave up on purchasing it. Until one day I walked through Anthropologie and sprayed one of the perfumes they carried on me and it smelled identical to this. Lollia "Always in Rose" is a rose & hibiscus perfume that smells so much like this, for a big bottle for half the cost. The staying power still isn't forever, but I can justify carrying an atomizer and reapplying. Also, that is my most complimented perfume xoxo.

Really lovely fresh rose, but just doesn't have enough oomph and staying/lasting power to justify keeping. Giving to my tween. Must say that it is on par with a body spray she enjoys and we compared them - and they are nearly identical. In other words, this isn't worth the Chloe price tag.

Obsessed with this fragrance. Completely addicted to this and I smell it for hours on end. I can't wear it every day because it does, unfortunately, give me headaches within the first hour of spraying, but once it hits the dry down, it's nothing but pure spring time bliss. My nose picks up the peach, and mixed with the rose, is so beautiful. I haven't smelled the original of this line, so I can't compare, but this was another blind buy win.

Pretty rose that starts with some fruit, but it doesn't scream "lychee" at me. I wish it did though, I love lychee. Anyways, the fruity freshness doesn't last very long. Within a few minutes we've moved into definite straight rose territory. It is a light, airy, springtime rose. It stays this way until fading away a couple of hours later. This smells 80% like the original Chloe to me, but less sharp and lower longevity.
Ohh this one is so lovely, like a romantic rose. Not too heavy, just a delicate rose, light and airy with woody base. And for me it's really different from Goldea
Delightful.

I associate different fragrances with specific items of clothing and settings. In this case, I imagine Roses de Chloe on a woman in a white sundress on a summer afternoon. She is sipping on iced tea with a group of female friends. This is not a sexy scent necessarily.... its more friendly, youthful and casual.

Roses de Chloe is a light, linear rose scent. This is not a complex fragrance by any means. Rose perfumes have a reputation for smelling "matronly" but in this case, there is a slight freshness and fruitiness that prevents it from being dated. I know melon is not one of the listed notes but I swear I can smell something along those lines in the top notes. The melon vibe fades after a few minutes and then the fragrance is a pure rose. Though its an EDT, I find it to have decent longevity, particularly on clothes.
Smells like a fresh cut rose. So realistic. I prefer this over Stella.

My favorite Spring fragrance. Sweet clean rose mixed with magnolia. The dry down on me is amazing. It’s a white musk that sticks to my skin and is almost imperceptible, but is there. I’m on my second bottle of this juice.
It’s not sexy, not offensive, just pure and lovely.
This smells exactly like a freshly cut rose. Delicate, beautiful and romantic. One of the most gorgeous perfumes I've ever smelt and by far the best rose one.

My boyfriend's sister wears Chloe Eau de Parfum and I always wondered (still do) what in the world makes me so nauseous about that fragrance.
All this to say - I was initially hesitant of Roses de Chloe. I tried in on a whim and I was pleasantly surprised! I was looking for an everyday rose solifore and this is it (I initially purchased Rosa Nobile from Acqua di Parma and couldn't stand it - it gave me a headache and it reminded me of a potpourri grandma smell).
In this fragrance, I don't smell any of the other notes mentioned besides rose; perhaps a little musk but that's it. Especially no cedar, black currant, apple or peach.
I purchased this fragrance and I'm currently wearing it right next to Hiram Green's Lustre. What a difference! Curious to see Chloe's longevity.

Edit: I really enjoy this fragrance. It reminds me SO much of Daisy Eau So Fresh (pink bottle) but it's a little more elegant.

I agree with other reviewers, this is a very delicate and natural rose. It’s crisp, clean and easy to wear. I feel like a ballerina when I wear this, because it just feels/smells like that creamy pink color of ballerinas’ ensembles. However, I have a few male friends who wear this and it smells so nice on them. This isn’t as a blooming bouquet smell, it’s more of the soapy smell of the original Chloe accompanied by a clean rose. One of my favs 💕

This is the most natural rose you could ever smell, according to me. Absolutely lovely. I have the original Chloe too, and love that one as well. If I would have to choose between the two, I couldn’t... but the original is more of a city rose for me, from a florist shop, given by your admirer, or your man. Enjoying city summer. But this one: it is more of an oldfashioned and softly intensive garden rose. Fresh in the morning, when you go out in the dewy grass.
The difference of colour in the packaging is just right, I think.
The only downside with this: might be the shorter longevity. The projection and the sillage is weaker than the original, but that does not have to be a downside. You just choose the fragrances for different occasions.
And if I, when I can afford yet another fragrance, do buy a bigger bottle ( I only have a 30 ml, with little left) I can allow myself to respray a bit during the day.
Beautiful enough for very special occasions, but can also be worn just for oneself to feel calmly fabulous and happy, an otherwise normal day at home.

This fragrance from Chloe was hugely disappointing, it smelled like plastic roses and increased this feeling the intense citrus dose present in the heart of the fragrance gave the feeling that it was a cheap perfume that seems like air fresheners.. I tried to love it but I couldn't 🥴

I was suprised to read the reviews and learn I'm not the only one who feels a bit sick when sniffing this perfume. For some reason it's nausea inducing. Apart from that, the scent itself - objectively, perhaps.. - is good. Wanted to love it but couldn't physically

This is the fragrance that does not need many words.
It's rose essential oil mixed into a cream base. That is it.
Pleasant, simple, both sillage and longevity are weak.
Everytime smelling this Chloe perfume, i fell like to vomiting and my nose getting itchy..., feeling not well for this perfume...omg...

I'll be honest I smell absolutely no notes in this apart from the rose. Inoffensive, subtle, linear (on me) and very pleasant smell, though not very intriguing or good value for money (as the commenter below me mentioned as well). To me there's nothing unique enough in this to be worth the price. I also hate how the metal on Chloe fragrances rusts/oxidizes. If I ever want a gentle rose perfume, I will look for something that's half or third the price of this one.

If you like rose, I think this is a safe blind buy just for the scent alone. You may think it's not groundbreaking, long lasting or good value for money but you can't deny how PRETTY and DELICATE this is. Furthermore, as simple as the composition is, this is one of my more complimented perfumes. This is for a woman who doesn't try too hard, but still comes off as elegant and refined. Try it, it probably won't blow you away but I come back to this time and time again because it's beautiful and refreshing.

I got a sample sprayer forever ago from Sephora, and I never really tested it; it just went into a basket with a bunch of other samples. As I am bored AF and also curious about where my collection stands, I have been slowly going through things to see what I want to keep and what needs to go. I grabbed this thinking it was the regular Chloe namesake fragrance, which I find inoffensive, but was pleasantly surprised when I was hit in the face with roses. For a mainstream brand, this is a good rose fragrance. It reminds me a lot of the original formulation of Stella McCartney's Stella, just slightly softer. I am surprising myself a lot, but I definitely will pick up a FB of this since a good mainstream rose fragrance is something that I love to have and the new Stella isn't as good for me.
Instant classic smells like clean and fresh roses 🌹. You can’t go wrong with this. I adore and have gotten compliments on this one. It’s a practical scent suitable for work.

This reminds me of Rose 2000, and at times throughout its development, Rose 2000 had trace whispers of Parfum sacre (both spiced rose perfumes). Both, were perhaps .?? a touch heavier than RDChloe.
Anyway, RDC is BEAUTIFUL. . AND it smells more beautiful as it dries down in its captivating and slight complexity - so wait for it.
Doesnt nearly everyone appreciate the soft faint smell of a fresh opening rose ? A bit sweet but not too so.
Quite therapeutic and inviting is Roses De Chloe. It is a garden you want to enter and stay in , because, it feels alive and real.
Lasts nicely, freshly, and i smell a faint greenery surround throughout its wear.
Anyone should try this - guys as well. You'll be surprised !

I bought this perfume as a blind buy because I wanted a) a Chloe scent in my collection and b) a rose scent.

The bottle - beautiful, classy, feminine. You can't go wrong with the bottle design.

The initial spray gives me nothing but roses upon roses. It's almost too much - but shortly after when it starts to dry down you get that classic Chloe DNA that's a bit more tart, woody, floral. There's nothing sweet about this fragrance. I haven't tried it on my skin yet, but on paper and at the atomizer, it's a classic Chloe fragrance but heavy on the rose.

Lovely. Classy. It makes me feel like a classy high society lady in the UK.

To me it's probably the most sophisticated classically floral scent I own. I'm not sure when I'll wear it - but it'll be during the spring and summer during the day for sure.

As a disclaimer, I tend to like more of the vanilla, powdery florientals.

This fragrance is a 7/10 for me.

I wanted to make Roses De Chloe my next spring rose but I can't. I've been testing it a few days and kept being reminded of another scent that was burned into my brain as a pre-teen in the late nineties... Tommy Girl. A scent I never liked for myself but smelled all around me as it grew in popularity among my peers. It also brings to mind Lancome Miracle and Versace Bright Crystal. Just like Tommy Girl, that magnolia note in Roses De Chloe is sharp and loud and takes over whatever it is accompanied by. While I wanted watery rose and lychee in a Chloe DNA, I'm actually getting mostly magnolia and nondescript fruit. The rose is just an afterthought. Shame since I remember liking it years ago. I must not have tested it long enough or my tastes changed after having a baby (likely the latter). The upside is that's one less perfume to want.

I love the current Chloe line. Each fragrance represents different facets of rose and emphasises them. Unfortunately I’m slightly anosmic to the other offerings (L’Eau and Fleur) and this is the best alongside Chloe EDP. All the fragrances are along a similar theme and I have to say this is such a pretty soft rose. The opening is possibly a little too on the tart citrusy side for me but the dry down is absolutely to die for. I would love this to layer with Chloe EDP I think and I will purchase this fragrance soon. It’s not too soapy or powdery but just perfect with the mild fruitiness. Gorgeous.

I would not compare to Sisley Izia or Paul Smith Rose as Izia is much soapier, dryer and less sweet/soft and Paul Smith is much sharper and more tart. Izia is a very different kind of fragrance as Sisley has a very distinct sort of style and Paul Smith is a very linear sort of rose.
This is soft and cosy and pretty and I wish it came in a bigger size... to be honest would not compare this with any other rose fragrance as this has very distinctive Chloe DNA and is not at all similar to other rose fragrances I have tried.

Very pleasant and unique rose: realistic and balanced. More sweet than fresh, not powdery, soapy or Oriental. I borderline love it. It has been compared to a Montale, and I can see that, though it is speaking of strength and quality I suppose... it isn't as intense for sure, and I like that. Has a touch of my beloved roses from Roses Musk, but the sensuality of musk here is dialed down, and the roses are louder. I wish my bottle of Chloe EDP could magically be replaced with a bottle of Roses de Chloe!

The first 3-4 hours are really lovely. Unmistakable rose, but modern and fresh smelling rather than traditional. It manages to be sophisticated yet youthful, and romantic without being "sexy". I can imagine it being appropriate for most occasions. Buuuut... After about 4 hours it dries to a strange sour greasy smell which I don't enjoy at all. This might just be my nose though because no one I ask knows what I mean!! Also it does smell very similar to Paul Smith rose.

A MASTERPIECE!

This is an actual garden of roses, bottled. It’s soft, sensual, elegant, romantic and just plain wonderful. I get compliments every time I wear this and I wear it a lot because I just love it so much. An everyday, versatile, completely inoffensive fragrance. I generally love Chloé’s fragrances, but this one is definitely one of my top favorites, if not my favorite. I wear it to bed sometimes because it’s so lovely and calming and I can never seem to get enough of it. Gorgeous, gorgeous, gorgeous!

Thank you, Chloé!

Lovely fragrance! Very feminine and romantic. I get a sweet, a bit powdery and warm rose. Very comforting and pleasant. I am positively surprised.
It reminded me of Valentino Donna, but Roses de Chloé is younger. It also reminded me of Rose Goldea, but Roses de Chloé is less soapy.
This is the perfect perfume for a soft, sensitive and sensual girl.
It’s inoffensive, appropriate for all occasions.
Sillage is soft.
Thumbs up! It goes to my wish list.
Final note: 8/10

I wasn't blown away by this perfume in any way shape or form, it's pleasant but that is pretty much it for me, for the price this is being sold for I expected to atleast really like it even if it wasn't a love but it just doesn't smell special or unique enough for me. I prefer Paul Smith rose by far over this one, that one is the best rose fragrance I've ever come across and for the price it is a steal, it is so much more special and smells absolutely gorgeous, this was a definate flop for me x

Rose in this fragrance is the most beautiful rose I have had a chance to smell. I have a large perfume collection and rose fragrances are always welcome there. Its not overwhelming sweet or sour. It just perfect rose sitting on the white musk notes with few sprinkle of lime on the top. Wonderful composition that is balanced to perfection.
Lovely. Citrusy rose on the card but on my skin I’m getting realistic freshly cut rose blooms without any sweetness. Finding the dry down to be a touch mature/perfumey. Lasts all day.

ย้อนไปสัก 5 ปีก่อนหน้าที่เทรนด์น้ำหอมหวานหยาดเยิ้มเหมือนน้ำเชื่อมอย่างลาวิเอเบลที่ฮิตกันตอนนี้จะมา กลิ่นแนวกุหลาบลิ้นจี่อย่าง Chole นี้เราจะได้กลิ่นฟุ้งอยู่ทั่วทุกหัวถนน

สาวออฟฟิช 1 ในสิบคนน่าจะเคยผ่านกลิ่นนี้ เรียกได้ว่าใส่กลิ่นนี้ซ้ำกันทุกโบกี้ BTS เชียวละ

ก็จะไม่ใช้ฮิตได้อย่างไรในเมื่อแนวกลิ่นแสนน่ารัก สดใส ใช้ง่าย แต่ยังหรูหราเหมือนคุณหนูผู้ไม่เคยย่างเท้าขึ้นรถเมล์ กลิ่นกระจายตัวดีในอากาศชื้นๆอย่างบ้านเรา ทั้งยังหาซื้อง่ายราคาไม่แพงอีก แถมติดทนเสียอีก

เพื่อนสจ้วตข้าพเจ้าท่านหนึ่งเคยกรุ่นกลิ่นด้วยโจมาโลนนัคทารีนและน้ำผึ้ง จู่ๆก็เปลี่ยนกลิ่นเป็นกลิ่นหอมแหลมของกุหลาบ แทรกโทนหวานฉ่ำคล้ายน้ำลิ้นจี่กระป๋องแช่เย็น และน้ำมันมะกรูดนุ่ม

ทางเราได้ดมแล้วชอบมาก ตะบอยถามนางอยู่หลายรอบนางก็ไม่ยอมตอบ อุบไว้หอมคนเดียว จนเราต้องไปตามเจอเองว่าเป็นกลิ่นโคลเอ้นี่เอง

ตามธรรมดาโคลเอ้จะจำแนกกันง่ายๆด้วยสีโบว์พันรอบคอขวด นอกจากความหวานเข้มข้นกุหลาบน้ำผึ้งของโบว์ดำ ก็มีโบว์ชมพูนี่แหละที่ชอบ

ใส่กุหลาบลงไปหนักมือหน่อย แต่กลิ่นเบาอ่อนหวานกว่าโบว์ครีม อาจจะหรูหราน้อยลงแต่สดใสมากขึ้น เบาพริ้วกว่าเดิม

เสียดายเก็บไว้นานแทนที่กลิ่นจะกลมกล่อมนวลเนียนขึ้น แต่กลับไม่ใช่ กลิ่นเหมือนซ่าปร่าขึ้น ยังดีไม่ถึงขั้นบูด

ส่วนคอขวดต้องดำๆแบบนี้หละถึงจะขลัง อิอิ

Smells purely of rose, but not the flowery, rose hand cream scent you're accustomed to This one is fresh, sweet and uncomplicated. Has a long wear time for an edt which helps justify the price. Would recommend this to any young women who love the smell of roses and doesn't want a 'mature' scent.

Very young fresh rose. Not your grandma rose. Very natural, realistic.
Close to Izia Sisley (I have both). Mush cheaper. Good lasting power.
Suitable for hot humid summer (I am in Texas). Ok for office.
One of my favorite roses ever.

I absolutely adore this fragrance. I just wish it performed as well in warm weather as it did in the cold. The first time I wore it the weather was still cold outside and it had great longevity and silage. I could smell it most of the day. Today I wore it for the second time and for some reason it was gone within an hour. It wasn’t even a skin scent. I did my usual amount of spraying and in the beginning it was so intense my friend jokingly asked if I bathe myself in it. Within an hour neither she nor I could smell it. I'm beginning to wonder if this is one of those scents that doesn't work well in all seasons. That would be a bummer because the warm season is why I bought it. As for the purchase I know it's not a fake because I bought it from a reputable department store. Anyone else have the same issue I'm having? I don't think the bottle is bad ether because as I stated earlier I could smell it fine in the cold weather. I don’t know what to make of this. It is really strange and upsetting because this wasn’t a cheap perfume. I’ll just have to try it again on another warm day and see if it happens again.

I’m starting to think Fragrantica ratings of a perfume aren’t accurate, cause based on the ratings of this you’d think it’s pbjectively good. It’s deifnitely NOT, it’s an acquired taste, especially not if you don’t like rose.

The most lovely and bright scent of rose. This is the scent of the heart of a blooming rose still on the bush, when you press your nose into it. It is clean and natural and spritely.

I love how bright this fragrance is on my skin. It isn't a dour aged rose, but young, bright, and feminine one.

Sillage is about arms length. I can smell it on myself when I wear it for the first hour, and then it settles into most lovely gentle fragrance at the points I've sprayed.
Go to your nearest rose garden. There's bright roses, screechy roses, opulent roses, tons of smiling faces. You smell the demure, sweet ones? That's Roses de Chloe <3
I think this was reformulated recently. A bit lighter than Chloe usually dishes out.....

Smells like falling in love. Pink roses. The scent of new books. White snow melting at the beginning of a spring...Gets you the feeling like something new and exciting is comming, yet makes you feel comforted and secure.
Very romantic and personal.

In the beggining it's fresh and natural. If only it could stay that way. The drydown is pretty generic and bothers my nose. The lasting power is not great. Too bad because it is a beutifully composed fragrance. I still love it!

this opens up with a gorgeous light and realistic rose bouquet scent (like you're spinning in a spring garden wearing a pastel and fluffy dress) but it dries down to a soapy shampoo scent that i just can't stand. if you're into clean, luxury, shampoo-esque florals than this would be a good bet, but i think i like my roses with more depth and bite.

Been searching for the "perfect" rose perfume but it was very difficult to find the right one cause most of the rose fragrances smell like old lady. I tried Roses de Chloe on paper when it was on sale but i thought it just smell like alcohol with a very expensive price tag even after reduced price.

I went home and put the paper on my nightstand, the next day i woke up and sniff the paper aaand... Voila! I have found the "perfect" rose that i've been searching for. I bought it on that same day.

Roses de Chloe does take time to reveal its beauty. When i first spray all i get is rose water & alcohol. But the drydown is AMAZING. To me it is really the "perfect" one, the rose is really there without that vintage old smell. It is very elegant, feminine, beautiful, sweet and lasting power is quite good for an EDT. It is a beautiful nice girl wearing pastel color feminine dress kind of smell.

I don't mind the price cause i get what i paid for. Will definitely buy again.

Fresh and sweet roses. Very simple and classy, I wear it during the daytime. It's always a nice moment when I catch a whiff of it from my clothing or skin. It's definitely a very girly scent. This is the first Chloe I've tried and I'm very interested, going to try Love Story next!

-Longevity about 5 hours, fresh then becoming sweet and soft

-Projection, moderate/light
Elegant, classy and natural scent of fresh cut, delicate roses mixed with bergamot and some fruity notes. It is extremely feminine and the drydown is cosy and very pleasant.
Chloe Roses de Chloe= Cartier Baiser Vole.

I sort of blind bought it after trying it on paper. It is very similar to the original 'Chloe'. But whereas the original had a bit of a sour note on me, 'Roses de Chloe' was a little sweeter. It is a very fresh authentic rose scent. But I could not detect it after an hour, which is a huge disappointment considering its price!

EDIT: I stand corrected on the projection and longevity. The bottle I bought was unboxed and I imagine the liquid that was in the tube I guess was oldish. I sprayed it again and it's all good, above average.

I was looking for a perfume for my wedding and was recommended the Chloe EDP. Although I liked it, I found it to be a little too clean/soapy and wanted something a bit warmer for my wedding.

I bought a sample of this after reading reviews and I love it! I've worn it for a couple of days as I wanted to make sure that I was 100% on this. I definitely liked it and I don't get fed up of it, which I often do quite quickly with perfumes.

I didn't consider myself a rose person before but this is just lovely. It smells romantic and can totally imagine myself wearing this on my wedding day.

I do find that I can't smell it fairly soon after application but I don't have a good sense of smell. In any case, I didn't want anything too overpowering for my wedding so this suits me just fine! Some might say it's a little safe for a wedding but that's what I'd like for a special day.

After a while, it smells warm and cosy on me with a hint of rose.

Would recommend trying it if you are on the fence!
This perfume actually smells like roses! It's fresh in the beginning and powdery soft after a few hours. What a feminine scent!
Simply the most roselike rose scent in market. Beautiful.

Such a gorgeous rose scent! This, to me, smells like Easter. A perfect spring day with pastel colors everywhere. A nice, fresh, syrupy rose with that fabulous Chloe DNA that I adore. Best rose I’ve smelled

I must agree that Chloe Roses de Chloe is a masterpiece. Just enough green notes to make it smooth and easy to wear. If you have only one rose, this would be the choice. That's about it.

The bottle is so precious. Love that ribbon; it adds femininity without being too cute.

Simply the best rose scent ever. I’ve tried Chloé perfums due to their reputation but none of them were for me - except this masterpiece. True soft wonderful rose, nothing else. No soapiness, no vintage feeling (aka granny’s scent), but lovely, romantic, bright rose.
Red, red rose and green, green grass. This is the best fragrance I've experienced in 10 years. The problem: it only smells like that for 5 minutes. Disappears completely within an hour. Arrgh!

It's a beautiful, light rose scent. Very feminine. It is not offensive and appropriate to wear around crowds as long as you don't over spray it. I saw another reviewer say that it was discontinued, however, as of posting this, it is not. I believe that reviewer meant Chloe Rose Edition.

This is the first conventional fragrance I have bought a full size of. I'd absolutely wear it to work or the store. I am a huge fan of rose scents, and I only wish that this one lasted longer.
My all-time favorite! Unfortunately, I was at a Chloe store today and the SA mentioned that it has been discontinued. :(

My favorite Rose. Grown up, not cloying. Doesn't make you think of Grandma. I can't smell the musk at all. However, i cannot smell it in less than an hour. If anyone has suggestions for a longer lasting similar scent, please share.
A lovely, cheerful rose fragrance.

I didn't know it, but I'd been waiting on this perfume for my entire life. And now I have it, just in time for spring. Gorgeous, more floral than rose-rose, makes me feel floaty and graceful. A definite spring/summer scent, needs the sun and the warmth to open it up.

Just an FYI: The noses behind Roses de Chloe are Michel Almairac and Mylène Alran according to the Chloe website while Karl Lagerfeld apparently created the original Chloe from back in the day (mid-70's). I honestly strongly like Roses de Chloe as it reminds me of my beloved childhood scent Tea Roses by Perfumer's Workshop, but I'm not sure I want to buy a full bottle of it since I'm no longer into rose scents as such.

Before testing this scent, I was already interested due to the high amount of raves on this perfume, I tested it at a store and I immediately was shocked with joy. This is the best version of a rose, picture an elegant rose that somehow has never touched dirt and smells of the citrus trees near by and you've got Chloe Roses De Chloe. It lingers on you for a while of course and this made me happy because the dry down is absolutely beautiful and natural- almost as if you were not wearing any perfume but were laying down in a field of roses. I am extremely impressed and this will be my next purchase and perhaps my new signature scent. The name somehow makes sense in correlation to the scent- I can see a Chloe wearing this, a very elegant lady. The bottle itself reminds me of another dear scent that i recently purchased which is My Burberry Blush, since they both have ribbons on the bottle. You will definitely get compliments wearing this and I can see any age wearing this. Whoever designed the scent (I believe the famous Karl Lagerfeld) put a lot of thoughts to this extravagantly delicate yet powerful scent, It is youthful but not childish. It is femininity in a bottle.


Update: I have ordered it and am very excited :)
On skin: Oh how beautiful! It smells like real roses, even after the dry down.

Just tested this, and it's way rosier than I expected. But it fades, for me, in 2 hours. Which is odd because it was super strong at first spray. There's a bit of "grandma" in this, but it's also an innocent and feminine fragrance. I will enjoy this once I figure out what to do with it. Spray my sheets or me... not sure. I tend to lean toward sexy, heavy and complicated scents or simple but rich roses like Jo Malone Velvet Rose and Oud. This is just simple and fresh.

Blind buy for me. This smells very cute: airy, roses, a bit sweet and some musk too. Very clean scent in the rose family of L'Eau d'Issey Florale and Stella McCartney. It smells like a very watered down Montale Roses Musk. It has nothing in common with the original Chloe and the longevity of this fragrance is unbelievably poor. After two hours it's completely gone. Also, this scent is so watery and gentle that it lacks sophistication. I don't feel that great wearing it and I mostly find myself spraying this after a shower or on my sheets. Maybe it'll be a nice refresher when the weather gets extremely hot but right now I'm unimpressed, should've gotten Love Story instead.

My favorite Chloe perfume.

In the other versions I smell a "laundry" detergent soapy scent that I dislike.

Chloe Rose does have a musky warm tone but not as sharp as the other Chloes IMO.

Very simple perfume overall, I don't see a change in scent over time. Simple rose. But a very nice one. Pure, quality rose, soft, romantic. Feminine but not teenage-perfume like, more elegant.

Perfect for everyday, work, any time of the year.

It does not have enormous sillage just enough, at the end of a day of wearing it it's very light but you do still get a little bit of subtle rose.

Makes me feel happy but also a little bit nostalgic and sad sometimes, I don't know why. Simple beauty.

Ordered this after watching a rose farming documentary. I felt nostalgic about my Mom´s fragrant garden roses growing up in our old house...I feel this is a true rose smell. Husband disagrees. You can definitely give it the fearless full spray blast as it is more of a light fragrant body mist that doesn´t last for goodness sake.This became suddenly a familiar smell to me and I recall owning L´Eau de Chloe, the green one with the green bow in 2015. It´s very close to the green Chloe and a similar much weaker version of the Chloe from 2008. Although it is a pretty, feminine and romantic perfume its lightness disappoints. I miss Narciso Rodriguez´Fleur Musc so much right now. So far NC fleur musc is the best Rose smell for me. I may go back to it. But first I want to try Florabotanica out from Balenciaga as I´ve heard it is a good rose smell as well. And I love carnations too. Mom grew carnations too and they smelled divine...
A pleasant light, clean rose, but it's completely gone from my skin after an hour. Yikes.

I have been wearing this little beauty for awhile now, and I must say that it has captivated my heart more and more with every single spray. I wanted to create a memory with it, so I wore this to the hospital when my father had surgery to remove cancer. I associate it now with the fact that he is cancer free. So now when I close my eyes, and inhale deeply, I think "Healed".

I have been craving rose scented fragrances a lot lately, and this one is very pretty. On my wrist it's a green litchi rose, but when I spray it in the bend of my arm it is a fruity appley rose. I love it!

Longevity is awesome on me even though it is a toilette. I get 5+ hrs. If you love being enveloped in a rose garden, go out and get this little beauty and add her to your collection. I did...
Lovely rose scent mixed with peony, it’s simple and fresh I like to use it after the shower, wear my pajama, and enjoy the feeling of being fresh and clean

This perfume is a top favorite of mine. I love rose scents, when done right. They nailed this one. It's sophisticated without being old, sexy without being obvious, loud yet very wearable. Super romantic. It's not a jammy rose or an old english rose...It is very much an actual rose garden scent...like you stopped to smell the roses.


I like it better in the Fall/Winter because I prefer something more juicy in the Spring/ Summer. The cedar in this makes it more of a warm scent and is, in my opinion, what rounds this fragrance out perfectly.
the absolute best rose perfume ive smelt. very good sillage.

I ordered a whole slew of samples online and in a group of 24 or so decants, this is one that spoke to me. Right away, I had to go back online and order a bigger bottle. I am definitely a floral gal and surely love roses, but this scent blew my socks off. She is loud but not screechy, not a soft powdery rose, but a bury your face in rose bush...thorns and all kind of scent. I don't think I can describe it as accurately as I would like, but this rose is not boring. She is not watery or old fashioned. She yells at you a bit, but just to get your attention and make you take a moment to admire her beauty. I do love this so much.

I really like the regular Chloé, but this is far better. I smell roses, fruit and a touch of wood. It’s floral, fresh and juicy. Very feminine, romantic, classy and sophisticated in my opinion. Long lasting. Not overpowering. I would wear this year round, except maybe summer. Day or night. It’s wonderful.

OMG I got a sample of it about a week ago. What a beauty it is. It is far superior than the original Chloè that was released some where in 2011 in Canada. This is more fresh and heavenly gorgeous compared to original Chloè. It has an excellent sillage and longevity ❤❤❤

Sexy without obvious intension to be sexy
Chloe de roses is very soft and tender. It ´s an amazing sensual scent. Drydown is a heaven. I see a woman who wants to be irresistible and sexy but it´s her secret. Not the first plan. Balance is crucial. Something very sexy like red lipstick, something elegant like right length of skirt, something tender like feminine tender scent, then again something sexy like smart attitude. In other words I see a sexy woman without intention to be sexy. I find it very smart. Smart and sexy. What ´s more?

The theory of smelling like a fresh boquet of red roses turned out to be nicer than really truely smelling of roses. I cannot say about the drydown I didn't last a half hour without scrubbing this off

Smell reminds me of freshly cut roses from the plant with dewdrops on them. I love rose perfumes and this one is an absolute favourite, right down to the dry down. Lasting power and projection is moderate on me.
This smells like Tommy Girl to me. Just a lighter version

This frag opens into a very green rose with lingering lemon. Hours later I got whiffs of true rose. When I woke up the next morning, I still smelled it on my camisole. I don't feel the need to own it since I have several rose scents, but if I was looking for a green-to-true rose frag, I would consider this long lasting beauty
Edit: the opening is very musky

I have just ordered this perfume and i am so excited and cant wait for my parcel. I have had its miniature for a year but couldnt decide if i neened the full bottle or not as the scent is lovely and sweet and so nostalgic. It is a crowd pleaser. The only con is that it does not stay long. It fades away in 2-3hrs max on me. Whenever i buy a perfume for me its longevity is the priority but.. not in this case!!

Packeging is 10/10

I love it :-)

Let me preface by saying that I'm not a fan of rose scents at all...I get flashbacks to the era when everyone in my office was going through a Stella McCartney phase at once. I associate the smell of roses with a heavy, suffocating cheapness. Imagine my surprise when I got a sample of this and fell in love with it! It smells of roses, certainly - but in a very soft, fresh and infinitely wearable way. Several hours after spritzing, I keep sniffing my arms and the fragrance has morphed into a delicious shower clean citrusy rose. I could definitely see this one making it's way into my Spring/Summer rotation. Finally found a rose to love!
Love this! It's hard for me to find roses fragrances that aren't repulsive or overpowering. This is one of the best rose fragrances I've ever had.

I'm sitting in a glorious English garden with roses dewy and fresh from a gentle rain all around, ahhh ;) Haha, not really but that's how this delicious blend of floral and fruit smells on my skin! Actually, I'm on my patio with a nice glass of Chardonnay with cutoff jean shorts and a tank top! Oh, and it's 102 here right now! But the freshness of Chloe Roses evokes a fresh, creamy and very feminine vibe of soft flower petals floating around me. This is not a simple rose fragrance. On my skin, it really smells like freshly cut roses on a dewy spring day. The interesting addition of tarragon in the top, adds a lovely balance to the sweet litchi and citrusy lemon--perfect. It may be the cedar in the heart that gives this beautiful scent it's freshness. Also, the fruits chosen here: apple, currant, peach really help to keep this a youthful rose scent. Love that!! Truly, I'm loving this rose Chloe so much right now and haven't yet experienced the warmth of the dry down with that great musky-woods blend. Looking forward to it...and one more sip of Chardonnay. Cheers my friends, this one is a keeper.

The scent of wild rose (Dog rose - Rosa canina) + musk.
Not rose petal jam or rose water.
Color: mexican pink.

For years I avoided rose scents, as in my mind I pictured geriatric homes heavily scented in rose and lavendar pot pourri. My mother use to work in a nursing home & on occasions when I would visit her work place, the scent of rose & lavendar was everywhere and seemed to hang around like a bad stench.
This is my very first Rose based perfume, which I would never in a million years would have thought of trying, had it not been gifted to me by my then 15 year old niece.
Thank goodness, I absolutely love it! The top note is definitely rose, however it feels bright and fresh and lingers enough for you to enjoy it without feeling overwhelmed. (Note, I am not one to spray heavily on any of my perfumes, as I don't want to smell like I was too lazy to shower and just doused myself in perfume.) I love smelling this scent, it makes me feel calm and relaxed for some reason. Thank heavens for my neice as she has opened my senses to more rose based scents. I am now testing out rose offerings from Diptyque & Serge Lutens which I hope to own one day.
A romantic simple loud floral that is somewhat sparkling. It is in the same class as Miss Dior Blooming Boquet just not as sweet. Roses de Chloe is very pretty and really nice to wear in the spring.

Just like the original Chloé, only more rose. Just as clean, fresh and beautiful. Perfect for hot summer days. Reminds me of the Atlas Mountain Rose line from The Body Shop, only a bit more sophisticated. I'd say the Atlas Mountain Rose body butter would complement this perfume very well.

What human being doesn’t want to smell like a bouquet of freshly-cut roses every once in awhile?! Well maybe I’m pushing it, but goodness this is divine! One of the freshest, cleanest, most natural rose fragrances I have had the pleasure of smelling in a long time. Slightly powdery but no plastic, dirt, or play-dough here! I applaud Chloe for this one. Sillage and Longevity are fabulous for a floral. Masterfully blended. No single note stands out except the rose, but it’s balanced somehow. Classy, fresh, and romantic. I can’t stop sniffing my wrist!

This is a lovely and fresh rose scent. Personally, I will not be buying because I like more dirt, skank, and depth to my roses. But this is perfect for young professionals and even high school girls who really want to smell sophisticated and fresh without being overwhelming.

Well done.

Fresh, clean, and soapy rose....reminds me a lot of dolce and gabanna rose the one, with bite. Perfect summer scent for when you want to smell clean with a little extra. However, I will not buy a FB because it lasts a total of 3 hours on my skin, at the very most. Lovely scent, but not worth the price tag.

Tender Powder Rose
I remember the little rose garden my grandmother used to have in my childhood. It was very small but through my girl ´s eyes I took it as beautiful royal garden. Chloe de roses reminds me the natural smell of rose so much. I have smelled some rose note perfumes and Chloe de roses is the most genuine. The opening is a little bit generic but after a few seconds there is the rose beauty. Very feminine delicate young in heart fragrance.
On the dry down, this reminds me of stella by stella mccartney perfume. I love both.

This reminds me of stella mc cartney
This is beautiful smells so similar smell the rose all day!

JustaPixel, try Mira by Korres, it is a light, spicy musky rose, lasts for 5/7 hours on my skin with subtle but persistant projection. Inexpensive and made from natural ingredients, as per Korres work philosophy.
Also, have you tried Pleats Please L'Eau? It is a rose based soft perfume, ideal for summer, really delicious and, in Brazil, quite inexpensive and with great quality. Pleats Please EdP is a violet based scent, EdT a sweet pea and orange flower one and L'Eau a rose based scent. For me this is the best. Green light rose with a 5 to 7 hour longevity.
To me this smells like a very juvenile fruity-sweet fragrance. Something a 16 year old would wear. When it settles it shows more floral notes but is still very fruity-sweet heavy.
Deeply confused by the reviews calling this too sweet. To my nose, a photorealistic garden salad, heavy on the dill.
This starts off very tonka, heavy and dusty. Then it becomes woody then it's the same detergent fruity rose as always. All the flankers end up smelling like the original in the end. Unnecessary.

Unrecognisable as Chloé.
Smells more like Chloé Lumineuse.
It's like a step further into modernity for 💰💰💰 and it's just a bottle of sweetness. Not much more.

What a shame...

It’s a basic orange blossom/vanilla blend, way too sweet for my taste. The rose is nowhere to be found, and the whole thing feels crude - not elegant, not refined. A total disappointment for me; how can you mess up a perfume with such a lovely note pyramid?

Next.

I have the entire Chloe line and have been a long time fan, however this fragrance is absolutely disgusting. There are just no other words to describe it. It smells like someone spilled a fruity scented nail polish remover at a gas station.

I looove this!!! I am a big fan of Chloe and this flanker I do like a lot! I think it has more depth, more of an evening vibe, as Chloe EDP is more versatile, more light and ethereal, Le Parfum is more dense and I imagine this one perfectly as an evening scent. But not like clubbing or anything like that, more like elegant, luxurious events. This is amazing. I do not think this is overly sweet, at first I thought it should have some woody notes for sure as it is truly a more dense and opulent scent, but turns out there is none. Maybe it's the tonka note. Overall, the vanilla and tonka do not make this scent overly obnoxious and offensively sweet, I honestly found this very luxurious, high class perfume if you can call it that way.
Beautiful longevity and projection, Stays a long time, even till next day and lingers in the air. Love it! No matter what generation you are, you are young or in your elder years, I can totally imagine this perfume on all age groups!

Pretty, easy going rose scent. Nice but forgettable. The orange blossom note adds a slight bitter, green touch, but the dry down is woody, powdery and vanillic. It’s less bright and floral than the other flankers, and goes into a more generic rose/orange blossom/vanilla direction. It’s also less sweeter than the OG Chloe, which I don’t like about it.

Nothing to write home about really, it is simple, linear, clean and feminine. I like it, but way less than the OG or the Absolu versions, so I won't get a full bottle. I have many scents with a similar profile and to me personally Chloe Le Parfum 2025 is kinda boring and uninspiring! And massively overpriced for the average performance..

From someone who is not so much into floral scent, I love this flanker! At first spray, I could smell the Chloe DNA in it, but it was a tad bit heavier and less sweet on my skin. After the dried down... holy molly macaroni! The vanilla started to pick up, and it turned powdery on me (which I love). I also smelled a mixture of citric and herbal scents that lingered for the rest of the day. I could even smell it the next morning!
Definitely a fragrance to go during my cold days!

The first five minutes or so was very annoying, maybe because of the sharpness of the orange flowers. But it developed to a different thing, a bit more rounded and rose is there too but more like in the background. I feel like it has that soapy clean vibe but not overly so, and I feel like it's floral and fresh as well as that.

i love love love this perfume
it lasts so long, by the ed of the day when you totally forget about it, you can still smell it on your skin

I can really smell the chloe dna in the backround but with a warmer, sweeter frame. I really love it.
I dont understand the low rating at all🤷🏼♀️
Its just so lovely🥰

I’ve always liked the Chloe fragrance dna but to me they are all basically the same and I’ve never really smelled one that I really wanted. Reading the reviews below didn’t really spur me on to buy this particular one but strangely enough I was enticed to buy the 10ml version. This definitely has the aforementioned Chloe dna but has a Delina vibe going on, but it feels & smells more timeless, a rose that is not too juvenile or too old, very classy. I’ve put on one spray and it projects nicely, longevity is also pretty good. Husband LOVES it, he’s used to me wearing something different pretty much all the time and hardly ever compliments me, but this is just such a pleasing and uncomplicated scent that it really spoke to him 😊. Is it really original? No. If you have any of the other Chloe frags would you need this one as well? Nooo. But if you like the dna but never felt compelled to actually buy one, try this one, I bet it will not disappoint.

The first minutes are screechy, pungent, odd—pretty bad. So bad that I wondered, why, oh why, did this perfume ever get the green light to be released? With thousands of new launches every year, how could they make such a wasteful move? Didn’t they want to create something attractive? Didn’t they want to sell more bottles?

More or less at the same time, I tested a few other perfumes on my skin and then left home. After about 20 minutes, while driving, I suddenly found myself surrounded by a juicy, sensual cloud. At first, I didn’t know which of the 4–5 perfumes was the source of such gorgeousness. But my memory kicked in, and in less than a minute I remembered exactly which spot I had sprayed it on. It was Chloe Le Parfum—the very one with the worst opening of them all.

This fruity, flowery bloom was such a surprise that I went straight to the nearest shopping center to test it again, more thoroughly. I wanted to wear it fully—on the neck, behind the ears, in the hair—to feel it better and make sure it was really this one and not another.

The fruity-sweet molecules form a jammy, rich accord with the woody-musk notes, reminiscent of Xerjoff Muse. The drydown, however, is drier, less spectacular, with too much white amber for my taste and not enough juiciness. I’m on the fence—but for those few hours of heart notes, I might actually consider it the best release of 2025 so far.

I recently added Chloe Le Parfum to my collection.
For me, Chloe Le Parfum is a more mature version of Chloe. Or rather, it's like a combo of Chloe Intense and Chloe Lumineuse. More perfect and round. With just a hint of fruity sweetness and vanilla.
On my skin, the tonka bean note stands out, and together with the Chloe rose, they make the scent subtle and elegant.

I have Chloe Intense, and the intensity of the raspberry annoys me – it's too childish, sweet, and girly. Lumineuse was even worse – I could only smell on my skin a plastic, artificial vanilla all the time. I had to give it to my sister because I couldn't stand it. Surprisingly, it smells completely different on her – joyful and optimistic.

So, Chloe Le Parfum is THE version of Chloe for fall and winter. It has all my favorites notes – tonka bean, orange blossom, and rose. (for spring and summer - Chloe Naturelle or Naturelle Intense)

I'm going to Venice this fall, and this scent will be perfect company.
This is smells so bad, nauseous and migraine inducing
Wish they would bring back Narcisse

Smells so similar to the last L’eau edp intense but without the raspberry opening changed to a woody vanilla base, I smell the ambroxan aka cashmere here too…

This is quite boring to be honest

Hmmmm first impression is quite redundant if you already have the intense version from last year~ it just smells different from the start but the dry down is almost 85% the same IMO

How a perfume can be so yummy! Totally delicious. Complement getters with every spray. Staying power five hour but I notice stay longer in my clothes. Open a kind odd but after 5 minutes is good and after that I couldn’t stop smelling my wrist. I prefer wearing it at night and planning to use it for fall. Too good for my office. Packages is good have a good spray like all Chloé perfumes.
Sillage incredible-the first three hours. I have to admit this is my favorite, I am enjoy it so much!
This was the perfect gift this year!

I honestly do not get ANY vanilla from this... it is even more intense version of the 2024 INtense release. It is nuclear. It's still on my skin after shower. Not sure I like it - it almost is like strong woody/spicy... it's weird and not a blind buy even if you love chloe (my fave is the original EDP)
I've got it. I hate it. Smells like raspberry water. And that's it. Very odd.

Didn't try it yet, but come on, it's Lumineuse with orange blossom? Going and going in circle! There are only 3 notes left in perfume drawers at Chloé ?!

Edit : wow it is awful, smells simply like obnoxious dusty sugar. No

At least the other one before smells a little bit tender and comforting...
ANOTHER vanilla perfume!!! please can we try something new...
We want something new Chloe!!! Stop releasing meaningless flankers please… or bring the love collection back!
How are houses and consumers not bored of vanilla already lmao
I didn't like it strong ugly scent

This is my comfort fragrance <3
I always feel cared and effortless when smelling this.
It's so gentle but intoxicating at the same time.
Like smelling a jasmine flower 🪷

i am so fricking done with people using ‘old lady’ or ‘grandma’ as a descriptive word for perfume. all you women will be an old lady one day, if youre lucky, and will have to read people describing what they dont like as ‘old lady’.

I asked for this perfume (un-sniffed) for Christmas when it first came out. Tried it on and enjoyed the sweetness of the dates and the jasmine. I then put it away and tried wearing it in autumn/winter but found it overpowering and sickening. I have very frequent migraine attacks that mess with my sense of smell, and this was one that I really couldn't stand around an attack. Nevertheless, I left it til the heat of summer, and I was so glad I did. The longevity was amazing for my skin, 8 or so hours. I am no longer able to discern a lot of the specific notes in a frag, but again the sweetness of this really hits beautifully for me on a hot day. Another win by Chloe 🩷

FULL BOTTLE WORTHY. One of the best fruit scents I’ve ever smelled. It’s a sweet, creamy, resinous, fruity-floral. Slight tropical vibe. Well blended. Just as floral as it is fruity, but there’s a brilliant bite to it that propels the fruit to the forefront. It’s more peach than plum on my skin. Brings peach Jolly Ranchers to mind. I also get the deliciousness of a freshly lit cigar from it. Candied jasmine, too. Could pass for a tart peach flanker of ROOM1015 Jasmine Freak. Haven’t smelled all that much from the house of Chloe, but this is my favorite yet. So good I can’t imagine it gets any better. Gorgeous and addicting. I want it. MASTERPIECE

We’re witnessing a beautiful evolution in the Chloé line - a gradual shift in notes toward the "Egyptian" theme that eventually lands us in Nuit d’Égypte. It’s like a slow gradient, and I have to say, it’s a really interesting concept the house has developed.

I’m usually not a fan of flankers. But Chloé is one of the very few brands that actually do them well. Not too many, and when they release one, it makes sense. Like it’s part of a broader narrative, not just another random spin-off. I enjoyed both Naturelle and Naturelle Intense. The Intense version is a bit sweeter and woodier, but ultimately, they share the same genetics. Very pretty. Very well done.
I don’t think I will ever stop purchasing this fragrance. I absolutely adore it! I have received so many compliments on it.

Chloe Nomade Jasmin Naturel Intense starts bright with a tangy mirabelle and fresh pear. This is quickly overtaken by sweet dates (actually on my skin it feels more like honey). The jasmine note here is rendered creamy by another white flower, probably tiara, gardenia or maybe tuberose. The base has oak moss way in the background (unlike the original Nomade), the patchouli is almost nonexistent. What I get most, on my skin, is a powdery smooth wood in the dry down. It is an elegant scent in an elegant flacon but unfortunately, it has poor performance, the name should have stopped before the Intense part.
Although I LOVE white flowers, I prefer the OG to this flanker. It’s more unique.

I am a fan of Chloé, many thanks for the nice and clean perfumes they make, but I'm wondering what's going on with those Nomade flankers...
They are overly sweet and flat and for Nomade jasmin intense, I don't know what I'm smelling. It's like jasmine sprinkled with vanilla in some hot water and with a big splash of honey.

It would be a nice concept of a perfume but it's not at all charming. It reminds me of a jasmine roll-on I once bought and was bored of it after one week.

I'll finish my 5ml sample that I had to pay for, because I appreciate the natural side of it and the fact that there's no trace of alcohol. And I don't mind it's lack of projection, a perfume that doesn't tire the senses.

I guess it'll stay 2 years on the shelves (if they distribute it in shops and not only online as I see it's the case).

I wish Chloé would focus on creating a new solid perfume because they only have 2 remaining pillars : Chloé signature and Nomade.

I do enjoy sweet perfumes, but this one takes sweetness to an entirely different level. Sometimes, less is more and I truly wish this fragrance embraced that philosophy. Instead, it comes across as overwhelmingly sweet, and not in a charming gourmand way, but rather in a cloying, almost excessive manner.

The opening is particularly sharp likely due to the combination of dates and jasmine, which overpower everything else and leave the remaining notes lost in the background. I do get a trace of sandalwood as it dries down, but by then, the sweetness has already worn me out.

I’m a huge admirer of the original Nomade … it’s a scent I love to the core. But unfortunately, none of the flankers have lived up to it for me. I do own the Egypt version, which feels far more balanced. This one, sadly, just didn’t work for me.

– Bhavna Darira Chesan

If you’re a fan of jasmine & white florals, this is a must have for your collection.

This is personally my signature scent. In the warmer months the pear & mirabelle notes are bright & the vanilla is delightfully creamy. In the winter months the date, sandalwood & okamoss is prominent on me and is a “sticky date pudding” type aroma. Both warm and cool the jasmine & freesia comes through heady & creamy, but also transitions the complexity & seasonal mutability.

It is not a scent appropriate for people who strongly dislike white florals. But this scent I find a delight all year round, day or night. I’m often complimented & asked what scent am I wearing. A somewhat whimsical part of me thinks there’s a signature fragrance for everyone, where they can wear it anytime of day or year and it just compliments their personal chemistry & for me I’ve found it with this one. This pure enjoyment that I have & multiple compliments I receive may make me bias in my review.

I remember the first day I tried it as a tester. My husband (fiancé at the time) would not stop saying how good I smelled & he asked me to wear it on our wedding day. It’s definitely a scent that would have the longevity and the right balance for a wedding fragrance

I have a 1oz of the regular nomad and a 1.6oz this one. And the regular is sweet fruity light easy.

This one is deep, sexy, more complex. You have to like Jasmine! I find it more rich with the dates and the freesia keeps it from getting too heavy and syrupy. I like it much much more!
Soft and sweet, the jasmine is well balanced with a vanilla base. If it wasn't designer price I would snap it up in a heartbeat.

I didn’t like it. It has a smell of an “old lady”. In my early 30s I don’t find this perfume appealing. It’s nauseating and suffocating as well. I was trying to wear this in the cold weather and I was choking over this smell. Can’t imagine to wear it in hot weather. It is sweet, and I usually like sweet parfumes, but this one is unpleasant for me.
I got a sample of this, and it kinda reminds me of Mancera's Velvet Vanilla and it changed my whole perspective on it :D Beautiful fragrance!

I must admit, I had no prior interest in the Chloé Nomade line, but this version completely changed my perspective. Nomade Jasmin Naturelle Intense is a stunning fragrance that captivated me easily.

The jasmine here is fresh, lush, and radiant , balanced beautifully by a sweet, balsamic base that adds warmth and depth. Unlike many mainstream designer fragrances, this one stands out with its refined quality and elegance.

It clings to my skin all day, leaving a soft, inviting trail with every whiff. Each encounter with its scent lifts my mood and brings a sense of joy.

If you love jasmine and crave something warm and sophisticated, this one is absolutely worth experiencing.

I wanted to get Nomade Naturelle EDP which lacks the patch and pear - both not safe notes with me, but a review described a smoky scent like burning wood and I was hesitant to drop the money on it. Dates as a note is weird, sometimes sour like ambroxan as in DUA Ajwa Dates or sour-balsamic and slightly smoky as in DUA Desert Mirage. I hadn't realized that dates are sour as a note.

So I got DUA's version called Intense Natural Jasmine Voyage. It is missing some notes, the mirabelle, freesia and oakmoss. It is an indolic jasmine scent with a VERY balsamic quality making it perfectly oriental, triggering vivid visuals in my brain of hot deserts and refreshing oases. The pear makes it sour and slightly spicy as in salty and the dates add the sour like ambroxan and almost smoky effect but no actual burning scent or obnoxiously smoky - I despise smoky scents. The dates note is rather a vanilla-syrupy slightly 'smoky' sour element in it, but quite dry too and the patchouli adds some subtle earthiness without being obnoxious. The vanilla in conjunction with the dates note is giving the syrupy balsamic vein that is almost boozy. For 21 bux I am not complaining, it's very nice, quite addicting if you are into mysterious oriental warm aromatic jasmine scents with a refreshing floral essence. It also doesn't smell masculine maybe as it lacks the oakmoss, even though I love oakmoss and all mossy scents even the manly ones. I am a fan of the OG Nomade btw, but I needed something new cuz I get bored too easily. In fact it reminds me of DUA Desert Mirage which is kinda like Armani Si due to being sour with the cassis and ambroxan, without the leathery obnoxious cistus and the rose. This is smoother than Armani Si, even though it is also sour, but much better, no cigarette smell from this, also not ambery sour as BBW Ivory Cashmere and I get sour cigarette vibes from that one too. So this is a total winner for me.

To be honest I have no idea whether I love this perfume or not at all.

I have a small test bottle and it is so very sticky sweet, cloying and maybe even a little tacky. The scent is huge on me and it feels thick and heavy, think of warm languid thighs on an overly hot summer evening. At times, the smell is a little nauseating, overwhelming and suffocating but at the same time addictive, incredibly addictive. Maybe it's a bit of sexiness in a bottle, still noticeable and sticking on the body.

Thus I put it on my wishlist anyway (grin)

Nice creamy jasmine with a sweeter base and some tropical nuances (probably ylang-ylang, even though it’s not listed). It has a sweeter base, which is also a bit balsamic. I think it’s a very well balanced fragrance. Definitely smells expensive.
The combination of syrupy dates and white florals causes this fragrance to smell like pure honey. Sweet, sticky, bright and floral, with virtually undetectable base notes.

I recently smelled Chloé Nomade Jasmine Naturelle and the Intense version back to back and I'm not sure which one I love more. They were a lot similar, only I find this one a little sweeter and overall bolder. They gave me a tester paper, and two days later the paper still smells like it was just sprayed on. But I guess it's a different story when it comes to our bodies lol. Anyway, it's not a fragrance I would choose in my late 20s, I find it more of a 35-40s because it's still floral, sweet, feminine, a fragrance for a younger person, but it's a smell you choose when you change perspectives a little and want to get away from the overly girly vibes. If that's your vibe go for it, everyone will stop and admire believe me. BUT, also go and test the EDP version, it's worth it.
I like the original Nomade Naturalle better. Maybe it's the pear but something in this one pushes it over the edge of too sweet.

Is the patchouli in the room with us now? How about the moss? Nomade J.N.I. is just jasmine (jasmine that smells like tuberose and gardenia.) This is boring. I'm disappointed.

Update: I love it layered over Liz Taylor Passion. But why buy this if it doesn't stand on its own? The quality is there, longevity is great, but ultimately, I cannot recommend Jasmin Naturel Intense.

As an absolute lover of Jasmine, I thought I was going to love this! However, this is that off putting, indolic and annoying "in your face" Jasmine I've heard people talk about it! My skin always amplifies that note and, in the case of this perfume, it smells musty, rancid and quite frankly "old lady" dated on me, yuck! I agree with Jus de Rose, though discontinued, if you can find Nomade eau de parfum Naturelle, get that one, the Jasmine is beautiful and the sweetness and creaminess are there to support the floral and fruit.

Smells like honey to me! Very sweet, almost sickly sweet. Mood lifting. It's not bad but I don't want to smell like it. Makes me think of scented candles or scented hand soap bars, doesn't work as a perfume.
