This was lovely until I realized that it smells like bananas :D I sold it. I really don't want to smell like bananas. If you want something that is heavy on the sweet dates, go for Lattafa Khamrah - that perfume gave me what I wished for from this one.

I cant find much patchouli or sandalwood characterized in Nomade. The sweetness is overpowering. Im writing this in mid-July summer... Ill try again in the winter.

Side note: Bees (and wasps) LOVE IT. They keep sniffing me 🥴

I'm not a connoisseur of all notes and their combination but I feel 100 % that this fragrance projects on my skin the same scent that Kenzo Jungle Elephant fragrance does (I used to love Elephant in my youth days). After 30 minutes from the moment spraying this fragrance on my arm in the shop, I got so drawn back to something so well known and then I understood that this is Elephant but in a more gentle , a bit sweeter &b creamier way. I love this fragrance but I'll purchase it in winter time , in summer it is too harsh and heavy.
Smells like coca cola
I am so in love with this scent. I find it very sophisticated and unique. Very well blended and addictive. It has become my signature scent.

Although I love this
But it’s too sweet for me to use it in summer
Interesting but too sweet.

What and where is the jasmine?
It smells like a warm vanilla custard with dates, lot of dates. I don't think i want to smells like a fresh baked cream puff 🙃

I should start by saying that it's probably about me, but this scent is overwhelming. I'm suffocating because of it. And I suspect that jasmine is the culprit (or maybe it's a tuberose). I have such a problem with this note that I rarely enjoy it, though there are exceptions. Unfortunately, Nomade Jasmine is not one of them. And I really wanted to like it. Sadly, the sweetness of dates didn't help.

i was influenced by youtube to buy this. so, after reading reviews and knowing i like chloe nomade, and wanting to have a flanker to add to the collection, (like a stamp collection 😂) and not being anywhere near a store to smell this, and not finding it online anywhere, i blind bought it straight from chloe. i thought it would be a sweet jasmin with some nomade notes. it all sounded good to me. dates, jasmin, mirabelle, etc, etc. on me, it’s mint, then an unusual sweetness, then a faint shy jasmin. i dont know why im getting mint. so weird. i need to see how others smell this on me. either my nose is missing some things or exaggerating other notes, or my skin is failing me. why??? we had such high hopes of welcoming you into our collection, but, now we just dont know….
Unfortunately, the Nomade Jasmin Naturel (EDP) fragrance is not described separately.

This is so tropical and rich, boardline gourmand. It does open with a bubbglegummy feel, probably the combo of dates and mirabelle plum mixed with the jasmin. Then it settles into a very rich and creamy tropical scent.
Not gonna lie, it reminds me of M. Micallef Ylang in Gold, which I own and love as well. In the drydown, they are quite similar. Good lasting power and moderate sillage I would say.
Great summer scent! Give it a sniff.

چند روزی هست که دارم تستش میکنم
عطر بخاطر وجود یاس و خرما خیلی حال هوای شرقی داره و برای ماهایی که ایرانییم رایحه به نسبت آشناییه
حدود چهار دقیقه اولی که روی پوست اسپری میکنم یه رایحه ای حس میکنم تو عطر که دقیقا نمیدونم از چی میاد ولی زیاد برام خوشایند نیست ،یچیزی که انگار بوی کثیفی میده
خوشبختانه خیلی زود این نت کنار میکشه و جاشو میده به یه رایحه یاس دلنشین همرا با عسل که یجورایی گورمانده

در کل بشدت عطر دخترونه ای و خیلی دوسش دارم
انگار اعتیاد آوره
یکی از چیزایی که باعث شده انقد جذبش بشم اینه که در طول عمر عطر روی پوست کاملا تغییراتش مشخصه و تاپ نت و میدل نت و بیس کاملا شخصیت های جداگونه خودشونو دارن
تنها مشکلم باهاش همون رایحه چند دقیقه اوله و موندگاری نسبتا کمش
چون رو پوست من حدود چهار ساعت میمونه و بعد اون هیچ اثری ازش نیست که خیلی برام ناراحت کننده س

Blind Buy experience: This stuff is goooood!! I'm a lover of tropical scents. Beachy, summery scents are my thing. Everyone seems to love their wintertime scents and I'm all about the summer fragrances and I have my fair share of them. I live in the desert, so I get plenty of use for them and not so much use for fall/winter scents. With that being said, I had to come back here to look at the pyramid because I don't recall tiare, frangipani, or coconut being in this one, but it smells beachy, and I love that! It's a smooth, creamy jasmine, a very classy take on this style of perfumery. I suppose it's just the combination of mirabelle, jasmine, dates, pear, and freesia that's doing it for me. This is blended so well, none of the notes are dominant and the base is there just to support the heart and top to provide longevity and stability.

The patchouli is almost undetectable here so if you're not a patch fan, fear not. The oakmoss complements the scent to provide some class with a nice earthy touch. I would have never known there were dates in this had I not come here, nothing like the dates in Kamrah. I suppose they are used for sweetness and an earthy, fruitiness since the whole nomad line is about elegant earthiness. I just keep thinking when I smell this, I smell class. It's classy, but also youthful, feminine, and sexy. Not easy to do all of those at once, but they pulled it off here and I say kudos! I say this is good for anyone 25+. It might be a bit too sweet for women over 70, but if you like sweet fragrances and you're over 70, you do you! I'm just thinking about the women I know over 70 and I know most of them are not big fans of overly sweet perfumes. By no means is this overly sweet, at least for me, but it definitely has that sweetness of a floral/fruity fragrance.

I love this one. I keep going back to smell my hand! Definitely blind buy safe, as long as you don't have an aversion to tropical florals because that's what this scent is. It's jasmine disguised as frangipani here!

Jasmin Naturel intensified, meaning: again dates, mirabelle, jasmine, but less green and more vanilla sweet. I, again, detect the strawberry bubblegum/tuberose here, with addition with cinnamon and a herbal note.
As silly as it sounds, this reminds me of my dentist office.
But even though, these new Nomade flankers are not appealing for me. I do not like these particular blends, sorry.

I love it so much! I like all fragrances made by chloe. But it will be my favorite odour forever. It makes me feel so warm, safe, elegant, calm. İt is like home or someone who is beloved but not seen for a while.
This is a BEAUTIFUL fragrance! More mature than youthful so I’m gonna gift this to my mum. To me it smells like safety and home. Absolutely gorgeous!

Rating: 💮🍯🍵🥛 ⛪💮
Do I like it: So-so, i feel sticky
Who it is: An older church lady offering you green milk tea with honey and dates after she decorated the church in flowers for her daughter's wedding
Smells I get: freshly cut jasmine, honey, earth, dates, oh jesus more honey, so sticky, will it stop
🍯🍯 🥵 🍯🍯 help
Meyer's Briggs type: ISFJ, INFJ

Realistic, pollen-y jasmine cut from the bush, with a slight dash of honey in the back. Slightly church-y, earthly and evocative of opulent, dark, thick chestnut honey or dates. Think a jar of dates in a western church full of white wedding flowers. 💮🍯⛪🍵 💮

My mom also smells green milk tea with violets and coconut we usually drink in autumn, I can't unsmell it now. Probably better in colder weather.

Edit: Lasts veeerry llong

In a same order I got M.Micallef Ylang in gold and Chloe Nomade Jasmine Naturale Intense both blind buys and my box arrived this afternoon. To my surprise, despite having different notes I found they smell quite similar being YiG fruitier and my favorite so far. This is my first impression, I might decide to layer both for more longevity.
I smell a mix of white flowers (tuberose?), the ‘mature’ sweet smell of Juicy Couture’s Couture Couture (which I loved!) and a dash of Narciso’s Musc Noir Rose. I like it!
Lovely, youthful, sweet candy jasmine. Reminds me of hard sweet candies Bonpari. Energizing scent.

Not to be dramatic, but I am in love. Madly, hopelessly in love. I'm smelling a mix of gourmand dates, creamy sandalwood, and vanilla mixing with some bubblegum-esque white florals. The Egyptian jasmine is exotic and potent. It's intoxicating, really. It smells really warm and comforting, like being out in the sun. It's really an absolutely stunning fragrance with fantastic longevity. It smells both bright and solar and dark and exotic (from the Egyptian jasmine) at the same time. It also gets an exotic flair from the spices that come a bit after the top notes settle down. I am half tempted to buy three backup bottles of this so that I always have it. Sometimes, I'll wear this in the evening, and it'll still be going strong in the morning after I've slept in it.

I love this it’s stunning. Such a unique scent. It reminds me a bit of Kayali utopia vanilla coco but with a cinnamon note even though it’s not listed. This is sweet and sticky like the dates and it lasts very well on the skin and creates a long lasting scent bubble. The bottle is really beautiful and looks so nice on my perfume tray. I’d say this is more of an autumn / winter scent, quite sticky sweet in a good way, the previouse one Chloe nomade naturel is more summer / spring, coconut beachy scent. both are very different to each other so you could own both. Good to compare the two.

This is very strong and potent, super long lasting >8 hours. The scent is very bright and the white florals are a little bubblegummy, a little like petit Fracas and even like Guerlain Terracotta. I think the scent profile is very feminine and wearable, but unfortunately it has migraine triggering potential on me.

I absolutely love this scent; it was a blind purchase and I'm glad I took the plunge. This is definitely an autumn and winter scent; cosy and comforting. There is something in the scent which gives me bonfire/open fire vibes - not strongly but every now and then. It's gone seven hours since I sprayed this perfume on, and it's still going strong. I think the date and mirabelle combination, together with the sandalwood and vanilla, are just heavenly (I sometimes find mirabelle in some perfumes jarring and overpowering, but not here). I will definitely be investing in another bottle of this at some point, and would like to try some of the other Chloe perfumes.

I have never been more obsessed and thoroughly enchanted by a line of fragrances before. Every single Nomade incarnation has been beautiful. It has been a true delight getting to know each one.
Who knew jasmine and dates could be such a mouthwatering combination? There is a sort of soapiness to it, though (to my nose, at least). It’s not overwhelming. It just reads as fresh.

BEAUTIFUL!!!! This was my first successful blind buy purchase in 2024 (and it's still January ☺️)
Nevertheless, I was completely smitten from the first spray. On my skin, this fragrance develops into a soft and sweet floral perfume that screams FEMININITY. The jasmine and the freesia are blended to perfection! It's so unexpectedly good that it could definitely be a signature scent. Smells much more expensive than what I paid for it. A year-round winner for sure!

Disclaimer: I own the normal version of this perfume which I don't find on fragrantica the Chloe Nomade jasmin naturelle not the intense.
This was an impulsive acquisition 😅. I went to the store wanting to try D&G the only one intense and Burberry Godess but neither one convinced me enough to buy them. Of all the designer perfumes the Chloe Nomade bottles caught my eye and I randomly picked this one. OMG it was love at first sniff. Very sweet, potent and floral. Sillage and longevity are amazing for a designer perfume. The initial sweet note remains throughout and even the drydown on my skin smells more sweet than floral which I love. I hope they don't discontinue this fragrance because I'll definitely repurchase in the future.

OMG Hear me out... this is the designer sibling of Amouage Guidance. They are quite similar (i am literally smelling them both now), not identical, but more like cousins. They share similar notes: pear in the top notes, jasmine in the middle notes (here, dates add sweetness, while in Amouage, it's osmanthus), and sandalwood and vanilla in the base. If you don't have the budget for Amouage, go for this one; they give off exactly same vibe. I still think Amouage is more complex, but remove the nuts, saffron, and Labdanum, and it becomes Chloe Nomade. To be honest, I even prefer Chloe because Guidance, with hazelnuts in top nots, has this rotting, spoiled smell that Chloe doesn't have.

By the way, out of all the designer perfumes I've tried, these are among the few I adore (maybe 3-4 that deserve my approval out there). They are not linear and quite complex in a non-offensive way. Definitely worse its money.

The first time I tried this I just got a sickly vanilla bomb. But the sample has been sitting patiently next to my Nomade edp so I tried it again on a cold, rainy Winter's day and it was like a sweet, spicy festive hug. In the cooler weather I can smell the pear and the dates for the first time and they make for quite an addictive combination. I cannot smell the Nomade DNA at all, but I it has that Chloe trademark of taking something sweet and feminine and making it grown-up at the same time. My sister used to love Dior Addict and I'm thinking she would like this as a more mellow, sophisticated vanilla/white floral scent.

I feel like it will become my new trick pick. Such a beautiful perfume. Firstly, the pear-floral mixture is so calming and unique. After 10-20 min the beautiful sweet part begins, where it smells like tea with sweet spices or Apfelstrudel. I feel like wearing it every season, since the jasmine and light pear would fit hot seasons too. At the end, there is a nice transition from pear to vanilla, reminding of the ice cream that’s served together with the Apfelstrudel. One spray lasted almost 8h on my skin. My boyfriend hates perfumes and gets headaches even from the most natural smelling ones, but this one and Coffee Break from MMM are the only ones that he likes, so definitely also a sign for FB for me.

I feel like this perfume is perfect to wear for calm/cozy moments or when you want to feel like that. I imagine it fitting every age and being worn by a girl/woman in cozy and soft neutral clothes. Soft sweaters in winter and flowing very light linen or satin in summer. The clothes that give a delightful feeling on skin, same as this perfume gives you a charming feeling when wearing it.
10/10
I don't know what happened, when I first tried this I liked it a lot. Now it reminds me 100% of a bug spray and once I realised that that's all I smell. I need to get rid off this ASAP

Very pleasant and sensual. It is definitely sweet but in a mature way. I think it's the dates note here. Dates add sweetness but in a dark and sultry way. The scent is certainly nice but I can barely recognize the Nomade DNA here. If anything, this feels somewhat close to Supreme Bouquet by YSL if you take away the tuberose and amp up the jasmine, and even more similar to each other on the dry down. I prefer the original Nomade or Nomade Absolu over this, but I am biased as I prefer the classic chypre profile. Nomade and Nomade Absolu are closer to a classic chypre than this one. Regardless, this is a grown, intimate and poised scent that I think everybody should like on themselves and others. I do feel that this could've been a starter of Chloe's new fragrance line instead of a flanker.

Beyond testing Nomade Naturelle once in store, Jasmin Naturel Intense was the first flanker in the line that really caught my eye. I think if you already own Nomade Naturelle, then this would be very redundant for you as the differences are pretty minor. However, I personally think the changes made here improve on the original. I like the addition of pear and the slightly amped up florals.

While the jasmine note is elevated vs the original this is not really a Jasmin floral fragrance despite the name. If you come in expecting a very heady and indolic jasmine, I think you'll be disappointed. That's not this fragrance. It's also not a true gourmand but the dates are still the real star of this show. The overall effect very much gives spiced date bread in big wide pastures. I don't know how to explain it but this perfume speaks to the former horse girl in my soul. (Though there is absolutely nothing animalic about this. I'd be curious if other people who have spent time around horses get the same feeling.)

Solid performance of about 5-6 hours before it starts to really fade. I really enjoy this perfume and it's been getting a lot of wear recently both casually and at work. I will say though, when I asked my husband his opinion on this he told me he thought it smelled like the candle/home goods section of a Marshalls. So you know, YMMV. He's not entirely wrong, I can kind of see the spiced Yankee candle comparisons but it doesn't diminish the fact that I'm into this perfume and I continue to reach for it frequently. At the rate I am going through my 30 ml, it may be full bottle worthy for me. Solid designer launch from Chloe.

it has really nice syrupy jasmine candy opening, but I wish brands didn't use the word "intense" so loosey goosey. The original Nomade edp is way stronger than this. this is practically a skin scent. It doesn't remind me of the the original Nomade at all, but it is very nice. I have a big bottle of the original and the smallest bottle of this, and I think it's the exact right amount. I like it, I don't love it. The lack of strength and longevity is inexcusable if the word intense is in the name.

INSANE! The beginning opens up like the classic Nomade but after 15 minutes it turns into the most beautiful sweet jasmine scent. I dont know if I can compare it to jasmine candy, jasmine jelly or date paste infused with jasmine (it is sweet but not THAT sweet).

Absolutely stunning!!!!

A much sweeter fruitier take on Nomade absolu which I own. I feel like this is a typical designer dna, a pleasant daytime floral but overall underwhelming and lacks the uniqueness of the original. Additionally, the performance is severely lacking, not impressed!
it reminds me of dior addict

This fragrance is so beautiful and feminine.. it’s like a warm hug in a garden on a spring day. I smelt this while browsing a perfume shop and I couldn’t stop thinking about it - so I came back after half an hour and bought a whole bottle.

It's super similar to nomade naturelle which is a fav. Having both would be redundant but I'm glad I have a 30ml because I'm partial to a Jasmine note. There's a dryness of nomade that I adore. It reminds me of philosykos that way.

Edit: testing nomade naturelle and jasmin naturel side by side, I much prefer nomade naturelle. Creamier, stronger date note and the pear note in jasmin feels a bit artificial and honestly a bit screechy compared to the original. Jasmin seems to project more.

I like this one! For me, the opening is quite sharp so I really have to be in the mood for it, otherwise I'll get a headache unfortunately. But I love the warm and creamy vanilla dry down so I still wear this, especially on cooler days!

I'm a bit surprised- I enjoyed the opening of pear and jasmine, and it stayed a while, almost convincing me that I'd found something to adore. However, the dry down was not as nose catching- rather creamy vanilla, dates and freesia, I could no longer detect the jasmine note.

I’ve never smelled the original naturel so I can’t compare but I have all the other nomades which all offer something different… it’s heavy on the jasmin as the name suggests… this perfume is sweet I like it if I’m in the mood…I actually layered this with the nomade absolute to tone down the sweetness… they worked well together! And I must add this perfume lasts a long time on my skin… after testing this out longer… the dry down is amazing … the woody creamy vanilla insency jasmine comes through after the hit of initial floral jasmine… tropical vibes too

Edit: I decided to get the naturel original to compare… they are 95 percent similar… I’d say original just less Jasmin honestly and maybe the Jasmin intense a tad sweeter? Not enough of a difference to have both honestly. If I really search for the patchouli in the intense I can find it but it’s not that noticeable to me! But when comparing the two I can tell the Jasmine version is a little more sharp from that note possibly

If Juicy Couture and Roberto Cavalli for Her had a child, it would be this fragrance. It has a hint of chewing gum that bothers me, and on my skin, the vanilla warms up the fragrance a lot. It's not for me.
Hype train!

I was on the fence about the OG of this line, but this one is a definite dislike.
I don't like how the intensified jasmine combines with the other notes.
This smells bitter instead of smokey like the OG. The date note is much stronger here too, and not in a good way.
On my skin this fragrance smells like acrid wine.

I just can't stop sniffing. Creaminess of the dates takes a lead in this journey, followed by jasmine by his side such a combo. I never love creamy jasmine until I try this. Somehow I can't smell any pear or mirabelle.The sillage is not bad, durability also okay. Very nice to wear in winter/autumn. Expensive smell, elegant but in modern way. Suitable for all ages I think. Full bottle? Yes!

PS : I just found incense smell on the dry down, adding an oriental/dark vibes. Love it!

Beautiful if you love sweet, woody, jasmines. I don't agree that this smells exactly like the Nomade Naturelle. The DNA is the same of course, but the jasmine is DEFINITELY the star in this. Just lovely overall. It's a bit sweet for my personal taste, but I love layering it on top of the Nomade EDP or EDT.

I am on my second bottle of the OG Naturelle and have already purchased a 3rd because I heard it’s discontinued. This Jasmine version isn’t as strong on me. I didn’t get those glorious wafts of creaminess. It wouldn’t be a replacement for the OG in my opinion.
Received a tester. First impression soft creamy coconutty. Then jasmine ish wood in the background. Would I buy FB, probably not. Its not strong enough for me. It's a nice summer scent .
I agree this smells 95% like the OG nomade Naturelle. Just has a slight floral tinge which I don’t love here - I much prefer the original.

Absolutely gorgeous, fluffy, warm sweetness accompanied by sandalwood
Smells expensive and unlike anything I know
Not as floral as I expected, a lot more sweet and musky.
Definitely try before you buy

I've received a sample and I do not like it.
There's something in the dry down that I actually hate (reminds me of an ashtray)
But it's really elegant, feminine and well blended.
Very good I recive a sample and I purchased full size. It’s soft delicate jasmin but it stay a long time. And I like to layer it with Ylang in Gold Nectar ❤️❤️❤️

Very earthy, just like the others in this line...I think Im just not a fan :) they all smell so masculine on me. I tried to scrub it off my skin with two different soaps and it still stays on my skin.

This is beautiful! I get a very natural jasmine. It’s fresh and simple but very well done. The jasmine is definitely dominant here, i don’t get much of the other notes with the exception of a soft touch of mirabelle and a bit of dates. It smells a bit earthy and very relaxing. It’s not really sweet, it’s more floral. It’s pleasant and timeless. I am positively surprised! And the bottle is pretty too. Thumbs up!

Why is tuberose omitted from the list of notes? To me, this fragrance (regardless of its pointless name) actually smells like tuberose (of the sweet-bubblegummy variety). The rest of the notes, jasmine included, only play supporting roles.

I'm in love with this version. The original Nomade Naturelle smells strongly of incense on my skin, it's still very good but this one is much sweeter and I prefer it on me. I love it and I can't stop smelling it.

I feel like this version has a lot more dates to it! It sits so pretty on my skin, it smells yummy, fresh and effortless. Jasmine also suits really well there. Its performance tho, is disappointing. Lasted for around 3 hours on me and had to reapply after this time. I would expect more from it.

Smells exactly as the eau Naturelle original. I would choose the original, also because a coconutty-creamy note that makes it delicious, and this flanker is more fruity than creamy.
Stick with the original Nomade eau naturelle!
This smells almost exactly like Nomade Naturelle Eau de Parfum? It's delicious but I'm a bit confused

I will never forget this scent. Never. I don't understand how you can discount such a magnificently beatiful frangrance. Love by Chloe was ahead of time before gourmand took the perfume scene. Love was more modern than Dune or J'dore by Dior, Love was more sophisticated, complex than La Vie Est Belle. It was powdery, floral. It was so warm, musky but also fresh.

I have just recently started my perfume journey because I am on a quest to find a perfume that smells like a hug with my mom: covergirl pressed powder foundation, clean laundry, coffee, and love. My mom’s fragrance is Clinique Happy. This perfume is a hug in a bottle, and as close to a hug from her as possible.

It is feminine, clean, comforting and sweet. The florals add a beautiful complexity that settles into the powder. It’s just lovely.

I had to blind buy a 15 ml, but I was certain this would be the one. It was. Such a beautiful fragrance, I hope I can find a larger bottle someday.
I'm so FED UP with the perfume-game and the discontinuation. This was the most beautiful scent ever!

I still have a little bit left in my bottle. 🥲💖
Some say it's a spring floral and i can totally understand that, considering the notes.
But to me this will always be a crisp autumn 🍁🍂night with twinkling lights✨️ and going out in the evening fragrance. Also all the -ber month festive season vibes.
It's magical💫 and incredibly uplifting.
By far the prettiest most loved fragrance i've ever known and had the privilege to own. (This AND the intense)

Just blind bought this on Mercari for $16 (the travel size)!!! I hope it's as beautiful as everyone says.

EDIT: I was a little disappointed tbh, I don't hate it but it's just not giving what I was hoping it would.. I love powdery perfumes but this was a bit too straight forward baby powder to my nose with nothing blended into it to make it sensual.

I'll tell y'all why this got discontinued:
The world did not deserve such beauty!
I’ve never smelt this but I’d love to smell this or a dupe. Does anyone have any good recommendations?
Every one of you who said this doesn't have violet is a liar!

Why?
Why Chloé did discontinue this amazing fragrance?🫠
So unrespectful to the customers!
This is a timeless kind of fragrance, no point to take out of market.

Heaven for powdery floral enjoyers. Feminine, nostalgic, magical. It’s like a soft fairy dust, like a comforting dream, like a hug from a loved one.
It’s so sad seeing such beauties being discontinued. Why do they break our bonds with better past, I will never understand.

One of THE most beautiful fragrances I have ever worn in my entire life. It has a strong element of nostalgia, like something from my childhood. You won't smell anything prettier than this scent. Sweet lilacs and all it's sweet best friends, so, so pretty.

I love to sniff Love from up close on my skin. The purple flower-y nuances in all of their glory and rice come through and it feels complex, elegant and warm. However, most people who smell this fragrance in the air as it projects off of my body tell me I smell like straight-up baby powder; perhaps a novice association pertaining to the ultra powerdiness of Love. While I do love it to pieces for personal use, I rarely wear it out in public and never really have. It's an evening or bedtime scent mostly. One that I use to feel comforted and relaxed. Love Intense and Love Eau Florale are a bit more palatable due to their additional notes that tame or tone the powder down. But Love the og will always have a special place in my heart. I don't think a suitable replacement exists. It is one-of-a kind and a crying shame they stopped making this line of beauties. I cherish my 2.5 oz. bottle and will likely have it for many years to come.

I've tested this in various phases of my perfume journey / life. Always hits different. Ten years ago it felt synthetic, powdery, dated. Now it feels very much springtime fresh daywear. A good complex spring purple floral with plenty of powderiness from the rice and iris. It's just a touch on the dry side for me, a touch waxy, a little violet-y even though I see no violets. I think If I did pick a perfume in this genre it would be a bit more photorealistic floral, and a touch more sweet. This leans more on the waxy dry make up bag but still spring floral style powdery perfume. I do like it, and interesting how my perception of it changes each time i try it.

I miss this perfume whenever I stop using it, no other fragrance made me feel this way thank god they sell the dupe in Türkiye, whenever I spray I feel like a ballerina in nutcracker, almost like tinkerbell sprinkles fairy dust on you...
Ooh that’s a lot of purple florals! I guess violet wasn’t good enough to be in here. Poor violet, left out from all her friends having a party here without her.

Why on earth did they discontinue this?
There is no logic whatsoever in perfume houses discontinuing their most loved scents. I just dont get it🤷🏼♀️

Uber feminine, retro leaning (but somehow still modern) powdery floral. The florals are sweet and intense, with an almost honeyed facet that shines through the opening and lasts until the far drydown. It also definitely has an expensive make-up-adjacent smell (think vintage rice powder). Smells sophisticated but it's not exactly subtle - I often find it a bit too screechy and overbearing, especially for the first couple hours. It has excellent sillage and staying power (at least 8 hours on my skin). Even though it's only a mild like and not a love for me, I can't see why Chloe discontinued it, as it does strike me as the ultimate crowd pleaser fragrance, and I always imagined it was a big seller.

This is an undoubtedly floral scent that, if you can bear the first 20 minutes, opens up into a soapy and clean smell. Long-lasting and sophisticated. Some moments, it feels sweet, other moments it feels fresh and even slightly bitter. Musky and powdery. One of those smells that feels comforting in any season.Too bad it was discontinued.

I love Powder Flowers and used to wear it religiously and to my nose it does not smell like Love. I would say only the initial blast is very slightly (30%) reminiscent of.
I hope they will bring back this gorgeous scent though. It was my favorite rice scent.
just the scent i've been looking for according to the notes and all the comments, it's annoying that it's discontinued and i won't be able to find it

My signature scent. A warm powdery perfume with purple florals. I agree that it has a ‘vintage’ feel to it, but it is not ‘dated’ by any means. Feels like a warm hug. Veryyy long lasting especially on clothes. A huge shame they discontinued it.

That’s nice! Slightly soapy and vintage but still a very lovely (and quite realistic) scent of lilac (which is not a very popular note in perfumery at the moment). Light yet long-lasting purple flowers.

For those who are looking for an alternative I suggest go try Jours Heureux 2022 by Bienaimé!
I sprayed to work today my colleague thought I was using Love, Chloe ! ( I used to wear Love Chloe to work so she is familiar with the scent!)

I’m so happy to find a new fragrance reminds me of this long discontinued gem🥹
One of the best fragrances ever made
I will never give up on this scent. I’m constantly in search of another perfume, but my hands always reach for 'love' that’s sitting in the corner. It has a very special place in my heart <3

Oh my god this was my signature scent and I loved it SO MUCH!
Again a super nice fragrance where I simply don't understand why they discountinued it.
I tried to find anything similar, dupes etc but no luck.

This is the happiest powdery sweet fragrance I have ever tried. It is powdery without being lipsticky (which I hate) and without being grandma-ish. This perfume made me smile everytime I smelled it. It is comforting, feminine, soft, warm, floral, kind. I wish they bring it back.

Update: I found a dupe that is actually quite nice - if you live in Europe, you might want to check out the PURE No. 414 fragrance (where I live they are available on parfum e-shop). It is not exactly the same but close enough to give me the nostalgic comfort.

One of the most elegant bottles of all. Rich and Chic.
The smell is just amazing.
I have something like 25ml from my 80ml bottle.
I use almost once a year now, just to never ends.😭

This is by far the prettiest, powdery floral I have ever owned. I’m savoring every last drop of this beauty. It would be a glorious day if Chloe ever re-released this one

Edit 2025: I came across another user who said Sopranissima by Luciano Soprani was the closest to Love, Chloe that she has found. I decided to give it a shot since Fragrance Net has it for an extremely affordable price. Although the performance is equivalent to a body mist, the delicate purple floral note is nearly spot on. I have tried several dupes and I prefer this over them all.

Love, Chloe perfume is a magical elixir. I recall the first time I smelled it in a Sephora upon its release, not expecting much. I consider the bottle somewhat underwhelming. However, that first sniff was pure olfactory wonderment. Just pure rice powder and flowers, like diving into a cloud of uncompromising femininity. The projection and lasting power are also remarkable. Such a shame that Chloe discontinued it, as I have met so many people that consider it a favorite and/or holy grail. Though I tend to love every fragrance that Chloe releases, none come close to my passionate affair with Love, Chloe. A few years ago I bought the closest dupe on the market, Phyllis by Pull & Bear (also discontinued now). That is a good one as well, though it has a zing or Sprite-like carbonation to it that makes it less powdery. If they re-released Love, Chloe - I would instantly buy 20 bottles and sell the majority of the rest of my collection. I love it that much.

During the pandemic, my perfume obsession was reignited. I admittedly have always loved perfume but it wasn’t until I needed a hobby that distracted me from the ensuing chaos of an all too darkening reality that I dove in deeply. In those early days, I started trying to become educated on Covid because it was slowly becoming the centerpiece of my daily thoughts and interactions. Unsurprisingly, I was led to dismal corners of the internet predicting that whole ice skating rinks would need to become makeshift morgues in order to house the expected death tolls. There was unrelenting fear mongering and divisive arguing taking place on my social media pages. It was such a paranoia fueled, bleak time for everyone. I found myself supplementing Facebook and YouTube with this site more and more to evade the drama. Inadvertently, this is when I first discovered Love, Chloé through scouring message boards. It was one of my first fragrance acquisitions after neglecting my collection for a while.

Being fairly new to this world, I couldn’t appreciate the sophistication of LC. I sprayed it on my pulse points and it registered merely as a tangy, baby-powdery scent that overwhelmed me. It reminded me of a deodorant I had owned at some point and the settled way it smelled at the end of the day while I changed into my pajamas. This wasn’t necessarily a bad thing but it wasn’t quite what I expected. I had a friend try this on and she said it smelled like Liz Claiborne’s Curve to her 🤔 I had no idea how to interpret LC initially and it definitely is a unique scent that has grown on me in the last few years. It’s the first perfume I tend to think of for a special occasion and that right there shows its place in my heart. My initial thoughts of it being powdery were accurate. But it’s not solely powdery. It could be the pink pepper or the starch from the rice but there’s this grounding warmth to this scent that just expands throughout wear time. There’s just the slightest aspect of wood/dirt hidden behind the florals that makes the warmth radiate even more. It reminds me of that old Campbell’s chicken noodle soup commercial with the snowman. The soothing heat causes the snow to dissipate revealing a chipper, comforted child. I know it sounds strange but this exactly how this perfume makes me feel! That must be why I have a preference for wearing it in cold months which are pretty frequent in my state. I choose this indiscriminately to weather and more so when I want to feel uplifted but I find that it performs equally well in all seasons. You would be hard pressed to find a perfume that performs comparably to LC in the current market with regard to longevity. I can still smell this in the morning. The unique array of purple flowers is fascinating because it would seem that they would make this scent feel dated. It feels retro but not old-fashioned. Perhaps if you bottled Lana Del Rey’s essence of reinterpreting old-school glamour… all the old rules apply but it’s a new game. The orange flower enhances the soapier, clean aspect that this fragrance morphs into about an hour in. I am a sucker for a fragrance that has intricate layers woven into the duration. This is definitely one of those. It’s a whole ass symphony for the senses.

I can’t say enough good things EXCEPT how it’s been discontinued. What a shame that people can’t experience this scent anymore. If Chloé does actually decide to hear our woes and bring LC back, it would most likely be a hollow, replicated shell of its original exquisiteness. I have heard that Phyllis by Pull & Bear comes close to recreating LC. I don’t know if they discontinued that as well but it seems like it has fallen off the face of the earth. I have seen that the bottle design was altered but it looks like they just shelved it completely. Oil Perfumery has a decent dupe that I have tried. It’s the best dupe I have tried and does come close but it’s just an impression. I will disclose that I came close to selling my bottle at some point when I saw how much money the existing bottles were going for and really needed the extra cash. I did a little bit of whining while I took the pictures for the listing and edited them. I believe I even blurted out, “I don’t wanna!” In the end, I just couldn’t. I have never had such an attachment to a perfume I was listing like that before. My rationale on reselling perfume is usually that I might not be appreciating something in my collection that someone else might enjoy and get more use out of. The opposite happened with this fragrance. I kept thinking about what a void would be left if I parted with my bottle and how much less I would enjoy my collection if CL weren’t a part of it. Yes, I know it’s only perfume and yes, I have other perfumes (some would argue too many.) This particular perfume is special to me. I found it during such a hopeless time in my life where nothing felt glamorous, affirming, or comforting. This was my little reminder that those things were still tangible and I guess it still represents those things for me. My perfume passion has started to dwindle recently, as I think it has for a lot of us, but I will forever be inspired by scents like CL. The way they make you feel is indescribable but once they have imprinted on you, you can’t let go.

everyone in türkiye still wears this heavily. the dupe-perfume industry is big in here thanks to economy, and they don't seem to discontinue it. this frag, is really loved here; there are even deodorants with this exact smell. the first time i smelled this i was in middle school, i had a really bad-ass friend that smoked at the age of 13 and was really into WWE women's division. she got this as her signature and it was also the first time i heard the words "signature perfume". i remember liking it so much but she wouldn't give me the name because apparently she was afraid i would go and buy it too. after making me promise i wouldn't buy it while we were in the same school, she gave the name to me. i think this is a beautiful scent but the people who wear it around here rarely even suit it. i think they underestimate the power of "perfume" and how it can look out of place for some people. this perfume is(was) for either the purest girl or the loveliest modern grandma. and if i saw a person who dons all blacks and swears and smokes, i will not associate this perfume with her.

In case you have the chance, please get Luxure Lady Elite, which is an extremely cheap and incredibly well-performing dupe for Chloé Love. The dry-down is just 10/10 the same and it has moderate to strong sillage with about 8-10 hours of longevity, for the price of around 7-8 EURs.

It looks like a fragrance as if spice has been added to spring flowers. Although there is no rose in it, it has a pink rose-like tone. The fragrance is generally herbal aromatic. Spice can be felt, albeit in small amounts.

Contrary to the rating above, the fragrance stays on the fabric until the end of the day and has a high projection and silage ratio.

I do not have the original of this perfume. I have a solid perfume produced with the essences of this perfume. I will make my review according to the perfume I have.
First of all, it smelled too green to me at first. There is no sweetness. I can say that I smell a mixture of herbs, leaves and musk. After about 1 hour, the green scent fades and only a light floral musk scent remains. It is very difficult to distinguish the notes. They have achieved a beautiful unity with each other. In general, I liked it very much, except for that green smell at the beginning. Musk is with you from the beginning to the end. I am sure musk lovers will love this one.

Warning: This is going to be long!

Love Chloe is a dreamy powdery floral…clean, warm, distinctive, and has a vintage/nostalgic vibe to it that I love so much. I adore lilacs! There aren’t a lot of fragrances that feature this note and execute a composition so graceful and versatile...a true modern classic. The powderiness is reminiscent of luxury face powder, and you also get that clean feeling like you just got done taking a hot shower. You know that warm, fresh feeling after, you’re wrapping yourself in the fluffiest towel...and the scent of the best quality lilac shower gel that you used, it is heavily perfuming the steamy air around you. There is also that sweet musky smell of clean skin that adds an element of sensuality (this must be the rice steam and musk combination, it comes through more in the drydown and I adore that).

I smell a vast green garden with blooming purple flowers, a romantic vision, and yet, I see a woman dressed in softly monochromatic neutrals (like the ad) in a more urban setting, beige cashmere sweater, below the knee pleated skirt...she has doe eyes and perfectly parted soft hair, a cool and distant sort of beauty, and she is sitting in a quaint cafe in Paris, warming her hands around a hot drink. Her clean and well-assembled appearance attracts attention as she looks somewhat out of place. She gazes dreamily outside the window into the rainy streets outside. Her beauty may be reserved and distant, yet her eyes reflect warmth, tenderness and perhaps a restrained sensuality...perhaps a longing for something, or someone, or a time gone by. Nobody knows if she is waiting for someone, or what she is thinking, or what she is feeling, but most likely she is just content with the moment, with her self, indulging in her reveries.

This has been my signature scent since 2014. I was 27 when I first smelled this, and I immediately knew: ‘This is me’. Full stop. It was an instant love that never diminished. People close to me have even commented that this fragrance suits me so well. Before Love Chloe, my signatures were Miss Dior Cherie (2005 version), and then Lolita Lempicka (another evocative, powdery scent with a dreamy element to it...just sweet instead of classic like Love) after MDC got reformulated. I still wear LL to this day, but I had wanted something more serious, more polished and sophisticated than LL, more ‘clean’ than sweet, something that better reflected my maturing into my late 20s and beyond...however, I still required that innocent, ‘wet-eyed’, dreamy quality to my scent, that element of ‘fantasy’ that I never outgrew. Last but not least, I also wanted my signature to be distinctive and different from trending scents, something I can wear all year round, and with great projection and sillage to boot. And this scent fit the bill perfectly, it checked every single requirement and passed with flying colors (and that has never happened before!).

I bought back up bottles when it was getting hard to find, and by now I am running out. I am looking for a replacement to be my new signature and it is so difficult! We should petition for Chloe for bring back this gem!

To Kittymoon:

I have to disagree. Strongly disagree !!!
I had read reviews before buying this perfume, and the first one I have snatched was "that tester", which has had the word "TESTER" printed right on the bottle.
Now I have managed to grab some originals - and let me tell you:

THEY.ARE.THE.SAME ‼️‼️‼️

So to all little scared perfume lovers - do not be afraid to buy the tester, which is marked like that on its glass.
You will get your beloved Love, Chloe.

My personal opinion -
I do not like it, though I love a rice note in general. Not here. I am not going to wear Love, Chloe.
But I cannot say it is not done very well. VERY well. Like some others say - I am quite surprised that Chloe had managed to produce such good, memorable perfumes thus far, including original Chloe, EDP and Nomade (and all the flankers). There is no perfume like Love, Chloe, far and wide. The vintage powder and the rice note are very noticable, and play very well together. This is an elegant, inoffensive, lady-like perfume. Something similar I found in Narcisso Rodriguez Poudree, and the drydown of Chanel L'eau No.5. If you have ever had the chance to smell old, vintage makeup, there is this pleasant smell, especially in vintage powders. I find it pretty.

Super powdery. Like real old fashioned face powder. Some flowery notes. Some sweetness. Super strong when it comes to last power and projection. I just can’t imagine wearing it. It’s simply all powder. Over the top powder.

I got few years ago a 30ml bottle of Love, Chloé. Then I didn't pay any attention to it and it just sat in the back of my perfume closet. After trying it couple of times on my skin I decided to wear it. I do agree it's a feminine and sophisticated vintage powder puff scent but it's maybe too powdery in my eyes.
I am thinking of decluttering some of my perfumes that I just don't wear and Love, Chloé is one of them. So message me if you are interested to buy the 30ml bottle.
PS. I live in Europe.

EDIT: I sold the bottle, so at least one lucky Love, Chloé fan is happy :)

I loved this too, but it was tricky to wear, since it's a bit vintage smelling. And very intense, soft and powdery but also very sweet and definitely beastmode despite the softness. Just be aware of fakes, don't get scammed. aliexpress has these exact bottes, most of them are stamped "tester" and I have seen some on ebay already :(
Praying for its revival..
Pure soft powder. Really comforting scent.

My absolute favorite perfume of all time. I used to get the roll on at Sephora and this it reminds me of my younger days. It’s feminine, elegant. I’ve had people come up to me in public sniffing me. Definitely my most complimented signature fragrance. The orange blossoms do wonders on my skin. And it lasts FOREVER. Truly amazing. I am looking to buy a bottle please DM me if you’re looking to sell ❤️ Or if you know some good dupes!

Found an unused perfectly kept miniature bottle in my aunts perfume fridge, and years after my first whiff (in which I hated the perfume but I was 18 back then) I smelled and tried Love once more, and I think I actually love this perfume... A sophisticated, soft and beautiful formulation! Smells almost dreamy, but for someone who still has a foot on the ground; she knows the melody of la vie en rose coming down the street doesn't speak of life but still daydreams on the reflection of her mirror, she eventually comes down the stairs for dinner back to her usual place in life. Reminds me of powder compacts my mother used to have when I was a child. I think the formulation works really strange on my skin; the first spray was powder and lilac but at the drydown I cannot tell the notes apart at all. It is immensely melancholic but also enchanting in its quiet way, might be one of my favorite makeup scented perfume.
Sweet purple flowers, sitting on a bed of dewey green leaves, lightly sprinkled with powdery icing sugar. Beautiful!

This is such a beautiful feminine fragrance. Elegant, flirty and ladylike. Clean, fresh, creamy, powdery florals. Smells like confidence. Love wearing this in the springtime. Silage and longevity is excellent. It’s a shame Chloe discontinued this. I always get so many compliments when I wear this, from men and women, young and old. Have yet to find a fragrance that smells similar to it.
My all time favourite! Praying for its revival🙏🏻

Chloe Love was my instant love and signature scent for 4 years and still can't believe how such a beauty could be discontinued. Perfect clean make-up powder. Abstract purple fowers, rice and clean musk give its distinct character. Gentle and elegant but noticable. It was my most complemented perfume. Now I rarely use the last 20 mls. of my current bottle. I will wait to open my back-up until Love will be relaunched.

It was my dream fragrance. There had been no perfume that made me feel the joy happiness that Love has brought. Only Chanel Beige evoked the same feelings. Despite they have no notes in common, it has a similar, happy, feel good and safe vibe. They both share that warm and clean, charming aura.

Please bring back Chloe Love again!

This was a powdery feminine dream.
I miss it.
You guys should try impression oils. There are companies that replicate the scent in oil form and sell it it for a decent price. OilPerfumery sells theirs for $15.

Maraschino cherries, sugared violets, with iced iris petals. That is this fragrance and it is dreamy!!! This is an enchanted garden of light blues and purples at twilight with an icy full moon illuminating the majesty 💙💜👗👑💎💌. This is twilight delight💬

I finally, finally got the chance to smell this and I totally fell in love... Honestly, I didn't expect the Chloé perfume to be this good, as normally I used to get samples of their perfumes in shopping centers and I found them only "nice, decent smelling" and that's it... but this is very, very different.
Now I completely understand why Love is so loved by many here on Fragrantica. It's slightly sweet, powdery and had this unique (not too overbearing or floral-pungent) hint of soapiness, too, which gives the fragrance this beautiful soft and clean, heavenly smell of innocence (it's almost baby-like). The scent also feels kind of nostalgic, in a way, but it makes me smile every time I smell it.
I absolutely love powdery perfumes and this is "the new kind of powdery" I don't have in my collection yet.
It's such a shame that this beauty got discontinued. They should really bring it back. :(

Found a bottle again in 2021 and I'm in LOVE!!! ;)
Will be using the 50ml Love, Chloe sparingly (genuinely sad)
On my way to get Love, Chloe Eau Florale EDT.

These pandemic years had me being sentimental and all, getting the things that reminded me of the good old days back.
I'm so glad @s3raph1nas mentioned the similarities between Love Chloé and Phyllis from Pull&Bear because I absolutely hate that scent, I received a bottle as a gift, cannot wear it.

Why on earth was this discontinued? It is such a pretty, airy, feminine fragrance. It's perfect for the office because it is innocuous; yet it's noticeable due to its nice sillage. It evokes compliments and has good longevity (typically about 6 to 8 hours). Even after a shower, I can sometimes still smell it lightly on my skin. As for the scent itself, it's a nice combination of green, powdery, sweet, and slightly woody notes. It is well blended and doesn't smell overwhelmingly of one particular note, although the purple floral notes have a slight prominence. In the dry down, it remains true to its composition and doesn't turn too powdery. This is a perfect daytime scent and I hope it will be relaunched soon.
I’m not surprised this is discontinued...I don’t know why I keep trying Chloe perfumes since I never liked one.

This is powdery perfection. It smells like baby powder and makeup in the best way possible and it's a shame it's discontinued. I managed to find a 20 ml brand new bottle on ebay that wasn't too expensive, but I use it sparingly.

I find that Pull & Bear Phyllis is an incredible dupe. It's a tad fresher and doesn't have the faint pencil shavings smell of the original. Another vaguely similar perfume is Montale Powder Flowers, but this one smells like straight-up baby powder before it turns into a slightly more flowery scent after a few hours. A third option, and the most far-fetched, is Byredo Slow Dance. In the dry-down it's reminiscent of Love, Chloe. While it's not as sweet, more boozy, mature and definitely unisex, there is a lovely powderiness from the vanilla and violet notes.
I blind bought this-when will I ever learn! Very Pretty, but sadly doesn't work with my skin. I have a 1.7oz bottle for swap in US- PM me.

THIS is the Purple Flower Powder Puff fragrance I've been looking for. A generous Fragrantican sold me her used bottle at a wonderful price and as soon as I opened the package I could tell it was something special.
It's a gentle perfume but the sillage is excellent, managing to be strong enough to remain present even at a distance without ever becoming cloying or overbearing. This is both sweet and slightly savory, with an elegant and feminine blend of florals that reads like a natural bouquet. You know how a room smells when you have fresh blossoms somewhere in a vase? Alive and clean and pretty.
The powder aspects here are not dry, but creamily blend with my skin, courtesy of the musk in the base. The rice is not cosmetic to me, but edible and wholesome and warm. I can't say I've smelled anything like it but it does bring up memories of a time in my life when I used Nivea hand cream religiously. It was the one in the white packaging, and I remember the sum total of my personal smell being a combination of juicy leave in conditioner, honeysuckle perfume, and hand lotion. Something about Love, Chloe recalls that seamless blending of various beauty products into one very unique signature scent.
I don't understand who in their right mind discontinued this but I have a bone to pick with them.

I just purchased 3 rare originally 75 ml bottles of this perfume from a local perfume shop.
It’s certainly divine, feminine and sophisticated.
I can’t help to notice that there are many who want to buy it
Message me if you are interested to buy a 75m ll bottle of discontinued Love by Chloe

I was so disappointed when this was taken off the shelves. It was my signature scent and it made me feel deliciously fresh all day long. It lingered on my skin and on my clothing. Ladies would follow me just to ask about my delicious smell. I miss it terribly. Can't find another like it. Have tried Prada L'eau de Iris, Chloe eau de parfum (second choice), Narcisso Rodriguez but none come close.

This was a blind buy for me, and although it's quite a beautiful fragrance as the rave reviews indicate, it just doesn't work on me. My 1.7 Oz bottle is for sale or equivalent swap. If you're interested message me.

I should love this by just looking at the purple notes alone, but I don't. The orange blossom combined with the musk goes very barnyard on me, smelling like a cow patty. Orange blossom is a hard one for my skin, combine that with musk and it never works. Insolence by Guerlain is one EdT I can take with it (no musk in that one), but the EdP version of it is too much, even with just the orange blossom. I wouldn't classify this scent as a safe blind buy like I would Chloe, the original. I only have a mini bottle that came in a dual with Chloe, and it's so cute I'll never give it away.
I was lucky to find a mini last year and I love it definitely better than the original, too bad it's discontinued

working at home, and then was distracted, and realized I want to smell beautiful and soft and ooo, only that thing that Love Chloe can bring....
then realized hold on, do I recall this was no longer found in the stores, but somehow I was lucky enough that I found one at an airport duty free that still had it and bought it about last october.
Now i searched the web to see if i can buy another bottle considering it is really and truly discontinued and not just something i thought... omg am I now obsessed with finding a bottle since it is discontinued... and feeling absolutely gutted that this scent i have come to associate with happiness, I won't again, once this bottle is finished. I could almost cry.
I must add that i am glad there are people who will miss it just as much as i do... a sort of support group.. ;)

I have an unhealthy obsession with this perfume. It's such a unique blend of powdery floral, with rice notes in the dry down? The rice add a little something unique, almost cosmetic powder-like. I really hope to find a dupe or hopefully one day they will release the Love, Chloe edp again. One can only dream.

The bottle is beautiful too, it looks like a classy alcohol/potion flask. So simple but luxurious at the same time. a beautiful addition to my counter.
Love this,if anyone -europe- has for sale,please message me
I'm so upset this perfume has been discontinued. I loved the playdoh-ish-soapy-sexyness of this smell and have tried to find similar but no success ):

This is one of my many blind buys. I love to blind buy. It is the unknown, the chance that you'll get this wonderful surprise that may end up being on your top shelf. When will I learn. The notes sounded like a safe bet for me but no go.
Great powdery gem. All of the heart notes are so nice and warm. Easily one of the best powder juices around.
RIP, you extinct and magical creature. Had I known, I would have bought ten bottles to last me. Utterly feminine and optimistic.

One of the most unique powdery feminine smell in the planet. It lasts the whole day on my skin and a week on my clothes. I love it so much, it was a LOVE at first sniff. Unfortunately, it's been discontinued so I'll be cheriching my bottle for the rest of my life. Love you...
Discontinued??!! 😣😣😣😣

I fell in love with this fragrance when I tested in a shop, about 10 years ago. My absolute favorite from all the Chloe perfumes I know. It's feminine, powdery, delicate and strong at the same time. The bottle reflects its sophistication. Fantastic creation. It's discontinued but I kind of like that it's not easy to find.
Peachy, soapy, long lasting like a freak. Pretty af.

WHY is this one discontinued?!
It’s the best scent ever.
Want to cry!
My signature scent, I just can't get enough of it. So feminine and gorgeous
I have full bottles of Love Intense and Love Eau Florale if anyone wants to trade their original version! 😉

Perfection in a bottle! Elegant, sophisticated, very well done perfume. Nothing to envy a niche brand whatsoever.
This is not your every day generic type of fragrance. It is hard to describe but delicious to smell. It's definitely a powdery smelling perfume, albeit well-done. No baby-powder smell here (nothing against baby-powder scents, this is just not the case). To my nose, this is a very complex scent where pinpointing a note or two is hard (except for the powder and the pink pepper). It's neither sweet nor tart, definitely not your typical spring floral scent either, which makes it an unsafe blind buy. There is, though, a soapy quality about it that is absolutely divine.

Let us behold the exquisite minimalistic bottle for a while.

Suited for night time and/or cold days. The longevity both in skin and clothes is a monster and sillage is just perfect...not too Jean-Paul Gaultier "Hey look at me" (which I particularly dislike).

No over spraying is required! In fact, by all means avoid it, unless you want to end up sneezing due to the pepper note. Unfortunately It has been discontinued. I only have one bottle that's holding on for dear life.

This is my beloved signature scent.

10/10 hands down.
My wedding scent! Adorable and super lasting baby smell! 🤍

@ioanaszmeu, your bottle may have a problem. I used Love for four years but it was never nose burning, too dry and non-sweet. It's strong at first but then settles and turnes into a relaxing fragrance. It has a kind of make-up powder sweetness. It doesn't smell like any cleaning product but has a similarity with scented tissues. It may be cloying when sprayed generously or used without giving a break. At least, according to my experiences. Regards...

One of the powderiest fragrances.

Chloe Love is a powdery smell from start to finish; clean, cool, musky powder. This powdery scent turned feminine with a sprinkle of purple floral notes on top, mainly the iris and lilac. It does smell makeup-y. It is in the same vein as Narcios's Pure Musc; both very clean and musky scents.

A lovely, inoffensive fragrance better suited for the cooler days.

"Like".
Please!!!! Bring it back

JUST GOT A STEAL ON A SAMPLE OF THIS AND I AM IN LOVE!! Sorry I’m excited lol. This smells sooo good, heavenly. Weirdly reminds me of my mom when I would hug her as a child and would get a comforting whiff of her powder blush. It’s floral, slightly sweet but not in a sickening way, powdery but not in a sickening way as well. Just smells motherly, I don’t know if that makes sense. The name is fitting, it smells like unconditional motherly love. Like compact makeup, mature and sweet. So sad this is discontinued. One of my favorite scents now but I will have to thrive off my .13oz sample, wish me luck!

Ugh, this used to be one of the biggest 'love at first sniff' perfumes for me, EVER, and that was 8-9 years ago. Smelled it in a store, bought it later the same day (which was a BOLD move for my broke uni student ass, just to be clear)

Extremely powdery but something about it was so extravagant and unique, just unforgettable. I last owned this about 8 years ago, but I remember exactly how it smelled. I have no idea why it got discontinued, it really stood out from the rest of the Chloe fragrances.

The most subtle and elegant perfume I have ever come across. It reminds me of a very expensive Chanel powder compact. Like liquid gold but never Vulgar. It’s like ivory silk pyjamas that fit your every curve perfectly. The violets come through in the dry down but definitely not overly sweet or sickly. I always get compliments from men on this fragrance. I wouldn’t say it’s for summer but I sprits a little on my clothes instead of skin on warmer days. A lot softer than original Chloe but got its own Je Ne Sais Pa... Have been wearing this since 2010. Chloe need to bring this back it’s getting harder to come by! Pure class.

This smells vintage. I don't think it's particularly crowd pleasing. Reminds me of an expensive soap/powder. It's very sweet but airy. I would only wear it indoors to feel cozy. I used to own and love this years ago, and was on the hunt for a "left over" bottle. Only thing is,I don't trust I will get the real deal... So I decided to give Pull and Bear's "Phyllis" a whirl, and boy that's a great dupe! The opening is more citrussy than I remember, but the dry down is spot on. And to get a flashback of long gone memories for the price of £16/100ml, I mean...

Oh boy. I LOVE Chloe perfumes. I read a review about this, came here to read more & couldn't resist the 10 ML travel spray. WOW. You bettah like Iris & Violet. Whatever accords they have mixed here, on ME, that is point blank all it is. I do like Wisteria, a LOT, but I do not get that here. I sprayed half a spray, no need for anymore. Selling it on Ebay for what I paid. Fail.

Sadly, it wasn't as wonderful as I was expecting.
I was expecting a gorgeous, lush, heavenly, super-feminine, glamorous, powdery scent.

In reality, I feel it is more of a drug-store powdery body spray. It's sharp and spicy in its opening and only mildly settles throughout its life. There's definitely lilac and iris. The lilac isn't the gentle, sweet scent I usually love in lilacs. The iris does provide a slight cosmetic scent, but not an intoxicating one.
The powder notes are - of course - present. Again, it smells too light, airy...and, well...lower-quality. Hence, the drug store body spray.
Standard longevity and not a great deal of sillage. A skin scent. The scent is nice enough. Just noticeably average. Gorgeous bottle, though.

I feel like this is the scent that would come out of a body spray I would have bought for my mother as a Mothers' Day present at about 7 years old, with no money, and no clue what she actually liked!
Be careful when buying this for the exorbitant prices its going for online. Personally, I found it didn't live up to the hype. :(

***

Kitty rating: 4/10.

This is perfection. And I'll hardly ever call that a fragrance, no matter how much I personally enjoy it.
But this one is simply perfect alright. Heady, yet airy. Beautiful, with nothing pathetic about it. Floating but stubborn. Clean and soapy, not sterile though. Hyper feminine floral. Sweet just enough! It's on the verge to end up bland, instead there's something just a tiny bit bitter added, in order to keep it tasteful altogether.
It's so pretty, so posh, you cannot miss her in a crowd nor mistake her for a commoner. She is the princess in her community - strikingly beautiful with perfect facial symmetry, preppy, with perfect manners and the best education out there. And hopelessly romantic.
She has never experienced cruelty whatsoever.

This is a perfume I crave — sometimes. I don’t usually go for purple flowers so this is a departure for me. It is different from the screechy fruitchoulis of the decade. But I rather miss some sugar. I sometimes mix Love Chloe with a sweet, resinous fragrance featuring rose because Love alone is like dry wine.
Initially a like/dislike, I can see the love for Love. Love is powdery and comforting, at night especially. And in the morning the rice musk lingers on my skin.

Ill be giving a review as best I could in describing this fragrance. This fragrance starts with spiceness as we could see theres pink pepper in the top notes. It is kinda annoying since the more I spray the fragrance, the more spicy it becomes. And then slowly I could smell myself like belvita biscuit (its either the musk or the rice) since at this moment the musk is getting intensifies. Then I could barely smell the mix of this belvita biscuit scent and a note (I have no clue what the note is) which smells so greeny like a vegetable, really reminds me of a vegetable but still no idea. Then yes we r coming to the base which smelllssss so lovely, the powder and the musk + the belvita biscuit. This fragrance is spicy, sweet, musky, powdery. But the sillage is so soft and the longevity is average. This fragrance reminds me of something but i forget it so its not unique but still lovely

I consider powdery scents to be my favorite type of fragrances. Love, Chloe is beyond just being powdery, it's luxurious. It smells like expensive cosmetics. Super feminine and soothing.

If this wasn’t discontinued I would consider this my signature scent. The fear of running out of my small stash keeps me from swimming in it.

If you’re a lover of purple flower scents or just powdery fragrances and you happen to come across the opportunity to sniff this… Sniff it!

My no 1 perfume of all time glad I got backups so I will treasured it till the last drop 😊 I prayed Chloe will bring this back in the future Cuz this perfume is so modern elegance and beautiful.

Edit : found another bottle and now I got 2 unused 75ml yay 💃🏼💃🏼💃🏼
A very close dupe of this masterpiece is the new Violet Blossom from Zara. The resemblance is shocking!

I really need a full bottle of this, but the price is way up there! I haven't decided to take the plunge. I think it's beautiful. Soft and sexy, the powder, iris, and heliotrope are gorgeous on top of the musky notes. I was so surprised because I haven't found any other Chloe's to be anywhere near as good. Now to find a bottle, even partially used, that won't break the bank!
EDIT - it's fate. Just found a 1.7 oz for a more down to earth cost.
EDIT 5/25/20 - the more I wear this, the deeper I fall in love with it. If I did the signature scent thing, this would certainly be a contender, though the list is long. It makes me feel very sexy, something that is hard to find in powdery scents, which veer more to the romantic in my opinion. I can't get enough of it, but will have to be judicious in my application because of it's high price and increasing scarcity. True love for Love!

Comparing this to Jil Sander Simply Poudrée:
Simply is like a winter version of Love. Simply is sweeter, dryer and more modern, Love is more floral and a lot brighter.
Hi Chloe lovers, try Mancera Indian Dream, they are kinda similar. Hope it helps :)

In all those purple flowers I also smell violets briefly in the opening, but violet is not listed as a note. Must be a trick of the brain. Violet is often paired with powder and those other florals.

Gorgeous stuff, ultimately not really for me. There is something just a little too perfect in this perfume. I don't wear silk blouses, perfectly tailored pants or classic long-line jackets. I love the ads, just can't relate! But Love, Chloe is nice for a spritz every now and then, and I'm glad I grabbed a little bottle while they were still cheap at the discounters.

I always imagine a sweet young lady sitting on a sofa, reading the magazine 'Vogue' when I sniff Love, Chloe. Its powdery notes are dominant and make the fragrance easily recognisable. It is a light but not fresh perfume rather suitable for the day than the night. Composed mainly of purple colored flowers, it's a soft floral which has a base of rise, musk and powdery notes, so if it wasn't for the pink pepper and orange at the top of the composition then the juice of Love, Chloe would smell more simple. It's a nice blended contemporary composition of lilac and rise powder. Also, I love love love the metal details and the heavy glass and the light peach color in the bottle! So luxurious, it is a shame this has been discontinued.

very feminine,classy,elegant and clean it is not soapy more it is refreshing clean and shower feel,love it good for spring and summer morning but can be good for all seasons .
performance and silliage are moderate.

Come back already!
It’s Stunning
And so delicately female

I absolutely love this perfume and cannot understand why they would stop selling it... It's the only perfume I like from this brand. For those into powdery notes, try Valentina Poudre and Lipstick On from Maison Margiela. They are really nice!
Adore this one. have a original bottle stored in the fridge, from 2010. Should have bought more. use it sparingly.
Ugh why do they keep changing the note icons so I have to relearn them all over again? I keep thinking the musk is milk mousse and I still cant tell ambroxyn and calone from hedione!

هدیه ای از یک دوست
بویی شبیه لوازم آرایشی داره و خیلی شاید به مذاق بعضیا خوش نیاد. برای من هم بیشتر به دلیل هدیه بودنش عزیزه تا این که خیلی جذاب باشه. میشه بهش از 10 نمره 6 یا 7 داد در کل

Is there not a way to convince Chloe’ to bring this back to production? They could take away that dreadful Nomade instead!!! This is so wonderfully warm, soft, womanly, delightful, divine. Would be my signature if it was not for the fact that I am afraid to be without it if I use too much... Powdery and lovely, makes me feel safe. I can use this when I am with my grandchildren, to give them a scent to connect with me. And I can use it on a date, to let that man be enchanted and never forget.
PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE BRING BACK!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! 😭😭😭💘💘💘💔💔💔

After smelling hundreds of fragrances over the years, nothing could take the place of my love for Love Chloe. It’s not any one individual note that stands out to me, but the composition as a whole is Pure Perfection. Feminine, soft with exceptional longevity and sillage, alluring, yet comforting. Fragrance is subjective, but this one has always hit the mark for me. And I’m surprised after 10 years of having it I can still say that. A modern classic for lovers of sweet, powdery purple flowers. Delicate as a butterfly, yet underneath, hard as a rock. Like a woman.
@nadinehachem - I suggest Quelques Fleurs Royale by Houbigant

It is an all time favorite for me. Very feminen, very soft, very strong. It remineds me a ballerina. Elegant, soft, naive but strong. I read it is out of produce but i hope it is something temporary for promotion of their new parfume Nomad. Because Nomad can not replace Love.
D&P Perfumum have the perfect dupe for this and lasts all day long, at a very good price! I had it and loved it, got so many compliments wearing it.

Does anyone know a perfume
Close to chloe love other than phyllis? I cant find either 😭
Buy "Phyllis" Pull & Bear when you can't find it : they are quite the same ;o)
I have a 7ml decant. I love it!! Anyone out there who have a 50ml or larger bottle and is not keen on it, willing to part with it? PM me please.

I have a 50mL no box but chain and bottle in great condition. Barely any missing and it smells great. Selling as I don’t wear it, I’ve been riding a white floral wave the past three years! Hope I can rehome this beauty.
I get the distinct small of pickles at first spray, weird. Dries down way too powdery for me, not my cup of tea.

Powder, powder, and more powder. From the top to the bottom. Soft throw and skin scent within half an hour.
Pleasant but do you really want just powder?

This perfume is extremely unique. When i wear i get SO many complements that i smell so clean. I constantly get asked what perfume im wearing. It has been discontinued and i bought a leftover 50 ml bottle for double its price (but completely worth it). Phyllis pull&bear is similar, same top notes but love chloe has more powder and musk if that can make sense. I wish we could somehow sign a petition for CHLoE to bring this back lol.
If u guys also search for similar notes u can try also Bvlgari femme (heliotrope, iris and powder)
Is anyone selling this or is ready to swap? Let me know, please:)
This has been discontinued:((((((((( why chloe?? just ask you why?

Nourh:
Try eBay (US) or similar auction-type sites for Love, Chloe. Good luck.

Love, Chloe lasts longer when layered with the honeyed powder scent of discontinued Johnson’s 24 Hour Body Lotion. Discontinuing the Johnson’s lotion is a scandal too.

I received this as a birthday gift from someone who works for the parent company as she thought it might work on me, and she was right; it does! I find the other Chloe fragrances a bit too flowery/overpowering but I think this would be wonderful as an everyday day scent. Although some of the notes (lilac for instance) are bright up front, on me, its like a very good soap and powder. Clean and fresh and not at all overpowering, but certainly "there." A perfect, classic summer scent but also a great office scent as its completely inoffensive. There is just enough "unique" here to make it a scent you'd want to notice on yourself all day, but not necessarily others noticing this on you.
WHERE CAN I FIND THIS! This has been sold out worldwide/discontinued 😫 why would chloe do this.

Instant love. This is more floral than other powdery perfumes I've tried...but I'm not complaining. It's also very "wet" smelling for a powdery focused sent. It reminds me of dainty purple flowers next to a waterfall, and the powder leans more green and herbal than a pure lipstick, make-upy scent. It smells very natural and clean! So far I'm 10/10 for all of Chloe's scents...wow.

It's my second ever blind buy and I absolutely love it. To me, it's unique. Not too powdery, too floral or too sweet and Scents are in harmony with each other. Also I love the rice note. It reminds me of raw rice or paddy fields from far distance.

I don’t have time right now to fully review but if you own it already and have a vacuum with a washable filter, next time you wash and dry it, spray this on it! It’s like a little luxury every time you turn it on.

This is such a vintage fragance, it smells like make up, powder and soap. Not good for a blind buy, people could call it an "old lady" fragance, but I just find it nostalgic, warm and soft. Beautiful bottle, great silage and longetivity and even the deodorant is a good lighter substitute for the perfume, I used to have it in my purse and use it as a touch up mist.

To me, this is one of the most beautiful fragrances ever created. It’s the scent of everything beautiful and rose gold. It’s quite a vintage structured, classic fragrance but with so much life and soul, it has a timeless quality that makes it smell lovely on even a 17 year old girl. It’s composed with a melange of powdery florals; heliotrope (if you’re not acquainted with this flower, it smells like vanilla marshmallows), violet powder, sugared lilacs and rice milk. This fragrance contains one of the loveliest mixtures of musks I’ve ever smelled; it’s sensual yet comforting. It has so many layers and changes slightly on everyone’s skin I feel like I don’t have the words to do it full justice. But this has been one of my favourites since I was that 17 year old girl, and I know it will be, for many, many more years. A modern classic and gem.

Heavenly. Powdery, creamy in the dry down (I swear there's something vanilla-y in there somewhere), clean in that just-bathed-with-beautiful-soap way. So sensual. Ultra feminine. The holy grail of perfumes (for me!).

This one is clean, warm and powdery. It's like I've just emerged from the most luxurious outdoor bath, in a garden of blooming purple flowers. Sunshine, steam, warm skin, fine bath products, lilacs, greens. A barely-there touch of sweetness. Yes, the 'expensive face powder' note is quite dominant for the first hour or so, but on my skin, it doesn't hijack the composition, the scent gets better with time. Very classy, very 'French', and very feminine, but also down to earth, inviting and versatile. A fine, modern scent with a nostalgic twist, très retro-chic! If it were a person it would be a fresh-faced natural beauty who exudes effortless elegance and a warm sincerity (imagine the wholesome charms of a young Brigete Bardot). Suits many different occassions, any age group (I've been wearing it since my mid-20s), and works all year round. Sillage and longevity are excellent, and it smells different from what most girls/women are wearing these days. You will stand out wearing Love Chloe. I will never understand its discontinuation.
