Luckily I have back up bottles. I get compliments from both genders when I wear this. Men seem to like it more though...the last guy who smelled it on me was a 24 year old aquaintence, he commented that I always smell so clean and sensuous, and he wasn't sure if it was my perfume or if I'd just taken a shower. It feels very 'me', like 2nd skin, and it will remain as my signature for as long as I can get my hands on it.
Love Love :-) Love, Chloe. I don't know why they discontinued that fragrance. It was my favorite from the line. I found it very feminine - powdery and long lasting.
Hi guys, i have noticed that this fragrance is discontinued. Just to help out to whoever loves this perfume they do have it on creedperfumesamples.com i think they ship from UK
Par pitié ne cessez pas la production de "Love" !! Mon flacon arrive à la fin et je n'ai pas eu le temps d'acheter de nouveau ce parfum poudré qui me rend folle !!! J'adore "Love Chloé"....
this one is so feminine and beautiful!!!

I’m not at all surprised that Chloe has discontinued Love. Fragrances reminiscent of old time face powder and lipstick aren’t the current fashion, even though there are hoards of us who find it delightful and nostalgic.

Having said that though, I can’t love Love.

For me, the powderiness is overdone to the extent that this fragrance can be smothering. How many powdery notes can be thrown into one bottle? Powder, iris, violet, heliotrope (yes, it can be powdery) and musk.

Love definitely needs a light hand.

I don’t hate Love, and it can be comforting after a shower and before bed, but if you can’t get hold of this now that it is discontinued, Guerlain’s Insolence EDP might be a nice alternative for you.

I've got admit I'm addicted to this. I own a load of florals but Love Chloe is my fave. I do detect the powderiness of iris and face powder but it's the lilac and hyacinth that make this special for me. Heaven knows why this beauty has been discontinued!
It has a little vanilla sweetness from the heliotrope and enough musk to soften and merge the notes.
My birthday is in May just when the lilac is in bloom in the south of the UK. This scent really transports me to this time when spring is nearly done and everything is still new and fresh.
It doesn't screech at you as some floral do. This is soft but also not weak. It is entrancing. My search for a lilac scent is done. It works beautifully in this.
I admit I'm on the wrong side of 40 but this is what I reach for when I particularly want to feel confident and feminine.
I'm so pleased that I also get moderate sillage and longevity. Please bring it back!!!
You can definitely tell this is a Chloe flanker upon first whiff. Within seconds sparkles of tangerine and black current twinkle around the rose. It's backup bottle worthy.
Whoa I have a colleague that wears it almost everyday and is zesty tangerine floral smell. Very elegant, and quite strong for an EDT. I added it immediately to my wishlist.
I love this. It’s so delicate and pretty!! I couldn’t stop smelling it when I sprayed it. It smells like drinking mimosas at a picnic in back of a chateau. Loveeee!

Pretty, sparkly but very similar to the Chloé I own.
I do pick up a bit of Tangerine 🍊

This is basically Chloé with a fleeting whisper of tangerine. But so fleeting, that if you blink, you’ll miss it. The citrus pops up in the very beginning, stays for under a minute, and then it’s gone, leaving behind the familiar powdery rose DNA of the original.

Citrus top notes are naturally volatile, so it’s no surprise they disappear quickly. But if this was meant to be a citrusy twist on Chloé, the tangerine needed more weight, something bolder to carry the opening before fading out. As it stands, it feels almost identical to the original, to the point where I’m not entirely sure this needed to exist as a separate release.

A workaround? Maybe layering it with a bit of mandarin essential oil before spraying. The oil will capture the fragrance and deliver a better longevity, and you'd get the citrus it promises.

Pretty, wearable, pleasant, but not a citrus-forward experience. This is Chloé, lightly touched, not transformed.

I loved it the first time I smelled it. On me it smells like a chamomile tea, so fresh and natural and makes me relaxed and happy. It's the only scent that works for me among all Chloe perfumes. I'm glad that I picked it up by accident. After 2 hours, it starts to smell like the original Chloe, but more woody and less sweet. It lasts relatively long and becomes a skin scent after 2 hours. And it's perfect for me because I can't stand strong perfumes. I have tried it multiple times and really liked it, will get a big bottle when I get a good price.

What a lovely fresh scent. On paper I love this, its just so fresh, I just kept smelling the paper, and had to get a bottle.
Next to Roses De Chloé I definitely smell the difference, as this is less rose and more tangerine and citrus fresh, but they are certainly sisters in the DNA.
On my body chemistry this hits different though, the tangerine in the opening is not so fresh, but it smells sweet like honey. I am not into sweet perfumes, so this opening is not so much for me, but after 30 minutes or so I really do enjoy it, and it sort of becomes similar to the Roses de Chloé on me. Lesson learned, test the perfume on the skin.

I LOVE the tangerine 🍊 blast of zesty freshness I get from this (which I blind bought by the way) knowing I’d love it. It’s backed up by the rose and blackcurrant giving it some body and character in the background. It is very well blended, that I feel that the main co-star of this perfume, the tangerine, is what I actually get as the main scent. The tangerine is what I wanted and is what I get. And is contrasted with the Chloe clean/ soapy/ rose sparkly essence. This note makes me feel joy. It doesn’t last but I have an aveda tangerine essential oil i will use with it when I’m feeling more organised. I think that will help. I’ve always loved this style of Chloe bottle although I’ve never owned the classics only the nomade naturelle which I loved initially and is still special but is especially sweet and I am not really a sweet fragrance wearer but I do still love to smell it from the bottle. This however is fresh and classy combined in perfect unison. If you enjoy citrus fragrances that are perfumey but not heavy you should enjoy this, even if longevity is somewhat lacking. I’ve already bought a back up. That’s how confident I am that I’ll get through this. Enjoy 🍊

I quite like it, although it wasn’t what I expected. It opens up very green and fresh, then settles into a powdery rose enveloped in a warm, realistic tangerine. I expected it to be zesty and sharp, but instead it’s green-to-powdery and slightly sweet. The sillage isn’t crazy, this is more of a skin scent, but lasting power is good, sometimes I can still smell it on my wrist the next day.

Very weather dependent for me, for some reason. I strongly associate it with spring and usually with summer, meaning I usually like it when it’s 15+°C outside. Wind and open air also suit this perfume. It’s very long lasting and with strong sillage. Has some sparkling soapy quality to it, like most Chloé rose perfumes. I’m not a big fan of solo rose in perfumes, but I like this one: it’s not dry, sour, heavy or migraine-inducing, but rather fresh and citrusy in a moderately soapy way.

What is up with this? It was a nice scent of the original classic Chloe (from the early 2000's, not the one from the 70's) mixed with a strong note of tangerine, but it vanished from my skin within minutes 🤯! I mean there is no trace of it, not even some lingering aromachemicals. I am just baffled as to how they can even charge money for this and baffled as to how it's possible to disappear like that 🫥

Tengo solo una muestra pequeña, pero me sorprendió tantísimo cuando lo aplique y lo primero que vino a mi mente fue agarrar un ramo de flores y rosas y pegar mi nariz en el para luego inhalar profundamente. Se siente tan natural, tan orgánico. Como si realmente hubiesen rosas encapsuladas dentro de esta botella.
Es suave, es girly, es fresco, es rosa, grita feminidad y suavidad a todo pulmón.

For me, by far the best Chloe scent in this particular bottle shape. Fresh, zesty, clean, with a hint of greenery. Love to wear this as a light inoffensive everyday perfume for the office. Also the perfect kind of clean girl scent. Perfect for wearing post workout after you’ve showered and are leaving the gym. Feels like the right type of thing for that. I like layering an citrus heavy body spray if I’m looking to bump up the subtle tangerine note.

The rose and tangerine notes complement each other very well. It’s smells like a garden in summer - I was expecting to see a green accord as I feel it’s quite a green fragrance. I wish the longevity and oomph was there because it’s such a beautiful scent.

WAY better than the original Chloe! The original Chloe is beautiful, but more powdery than it is floral. Chloe Rose Tangerine made me feel so pretty and happy…it’s so fresh, youthful, and rosy. Springtime in a bottle.
It is a lovely scent but it smells exactly like one of these bubble bath liquids from Avon they sold in the 2000s.

Call me crazy, but this perfume gives me the “vibe” of one of my favorites perfumes ever, and sadly discontinued. Florabotanica balenciaga and rose tangerine gives me the same vibe, fresh, green, aromatic. Not a dupe, but in the sane category.
Actually im wearing florabotanica in one wrist, and rose tangerine in the other, and It feels like I find the baby sister of my beloved one.
Fresh, simple, any occasion perfume.
I Love chloe!
Beautiful! Day- time, perfect for all year round and for any occasion.
It has an aromatherapeutic vibe in warmer autumn and colder spring days.
The perfect white tee running errands type of scent ! I really like this one !

Delicate and light. Soft citrus in the opening. Both the tangerine and rose smell realistic. The black currant brings the scent a gentle green spiciness, like the scent of the black currant plant's leaf.

A safe, pleasant scent that could be worn any time any place.

This is the first perfume that I have ever found that reminds me of the wonderful discontinued Victoria’s Secret Victoria Eau de Perfume Cologne from 1991 which was my signature perfume for over a decade, Even though this perfume smells heavily of rose, there is something in the dark honey-ish undertone that it settles on my skin that is EXACTLY like Victoria. For me, that makes this a winner. I wish the longevity was a bit longer like Victoria though. The silage and longevity are less, which makes this ideal for the workplace.

Some people comment they can’t smell the tangerine; I only smell distinct tangerine for about 2 minutes and then it settles into citrus that is balanced nicely by the other elements. I think this is a VERY well balanced perfume with rose settling at the top, but not in a sickeningly sweet way. The middle and bottom notes anchor the rose in such a way that is attractive and sensible, with a hint of sexy.

As long as you like rose, this should be a safe blind buy.

This is classic Chloe DNA : sharp, fresh and a good mix of floral and fruits. I'm not a fan of tangerines in perfume but I do like this one, it settles in very nicely. After 2 hours, you get this nice light woody/ambery scent. But it is quite light, so the tenacity isn't the best. At first there's a good sillage, but it weakens pretty fast. Great for office, school or day-wear in general. I wouldn't buy a bottle because this isn't my kind of perfume exactly. As someone who doesn't like citrusy perfumes that much, it is pretty great!

Sweet, fresh, fruity rose, inoffensive and office appropriate makes you feel clean and fresh. Longevity and sillage are moderate, might need to be topped up throughout the day. Not a special or memorable fragrance but likeable.
Initially smells like PURELL on me and turns green and bitter after an hour, with a little bit of rose peeking through. I smell like a grandma’s bathroom, in a bad way. It’s a pass for me.

It smells like roses de Chloe with citrus, just that simple lol. I still prefer original Chloe over this though, I’ve gotten more compliments with Chloe Eau De Parfum. Go figure. Longevity is super low, like 2 hours max on a good day, so you’ll need to reapply.

There are things in this rose that are lovely, however it becomes rather too green and bitter with a Lovage accord that seems to be of popular use in many fragrances these days... I'm not a fan. I'm sure on the right skin it could be lovely. Not for me.
A photorealistic dewy rose. Quite nice and delicate. It’s an EDT so it becomes close to skin an hour after spraying.

The sparkling, ticklish and zesty version of the original, which is already a masterpiece to me. It performs a little less well, and as you would expect from an EDT, but stays on the skin on the same way as the OG. Is it a necessary addition if you already have the original? I don't think so, but this one is perfect if you want a slightly punchier version. Or a big Chloé fan <3 In any case: lovely :)

Fresh rose, with tangerine which brings a subtle natural sweetness, and a woody background. A bit soapy. Pretty, young, ultra-feminine. Terrible longevity (2 hours). When you first spray it, the sillage is great but it becomes soft quickly. I like the scent, but the performance is a let down. Then again it's a fresh EDT so it is what it is.
Tested at Sephora. I used to really want a bottle of this. Smelling it again, it’s just alright. Clean fresh rose, with a drip of tangerine. Doesn’t have enough character for me I guess.

For an EDT, this is unusually strong right out of the gate. Using very little, the scent is all around me. It does fade out as you would expect for an EDT and within a couple of hours, it's much softer. I find it more floral than fruity, fresh, elegant and feminine. A perfect, pretty scent for everyday wear in the warmer spring and summer months with that lovely rose you know from Chloe fragrances.

While not a perfect rose scent by any means, Rose Tangerine is a great improvement on Roses de Chloe in terms of longevity and throw. It still sits fairly close to the skin, but the rose note stays around for much longer. It is slightly sweeter and obviously has a great zing from the citrus, but it is still a rose-focused perfume. The two smell similar enough to me that one would not need both, and if I had to choose between the two Rose Tangerine would win hands down to come home to my collection. Of course the bottle is lovely and would look gorgeous on any vanity or dressing table, but the scent is pretty and also approachable enough that those looking to dip their toe in rose scents might really enjoy this one.

Oh noooo... I had so many expectations based on the notes and reviews...
It smells like celery on me, I have no idea how this is even possible! That said, I can't give an impartial review, I guess this just doesn't work on my skin. I'm mostly writing this for my future reference and to warn anybody who intends on blind buying it. Don't. Try it on first.

I already had Chloé by Chloé but was getting bored of it from time to time and I love citrusy scents which is why rose tangerine seemed like a great option for me. While I absolutely adore the scent and I get the rose and the tangerine and the black currant, the longevity is just non existent, it kind of makes me mad. I get it, it’s edt not edp but it just does not excuse it’s longevity.

I really love this. I really smell the rose in it. At least on my skin. I've noticed that I tend to like perfumes that are flowers with some citrus. This is it. If you're not a floral person, this isn't for you. I love it though. Very pretty. I spray it in my hair.

This is a lovely and elegant rose scent like from years back, although I can smell something green in there. The blackcurrant is somewhat faint and I can barely smell the tangerine, but overall this is a scent I enjoy sniffing. It lasts for about four hours before it turns into a skin scent, but when I sprayed it on the shawl I was wearing I could still smell it the next day.

My first Chloe and I knew I would love it (it was a blind buy). It is so elegant, delicate, and uplifting. Roses and tangerines are here, but none of them are suffocating or harsh. It's so well-balanced! Sits close to the skin, but is long-lasting (especially on clothes). I can't stop sniffing at it! Très chic!🧡🌹🍊

Gorgeous! Sparkling, joyful, enjoyable, and vibrant. On me, this is a very clean, sweet orange with a delicate pink rosebud undertone. Although it smells like fresh dewy pink roses, its longevity leaves much to be desired at the end of the day. Tangerine, for whatever reason, seems to stick to the skin better. It's extremely stunning and a must-have!

I like this scent very much.
Maybe it's not the best, the most suprising or the most exqusite fragrance. But definetley it's one of the most comforting. At least for me.
On my skin Rose Tangerine turn into rosy-peachy combo with hint of musk. You can almost feel this peachy, fluffy skin of fruit. Decent longevity (6h approx.), good for work, not to loud - will not cause any unplesant sensation/migrene, not offend anyone. I could wallow in this peachy cloud forever ... but my husband can't stand it :(. All he can get from Rose Tangerine it's "stinky rose".
What a pity!

As someone already mentioned, it smells like a rose shampoo: very refreshing rose with black currant and a little spice. The tangerine is undetectable on me.
Three-to-four sprays are enough to last a few hours, and you can definitely smell it on yourself.
On me, the scent barely changes; it dries down practically the same, just a little warmer and spicier.
An overall lovely fragrance, one I could see many liking, but I would not repurchase it, as I prefer some sweetness.
Zero sweetness. Has bite. Refreshing bug spray.

Very pretty for those who want a rose fragrance where the rose takes a back seat. On me this is mostly tangerine, but it's a great tangerine. Juicy, pulpy, with a hint of bitterness you may find in the rind. A great find for citrus lovers who prefer a garden-fresh citrus over a candied citrus.

This one is really good. it definitely has the Chloe DNA, and for some, at first scent, they might not be able to get it.
that was my case.

I tried it again one of these nights, after shower. at first, there is a strong note of tangerine, citrusy and juicy.
then it comes the rose. but it is not a rose like roses de Chloe, I would describe as a petal being crushed and you get that fresh rose smell.

the dry down is pretty simple, tangerine citrusy and the petal scent mixed.

good longevity on my skin, poor sillage. but still, a must have for Chloe perfume lovers.

to the ones that love the Chloe edp, this has its DNA, but a lot less serious and a lot more luminous, I would not say fresh, but light.

there it is.

The first five minutes of this on my wrist smelled a lot like Roses de Chloe (which I like, but don’t want another perfume of the same scent) and then it turned into a brighter, sparkling, sweet rose that’s just so uplifting and refreshing. I’ll keep wearing this sample until I run out. Hope I have enough to form a good decision of whether or not it’s full bottle worthy.

At first I hated it, especially the opening. I get the black currant more than the tangerine. I got sour wine. But now I am a fan of the whole fragrance. It’s a rose shampoo scent to me and I am all about the clean/soapy/shampoo scents.
I agree with the previous comment. If you're willing to wait for the dry down it's gorgeous....the tangerine is a uplifting one, it has a herbal seaside note. Best from the Chloe range.

1 - 3 sprays, lightly misted: fresh roses and citrus zest with a slight fruity undertone. Fresh, clean, delicate and youthful.

If applied more heavily than that it gets too bitter, like a grapefruit zest overdose.

This is one of those fragrances that must be worn with a slight hand. It's beautiful when worn correctly. I bought a small bottle yesterday.

I have received a sample of this fragrance, it smells very straightforward, there is nothing else but a velvet rose🌹. I have a cheap hairspray that smells exactly as this fragrance, so I think you should be a big fan of this brand and rose scent to purchase this fragrance

Almost smells like rose-scented baby wipes in the bottle but once sprayed is a fresh rose but with more of a white floral note compared to say Red Roses by Jo Malone. It stays like that in the dry down to my nose. I don't smell any tangerine or blackcurrant or the base notes so I'm quite sad about that but found that Gia by Tocca is what I wanted this to be, a citrusy rose.

If anyone wants some fragrances check out my page on mercari @ bellabello
Very nice and fresh rose!

I am new to the house of Chloe. I have never smelled the original Chloe edp, so this is just a review for the Chloe Rose Tangerine edt.

I put the perfume on around 7:30 this morning. It was a soft rose with a hint of green sweetness that morphed into a more robust rose as it heated on my skin. It still remained lightly sweetened by the tangerine and soft wine note of the black currant.

By 11:50 on my skin it is very sweet but on my clothing the rose still dominates. Overall the affect is quite lovely. The rose is a bit powdery like the Miss Dior Rose N'Roses Roller Pearl (not to be confused with the edt...this one is the oil roller). I don't think I need both scents in my collection, but so far out of the two Chloe Rose Tangerine edt, is the better. However both are nice and long lasting on my dryer skin type.

It is 3:30 in the afternoon, and the sweetness on my skin is still there, and a soft fluffy rose like a halo remains.

The beginning of this perfume smells exactly like fresh Turkish red roses and I love rose smell. Dry down grows on my skin, it becomes more intense and outstanding. I don't know how but maybe this perfume triggered my smell memory. In conclusion I loved this perfume.

I adore this scent but because of my warm body chemistry, the smell of tangerine struggles to make it past the heavy floral scent so it's definitely not "fresh" on me. The staying power is incredibly weak as well, even for an EDT. My 'Blooming Bouquet' by Dior lasts longer than this one. I am however addicted to this scent. The floral smells more like a fresh garden instead of potpourri which I love so I may try getting my hands on the 5ml travel size bottle. If I end up really loving it I may consider the 30ml in the future, but the longevity and projection is extremely poor on me. I do highly recommend testing it on your skin. If you have a cooler skin temperature, this might work for you :)

My mouth is watering just thinking of this fragrance, no lie. I love the original EDP, and I got a sample of this one when purchasing something else, and to me, they smell basically the same, the only distinction being that the designers of Rose Tangerine managed to replicate the explosive juiciness of the individual pulps you feel when you bite down into a tangerine for this fragrance. Definitely a younger, fresher version of the original. Yum!

Omg - this is gorgeous! I kept forgetting to try it when I was anywhere that sells it, so finally I just ordered it. I wish I bought the big bottle. Next time. Who knows why some notes hit some sweet spot in our brains and ignite euphoria! I wish I knew exactly what they were…but, luckily, my whatever activates my dopamine is abundant in this. It smells so…euphoric! Sparkling, happy, fun, vacationey…I love Roses de Chloe but this…this is joy in a bottle. On me this is very pure, sweet tangerine, with an undertone of gentle pink rosebuds. This will be an no all time favorite!

Love this fragrance! I like it so much better than Chloe EDP. It is a beautiful mix of the citrus and rose components. I don't smell the cedar only citrus and rose. The opening is so bright and gorgeous! Smells great on the scent strip as well as on my skin. In a way, I blind bought a bottle because I only smelled it on the scent strip so I went to Sephora again today to test it on my skin. I am so happy that it worked out for me. I know other people may think differently but this is a successful blind buy for me.

Initial spray: Rose & Tangerine was prominent, really nice!
Dry down: Smells like a common female deodorant
Verdict: Its a No for me

Note: I love Chloe Nomade Perfume !!!

I enjoyed the bright fruitiness of this perfume, but a warning if you’re going to be around people with allergies— I started to cough and felt my throat get hoarse soon after putting it on, and it was bad enough that I had to wash it off after about 10 min, then I was fine. I’m not sure what caused this reaction as I have never had a perfume make me cough like that before.

This is a huge improvement on the original, and I liked the original, which was my signature scent from its release in 2008 for about three years. I can definitely smell the roses and the tangerines, which serve to brighten and freshen the scent, but the Chloe DNA is still there. Really happy to have this in my collection.

This one is no mystery which I appreciate. It is exactly what it says it is- Chloe EDP with a juicy tangerine and a hint of blackcurrant that I have to try really hard to detect. Since I like Chloe EDP just fine and really like a sweet citrus, I do enjoy this but it probably doesn't last beyond an hour and there's nothing interesting about it. Still, I appreciate that it brought the tangerine/rose combo to the forefront of my mind and I'll now be seeking out some scents with this profile.

I've currently got Chloe EDP on one wrist and Chloe Rose Tangerine on the other. They're definitely similar but Rose Tangerine is far better in my opinion.

I've never been a huge fan of the original. It's way too soapy and bitter. It burns the back of my throat when I smell it. Rose Tangerine, on the other hand, is like they took the original, removed the bitterness I don't like, and then added some juicy citrus. It's absolutely lovely, like Chloe had a glow up.

If you don't like the original, give this a try!

A very citrusy and refreshing take on rose. It perfectly captures both rose and tangerine essences-if a rose and a tangerine had a baby, this would be it. The tangerine makes the rose more "modern," so I think even those who typically aren't rose fans would like it. A bright daytime fragrance for any age group.
Tangerine is strong in the opening with a hint of the rose. I was enjoying it but after 30 minutes the scent was pretty much gone. Disappointing
What can I say? It smells like rose tangerine. The tangerine shines through more on me. Sweet, fresh and juicy.

I was so disappointed in this fragrance. On paper, it's everything I love, but on *me* it becomes an unpleasant "green" fragrance. I lose the nice citrus rose from the tester, and it turns into something that I can only describe as being similar to old deodorant that has turned. Hope you have better luck than me!

Update February 2022: Tried it again today by accident (reached for the wrong Chloe). At first sniff I though, "this isn't as bad as I remember," and I continued to get dressed excited to test this scent. Well, before leaving home I realized that I made a huge mistake. I think the problem isn't that the tangerine" isn't bright or even fresh enough for my taste, but that it actually smells a bit old or rotten to my nose. I LOVE citrus scents, so I'm still really disappointed in this one.
clean and fresh, but does not last, I kept wishing it had just a bit more. the tangerine is weak and overpowered by the rose making it more peony. I wouldn't repurchase.

To my nose this smells like walnut with a hint of black currant. No rose, no tangerine, very little rose, there seems to be a bit of original chloe DNA in the background but it's really far.

Man, how come noone mention this smells like walnut??? To my nose this is totally realistic walnut, especially in the opening. It's nice sweet smell but I don't think the name reflects the smell well. Smells like niche fragrance, very specific. I imagine it could be like some imaginary Tom Ford Walnut Garden, or something like that. I also think it's unisex, that walnut gives it a confident "I'm doing what I want" vibe.

I'm giving rating OK because I don't know what do with that scent, but if you want confidence boosting walnut scent with floral background this is it.

From what I read other people say here I almost think that I smelled the wrong perfume, but this is just what I'm getting from scent strip at Douglas...

I love this one so much. To me this smells 90% as similar as the chloé roses edp. I broke the bottle IMMEDIATLY just after i took it out the box 🥸 and it shattered into pieces just like my heart (LMAO)
Yet still, i could barely detect it! So i guess this has a weak sillage.. But it’s so so pretty, and i’ve already reordered a new bottle. Echoing past comments, if you already have the chloé roses edp, or even the original chloé; i don’t think you’ll miss much with this flanker/release

It reminds me of coral-tangerine color rose.
This rose is prominent and modern, unlike typical rose scent.

This smells like cheap shower gel. I am so sick of shower gel fragrances. They are everywhere! Niche, designer, they all have them and they all smell very similar w/ their slightly fake floral, fake citrus scent. The only place you can go that doesn't have a shower gel fragrance is natural houses, they don't do shower gel accords. This is just bad, boring, sharp and I probably should've rated it a hate.
I cant get past the intense peony. I want to like it as its clean and fresh, I wish it had less of that and more tangerine and rose. It kind of burns my nose from peony sharpness

Simple, fresh, and fun. Pairs well with a sweatshirt and casual errands. All the notes play a role and don't compete with each other. The rose and tangerine are most present, but not overwhelmingly so.
Does what it says on the bottle! Rose and tangerine – fresh, clean, floral. Not groundbreaking, but very pleasant and enjoyable.
It is very pleasant however leans towards more youthful fragrances than mature for example the EDT is super mature to my nose but this seems a bit playful 7/10

Rose Tangerine is a nice, clean perfume, and gives me "nice girl" vibes. It smells floral, fruity/citrusy (especially grapefruit), but it's very delicate therefore projection and sillage are not the best, so a shy girl might be more happy to wear it.

Got a sample with an order online and came straight on here to read reviews... I am so surprised that I like this so much. Its a rose floral citrus right enough and is so nice to wear! I really enjoyed this and I'm going to buy it next year as my spring/summer perfume for sure.

Urgh, I got a freebie sample of this. I knew I wouldn't be fussed as it's really not my style of fragrance. I have to say I hate it so much, it stinks on my skin. I smell like an old lady smothered in moth balls.
It's powdery, sickly watery rose perfume.

Pretty scent, but barely detectable. Using a sample from Sephora Favorites, I applied on pulse points and clothes and within a few minutes could not smell anything. I sprayed all over for 2nd time, and still nothing. I used the remaining sample in the afternoon, and only now I can detect a very faint scent. No buy.

I grabbed a sample of this because I love the Chloe EDP and Roses de Chloe. This tangerine version smelled very citrusy and sharp on paper, so I wasn't expecting to like it. However, it's really lovely on the skin. It's a warmer version of Roses de Chloe to me. It smells very summer-y, I get lots of coconut at the top even though that's not listed as a note. It has a bit of a sunscreen smell, but still has the light fresh floral quality of the other Chloes. I'm surprised no other reviews mention this smelling beachy or sunscreeny because that is EXACTLY what I get from this fragrance. It actually reminds me of any generic "beach" fragrance but heavy on the rose. Perhaps I'm just associating the orange notes with sunscreen?

Like the Roses de Chloe EDT, this is overpriced considering the longevity you get. It starts to fade after about 2 hours, then lingers as a skin scent for another few hours. The scent is FBW but I wouldn't pay full price.

I was so eager to buy something fresh, citrusy and rosy for upcoming summer season and I expected this one to be perfect. Sadly, it’s not! No tangerine/ citrus )not for me at least), rose is faint and not the one I’m used to in Chloe perfumes. The longevity is extremely poor - after 30 minutes I can barely smell anything. It was a blind buy for me and it was a fail so I strongly advise you to smell it before buying (I wish I did…).
Oh God ladies, this is everything a perfume should be! Smells like a straight flower shop, heavenly!

This is an ok perfume from Chloe. Not much staying power or strength and hardly any sillage like the original EDP. Smell is a bit like Roses de Chloe but with some citrus notes. Roses de Chloe is a favourite of mine, I don’t want that discontinued because of this new launch. I prefer the freshly cut rose smell to this orangey smell.

To be honest I couldnt stand this perfume. I got about 30 minutes in and gave up, deciding to wash it off. When i got the sample I didnt have the highest hopes. Mainly because while years back I really liked Chloé, I revisited it recently and found i just wasnt a fan anymore. It was coming off sharp on me for some reason. Well the same thing happened here. Very sharp and astringent smelling from the onset. I kept waiting for it to settle, hoping it was the top notes causing the issue but it remained sharp. (Maybe its my chemistry??) It still has a very similar smell to the original Chloe. So I feel like if you like that perfume and dont mind a strong orange citrus twist added to it you may like it. (That was really all i could smell from it: chloe+sharp tangerine) But for me its a hard pass. And full disclosure I dont seek out citrus scents often, just not a big fan.
This reminds me of the original Tory Burch but softer. Opens too sweet but settles into a lovely rose/citrus combo quickly.

A lovely crisp rose scent, the initial fruit burst of tangerine and berries last just a few minutes but it adds sweetness and makes it very youthful. The cedar note makes it feel very clean. I have trouble to perceive the amber here. Transparent, clean, uplifting and very pretty. I think this is a very casual and relaxed scent, nothing groundbreaking here. A safe gift for an energetic lady. Projection and longevity are both moderate.

I think Rose Tangerine is a better, more updated version of Roses de Chloe. I love the scent of the latter, as it smells like fresh dewy pink roses, but the longevity leaves something to be desired at the end of the day. Tangerine, somehow, does seem to hold onto the skin better. Scent-wise, they are about 90% similar to my nose--tangerine is a bit zestier, with a little more bounce, while Roses de Chloe is a little more single-note. I've gotten back into rose scents a little lately, so I am glad that I've gotten to smell this one. I can see now why Roses de Chloe has been pushed to the side, and I think it was smart of Chloe to launch this as its own scent rather than just reformulate Roses.

Opens with sweet tangerine rose, just as the name suggests. However, the tangerine note fades quickly, and the rose takes on a touch of that soft plantish spice roses acquire as they begin to droop and wither: just a faint mineral tickle in the nose.

For a bit during the dry down there’s also a minor plastic-y note—a tangy synthetic smoothness, like a lighter and friendlier version of the rose in Le Labo Baie Rose 26. It vanishes after half an hour, though, and about an hour in the rose becomes quite green.

The woody base is smooth and dry throughout—almost powdery, even.

To me, Chloe Rose Tangerine is fine. It’s pretty, spring-y, work-safe, wedding-safe. It’s dainty jewelry and morning sunshine and a pinkish-nude lip. It's too innocuous for my personal taste, but certainly nice enough.

This is very interesting if you’re used to the line. Light, fresh, clean... as one would guess. It has a very fresh, fruity note that changes the composition. Sillage is very low but still has presence. I like it. 7/10

I love it, this is currently my signature spring fragrance. All notes there are so gorgeous - tangerine, black currant and strong sharp cedar opening. Settles in to a cosy warm woody scent, still with a hint of quite sharp cedar note. I only wish this EDT lasted longer, after couple of hours the scent completely disappears. Still I love this fragrance so much I invested in a full size product.
Dreamy rose tea, if you are into this flower you’ll inevitability like or love this Chloe. Reminds me a lot of Rose by Paul Smith.

Sampled as part of the Sephora Favorites Perfume Sampler.

I want to like this, as it smells quite nice in both the opening and the first few minutes of dry down. I get nice fresh rose first and foremost, and then a background of faint tangerine and sparkling wine, like a bougie mimosa.

Unfortunately, about ~20 minutes after dry down, it's straight up gone. I know that an EDT isn't going to last as long as an EDP the vast majority of the time, but damn dude, not even 45 minutes? The extremely weak longevity takes what would be a solid "like" from me and turns it into just an "ok".

I'll save the rest of my sample for warmer weather and see if the longevity improves then.

This is my first Chloé perfume and as a rose lover I really like it. To me it mainly smells like rose, I'm surprised no one has mentioned that this has an element of powder. I don't really get the tangerine in this. This honesty reminds me of Amazing Grace Ballet Rose but slightly fruity and powdery. This was a blind buy and I dont regret it but the staying power is my problem with this, it's weak.

Testing this in the winter (almost) with an inside temperature of 64 degrees F. Two sprays on my right arm.
The tangerine is lost on me. It just is NOT there. I get rose, fresh, in your face, sparkling rose with a hint of some woodiness that is keeping this from making me queasy. I love rose but I guess it needs to be tempered with other notes that I notice because this is just too, too much. I'm getting no citrus, black currant or amber warmth.

Now almost an hour has gone by and this is more palatable to my nose. But that is mainly because the scent is disappearing. It hasn't morphed into anything more on me, just faded quite a bit. I am betting that within the hour, it will be *poof*--all gone. I own Solinotes Rose and I would rather wear that than this one. This is a "dislike" for me as the rose is just too "there" to be enjoyable. My husband says "It isn't horrible but you have a lot of other perfumes that are nicer and not as harsh." Then he sneezed. I wore Noir Extreme last night and he loved that one (for frame of reference).

After another 10 minutes I have decided to scrub this one off. Not my cup of tea or vase of roses, if you will.

I got a bit roped into trying this by a nice sales lady pushing product, but I ended up loving it. I didn't buy it as I wanted to see how it would wear all day rather than going off ten minutes, but now that I have worn it this is going on my wish-list.

For me, the opener was a fresh and dazzling tangerine scent, but with the citrus elements balanced by a hint of rose and a slight meatier scent I couldn't place (possibly the black current.) Over the hours it balanced really well, into a soft tangerine that didn't come off as tropical but feminine, mixed with a stronger rose vibe like pressed petals that I loved - I almost went back right then to grab a bottle. Over six hours later the scent was still very nice, though the sillage had decreased and I needed to get a few inches from my wrist to pick it up. But it had changed again, to a more down to Earthy, warm, woody citrus. It was very calming, and unique to anything I've tried (I think this is the first Chloe perfume I've tried at all.) It easily lasted over eight hours, though near the end it was a very close Earthy scent with just a hint of orange.

I loved it start to finish though, and found it unique and surprising. It felt a lot more 'well-thought-out' than many perfumes I have tried, with a story from beginning to end that I found captivating. It managed to start feminine and bright, flirty but not seductive, then move to refined and confident, and finally evolve into something mature and relaxing.
This is not my cup of tea, but if you enjoy tangerine and rose notes it might be yours! This is a pretty unique combination!

rose and tangerine, summer, skin test

the opening is similar to when you open a pair of new shoes in their box, not leather, but that (not terrible) 'shoe' scent+box.
let it be for an hour, and oh my, you have a make upy, dense, rosey, clean, delight.

perhaps its the cedar and berry, tangerine in the opening which on my skin is weird, sniffing the nozzle is very nice, a tangeriney- bright non dry citrus, clean, powdery, dry rose. skin its not. i think its me, i had the same issue with another chloe.

the rose part itsself reminds me of the absolute.
its dense, dry, make up powdery, rose. about an hour previous i kinda got vibes like i do from a YSL paris flanker i have which is all stems and rose branch - you gotta have a really good nose to feel the rose (or, again, could just be my charming skin).
opening weird, will try again on skin, rosey make up, clean - but not sharp at all
great sillage, i get a bit more citrus off that.

This smells identical to fleur de parfum (just another flanker) to me with the same sharp, sparkling top notes and slightly green middle. If I have to distinguish the two, I would say the dry-down of this is a frosted fruit candy, while the other smells more starchy and creamy.

I love exploring the flankers of the original chloe edp which I love but unfortunately seems to be worn by literally everyone around me. So far I prefer, in this order, l'eau de chloe (the green one, earthy and interesting), roses de chloe (beautiful vibrant rose), chloe edt (clean soapy rose) and chloe l'eau (the light pink one, watery lychee rose) all more than rose tangerine.

The longevity is on par with the original, longer than l'eau.

The first Chloe that I've had a seriously negative reaction to and I place the blame squarely on that horrible (to me) black currant. Smells like generic rosewater, sour tangerines, and cat pee mixed together. This is a total fail for me...

The first notes released by spraying it from the bottle are exactly those of Chloé, this has already been highlighted and I agree.
Then something happens, the fragrance warms, dries, almost of dry foliage and light dust.
Rose disappears completely. That is, it is ideally represented by the stems and leaves.
Tangerine takes place of the rose. But don't think about the taste of juicy mandarin but rather imagine the moment in which it's peeled, that slightly bitter scent dissolved while fills the air.
As its suspended mid air for hours, like it never completely blends with the skin, this allows it freshness like just sprinkled.
I love Chloé immensely, I thought it could never be outclassed, and I thought that until I met Rose Tangerine, and its being simply superb.

I really like this flanker. The opening was very green and grassy but this isn’t supposed to be a green fragrance at all, oddly enough. When it dries down, it’s just a soft, pleasant, classy, citrusy but not sharp, and not too sweet fragrance. It’s not mind blowing or anything but if you like fresh roses then it’s a great one. I prefer it to the original Chloé EDP. I think I also prefer it to Stella which is also a similar sort of fragrance but more sour and citrusy. I can definitely see myself using this year round. I can’t seeing it offending anyone so it’s the kind of fragrance that can be worn to work. Great for the daytime and warm weather especially. Planning to purchase a full bottle of this at some point.

لطيف، خفيف الظل، رقيق كنسمة ربيعية مشبعة برائحة الورود.. العطر جميل بشكل غريب، يكمن جماله في بساطته، إسمه عنوان محتواه فهو عبارة عن مزيج من الورد واليوسفي، لذلك الورد هنا مشرق، مضيء منعش و العطر سهل الارتداء في كل الفصول و مناسب أكثر للنهار.

This opens a little sour on my skin. Must be the tangerine.
After 15 minutes i start smelling the rose. The chedar comes later. A little later the amber comes.
I do not smell any black currant.


I like this! But i don't know if i love it like i love roses de chloe.
This is a bit more fruity.
It reminds me a little of Chanel eau Tendre edt but this is a little more fresh.

This is really nice for spring and summer cause of the citrus so I might try it again next year around april :)
Such a beautiful fragrance, the only let down is that it doesn't last very long (2 hours max). Unfortunately wouldn't buy it because of this reason.

This is definitely more rose than tangerine, a nice classy rose,and I expected more of a fruity or juicy undertone, I don’t get tangerine nor blackcurrant..this is in the vein of the classic Chloe fragrances, I like it, but I probably won’t wear it much as the rose dominates..if you enjoy the classy vibe of the Chloe, with a little tangerine twist, you might like it, if you like rose scents...it has a more grown up vibe too..I was expecting different , this isn’t bad at all, just too much rose for me.

The softest and most gorgeous juicy tangerine and some ripe black currant berries just sparkle
somewhere
among
sweet, oil-like, nasty rose and rather sharp cedar.
I have expected so much more from Chloé, sigh... And I want that honey-like, juicy, sweet tangerine so badly. Some other fragrance, I guess...
Must be the first of their roses I dislike (and first Chloé's fragrance whatsoever). Even the paper seems not to be dry enough to carry this scent beautifully, it just ruins that rose making it greasy, dominant and the whole composition imbalanced leaving everything else very sad and flat shampoo foam like; it was even worse on my quite sour/semi-oily skin. It developed nicely on my stiffened cotton shirt cuffs though. Be warned (and try it on the skin).

Love this. Fresh, feminine, romantic floral, lovely dry down perfect for hot weather and into Autumn. Quality juice, lovely bottle, good offering from house of Chloe. My first ever purchase. I'm normally a Guerlain and Chanel lady. Highly recommended.

I LOVE this scent, it is so gorgeous and sophisticated. Very soft and feminine. I have been wearing it for work until my bottle ran out today; which brings me to my next point: Sadly, the longevity is very poor, I had to keep spraying and dousing myself all day long to feel like I was actually wearing any perfume and thus used up a 50 ml bottle in less than 2 weeks. I love the opening and the dry down, but on me it lasts maybe 30 mins tops. When I spend that amount of money on perfume, I need and want good performance. I love Chloè so much, I use the Signature EDP and the L'eau as well, and they perform much better. The other flankers such as Fleur and Roses de Chloè don't last on me either, so I really wish they would create some intense versions of their Chloè signatures soon, as the scents in all of them are so gorgeous, feminine and sophisticated. Chloé, please let your next flanker be an EDP intense version!!
Tried this parfum today and it's nice I enjoyed it the tangerine note is nice and friendly with the rose and very girlie and cute..

It is very similar to the original Chloé and to its flankers. However, most of those turn quite green on me, especially L'eau and the original one.
This one remains soapy and floral all-throught, there is no hint of a green note.

I really can't make out any tangerine, and especially no black currant. It is not sweet at all, there is just an absence of greenness, if that makes sense.

I love all things Chloe, specially their jewelry and fragrances. Now this one is not my favorite. Ended up being too citrusy for me, kind of like when you have so much grapefruit zest in a fragrance that is turns bitter/ smells a bit like BO. The rose note is fresh and delicate like the previous renditions, and lots of people will love it. It just didn't work for me. The citrus part reminds me of Guerlain Aqua Allegoria Pamplelune. The ad is gorgeous, and the model is heartbreakingly beautiful.

My favorite perfume of all time is Chloe and Chloe rose so I bought this as soon as it came out without even trying it and I'm so glad that I did.

I'm really not going to go and to it because their review before me explained it perfectly But I can't get enough of this beautiful scent.

It smells just like Chloe rose but the dry down is citrus. It is beautiful.

So I marked this as low longevity Because I can't smell it after 15 minutes. I am constantly re spraying but it is so good that it's worth it. Another thing I'd like to mention is that I could be nose blind to Chloe because I wear it so often so take that with a grain of salt.

I recently purchased DE Marly delina And I thought I would never find anything that I liked more then the way that smelled on my skin. That is in toll this period in a way they somehow remind me of each other a little bit. I don't know what they share notes and I am a novice but they are a little similar to my nose.

Rose Tangerine has the classic fresh roses from Chloe. The DNA is there.
The scent opens with bright fresh lush pink roses and pulpy tangerine
bits. It’s not a zesty tangerine opening, nor as sparkling with bubbling feel so worry not
about being too “ginger ale”. The pulpy bits are short lived. Now the roses aren’t as bright and fresh, but more settled with faint of orange peel.. The cedars and amber are more of a supporting role here to prevent the tangerine from becoming too tangy or sour.
Interesting combo for sure and does not scream of cloying sweet rose.
It’s crisp but not zesty, tenderly sweet but not cloying. Woodsy green finish give it a more grown up feel that is not overly heavy(not a typical patchouli amber bomb). I’m in love with the dry down. Glad it did not turned soapy or powdery!
Projection is mild, but I’m a light sprayer!
Longevity: a good few hours!
Selling a 75 ml bottle on Mercari
Thick syrupy sweet fruit - apple and pear and maybe apricot. Prominent ylang ylang.

Just the best. Never should've been discontinued. BRING IT BACK 🙏🙏🙏 beautiful apple blossom scent. It's a dainty, clean fruity floral. If you want something light and safe but also pleasant and comforting, this is it. If you can find it, snatch it up! Great for spring and summer 😁

See By Chloé – Chloé

Oh, how I miss this one. See By Chloé wasn’t just a perfume, it was a mood bubbly, flirty, effortlessly pretty. Every time I wore it, I felt like the main character in a soft-focus Parisian daydream. Compliments? Constant. It wrapped around me like a halo, and people always asked what I was wearing. The apple blossom here was magic. And then, just like that… it got discontinued …. WHY do they always take the best ones away? It still lives rent-free in my heart, and no dupe has ever come close. Truly one of my most missed scents.

– Bhavna Darira Chesan
This ain’t it!! Someone gave me a bottle with 1/4 left in it. Smell like cheap shampoo! I heard it was discontinued and now I know why. My favorite apple perfume is Nina by Nina Ricci.

For years, it was my signature scent, and I still remember falling in love with it when they handed out samples with a newspaper. It was my first real perfume, and I’ll never stop appreciating it.
The fact that it’s been discontinued is honestly very sad. I’ve discovered other perfumes I liked since then, even loved a few—but none of them ever reached the same level or created that special bond you have with your siganture scent.
I can only hope that one day I’ll find something similar…

I'm so incredibly sad that they discontinued this fragrance, it was my signature scent for years and I have yet to find anything like it since.

The initial scent is light, fresh, floral and sweet, uber feminine. But the dry-down is this absolutely incredible bedroom skin-like musk that lingers all day but people can only smell it when close to you. People would literally lean in just to smell me, and it was popular with the guys haha!

Chloe has since come out with a kind of "See 2.0" with Chloe Intense in the red packaging as that one has a similar apple top note and musk dry down but it's not at all the same :(

If anyone has smelled anything similar to See by Chloe pls let me know!!
ı miss this perfume.
Jenny Glow Vision is a dupe of this. The scent is quite like Gucci Rush, also by the same perfumer.

In my pursuit of acquiring a powdery floral perfume, I impulsively blind-bought this. This has been in my collection for years; the bottle is pretty!
The initial impression is of crisp, juicy apples intertwined with ylang-ylang, imparting a green and earthy quality until it gradually transitions into a powdery floral essence. I like layering this with Zara's Lightly Bloom.

It is perfectly suited for spring and summer, and its longevity is good, lingering on the skin for 6-7 hours. The fragrance's sillage is restricted to a personal bubble; only those in close proximity can catch a subtle whiff. I love the interplay of sandalwood, vanilla, and musk in the base notes. I've added this to my list of perfumes I need to finish this year.

This perfume brings back so many memories! I bought this for myself on a cruise ship after winning at the casino and it easily became my signature day/work scent for a number of years throughout my 20s.

I haven't quite found anything similar to this as time has passed and I'm forever devastated it's been discontinued. It's easily one of my favourite floral fruity scents of all time.

Ah! Beautiful fragrance, that takes me back.

See by Chloé was the signature scent of my early 20's! I remember sniffing a magazine ad for it and immediately set out on a journey to find her.

She was the first perfume I used that made me feel like an adult: put together and confident, yet still young and carefree. I wore See all year round, but back then I lived in a much cooler climate, so I'm not sure how she'd fare in the hot weather.

I would say it's a warm, dark, and lightly sweet apple scent. Like drinking warm apple juice by a fire, but you're in a cool dark cave and it's raining outside, so it's still fresh somehow. One of my all time favorite fragrances, I was so sad that they discontinued it. But luckily I still have a bottle to sniff when I'm feeling nostalgic.

This has to be the best apple (let alone apple blossom) fragrance I've tested so far. Quite nice, but very floral.
Also, the best from Chloe collection.

Signatures sent! signature scent! signature sent! I say no more. This has the most youthful apple blossom that incorporates such a bright jasmine and Lang Lang, that the Bergamot pairs like sun accords outside in cool weather and indoors last on my skin 8 hours and on my clothes till washed. I wish that they had a similar perfume on the market. I will definitely be looking for a second bottle as I am almost out.

APPLE-BLOSSOM NECTAR. I used to have a view of an ornamental crab-apple tree from my patio. Every year around Mother's day it would be covered in pink blossoms for a few days. Then one year it was struck by lighting which split it in two, and it had to be cut down. There's something about this scent that hooked me when it first came out in 2012. It was how I wanted to smell at the time, because it seemed to represent a version of myself where losses were recovered. Even now, testing the treasured last 5ml of the second bottle I went through (although I may have a roller-ball or two), I can imagine the pink blossoms filling the patio view.

Opens with a burst of apple-blossom - which is the star of the show here - supported by multi-faceted bergamot to help elaborate fruity aspects to the floral-apple and lend a faint citrus tone to the background. That deepens into the floral heart of jasmine & ylang with powdery, musky, sweet, white & yellow floral tones, all resting on a musky sandalwood-vanilla base. Overall I get a well blended floral-apple that starts fresh & faintly citrus but dries down powdery and sweeter to a floral nectar with vanilla & sweet-sandalwood tones. The floral nectar here is almost honey but doesn't have the animalic or near-beeswax notes normally associated with honey. Average or slightly above average performance.

Sadly this has been discontinued, but people change and grow, and losses become a part of who we are, rather than something to be denied. Now as I sniff my wrist I'm finding this evolves to a nearly uncomfortable sweetness. I look out my patio window through my unobstructed view and ask myself, 'Did I spray it once or twice?'... Still, if you happen to find a roller-ball of this for a reasonable price, enjoy!

wow, this smells just like green apples! it's a fresh and playful scent without too much sweetness, as the apple blossom note feels quite tart and overpowers anything else going on in there. i really like the bottle design, i think the typography gives a bit of grit to the otherwise feminine aesthetic for chloé.

I never bought it back in 2012, then forgot about it. Then it got discontinued. I have finally got it - now, in 2023. I had been dreaming of this scent, trying to find similar notes in other fragrances.
It smells the same as it did in 2012, It smells of skin in the sunshine, cream-covered skin, sunshine, and air. Evokes that feeling of coziness when you're lying on the grass or sitting in the sun, feeling soft, relaxed and happy.
It makes me think of an old Nivea cream in a flat round box.
Love it.

Okay so my signature sent is chloe. I love the Soapy Rose. I've been going through my perfume collection and trying to sell a lot of it that I don't reach for anymore. I just don't have the space and I own far too many bottles. I've been picking about 4 a week to sell.
I bought a 2.5 oz bottle of this perfume when it first came out so it's pretty old. I had about 75% of it remaining. All that I was really thinking about is that I haven't reached for it in many years. I looked up that going price and it was a couple hundred dollars for one in my condition. I listed it as vintage for 115 and it sold right away.
As soon as I printed the label and went to package the product I got a whiff of the perfume and sprayed it one time on my wrist. By this time it's too late but I don't remember it being this beautiful. It was the best thing I've smelled in years and I've just sold it. I went ahead and packaged it and mailed it and ever since then have thought about it constantly.
If anybody has a bottle that they're willing to sell me a travel size decant, i would be very grateful. I would like to try to buy the equivalent of the size of a Rollerball if I can ever find if I can ever find it. That's kind of ridiculous that I just sold it and then realized how great.
There is just nothing like it that I've ever smelled. I came on here today to look to see what people are saying smells similar. The only thing that I see here is that one by oriflame and I checked online and there's only one online for sale and it's just as expensive as buying a vintage bottle of this.
You know what I don't understand about perfume companies in general is why they produce something this beautiful or a perfume that is a great seller and beloved by so many and then they choose to discontinue it? The worst part is they discontinue it forever. I can see taking it off the market for a few years, but bring it back. Instead, Chloe keeps on selling the ones that are not unique and beautiful that people aren't buying like Chloe absolu. Why would they keep on producing something like that but discontinue this beauty? Even cosmetic companies have been known to re-release certain bestsellers, even up to 10 years after the first release. That happened with Mac Whisper of guilt. The highlighter was selling for like $300 because it was so great and hard to find and then they just re-released it. Very smart. I was Chloe would do the same.
I love how the apples you can smell practically all the way through. Most perfumes that smell like Apple, only do so in the very beginning and that smell is fleeting. Not with this one.

Years have passed since it got discontinued but I can't get over it :( ... This was my perfect powdery scent, the sillage of the jazmin and apple blossom was just amazing❤ I have tried to find the most similar scent but with no success... I would be so grateful if somebody could tell the best similar finding to See by Clohe 😢

This fragrance is YUMMY. It gives that nostalgic feel of walking through an apple orchard when you were a kid. I would actually prefer this scent in a form of a body spray that you can reapply during the day, as I find it quite one-dimensional and not getting much on my skin once the apple scent dies down. Because of this it's not an everyday scent for me, but nevertheless the initial notes are lovely. Definitely an early spring daytime fragrance

Meh. There were two distinct phases for me when wearing this one. First phase, which lasted about 3-4 hours, was a full blast of fruity apples upon apples, which was surprising to me because I could hardly detect the jasmine (and I'm a jasmine lover). Then it dries down to this musky vanilla (while retaining this light apple fruitiness), which lingers as a skin scent. The dry down is quite pleasant, but I'm not a fruity scent lover, so this is a definite pass for me. I can see the appeal of this fragrance for others though. Overall, this scent lasted around 5-6 hours on me until it became ever so faint.
I absolutely adore this perfume! Such a clean soft and happy scent. Have no idea why it’s no longer to be found on the shelves:(

Smells amazing, so clean and crisp. Couldn't stop smelling my wrist the first time I tried it. Unfortunately it barely lasted 2 hrs on me and I could barely smell it anymore so I returned it :( such a shame as I wanted this to be my signature scent soo bad
This was my favorite of all time. Now it's gone. I don't like the thought of a signature scent being taken away but.... could happen with any fragrance. This was sweet, sour, fresh, sharp. Elegant.
So pretty and girly. I found a dupe at T.J. Maxx by the brand of Aubusson’s Parfum Library named Pink Musk. I love it!

this fragrance is very pleasant and nostalgic for me. I am surprised to see that it came about in 2012, as I would have suspected it of being from 200 or so. The apple blossom top note is very mid-90's Herbal Essences shampoo and White Rain hair mousse to me. The bergamot is cheerful and keeps things bright, I would consider this a spring or summer fragrance.

I get a little bit of the musk and ylang ylang after a while, but it's soft. Sillage is limited to your own little personal bubble, this is a good choice for the office or for doctor's appointments when you aren't looking to offend anyone. Based on the brightness and retro vibes the fragrance gives off, it sort of reminds me of Cacheral Promesse, even though there are no berry notes in this one. To me this smells like something that a younger person in 2006 would have worn.

Oh, and the bottle is lovely. Very heavy, cut glass and a securely fastened cap.

It is one-of-a-kind, comfortable, friendly, and attempts to maintain everything in balance. It's wonderful, appley, and enjoyable, and it makes me feel clean and natural. 'See' is obviously fruity, although it appears flowery due to how fresh it is. It's stunning. This smell is a harmonious blend of roses, musk, and vanilla for me. It's quite bright! It smells like summer, a little sweet and a little fresh. exactly right! It simply smells amazing. The lasting power and silage are fantastic on me.

WHY DID THEY DISCONTINUE THIS SCENT!!! It was my first expensive perfume purchase and I was totally in love with it. Incredible staying power and a warm comforting scent. It's like something I can't even describe - fall inspired, woodsy, fresh apple, cinnamon and clove. Such an amazing fragrance. I've tried for years to find another bottle but with no luck.

Where to start: The spice! Never did I smell a fragrance that beautifully, captured spice in a bottle. It was like a crab apple (little green apples found in the southeastern USA) cobbler trapped in a bottle! Also, for me, I could sense a tinge of leather...maybe that was the magic of the sandalwood base. Forget about the compliments. But the way I felt once I sprayed this on...I felt chic, confident, and feminine. It was good times spent wearing this fragrance.
I completely agree with the review below me, this is my ultimate fall fragrance. Smells like apple picking and making pies afterwards. To me it’s warm and sweet.

I see many comments about this being a spring scent, and while I see it being used in spring and summer, to me it's the ultimate fall fragrance. The unmistakeable apple, spice, and vanilla notes give me such cozy cool-weather vibes and it evokes pies, the color red (like the box and font), and falling leaves. As today is the first day of fall, I've been thinking about See by Chloe. I'm glad I still have my bottle!

It was this perfume that created my years long love affair with Jasmine. It was also the first perfume to get my out of my youthful sickly sweet era (think Britney Spears, Escada). So I will always have love for this perfume as my first ever classic grown up scent, and it remains in regular rotation to this day. Sweet and non-offensive, it smells very fresh, yet still warm. I feel it transitions well from day to night, and I frequently get comments on the scent.
Tropical and aquatic. Pretty good longevity. Not really sure if I like it.

This is such a unique scent. I first smelled it on a lady in Russia. I am disappointed it seems to be discontinued and very difficult to find these days. I can't pin exactly what it smells like but it is unlike any other perfume I've smelled. It is very natural, almost as if it is someone's natural scent. It is so fresh and sweet. It's a great every day perfume. I got it for Christmas and I love it.

A light fresh fragrance. The apple blossom and citrus are quite nice in the opening. In fact I get apple not just the floral part. It's true to the Chloe brand with that powdery, floral, romantic and old-fashioned feel. It's very nice. Great fragrance for spring and summer. Good for work or other places you want a subtle scent. It wears close to the skin but sticks around for a decent amount of time.

I'm glad I bought a small sample instead of a full sized bottle. This smells like a sachet of cheap potpourri at first whiff. I'm willing to give it another chance in the coming days but my expectations are rather low. I now suspect I got an old sample. I keep sampling it but it still just stinks of a cheap potpourri, not a good blind buy.
This is the best perfume I had.... It is so bright! It smells like summer - a bit sweet, a bit fresh - just perfect! Unfortunately, it is discontinued...I wish Chloe could bring it back!
This could be my signature scent (and i never have a signature scent), but it's not in the market anymore. CHLOE SHOULD BRİNG THİS BACK!

See is a very feminine, airy, freshly squeezed apples perfume :) It's inoffensive and suitable for a day out in the park or for a walk, perfect for spring/summer.

It's the type of "wallflower" perfume, if I can call it so. :)

Instagram: @My_Insta_Fragrances

Love the bottle - reminds me of a small bird cage. I blind-bought this after really liking See Si Belle, although the two aren't similar in any shape and form..

This is one of the fragrances I tend to get loads of compliments on when I wear it. Pleasant smelling, and light enough for warm weather. The Apple Blossom / Bergamot / Sandalwood combination does remind me of beer, or a brand of furniture polish I smelled when I was little.

Not overly ecstatic about it, no show-stopper, but nice enough to use from time to time

This is the love of my early 20s. Fresh cotton scent with a hint of fruits but still not that sweet enough to be overpowering. The only vanilla I could wear. It broke my heart when they have discontiuned it - but as with every freagrance I had more than two bottles of - I had a good run. I am currently at my last 30ml bottle, I was lucky enough to buy last year. There are just few spritzes left. It is time for me to find a new signature. Thank you, Chloé!
Vibes: fresh, cotton, clean, allarounder, not so sweet vanilla, office appropriate

This was my absolute favourite and now I can’t seem to find it anywhere in Australia except online and what they are charging is double of what I originally used to get it for. it’s one of the best Chloe’s in my opinion but I’m not sure if it has been discontinued as they do with a lot of their fragrances. The thing with all Chloé fragrances is u can tell it’s Chloé and this ones not any different in that sense just less powdery and more fruity but stil very elegant. The vanilla is subtle yet it’s not sickly sweet. absolulty love it
This is divine! It's my happy perfume. It's like drinking the sweetest apple juice while on a picnic at a flowery garden. Love it!

I put this on since I hadn’t tried it in a while. On my skin the first strong smell is pepper. It settles down to a fresh, somewhat powdery floral with some musk. It’s a clean smelling day time scent. Not my favorite but pleasant. I suspect it would smell better on other folks.

THIS is so great. My signature is Chloe New or Chloe Chloe and this one is a close second. I own everything she has ever made and the only one I did not like at all is Nomade. This is so pretty and I love the fruit in the beginning. The apple smell stays with me all day in fact. I love that. have not tried a perfume yet that successfully made the fruit opening stay through drydown. Just stunning.

My love affair with Chloe perfumes continues... such a quality house. Effortlessly feminine and long-lasting, well blended, lovely fragrances all of them; See being no exception.

See is a musky-sweet white floral with a juicy bite of apple. It's soft-seeming like velvety flower petals but still strong, assertive in its femininity. Incredibly long-lasting, at first sniff I thought "Oh no, this is the type of scent that fades away quickly".. a polite barely-there floral like Allure or Baiser Vole.. but no, See makes a statement. Like its name, it proclaims "See!"

The bottle shape reminds me of an old fashioned birdcage and feels heavy and high quality. It looks great next to my other Chloe perfumes...I love the ribbed glass theme all the newer Chloes have.

The best way to sum up See is that it is spring in a bottle. The apple blossom note dominates but not in a bad way. It is what makes See fresh and uplifting. At this time of year when the flowers start to bloom, the leaves start to grow on the trees, the days are longer and warmer, that's when I reach for See. It really puts me in an optimistic mood. Also, the sillage and longevity are strong.
It smells like flowers and apple cider. Not what I expected but it's not bad.

I don't usually do negative reviews because scent is personal and subjective. But truly, I do not like this at all. The scent itself is pleasant enough, if a bit to powdery and stuffy. But something about it offends my nose, immediately my throat is itchy and I can't bear to be near it. Yuck.

Just repurchased! I was at TJ Maxx and decided to browse through the fragrance section and I'm so glad I did. Found the 2.5oz for a good price. This is the perfect time of year (in my opinion) for this fragrance. Today it's cold and raining. I spritzed this on and it is just gorgeous. Something about the cold weather just makes this fragrance work for me. This fragrance has been hard to come by (for me.) It's been sold out online and Sephora no longer carries it. Found a pile of this fragrance at TJ Maxx. I may be in the minority of people that actually like the See flankers. They don't seem to be well liked. Just repurchased See Eau Fraiche a few days ago as well ;) you can read my first review of this scent since this technically isn't a review.

NEVER in my life did I see so many conflicting reviews!!!!!

----------------------------------------------------

1) My first ever experience with a Chloe product aside from Chloe Neroli - which was early on in the game and I dismissed it (as too girly) because that was BEFORE I openly admitted...... I'm a "gender bender" with fragrances. (in reality- I am a husky bald 53 year old MAN). Deal with it.
2) I had my eyes OPEN for a good Chloe because in the summer ; Chloe Narcisissy (sp?) was in abundance and I wanted to TRY IT! Months go by and the Chloe Train don't stop here no more at T.J. Asswipe Junction. Boo hoo.

3) Today I see Chloe See and read (on HERE) all the (mostly inane and dented) reviews calling this "Generic Yet Incredible" , "Cozy but No Identity" and "Come Pee Pee on my Moo Moo". . Or some such garbage. I have no idea what these people are talking about. As Archie Bunker once said "They're the kind of people that keep fruit in the house even when nobody's sick".

---------------------------------------------------
WHAT THIS IS:
A light fruity FRAPPLE (fruit & apple to you, waffle hips) with a musk dry-down . This is ONLY a few notches UP from any dopey "celebrity" spritz it shares VALUABLE rack space with next to the
Bed Head oozing all over the place.

The MUSK is above average. The Apple scent is above average. The projection is BELOW average - like worse than a can of scented hairspray.

I sprayed my scarf (wool) in the car and it did hold the musk dry-down for hours-- but on skin; Missing In Action, Chuck Norris.
WORTH $24.99 ? NO. No blind buy either.
Oh well. I'm on my way to find another Chloe (a line that was supposed to be heavy-ish and old lassie ish?).

I really dig this, and on my skin, at least, the apple is quite strong, throughout its progression. Lasts really long on me, about 6 hours and I can still smell fresh, pretty apple-y goodness. The drydown is creamy and pretty, I get some sandalwood and musk. I actually like this perfume a lot more than I thought I would, since I haven't been a fan of other Chloe perfumes I've tried. I could see this being a big crowd-pleaser.

I fell in love with this with the first sniff of the bottle. When I wear it I get a very strong white floral scent that never fades or changes. I have worn it in the summer and it was a big mistake as it was too strong and old lady floral on my skin. I have been afraid to wear it in the daytime since then. Now it is winter and I sprayed just one pump on each wrist and it is still very strong floral 2 hours later. I love it but it reminds me of many strongly scented perfumes from the 80's. It is going to take me forever to use up the bottle.

I love the See by Chloe range and have both the EDP & Eau Fraiche version. My first love was the Si Belle version but it wasn't available when I purchased the other two. I love the freshness and fruitiness of the perfume, especially after a refreshing shower on a hot day. The Eau Fraiche is more citrusy and maintains that note throughout, whilst the EDP has a fruitier, slightly sweet dry down. My skin doesn't really project any floral note in this and I find it hard to detect any. Its just fresh and fruity for me. They both open with a big bang but they don't have huge longevity and I'm always respraying after couple hours to get the initial fresh burst. Great for day time during those hot summer months. Clean and fresh is how I can best describe it.

I love this perfume a little more each time I wear it. Starts a lot like sparkling apple cider and honey with a little woody bite of something brambly-not sure what? Crisp, sweet and snappy, and then the woody musk base gets heavier and sweeter apple pie-ish smelling. But the theme of apple stays the whole time. Something creamed emerges in the dry down- sandalwood/vanilla? Very charming! Just sweet enough but not syrupy or cloying.
Happy, crisp, bubbly, honey and apples. Fairly long-lasting and friendly perfume. Love!

Every time I wear this fragrance I get compliments! I hesitated to purchase this fragrance for a long time even though I liked it, because so many reviews I had read dismissed it as a scent for teenagers, so I thought there must be something about it that I was missing. After purchasing and wearing for a few weeks however, I think it's the other way around. It is fresh, fruity and sweet, but has a lovely powdery, pink petal overtone to it that adds maturity and complexity, keeping it far and away from smelling like it belongs in a high school class room in my opinion. It is a perfect daytime fragrance for spring and summer, an automatic mood lifter- I don't know how anyone couldn't be cheerful wearing this!- and when you can find 2.5 oz at TJ Maxx for $20, is a bit of a no brainer, even for a blind buy.

Finally my dreams of an affordable creamy/vanillic gardenia/tuberose/jasmine perfume have come true!!!:)
Beautiful, opulent white floral bomb, true jasmine grandiflora with juicy bergamot opening - one that doesn't spoil the white floral component!:D
A nice replacement for Annick Goutal Songes - although definitely not the same - just from the same story;)
Apple blossom? No, I can't sense it at all - white flowers totally block this precious and discreet aroma from surfacing, at least to my nose.
I know that gardenia and tuberose are not listed but I can smell them in the opening notes, mixed with vanilla. What remains is jasmine - my beloved kind that grows in my area!!! I don't smell any musk, but if there is any, it is so well-blended and clean that it only makes the whole combo nice and round - nothing else. Vanilla is very natural and delicate, it soon disappears. Gardenia reappears in the base notes, after a short departure in the heart notes. Ylang-ylang unfortunately emerges after half an hour and this is the headache-inducing bit of the perfume.
Still, it's a big discovery for me and a "must-have" for June!!! It will be just perfect for a dinner in the blooming garden or for a romantic walk in the nature!

Just received this in a swap and to me this is a 70's rock star complete with bell bottoms a leather jacket and disheveled but polished blonde hair. She is a lovely rock princess in the best way possible. I love one of the reviews here that said they love to wear this with a leather jacket. This is exactly what I picture this girl wearing with this. It is clean and crisp but has an edge to it. The perfect clean scent with a dirty, vintage, Rock vibe. Just my style but I will test more to get who this scent is and if it works for me.

Before this fragrance, I use to avoid all sweet fragrances since I always associated them with cheap & childish scents. This definitely changed my mind about them.

It's a sweet fragrance but toned down just enough for those who hate sweet fragrances as it allows the other notes to come through (tone down the sweetness + add a bit of maturity) I find. It's also perfect for those who love sweet fragrances as the sweetness is still present enough for them to enjoy. The dry down is just lovely. The vanilla here is done/used so well, way better than Armani's Si (eau de parfum) which I sadly no longer want to use after getting this.
All Chloe perfumes are very weak. You can barely smell it on your hand.
