On me, this perfume is extremely musky (which i don't really like).After it sets down the slight floral fragrance that i felt at the beginning disappears.Not for me at all.

This is a nice sweet, clean and a little musky smelling floral fragrance.
Very inoffensive and fresh.
Longevity and projection are good.

Whenever I wear this it lifts my mood and I get a can-do attitude. (most of the chloe fragrances have that effect on me so...... I might be biased because I really, really like them).

Summary: sweet fruity floral, pretty enough and not nauseatingly sweet, though I would rather it would be a little less sweet.

---

Interesting enough. Fruity and sweet (yup, it does remind you of yellow apples), and simultaneously a sort of abstract floral. I cannot recognize the specific flower notes, just the vague idea of flowers.

It's actually quite pretty and well-done in a simple way, just not exactly to my personal taste. I would wear it if offered, but for me it lacks something. Maybe some lemon-y note?


Note: I have a small sample vial.

Sweet apple balanced with sandalwood and musk. It's not overly sweet like some say, it's actually fresh and crisp. Youthful, energizing and flirty. Ideal for spring. I'm not a fan of Chloe, but this one is my favorite so far.

I'm trying to like this.
It's a soft fruit floral
There's some sour or slightly bitter note, it might be magnolia?? Or frangipani?
I like it in first sniff, then that note sneaks in and ruins it on my skin

I bought this blind today (I was gaming actually this should be called "visual buying!" Since you can see but not smell it.) it was a great price and I adore the si belle version, which to me is quite different. This is honey on me. The first minute there is a chemical smell but very soon it's just honey (actually I wouldn't notice the chemical smell but I read someone says bug spray so yes I can smell that but literally under one minute and it's gone). So honey (I had creamed honey and this reminds me of it, clover it orange? It's not spicy but it gives me the idea of cinnamon on honey not sure why). Also very faintly it smells if a freshly snapped tree branch, small and green. I wonder if my impression will change when I wear it again.
I have a FB of this if anyone is willing to do a swap with me :)
Agreed with Andreas. Also I found that Chloe See is smelled a bit old lady-ish in summer time but beautiful also uplifting in winter :)

Is it possible for a fragrance to be "bubbling" and "crispy"? This one proves it is.

It starts very spring-like and youthful, with notes of juicy apple, apple blossoms and lots of musk, which gives the fragrance intensity and that "something else" that wouldn't be there without its presence. Soon after, ylang ylang and vanilla notes render the fragrance sweeter and kind of "caramelized", making it a little bit warmer. Even so, as it has a discreet sillage, the fragrance doesn't disturb on days with higher temperatures.

This is one of the fragrances that make us feel clean and fresh, as if we just have had a shower. Soft, inoffensive, great for wearing on a daily basis and perfect for people who get annoyed by "showy" fragrances. And, for such a discreet perfume, the longevity is excellent, of almost 10 hours.

Immediately I had crush on Chloe, and later on on L'eau de Chloe as love forever, which made me explore other Chloe versions. See by Chloe is a bit different, might say not as such love, but still like to have it in possession. I found this floral-musky scent very nice and kind of recognisable, so it will be the part of the collection for some time. For me 7/10.
It is interesting that this one got lower rating that ones I really dislike, so I learned that those reviews are the great help for initial informations, but not a guide for a blind buy (at least for me :)

This seems to be a bit of a chameleon - as if it changes its color on everyone who wears it. For the life of me (it's been a long time, folks), I can't remember another fragrance I've ever worn that goes through such a complete transformation.

At first 'See' was not particularly appealing to me (powdery, rich white musk and fruity-melon), so I was pleasantly surprised when it became an entirely different creature as it dried down. On my skin, 'See' warms to freshly cut vanilla bean and maple syrup with a touch of new leather. This scent then morphs entirely; lingering as the citrusy wild bergamot that grows in my yard, dewy springtime grasses, a bit of warm sandalwood and some element that reminds me of freshly baked cardamom bread.

Soft enough to wear any time and appropriate for any age, 'See' is safe gift choice. Sillage is minimal - even when I brazenly spray it everywhere after a shower. Its longevity always catches me off guard. Just when the scent seems to have vanished, I'll catch a warm unexpected hint of something delicious that - aha! - I believe I've just identified:

Steaming basmati rice with saffron.
Peculiar, but that's it!

While searching for original 'Chloe', I blind bought a 2.5 oz/75 ml 'See' EDP tester on ebay for pennies on the dollar. In a few month's time, I've nearly emptied the lovely bottle. Not at all disappointed with the fragrance (especially considering the incredibly low price paid), I might purchase again at a good markdown, but probably not at full retail.

See by Chloe is a unique fruity floral. It's fresh and bright, but also very subtly spicy. It's primarily a sweet floral but the apple note is present through to the dry down, though the note itself changes a lot along the way. I noticed a lot of folks think of this as purely a spring and summer scent, but I actually think See shines most in the fall. There's note combination in this fragrance that really reminds me of spiced pears.
The only note I get: play dough.

Breath of fresh air, sunshine and light showers. Just in time for April.

Apples, jasmine, musk and vanilla. Starts of crisp and bright with apples and musk. Jasmine is quite strong yet pristine and clean. Vanilla rounds everything out ever so gently. Chloe See is not at all complicated yet sometimes it is all I need. It's fresh, floral, airy, and a sheer veil of sweetness. I would like to wear this perfume while my hair is still wet and go outside in the sun. Which does remind me, this smells like shampoo, but in the best way possible.

When Victoria Secret Pink came out with a fragrance and body line, my favorite scent was Fresh & Clean. Getting older and wanting something a little more sophisticated and longer lasting with the same feel, Chloe See is fits the slot perfectly. Wearing Chloe See gives me a youthful feeling like I had when I wore VS Fresh&Clean in college without being childish.

Also, something about this does remind me of a 90's perfume. for as simple as this is, It is understated yet lovely and one of my favorite perfumes.

I love this perfume. It isn't a complex, sexy scent. It is just a good, everyday perfume.

I smell a lot of apple and vanilla, but not in an apple pie candle way; it's much more bright.

It does no project well on me, but when people do smell it, they compliment it.

Although I do love it, it's not the type of perfume I would repurchase. The bottle is beautiful, and the scent is great, but it resembles too many other fragrances. There just isn't enough to set it apart from the other juicy, fruity, perfumes available right now.

i've waited a long time to review this one (at least, I don't think I have yet!)
I immediately fell in love with this when I smelled it on the magazine test strip. It was before I really got into perfumes, but even now, with all the ones I have, See by Chloe holds a special place in my heart.

The notes are right on, and like other reviewers have said, it's a clean and bright smell. It reminds me of spring and vacation. I don't get any soapiness out of it.

This fragrance is sparkling and innocent, and that is why i love it so much. it's quite ingenue. something i can see young parisian ladies wearing around the streets while out shopping in the spring! it's really lovely, sweet, and romantic, but not seductive, mysterious, or sexy.

i know it doesn't get a lot of love here, but i've received many compliments on it, and actually i find that the longevity and projection are quite good!

i really recommend it, for women under 30...
Very weak, longevity is nor good too. Smell is very light and reminds me of apples. Not worth its price.

I absolutely adore this perfume, so much so that it's my new favourite. I tested it by chance one day in a department store and couldn't stop sniffing my wrist afterwards. This comes out as a clean powdery scent on me with a touch of apple and florals. It's a lovely day scent and I get many compliments for wearing it though it's hard to find. I was given Narcisse a few years ago and in all honesty I hated it but this scent is perfect, at least for me.

Blind bought again with this one (sale!) I really love the original Chloe so I thought I'd give this a go even though it wasn't part of the same line. To me it is inoffensive, fresh, feminine but quite boring... when I put it on its just "meh". Its the type of scent I'd put on if I was feeling indifferent. I think its better suited for summer. Pretty bottle, longevity is ok but sillage not so much.

This is the only perfume that smells terrible on the paper, but it does smell amazing on my skin.
When I was in the airport, I unpurposely sprayed it on my skin. after few minutes/hours, I kept smelling my wrist and wordered what perfume did I put on (because I forgot). So I came back to the store and realized that it was this See by Chole. Ever since, everytime I go to the department store, I will always spray this on my skin till I can afford to by it.
plus, it last for hours

this is an inoffensive floral perfume better suited for spring or summer.i've really enjoyed using the 1ml sample that i had and maybe will buy a bottle next summer.the longevity and sillage are moderate.

To be honest, I am not sure what to think about it. I have it, I wear it, but for sure it is not in my top 10. After i finish this bottle, I do not think I will buy it again, unless I find it for a bargain price (which is not likely to happen for some time). There is nothing exactly that I do not like, but I am just not excited when I put it on.
Unfortunately, I don't care for this fragrance! I don't get the clean crisp happy scent that everyone speaks of. On me, it is a musky boozy sour cherry hot of a mess disaster.

I really like this one. It is bright, clean, and lightly floral/fruity. Definitely day-appropriate, and I find that I like the slightly soapy scents because they're inoffensive. Though it's clean, it's not "fresh" but more warm clean. It reminds me a tad of one of the Clean fragrances-- warm cotton, I think. I don't like when fragrances are too "perfumey" and this one is not. Very nice! :)

This somehow just barely makes it among my favorites, but, for some reason, this and Gucci Flora EDP gets the most compliments. I live in Fiji, BTW, and work in an environment with a very multicultural workforce, with people from age three to, well, senior citizen. This gets compliments from people of various backgrounds... There are days my husband just says he loves it so much. I have finished a 75ml, got a 50ml, then bought another 75 on sale. Is it the climate, or is it my body chemistry? Can't tell. In Fiji, I find it more wearable than Gucci Flora (the other "most complimented). This one's mild enough for even the warmest days.

Not a fan of simple sweet perfumes, but this one is very nice. Its crisp, clean and flowery but not what I would call complex or unusual. Not a far cry from Happy by Clinique but more sophisticated. The sandalwood in this is very light and barley there, but it does give it a nice balance and a more "expensive" smell. A young girl can wear this in the summer just as easily as a mature woman could wear this to work at the office. Its got a classic feminine element to it too. A crowd pleaser, so its a safe gift or blind buy. Only real criticism is the longevity is on the weak side and acts more like an EDT than an EDP. Still I give it a thumbs up.

I just sprayed this on my wrist in the shop. And ugh, I can't wait to get home to wash it off. Such a sickly sweet perfume that to me hust smells like soap. At least right now this is definitely not for me. Way too sweet and no personality at all.
It almost smells like apple. Longevity is good. A nice scent for young ladies, in my opinion. It was a gift for me. I like to wear it but I don't think I'll buy another bottle again for myself.
My Mom loves it for its 'soapy' smell. She prefers inoffensive simple scents. But I can't stand it on her - I feel there's too much musk in it and that gives me a rather unpleasant nauseous feeling.

I wore See by Chloe yesterday for the first time, and I was pleasantly surprised, a fresh clean bright an pretty fruity floral. Quite sweet, but it has a little bite to it, preventing it from becoming a sugary mess. It is not quite my taste, so I doubt I would buy this for myself, however I think it would perfect on my teenage daughter for spring /summer.
Anyway, if I smelled this on someone else, I would certainly lean in and say.

"Mmmmm, you smell good"
This perfume is my favourite summer day fragrance. I smell good :) Well, at least it's my opinion.

This perfume is one of my favorites. After using up half the bottle, it may be time for a review. I got this back in winter 2013 at the after Christmas sales on a holiday trip. My dad offered to buy this for me, which makes it even more special!

I must admit that I didn't start using this until winter 2014. I was kinda put off by See for a while. I smelled See on a college friend, but I didn't realize it was See. I smelled a synthetic Apple/musky weird scent that seemed to last and last AND last. I finally asked what fragrance she had began wearing and she told me See. I was shocked! Not MY See by Chloe? Can't be?

Finally, last winter I decided to pull See from its box and test it on my skin. I thought it was lovely! Definitly Apple and floral. But in a unique way. I don't think I've smelled another perfume like See. It's hard to confuse it with something else. Which I love about it! I wore it a few times and asked my husband and brothers (brutally honest critics) what they thought of it. They said it was nice. My hubby loves it! When I was still living with my mom, she would steal a spritz or two every now and then. It smells awesome on my mom as well. I believe chemistry is a major factor with this fragrance.

I tried See in summer since it seems like more of a summer scent but I think it smells a whole lot better in cooler weather. I realized I LOVE wearing this scent when I wear my leather jackets. The unique smell of See combined with the smell of leather smells sexy to me! (I don't spray my perfume on my leather jackets btw!) I can't wait for the cooler weather to come around so I can start wearing this again.
It's beautiful, unique, long lasting! It's rare that I ever repurchase a fragrance but once I'm out of this beauty, I'm buying another full sized bottle.

Don't blind buy See - test it on your skin first and see if it works with you.

Personally, this was one of the worst fragrances I've ever encountered. Honey + bug spray + waxy apple lollipop that you'd find at the Dollar Store = See by Chloe.
I feel I can wear this any time day or night , is very fresh ,clean , sexy and I love wearing this specially in spring and summer days.

Apple, apple, apple... like trees full of them. On the verge of sickeningly sweet, but never quite crosses that line. There's something refreshingly youthful about See, I get why it was geared towards a younger demographic, but a true lady of any age can pull this off. Very business casual or jeans and tee friendly.

I get a sweet smelling appelpie, jasmin kind of smell. I love it! it is perfect for a summerday when you feel happy and girly, or perhaps a autumn day, when the sun is shining. a lot of people dont find, that it smells like appel on me, but only flowers, but i get a lot of appels. Very strong scent, lasts many hours on me.
I have tried this numerous times, always hoping that I will smell something different - but all I get is waxy (in that synthetic lipstick kind of way) apple! Not a fan.
I have no idea why this fragrance smells like paper on me. It smells so nice on other people. I think it is the Jasmine.
I have both the Edp and the Edt and they smell different. The Edp is more the scent of apples similar to baked apples. The Edt is softer and muskier. I don't see the EDT listed here in fragrantica.

LOVE It :) :) :)
I tested and will have it soon!

The first spray is sweet and youthful, like honey and flowers. Then it starts to tone down to a softer, more sophisticated smell, still honey like, but not as bold. The final smells are a sweet light musk. I find it very feminine and confident.

This is an easy-to-wear but very ordinary scent. It is fruity and floral at the start, then the musk start to show through a while later. The result is a pleasant, well-blended scent which, however, smells like a lot of other perfumes. I can't say that I dislike it, but I would prefer something more distinctive than this. And I do agree that it doesn't seem to last very long.

It is a funky, easy to wear scent, more for daytime. A younger, more fun version of the original Chloe Chloe. My personal experience is that sniffing it from the bottle, I am overwhelmed by this outstanding scent but wearing it, really? Where does it go? It does not last very long and turns out to be quite ordinary.

I absolutely LOVE this fragrance! I was so surprised. I received a sample size when I purchased another perfume from Nordstrom and it has quickly become within my top 5 fragrance for work. Its initially fruity with a freshness that doesn't smell like cleaning solution or soap and just the right amount of sweet. I've received so many compliments on it & I'm so glad I purchased a big bottle.

This is my kind of scent. IN LOVE!

Nice bottle is the kindest thing I can say about this fragrance. On me it doesn't smell like much, therefore it will never be on my repurchase list. A blind buy which annoys me as I hate wasting money. Sorry, not for me :-(

I bought this in the January Sales, I hadn't smelt it in over a year but I swore that I had liked it when I had. I ended up buying the 75ml set for £28.....sadly It reminds me of a certain furniture polish that I always use :-( I'm gutted but I'll find it a good home with someone who loves it :-)

A very nice refreshing scent. It's fresh and rather clean, but not "straight up soap" like the regular Chloe or sanitized roses like Roses de Chloe. This is naturally fresh and bright, and would be great in the Spring or Summertime when it would feel like drinking a cold glass of lemonade. Very pretty and the bird-cage bottle is gorgeous (all of Chloe's bottles are pretty, but my favorites are this one and the new Love Story, which I have yet to smell.)
Crisp apple (blossom?) with the floral (non-indolic) jasmine that dries down to a soft musk and an edge of sandalwood that grounds it. Longevity is quite good for such a light scent.

I'm surprised to find out some Fragrantica users find this perfume too intense - it's such an "inoffensive" scent that you're bound to find it boring if you like powerhouse perfumes. Innocuous is probably the word that best describes it.
Once you spray it on your wrist, you enjoy a delicate, feminine-yet-urban, somewhat sophisticated scent. The notes change quickly as the perfume evolves and you're delighted by the combination. "Hmmm, that's pleasant", you're thinking. "This might be my next favourite perfume". After 15-20 minutes, when you sniff your wrist again in an attempt to find out what the next notes are, you find out it's all gone. SWOOSH. Like the 50€ bill you payed for it at the store. All that is left is sorrow, dissappointment and dispair, and a REALLY faint scent that you can vaguely intuit if you press your nose really hard against your skin while inhaling madly. Ok, I might have exaggerated a little, but just for the purpose of making a point.
The remaining scent, which is reminiscent of a pleasant 3€ body spray, or a nice shower gel, will last for about 2 hours. I tried it on my skin, on my hair, on my scarf...I even tried it on my mother! And I kept getting the same innocuous, boring result.

The majority of my fragrances are heavy, sweet, gourmand, fruity smells. While I love my collection, I've really been longing to own something lighter, something fresh, yet sophisticated. I've always admired Chloe's fragrances, but found the rose note unwearable on me. I found what I was searching for in See by Chloe.

Very easily your every day, put on without thinking about it perfume. Light, fresh, cozy, almost like a floral laundry detergent. I love the woody floral notes in this. It's crisp, and easy. I don't find it musky, or overly powdery at all, just a light, gentle floral. I'm not someone who changes scents based on season, but this is something I could see going all year round, this is very, very wearable, and I LOVE it!

A lovely everyday perfume. Extremely wearable, light and fresh with a crisp fruity, slightly floral scent. Lasts a fair amount of time, around the 5 hour mark for me.

This is different to the more mature scent of Chloe eau de parfum, but still has a hint of powdery floral to it. A very pretty fragrance.
My favourite summer fragrance, I love it sooo much. Ideal for daytime, for me it lasts 5-6 hours

Upon initial spray this perfume is reminiscent of a nice skin cream or sunscreen, which is pleasant enough, but not worth forking out a large amount of money for.

After it settles into the skin, however, this fragrance becomes a warm, cozy, Apple pie type of scent. Maybe I'm the only one who thinks this way, but the mixture of Apple blossom, vanilla and sandalwood combine in my opinion to form a delicious, dessert-smelling concoction.

The lasting power is fairly decent, around 8 hours on my skin, and this is the only perfume I own that has achieved numerous compliments from complete strangers.

Most reviews have classified this scent as a summer fragrance, but I prefer this cozy scent in the cooler months.

Very, very sweet (apple blossom) for me for about 1 1/2 hours, then it becomes lovely (jasmine, vanilla, sandalwood with just a touch of apple). It is quite musky! The sillage is moderate at first, then very close to my skin after a couple of hours. I like it okay, not love, but like. Also, it was completely off my skin within 6 hours.

Smells like an apple garden in spring time, when the new shoots, sprouts and buds on the trees smell green and carry the promise of ripe green apples. I used to be a naughty child and actually kept breaking new sprouts off the trees just because I loved how they smelled under the thin layer of bark when they were still green inside.

See By Chloe brought those memories right back to me. It's a green, fruity, woody floral, but also very musky. All the while it remains gentle and innocent, laced with the faint smell of green apples from the beginning to the end. For something so delicate and light, this gem is outstandingly long lasting and I caught whispers of it throughout the day.

LOVE at first sniff!
I´m very weak for wellrounded, comfortable and warm perfumes, and this one does it for me.
It lasts all day, has good sillage and makes you feel very feminine.

Not to sweet, not to heavy, just right!
GO BUY
Spring in a bottle! Very longlasting, suitable for young ladies and perfect for office.

This is a nice scent but so strong.
I have a perfume and lotion id love to swap. Inbox me :]
I didn't get any sharpness. For me it is similar than Eau Fresh. Nice, decent, fresh and simple fragrance. But it does not last. That's why it is not on my whishlist. I just tested it in the store.

I first stumbled upon 'see' as a lady standing in front of me in a queue smelt strongly of " clean hair" as I like " skin scents" ( cream, talc, hairspray etc) i enquired what the smell was " see, by chloe" she replied, the following week I purchased a bottle, to me, it smells very similar to "vosene" shampoo, I do get the vinegary apple smell, but its very shampooy!! Which I quite like, there's no great depth to this perfume, does last ok, it's by no means a "wow" perfume but that's ok!! I do like it alot would I repurchase?? Not sure, still got a large bottle to use up, but not sure I'd pay 50 odd quid for it again, as I say its " vosene" shampoo in a fancy bottle ( do love the bottle design tho!!) ;)
Edit- since writing this I have become alot more smitten with this perfume and will definatly re-purchase unless sadly it becomes discontinued, it really is a nice clean smell !!

It smells like apple. It's not the same strong synthetic apple as the Be Delicious line, it's a gentler apple, appropriate for daytime or work. This one is fresh, playful, and fruity, so if that's what you're into, this might be good for you. It might not be for you if you don't like the idea of smelling like shampoo, because the apple blossom really is the most dominant note by far, so that and the low sillage can sometimes come across as shampoo-y.

It lasts 3-4 hours, but it's only really noticeable to others for the first hour or two. It works just fine to freshen up partway through the day, but I wish it lasted a little longer.

This is quite sharp and very strongly apple at first. It kind of reminds me of apple cider sometimes, and I agree that it has a sort of shampoo vibe on my skin too. After the first 15minutes of apple/cider/shampoo stuff, it becomes really nice and smooth on my skin. It's very soft vanilla with apple and lasts a while. I'm finding it more enjoyable now the weather is getting warmer here :)

This perfume is like a crisp apple !!
It's a cheerful light scent, young, flirty ... smells like spring, summer and smiles but while has a tender side that makes you feel good, like home.
In my skin is much more floral than sweet / fruity and has very good durability.
The bottle is adorable.
It may become my new signature scent.


****

Este perfume es como una manzana crujiente!!
Es un olor ligero, alegre, joven, coqueto... Huele a primavera, a verano y a sonrisas pero a la vez tiene un lado tierno, que hace que te sientas bien, como en casa.
En mi piel es mucho más floral que dulce/frutal y tiene muy buena perdurabilidad.
El frasco es adorable.
Es posible que lo convierta en mi nuevo perfume firma.

Young, fresh, addictive, sweet, adorable. This is one of my top 5 fragrances. I had been searching for a nice fresh sweet fragrance, but couldn't find one, until I found this one. I loved it so much I had to buy the whole set. The opening is a fresh burst of appley goodness, and the dry down doesn't change that much, it remains fresh and pretty on my skin. I love this scent. The bottle is gorgeous and so is the packaging. Bright and happy, very much like the scent. A very good updated version of the traditional heavy florals of the old Chloe line. Only negative would be, that it is quite pricey.

This is a very sharp, uncomplicated smell on me. I'm getting the apple, but not the sweet, juicy apple I had been hoping for. This is one of those under-ripe apples that is a chore to eat, that you eat because you packed it in your lunch and it's supposed to be good for you. I also get a little bit of powder, which I am guessing was supposed to soften the sharp apple, but I happen to hate powdery smells. I am disappointed by this scent.

I literally wanted this fragrance because of the commercials. They looked so fun!! But I had never really smelled the fragrance before, UNTIL TODAY. I went to the mall today to hit a couple of perfume stores and when I was at macy's I recognized it from the commercials, and I smelled it and I was like "yeesssssss" it is amazing. I didn't buy it at Macy's but once I got to sephora I just HAD to get a roller ball 1.0 Oz version. AND IT. IS. AMAZING. Literally has become one of my favorite fragrances within the night. When I got home and smelled it, initially I liked it but wasn't blown away (also actually spraying perfume is so much nicer than roller balls, but it's not all bad now it can travel with me). But as the night has progressed I have fallen completely head over heels for this perfume. However, I disagree with the top notes and bottom notes listed on here. I personally smell more of a sweet and light wood on first whiff, then as it settles in I smell the apple blossom more. I love this perfume so much though. It reminds me of a nice classy British lady drinking tea and lookin really cute while doing it. I ADORE THIS FRAGRANCE AND I LOVE IT WITH ALL OF MY HEART. yum yum yum. Definitely buying a big bottle soon.

On my skin See by Chloe smells like apple with vanilla, sandalwood, jasmine and musk. In my personal opinion, it is fresh and warm at the same time...I wear it at summer nights and I am going to wear it in autumn as well. My favourite one by Chloe.

Chloe See - Mucho like ! It smells different. You know it when you smell it.

It's a soothing scent that makes one follow it around. It's a very lovely fragrance that fits even the younger population.

This fragrance cannot be considered powdery at all, not musky, not warm. There is a fresh, lovely and sweet feel to it that is very pleasing.

Very likable. Day or night, it's pretty much a good wear.

I liked this on first spray, red apple is what I smelled. But when it dried down there was this sickening sweet smell that I just couldn't stand. I'm not sure exactly what it was. I like green apple, maybe I can't handle apple blossom or ylang-ylang. Whatever it was I had to scrub this off within 10 minutes of spraying it. Not for me.

Oh gosh I love this! Fresh sweet crunchy red apples! Lots of them! Subtle florals, a soft clean musk and a welcoming hint of vanilla are there too...gets even better in the drydown, softer and sweeter abit more mature, but does not last that long (~5 hours on my skin). I think I love it because it smells like my beloved first perfume as a teen (Jean Arthes Amore Mio, the green bottle...now unavailable...Amore Mio was greener smelling though). It's just extremely pleasant and I could just drench myself in it...
BUT!
it doesn't smell like a Chloe...it smells...cheap....like a REALLY GOOD cheap (and non-synthetic smelling) EDT or body spray, the kind they used to release in the 90s, something you'd enjoy wearing daily, not something you'd imagine being released by Chloe and being sold at such a crazy high price. It smells like it shouldn't be sold for more than 20 to 25 bucks for the largest bottle. I feel like I can find something similar from VS or BBW, so that's where I'll look for these types of scents. I imagine that this scent is most suited to 10-16 year old girls with rich parents who can afford to keep them supplied with it. I say 10-16 year olds, because I find that this scent has a very innocent vibe to it, not young or old, just completely non-sexual, child-like and blissfully carefree.

I'll stick to Chloe's Love, my favorite Chloe by far.

I finally gave into myself and indulged.
WOW...on me it smells like apple blossom and honey,
Then it becomes more powdery and the Jasmine comes and goes.I also get occasional glimpses of the opening, like it never went away.In the end I get verbena (I know it isn't there) and crisp apple, but no vanilla.
I used a very small spray.It lasted for about 5 hrs,but I can still smell it on my wrist 8 hrs later

hi fragranticans!
sometimes my dear friend would come pay
me a visit and as a hairdresser ill be more than
hapy to give her a haicut! as my hands start doing
the job i couldnt help askin what perfume she is
wearing? it took me by suprised that she told me it
was see by chloe coz i swear i had a cheap spray
cologne which i bought at a local drugstore. and
i swear both share the same synthethic smell. but
dont let my words turn u off do try it under ur own
nose. for me this one doesnt match its reputation
under a big label such as chloe..good day!

This fragrance is fun and quirky, yet still plenty mature.
I don't find it overly floral or...overly anything, really. It's just nice.
I've had it a year and have probably only worn it three times total.
I should probably give it away before it goes bad.

See By Chloe is a beautiful, clean, and feminine fragrance. Whilst it retains a few qualities of a 'typical' fruity floral scent, there is something very unique about it... I can see how some people may find it a little underwhelming, but to me, See by Chloe is a simple, effortless beauty. It makes an impression without trying too hard. The overall scent has a very urban, chic and modern feel, but it is also quite vintage and romantic; very reminiscent of other, popular Chloe fragrances such as Love and Chloe Eau de Parfum.

The composition opens with bright apple blossom, which smells very fresh and light, like a warm summer breeze. It's a lovely, feminine opening, and there is something about it that makes it smell very 'perfumey'. This apple blossom note is done really well, and not necessarily how you'd expect. It's not sweet and juicy (like in many of the DKNY's Delicious fragrances); but it smells very floral, delicate and soft. It's dominant without being loud and screechy. After a while, an interesting musk note unfolds, which I guess is the tricky part of the composition. Accompanied by dry sandalwood and delicate vanilla, they create an unusual layer of quite contrasting accords. At this point, I can see how this fragrance may start bothering some people. I suppose it does smell a little bit as if you have just stepped into an old basement, but I'm not saying this as a bad point... This romantic, dusty, vintage feel is actually quite charming, and it feels very 'Chloe'. The freshness of the apple blossom (still present from the beginning)balances out the musky base, creating an unique, clean and very feminine composition. It's a harmony of old and new; – a concept so beautifully represented by the bird cage bottle design, which mirrors both modern and vintage qualities of See by Chloe.

I love this, but I still wouldn't recommend it as a blind buy. Whilst very versatile and comfortable to wear, this fragrance can be a little polarising because of the musky drydown. Just make sure you test it first, and hopefully you'll end up enjoying it as much as I do!
ʕ•ᴥ•ʔ
my colleague told me i smell like a beer hahahha

I love the soft, romantic vibe the Chloe line of perfumes, purses, and clothing have. See by Chloe is the slightly edgier, more urban scent...but it still holds on to the romantic vibe. It smells mainly like Apple fritter of Apple pie overall. Yummy :) It's not going to go down in history as being groundbreaking, but it's a young and fun scent that I highly doubt would offend anyone. Wear this to a date and/or picnic at an urban central park!

I checked some reviews here and it's actually good to see that everyone has a different taste. Personally I find this fragrance beautiful. I don't care about the commercial where the girl looks little weird with her openened mouth or some videos...No clue what they're about. First I got bitter bergamot which disappeared in few minutes. What came than is calming, sensual smell of tea. I don't know but I smelled tea on my skin. Little like earl grey with some vanilla and apple cider. That slightly bitter smell of tea with sweet undernotes of sweet red apple and creamy light vanilla. It changed again after about half an hour when it happened to smell all like apple pie with cinammon, hints of vanilla and musk. Don't ask me how I got this, but it seems it played with my skin a very good game. Don't expect unbeliavable miracle. This fragrance is more down to earth, as a girl who wears it.
Sensual, girly, calming, reminds me of a beautiful girl with big eyes, very ambitious, young but elegant with her own style and personality.
I don't smell any old lady thing, no pungent parts. Can SEE it as a signature and desirable.

Why oh whyy the dislikes?

Ok, I can se "why". It's fruity. It's floral. It's not spectacular per se. But even so, It's way more "fun" and "uplifting" and "sparkly" than the "regular" Chloe scents, is it not?

I think so at least. It's a bit of an.. odd fragrance as well. I've heard poolwater beeing mentioned before. It has that sort of chlorine undertone. But that just makes me love it even more. Yhea. I'm also that kind of person that likes to sniff gasoline.

The body lotion in this one is absolutley spot on the perfume aswell, not stale or frowsy at all.

At first it was light floral scent, very boring in my opinion.
Later it became musky and woody. I like those base notes much better. Base notes represent confident woman with style.
Sexy, intriguing and impressive.

I expected this to be fresh and springy, but there is something that gives it an odd, sickly sweet smell. I think it might be the apple blossom mixed with jasmine. I was hoping to get some bergamot, but I can't detect it at all. I can't say I really enjoy it. I am interested to try the flanker though.

I FINALLY FIGURED OUT WHAT THIS REMINDS ME OF!!! Ok so this has been bothering me since I first sniffed it on a magazine strip almost a year ago. It has always reminded me of a very distinct smell from my childhood, definitely a cosmetic product, something my mother or grandmother used. There's this Polish skin care brand that my mom would stock up on when we went to visit my aunt. The brand was AA but I don't remember what it stood for, just the AA logo on the bottles. Anyway, this perfume smells exactly like those products. Everyone saying it has a cosmetics type smell to it (more so skin/hair care than makeup) is absolutely right. That's what it always reminded me of too but now I finally got the specific product. I probably won't buy it but this is so nostalgic to me.

This was an instant headache for me. I really tried to like it, but See Chloe simply doesn't agree with me. I don't get any floral fruity vibe with this, to me it's a powdery fragrance through and through. It smells like a face cream or a conditioner, and although not listed I get a strong rice note. I think this perfume is quite unusual, and it's one of those perfumes that are either love it or hate it.
On a side note,when I was wearing this my husband asked me if I just had a glass of wine, because he found that it was smelling like one!...

sorry fans of chloe but this stuff smells like shampoo on me. very fresh and citrusy. fits for summertime. for a perfume which is launched at 2012, it is very ordinary. maybe floral fans can love it but i feel neutral about it.
I LOVE this fragrance I realy do :)

On first test, See smells very reminiscent of a brighter, screechier Jimmy Choo. One might not like that, but despite the highly synthetic vibe I get from it, I quite like it. Like most Chloe fragrances, silage is fairly powerful. I can't yet speak on longevity, but if their other frags are any indication, then this is worth the money. On the want list it goes!
After sampling many fragrances, I keep going back to this one! LOVE it!

Usually i never really dislike perfumes, but this one...ohmy. i can wear almost whatever, but this one makes me feel sick after two sniffs:( i normally loove light yellow and pink perfumes, but this is a nogo from me.

A typical flowersweet spring fragrance, nothing special to me.

En typiskt blomsöt vårdoft, inget speciellt tycker jag..

I bought the sample size and it was love at first sight, long lasting up to 3 hours and I can still smell it on my clothes. And then I bought the full bottle of 50ml, and so disappointed. The smell didn't even last for 5 minutes. Mine was EDP so I don't know what's wrong. I sold it right away. Too bad I had so much expectation on this one *sigh*

Sometimes I think this smells like hairspray, and sometimes I think it smells like sake/rice. I dunno, I just can't get on board with this one. I've tried, but I just don't like it at all. It's probably the opposite of anything I'd want in a scent, but I can see why some people might like it. It's a bit of a weird scent. I do like other Chloe scents though.

I received a sample of this and immediately fell in love with the scent. It is very fresh and clean, really suitable for spring time. I think there's hint of apple in it, but not very overwhelming like the original DKNY Be Delicious. The bottle is super cute too, like a birdcage, I think the packaging of Chloe is always very chic.

However, I don't know why but this doesn't last long on me at all. I couldn't smell it on me after 2 hours, not even when I flip my hair (I usually spray perfume on my hair.) It's too bad though because I have Chloe EDP and that one lasts surprisingly a long time. But the poor longevity doesn't stop me from wearing this though, I just need to re-apply it a few times during the day.
it smell like water form toilet

Some say is smells like hair spray. They aren't wrong. But it is a smell of nice-smelling hair spray so I don't mind. Fresh, like you are just out of the shower. Tried it yesterday and really liked it, now it is on my wishlist. On my skin staying power was about 5 hours.

This smells like aftershave on me. It smelled so good in the bottle and on my skin the first hour. Then it transformed into a musky, dark aftershave smell, with a hint of apples. It lasted the whole day

Not long lasting on me. Smells ok but too light for my taste. I got this perfume for free that's why I even have it at all otherwise it wouldn't be on my vanity. Might be great for people with perfume allergies or for those who like very light scents but I will definitely not purchase another bottle.

Swimming pool! I was so happy to read that I am not the only one smelling a pool. It's not chlorine, and I can't think of a particular sunscreen that smells like this so I don't know what it is. Little plastic floaties on children's arms or inflatable rings perhaps. In any case it is a happy smell to me. The emotional resonance by itself is good-time, happy day. So I have to say I like it. Is this what I'm looking for in a perfume for a grown woman like myself? No, it isn't. Am I sorry I have this on my wrists on this dismal gray January day? Not at all, it's a real day brightener.

By the way, lots of people have said it reminds them of this, that, and the other thing, and I can see why they said that. Before it settled into its final form it went through so many changes I didn't know if my nose was broken or what was going on. It was astringent, then pure vanilla, then a light floral, then aftershave, then floral again, and now swimming pool. It's a whole day in a bottle! Sort of like Everlasting Gobstoppers from the book Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, that tasted like all of the flavors of a complete meal in order as you sucked them.

Another review here - I tried the regular EDP and liked it but ended up ordering the paint a scent one. Its is more like an oil than liquid and it does not last long. Also, the smell is a weaker than the regular version. I am stuck with it though since I ordered it in Nordstrom. Next time I am blinding buy I will use Sephora

A chic version of Harajuky lovers Love or Music? Can't remember exactly since O had those years ago, but def. one of these two. I ordered a small bottle, simply because I really liked the scent on my skin and it lasts forever. Now, I am intrigued with the new Eau Fraiche. Let's wait till January and see what's gonna be

I like this perfume. It winds up smelling like apples, at times, apple wine or some sort of apple pastry. Unfortunately, while I do like apples, it's not exactly what I want..especially when it smells like I've been drinking apple wine..

It smells like a pool on me. Now I like pools and clean chlorine is an interesting theme. Not sure they meant it but........yup pool with apples. Too sweet though and I hardly ever do this but I'm washing this off my wrist.

I really love this fragrance despite some of the reviews! This is one of my ideas of an irresistable scent! It also really reminds you of some of the Burberry scents which I love as well. Quality scent in a quality bottle.

A sales lady sprayed this on me, swearing I'd like it because my favorite is Burberry Brit (another fruity floral).

At first it smelled nice, a different, sort of spicy scent. Now after about an hours dry down, it smells strongly of honey...kind of cheap and old ladyish. I need to wash it off because it smells very strong on me.

Another one bites the dust...

I thought this opened very nicely with floral notes but got musty as it died down. I thought it was interesting, but not enough to purchase. Overall, there's something about Chloe perfumes that smell a bit synthetic to me.

I honestly did not think I would like this AT ALL. It is described as a fruity floral and I was like, "meh, boring, probably just another juicy sugar bomb". I also don't like apple in frags and really dislike the DKNY Be Delicious line (smells like Herbal Essence shampoo on me, blech). However, when I was bored and wandering around in Sephora I decided to give this a spray because I couldn't find the perfume I was looking for. The scent stuck with me and I LOVED it. This smells more like a spicy hot apple pie, not like a cool crisp fresh apple. I love the muskiness to it. I purchased it and it is my favorite fall scent, PERFECT for the colder weather and cool spicy bite in the air. Sillage and longevity are both very good, a little TOO good if you plan on wearing this in the office on a hot day, so spray lightly. One of my new favorites. Chloe is quickly becoming one of my favorite houses.

Beside Chloe women edp, this one is my other favorite perfume from Chloe. One thing that I love the most is, not many people in my circle know about this perfume.

It smells delicious but not in a candy way. It's a happy, bright and playful fragrance.
Thank God the staying power is better than Chloe women on my skin. It can last all day long.

Just got my vial and I loved it! My husband normally is very critical about my perfume, he hates Fancy by Jessica Simpson, but he's ok with this one. And I feel like See by Chloe is a sweet yet elegant fragrance, last 2-4 hours, I can still smell it afterva long day at work. Love it! Will get the fill bottle soon

I love the house of Chloe so I may be biased in this review. I went from sampling it to loving it and getting a full bottle. It has become my signature scent and I have over 100 bottles. Simply smells fantastic.

The scent: Unique, comforting, approachable and strives to keep things balanced. It's a restrained beauty, the scent in the cage snapped bottle is just waiting to release its beauty. This scent reminds me of the girl that is beautiful and takes care of herself and is fashionable and know how to dress. but yet sometimes downplays her beauty and dresses down and is not trying too hard to be perfect. The scent is just that! It's got the transparency crystalline quality Chloe scents possess. This quality makes it versatile. You can wear the scent any time of year anywhere and you don't have to think too hard about choosing a scent yet you know that your scent will represent you. The apple note is so beautiful blended with the floral aspect of the scent. Perfectly balanced with the woodsy dry down. I can see myself wearing this scent around Christmas time as we'll. The scent it's youthful and sophisticated but not limited to an age group.

The staying power and silage is great on me. I usually spray my clothes and hair as opposed to skin.

The bottle representative of the scent itself. Minimalist yet interesting enough to be looked at and handled. Glass is quite heavy. It's got a vintage feel to it just as the other Chloe scents.

I've used 3/4 of a bottle in a short time that's saying a lot when you've got as many bottles as I do. I can see myself buying a replacement bottle after this one runs out or a backup Bottle if found at a good price.

If you liked the original Chloe Edp and you like sophisticated scents then you might enjoy this one too.

Smells pleasant. I didn't smell any powder with this perfume (thank goodness). It's definitely light and floral. Reminds me of spring. It was strong enough, not overpowering. The scent lasted for a while, which is great. It is very youthful. The lady at the counter did not like it at all, but I loved it.
On my skin this smells like warm apple cider, piss and ammonia. Absolutely horrifying. Very synthetic and nothing outstading. No thank you.

Biggest perfume lesson ever: test it on your skin before you buy it please! On the paper tester it was the most unique and heavenly scent I had smelled in a long time, so I bought it. Sadly on my skin it turns sickeningly sweet and cloying, almost like a sugary apple juice concentrate. Very disappointed and don't know what to do with the bottle now :/

Mmm... I tried this See by Chloe a few times because I really admire Chloe House work, but my first impression was not so positive. I thought: Oh, here it comes, another transparent one to soothe teenagers' tastes for fruit&flower!
Quite useless, considering all Chloe flankers that could serve the scope.
After a few times I came to consider it a perfume on its own and a personality, but I don't like it so much to choose it for me. If I was given it I would probably wear it and I guess my bf would be happier than my usual choices, but not me.
the listed notes make no sense to my nose.
Apple blossom? Or rather pear peel? Maybe they smell similar.
Ylang Ylang? Where? The thick typical yellowish ylang seems bleached.
I also smell a slightly musty wood similar to tobacco leaves, similar to old Cacharel Eau d'Eden (bbrrr!!)
Anyway it's a nice modern feminine scent and quite longlasting. A perfume for a carefree girl with some taste.
I know a lot of people dislike this fragrance but I love it. It's light and fresh - a perfect spring scent, in my opinion. And I feel that it can be worn by any age.

This is now my second, maybe third review on this one. This is the perfume that when I first tried it, I HATED it. I smelled stale beer and then just something gross. I didn't understand people who bought it or why they wanted it.

That has changed, though. And honestly, the notes "floral, woody, white floral, musky, fruity" don't seem accurate to me and that is not what I associate what I'm smelling with it at all. I smell something delicious, and I can't figure out what it is. Like an ingredient in some pastry or dessert made around the Holidays. Mayben it's the apple, like cinnamon apples but with a burnt crunchy brown sugar crust, Lord I don't know, I'm rambling here, I just can't figure it out. It's probably one of the most unique perfumes I've ever smelled, hence why I keep reviewing it and it's got my brain going in every which way. I just haven't committed to buying it yet. I'm going to try some on and "take it for a spin", and see how I feel about it after that. I just know after spraying it on my wrist to get a 6th, 7th, 8th... opinion about it (because it's always changing), I still find myself thinking "mmmmmmmmm... yum" after smelling it and how it changes over time. And don't even get me started on the "paint a scent" idea. I LOVE that, and I'm going to walk over to Macy's in a minute now to paint my wrist, now that this fragrance is on my damn mind again.

Long story short: I originally hated it. Now I'm infatuated with it.

Tested today.I think it's a nice and inoffensive fragrance. Slightly bitter fruit in the middle phase, but once it has settled on the skin the vanilla has softened it quite a bit.

First of all I experienced the scent as the most delicious of desserts and the SA probably got tired of all my aaaah!!-s and mmmmmm!!-s. I was completely mesmerized by the scent. When I came home after an hour I took a second sniff on my wrist but then it had turned slightly bitter and I came to think of beer. (?) It´s all about body chemistry I guess. :) Thankfully, the vanilla came through after a while. So far it is a Like, not Love from me. If the initial scent had stayed throughout, I wouldn´t hesitate to buy a FB. It was that GOOD.

Update: 7 hours later the scent is still there, Very soft, very nice. No bitterness whatsoever.

OK, so as context as to how much I LOVE this scent, I had, LAST DECEMBER, put myself on a perfume buying BAN. I admittedly had gotten a bit ridiculous in my perfume buying habits (my tried and tested signatures are Givenchy Very Irresistible L'Intense - the antithesis of See by Chloe - and Narciso Rodriguez for Her EDT, the black bottle). Therefore, I decided that I was going to make an effort to use some of my current scents up before investing in new ones. However, as of September 17, 2013, my ban has been broken with THIS scent.
It's amazing. If you're a girl who enjoys scents that could be mistaken for a fresh masculine scent, especially in the dry down, you'll love this. On the other hand, the heart of the fragrance is so light and feminine. It really is the best of both worlds. It's one of those fragrances that will have you lifting your wrist to your nose every few minutes. One of THOSE perfumes. It really is a lovely scent, and I can't say I'm sorry that my ban was broken because this scent is WORTH IT.

So I have this little vial sample in my bag and decided to try it tonight...First I get this sentimental apple blossom (my grandmother's favorite flower). It has this retro feel to it...like a scent that has sucked me back to the 70s. As it dries down it begins to transform into a fresh apple pie slice just a hint of spice and creamy vanilla ice cream sliding around on a polished wood plate. I like it...fresh & innocent.

If the actual perfume smells like it does in the magazine insert, then I have to have it. The first smell I noticed was a honey smell. It's a heavier smelling perfume, but it's intoxicating. I can't quit smelling that insert.
This smells very clean and floral, but like other Chloe fragrances, has a sharp powder note that just results in giving me a headache.

Again I usually dont look at these types of fragrances but was given as sample and fell inlove with this one. I do like Chloe Narcisse also but this one is stunning and another that lingers for many hrs. Still a little pricey though for larger bottle.

It is an amazing fragrance IMO. Smells really clean. I agree that there is an almost apple pie like note to it, and I find it comforting & delicious. I absolutely love it. I think it is good for summer, & perfect for the fall.

This perfume play tricks on me.. First I went through a pile of magazines in my local supermarket trying to find which one has sample of this divine scent. I found it! Vogue... See by Chloe.. Something in this scent caught me so tight I was itchy to come home soon and order a sample. It came, I sprayed and...almost chocked.. Too strong...but in an hour I had this aura that attired my so much..omg..I love it! It's great complex perfume, warm and intriguing..I bough 100 ml and never felt sorry.

It looks like I'm 0 for 2 with Chloe fragrances so far... I received a sample of this recently and, since I had already used up my available test spots for the night, sprayed it on a card first just to check it out. My first thought was it smelled *exactly* like walking into a certain store in the mall (Aerie? The Gap? One of those shops that uses a lot of lighter colored woods and wants to give off a "clean" vibe); and this would be just the scent that they pumped in to make all the clothes seem fresh and clean and youthful. So, it seemed relatively inoffensive, if not exciting, and I set the sample card on my nightstand and saved See for another day.

The next day, I was sitting in my bedroom and kept getting wafts of the same kind of sickly sweet, kind of rotting waxy flower note that turned me off of the regular Chloe EDP. I couldn't figure out where it was coming from until I remembered the card sitting on my nightstand--but it smelled so different from what I remember from the day before that I couldn't believe that could be the source. Another sniff seemed to prove otherwise; the horrible smell was coming from the card, which I quickly tossed into the kitchen garbage.

One day later(!), I was getting those wafts again. After briefly considering whether I was going nuts or experiencing some sort of pre-stroke event, I homed in on the sample atomizer on my dresser. It had leaked a little into its cap during shipping, so it was giving off quite a lot of scent and was indeed the source of that sickly sweet smell I kept getting.

It's odd, because See and Chloe EDP don't have any notes in common listed, but there's something about both of them that my nose just cannot stand... Cute bottle, though!

It is very weak. Had to strain to smell it. Immediately eaten by my skin. Left a vague trace of powdery apple-floral. Almost like an eau de cologne

Perhaps suitable for those that enjoy light scents.

I really loved my first sample of it. I ordered more samples and now I don't love it. It's okay and I still like it but not enough to purchase it, it dries down to a nice green apple scent. It just isn't the right scent for me. I'm glad I only paid for sample viles (very cheap on ebay) instead of a whole bottle at Nordys.

This fragrance is very soft,musky,fruity at first and it dries down to a clean and fresh scent.....it lasts all day and I can't resist of smelling my wrist!!!! suitable for all seasons in my opinion!!!!

loove honey and i loooveeee apples (but for some reason could never wear the DKNYs)

This is just APPLE PIE/APPLE FRITTER/ WARM APPLE CIDER like some have already mentioned. u banged it on the head! its sooo cozy. i could for sure see myself wearing this in the winters. i kept a sample in my bag next to my earbuds, and every time i plugged them in i would smell it! such a wonderful surprise each time.

don't know if its 'signature'-type, it IS a pretty heady apple pie smell. but its perfect in small amounts, in such a way that you catch a 'whiff' of it every now and then.

Horrific apple in the topnote, it smells just like beer!

But the drydown is nice. Rosy and soft.

I smiled while reading missk's review, because what immediately came to mind when I tried Chloe See was an apple fritter! Crisp and glazed outside, with warm, soft dough and fruit inside. To me, this fragrance is more gourmand than floral. I'm a big fan of sandalwood, cinnamon, and vanilla, which are very present in this scent. It's delicious, comforting. Makes me want to sit at a corner table in a cozy coffeehouse with a latte and a big apple fritter! The presence of spicy cinnamon keeps this perfume from smelling shampoo-like, in my opinion.

Clean bergamot with a sweet edge. Middle notes remind me of honey and the sandalwood finish is somewhat powdery and feminine.

This doesn't smell "cheap" or "shampoo" like to me. It smells sophisticated. Strongly reminiscent of 'Burberry for Men' - but ladylike.

My fiancé loves it! : )

I personally adore this fresh & crisp scent. Some people cannot wear apple based scents, but those that can will love it, on my body I get the crisp apple scent paired with the Jasmine, then a dry down of musk and sandalwood and Ylang Ylang. It does not smell like shampoo on me nor is it synthetic at all, but on some people it might be depending on their body chemistry I guess. I like it because on me it is a crisp, & fresh fragrance, great for summer & the fall. I have been complemented numerous times when I where it too, my BF likes it a lot as well, and sometimes will wear it himself, I love it on him too, it can be a unisex fragrance IMO.

I have been searching for a new perfume lately and I have tried many different ones on my skin, looking for a new special scent as usual.
Today I have tested this one and it's a very interesting perfume, the scent is really extraordinary. Apple blossom gives a feeling of freshness and cleanness, so much that it alomst reminds me of shampoo!
Also, it lasts quite long, it's been over 5 hours since I have sprayed it on my wrist and it still smells with the same intense as the time I had it sprayed, at least on my skin.
I can't stop sniffing it, it's a very special scent as all of Chloe perfumes of course. Totally recommended to those who like fresh and clean scents in perfumes.

Hmmmmm, I have mixed feelings about that fragrance.

On me it smells the same from the first second to the last drying moments... it's youthful and sweet, but it gives me slight headache, unfortunately....

One of the notes doesn't suit me I guess...

It's amazing how different peoples body chemistry can work with a scent, on me this is a simple, fresh, crisp, and very clean scent, nothing synthetic at all. I was sure this scent would work on anyone, it is almost unisex in its scent, but on some people I guess not. I still like it a lot though.
This is awfull! Smells synthetic. I really hate it. I can't believe it's from the same house as "Love by Chloe", my beloved.

This perfume smells completely different on paper strips and on your skin! On me, the sharp, crisp and fruity top note is gone within 5 mins, and what leaves behind is simply amazing. This is very sweet like honey, with a hint of vanilla. This makes me feel very young and joyful. I am wearing it every day and just can't have enough of it!
I'm struggling to think of an apt word to describe this fragrance......dysfunctional.

I could swear that See by Chloé is one of the Marc Jacobs Lola flankers poured into a new bottle. I wouldn't hold it past Coty Prestige, as there has been a lot of homogenization going on among the houses which it now rules. Fruity-floral frags one and all, with no discernible natural notes. The "vanilla flavor" is probably what reminded me most immediately of Lola, though it is much fainter in this composition.

I received a nice-sized test-tube vial of this fragrance (4 ml), but in this case they'd be better off sticking with the visual marketing hype so that people buy before they try. Not for me. I have not seen the bottle in person, but from a distance it looks very attractive. Hey, wait a minute: isn't it very similar to the Balenciaga Paris bottle? Now that's an interesting marketing tack: use the bottle of an already successful perfume so that the associations carry over to the new launch.

It does seem as though bottles are really the focus of the big mainstream houses these days. Alas, the golden days of perfumery appear to be behind us...

I just tried this fragrance today. Even after my nighttime shower, the fragrance persists and can be smelled about 6 inches off teh surface of the skin.

On my skin, the fragrance itself quite interesting. There is a slight punch of fruit, small enough that it doesn't mess with the core of the fragrance but lends a bright positivity to it as fruits often do. The florals are chic and elegant, and the base is on the masculine side, but not too masculine that I wouldn't wear it.

This fragrance is one I would welcome in the workplace. It speaks to me of an independent, head strong woman who can and will speak for herself. She gets up in the morning and arrives to work on time, excelling at her job in a way that others do not.

I have never had the pleasure of trying Jo Malone Grapefruit myself (yet!), but from the reviews of it I imagine this would be slightly similiar to it in that it is a chic, modern scent that is slightly masculine but not enough to be deemed a unisex scent. The florals keep it feminine.

Very nice, clean, fresh, a little floral, and just a bit fruity scent! I usually stay away from anything with Vanilla as it does not work with me, but this one worked well probably due to the stronger sandalwood undertone. I really like it, a great summer scent, works for teen girls too as it is not overpowering. I would buy this again.

This is a very sharp floral with powdery undertones. Gives a very fresh feeling. I agree that this is not for everyone, but for me it is very unique, distinctive and pretty. Similar to Jo Malone scents actually, elegantly floral. I find it most suitible for ages 20-30. You would like this if you like nectarine blossom and honey (JM) kind of scents :)

Total scrubber! I gave it thirty minutes to work with my chemistry, but the heady white flower syrup started to bring on a headache. Historically I do terrible with apple flower scents- the apple turns sour and chemically on me. Chloe See makes me smell like I went into a musky bar, and rolled on the sticky floor after ladies spilled multiple Apple infused Vodka drinks on the floor.

I can respect what others see in this scent. The bottle is beautiful, and the notes like Jasmine was sweet and ripe for a few seconds, and the Ylang Ylang may also make a lovely debut. I really wish I could do Apple Blossom scents.

I am planning on testing a few other Chloe scents to compare and contrast.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: I liked it when I first tried it but my bf said it smelled like a clean bathroom and it kinda ruined it for me. I'm still thinking about it, maybe I should get a sample.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
This perfume is so alike the discontinued See by Chloe, which used to be my signature scent.

I am THRILLED!

So, naturelle IS a bit screechy, but only for the first 5-10 minutes. It then calms down quite a bit and in the air I would say that it's 90% See by Chloe. Nose to skin it will smell more different, a bit more fresh.

I have been craving See by Chloe and I am SO happy to have found this!

Super pretty and feminine scent - floral and bright and works all seasons.

Just like See by Chloe, it does not have a lot in common with the original Chloe Signature, even though they do share some notes. But I am sure they would layer beautifully together, I might actually try this since I also love and own the Chloe Signature.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: i found this again while cleaning my room (it's been sitting in storage for a year or so) and the scent is quite pretty now - i remember there being a screechy opening when i first tried it, but now it's a lot softer and i can smell that signature chloe in it. let it macerate

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Very loud and fresh/green scent. Not for me and definitely not a safe blind buy. Regretting this purchase.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
my favourite chloé scent by far. the blackcurrant plus mimosa give a more vegetal depth to a fairly synthetic rose. sounds a little offputting but it works; it's very prim and demure and chloé but manages to, if not break out of its conservative shell, at least tap on the glass a little from the inside.
put together with a noticeable air of aloofness, trying without trying.
also bang in the middle between powdery and juicy. nothing out of the box whatsoever but it's a timelessly elegant box.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
This is a beautiful rosy scent . Very natural smelling but does have the sophistication of a perfume . It’s not very long lasting but it’s nice to spray after a shower during hot days and it’s a nice one for those that like very natural smelling florals .

Update; the mimosa predominates which can smell a bit medicinal? Not sure how I feel it about it . I love the bottle though . If I spray liberally it does last more than five hours on skin

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: This is so vegetal. Like carrot's top verging on dill. Very refreshing. The rose comes to play soon enough. It differs a lot from the more floral and woody Chloe Naturelle Intense, especially in top notes. Then it evolves to be similar yet higher pitched.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Soapy smell. I don’t get any rose or woods, nor could i detect a single note. Smells very clean. Longevity is poor (1-2h max) but sillage was good on me

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Lasts max 30 min on me :(

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: wood notes in this fragrance are overwhelming i don’t like this smells smoky cigarettes.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
I agree with kikicardin below, whos wording this better than I would have: "I smell a lot of mimosa and cedar at the very beginning, a little special and a little disturbing at the same time ... It reminds a little of dentists' offices".

Totally agree, its not growing on me unfortunately. I usually like all the Chloé flankers, but this ones not for me. I do smells the lovely OG DNA, but there's something off about this. Happy that I only sampled it, I wont purchase.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
This scent reminds me of a room freshener (Air Wick’s White Flowers, in particular lol), but I weirdly like it a lot. I’m not sure if it’s because of the memories attached to that air freshener or if I just genuinely enjoy it, lmao. Either way, it’s a good scent.
I wore it on a slow, rainy spring/summer day that faded into the evening, and it gave me a certain feeling—soft and calm, yet still making a statement. If that makes sense? I’m not great at identifying specific notes or the exact composition of a perfume, so my review is purely based on the vibe and feeling it gave me.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Reminds me of the discontinued See by Chloe. I can still smell it on me and my clothes after 1-2 hours. But no compliments from other people so I think not as strong as the original Chloe edp

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
Initial spray: Yuck
After 2 minutes: Wait hold up…
Dry down: Smells like a very light costco dryer sheets

I like clean scents, and my fave brand is Chloe. I like the dry down of this scent but it’s very light. Barely there fragrance. Comparing to the intense version, I like that one better cause it has more projection. Dry down almost exactly the same, but intense is slightly sweeter. This tho, is a good office perfume… healthcare, teachers.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
I was afraid it was an "old rose" perfume that our grandmothers wore. I smell a lot of mimosa and cedar at the very beginning, a little special and a little disturbing at the same time.

It's very clean, cold and powdery. It reminds a little of dentists' offices at first. Maybe I'm just not used to mimosa.

After 30 minutes it softens a little more, something creamier, more comforting, more pleasant, even maternal like! It's as if there was still a rose syrup, with a little neroli and more cedar. A perfume a little more mature than what I'm used to, but it's something I could wear if the beginning wasn't so disturbing.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Somehow this smells a lot like Vilhelm Room Service to me

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: It’s okay, nothing special. Safe blind buy if you like floral, fresh scents. It’s not really my taste so maybe it’s just me but I wouldn’t waste my money on it. It’s a very subtle scent too and very feminine. I just smell some of the citron and florals, no rose, wood or blackcurrant.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: i have it. it didn't grow on me in time. i won't get it again.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: I love love love how this perfume smells and I would have very much liked to make this my signature, because it's light, fresh, floral and clean. It gives elegant and chic unproblematic girl for me. Sadly it lasts like 30 minutes on me and for the price that's just a no-go. I'm not sure if I'm not just too used to it now to smell it after the first couple of minutes, but I'm pretty sure it just doesn't perform well on the skin. On fabrics it's a little better but overall still not worth the money.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
This is so beautiful 🥹
A very natural and fresh honeyed rose shampoo scent.
So feminine and delicately chic.

I'm wondering if some of the negative reviews accidentally reviewed Rose Naturelle Intense, with the darker green ribbon.

Because that one was a very spicy bowl of 90's rose potpourri, way too dark and dusty for my tastes.

Edit:
Bought a bottle, and after a week of wear, this has become my favorite perfume. If I had to have a signature scent, this would be it - hands down.

Also, this is for waaaarmer weather, I sprayed it in 60 degree F and it did indeed smell like grass. In 80 F and up, it is very fresh and honey-like

Little plus: it has elicited very sweet compliments from friends, male and female!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
A lovely twist on classic Chloe. Chloe was my signature scent in my early 20s. I graduated from it but love to smell it on others.

This scent adds a fresh and clean spin, neutralizing the rose and upping the maturity. I’d categorize this as a laundry freshie, whereas the original is a youthful floral. Nothing revolutionary but extremely wearable.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: This is a very prim and proper scent to me and I enjoy the herbal freshness of it, but I can only smell it for about 15 minutes and then it’s gone. So sadly it’s a pass for me, I’m more of a Nomade type when it comes to Chloé.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: I have this one as a gift for buying another Chloé perfume. I like the first and middle notes that give out the sweet and romantic rose scent and it make you feel refreshing. When it dries down it leans toward patchouli and something sharp and dry that I find too strong to my nose. (That's why I didn't choose this perfume from the start). Still a like for me, though.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
Encantador. Delicado, fresco sem ser azedo...
Aconchegante como uma gelatina e gentil como uma pétala. Um doce sem ser doce. Um pouco maduro também, mas sem perder a sutileza da jovialidade.
Gostei bastante, nada comparado com outros importados... Cheirei muuuuitos procurando algo que não seja incômodo nem agressivo, até agora os únicos que encontrei foram o Miss Dior Blooming Bouquet (uma graça) e esse.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: I can only smell grass. Unfortunate

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Granny rose smell. Too much of herbs and powder.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
Rose Naturelle EDP is a beautiful floral/woody scent where I adore the white rose note (to me it's a white rose!).
I have given this fragrance twice already. They loved it as much as I did.
Rose Naturelle is light, suitable for spring and summer.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: I am not a fan of rose in general, BUT the rose in this one is just so nicely done. It starts citrusy very inoffensive nice. I wear it mostly in spring and summer. It has a very nice balance. It doesn't have very strong lasting power but on clothes is better. I love the bottle.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: If I had a signature scent this would most likely, be it. This will forever remain in my roster for as long as they make it. It's bright, warm, uncomplicated and beautiful. I pray it never gets discontinued.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Harsh rose water is what i get so i could not endure it long enough to get to the base notes. Try before you buy. If you do not like rose that is not tamed with other notes, you will probably not like this one.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Ultra chic, cool, green - not romantic or rosey like the OG, but greener, sharp, extremely clean and fresh. Simple yet elegant!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Did I get a bad vial? Felt sure I'd love this given the notes list, but I get none of the things other reviews mention. Zero honey, no rose. What I was most excited for was the sweet, bright, fresh-cut grass I kept reading about; turns out to be the biggest letdown, because it just isn't here. I get nothing but sharp green soap, start to finish. It gives Irish Spring bar soap vibes. Instant headache and heartbreak 💔.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
Slightly green but mostly fruits.
Initially this smells like a plum+peach flavored bubble gum.
20 minutes past, still waiting for some rose and mimosa to step up/
50 min past, Fruits are still there but I'm getting rose and cedar/
Overall thoughts: Fresh, girly, generic but not Too generic, and reasonable price. This is almost everything you can expect from a designer fragrance.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: I used it for the first time this morning. After three squirts I still could not detect anything distinct or distinctive. The forth squirt eventually produced the result I was after - my nose was enchanted by a very feminine scent in which the dominating notes were these of citrus and mimosa. Their combination + the other ingredients make a highly appealing and sensuous experience. Unfortunately, it does not last long... Two hours later and the sensation evaporated....

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
A colleague walked past me and before I could say hi I was enveloped in a cloud of bright, flowery, fresh cut grass. In that moment, I lost my ability to speak, so I messaged her afterward “I NEED TO KNOW WHAT PERFUME YOU’RE WEARING.”

And thus, that was my introduction to Naturelle.

She — and she is definitely a she — is BRIGHT! Bubbly, in your face brightness without in a care in the world: she’s a tried and true Chloe girl.

On me, the opening notes are fresh cut grass and dewy rose petals. But it dries down into something more grown-up. She’s a young, working mom who wears sets from The Row and always has a nude manicure. She gets highlights but wears her hair in its natural, unruly curls. Naturelle is bright, blossoming and a little wild.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
Beautiful scent. I was pleasantly surprised at this.
To me, this smells fresh, sunny and sweet.
I’m not really a huge fan of rose in perfumes as they usually smell artificial and overpowering, but this rose is done well. It’s lovely and fresh, not at all cloying.
The warm honey smell from the mimosa is strong but I love that as I like sweet perfumes. I get a slight soapy clean smell too, which again I enjoy.
When I wear this, it reminds me of the summer holiday and makes me feel excited for warm weather.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: This wasn't the smartest buying decision on my part. When I sampled it in-store, I loved how it smelled fresh and floral without being too rose-dominant. It has a sparkling quality that I assumed would work well in hot weather. But when I opened my bottle this summer, all I could smell was celery.
