And since I live in a place where it is 100+ degrees every day in the summer, there's a strong scent bubble of any perfume I spray. This means I had a very strong celery aroma to everyone around me. There is a very strong and sharp note immediately upon spraying, which lasts throughout the entirety of the wear. Now that it has been a couple of months I am going to try it again and see if maybe I should use it in the winter instead of summer.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Floral freshy with a touch of spice in the opening (rosey spice). Clean smelling without being musky or citrusy or aquatic. Not as powdery and not as rosy as the OG, I enjoy this version way more. Smells natural, not perfumey at all. Easy reach. Linens drying near rose bushes

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: No no no. Original Chloe is my OG, my most complimented, my desert island scent, the one I’d pick if I could only own one fragrance. This is just not it for me. The added notes just destroy the clean, transparent airy floral that defines Chloe. My travel spray was sold to another unsuspecting person. I liked the other flankers, they seemed to maintain the qualities I love, but not this one, sadly.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: This is one of my favorite perfumes, and by far my favorite rose perfume. it’s not very sweet or even very feminine, but something about it smells like a rainy day to me, but it’s also very rosy and elegant.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
It opens up very strangely on my skin. It smells like some kind of mixed herbs, but not in a good way. Reminds me of a bag of meat marinade with spices and herbs like basil, oregano and rhubarb. I really don't like it. Over time it turns into a nicer sparkly clean floral scent. It's even has that honey-like sweetness from blackcurrant.
Overall, it's a strong dislike from me. When I wear it, I feel like I'm at a cheap restaurant, where the smell of the preparing food is mixed with the floral cleaning products that were used for cleaning the dishes.
Also, just like most of the Chloé fragrances, I smell something very sharp and nauseating in it :(

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: I bought Naturelle mistakenly when I meant to get the original Chloe by Chloe eau de parfum but I’m honestly not mad at it. They smell very similar, but Naturelle is more woody and sharp yet still soft and i have to spray a bit more, whereas OG Chloe is more smooth and bright yet loud (it projects way more) and I don’t have to spray as much. Naturelle still has pretty good lasting power. I sprayed a few sprays on my on my shirt, ran a few errands, went to sleep with the same shirt, woke up the next day and I can still smell it on my shirt and now my blanket. This is such a gooooood freshie scent and I’m a gourmand girlie through and through, but there’s something about this and OG Chloe I just can’t get enough of. I can see how people could say it gives laundry detergent, like I get it but to me it still reads as a perfume. The only singular note I pick up on is the citron which I guess is why some ppl get “bug spray”, other than that I think it’s very well blended. Can’t wait to layer it with Chloe by Chloe for a touch of woodiness and depth. 3.5/5 stars, just wish it projected more but I am still happy with this!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Starts very green and lasts green for half an hour and theeeennn...suddenly opens up with honey! Kind of specific type of honey, very aromatic one, but not overly sweet! Interesting perfume, I like it! Longevity is medium which is ok for me.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: So I received a sample of this and instantly I fell in love with this fragrance. It is very special indeed. It’s almost polite in nature but very sensual at the same time. The only thing that may stop me from purchasing this perfume is that it really does not last for long on the skin. However owning a bottle of this perfume and having it just for yourself to wear to bed is almost like a heavenly thought. I think if your husband or partner smelled this on you going to bed they would actually fall in love with you all over again! That’s how good it is it’s almost sexy like it is sexy but in a polite way.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
On me, this fragrance smells rosy for about a minute and then citrusy for another five minutes, and then...

Powdery green skin scent that is barely detectable unless I stick my nose right on my skin.

On test paper, this fragrance smelt wonderful. Natural and lively, but on me, it's just completely uninspired. Maybe it's got something to do with my skin chemistry, but the result is not at all the same as on the test strip.

Try before purchase, for sure. As it is, I think it's way overpriced, like some (or many?) of Jo Malone's scents.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Apparently mimosa and I don't get along well. This is the 3rd fragrance I've sampled with that note and I've disliked all 3. The opening was ok, with a greenish light touch, but the dry down just is not pleasant, and I got to the dry down in less than 10 minutes. It didn't change for the rest of it's longevity. I'll avoid fragrances with a mimosa note in the future. Sorry, girl!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
Fresh and clean rose fragrance with the backround in some cedar. Very nice and inoffensive, kind of glad that the black currant is not so promiment. The longevity is poor, it was gone in two hours. (Might be the heat)
Vibes: rosy petals in light sweetness
Form: 2ml sample

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Opens too sharp for me, dry-down is better. The dry-down reminds me of Pastel by Gres, only less well balanced and less interesting.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Opens as a green dewey rose with an edge of spice. Smells like rose petals covered in dew. I’m noticing something sweet and almost soapy as well with a hint of citrus. It’s bringing to mind those clear bars of green rosey soaps you’d find wrapped in cellophane in a guest bathroom. It’s more pleasant than I remember the original Chloe being. For me, I always smelled a bug spray rose from the original. This one is so much more enjoyable. Neroli and cedar can sometimes bother my nose yet they’re light and inoffensive in this fragrance.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
I haven’t tried a mainstream fragrance in a very long time. The green ribbon made me think this may be a green forward fragrance.

I sort of is. First spray I got a lot of citrus and maybe some fruit. Once it settled down, all I got was fruit. I did not get any rose at all. The fruits were apple and or melon. I had sprayed my wrists, so when I needed to wash my hands I finally got the rose. It is nice, but like a lot of mainstream fragrances

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: On my skin this is VERY green and clean. It’s not for me

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Fresh and clean, it has a bright citrus opening that fades into a wearable green rose. It's not a perfume that would normally be up my alley, but I found myself reaching for it in the spring, when the trees are finally blooming and the sun is coming out. Longevity is nice, I can usually still smell it on me six or seven hours later. I would recommend getting a sample of this and not blind buying. To someone who doesn't like sharp green scents, this could definitely be overwhelming.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Maybe I don't know the difference between rose and mimosa, because this smells very rose like to me. I get freshly cut roses, with the green notes of the stems and perhaps some dewdrops. Projection is pretty good, had it on for about 4 hours now and it's still present.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
Initially I was surprised at the low rating because I think this is a great, easy to wear mainstream, approachable perfume. But if you think rose is dominant, you will be disappointed.

Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle is a citrus rose then dries down to a light powdery mimosa. I don’t get the dreaded laundry note; to me this is a beautiful, sunny springtime floral.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: It seems I don't like mimosa. I like citrus and rose so it's definitely the mimosa. I smell a strong soapy pollen with a hint of dirty socks in the background. I really think the mimosa doesn't mix well with my nose, especially with added rose. This is horrid.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
This perfume needs time to develop for the scent to show its velvety, yellow floral mimosa base. Mimosa is the star of the show in this one, so if you are expecting a heavy, intense rose you will be disappointed. Mimosa is powdery, soft, elegant, not something I experience in most modern perfumes I’ve sampled.

I can detect a bit of soft, astringent roses growing on a bush, with an ozonic light spring shower scent. The citron is also very light, but I think that’s what keeps this from becoming a dish soap type of scent. The woodiness in the base also connects this scent back to nature and grounds it. This perfume is expertly blended, romantic, and perfect for daytime wear or a brunch date in the spring or a cool summer evening boating on a lake.

If the original Chloe Edp is too screechy or intense for you (I enjoy it but sometimes it can be headache inducing if I don’t spray it lightly), give this one a try. Not a safe blind buy unless you are a mimosa lover and you want your scents to stay closer to the skin. I want to be able to draw my husband in for intimate moments and wear perfumes that he can snuggle into without sneezing.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
Wow, this is G-R-E-E-N. Fresh and green. Floral and green. Soapy and green.

I absolutely hated it on my first try but trying it a second time, it’s not that bad. As for me, it’s just not my cup of tea. I do see how someone else could find it absolutely beautiful. It’s fresh, youthful, very spring-like but… it also reminds me of a cleaning product and I agree on the unpleasant underlying sharpness…

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Got the sample searching for a light fresh rose. Well, a fresh light rose it ain’t, and not really a rose. Rose plays like a fourth fiddle here. Scent veers strangely between artificial sweetness of hard candy with sour undertones that read heavy and soapy floral. Plus a weird and prominent oily, almost coconutty note like a body cream that is off and slightly rancid. Weird scent, for me it utterly lacks subtlety and is quite sour, straightforward and heavy-handed. I was expecting garden watercolour and got a bag of cheap sour hard candy.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
I’m kind of soooo glad that I don’t like it….probably would’ve in the past nose.
I’m sure I would’ve killed for this one 10-20 years ago . It’s a very black currant scent on me.
Sillage is very good.
My nose doesn’t agree with it.

Chloe signature edp for LIFE!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: This is what a French woman in perfectly aged 501s and a white linen t-shirt strolling through public gardens in Paris in June would smell like.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: This and Chloe EDP are two of my favorite scents. My impression is that Chloe EDP performs a bit better than this but if it does it's not a huge difference. Both are fantastic regular scents for me.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
I was listening to "In the heat of the morning" by David Bowie when I tried this one so it is forever linked to that song. I can't find a better reason to like it even more.
It smells really natural: rosy berries and beautiful mimosa.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Oooh very green and fresh and yes a touch herbal - but in a cactussy prickly way if that makes any sense? I'm not sure why these words are coming to my mind but I'm just going with it. Not overly rosey, quite citrussy but overall mostly green to me. Just a touch sweet. Lovely, can easily be a fresh spring daywear scent. I'm not getting mimosa nor neroli, it's rather a bit fruity if anything besides the rosey citrussy greenness.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Tried this in store on my hand and for the rest of the day, couldn’t help but bury my nose to it. To me it smells like wild roses in the field, rain, cut grass and spring joyousness. Can’t get enough of it. There is a sour note also…..someone commented about grandma’s rose potpourri, yeah, I can smell that too.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Smells to me like a beautiful garden in the middle of the forest. Green but soft. I feel clean when I wear it. Imagine clean sheets and the whole room smelling of it, plus a few drops of etheric oil.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Something in this smells like celery to me... odd.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: I bought this one in spring last year and loved it for spring and early summer. I stopped wearing it in autumn but I still love the smell from the bottle itself - but when I reached for this a week ago, I smelled something way too green (a bit grassy, even?) for this time of year in the opening. The drydown is still beautiful, but I would definitely save this one for warmer weather only due to the opening. During those warmer days, though, it is absolutely my favourite fragrance to wear daily. It is rosy, floral, fresh and green. Spring in a bottle.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: The opening is mostly cedar and rose. It's not very sweet although the current note can be detected. Projection is good at first but quickly trails off a few hours in. Reminiscent of a soap or some other product you would pick up at the local farmers market. Over time it loses the soapiness and sour blackcurrant comes to the forefront. While not something I would personally go for, I do like that it is a departure from the other Chloe scents which I find all quite similar.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Tested this today on a blotter, smelled very freshly, raucously herbal to me.. very interesting, will def go back for another try.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: The original Chloe is one of my favorite scents. This scent is reminiscent of the original but lighter. I can smell the cedar here & I do like that. However, there is a strange note in the background that I just don’t like. It’s like rotten fruit or something.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
Gorgeous, fresh and crisp
Love it for spring days and office days.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: This perfume reminds me of Sandy from Grease, before she turned into a baddie! A sweet, pink rose is the prom queen of this high school dance. A beautiful, vintage mimosa is her prom king! They dance zesty, young moves while a subtle, sweet black currant plays in the background. This scent is timeless and I like it!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Team 'NO' on this one. This flanker is a scrubber for me, so sour.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Something about it reads as unexpected but fresh and juicy but green.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
Unique. A very "green", grassy scent, with strong currant and cedar. The cedar here almost smells like a mixture of Christmas spices. Simultaneously fresh, woodsy, and fruity. Slightly musky. It is constantly changing and showing different sides of itself.

This is like walking through the woods in early Springtime with a gingersnap in one hand and a cup of fruit juice in the other. There are grasshoppers all around and it recently rained. The whole landscape is pale green, it's a little cold out and you're wearing a cashmere sweater.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Nauseating, extremely sickly sweet and unbearable. I honestly don't even remember the notes, I disliked this so much I had to get it off of me and out of my home immediately.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
Citrusy 'Naturelle' Rose, fantastique! It's chic! I love most of Chloe's fragrance creations!
Projection tends to sit on the skin and is moderately lasting.
I am using it in the English Autumn but I am sure it will stand out during warmer weather! LOVE!🌹🍋

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
There are whispers of pine forest here and there, and a sour undertone in the early stages that was appealingly tart.Then a nondescript floral heart, then a woody baseand just the barest touch of sweetness.
Green, fresh and clean,not quite but almost soapy clean.
It’s pretty and I like it.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
I’m surprised to see all the hate on this fragrance!
In my opinion it smells les sharp and more green than the original. It has a clean quality. Smells a bit like a very refined laundry detergent to me.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Got a free sample of this with another purchase. It does have minor similarity with the original Chloe (emptied a big bottle, when it came out in '08), but then there is a green bitterness about it that I really don't like. Looking at the notes the rose and mimosa are the only 2 I can smell and it is a very odd combination to my nose. It feels like they are putting such a strong emphasis on the 100% natural, vegan etc that the actual scent wasn't as important. Will probably give my sample away.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
Got a tester of this with a Sephora order and not thinking that I’d like it… I fell in love with the fresh, ozonic dewy rose. It’s perfect for spring and summer, has surprising longevity for a natural fragrance. The neroli is really blended well with the other florals— I do like neroli, but I find it can overtake a fragrance. The rose is definitely the star. The only issue is where to find this in Canada. Every Chloe counter that I visit, the sales reps are not even remotely aware of this scent. Sephora doesn’t carry it, despite giving out the sample. Left scratching my head on this one. I’d buy a FB if I could get my hands on one!

Edit: Dec 2022
Found. FB on Perfumeonline.ca. It’s wonderful, but I won’t be using it much until the spring.

Edit: spring

Perfect for afternoons and mornings. Fresh and breezy. You have to like a green fragrance— I know some people don’t like this accord or find that its presence in a fragrance leaves a cleaning solution vibe. It works for me and I love the dewy freshness. It’s my spring rose scent!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
My sample says it contains rosa damascena flower oil among other ingredients, like linalool, citral, eugenol etc.
I was looking for the damascena rose smell. Sadly I don't get it. I get an intensely sharp green scent. I only can compare it to the green notes in Sa Majesta La Rose by Lutens. That bushy, thorny aspect of the rose plant that is just...well, not pleasant to my nose.
Sharp, sharp, sharp. Piercingly green.
I thought I was going to love it. I can say it projects like a beast and that is surprising given it's "naturelle" condition...
Sample it first. Not a safe blind buy.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
I think this one is very contingent to the skin chemistry of the wearer. I live in the tropics too - and I agree with all the negative comments. This is repulsive. But evidently, others seem to like it a lot! Which baffles me and lead me to the conclusion that perhaps, their skin chemistry just works with this one.

It turned into wet moth balls heavily scented with rose on my skin.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: I never liked this flanker but there is a new one called Roses Naturelle Intense which I would love to try once it drops

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: quite shocked by the negative reviews of this perfume as i don’t share the same sentiment at all! this is divine and perfect for me as i live in the tropics. very comforting, natural floral scent that i wouldn’t imagine can offend anyone. beatiful projection and people can still smell it on me even when i can only catch the softest whiff of it. makes me feel effortlessly pretty.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Wow! This frag really delivers, I was pleasantly surprised this random sample packed quite the punch. I suspect this frag can be quite polarizing on different skin chemistry's / climates. If you like heavier florals it's a must try. To my nose I get watery notes, not ocean water but babbling brook surrounded by moss. The mimosa sparkles through and everything gets a slight sweet edge. Citrus develops and gives this quite the body. I feel like this is what most generic florals miss, and this one nails. Finally The dry-down is sopping wet enormous rose. Quite the treat. I recommend sniffing the trail on this one and judging from there- arm sniffers are going to get smacked in the nose by this one!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Nauseating. Not for me.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: The citrus in this is way too overwhelming and together with the musty rose it smells like vomit on my skin.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Tested a few of the Chloe rose-centered fragrances and this one was a star. Tangerine rose was great but very much focused on the tangerine, so much so that I'd say it's primarily citrus rather than rose. L' eau had an odd celery note on my skin. Naturelle is a fantastic ROSE. The citrus isn't too bright for this to be multiseasonal, light enough for the summer but woody enough for fall. The rose is deep and peppery-- not too jammy, not too powdery. I wouldn't say this is a FRESH rose, but it is elegant and sensual.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: It reminds me Chloe Eau de Toilette, but EDT is more ozonic and Naturelle is really natural, genuine, green, soft... It is full of real flowers, nothing artificial. I like it very much.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: I love this one. It’s a very unique fresh floral scent. My husband always compliments me when I wear it. And it lasts a long time on me when almost nothing else does.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: For me, mimosa is a main star here. And it smells very naturelle, no synthetic flowers here, instead I smell real bouquet of fresh mimosa flowers. I'm not really into floral perfumes, but this one is nice.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: The perfume is okay, reminds me of the green Burberry her. The smell however is a bit too strong and long lasting. That would be great if it were notes I enjoyed, however something about it gives clean products and not a clean smell. Clean smell is water, maybe a dove or level 3000 soap. This is cleaning products, as in I can imagine Fabuloso has a smell like this on their line. And it’s as strong as cleaning products too. This fragrance is too heavy for me. I’ll reach for her on days where I’m out all day but not indoors. I can’t smell it for hours on end.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: This one missed the mark they could have made this a hit but it's a miss and smells like bathroom cleaner or a household product not a perfume. Definitely my least favorite from the Chloe family.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: A very light summer scent, with notes of rose, lemon and distant hints of cedar. Unfortunately it reminds me too much on laundry detergent.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: I bought this without properly testing it (you'd think I'd learn) because I loved the top notes. Unfortunately the dry down left me disappointed. You know that cheap pink liquid hand soap they have in the bathrooms of less expensive restaurants and in gas stations? That's the drydown. Skip this one - the rose and tangerine is muuuuch better.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: I wanted to like this but meh. It smells very green, fresh and floral but when it dried down it smells 100% like laundry detergent

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
I have a little non-spray bottle from the sephora sampler set so I might not be getting the full effect.

It's verrrry citrusy and green...and a little soapy? It reminds me a lot of Daisy Eau So Fresh.

Edit: When I first reviewed I wasn't sure if I liked it, but I wore full a full day last week and it was so nice! It has this uplifting citrusy "sparkle" to it that I love, and lasts a surprisingly long time (usually those sparkles can be fleeting). I notice the rose more now that I've worn it for a full day.

I love the original Chloe, but sometimes I worry it's too heavy of a floral for work. I don't feel that with this one. Strongly recommend if you enjoy both the original Chloe and any of the MJ Daisy flankers -- A good potential signature scent if you like those but want something not as many people use.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
I really like the idea of this perfume, the natural aspect, as I hate synthetic smelling scents. I used to wear the OG briefly when it came out, but I really love Chloé l’eau for its green-chypre citrus rose composition. The best one imo.

Naturelle doesn’t top L’eau for me, the mimosa makes it too flowershoppy. It’s not a seductive but more a subtle prim and proper natural woman type of fragrance. I prefer my rose with some patchouli or vanilla. I’d like this as a body product, not as a perfume, but wouldn’t mind smelling this on others.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
I adore this perfume. It feels bright and carefree and lasts all day on my skin. Many of my favorite perfumes have citrus-rose notes and this scent fits nicely into my collection for when I want to feel optimistic (many of my other scents have more down-to-earth notes). I keep a decanted atomizer in my gym bag and wear it after my morning work out. The top notes hastily exit the scene and I'm left with the rose and neroli for hours.

Honestly, I tested this one before I got to smell the original Chloe EDP. I recognize and appreciate the original Chloe's DNA in Naturelle, but I do think it smells synthetic compared to this lovely, fresh flanker.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: I tried Naturelle several times but as much as I can see that.. it does in fact smells natural and real the mimosa ruins it for me totally. I love the Chloe line but this one gets so smoky and unbearable on my skin it is a scrubber. Love the idea behind it and was looking for a fresh rosy green scent and thought this could work but sadly it did not

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
Though it is a lot more expensive than the original edp I will probably get it for summer instead of the original. It is less powdery, less synthetic, a bit greener. Naturelle truly delivers. There is nothing synthetic in the scent. It feels very natural and will not bother anybody. However, as elegant as the rest of the Chloe fragrances. Moreover, it really stands out from all the other summer fragrances - it is truly unique scent. I think it will perform well in the heat and wouldnt probably have much sillage in a winter weather. It takes a lot to get me like a fragrance this much.

Edit: I got myself a small bottle. Oh gosh. It smells like summer field by the cottage I used to go to as a small child. Sunny, natural, comforting, green. It is quite faint scent so I am looking forward to those hotter summer days for using it. It hurts my soul how expensive it is but really - worth every penny.

It is my new favorite. I hope it wont get discontinued. It is amazing 😍

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Naturally spicy. Unexpected warm spice (almost like cinnamon, but woodier), which I don't see in the listed notes. The Fragrantica review mentions that the type of rose used in this natural formula (de Grasse) has a spicy kick to it, so I think that must be it. This gives the perfume a unique aspect and keeps it fresh. If you can picture how when pink pepper is added to a rose perfume it gives it a cold punch, this spice gives the rose a warm blanket. Nevertheless, this feels fresh and light and I'm loving it for Spring.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
When I was browsing at the store for a summer scent, this one stood out to me more than any of the others. Among all of the florals and gourmand and spicy scents, this is the only one that didn't blur together with all the others. I felt shamed by the clerk because she called it "granola" but I guess in a way that's what I was looking for: a scent that smells natural, comfortable, playful and adventurous. It smells like a nice hike.

It's kinda spicy at the beginning. That's the kick of citron. The cedar base is there from the beginning and just gets stronger as it dries down. The heart's rose is not overstated. Blended with the cedar and neroli and mimosa, it almost feels creamy smooth. I work outside a lot so the cedar mixes with my sweat by the end of the day and smells like... I don't know, a healthy sense of adventure.

I've been wearing this for about a month now and it took me a while to get the the point where I appreciate the depth of this scent. I can definitely see myself falling out of love with it if it ever mixes with my BO, I can see myself associating it with being sweaty and dirty.

But for now, this is going to be my summer scent.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
This Chloe is very green as mentioned by others previously. You have to put this on your skin to see what it will smell like because on paper it is wildly different. When I sprayed this on paper the neroli is very strong and it's pretty much all I can smell, on my skin it's a much nicer/smoother blend. I think that if you like clean fragrances which are not aquatic or citrus dominant, and you enjoy a slight hint of freshly cut grass, you may enjoy this fragrance. It's super inoffensive just like all the Chloes from this line.

P.S. If you're looking for a signature which is unisex and a little different, I would recommend you sample Chloe Nomad EDP - It's more interesting/different than this one, and it's still fresh without being citrus/aquatic dominant.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: This smells very, very clean without being aquatic or citrusy. It’s green and soapy. Very feminine. The rose is not overt. My favorite flanker and makes me feel like a rich, modelesque influencer with a “clean girl aesthetic.”

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
Green and salty, beachy, soft creamy and powdery. Actually not much rose at all, to my nose! But it is very, very lovely, a bit different from the fragrances I have tried before. Feels like something from my childhood - I used to live very close to the beach when I was very little.
Will put this on my wishlist... I have and love Chloe edp (signature), Roses Chloe, Chloe Absolu edp, and the gorgeous beauty Love, Chloe - which I, as many others, hope that they will take back in production!! To me, in this new flanker, there is some resemblance with that soft creamyness that is so special in Love,Chloe. Not the same, of course, but there's just something, to me.
A bit woody, a bit soapy, too. Warm soap...

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
If Daphne Bridgerton had a fragrance it would be this, completely flawless. A natural rose with a fresh watery touch, elegant and youthful at the same time.
A natural beauty perfume, a diamond of the first water.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: I like it, it’s nice but boring. The end of this has sort of spice in it. I would prefer this as a deodorant.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: I really think this is pretty. Its opening is a bit nondescript but at the middle notes you do get the Chloe vibes fragrance. Its all about the middle with this guy...its green, its aromatic and slightly powdery. The drydown is a bit lemony and green. Not the best drydown but not awful. Its a skin scent for the most part. It is long lasting but the drydown happens rather quickly. I would have gotten a travel spray but i actually think it flaired up my allergies.😬😬

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: I have fallen in love with Chloe EDP and wanted to give this flanker a a try. It's too green for my taste. On me, it smells like I'm taking a nice long walk on a warm spring day... and someone is cutting grass while it's the peak of pollen season. It's the worst parts of spring in a bottle.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
This is not a bad scent, it’s just that I don’t get along with it.
I get some kind of bug spray/detergent feeling every time I smell it.

And it’s seriously strong and long lasting! I’ve never, ever used any perfume that performs so good. It’s a real bomb! I could smell it well after 4 days on my jacket - with only one spray!!! Not even Angel doesn’t last this long on clothes.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: For me it smells like grass so it’s a NO

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Light fruity forward rosé. Am I describing wine? It’s mushy fruits in the opening, then a lovely, sprightly rose. This scent is cute without being immature and is very pleasant. I like Red Roses style more but this one is a good travel scent that lifts my mood and would be nice all around. It doesn’t last very long on me though, so not FB worthy IMO but it wouldn’t make a bad present.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: This is fine, nice enough fragrance for Spring & Summer. It’s just kind of boring to me.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
Wow this is not what you would expect from this Chloe line! I love the rest that smell the same w their slight nuances, and this oddball was quite a pleasant surprise. I like it a lot.

I take that back. Both the green and pink leaus are also very different

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Bought the purse spray of this as I was looking for a fresh fragrance that would work for my dance class. I am not a huge fan of all the traditional “gym” fragrances and this one works great for me! Would consider a full size if I was a signature fragrance person but the price isn’t worth it for something I only spritz on like a deodorant…

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: I have a full bottle of this if anyone wants to trade?? I like it and my husband really likes it ( he says it smells clean) but I am so sad it does not work on my skin. I loved it in the store and on the lady wearing it.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
so i skin tested this and yeah its nice. i AM NOT paying $178 for a 50ml though!.

right so, on skin this is much more unisex than you might think.
retains the dry rosey flroal feel but adds in a green and nice rubber element. I have recently tried something else with mimosa and once you know what it is, its quite recognizable. this is very clean and fresh - almost a laundry smell - which i love, there is a delicate flower peeking out somewhere - but not you usually kind.. maybe a flower and the little bush in which it grows, .. the most delicate rose you might smell walking through a garden centre smelling the bloom attached to the rest of the plant.

clean, fresh, laundry, tiny bit green, delecate (marc jacobs perfect also had this hard to describe nostalgic 'thing' happening). a clean non flowery floral. lasted pretty well

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
Very interesting scent
It has something in common with the rochas Natural scent - girl.
Quitebpretty in the dry down. It has that smooth, yellow floral fresh and rounded thing which Mimosa does

This is a little dry like the original - a dry, laundry, powdery non fresh rose, floral, a tiny bit green but that comes out more for balance overall, it's rounded and cool.
There could almost be a little bit of a rubbery note??
This is overall a clean floral freshie - but no aquatics and no blue feel,no wood either.

I think this is feminine fir sure, however its unisex, there's a delicateness and coolness which could go either way, this isnt rosey per se, nor fruity.

I'm getting very good longevity, I sprayed around 1.30pm and this is still going very well at 8.30pm.
Hot day, two squirts to arm.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: I didn’t like this one at first, seemed astringent and bitter, but it actually works much better on the skin than on paper. On skin it’s fresh and natural, it glows, I can sense the Chloe DNA; I like what they’ve done with limiting artificial ingredients, very bold move for a designer perfume. I hope this sets off a trend for other perfume houses. This is a great one to add to the collection if you like the original Chloe, but try first (on skin, not paper!) as it has a completely different personality and mood.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: You can definitely smell the upgrade in the quality of ingredients, I love this one much much more than the original. Everyone seems to love this one around me, give me some sort of vibe to Byredo Rose of no man’s land but without the wooddiness. Pretty, elegant, young, classy and natural scent

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Received a sample. Testing. Kind of like it. Smells fresh.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
Really lovely,girly scent. It will be perfect for spring and summer. So cute… I see pretty girl in her floral dress, with pink cheeks wearing this. Citrusy-floral, light fragrance. Little bit soapy but I don’t mind.
I think this perfume will also be beautiful for bride for her wedding day. :) that’s the type of scent.

Edit- still don’t know why people hate this! Now I’m wearing it at spring and it’s so beautiful! Fresh, juicy and sweet with a hint of green.🧚🏼♂️

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
I am reading the notes listed & I am SCHOKED !!!
they have nothing to do with the scent.....
all I get is grassy notes and an attempt to make a new edition that has gone wrong

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
Yikes, smells like pure bug spray! Not a perfume…
Bug repellent, definetely a no for me.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Yuck. It smells like silicone and white paper.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: I'm surprised at poor reviews on this one. To me it is so pretty. It is fresh and clean and green and bright. Perfect for spring weather, but I've also worn it several times this winter on a laid back weekend. It lasts a lot longer than I expected it to, especially on clothes. I have worn it to bed and still smelled it the next day. On my clothes it lasts for days. The bright green aspect of the rose reminds me a bit of Mancera Pearl. I like how unsweetened and natural the rose smells without getting sharp or sour. Overall, I'm really glad I bought this. I'm looking forward to wearing it a lot when Spring rolls around.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
I was getting excited to smell it reading notes and reviews here until i read “ambroxan” in one of the review…
What a pitty to destroy it with this :(
Next!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: This is so green it gave me a headache. Like cut grass. The green notes are so strong. I have to pass on this.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
This is lovely! Soft and floral sweet. Smells really natural and feminine. Not as powdery as the other Chloès. This is more dusty. It also smells a bit country, but not earthy, if you know what i mean. It’s a great choice for spring and summer. I imagine a romantic lady wearing it in her garden.
Try it if you like soapy, a bit herbal scents.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: So gorgeous! The freshest fragrance I’ve ever smelled. It’s so light and airy, great for those early morning showers or even after a long day. On the safe side, yes, but it’s a pretty one.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Smells clean, soapy, and herbal almost. I hated it.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: I hate rose perfumes on myself, usually go for gormands but o m g this one is so good!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: I'm a die hard for that zesty opening. But I absolutely hate the rosy drydown. Overall it's a clean smelling perfume. Inoffensive. It smells as natural as a chemical product can get.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Very pretty , light and airy. Out of the shower clean. I love this . I sprayed it before bed and I still smell it on clothes, on skin its gone in 1-2 hours but I don't mind . This is beautiful .

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Call me crazy but the reminds me a lot of Elizabeth & James Rose Nirvana in that it is dry floral and slightly spicy. Rose Nirvana is rose with vetiver, and this new Chloe is rose and cedar, but both have a same effect. Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle is a little prettier and greener, but for the most part they are a lot alike. If you have one, you certainly won't need the other.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: That would be a pretty perfume, if it did not sit on a huge doze of ambroxan. Unbearable for me. I never expected it from Coty.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
On my skin it opens beautifully warm and cottony, like clean linen in summer sun. There is also a salty note that reminds me of tears. It has a feminine, wholesome quality to it with the same fresh baked bread note of the original chloes but lighter and fresher, reminds me a bit of Chloe edt and J'adore In Joy, the salty note is stronger on clothes.
Drydown is lightly creamy quince. Moderate sillage and longevity.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: This is a pretty citrus floral perfume. The only problem is it is a bit weak and that is a problem w/ naturals that are not heavy w/ resins or spices. So it is expensive because it wouldn't take long before you went through a bottle if you plan on using it a lot. That being said the perfume is pretty, demure, and soft. It starts of w/ a fresh citrus and to my nose is very heavy w/ mimosa. It is a citrus green floral best worn in spring. Pretty, I may spring for a small 1 ounce next time I'm in ULTA.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Not bad at all. Smells fresh and clean, a good rose perfume but quite forgettable.To me it smells a bit like sage, I don’t really know why.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
This perfume to me smells very similar to See by Chloe.
Other than that, it smells quite natural and fresh, but I have doubts about performance.
Very inoffensive and girly, nothing outstanding.

Instagram: @My_Insta_Fragrances

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Left a review on this a few months ago thought I would give it another chance and no I still don’t like it. It is cloyingly sweet in the same way that I find Carat by Cartier cloyingly sweet there are no similar ingredients but both juices give me the same vibe and it is not good!!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Impression from a paper strip: This is the only fragrance from Chloe I've ever really disliked. I should have known by the note profile, I really don't like neroli and it's quite prominent in this perfume. The green-herby notes combined with the florals and strong citrus give Chloe Naturelle a very vintage quality, which many people may find refreshing in a market dominated by gourmands and fruitchoulis but this scent really isn't for me.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: This is extremely reminiscent of the original See by Chloe, which was my signature scent in college (and which is now discontinued.) Unfortunately this may be the lightest scent I've ever sprayed, from the Chloe brand or otherwise. No depth, no strength, no sillage. Lasts 15 minutes or fewer. Such a shame, because I love the emphasis on natural ingredients and, like I said, was excited to bring my beloved signature scent back to my collection. Pass on this one.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Light refreshing floral citrus . It’s very soft without much projection . Too floral for me

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
I really wanted to like this, I'm still really on the fence with it though.

I'm a HUGE fan of Chloe EdP (and formerly the EdT), I loved the L'eau flankers and its one perfume I always gravitate back to time after time because its clean, its fresh, it works well with my chemistry and it really suits me well, so I got quite excited when I saw that Chloe was releasing this, I was hoping it may be a bit of a nod to the L'eau flankers with some extra fruity facets added to it.
As soon as I knew it was in stores I ventured out to my closest department store to try it, the first sniff from the sprayer was interesting; very strong blackcurrant/blackcurrant bud which read a little bit urine like to my nose but I decided to try it on my skin. The blackcurrant was present and quite strong but thankfully it settled a little bit to make way for the citron and then after 20 minutes the signature powdery/woody Chloe rose comes out and I thought it was quite pleasant, until, however 2 hours in when I noticed this "room freshener/pledge" type note coming from my wrist, (No, I am not a city dweller nor am I detached from nature, I also grow roses) and I have to say it kind of ruined it for me, I could still detect the gorgeousness from the other notes but whatever it is in the composition just didnt work well with my skin and that is such a shame!

I can totally see this working well on other people and I am really jealous of those whos skin really works well with the notes and allows this perfume to really bloom and flourish. I'm yet to be defeated though, I will be trying this again to see if I can get it to work for me because I really really wanted this to work for me like the original and L'eau flankers :(

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
Gives romantic vibes like other Chloe signatures. This is a very fresh scent, green and not sweet, there is blackcurrant buds, not the berries itself (wrong on this page) . I like the combination of mimosa, citron and rose with slight woody hints, like Mediterranean spring in a bottle…actually how odd to introduce this in fall. But I think many will be fans of this. It makes one feel refreshed and in tune with nature..
I like its sharp contrast against all artificial and sweet scents of today, this is like from another era.. so romantic 🍋🥀
(And no, i don’t agree with room-freshener/detergent or softener comparisons - comments usually from city-dwellers who got to detached from countyside and nature). Great sillage b t w, and outlasted the new Miss Dior on my other wrist by faaaaar!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
It Smells like thornes.
Tremendous.
End.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: I can clearly recognize the rose I love so much in the original Chloé EDP. Upon spraying, my nose is hit with a sharp bitterness that mellows after around 10 minutes. Even though I like the interplay of rose and mimosa in this EDP Naturelle, the whole fragrance is a bit too sharp, bitter and dry for me. I perceive the sillage to be strong, which I also attribute to the sharpness. I suggest to those who love the original EDP and who like drier fragrances to also test this one because they have definitely the same DNA.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: There is something in this that is very sharp sweet and unpleasant, think it is the combination of citron & blackcurrant. Bit like a room freshener tbh

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content:
Being someone that dislikes (some) synthetics, I am always quite happy to try natural perfume as no chance of encountering them. Not sure what 100% natural means here, but it did not scratch me in that way and it smells quite natural.

Definitely a mimosa perfume, at least that’s what I smell more clearly, and the rose is the May kind of rose, fresh and lemony so blends in with the lemon. I really like mimosa, so quite happy with it. It is a soft innocent type of scent but does not disappear in 2 hours- I can still smell where I sprayed this on my arm quite clearly 3-4 hours later. It reminds me a bit of Iris Perle from Les Indemodables. In that one the clary sage gives spark to the mimosa, and here the cassis and lemon do the same. Nice. First impression is I like it.

Edit: I have bought this perfume and have really been enjoying wearing it. My initial impression remains, and I find the longevity good around 8+ hours, but mild projection at my usual 1-2 sprays (for me that’s a positive, but I am aware this may not be the case for everyone). It’s an easy reach.

For reference, the other two Chloes I like are L’Eau de Chloe and Love Chloe, both now discontinued. I don’t really like the Chloe EDP as I now find it too synthetic strong and a bit headache inducing. However I used to own a bottle years ago given to me as a present. I wasn’t into fragrance then and didn’t realise it had caused olfactory fatigue so I maybe used 3-4 sprays at times and was very surprised when my boss very strongly complained about it 2 metres away from me and I couldn’t smell it! Avoidance of olfactory fatigue, that is a nice excuse for owning multiple perfumes to keep in rotation :)

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: I am wearing this right now. It is really peculiar... I sprayed 2x half hour passed and it is almost not noticeable. I am sniffing my hand close and it is barely there... The scent was light, fresh, but it has something "alienish" - i feel like it is not me, it dont belongs here... It is definitely not my type of scent... But i will never mind to feel in on somebody else... But i think the scent will put an invisible barrier amongst us..

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Chloé makes some of my favorite fragrances in the world and that’s why I was so surprised that to me this one just smells like cheap juice and dish soap.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Naturelle Chloé
review_content: Not what I expected! Don't be fooled by the green ribbon, this isn't a fresh fragrance - instead it's quite sweet. Looking at the notes, I imagined a summer neroli surrounded by lemons, with cedar at the base. What I got was far from it - opens with mimosa, comforting and really well done. Citron is detectable from the start, but you can only appreciate it a few minutes in. It's juicy and lemony, complementing the sweetness of mimosa. I get the Chloe DNA in this one, and even though the notes are completely different, I sometimes get whiffs of the original See by Chloe. A pleasant blind buy.

As I am wearing this today on an autumn day I felt the need to share my story on this one. I got this bottle, which is almost empty, just before COVID on sale at Corte Ingles, 40 for 50ml bottle. I never owned any Chloe fragrance, and never bought any after, but this was love at first smell. It's beautiful! Sure not going to say anything that has not already has been said. It makes you feel clean, feminine, classy, calm. Love wearing this at night after shower, but this definitely can be worn just as much with a nice dress for a night out.

I got this together with a bottle of eau Florale. Both are beauties on their own. After wearing it for a few days I discovered how much sought after this is and sadly discontinued, so I called the Cort Ingles, telling them to save the left over bottles as I needed a backup!! So here I am being spare with this beauty and 60% down on my first bottle, but wow I am glad I still have 2 hidden in a corner. I Thought I would sell them one day, but this is something that I cannot do ever!

This is freaking gorgeous. I've had it for a while, yet I keep rediscovering it every fall. Everybody bellow, who called this Fragrance elegant, classy, fit for a princes, proper but not boring... are absolutely right. I have no other words but heartbreakingly beautiful, deep and womanly. I think I could wear this every day, since it's long-lasting, warming and non-demanding. And it makes me feel good. Attractive. Seen. Pampered. Taken care of. This should have been named Womanity instead. Love

Intense is one of the last so called modern fragnances that I like, use and want to stay.
If I must find one word to describe it it's a word elegance. This is epitome of elegancy. It calls for elegant women. No, this is not scent a person can camouflage by "it's modern I am not spirituality elegant but I can wear it." It doesn't work. This is coat that fits born elegance. This scent is in its essence elegant. Smells elegant, allures elegance and it enhances spiritually elegant woman. Imagine Grace Kelly wearing it. It is possible to imagine that. Now try to imagine Natalie Portman wearing this. It doesn't work. That's what this perfume is. It's caractéristique expensive, luxurious, clean, attractive, powdery, irritating, intelligent and decent. This is not sexy or vulgare perfume. This is scent that doesn't wear mini skirts or tennis shoes. It wears long gloves and pearls. In its composition it is mature. I wore Intense when I meet my future husband. He memorised it forever.

Top notes:
Iris, Heliotrope, pink pepper (I can detect it)
Heart Notes:
Hyacinth, Lilac, Wisteria, wood (I can't define, maybe it's artificial)
Base Notes:
Talcum, Peru Balsam, Vanilla, Musk, rice powder (musk gave a bit of a sweaty sensation... So nice).

Looks simple. But the dosage and mixture is controlled. It opens nice. It settles nice. It dries down nice. It's very beautiful perfume. Great quality.

Perfumers
Louise Turner, Nathalie Gracia-Cetto

Bottle is elegant. In whole. With that wonderful chain attached to cover. Simply elegant. Beautiful.

(Warning. If you don't like Heart notes, don't buy this.)
Flanker done right! Speaks the same language as the original edp but with a deeper vibe and the vanilla amped up. Elegant, soft and prim but not boring.

I haven't worn this scent for more than 9 years! But back then, when I discovered this line in the shops and the world was all fruity floral and fruitchouli, I was so smitten, that I bought the regular EdP, its bodylotion and two large bottles of the Intense version - crazy. I stopped wearing it because my three pregnancies caused quite an olfactoric stir... Back than and now my DH thinks it smells like vintage 70tie or 80ties hairspray and I agree with this when it comes to the frist 15 minutes. The beginning is a bit chalky (the Iris?) and - dare I say - suffocating (Heliotrope?). In the regular EdP version I perceive this effect even more pronounced. But after some 15 minutes later it morphes into a beigey, addictive, powdery, floral, makeup-y veil, that is very sexy in an non offensive, je ne sais quoi kind of way. This is, what I imagined Chanel's "Beige" to be.
On my rather dry skin it has moderate lasting power (I applied this morning, 4 hours ago) and I still get whiffs of it, but it is slowly turning into a skin scent. I prefer the Intense version because the Vanilla is amped up here and makes the scent a bit snugglyer and less perfumey than the regular EdP, also definitively suited for colder months. I cannot imagine this version in summer, frankly not even the regular one. Its projection is discrete-moderate (wearing 4 sprays today) and I find it perfect for office too.This Love,Chloé line is a gift from women to women. It is the sort of scent, that women comment and compliment, but I don't see guys being attracted to it, seduced by it or even notice it. It is too restraint for that. But I get compliments from my six year old son ;-)
After wearing it several days in a row I have the following feeling about it: Imagine yourself preparing for a party. Your skin is perfect, the hair shiny and healthy and your dress has a minimalistic cut in an expensive heavy nude silk. You feel so feminine and classy. But then you arrive at the party and there is lots of bright colors, ruffles, drapes, complicated hair-does and red lipsticks. And although beautyful you just don't get noticed. I think this was the problem with Love, Chloé, when it was lunched. It should have been more amplified, more exagerated (like the Narciso Poudrée) to exist next to Mademoiselle and Her. Neither in the commercial nor in the print add the model is really seeking eyecontact with the spectator. So why should we watch her?

I’m down to my last fews sprays of this. Maybe one more wearing. I’m going to MISS THIS SO MUCH. Love, Chloe & Love, Chloe eau Intense were the closest things to signature scents for me from about 2012-2016. Something about these powdery florals that just suited me perfectly. Projection & sillage were moderate too. Such an absolute shame they’re gone. GORGEOUS.

I do love this intense version of Love, but the original (my signature of 5+ years) suits my chemistry and lifestyle better. Though gorgeous, this one smells very formal to my nose, like something you’d wear to a black-tie event, not an everyday/signature scent. It’s the original Chloe but minus the bright opening of neroli + pink pepper, and oomphed up in the base with vanilla and balsam, giving the scent more weight and body, and abit more sweetness and warmth. It’s still powdery, but not as powdery clean or as radiant as the original, rather it’s dense and richer. Monstrous sillage, but in a beautiful way. Very classy, fit for a princess.

Someone long ago mentioned here that it’s reminiscent of Guerlain works. Hmmm…plausible but not entirely. Love Intense fails to make natural its signature Chloe base; to me this still smells synthetic like in Ricci’s Deci Dela: a sharp rose and musk combo. However, the use of royal colored flowers is outstanding, giving it a ruminant feel. I also find it shares the watery quality as with some of Guerlain’s high-browed offerings which despite listing notes of intense nature (vanilla, benzoin etc.), one gets a restrained accord. Both beautiful nonetheless.

Opening is juicy and fruity; I’m wondering why rose isn’t declared as note. Then quickly to the heart of purple florals and vanilla. It leans slightly gourmand and may make one remember violet candies. On to its drydown, a lighthearted vanilla and musk with vestiges of the color purple.

Pleasant and well-rounded.

If violet was a color, it’d be this perfume 💜.
Chloe Love Intense is a powdery floral based scent with prominent notes of Iris, hyacinth and vanilla. The iris makes it powdery and the vanilla, somehow sweet. You’ll love this if you want something classy, inviting and confident.
Because this is good and has been discontinued, it’s being ridiculously overpriced.

Love Chloé Intense is my personal iris beauty.

I have smelled quite a few irises and there are really very beautiful current fragrances and also more vintage, designer and niche ones. But Love Chloé I is my talisman. The mixture of iris, vanilla and lilac are unique.

It is a perfume that does not evolve much in its smell, but it is not boring. It has a masterful sweetness, it's like an icy sweetness, cold and even dark.
I love feeling its beauty emulating a vintage scent but based on a perfect modern Chloé perfume.

I admit that no Chloé is my passion, but this perfume is from another galaxy.
Their bohemian romanticism makes me go crazy, I haven't found anything that is close enough, sometimes they have too much heliotrope and poorly conjugated and instead in this icy work of art everything is measured. And when I say measured I don't mean lazy or bland, it's not simple or cheesy.

Really Love Chloé I needs to be used when you feel within you that true beauty of vintage boudoir perfumes, but they must be the true vintage ones...

If you find it and it fits you, you will be able to enjoy long hours of this beautiful iridescent pearl and you will surely see that they want to hug you... because it is a fragrance of hugs, kisses, tenderness...
It is one of the few perfumes that make me feel really hyper feminine

Amazing purple flower dream of a perfume, I have both the Love, Chloe EDP and Love, Chloe Intense versions. Both are lovely in their own right and in different weather. Intense seems to cover a slightly wider temperature range for me. Sad that this beauty has been discontinued, really happy I bought a backup when I originally got this.

This forms a wonderful powdery purple cloud around me, it feels softer and more comforting that the EDP. The vanilla doesn't seem to be as pronounced on me as it seems to be with others but is probably what provides the softness and gentler touch.

I agree with @perfumesniffer below that @henri345que has done an amazing review <3

I have a sample.

---

Powdery floral, fluffy and delicate like a feather. Feels like a caress, or like someone you trust and care fluffying up your hair.

I wore Love, Chloe edp as my signature for about 4-5 years. That stuff was AMAZING. Like, literally perfect. I was late to finding out about the Intense version and have only had 1 bottle. The Intense version is all the perfect fluffy sophistication of the original except with a more dense quality and a big dollop of vanilla in the dry down. The Intense is not gourmand, it just hints at the edges of that territory. I can honestly say that Love, Chloe edp and Love, Chloe Intense are the best mainstream releases of the 2010s, hands down. I would describe them as if Guerlainade was recreated for a mainstream brand. Very retro inspired, but cheeky, playful modern scents for adult women. The Intense is a bit more sexy. I’m nearing the end of my bottle and starting to eye the $250 bottles on eBay. A ridiculous travesty that these were discontinued. 10/10 Sublime

@henri345que below has written a perfect review 👌🏻

Just purchased a decant sample on Ebay of Love Chloe Intense & Love Chloe Florale. I love both however Love Chloe EDP will be my forever fave.

It smells like they isolated the powdery fluffy part of the original. Sprayed on my left hand it was so strong and my right hand very subtle skin scent. On my clothes wow it's a whole new scent! It's beautiful.

The whole Bottle is going for around $200 so my little sample is perfect. I want to wear a sweater and smell like this puffy cloud in the winter. So if you want Love Chloe without the Orange Blossom and Pepper this is for you.

It smells extremely intense in the first 30 mins of wear to the point where I cannot tolerate it at times. But the dry down is absolutely gorgeous and so powdery. I never spray it directly on myself, I would spray it in my closet or on my clothes an hour before wearing them. The lasting power is really good, I get almost 7 to 8 hours.

It literally smells like wearing you favourite cashmere jumper. After 30 min I get a subtly soapy, deep iris, heliotrophe, hyacint, vanilla as well as some very round and soft woodsy and balsamic notes. Also recall smelling something almondy or nutty after another 30 minutes. There's some nostalgia vibes going on with this one. It makes me think of a European city on a late summer afternoon, brick and concrete warm from the sunlight, and a flowershop about to close for the day.
Chloé Love Eau Intense It's richer, more mature, and longer-lasting than Chloé Love in my opinion. I have had both versions but I prefer that one over the other.

I got it from ebay. Very expensive this days. It is powdery, flowery, sweet. I don't regret buying it but wont buy it again. There are other scents with similar floweriness, it just reminds me of volupte by Oscar de la Renta, which is easy to find and very unexpensive, not the same scent by any means, but a very similar vibe, similar flowery/intense olfactory experience.

I bought this about 2 years ago reasonably priced on the grey market and stored it away, only discovering it last night as I sift through my collection to list items for sale.
I decided to open and having tested it I chose to keep this one. It’s very intense in a sweet but not cloying way. I am not being overwhelmed by violets or purple flowers, and I am pretty sure this is very similar to Angel’s Dust by Francesca Bianchi.
I can see Chloe Love and Chloe Love intense are both now ridiculously priced on eBay as they’ve been discontinued. If you love this and must have it without the stupid price tag, try to get a sample of Angel’s Dust and see if it satisfies your obsession. Angel dust is also offered as extrait so you’re going to get more bang for your buck.
My opinion only, hope it is helpful.

Wow, I can't believe this is going for so much these days! I found my bottle at a discounter last summer and snatched it up! It was a blind buy. I spritzed it 3 times on myself and almost immediately began to regret it. There's something a little too sharp that was poking through and making me feel nauseated. I decided to try it again today with just ONE spray (since I was just wanting to re-test) and I'm happy to report that I like it much better. This is really a powdery explosion of purple flowers, just like in the pyramid. I love iris and heliotrope, but I'm not as familiar with how the other flowers are supposed to smell. The vanilla really saves this, and I'm thinking that if I'm actually going to wear this, I need to layer on another vanilla just to keep it more balanced. Overall, this is a pretty makeup-y smell. If it had some oud it would be stellar. I may try layering on some Nemat Arabian Wood oil to see if it transforms it.

I usually have decent luck with "blind buys", not this time! I remember testing the original Love Chloe years ago and really liking it. After reading reviews for this one and the original I was second guessing which one I'd tested and liked and guessed that it must have been the "Intense" version. Unfortunately it wasn't and I hate this one so much that I had to come home and change my clothes because I couldn't take it one minute longer. There are only a few other fragrances that I feel this way about - Amarige, Cabotine, Eternity and White Linen. Amarige always makes me feel slightly queasy and this one did the same and besides musk they don't seem to share other notes so I'm not sure what it is but I will be getting rid of this asap as I can't risk my daughter taking a liking to it!

LOVE this perfume! I feel like "me" when I wear it. I love the original Love Chloe (as well as the eau florale)but there is something special about the Intense version. It's richer, more mature, and so incredibly beautiful. It's got the makeup powder note that I adore, plus a beautifully blended iris and vanilla...it's just bliss. Longevity is great and the bottle is one of my very favorites.

what a magical perfume. i had been so curious about the original "love, chloe" after katie puckrick described it as such a unique designer offering. i see why, now - purple flower fragrances aren't so common these days, although this one is astonishingly beautiful.

when i first sprayed this on, it took me back to summers in bangladesh. after a shower, quickly getting dressed in someone else's bedroom, hoping no one wandered in because the doors always had pants hanging over the top and thus wouldn't close all the way. then furtively grabbing someone else's powder bottle, trying to shake some down your top, but nothing comes out. shake the bottle, tap it again, and whoosh now you're covered in powder, your whole neck and dress are dusty white but you almost don't care because of the scent...the cloud of fresh sweetness that coats your skin in flour, separating you from your slightly damp clothing. you already feel like a lady. you can hear all the traffic and sellers outside beneath the balcony and you are upstairs, your hair poorly wrapped in a towel, your clothes a speckled mess, but in your vision a queen because you smell and feel like one. you don't need perfume, deodorant, anything with this powder - it smells beautiful and fresh all over. "love, chloe eau intense" reminds me of that powder.

this beautiful iris vanilla fragrance is golden in quality, classy enough to make you feel a true lady even in pajamas (my current state.) there is a bitterness here, in the back of the throat when you inhale that keeps it earthy, like powder molecules scratching your airways. is heliotrope bitter? maybe that's what i'm smelling.

this is a warm iris fragrance, not a cold one. a shimmering lavender gold fabric, flashing royal purple in the light. i dabbed this on from the last of my sample, and it feels like this perfume was meant to be applied that way - the peru balsam gives it a vintage, heavy feel.

it's a crying shame this was discontinued. how i wish more women smelled like this...warm, inviting, but also aloof, not like a cake to eat...

This is amazingly beautiful scent. Indeed, Love Intense is like the softest, the most luxurious cashmere sweater. It's super, super elegant and classy. This is the scent of confident, caring, warm and gentle woman. Perfect for fall and winter season.

Chloe Love Intense is really powdery,you can definitely smell heliotrope and iris, with a hint of luxurious, melted pralines and chocolate. It's sweeter than the first Chloe Love and I like it more than her older sister.

It was a blind buy for me. Unfortunately it turns out, that on my skin it was not what I expected. On my skin Love Intense smells too powdery and too sharp. I can't smell those yummy chocolate pralines, nothing sweet on me. I didn't feel good in these one, so I gave it to my mum and on her skin it smells A-MAZ-ING. Pure magic.

It is really sad, that Love sisters was discontinued.

It is like my favorite cashmere sweater - soft, gentle, timeless, feminine.
I love the nuttiness of the heliotrope and here it is in its best company of the other lilac and gentle flowers. I keep as a treasure the last 5th ml. that remained in the bottle.

If I have to choose between this and the original I would go with this!!
Both are quite similar, but this intense version has a nice twist which makes it superior, and then is indeed stronger, very nice for the winter, I found it by chance in a shop and it was the last bottle and immediately I decided to buy it!

luxury and wonderful powdery scent, definitely classic and mature scent, i love it very much, great for evening and night scent, also perfect for rainy day, i made a blind purchase but I never regret to have it, now a day, it's not easy to get the intense version, only selected store carry out the intense version but still easy to get the original one's

Winter beauty.Iris so powdery and delicate on a vanilla cloud, makes you smile during some snowy mornings, like you sit on the sofa in a fluffy sweater and warm socks holding a cappuccino cup.Heliotrope gives some elegance and sensitivity, underlines an inner rather than outer beauty of a person wearing it.All is silent and white with silver and violet tones.We don`t need to speak up.Love Intense -as there is nothing intense in it-is an oriental perfume with some depth.Musky tones with violet flowers including the most difficult note of lilac embrace you like friendly arms do.It`a scent of missing our closest, for waiting,for some conversations we might have had but which for some reason never happened.
Quite different from other,rosey Chloe products Love Intense is a long-lasting scent, especially natural fabrics hold it for days.Not a skin scent with average sillage. For winter time rather as it looses part of its beauty in a hot weather
Could we compare it with any perfumes?More expensive- Eau L`Hiver (Frederic Malle) and Lilac Love (Amouage ).A cheaper one - Nivea EDT

I am a big lover of Love EDP. But the first thing that comes to mind with this one is: winter. The powdery notes are definitely (!!!) more accentuated, and the woody ones are subtle to smell. I think this one is more appropriate for winterly usage, at night, because its sillage is very heavy. Some people might get nauseated, I'ver heard. But I would never trade my Love EDP for this one, I have it, and I use it for specific occasions during winter..to me it matches with a fireplace, red wine, friends... people that appreciate the powdery notes of the first one will definitely enjoy this-if they can find one. Sad that this line was discontinued.

I truly know which note, combination of notes, or WHAT makes me react in a way that NO OTHER fragrance ever has. It makes me feel nauseous! When I was around my mother wearing this, I could not stand to be down wind of her or basically just being near her! There is something sharp and synthetic, I guess, about this fragrance that my nose detests. I have tried it in different seasons to no avail. Again, I can't keep from shaking my head because it makes NO SENSE to me whatsoever.

sladšia sestra Chloe love
sweeter sister of Chloe Love

Love Intense is quite an intriguing creation. The original Love is one of the better designer scents released the past decade. An effervescent and easy going fragrance, composed of purple flowers and an elegant, powdery backbone. It is quite a shame that, along with its flankers, Love is discontinued. Even though I like the original a lot and would actually wear it, despite it's uber feminine status; it's the equivalent of wearing a hyacinth mascot costume which shouts "Look at me!', simply because of it's nuclear longevity and sillage - it's too much for me personally.
I'd rather much wear the Intense flanker. It dials down on the sillage and soapy flowers, and replaces them with vanilla, tolu balsam and musk.
The opening actually reminds me of Licor 43; I guess it's the iris and heliotrope combined with the vanilla. It's powdery, floral but also balsamic - it also has a nutty, almondy feeling, provided by the heliotrope. The vanilla in Intense is more of the vanilla extract kind, that gooey, brown liquid you would add to your cakes. It's dark, sweet but it also has a bitter facet.
After the booze-like opening fades, a swooning trio of purple flowers shows up, with lilac being the most noticeable. It's not as hyper floral as in the original Love. I can also sense a bit of hyacinth, but the lilac is most prominent to me. It merges beautifully with the opening, balancing floral notes with powdery ones. It is never too sweet or overpowering, though.
The drydown is the best part of the fragrance. The florals start to fade and the musk appears. It gives Intense it's fluffy and clean character, whereas the vanilla and tolu balsam increase the balsamic aspect of Intense. The end result is a powdery floral, resting on a cloud of musk and dark vanilla with leathery aspects.
Longevity is good, around 6-8 hours for me. Sillage is considerably lighter when compared to the original Love (which is a good thing for me). It hovers around me for a good 4 hours, before turning into a skin scent.
Somehow it actually reminds me of Gucci EdP, launched in 2002. It has that same sensual vanilla and floral combination. The Gucci is a lot more subdued, spicy and leathery though. You could consider Intense to be it's more upbeat, daytime sister; being more floral and clean. Love Intense is a really good fragrance, and I'd advise you to pick it up before it completely disappears and prices will skyrocket for this little gem.

Overall this is very nice. If you like the original Love, then you will enjoy this Intense version. It's still purple/flowery just the starchy rice note is replaced by vanilla. The vanilla hits hard in the beginning, and it strikes me a little synthetic/plasticy. Its not a warm creamy vanilla, but a cool distant almost powdery one. It dries down pretty quickly, then it becomes the purple/powdery Love that one would expect. It defiantly has more punch than the original, more of a body, a backbone. Less light and clean, and more flowery and pronounced. Don't be afraid to blind buy this one as its discontinued and prices are reasonable on the secondary market. Once its gone this one might be valuable. It's a quality, well made fragrance. Thumbs way up.

Mi piacciono tanto tutti i Love di Chloè: il classico per la stagione fredda e l'eau florale per la primavera/estate (ma entrambi sono fantastici sempre). Anche questo Love eau intense è speciale, ma per un altro motivo: non amo indossarlo, ma per me rappresenta un piccolo viaggio olfattivo e mi piace ogni tanto farmi spruzzare una mouillette in profumeria e tenermela in borsa per sentire l'evoluzione di questo profumo. Si apre con una forte vaniglia molto femminile, per niente secca ma umida e balsamica, quasi liquorosa. Quindi si assesta su qualcosa che mi riporta a quando ero bambina in spiaggia: un meraviglioso profumo "caldo ma fresco", molto naturale ma ricercato, evidentemente simile a qualche crema abbronzante sentita molti anni fa :)
Poi subentra una fase talcata molto simile al Love classico, ma un po' più aromatica, e infine percepisco una scia che mi ricorda un connubio fra My name di Trussardi e Legni fruttati Erbolario... strano ma vero! Comunque delizioso.

This is a really nice one! I love the original Love, Chloe EDP too and you can tell these are sisters.

I honestly like the opening of Eau Intense better because it lacks the sharp-ish pink pepper and the hyacinth is much more subdued. Then I get all the melange of purple flowers and powder which is what they mostly have in common with Love,Chloe.
