The drydown goes to an entirely different direction though. Still retains some of the powderyness but gets more balmy, creamy/ambery instead of creamy/starchy here.

I like the drydown of this one a bit less than Love, Chloe and if anything it's not as intense despite the name. Still, I enjoy it a lot and wouldn't mind a bottle sometime.

I recently purchased Love, Chloe eau Intense. I own and love other Chloe perfumes such as Chloe Chloe EDP, Chloe l'eau Chloe. Chloe EDP and L'eau Chloe are rose centered. Love, Chloe eau Intense in my opinion is a spicy floral. I wore it today for the first extended period of time and I am happy! I have been looking for a signature and this may be it. I sprayed about 5 healthy sprays total....one on each wrist, behind each ear and one spray on my decollatage. At first to me it seemed a bit over-powering but as I was leaving for work my husband commented twice on how good I smelled. Hmm...that's a good sign. My hubby usually doesn't tell me that unless I have some sickly sweet gourmand like Britney Spears Midnight Fantasy on, which I keep around just for him. I kept getting wafts of this perfume for about 8-9 hours at work. Again, a little overwhelming at first then spicy, almost Big Red gum, in the middle with lovely sweet spice and then dried purple flowers with a hint of sweetness for the dry down. Hopefully I have described it correctly, in my humble opinion anyway. I really like it so far....

I purchased a 1oz bottle in high summer and found it rather too powerful. Six months later, in cold and rainy weather Love Chloe Intense is in its element (s)

It's rich and aristocratic, a bit highbrow and it doesn't know how to have fun; Love Chloe Intense takes itself very seriously, it's uptight and thorough, …..Man, is she Intense. Definitely a hard working lawyer type with winning on her mind. It's a very very good perfume, nicely crafted, I think the materials are the upper end of the commercial scale. That's my opinion.

The cherry pie of heliotrope is strong. I can't wear this perfume early in the day and I certainly wouldn't refresh it in a confined space or a dining area, but if I was in an art gallery, looking at jewellery, at a sophisticated wine bar or better yet, in a convertible, Love Chloe Intense would be part of my projecting persona. Uptown (uptight) Girl.

Longevity and silage are moderate to generous. For lovers of Narciso for Her, Prada Infusion D'Iris Absolu, L'Heure Bleu and even Chanel No 5 EDP.

I bought this blind as I was fairly sure I would like it, being a massive iris fan. Dry, distinctly iris based, powdery, purple flowers and a musky vanilla dry-down. Like Guermantes review, I also immediately picked up the association to L'Heure Bleu - must be the heliotrope that gives the slightly oily, waxy smell at the opening. I'm not a great fan of this part, but it is fleeting and soon dries down to that powdery floral vanilla. The lilac is quite prominent too and I get a similarity to Guerlains Champs Elysees due to this. Very nice - great scent for the office as long as not sprayed too heavily, makes you feel fresh and lovely.

The comparison between Love Chloe and Love Eau Intense Chloe.

I am wearing two testers on my wrists today. They both are lovely, warm, comforting and very feminine. I'd say, Love is a bit greener and Love Intense is a touch sweeter and more intense, as the name suggests. I think I would prefer Love Eau Intense as it has beautiful vanilla in and the heliotrope here is more pronounced. These two notes, I suppose, give the Love Eau Intense some intriguing and retro aura. Retro being said in a very good way, not 'old woman' at all. I would say, Love Eau Intense is better for the evening wear while Love would do for the office.

UPD: Projection is moderate and the longevity is about 2-3 hours on me with Love and about 6 hours with Love Eau Intense, should be staying longer on clothes. Both fragrances are very cosy and warm so should be just great for autumn and winter. To me Love Eau Intense is definitely the winner between the two. Might go for the full bottle

More powdery than I expected but I like this a lot. Powdery iris, sweet vanilla and heliotrope all tied up in a lacy, musky sachet of girliness. Nice longevity, I think the sillage is excellent without being overwhelming. This shows the world the sweet feminine side that comes out in us all every once in a while. It is gracious sweetness in a bottle.

Sillage-8
Longevity-8
Overall Beauty of Scent - 7

I agree with all the reviews, that say it's lighter than the original. I like it better. It does't have that weird undertone, I disliked in the original. I like how many hours later is smells so luxurious and balsamic. Top notes are a little too much for me, but I still think that this fragrance is worth trying.

Huh, I'd actually call this a "L'eau" vs. an "intense"!

As a huuuuuuuge fan of the original Love, Chloe, I was disappointed in the Intense. It sounded like it would be close to my dream fragrance, buuuut, not so much, it turns out.

Love Intense begins with a minty, powdery, chemical-feeling vanilla. You can smell the original Love in the background ever so slightly, but it has this veil of weird vanilla over the top of it.

It's certainly not as strong with my chemistry as everyone is claiming, either! I have to really press my nose to my skin to get a good sniff.

So on all fronts, this version is a no-go for me :(.

Ι would't say this one is more intense. It is certainly more powdery and has more vanilla, whereas the original to my nose is more floral and the pepper is really pronounced. But, to me, the original love has more sillage and longevity. Those WHO love the original, will love this one too, but if you are looking for a more robust , nigh time , wintery version, I don' think this is the one. I like to combine the two of them, for the longevity and the powderness. Love intense is very alike to chanel nr5, a modern version of it. A really pleasure, both of them, I use them in summer and spring, I like my perfumes to be more intense in the winter. Love it is , then...
one of the best for morning out .. I mix it with love from chloe too .. its a perfect combination

It's funny that despite Chloe Love Intense's scent pyramid this really does not register as either purple or floral to me at all.

Instead it feels like I'm sipping a very warm vanilla liquour served next to a lady who is powdering her entire body. This lady might have spritzed on some Chloe Love in the morning, but the powder and the vanilla aromas surrounding me overwhelm it.

I think this would be a lovely scent during colder weather, fantastic for snuggling up to someone in front of the fire while wearing an ivory cashmir sweater.

Personally, I don't find myself reaching for scents that are this powdery very often, and since I slightly prefer my Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum over Chloe Love Intense I think this one might end up in someone else's wardrobe in the future. Still, though, this is the 'warmest' Chloe perfume I know, and I would not mind being stuck in a small room with someone who wears this :D

Chloé Love Eau Intense preserves the powdery iris in the original Love, Chloé. And it's not necessarily much stronger, but instead, deeper and warmer due to promient vanilla and heliotrope, and even appears a bit milky. It's sweeter, but just slightly. It's cozy and fluffy, and if compared side by side, its warmth makes the original Love, Chloé seem cooler and more mineral, even edgier than how I perceived it before.

This tender warmth provided by vanilla and heliotrope leaves after about 5 hours. And at this moment, the drydowns of Eau Intense and Love, Chloé don't seem to differ a lot. However, after about 6 hours, a mineral and slightly salty amber kicks in, bringing in another depth and warmth to the drydown.

The sillage of Love Eau Intense is moderate on me, and the longevity is around 10 hours. Although Love Eau Intense is no doubt very powdery, it's not aggressive, and the sweetness of vanilla is also well balanced so that it doesn't get annoying. I highly recommend it to those who are looking for a vanilla floral fragrance and adores powdery texture.
It smells like someone put a little bit of caramel in the original Love. It's sweeter. Does anyone know if it was discontinued? It's hard to find even online.

I was out of the original Love, so I decided to give the Intense a try. I was hoping it would smell exactly like the original (only stronger), but the Intense has a prominent powdery note which out shines the lilac and iris. I might still prefer the original's flowery notes over this one. The Intense is a very nice fragrance by itself, but I think layering the two would be amazing! If you were wondering if you need both the Love Chloe and Love Chloe Eau Intense in your collection, I say go for it!

The original Love is my signature, and this is just glorious. A stronger, sweeter, much more opulent and 'dressier' version, Love Intense smells like bottled gold. Whereas the original has a stylishly clean sort of shampoo-vibe, this one feels more voluptuous and decadent...but they are very similar otherwise. At the core, both are basically the same sophisticated lilac rich floral with a very powdery start, morphing into something clean, feminine, sensuous and balmy. It's very potent so just a few spritzes will do. This is the sort of scent I would wear when I want to feel rich, glamorous, intelligent, sensual and drenched in luxury. I immediately feel like an 'ultimate' version of me, and I can almost hear myself speaking 6 different languages, wearing diamonds, and 20,000 dollar gowns on my perfectly sleek and flawless figure. I would wear it for fancy evening outings, or to an upscale jazz lounge with my littlest LBD and red lips. It wouldn't really smell out of place even if you chose to wear it daily, just as long as you're dressed for it, it needs a good pair of heels, perfect hair and abit of lipstick at the very least...absolutely no track pants, t-shirts or saggy blue jeans, no! This is the scent that lifts my spirits and makes me want to go out there and grab myself a large hunk of life, and do it with every single ounce of style, sophistication, sensuality and wit that I can squeeze out of me. Because of that, I definitely prefer to save Love Intense for special occasions or when I need that emotional boost, it is not an everyday scent for me, that is why the original remains as my signature.

Scent breakdown, from 1st spritz:
30 seconds: Hmm...this smells like something I could fall in love with!
10-20 minutes: Oh no!! it settled down to talcum powder! Nothing but a ton of talcum powder!!! AA-Choo!!!
30-40 minutes: the annoying talcum powder is fading away, and a rich opulent gorgeous feminine scent is emerging...mmmm...
1 hour: Okay this is amazing! I LOVE it. LOVE. Just like the original Love, I'm willing to endure the first 30 minutes of yucky powder to get to this!
3 hours: That same gorgeous scent is still wafting around me, and it's getting abit sweeter, warmer and fuzzier...sooo good....
5 hours: It's still there, not even fading yet :)
7 hours: On my skin the scent is soft by now, but still going strong on fabric.
12 hours: Close to the skin, a soft clean scent...still very detectable on fabric even though it's not leaving a trail like the first 7-8 hours.
update
20 hours: As I was waking up from my sleep, I caught this scent on my wrist, what a beautiful scent to wake up to :) It's still there, soft as an angel's breath, but there.

Tip: The application method that works best for me is 2 to 3 large squirts on fabric (usually the front of my blouse for eg.), and 1 large squirt distributed between both my wrists and neck. If you dislike the 'powdery' start (though it does fade away completely, some days it can be a bother to me), then I suggest you concentrate spraying it on fabric and the back of the neck (just beneath your hair), this is a scent that develops absolutely stunningly on fabric, it cocoons me in its clean, soft golden haze of a scent and leaves the most gorgeous trail.

I just tried it today at the mall. I am impressed with it's longivety. Smell itself is also beautiful, very purple & flowery with a hint of powdery. I disagree that vanilla is dominant note (according to the votes by readers above). It goes along very well with my skin chemistry.

After reading the recent and positive reviews, I sampled this perfume. I was quite disappointed, because of the chemical quality of ingredients I smelt on my skin.

I love very strong perfumes which is normally my signature. However, this perfume smells of heavy alcohol. The amber is very overpowering and rather crass. When I smelt my wrist after 1 spray it was floral. But it had a bitter smell. One ingredient that made me feel sick when I smelt my skin. However, when I walked around the perfume trail was pleasant and lovely with a floral musky smell.

This retro styled perfume has a slightly sharp burnt caramel smell, with a leather and old stale pot pouri favours after 2 hours. Interestingly, I have original retro perfumes which are musky, smooth, elegant, nicely balanced and very long lasting. For example, I have the original Armani perfume made in 1982. But this perfume has a jarring factor on me or perhaps it is a too try hard "look at me" factor when I wear it.

This perfume is too intense, and overdone for me. It is a long lasting perfume, which I sampled the perfume stays close to the skin after 1 hour. But then I lost the impressive perfume trail.

The perfume is extremely overpriced. I like the Chloe Love EDP much better. It is more balsamic, powdery, floral, musky, chic and lasted after 8 hours closely on the skin. The Chloe Love EDP perfume is sublime, delicious and nicely done. Sometimes less is more.

The Intense perfume has a strong alcoholic smell after 5 hours is unpleasant. For me, it was not value for money. It reminds me of a very strong Guilty from Gucci, the original rectangular brown bottle. There is a plastic and chemical smell with this perfume, and is off putting for me, even now. I will not purchase this perfume. I recommend that you will need to first sample this perfume, unless you like strong, musky and alcohol smelling perfumes.

Old perfumed talc you found in the attic is how it smells like. Marginally better than Love, Chloe, but still bitter, powdery and strong. It's a somewhat pleasant smell - it has that charming retro vibe of your grandma's vanity table, but it's very loud even in cold weather, and you fill the room with suffocating powdery bitterness when you wear it. There's no air around you, only that powdery cloud. I quite liked it on, especially after a couple of hours, but it gives my husband a headache. Heliotrope, iris, vanilla & peru balsam dominate the composition. It's long lasting and has a heavy sillage.

I Looooooooove this fragrance!!
Totally divine and a really sexy scent that makes me feel like the ultimate woman :))

It's a warm fragrance with a soft but intense luxury amber note, sweet vanilla/almond and a touch of iris. The powdery note is well balanced with all notes in the perfume, creating a gorgeous iris-vanilla/almond balsamic fragrance. Really long lasting and such a yummy scent.

I'm a big fan of the hole Chloe Love line, but compared to the original Chloe Love this scent is more sophisticated, sexy and intense.... at the same time very modern!! It's a winner :-))

MUST HAVE AT HOME AT ALL TIME!!


Jag äääääälskar doften!
Helt gudomlig, en riktigt sexig doft som får mig att känna sig som den ultimata kvinnan :))

Det är en varm doft med en mjuk men intensiv lyxig ambernot, söt vanilj / mandel och en touch av iris. Den pudriga tonen är väl balanserad med alla delar i parfymen, vilket skapar en underbar iris-vanilla/almond balsamic doft. Sitter hela dagen och doftar gudomligt!!
 
Jag är ett stort fan av hela Chloe Love serien, men jämfört med den orginalet Chloe Love doftar denna mer sofistikerad, sexigt och intensivt .... samtidigt väldigt modernt! Detta är en vinnare :)

MÅSTE HA HEMMA HELA TIDEN!

I just got this from my local department store and I am so far loving it!
I was eying on the Chloe line for ages, I was excited to try out the Roses de Chloe but I was massively disappointed as it just smelled like rosewater crabtree & evelyn handcream, starting off with a huge plastic and bitter note on my skin..
I was deciding between the original Chloe/ L'eau Chloe/Love then I suddenly picked up the Eau Intense tester. It just felt very warm and cozy to me (I am unable to pick up any notes by nose and describe them).
I just blindly bought it home without trying it on my skin coz I loved it!
Smells much stronger on skin, starts off like bitter powder and then transfers into a woodsy oriental then dries down to a spicy powdery smell. In my poor description, this perfume smells like dark purple flowers bumped into deep orange wood and sprinkled on top with a dust of old-fashioned face powder. Which is a good thing by the way!
I love it!

Pencil shavings, wax and wood. I'm so sorry that I don't get any flowers from it, I was really hoping for some beautiful powdery iris and fresh lilac, but... Nope, not for me. I'm happy for you guys, who get the sophisticated side of Love Eau Intense.

Chloe Love Eau Intense is the perfect blend of sophistication and sensuality! Considering how much I love the original Love, Chloe I knew I had to get the eau intense version. I am so happy I did because you still get the lovely, soft lilac top notes with a powdery iris undertone. The vanilla note is more prominent which gives the eau intense version a more sensual vibe. Incredibly chic, very classy, and great for evening wear! I absolutely love it!
For powdery scents lovers this is a must have (along with Teint de Neige of course). Gorgeous.

so, i was looking for something classy, something a little more grown up, but still with a little vanilla for my vanilla loving heart :P

i tested out a few scents, on paper and arms, got home, pet my dog and suddenly she stopped cuddling onto my leg and started sniffing my left arm. she has never done that before so i sniffed, to checked what it was and it was the original "Love, Chloe".
Next day i went back to the store to test it again and saw the "Intense" version. The notes said vanilla and i was sold.
It still smells grown up and subtle but still enough vanilla to make me happy :)
Very lovely, warm, deep scent to wear every day :)

I thought it smelled of some balsam and it does. It has a very peculiar scent but reminds me of the older Guerlain scnets, also heavy on balsams and resins. For its peculiar character these days, I find this scent quite interesting. I only wish it were stronger.

Warm
Deep
Powdery
Slightly sweet
Sensual

Longlasting

I love everything about it.
It's such a unique and lovely smell.
I love this perfume on others but unfortunately I can't wear it myself as there is a note which bothers me :(... Tried wearing it a few times but will have to give it away...

There is one note in this that really smell afwul and give me a headache and make me nauseous. And it's a bit masculine, that's not a bad thing, but in this one i don't like it. Very longlasting and good sillage though.

Woodsy, green, subtly dry, vanilla and nutty sweet. It's warm, it's cosy, powdery and perhaps very slightly smoky, also. That's the middle notes. And yes, after a while the smoky veil fades, and amber comes to prominence. I am falling for this perfume.

Update: after a couple of days, I can definitely say that the EDP has great longevity - I can still smell it very well after 12 hours. However, once the powdery, smokier notes have vanished, and the scent turns more towards amber, it then becomes very clean... reminding me a bit freshly washed linen. Maybe a bit too clean for me, girly type of scent - I like it slightly "dirtier" ;)

very ambrish kinda secent
may seem a lil masculine to some ppl

Now when I have it I find the Intense version less overwhelming than EDP. What I wanted to reduce in EDP is sillage which is monsterous and harsh. Intense smells deeper and flows around the skin right from the beggining although I can't say there's no sillage. On the contrary it is translucent but quite persuasive. I'd say to all who wants to choose between EDP and Intense that if you are after the same as me (less into your face scent but with a beautiful translucent sillage) go for Intense.

The Intense version is so much better than the EDP. The EDP is being worn by so many in buses, trams, even by the salesladies. The Intense is not an on your face version, it is just very different from the EDP. Perhaps I like lilac. I am a very confident woman, so perhaps the Intense suits me better.

I love this perfume, a scent is wonderful.
For me this is the true scent of a women elegant, modern, self-assured and powerful own.
When I smell this perfume I can only think of good things.
Is the perfume that I wish more.
With ths perfume women do not even need to wear beautiful clothes, this scent is as good as any women who is using an image conveys se perfect that it does not need any more accessory.
All women should use it.
Just have a problem, this perfume is very expensive in my country but I think it is worth buying.

I remember the first time I smelled it (I had a sample), it disappointed me a little bit: I found that the powdery dust that I loved so much in the classic Love here was a bit "ruined" by a slightly bitter note, annoying to my nose. So I gave the sample away! But now I've just received it in a swapping, and I could easy try it on my skin; so I realized that this note is very pleasant on my skin, and it gives to the entire composition an unusual(by my standards!)and refined touch.
It'is perhaps balsam of Peru note that gives this light leathery effect. And that's why the Chloe fragrance recalled to my mind another scent in which the powdery notes are accompanied with the note of leather: Putain de Palace of Etat Libre d'Orange (although in this case the powdery notes are those of rose and violet, while in Chloe they're given by iris, hyacinth and heliotrope).
I also found this Chloe a little bit similar to Malle Lipstick Rose, for its dust and "cosmetic" creaminess, even if in the Malle fragrance you can distinctly smell the violet rose.
For me, this is an amazing fragrance, but not so more intense than the classic Love.

Although I'm a guy, I have to write about this perfume, because it makes a statement. At first, when I smelled this one, I was not impressed at all, I thought this is the kind of fragrance that tries way too hard. Yesterday I was in a local department store and I decided to take a sniff of all Love Chloe's (the original, EDP Intense, Eau Florale). I sprayed a little on paper cards and EDP Intense was sooo much better this time. What popped into my mind was Christmas, somehow. So I decided to put a little bit on my wrist. At first I thought this has absolutely no sillage. But as time went by I started to smell this lovely fragrance. It smells powdery, clean, soapy, sweet, spicy, warm, unique, gourmand. This sits well on the skin too, and has good longevity. I will of course test this for a while now.
I would give 10 points out of 10 now.

Chloe's Love Eau Intense is perhaps a little too intense for me. I find the regular EDP versions heavy enough, so one step up in terms of projection, usually results in a head spin and a possible headache.

To start with, I'm not a big fan of Love, so this more intense flanker was not something I expected to enjoy. I tested it for the sake of seeing how the intense version compared to the original. Unfortunately they smell almost identical.

The opening of Love Eau Intense is quite a strong, powdery and soapy blend of lilac, iris and hyacinth. The blend itself is actually quite beautiful, but it's the strength of the opening that makes it a horrible experience for me. It's just way too strong. Every time I smell Love Eau Intense, my sensitive nose burns with the strength of it.

This is one of those fragrances that you have to be really careful with. If over applied it will easily become offensive, almost causing everyone, (including the wearer), to asphyxiate. It's also a good idea to let this fragrance dry on the skin before leaving the house.

The only part of Love Eau Intense that I liked, was the drydown. Thankfully the scent does become increasingly softer the longer it stays on the skin. The base notes are quite smooth and balanced, with a hint of iris, musk and vanilla.

Love Eau Intense is a rather warm and elegant fragrance when worn sparingly. Due to its 'out of this world' sillage and lasting strength, I would most likely choose to wear Love Eau Intense as a night-time only fragrance.

Don’t quite know what to think of it. There’s part of me that really likes the scent, the seriousness and floral side of it. And there’s also a part of me that gets pushed away whenever I sniff it for too long. It’s tempting but dangerous – seems warm and feminine, but if you’re too close it’s cloying, dry, woody, peppery, balmy. Makes me wonder is this fragrance really meant for the Chloe-girl kind of girl - younger, fashionable, flexible, easygoing, casual personalities?

Anyways. I’m discovering (slowly and painfully) that one of my biggest “turn-offs” could be iris.

The original Love, Chloé with it's retro Elnett hairspray accord was cute enough.
This intense version is very good. The warmer base makes it richer and more expensive smelling. Plus Chloé signature clean musk fabric softener makes it easy to wear. The almondy heliotrope note gives it a modern day Après L'Ondée vibe.

Many fragrance launches nowadays don't get enough cash for the juice. This is why so many smell of shampoo or deodorant. Chloé is the only brand that succeeds to wow me with cheaper than cheap formulas.
Amazing scent! Kind of mystery.. cannot help thinking about that I am like a quin when I'm in it. One of my favorite ones. So much lilac! I really love it! <3

I Love this one! Not a fan of the original Chloe Love...but pleasantly surprised and intrigued by this gorgeous addition to the chloe range. Reminds me slightly of the Estee Lauder Private Collection 'Amber & Ylang Ylang'..just a little more intriguing.
Will be purchasing this one :)
I love this fragrance. It is a little heady at the begining but settles beautifully and stays on, The florals are dominent in this one but are balanced nicely to a powdery musky feel.

This gives me a terrible headache and makes me feel dizzy. I sprayed it on my wrist to try it on my skin and it reminded me of Nonchalance, my grandmother's perfume. This on is very oriental, strong, longlasting and just unpleasant to me. I tried to get rid of it but i can still smell it on my arm. Use with caution!
I'm a romantical 17 years old and I love, really love this fragance. But I don't know if it's so ''adult wear'' for me... But I think that I'm gonna buy it,... what do you think?

Superelegant, Wow - I feel like a really rich girl. sober, soft and tender but yet intensive. Wonderful hint of powder. Iris, Musk and Vanilla stands out on my skin. Great scent - wonderful parfum. 10 / 10

Superelegant doft. Wow, jag känner mig flärdig och rik. Sober, mjuk och behaglig men ändå intensiv. Aningens pudrig. Iris, Musk och Vanilj är det jag känner mest på min hud. Underbar parfym. 10 / 10 .

i could not decide between the chloe love and this one in the end i choose this since it was the stronger version and to be honest i made a mistake buying it its not my fave its to strong for me i recommended for someone who likes strong scents but the quality is great it stays on forever....

This is the typical perfume that has made its way into my heart. I got a sample of it in my perfume shop and decided to try. Wearing it the first day, just after spritzing it on I thought it was "nice", but not soooo special. Then the flowers came out, one after the other, and I thought "waaaaaay too much", I am not usually a fan of these big florals and I thought of it being a very sophisticated perfume, something a little bit "old-lady perfume", nothing for teens and twenty-somethings... rather for the elegant ladies over 40.

But then came the drydown, and I fell in love. This soft, powdery vanilla! Just the way I love it! Soooo great! I truly couldn't stop sniffing my wrist - and the best thing is that it lasts almost forever.

Since I discovered the wonders of the drydown, I must say I like the top and middle notes better. And, I must admit, it is also time for me to grow up - with an "adult" perfume, he he! ;)

This is-without a doubt-a special scent. Sophisticated, warm and feminine, it has the power to charm and fascinate. Delicate and elegant, it is suitable for day and night.

However,I suppose there are people that find that perfume heavy or untolerable, since it is not light or soft. It definetely depends on each one's taste and personality but I firmly believe that you should try it on your skin first and decide the next day.

Therefore it is not a safe choice but it is a lovely one, if this perfume is proved to be good on you.

eau de intense is definitely attractive, more deeper, more sensual. you still have the old notes in there but this one has more to it, more classy, more assertive. the regular one is very ladylike, this one is the lady & sex bomb (together) to the hard core, and way more appropriate for a night wear as well.
I can to smell lilacs very much and very podwery,I don´t like it,I´m remeber to old ladies, I´m sorry :-(

I love both the original Love and the Intense, in fact since tomorrow is a discount day I am thinking of buying both. Love is one of the most beautiful, intensely feminine, sophisticated fragrances, complicated and spicey enough, very unique and defining with great sillage. Though the Intense is very similar, a few notes have been toned down and others were added making it passionate as well. What a gorgeous scent for an evening occasion, a date or any occasion you want to feel like a woman and exceptionally beautiful and seductive. Both are making it to my faves. Cannot decide between the two which is why I am thinking of getting a small bottle of both.
I absolutely love this one. The smell of vanilla is gorgeous. It is very long lasting, spray once or twice in the morning and it lasts all day.

I love the smell of Love, Chloe but unfortunately it turns disgusting on me. This one turns much more spicy and smells very reminiscent of leather (which isn't one of the notes listed but it really does) but I like it. On the blotter it was just a deeper richer fragrance then the original. It smells strangely masculine on me so I'd probably layer something a little more floral or sweet to make it a bit more feminine.

Today I almost bought a bottle of Chloe Love Intense blindly, but fortunately in the last minute the seller found the tester and I could test it on my skin.

Hmm..I have to say on paper this essence is a really stronger and much intense than the original Love -(which I love), but neighter I nor the seller wasn't able to make difference between the two fragrances on my skin. :)(Love Intense was less powdery and more soapy on paper, on me exactly the same as original Love)My chemistry is playing with me again.:)

So I remain of the original Love.:)

I am sorry to sound so out of tune among positive reviews, but I find this scent so vulgar that almost makes me sick. It's aggressive in an unpleasant way on my skin and this is odd as I can wear Opium and my skin chemistry turns it in a soft spicy scent. There must be some ingredient in Chloé Love Intense that goes the wrong direction on me. I would not certainly recommend a blind buy.
This version is just as beautiful as the original! Stunning. This Love Chloe franchise has made an outstanding start! Unique and lovely fragrance.

This is a very nice surprise! The original Chloe Love is a powdery, vintage 70's scent - it achieves the brief very well without being "old lady-ish" and is more then pleasant. But Eau Intense is a notch above it: in the opening notes, I get leather, which I love - I guess it is the iris. I could not check how the notes developped as I tested this fragrance on a strip of paper. I found the strip in my handbag 2 days ago, and the drydown is still very strong (made my bag smell beautiful). I get spicy vanilla, with just a hint of flowers, which stops it from being sickly. This drydown is a warm skin scent, and I think I will invest in a bottle for the winter as my boss is currently wearing my signature Coco Mademoiselle. And the added bonus is that the bottle is very handbag friendly!

Comparing to the regular Love the scent has changed drastically. The old-fashioned powder now doesn't prevail, but whispers and makes a lovely balance with the other part of the fragrance. The base of Eau Intense is gorgeous being vanilla balsamic. I don't know to explain but Eau Intense creates the impression of wealth. It doesn't smell like alcoholic drinks but can be compared to an expensive cognac.

I like Eau Intense much more than the regular Love, it is more modern and sexy. However I think some of Love fans will not accept the new version.

Ibought today YSL, Cinema and I received a sample of the wonderful perfume Chloe, Love Intense. And I loooooove Chloe. On me it smells a little like cognac:)
I don't know why, but every time I purchase a perfume, I get a sample that I love even more.
XOXO

I smell lot of warm, intensive, luxury amber in it, nice sweet vanilla and a bit almond. Really long lasting, loud yummy parfum. Not for very young ladys (under 20). This is the only one Chloe, I would buy it, if not so expensive (30 ml/56 €). They are a lot of very good long lasting parfums from a very old parfumery houses out there and for a reasonable prices. Love it, but definitely not for this price. Perfect for the fall and winter. It reminds me a bit of Van Cleef & Arpels Van Cleef, even if that one is a bit less sweet. The flacon is adorable.
very strong prominent tuberose with a vintage smell. not my favorite.

I am so very excited, Jomashop has the 5.0 oz for $106 and I had to buy one blindly. LOVE the original Lagerfeld Chloe! I have many many vintage Chloes to compare.

OK- the review. Fresh from shipping yesterday.
It's not Chloe. The nozzle sniff wasn't Chloe, the sprays down my shirt had a HINT of Chloe-- like I said "Oh there she is" but no. It wasn't her. This is not buttery or mossy prob from modern notes. This is sheer and soapy- actually elegant and wedding like for 2025. It's VERY nice, but the tuberose is not the star and it's not Lagerfeld Chloe.
No regrets. I have a huge stash of BethCo Chloe- and this is very lovely.
If I crave Chloe, I can wear this to work- it's very 2025 friendly. It's also sheer, light sillage, and only lasted about 4-5 hours.

Testing my sample; smoky florals cloaked in rich spices, tuberose is the focus.
Quite strong on the skin, very noticeable if someone is within arms' length.
Can be worn all year round.

Opens quit strong, almost smokey spicy. Thankfully for me, that fades into a sweet, deep, slightly soapy tuberose. I have to be very careful with grounding notes, but this is well blended enough that nothing particularly jumps out to make me sick. Someone mentioned amber and another aldehydes, things that I definitely notice and hate in high quantities.
It’s really interesting because while it’s a strong floral when I put my nose right up to it, it’s almost intense, but the silage is very close to the skin. Like other Chloes I've tried, it is very clean smelling, and I expect it to linger linearly for a few hours before fading altogether.

I understand those who categorize this as more mature because it takes influence from the vintage version(?), but I think it’s perfectly wearable and not grandma coded or anything.
Very appropriate name. Smells like what I would imagine a tuberose-centered perfume in 1974 smelled like. For vintage lovers.

Luckily, I have some of the original in mini form. It was a big favorite of mine in the early 80s, and if you are a white floral and amber lover, then you would have loved it, too.
If this is anything like that, then I really suggest you sample it because the OG was so lovely. As for me, there is no way I am going to purchase a bottle of a perfume I once loved that is bound to be different due to regulatory changes and costs an exorbitant amount of money when I still have the old stuff available. However, if I can get my hands on a decant or sample, I'm willing to give it a go just to see how it compares!

I’ve tried many Chloe perfumes over the years and so far have only liked one.

I’ve been wearing this for hours now and I just can’t stand it anymore. This beginning was nice, and that’s it. This is screechy and “high pitched” to me. So few perfumes annoy me and make me kinda angry but this is one of them. It’s got a nose burning quality to it. I think I’m done with the Chloe brand because I really love tuberose and thought I would love this.

I just tested this on a paper tester in a Chloe perfume masterclass, where they told us that this is the same formula that Karl Lagerfeld used in 1975, just with the ingredients updated to the ones which are available today in the market.
On a paper tester, this is a beautiful tuberose - if you like tuberose, give this one a try.

This floral fragrance is a glorious nod to the original amber-colored Chloé perfume by Karl Lagerfeld, launched in 1975. The 1974 in the name honors the year the Chloé brand itself was founded. The tuberose in the name could be misleading to some, as it is so well blended that the tuberose is not front and center. (This smells nothing like EL Private Collection Tuberose Gardenia.) If you loved the original Chloé (which you could buy at Nordstrom Rack 10 years ago for $30), you will be happy to learn that you can get it again at over 10 times the price. Regardless, this one is a throwback masterpiece to the days when perfumes were so masterfully blended, first and last sniff of the wrist smelled exactly the same. Flowers and aldehydes and sandalwood, oh my! This one is DIVINE.

Absolutely gorgeous, stunning, a must try for tuberose lovers. I’ve tried a lot of tuberose fragrances. I’d say this one is closest to something in the Gucci Bloom line. However, Gucci Bloom is a cheap synthetic drugstore knockoff with no actual tuberose compared to this perfume. I was very disappointed by Bloom and mostly got an overly blended synthetic airy lily scented powder, never any actual real flower scents. It never projected on me and vanished in under 2hrs. I can really smell the tuberose in Chloe Tuberosa. It’s tuberose, lightly softened by a lily-esque flower. Reads to me like actual flowers, not a sweetened powder. Smells very expensive. Not sharp or aquatic. Projects well and lasts a long time. I’d also recommend this as an alternative to fans of the Lys 41 type of tuberose scents. I never tried the TF tuberose but it’s on my test list. I know some reviewers here tend to think tuberose is old fashioned or too mature, but this is youthful, innocent, beautiful. Represents the brand very well. This is definitely going on my wish list. This has a classic timeless elegance. The ingredients are quality and it shows.

I’d recommend it over Bloom 1000000%.

Tuberosa 1974 on its own isn't really to my liking. It's a beautiful scent, but it just doesn't resonate with me.

HOWEVER, when I decided to layer it with Papyrus... OH MY, the result is an incredibly delightful, beautiful, elegant, sexy, and mature aroma that simply captivates.

This line of fragrances is meant to be used in combination with others, and I've particularly fallen in love with Papyrus. Yet, I felt it needed the company of a stronger scent, prompting me to pair it with Tuberosa, and the outcome is sensational. I ended up purchasing both, especially because there was a special promotion offering a free 50ml bottle of Papyrus when buying the 150ml Tuberosa.
Very strong spicy and nostalgic, 80's style White floral bouquet. I think it is more close to Ylang-ylang, not Tuberose

This is absolutely twins of Tom Ford Tubereuse Nue.
You can buy this for saving more money.
This is great!

This one is deffinitely better than the original Cedrus, it doesn't have that strong pine toilet refreshener scent, it is much milder.
Despite the "intense" it us also much weaker, I litterary can't smell anything after 15minutes. The performance is too weak to compromise the price tag.

By chance my hand reached for this perfume. I sprayed it on a blotter, smelled it and was stunned, absolutely incredible, like something from another world. I thought, why not, and applied it on my skin, hair and clothes.

You can definitely feel an oriental vibe. I live in an Eastern country, and I suppose the sandalwood revealed itself straight away. On the skin, the opening was very refined, and it reminded me of the scent of luxury hotel skincare products. The original version gave me the same association, which is why I didn’t apply it to my skin back then.

After a while, the fragrance settled and became a bit flatter, but still pleasant. Unfortunately, the final note ruined it for me. Once again I realised that I simply can’t stand anything with amber in it. It always cuts through my nose and smells somewhat cheap to me.

Of course, it’s all subjective. The opening is stunning. I still recommend testing it, as the first impression turned out to be misleading in my case. Now I’m sitting in a not-so-pleasant ambery cloud.

I own LV Fleur du Désert and Cedrus Intense, and to me they smell absolutely nothing alike. Not even remotely close to my nose.

Cedrus is my favorite scent in my collection but Cedrus Intense has a note in it (I think it's the sandalwood note) that sometimes makes my stomach turn. That chemical sandalwood note is also found in Impadia and Guidance 46. I much prefer the original which is much brighter, cleaner smelling and more effervescent.
This perfume reminds me to Fleurs Desert by LV but in economic way. The leather scent lasts well on my wrist. If u in the mood of bold and rebel, this perfume suits well!

Cedrus Intense has a sharp citurssy opening that is too akin to cleaning products for my liking. Thankfully, this soon subsides and gives way to a creamy aromatic woodsy base. This smells spa-like and zen, and reminiscent of the natural world. It is pleasant and unobtrusive and appropriate for most work environments. It just doesn't much feel like 'me.'

This is very nice. I can understand why some use Guidance as a reference but thank goodness, it isn’t a dupe. Guidance OG and I do not get along. Tho there aren’t any sweet notes, I find this to have a tiny bit of sweetness. This is a spa like fragrance. It’s Likable and inoffensive but if
you don’t like woody/green, you may want to sample first

Cedrus is a very nice fragrance, Cedrus Intense is signature worthy. From the moment I sprayed it on I could tell it has a lot more depth than the original Cedrus. It's warmer, woodier and more complex, a little greener and wetter, not nearly as airy and dry as the original. It's more fun. It also lasts a lot longer and projects more strongly. The long term dry-down is very coniferous. I can't sense any leather in this but the sandalwood is a lot more pronounced and there are very clear amber notes. It's still a wonderful, relatively fresh and clean office fragrance, but should not be oversprayed since I can see it giving some people headaches.

I didn't even spray it on my clothes but a day later the smell can still be clearly felt from the tshirt I wore.
btw this has the craziest silage in the Atelier de fluers collection... I can smell my fd 6 feet away

So I think between the two... Cedrus vs intense... I prefer the intense. This is really enjoyable and obvious woody scent. The other cedrus is brighter, slightly sparkly, powdery, a pinch of soapiness just like most other Chloe's in this line... and a little more fleeting. This one however is more bold, definitely more woody, just smoother and has more depth. I can actually pick up the cardamom and rose(!!) in this (which isn't listed on fragrantica) and it's absolutely stunning. Will need to test it a couple more times before deciding if it's full bottle worthy.
Awful Bisch synthetics, aroma is also bad. How this can have 4.10 is out of my understanding.

Also, on what planet does this smell anything like Guidance???

EDIT ***ok ok a few hours later in the dry down I do get it, though I would say it reminds me more of Guidance 46. Very creamy sweet amber sandalwood base. As much as I love OG Guidance this comparison is ruining Cedrus Intense for me so will need to test longer before jumping on that FB. I hate Impadia and that kind of ruined 46 for me a bit as that sickly sweetness is comparable and I find it nauseating.

Anyway, Cedrus Intense does not start as it means to go on. The opening and the dry down are quite different. This has been a wild ride.

Wow, not at all what I was expecting and I love it! I saw woods and QB and thought it would be in the realm of Ganymeade but it's not. Something in the bright opening made me instantly think of childhood summers and southern hemisphere summer Christmas. Instant love. Getting a full bottle!

So I LOVE the OG Cedrus.. but unfortunately it lasted maybe an hour on my skin and projection was super weak. But this! The intense.. it’s not as fresh as the OG but it’s sexier! I don’t smell the bergamot.. but I do pick up on rose slightly it goes really well with the leather. You get the same woody vibes in intense as you do in the OG. Over all I sold my OG and bought this and I am loving it! Lastly I find it to be a more suitable fragrance for cooler temperatures. I find if it’s hot out it tends to remind me of musky BO. So it’ll be in my cool temp rotation!
This, unfortunately, smells like a wet dog on me.

Very oriental sandalwoody.
Nothing like the original which is fresh cool spices on crisp cedars ..
This is little spice on warm ambers and big dose of sandalwood shifting the entire profile from fresh neat office friendly to autumn scent ..

I like it a lot and I would definitely prefer this one over the original version. But I have to admit that it smells quite similar to all other recent releases by Quentin Bisch: beautiful clean and slightly spicy woods with radiant earthy (sort of ethereal) sillage 😈

I have never liked woody, spicy, smokey scents but this has really blown my mind. It's not gormaund yet it's somehow delicious and I can't get enough of it.
Its warm, spicy, woody, mature, slightly green. It makes me think of sitting by a crackling campfire with the feeling of the burn when drinking strong whiskey. None of it an appealing image to me yet somehow it still works.


Edit: the longevity is insane i can still smell it after 24hrs
Woody, green, fresh, spicy, clean, rosy, geranium, a little spicy. A little bit different from the typical Chloe fragrances, but still very feminine, pleasant, fresh.

I have the original Cedrus (obsessed, wear it often) and I wanted to try this after seeing it at an airport. It's stunning. It reminds me of Santal 33. This lasts forever and honestly I don't really think it smells that much like the original (light, citrusy, mineral-y, clean); I get woods, amber, vetiver and leather most of all in this. It would absolutely deserve a place in my collection but I've already planned on purchasing Orpheon by Diptyque (I'm a sucker for the juniper note) and this would be very similar, and it's quite a bit more expensive than Diptyque. It's beautiful and 10/10; honestly this entire Atelier des Fleurs line did not disappoint.

Testing Cedrus Intense from a 1.2 ml Chloe official sample.

Citrusy, green, fresh in the opening and warm, ambery sandalwood in the dry down. The opening is truly beautiful in the way that smells so zesty and uplifting, but it settles down into a very pleasant, likeable creamy, warm blend of sandalwood and cedar. I’m getting a slightly pickled undertone from this scent, but not in an overwhelming, unpleasant way.

The fragrance smells absolutely amazing throughout all stages of development on skin, but it’s not a scent DNA that I would want to wear often enough to justify purchasing a bottle! It’s one of those perfumes where I can appreciate the craftsmanship that went into creating it, without having the urge to buy a bottle.

It’s a very nicely done one, buttery sandalwood forward fragrance with a fresh spicy greenness lurking in the background until the scent disappears from skin. Has a moderate to long lasting presence on skin with noticeable sillage for the first hour. I assume that applied on clothing Cedrus Intense would perform better, like most scents do. Comfortably unisex, I would wear it! Gives me outdoorsy vibes, like walking in a forest or hiking on a mountain with lush vegetation!

Cedrus Intense—warmth pressed into warmth, spice curling into cream. Vanilla, thick and sweet, made denser by woods that smolder with crackling depth and slight acidity. Cedar, yes, but not the crisp kind; this is richer, deeper, infused with an almost resinous glow. Like embers burning low, hot, hot, hot.

The spice isn’t a sharp bite, more of a slow bloom—maybe nutmeg, a whisper of cardamom. It's dry, earthy, thankfully grounding all that sweetness before it collapses into itself. But in humid weather, all gets just a little too cloying, a strong cloak of warm air refusing to let out

In the cold, though, I imagine it might melt just right, unfurling like the softest wool, spice sparking against the chill, cedar turning plush instead of oppressive. Akin to other intense flankers, this scent is very much built for frosted air and heavy knits, so in my foolishness here—here, I’m drowning in it. If only Singapore had the seasons to test it properly....

This is nice, however I don't think I could wear this. I thought I’d prefer this over the OG due to the bergamot note, and I do absolutely love the opening, but the dry down I just don’t enjoy. I so wish the opening remained throughout. What a shame! Although there’s no cardamom listed in this, I can 100% smell it. Unfortunately it’s a note I can struggle with and in this I do find it nauseating. As nice as this scent is, it’s one I’ll have to pass on. I actually find the OG more wearable and lasts longer
The drydown of this is a more palatable guidance by amouage. I cant get on board with guidance but this one i like. Same perfumer too.

Creamier and sweet version of the OG Cedrus. I love both. Extremely. When I want to a heavier, more complex version of Cedrus, I reach for this one. Usually when I know I'll be in a colder environment or during the evenings. Dries down to a very creamy sandalwood.

This is a very fresh-woody fragrance. It smells fresh and slightly creamy woody (sandalwood) at the beginning it turns into a leathery rose but the rose here is not not sweet( I think fragrantica’s notes is missing the rose) at last it’s not a dirty leather its a very very clean leather like other Chloe fragrances they all have a clean DNA but not as soapy as other Chloe.

I think I prefer the OG edp more it suits the concept of atelier de Fleurs more , more airy and clean it’s more versatile too.
Not a bad release but the og is just too good

It may just be me but, this smells very similar to the sandalwood vanilla body scrub by onyx. You can find it at Walmart. The body scrub smells really good and lingers on the skin. It’s around $7. Am I gonna sell my bottle of Santalum? YUP:)

This is pretty! ... But not a love for me. It's a very polite sandalwood with a touch of soapiness. Very feminine to my nose. Almost a gateway sandalwood... It's smooth, but I definitely wouldn't say "milky" - more clean than anything.

It is more sophisticated & more refined than cedrus & Santal 33... airier spice.
I agree with person commented as i tested it & now keep on thinking if i get full bottle.
This deserves more hype than Cedrus from the same line in my opinion. The creamiest and purest sandalwood scent I've come across so far.

Oh, Santalum. Santalum is just… everything. That slightly iris-y, perfumey edge that I often find off-putting, is simply swoonable here. It's a kiss, a soft-focus pat of powdered skin, an intimate moment of femininity. Powdery, yes, but not at all antique—more like the delicate veil of something familiar and romantic. And the sandalwood, that's the crème de la crème. Silky—that doesn’t even begin to cover it—like liquid velvet poured over warm, sunlit, enrapturing wood. It has this gentle, savory undertone that sneaks in every now and then too—not overwhelming, and just the ideal touch to add a cozy gourmand depth, like a steamy turmeric milk, full in body and cream. Mostly, oh mostly, it’s in the woods. A soft, comforting warmth that wraps round you, never sharp, always tender. Always tender, always plush, maybe a little yummy, and always luxurious without the being any cold. Just… everything.
All i can smell is wood. Very light .

I blind bought this because I love sandalwood. I read a lot of reviews on this and felt it was a "safe" blind buy for me. It smells lovely, for me it fell in the 'strong like' category. So I felt it was a successful blind buy. The problem with this scent for me is that it doesn't last even an hour on my skin. I tried spraying it over vaseline, moisturized skin and over spraying and it still didn't last. Fortunately I was able to return it.

This is a very surprising scent. On my skin, it doesn’t have any woody notes. Then I realised it’s called SANTALUM, not SandalWOOD. So I already had wrong expectations of this. And while I cannot stand Sandalwood, I really love Santalum. I’m getting mainly very milky and spicy notes. Warm, spiced milk, that’s what it smells like. Big like.
This smells like cold, outdoor air. At night.
Similar to Sunny side up from JHAG.

I have only just received this after sampling it months ago in a store. I also bought Ode to Dullness by JHAG. Comparing them side by side is an interesting experience, them both being Sandalwood fragrances. Santalum is much more effervescent, floral and sweet, despite none of the notes hinting at that. To me Santalum is a very cosy, clean, feminine take on Sandalwood. It is much more complex than I would have thought from other reviews. It has that woody undertone that makes it feel comfortable yet sophisticated but it also smells like laundry fresh from the dryer, crisp clean linen and expensive yet understated bodylotion. It is inoffensive but evokes pictures of put together women in smart casual attire. I can see myself wearing this a lot. The opening is surprisingly refreshing with it settling into a creamy, quiet, feminine sandalwood that is a perfect daytime, office scent.
Odd scent. A wannabe gourmand

Woody and lactonic, an okay neutral scent. More of an intimate type of scent to me though.

It lasts longer than I expected.

There isn't much to say, tbh. It's definitely sandalwood, with it's sweet, creamy qualities. It's a bit powdery, too, and that's all.
The good thing is that, it's not one of those sickening sandalwood scents, everything is in moderation here.
It's not at all a complex scent, but that's not always a bad thing.
Very weak on my skin so, for the price they're asking, hum, not sure it's worth it!
If you like sandalwood, this is something you need to check out, just don't expect fireworks, it's a very simple scent, but it's also nicely done.
Soft, slightly sweet and predominantly lactonic sandalwood.

*Initial review after store testing*

SOLO-SANDALWOOD.Tried once in the airport but I can already say this is very promising, true “Indian - Mysore” sandalwood oil profile, without much change. It really does smell like pure indian sandalwood. Though fascinating it is, it can also let many people down because of incorrect associations they may have based on other fragrances mentioning sandalwood in their names but actually smells nothing like it. Example: Le Labo - Santal 33.

Santalum is muted, just like the real oil. It will not shout loud, but it may create an inviting sillage that others get curious than the wearer.

I’ll definitely try this again and for the moment putting it to the list of my top sandalwood frags.

Chloe Love was my signature 10y ago. It is weird that Florale has completely different notes but smells almost exaclty like original. I love florale even more because is a brighter. There is something so special and deep about this perfume, so feminine and gentle, i am considering buying it again, i managed to find a bottle, very expensive though but i think it's worth it!
Chloe bring this back pleaseee
Not sure why it was discontinued. I loved it

This one is special... I own the intense one as well, but this one is used sparingly, no backup bottle, down about 50% on the bottle, but wow, how I love this one.

I love the tea and mate notes at opening then it slowly calms down into this soft, cloudy powdery clean feminine scent. I have been trying to find something similar so I can spare my bottle but I have not found anything that comes close to this. Why they always discontinue gems like this?
The perfume I wore whilst on my honeymoon. I’m heart broken it’s been discontinued. Why do they do that?

Chloe bring this back … please

This is a very light floral powdery smells a bit creamy and sweet at first, but turns into a very fresh and wearable almost skin like clean powdery scent, love it!!!! Not as creamy as the OG love, I have both and love both IMO you definitely need to get both of them!! They smell very similar but different at the same time.

I really like the soapy dna in all Chloe fragrances, especially the love collection really don’t know why they chose to discontinue this collection but continue to carry the “love story” line

Would definitely be my signature scent if it’s not discontinued:(

I stole this from my mothers perfume collection. This smells very similar to Rituals of sakura products to me, it's powdery yet warm and sweet. I hate the Rituals of sakura body mist but I love the shower products etc in that scent. It is very different compared to the Chloe EDP, which I used to own. I would say that this is a motherly and inviting scent, and it's signature scent worthy. It's kinda sad that it's discontinued. Chloe EDP is very sparkly and young scent, but this is more sophisticated and mature. I think that this fits anyone who wears it. It might sound silly, but I find this addicting. It's just something very special to my nose. I actually love this.

Love, Chloe florale, amour de ma vie. A masterpiece. Sophisticated gorgeous soapy, feminine, powder on a bed of roses. A compliment getter. Perfection. If you’re reading this Chloe please bring it back 😭🙏.

I get why so many reviews says that this smells soapy. When you open the bottle and spray it on your skin the soapy scent is strong. I think it has something to do with it's green accords. It's fresh too. first it's strong, but once you give it time to lay on your skin it is the most feminine scent I've smelled. I wouldn't say that the dry down is powdery, but it's more creamy and sweet. The after scent of the sweetness is like a trail of AG Cloud. The dry down is just sooo good and feminine. I just hate how it comes off strong once you spray it but that dry down is making me love and keep wearing this perfume. I've been finding perfumes that are floral and powdery at the same time yet with a trail of sweetness that lingers and this is it! I'm not a big fan of floral and fruity perfumes so this perfume is perfect for me. Don't knock this before you try it. That dry down will change your mind, just give it time. Love this.

I agree with others saying this is more soapy rather than powdery like the original edp. There is something with the fresh, green opening that makes this smell like a perfumed but sweaty armpit come late afternoon on me. It made me almost want to sell or swap this. But then comes the beautiful, soft dry down and everything is forgotten. The smell that lingers on your coat the next day after applying this is addictive. Will keep!

I can't believe I haven't reviewed this fragrance yet! When I was a little girl, my father bought it for my mother as a gift, and I stole it. Ever since, I've absolutely adored this fragrance—it's the one that made me fall in love with perfumes. Unfortunately, I found out it was discontinued about a few months ago. When I run out, I'm for sure purchasing a new bottle. It's a powdery and sweet feminine delight! I love this fragrance throughout every hour. Must have!

Edit: Bought a 30 mL on ebay for like 130$, a bit ridiculous, but I had to :)
less powdery than Love Chloe. a floral caressing combination with the soft sweetness of sweet pea and the calming notes of mate.
Go to Jomashop.com to buy perfumes. They are legit and discounted as overstock. They carry current and discontinued authentic fragrances as a grey market retailer. I just ordered the 2.5 oz. for $60.

Mistakenly put this under Love Story. I bought a mini of this for a trip back in 2016. A really nice smelling soap was how I initially described this. This smells good on women of all ages. It smells luxurious and expensive, but not demanding. I have since smelt this on older women only and it feels elegant!

Same but different. It smells like the original but then I can smell the peony and tea. More soapy rather than powdery. If it wasn't discontinued I would have purchased it but I won't spring the $150+ for a discontinued bottle. I will stick with my #1 love, my signature scent, Love Chloe EDP

Ebay has decant samples for those who are trying to avoid an expensive blind buy.

I bought a bottle and was super excited as I love both the original and the Intense versions - I just KNEW I would love this one too! Buuut, the sweet pea mixed with the tea is odd-smelling. The opening is beautiful and the dry down is identical to the original Love. The mid, which lasts a long time, is not a good mix to my nose... Gorgeous bottle... Full 2.5 oz up for trade!
Beautiful, clean, powdery scent. Get this if you can!

Too late, too late to the game here. I’m always on the hunt for the best soapy scents. This nails it for me. Unfortunately bottles of Love, Chloe and her flankers are going for extortionate prices on the internet now. I saw a rare mini in a shop and grabbed it.

Powdery and soapy are some of my favourite accords. Love, Chloe Eau Florale leans more soapy than powdery for me. But what a lovely, delicate fresh-out-of-the-shower soapiness. Feminine, clean, relaxed. It is the feeling of basking in the sun by the window after a bath, curtains billowing in the wind and the smell of soap-scented damp skin slowly drying.

Ugh, I need this.

Such a soft yet rich and long lasting scent. It just melts into my skin so gently. I like to add a pomegranate/blackberry lotion to layer this and they bring out the best when combined. All of her notes really shine together and are perfectly blended. I am a fan of mini's due to frequent blind buys. This is a winner!

This is such a pretty fragrance, especially for Spring. The tea and mate makes it slightly bitter green while still having the powdery goodness of Love. Less powder, more herbal freshness. Also sweet in a refreshing way, not custardy like the original. Sweet pea flowers as I perceive them (thanks BBW) are sweet with fruity nuances, which I do get here. Extremely wearable, more wearable than the other two.

As much as I am smitten over it I've proven to myself this and all the Love, Chloes are simply not "me." Have you ever loved a perfume for how it's constructed, the way it smells and basically everything about it but for some reason don't feel fully comfortable wearing it? This is me with the Love line. I think they're phenomenal perfumes, the best of Chloe for sure ( this goes for all of them), but I'm not the polite girly girl for them. The older I get the more I realize I only wanna keep fragrances that totally get me.
@whitecity ...yes it’s discontinued, it does pop up online periodically though..Real shame, I am cherishing my bottle! It used to be my signature but have to use it sparingly now..
Has this been discontinued??

Beautiful scent!! I’m obsessed! Powdery, Fresh, soapy goodness. Excellent longevity and sillage. I thought it couldn’t get better than the original Love Chloe, then I found this gem! Chloe has done it again.

This is my new signature scent. I just feel like "me" while wearing it. So pretty, clean, fresh, but also with a bit of powder.

As with the original Love, Chloe...give it a few minutes to settle in. You'll be pleasantly surprised!

I am head over heals in love with this! I find it absolutely wonderful how it is BOTH powdery, really clean soapy AND brisk and fresh! There is really this zing in the opening from the tea and the mate leaves that quickly reveals the sweet, sweet sweet pea. Sweet pea is almost too girly for me, but... nah, I adore it here! Powder, woods and musk embrace the tea and floral notes and the balance is supreme. It´s quite linear if not all linear and silage is medium and longevity phenomenal. It never gets too powdery and never falls into baby powder territory (nothing wrong with that, but I rather not smell like baby) and the tickling brightness of the tea follows all the way. I just scored an almost full 50 ml bottle and am totally happy that I did since my other one is running dry. This is sexy clean at its best!

Smells like the most EXPENSIVE feminine soap ever. Way cleaner and fresher than Chloe Love. Very ladylike & princessy to me, like something a modern-day Grace Kelly would wear. Has that Coco Mademoiselle vibe, but with more powder and less citrusy notes. Also less commonly worn than Coco, which is a plus for me. It can be a bit overpowering, so I like to spritz sparingly. Great longevity as well! You'll definitely be noticed wearing this. Try it in the summer, that's when it does it's magic.

You cannot offend anyone wearing this. Classy powdery-soapy floral fragrance. Smells clean and romantic (but not in a naive way). Great EDT longevity.

Good for summer days too, not overwhelming. Having my second bottle.Too bad it was discontinued.

To me 8/10.

Love Chloe eau florale is what I call a polite soap and powder fragrance. In fact more soap than powder. There is a hint of greeness to it and for such a polite fragrance the longevity is very good - 6/8 hours on my skin. I like clean fragrances however this one, I cannot find the love for. No pun intended.

Soap and powder. Both of the best quality possible. It brings to my mind freshly washed and ironed white shirt on extremely beautful woman. Long, dark hair, big eyes and smile of Mona Lisa. She stands on the hill, wind brushes her hair while she is simply enjoing the view on the valley. It's summer and there is scent of flowers all around. Or maybe it's her perfume. Flowers mixed with freshness of white shirt. Peaceful heaven.

Goes without saying that I love Chloe Love Eau Florale. :) <3

Sweet pea and green tea really work together, don't they. I would not have thought of that combination myself. It's pretty nondescript though, pleasant clean floral. I spilled some almond essence on my hand while baking muffins though, and the bitter almond note enriches this fragrance perfectly! I wish that note was actually in there, to be honest.

spring fragrance. the scent is exactly the same as the EDP, but not as long lasting. the powdery notes are lighter, too. i think it is a interesting option for someone who wants one to apply through the day after spraying some before leaving home, you could use the EDP version and then retouch it through the day, looking for a less heavy sillage. I love it.
spring time floral, nice scent to layer.with the Love deodorant, this scent sweeps away the winter grief.
It smells like...I don't know...Barbies? I don't like it..too intense, too powdery, It's not what I like in a perfume.

A pretty nice fragrance for summer. I smell the mate and sweet pea, the tea, a bit aromatic as it starts but quickly turns into the softest sweetest pink powder. It smells like a boudoir scent very girly. I wish it had more fruit in it or more flowers but whatever they did to this it smells really really good. Sometimes when I don't want to wear this and I put on a different fragrance I still like to smell this scent by putting my nose to the nozzle of the spray. This is really good.
Very good sillage for an Edt. The original one is too powdery for my taste. This perfume smells clean and soapy which is good for me who lives in tropical, humid country.

For an EDT, it sure lasts forever. The only perfume I own that I call "beautiful" without hesitation, even though there are others I love more intensely. My most-used summer fragrance for work, as it is neither offensive nor cloyingly sweet. I do adore the original Love, Chloe EDP more than this, however this Eau Florale should be for those who somehow like Love EDP, but find it old-ish. Both are permanent fixtures on my vanity, along with Chloe EDP, EDT, Intense, and See by Chloe. Fan of the house.

beautiful summer soapy clean fragrance

it´s more soapy than powdery
love it!

It's very intensive on the sweet pea at first - I almost get a headache from the sweetness. Luckily, the powdery and woody notes take over and balances it quite well. It's more casual than your average "fresh floral" - but not particularly interesting in my opinion. I like it for everyday wear, I spray it in my hair for a longer lasting soapy smell. I will not repurchase though, since there are so many more interesting fragrances out there!
Very similar to True love elizabeth arden

I cant believe i did not like this perfume before!! Our noses and chemistries sure are mystifying.

After disliking this (see my other review below) and ignoring it for a few months, i wore this yesterday just so i wont be wasting my bottle and i fell in love. This is a pretty, soapy, floral scent. It's fresh as well. I no longer smelled the heavy tea and woody notes. I tried to think what could have made me dislike it before and i have only my nose to blame. The projection is soft but the longevity is amazing. I did some house chores after putting it on and i can still smell this after 8 hours later. A love for sure.

It such a beautiful feminine perfume.Very gorgeous,powdery and flowery at the same time,very unique!Very sophisticated,classy,feminine,clean and soapy but in an expensive way.Perfect for spring,and it has a wonderfull sillage.I totally fall in love with this scent,this is a masterpiece in a bottle, looooove it!Love,Love,Love

Beautiful feminine scent,very light,airy,but powdery,floral at the same time....such a elegant,very chic fragrance,and I Loooove it so so smuch.
At first its sweet,with pea,and fresh thanks for the tea.But a few minutes later,turns into a clean,fresh soapy scent,with the powdery notes!It stay very fresh thanks for the tea,and floral (sweet pea),and at last the musk create a soft,comfort feeling.....................for a spring such a enchanting fragrance,but for every day is also peeerfect.The lasting power is very good,and the design is very beautiful,and i totaly looooove this,love love love it!!!

This is too heavy for me. I did not like this at all. I did not detect any floral notes. The green tea almost jasmine like note stays with me and it's very, very prominent and stays for long! The tea note is not refreshing on me, it's heady and rather masculine. After testing this i think i would skip the original Chloe, Love. The longevity is really high though, so for people who like this, it's a great buy.

There's the same weird bean scent again, just like in Chloe Love. I really wanted to like something from this line, because I like other Chloe's fragrances.
But this one is just super sharp and super soapy.
It's very clean and in base notes smells actually very nice.
But I still can't imagine wearing it because of those top notes and sharpness.
It's a powder bomb.

As other reviewers have mentioned this perfume is very similar to Chloé Love, which happens to be one of my favourite perfumes. I do actually prefer the scent of this one, however, as it has a freshness to it that the other one doesn't.

Had the staying power been equal to Chloé Love it would have been my all time favourite, but unfortunately it wears off way to fast (unlike Chloé Love), so I'm beginning to think that I may have to combine the two. ;)

update August 2014 :
To this day I couldn't find this fragrance in any perfum srores where I live & I don't order fragrances online due to shipments so no review will be posted as I don't have this perfume & it's sadly out of my wish list or at least must test lest.

Chloe Love Eau Florale (CLEF) is similar to Chloe Love, but not the same. CLEF starts out much fresher, with the sweet pea and the almost citrus-like tea notes dashing in full force. A bit overwhelming at first, CLEF quickly settles into a softer floral powdery perfume. It's similar to Chloe Love's powder notes, only less heavy; a soft dusting of powder on clean skin, where Chloe Love can sometimes feel like breathing in close to the actual powder puff.

I find CLEF a perfect alternative for Chloe Love when the weather heats up. However, because sillage and longevity are significantly weaker than Chloe Love's, and because I find the opening stages somewhat bracing, I prefer Chloe Love. That is not to say that I don't appreciate CLEF, though. I'm very happy with my bottle and I'm 90% sure I will replace it once I run out.

CLEF is absolutely perfect for when I want to smell unequivocally beautiful without making any waves. I find these types of perfumes very soothing and often reach for them when I can't make up my mind about which scent I want to wear.

Very powdery, but it is not the worst. It smells so chemical! Like some perfumed washing detergent. Well, even detergents smell better because not so powdery. All in all, not for me.

Update: I've tried it again, but my impression hasn't changed much. Lots of powder. I could smell also some green notes which surprisingly did not add any freshness to this scent.
Though honestly I have to admit that powdery green scents have been never my favorite ones. No surprise then.

I received a sample of this today. I think this is a disappointment for me. On my skin, it is a linear smell after a short period of a delicious array of flowers. If only the flowers remained throughout the fragrance which is a shame. However, it lacks the richness and creamy aspects of the Chloe EDP Love or Intense. I smell an almond and a screechy smell which makes me sick which gives me weakened soapy finish. Unfortunately, I do not smell the lovely sweet pea smell, which I was after. I can understand why some people would like a weakened fragrance, while it seems to linger softly for a long time. I will not purchasing a large bottle. Unfortunately, the lack of rich floral flowers gives this perfume a fly spray, green and bitter powdery smell combination which I find offensive. However, I recommend one to sample this first, while others love this. I am happy I did not rely on positive views, because it does not work for me. The smell is 1/5, the silage 1/5 and the strength is 1/5 for me. It is not quality for the price. For the 75mls EDT of this fragrance is $89.00 on Ebay, which is the cheapest, because it is not available in Australia.

I'm so happy to see how many people love this. The Eau Florale version has an incredible lasting power and I can feel it even after 12 hours.

It's a very elegant daytime scent, suitable in the evening as well. The price is very reasonable, considering the high quality - as someone else has already said, better than many EDPs. ;)

This was a blind buy for me but I have no regrets. It is such a beautiful soft and very feminine perfume IMHO. Powdery and flowery at the same time. I usually stay away from perfumes with tea in but I am so glad that I bought this. Amazing longevity and silage for EDT. It lasts 7 hours on my skin and even longer on my jacket. This is just perfect for the coming spring and summer. A winner in my wardrobe.

Unbelievably amazing scent! Sweetpea and white flowers are dominant from the start. Powder-note holds them together and gives them great longetivety and effect.
So fresh, crisp and airy. Feels like light air after summer rain.
Lastingpower is huge on my skin, and even it is edT.
I can honestly say, my little 30ml bottle will last forever. Will repurchase surely.

Received in a swap today and I am very pleased with it!
It's a lovely powdery, fresh floral that makes a wonderful springtime scent!
The sillage and longevity on my skin are outstanding for a fragrance in this category.
It's been 9 hours since I sprayed this on and it's still detectable to my own nose.
The first 2 - 3 hours of wearing offer a wonderful sillage, after which it softens.
Feminine and classy!
♥♥♥♥♥

This is very feminine and sophisticated scent. Powdery and flowery at the same time. It's quite unique, doesn't remind me anything else. This is my choise for this spring. I applied liberally this morning (three spritz on neck and two on wrists) and I am suprised by the longevity, because It's 9 pm, and I can still smell it.

Soft, powdery, clean, fresh. Soapy but in an expensive way. Pretty but with a definite personality.
So many compliments!
Very feminine, easy to wear, won't let you down whenever, wherever.
Truly love it, centre stage in my wardrobe .

Update For edt it's got great longevity and silage, better than many edps! Definitely getting second bottle when it runs out!

I had one magazine with the page scented with this fragrance. I thought it was not my cup of tea because it is not rosy or fruity scent. But I couldnt stop sniffing that magazine page all day long. I love it. Soooo beautiful, classy, feminine scent. It is powdery, which I usually dont like at all. But this one is an exception, because it is very soft.
Clean, powdery and soft florals, very pretty!

First of all I must say that I just loooove the orginal Chloé Love.... and this one is just as adorable :))

The scent is a powdery divine floral scent with notes of sweet pea and then refreshed by green tea leaves. It makes me feel sophisticated, clean and refreshed in a very womanly way.

It is an EdT but it doesn't fade away fast and I can still notice the scent at the end of the day :-)

It's an amazingly beautiful classic scent. It's a keeper fore sure !!!!! :-))

Ps. Ran out of it and on my way to buy a new one :)


Till och börja med måste jag säga att jag bara ääääälskar, orginal Chloé Love .... & denna är lika bedårande :))

Doften är pudrig med gudomliga noter av sweet pea och en uppfräschande ton av grönt te. Detta får mig att känna mig sofistikerad, ren och fräsch på ett mycket kvinnligt sätt.

Det är en EdT, men dunstar inte snabbt och mot slutet av dagen kan jag fortfarande känna doften :-)

Det är en otroligt klassisk vacker doft.

Det är en keeper med säkerhet!!!!! :-))

This is a perfect genius in a bottle :)
Pretty, sophisticated, clean and refined soap, very powdery.
Just LOVELY --- I can't resist this smell. Kept sniffing on my wrist. Old masterpiece fragrances are good indeed, but I'm also truly happy that I could encounter this refined masterpiece of today.
Womanly and sophisticated. I wear this scent to work. Wear pearls with it :)
