The first thing I thought when I sprayed this was how pretty it is. It does slightly remind me of EA True Love but it's not as sharp, it is much softer and settles down to a beautiful soft floral. I don't get any honey, more a slightly green, powdery floral - I guess the prominent note is the sweet pea but its not one I have smelt before in a fragrance. It is a really beautiful perfume and I would be tempted to buy a FB. It is worlds apart from my usual strong oriental loves but a change is good! Longeivity too was amazing for a ligter fragrance, it lasted about 12 hours.

15 min. ago received it,decided to buy after reading reviews here and I'm shocked, soft and fresh??? for me it's oldish powdery perfume ,cant smell any ozonic or soapy notes which I love..I did same mistake again,never buy before test!

I read some reviews and got interested....was lucky to get a hold of it from swap !
It is in an astringent but fresh way different from what I normally enjoy to wearr. The notes are too - slightly unusual...
Its fresh start suddenly turms into a lovely mix of sweet pea and woods, it really does smell lovely !. This fase slowly morphs into a day long very subtle and powdery /creamy base, with the sweet pea playing hide and seek in the background. It does not really compare to the original or any off the perfumes I got, though I could easily layer it with senseous nude last night !
Not a typical smellME perfume but I 'm drawn to it .
Lovely !
A day and all year round perfume...
love it back :)
"I love you", "Love" by Chloe. What else can I say?

My most fav out of others Chloe, i hv tried many but i still prefer something fresh and light but last for a long time, this bottle is my most favorite one n nina ricci is my second...i dont like too strong smell of perfume as sometimes it makes me feel dizzy but these two are not but very fresh, fruity n feminine frangances. I love them sooo much....

really, really, really nice perfume!!
I find it a lot more pleasant than the original Love Chloé.
Both smell very powdery but it seems like the smell of heavy make up in the original has been replaced by the smell of baby powder in Love chloé eau florale.
When you wear it you just feel very innocent and clean and LOVELY!
I even find the bottle prettier than the original :)

LOVE

sooooo nice absolutely my favorite perfume make s me happy. in combination with the body lotion love it is magic! very very feminem and elegant. during time this scent shows several nuances flowers powder soft cosy freshness. this is not just a perfume it is a beautifull creation.

Smell soapy and powdery from the first spray. This one is similar with the original but less sweet, more fresh and not overwhelming. Yes this is more floral and still unique. Sillage is moderate but turns soft after a while. You can wear it everyday just in 1-2 spray because it's so lasting a whole day! Oh I loves all Chloe's!!
EA True Love expensive version.Delicate and liong lasting.Love it,

A versão Eau florale é semelhante a Love, Chloé tradicional apenas na secagem! Porque a nota de chá neste é muito persistente tanto na saída quanto durante a estada na pele, o que modifica muito o cheiro tradicional! Percebem-se apenas alguns traços de semelhanças nas notas de pó de ambos os perfumes.
Ainda sim, Eau florale é exatamente como deveria ser: tem qualidade para um EDT, é uma versão mais calma, floral e para primavera/verão do original!

This is a very pretty floral indeed. I don't smell the powder so much, though it does sit on the skin beautifully. It's both light and warm, nothing about it feels heavy. The floral note feels a little bit vintage and perfumey, in the way that Chanel No 5 does. They don't smell alike, but they feel similar, classy florals that have a lightness and lift to them, very feminine.
This one is also I think hugely versatile. I think it would work very well in almost any weather and it could easily be office appropriate or for a formal dinner or even jeans and t-shirt days for a bit of added glamour.
Very nice and well done, unsurprising from Chloe I guess.

I'm very surprised there is no Magnolia in this! The opening is quite sharp, but within minutes it settles very delicately on the skin. To me, it's very light, well done, creamy Magnolia. I'm enjoying it.. I've always found Magnolia is often over done, but whatever is in this, works well.its not entirely fresh and airy, because of the element of creaminess in it adds warmth, but indeed it is very light and ideal for warmer weather. Id recommend this to somebody who likes warm cuddly perfumes but lives in a hot climate.
I'm very pleased with this blind swap! Thanks pixiepuff :-)
Chloe Love is like a box of luxury loose powder! A dust on the skin, makes the skin soft, flawless and beautiful.

I find this fragrance far more favourable than Love by Chloe EDP. The original made me sneeze with its bold sillage and sharp, almost fizzy powderiness. Thankfully, Love by Chloe Eau Florale has a much softer presence.

It's really pretty and flowery on the skin, with the familiar powder note found in the original. The lilac has been replaced with sweet pea in this flanker, and the overall feeling is more fresh and airy.

A subtle tea note in the drydown, provides an interesting green quality. It's what makes this fragrance so suitable for Spring and Summer.

Love by Chloe Eau Florale has surpassed all my expectations. I enjoyed it enough to recommend it as a wedding day fragrance to one of my dear friends. Here's hoping that she'll use it for her special day.

Fans of the original Love EDP will be pleased to know that Love by Chloe Eau Florale has much in common with its predecessor, however the softer aspects may find this fragrance some new fans. I know that I personally would choose this flanker over and above the EDP and the Intense version. Actually, make it my pick out of the entire Chloe range.

The packaging is as always, very classy and chic. The lighter pink bottle is a nice touch. This flanker has my personal tick of approval. Very nicely done.

A soft and airy scent, lighter and without that huge sillage of the original Love, Chloe. At the beginning fresh, after that it dries down very powdery with some little flower and tea notes in the background. Perfect for spring and summer.

Today I bought this perfume and fragrance and has a very carefree, inviting me to go out and run on the grass, very funny.Thanks to all of you girls with your reviews have made me choose the right scent of spring
Very beautiful and unique fragrance!!! <3
i love it! So soft and fresh.it can be a signature, as it is very easy to wear all the seasons. I will have a bottle for sure!

This is fantastic. Amazingly delicate, refreshing, innocent yet confident, very tranquil. Powdered and pampered, yet still it is a scent of a grown up female. I love soapy and powdery scents and the airiness of this is irresistible. I need this perfume in my life.

I normally steer clear from gifting others with fragrances, but I may have to pick up a bottle of this for my beautiful 16 year old niece Chloe. :)

From the descriptions, the sweet-yet-sophisticated air of this perfume will suit her. Thanks to the reviewers for their descriptions!

I adore this scent. Yes, this is not something that you like, this is a scent to be ADORED. It is feminine, longlasting, light, powdery and reminds me of Arwen in Lord of the Rings. She would wear this :) I do not like the other Chloe scents, but this one is to die for. BIG love!

update 3rd March:
I couldn't find this fragrance where I live. It's available at chloe.com though. The company didn't mention anything if this one is limited or permanent I had to find out myself. All other chlo fragrances are available though.
Update 13th March:
In cosmoty.com this fragrance is due in March 2013, it means not all countries have it yet. I'll wait & see if it's ever gonna be available where I live cause all what I saw is chloe love & chloe love intense.
hmmmm.... I wouldn't mind to smell clean and soapyfresh during spring and summer, I definately wanna try this!!!

I absolutely adore this fragrance :) I tried it on so many times before finally getting a bottle today and I'm definitelly pleased with my purchase! Personally for me this is a unique scent in my collection since I don't really have any powdery/clean scents but I think this is already up for becoming a favourite of mine!

Love is a perfect feminine, almost girly yet sophisticated fragrance. When I first spray this I can smell a beautiful blend of floral and powdery notes that blend in together to a lovely clean soapy scent. After a while I start to pick up the green tea notes :) I'm in love with Chloe Love!

HUGE soap-monster! Smells of the finest triple milled soap: fresh, clean, sudsy and refined. The sillage and longevity is nuclear, luckily it smells fantastic. Its not thick- its airy and diffusive, but it is very potent. If youre loking for the perfect true-to-life soap scent, this is it. The Clean line of scents and Philosophy's Pure Grace come nowhere near the authenticty and quality of this one.

I tried it on at the airport, and kept sniffing my wrist throughout the flight. what an addictive yet fresh and clean scent! So today I had then today I had to go out and buy it. I got the 30 ml bottle which is perfect for the handbag so I can top off during the day or night. The bottle is so elegant and stylish with the lid connected to the bottle through a chain. Neat design.
The fragrance starts out slightly green, but not as green as a green fragrance like Green Tea or Chanel Chance eau fresh or Chloe Lèau. The green note is just a fresh clean note, then it to me quickly turns into a supersoft, light perfectly powdery, clean, fresh yet elegant floral.

This fragrance is just heavenly perfection if you are looking for a scent that is elegant and sophisticated without being heavy, and clean and fresh without being sticky or cheap.
This fragrance is like a soft powdery petal falling from a clean sky on a beautiful summer day. A classic.
lovely light and clean soapy scent. I love it

This fragrance is lighter scent which is clean, powdery soft, fresh and floral particularly very feminine and airy. Actually very easy to love like its love sisters. It is an eau de toilette, so it evaporates slightly faster than what I am used to, but it is an amazingly beautiful scent. At the end of the day it is still lingering and noticeably soft. I'm impressed to be honest. Really a sweet, floral and soapy clean-fresh scent! I simply recommend this during hot weather days.
I am in love. I think I will wear it forever. Poor other perfumes on my dresser.
soft, and beautiful.
Very delicate, clean and elegant. Beauty.

Soft, feminine, calming pretty scent. Nothing candy like here for little girls. It smells like laundry softener (in a good way). Hint of sweetness, hint of bitterness from tea and powdery heaven. I think I will buy it for my mom. Classy for mature chic women for casual everyday wear. Lasts very long. Luv :-)
A beautiful feminine scent!
Seems to be more sopy than EDP. Also harsh sent to me.
I received a sample of this today. I was so looking forward to powder. What a disappointment. I would swear I had a bug spray in camp that smelled just like this, no powder at all. Ick!

Better than the original chloe love, which has a plasticky powdery trail that is way too strong for my nose.

The floral notes tame the powdery notes, giving rise to a very pleasant and natural smelling fusion of both.

However, powdery notes are stil too dominant...it would be better for me if the flora notes are stronger. Smelling ths trong powdery notes for too long makes me feel sick.

It's similar to true love, EA to me.
Sharp flower scent, plused powdery.
but there's something fruity sweetness. it's the difference.
not my taste.

In my opinion, Chloé has centered ten for the romantic ladies: it created Chloé Eau de Parfum and... Love, Chloé.
I am currently testing Love, Chloé Eau Florale and it's so delicate but present, so tender and embracing that makes me feel wrapped up in love, and a better person.
This is NOT a fragrance for the fatal woman. It's a fragrance for the one that believes in eternal love and that this world can be a better place.
This is my way to describe it. And I love this scent so much.

wooooww !!!never was in my head that one of the chloe fragrance especial the "love chloe seria "its sooo sooo long lastin powerfull smell !!!At begining its powdery then became the beautiful green tea and sweet pea smell witch stay with you all day long !!!Amazing and you know why because its one of the most uniqe and special frag !!!
The perfect scent. Anytime.... anywhere. The ultimate delicacy.
its god an sweet not so strong thats way i like it .its not granma .
It smells like flowery soap placed on grandma´s white cotton panties.... very old-fashioned, very powdery, very soapy, very flowery scent
i love this. floral powdery...fresh...last long too.

This perfume is so pretty: soft floral with gentle green tea accent, with a powdery overcast to give the scent some depth. Nothing unexpected or spectacular, but quietly brilliant as tranquility creeps up from my nose to my mind within the first few sniffs. Beautifully made, just like its predecessor :)

@mariabojana and Cams, I'm SO jealous! Where did you get to smell this?! I'm in the US and have no clue when this one is coming! I cannot wait to smell this one and would LOVE a lighter Love, Chloe seeing as how the original is just TOO strong for me. : )
Beautiful, soft and delightfully feminine. It's still at its essence the original Love, Chloe just light (distinctly noticeable), refreshed and lovely!

Softer and less provocative version of the strong ("in your face") scent Chloe Love.

A soft and fresh scent from beginning to end, reminds me a bit of Cacharel's Noa in a way. Very suitabe for summer, but may be as good for the other seasons..

I have complicated feeling at the first sniff. It has nice aquatic scent but I can smell green and spices at the same time. So I cannot decide if I like it or not. I keep telling myself 'This is the worst Nomade flankers ever!' and 'I do not want to smell like this all day'.
BUT the scent became so heavenly after dry down. It is very sweet and sensual. I keep sniffing myself all the time. I do not expected much about the sillage and longevity from aquatic fragrance but this one is actually good. I still prefer Nuit d’Egypte but I am glad I give this one a try.

This is a jasmine bomb with oriental spices! It smells really green to me and reminds me of nature some how. Like a home filled with natural fragrances in every corner. This is not something I would ever wear but I would respect someone who could pull this off! It is quite a mature scent to me but not in the fancy lady kind of style, more lika an older woman living an organic life in a cottage and likes to spend time outside. A fresh, floral and spicy perfume all at once. I think I would like this as a candle to put in my bathroom for relaxation!

As someone from Egypt, Chloè Lumiere d'Egypte holds a deep sense of nostalgia for me; it reminds me of home. There’s the intensity of Cairo in its heart, balanced by the peace of the land and the warmth of its people ☀️🌊🤍.

It carries an oriental spice that feels both powerful and graceful, and then comes the jasmine: that same enamoured jasmine you smell when you walk past blooming trees under the bright Egyptian sun. Paired with lily of the valley, it creates a scent that’s luminous, elegant, spellbinding, and kind.

A single spray lasts beautifully for over five hours, making it perfect for everyday sophistication or special evenings. After testing over 20 perfumes, this was the one I chose as my wedding fragrance, and it couldn’t have been more perfect.

I ADORE this fragrance. If you give it a try it will lift your spirit and wrap you in the warmth of the Egyptian sun. You won’t be disappointed ✨

On my skin: Very green, bright, ladylike, unique opening. Harmonious and it reminds me of a handmade body cream from Africa, very seductive and mystical. It's not sweet (my type of scents), but I love it. In the middle notes it gets resinous , rather than green. I definitely get the resins... thankfully it doesn't remind me too much "church", but myrrh is clearly there. It's the only thing that makes me hesitant to buy it. It keeps its feminine notes throughout (jasmine + something else), but not as in the amazing opening. I definitely prefer its opening. I get 0 cinnamon. Imo it suits mature, put together, old money, conservative, religious women. Not so "nomade" 😆 I smelled it next to Prada Paradoxe: same vibe, but this is the 40s mother and PP is the 20s daughter. Edit: yeah, it has something comforting, motherly, trustworthty, reassuring (I guess it's the myrrh). It's very elegant from the start till its drydown which stays consistent without dissapointing surprises. Hmm...then I'll might get a bottle.

Some people say it's a mature scent, but I disagree. I picture an elegant woman who knows what she wants. This isn't a sweet or energetic perfume; it has a slight greenish edge, but it's not entirely green; the floral aspect is prominent. It's a very clean scent, suitable for office use. The longevity is quite satisfactory. I can smell the jasmine, and I adore it. It's lighter, more aquatic, and shares the same DNA as Nuit d'Egypte. I'd say it's a scent for those who don't like to take risks. When I'm unsure what to wear and don't want to draw too much attention, I'd spray this scent :) It's not very diffused, but someone hugging you or sitting next to you will definitely smell it.
Longevity on clothing: 7/10

Broke my no-buy for this, because it is just that good. Such a nicely balanced and intoxicating scent that develops in a lovely way. I can see myself wearing this for almost all situations and seasons

Fig, fig...and more fig. A fig dominated fragrance even though the note is not listed !!!
As many others state there is definitely fig/ fig leaf in this perfume. To me it's similar to Davidoff Goodlife (for Men).

I just humbly ask here CHLOÉ ~ please never ever stop making this absolutely perfect fresh’n still creamy, dimensional, happy, mystic jet professional scent!
Lumiere d’ Egypt is really big love of mine even words are not enough.
There is some clever compositioning, its a true gem.
Thank You!

The opening is spicy, pungent, very green.
After a few minutes, the acquatic aspect starts to emerge, but the green note (or at least what I process as green note), is still the strongest, until you get to the final hour of the perfume, which is definitely more acquatic. I dont pick up any sweetness at all.
It's quite refreshing, it smells of wet green leaves and water, but in a nice way.
Summer weather appropriate. The name Egypt seems completely irrelevant here🍃☀️💧
This is ARMANI CODE the original!! Intoxicating. This will be my next buy!
shes kind of wierd. sweet but a bit psycho. put together but a bit edgy. I can't explain her and I love her for it

The balsamic, ceremonial, sacred notes from the original Nuit d’Égypte have moved to the base here. In the OG, they’re woven through all three layers, with the myrrh making a grand entrance. Here, they’re in the background, and white florals take the lead.

This is clearly an airy white floral spin on Nuit d’Égypte, and I have to say, I’m a bit surprised by it. It’s a fine fragrance on its own, but for me, the original is just on another level - a creation that holds a special place in perfumery.

Because really… why would you want a light, airy version of something that is so essentially not light, airy, or white floral? Lumière is pretty, but it simply can’t compete with the depth and presence of Nuit.

The blend is formal and abstract. It opens with abundant honeyed wood and fresh green spices.
The fragrance of the flowers is fresh and fruity for a moment, and then watery wafts carry a creamy air with a delightful mist of elemi. The effect is similar to the deep aroma of fig leaves (it lingers throughout), so the ambery resins and spices become creamy while remaining dusty, bitter, slightly citrusy, green and woody… IMHO, it brings a feeling of serenity, accentuated by stimulating sparkles.

This is an ode to the romantic, magic notion of Egypt that many of us carry in our memories from history lessons in school.

It's the sight of a Felucca with crisp, white sails floating down the shimmering Nile while a light breeze carries the sigh of blooming jasmine along the banks of the river.

This is a bright, clean, and easygoing fragrance. I usually don’t go for clean girl scents, since neither my style, makeup, nor wardrobe really fits that aesthetic. But this one stands out for me, it’s the most wearable clean fragrance I’ve come across. :) There’s something subtly edgy about it that I really enjoy. It’s perfect for daytime, I’d wear this to brunch, cinema, a cafe, or to a sunny walk.

This perfume smells like you're in Egypt, sitting by the bank of the Nile as the tall palm trees rustle above you on a hot summer day. There is a calm, watery freshness carried by the lotus, blending beautifully with jasmine, spices and myrrh. I sense a green nuance (possibly a fig tree accord) and, from what I gather, I'm not the only one who senses it. If you enjoy fig scents, I think this is the one to try.

Nicest of the Nomades IMO. It's juicier, fruitier, younger and brighter than the others, and more summer fun energy/solar vibes than the OG.

Unsure what note is giving the tarty, juicy, slightly green edge - but it gets more subtle in the dry-down and when the whole thing becomes more reminiscent of the OG (but stays younger and brighter overall). I can't really spot the resins & spices in this that are strong players in the Nuit flanker and in this note list.
Unique and addictive to sniff - will enjoy playing with it in different weather.
Gaultier Divine in another bottle.

It is lovely. Better than Nuit d'Egypte that is heavy on particular jasmine thats a bit sour. This is bright, crisp, floral without being obviously jasmine and lotus. This duo plays together nicely. There is something slightly bitter in the front that is so very Chloe. In the background this is sweet. The sandalwood is there but also not obvious. It is animalistic-resinous in the drydown, oriental but refined by the French. I think I like the classic Nomade edp the most, then Nomade Naturelle then this. I dont know only the Nomade Naturelle Jasmin.
I think this is a safe blind buy and a lovely gift cause this is timeless, elegant, cheerful and universal with regards to weather. Today is a stormy, rainy hot spring day and I am so comfortable in it yet I feel it on myself 9 hours already.
I can swear I got a fig note from the opening, so that I fell in love with this scent

If Nuit d’Egypte is the whisper of an evening, Lumière d’Egypte is the sigh of a golden dawn.

Both perfumes offer the same silky balm, the same tender ointment laid on the skin, still that warm breath of the Orient that gently caresses the senses without ever overwhelming them. It’s a velvety, spicy, and rounded scent.

But here, the light enters. Jasmine blooms more clearly, lotus offers its fresh aquatic note without breaking the creamy base. It’s the same family, the same olfactory dynasty: that of oriental caresses, but this time under the clear sky of an Egypt bathed in daylight.

Two faces of the same dream. I really like these Egyptian flankers.

To my nose, this is a green fig and warm jasmine fragrance. I think the warmth comes from the Myrrh but there has to be fig in this. That's what's coming across on my skin. It does settle down a bit as it transitions from the opening to the dry down, and the jasmine becomes equal with the fig (that I'm picking up but isn't a listed note). It's nice but nothing groundbreaking IMO. I appreciate that the Nomade DNA is still present in this fragrance, as it should be since it's a flanker.

The Nomad d'Egypte editions are so different to the other Nomads, I had to try them in the store and I was truly mesmerized. They don't even remind me of Nomad. I prefer Lumiere and bought it asap.

Lumiere is so niche and weird, but in a very good way: its warm, creamy, ambery, spicy, all in a subtle non-cloying way, and at the same time its also fresh and aquatic. I would have thought these accords would clash, but it doesn't and its just so addictive. Its not a fill the room scent, which I love, I find this very classy. I don't get any coconut here like others review, I do not like coconut in a fragrance so that's lucky.

Update: This performs very well in a cold season for me, when its warmer I don't like this on me at all, it went weirdly fishy on me, sooo weird, enough so it has been putting me off wanting to use it, its a sell. It must be a mix of the aquatic and the spices throwing it in that direction.

Very tropical smelling to me, i get jasmine, even tuberose, with notes of coconut and banana (lol). Unfortunately it doesn't really make me think of Egypt, rather of a tropical country close to the beach in the summer. It is very pleasant though, a very sunny perfume, plus tbh the performance is great. The projection is good and it lasts even after a shower.
super creamy jasmine and amber, although amber isn't even listed in the notes. very faint pink pepper – i have to sniff very hard to get a whiff of it. not for me, but beautifully blended otherwise!

Opens up juicy green and aquatic.
I guess it’s the lotus flower. It quickly settles down to a pleasant, sparkly, solar fragrance.
It’s closer to the original EDT than to the recent Nuit edition.
It’s a happy fragrance, slightly aquatic, great for summer and I totally agree - if you liked the original chypre edt but found it too strong - this is a great option to try.

In dry, cold winter weather: Fresh creamy jasmine with a pinch of sweetness in the opening. Classy and subdued. Getting sweeter as time goes by, at some point the jasmine is a little indolic, or maybe it's just a somewhat weird combination of jasmine and pepper. A bit spicy and dry in the drydown, maintaining the initial creaminess at the same time. Turns into a skin scent after 2,5h.

I like it, but I wish it were more unique. I will give it another go in spring as the dry and cold climate I'm experiencing right now is probably not doing it justice.

Warm spring: It is now far more powerful and very long lasting. It's the same creamy and fresh jasmine, but with a dominating aquatic scent to it that stays until the end. It's still in my hair after 18h.

I like this one. The jasmine is present but balanced through the other notes. It also has something green and fresh. Not nauseating at all, good daytime scent. It definitely takes a step back from generic designer frags and does something more unique.
Don’t own this one yet but I just tested it today and it is so beautiful. Very jasmine forward on me, I even was complimented as I walked around the mall.

Much more better version of Chloe Nomade EDT to my nose. Has the same vibe, but is more fresh and not nauseating. So if you like Nomade EDT, but find it too overpowering, this could be a great alternative.

Actually I got this sample by mistake, I was thinking that I would be getting another Nuit d'Egypte. That is the only one from Nomade flankers that I really enjoy. This one... So green, at the start it was promising, but no, it turns a bit bitter and def green. If I would smell this on someone, I wouldn't think that it is perfume, that I am smelling, but like some herbs or gardening stuff. an easy pass for me.

I purchased this without sampling, wasn’t really sure what to expect as this flanker seems to be getting some mixed reviews. Well, it arrived today and upon first sniff, I fell in love. It is so beautiful and classy. I actually like this better than Nomade Nuit d’Egypte, which I also have.

This Lumiere flanker is honestly not really similar to Nuit, this is a light, fresh, kinda aquatic, elegant jasmine with some noticeable green notes. (Whereas Nuit is more of a sweet, vaguely spicy orange blossom and vanilla.) Lumiere apparently has the same “spice” backbone as Nuit d’Egypte but I’m not really picking up on it. This will be a perfect spring/summer daytime fragrance.

I just received the sample in my order, and I think it's pretty alright (not my thing tho)
This one is a super creamy jasmine, it's not completely floral and get a slight green note, and a quite sour one, which is the red pepper. I'm really not a fan of pepper note sadly, but the overall is great.
Both of d'Egypte versions are ..good, without any doubt..What can I say? I have to be honest, they are well done! bravissimo!

Gorgeous summer scent!
An absolute favourite🥰

The Chloe Nomade line is my most favorite ever! That being said… Interestingly, this one is very sandalwood-heavy to me which is not my favorite, but does not come off “pickle-y” and blends well with the jasmine. I can’t discern the other notes in this one unfortunately.
Easy to reach for, very calm scent. I can't smell anything particular other than very fresh sparkly jasmine. Very calm version of jasmine with a hint of incense. It will wear nicely this summer.

This is so good! Bright, solar, aquatic, fresh, sweet and summery. I love it :) Perfect for spring and summer. It lifts my mood and I feel like I just wake up in a luxury resort by the french riviera, eating breakfast at the balcony. Sillage is moderate and it lasts on my skin for about 6-7 hours. Chic and elegant :)

Tried a sample today, this is a jasmine dominant scent but in a sweet and fresh way! Personally I really like floral fragrances that’s why I’m very into all the Chloe releases.

This opens with a very fresh aquatic lotus accord since it’s inspired by the Nile River it smells kinda veggie to me (?) like the one from Hermes Jardin series. It turns into a fruity jasmine in the middle stage kinda reminds me of Nomade EDT (my fav from the line) the pink pepper is missing from the middle notes from what I’ve smelt (some press release mentioned pink berries? Not quite sure which is correct but it smells quite fruity to me)

I think this flanker is a mixture of Nomade edt and the Nuit Egypt the middle stage really reminds a lot of the OG Nomade DNA but when it finally dry down on my skin I can detect the Nuit Egypt dna without the vanilla. It swifts between these two versions from time to time quite interesting! But the sweet fresh a bit vegetal jasmine lingers on my skin for a very very long time. Not sure is it a love but it is a like 👍🏻

EDIT: The more I wear the more I love this version!!!! so so good very fresh and aquatic at the same time, I used to hate lotus note as a very aquatic ingredient but in this it makes it more fresh and calm like other have said I like it very much! Hope this is not a limited edition if yes, I'm gonna buy backups!

Also received compliments twice from friend and co-worker!

It has the same base like "Nuit d'egypte", but way more spicier. I personnally don't like it because it has something "old aunt" like.

Jasmin intense was wonderfull, sweet and spicy, but not my typical type. Nuit d'egypte is my favorite one.
So excited about this!!! Just wanna say I really love the Nomade in blue color 👍🏻 so pretty
The OG Nomade Nuit d’Egypte Chloé was a lovely orange vanilla but underwhelmed on spice given the notes, I hope this one is a little punchier either with spice or resins.

Was launched in 2025.... fragrantica is time-traveling again. 😂

Although not a fan of Jasmine, curious to try though. I'm a big fan of Nomade Nuit D'Egypte. It's as close as a signature scent I'll ever come, just so easy for everyday wear.

Merry christmas!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: This isn’t my kind of rose — I actually don’t like how it comes across here. The pepper, however, is great and gives the scent a bold, addictive quality. I think it’s the pepper that keeps me interested, not the rose.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: We need a dupe for this one 😭😭😭so freakin classy!!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: I kinda thrifted this gem. It’s Chloe signature’s older and wiser sister. The pink pepper note is too prominent at first spray for my liking but it develops as a such a perfect creamy rose scent. Also sillage is hands down the best among the signature line. When you walk it leaves a beautiful rose trail after you.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: ı wish it released again

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
I loved this perfume and was so sad when they took it of the market!
Today I found a perfume that smells Excatly the same on me!! So if you loved Chloe intense just as much as I did, I highly recomend trying out “pure musk” from Ayat! The bottle is grey vevet and with gold details. 🤩 I sprayed it on my wrist 4 hours ago and I can still smell it and keep thinking of Chloe intense ❤️

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: Sooo clean and classy. One of the best perfumes

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: chloe why did you stop to produce chloe love andd chloe eau de parfum intense? they are elegant and so gorgeous..

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: Smells so beautiful and classy! Gorgeous!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
I really wished I had stock up on it when it was still available on the grey market. It's a very special scent that defined my late 20s and grew my interest for other fragrance notes beyond just floral or roses.

If more people had given it a chance to let it develop, you'll find that the initial mature and somewhat ageing rose opening slowly fades away and reveal a warming spiced honey tone. It has some similarity to the original EDP, but the Intense version has more special and exceptional quality to it, that I've yet seen it replicated in other fragrances. It's definitely a scent that wears better during the colder temperature or at night. In hotter climate, I find that it sometimes turns a little acidic on my body.
I have a very old 50ml bottle that is half used; the metal part of the perfume body was already tarnished beyond repair but i cherish it more than anything in my closet.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: I just love this scent. It doesn't smell like boring old roses, is so much more than that and I'm not a rose lover. I loved it on a friend and had to buy it. I have the EDT and EDP but this is my fav.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: Very similar to the original one. I don't smell the difference. Fresh and delicate.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: This has been sold out worldwide/discontinued:(

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: I generally at least like every rose scent I test, and Chloe is among my favourite designer perfumers, but unfortunately this is the odd one out in both regards. I think it's the "intense" that's the problem, at least for me: the sheer power of this fragrance combined with the extremely botanical character of the rose and the hefty dose of pink pepper make it borderline overpowering to my nose...especially when oversprayed, which is easy to do. It's a shame, because it does dry down to a very nice, luxuruous rose after a couple of hours, still realistic but in a way that's much easier to wear, powdery and subtly sweet. And in that incarnation it sticks around all day - a wonderful fall rose! So if it weren't for that opening I'd be tempted to put this on my wish list, but as it is I don't think I'd ever wear it...I guess I'll have to try to get a sample of the regular version instead!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: Hi! I have a brand new 1.7oz bottle with box for sell. PM me if interested.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: Chloé Intense is not really like Chloé Signature EDP. It’s different and quite peppery strong in its opening but settles into a powdery smell which is quite nice. There’s nothing peppery after the initial blast, it’s actually a powdery soapy scent with mildly spicy woody notes.I don’t love it as much as the Original but I like it a lot. Good sillage and lasting power.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
I got Chloe Intense as part of a bundle (along with L'Eau de Chloe), which I bought because the seller was destashing and selling really low. I normally dislike rose scents, the old-lady type of roses. Granted, I'm not really familiar with many rose fragrances, but whatever impression I had must have come from an unfortunate encounter with some rose scent of the type I mentioned.

Anyway, I was intrigued enough by Chloe's popularity that I decided to blind buy the bundle (I was getting a third perfume at half price along with it, something I was really keen on blind buying), even though it didn't include the classic Chloe EDP or EDT. I'd read up the notes and reviews here on Fragrantica, and thought they sounded interesting anyway.

Well, in spite of reading up first, I wasn't ready for the opening. Chloe Intense hit me harshly with an initial blast of pepper that almost physically hurt my nose. That was the greatest first impression it made on me when I tried it on my arm. It softened up later, but all I could remember from that time was the pepper. The only reason I didn't really regret getting it was because it was so cheap and came with L'Eau de Chloe (which I discovered I rather liked).

But remembering that it had a softer, less offensive dry down, I decided to use it today. (I would give almost any fragrance I acquire a chance and use it at least a full day or give it several hours' use.) Remembering the intense peppery opening, I applied a bit of Lush All Good Things solid perfume on my inner arms for just a touch of smoky sweetness. Then I sprayed on Chloe Intense.

As I sniffed it more closely and fully this time, I still got a peppery blast, but now I could detect a powdery rose underneath. It was not the old-lady rose I was wary of. It's still a strong opening; I agree with heather.h.weber about avoiding spraying so close to the face when trying it out. I still don't like that part so much, but the dry-down was better. It got smoother and woodier, and I found it quite soapy and clean.

However, while pleasant enough for me, it is still not really my type of scent. I could wear it occasionally, but I can't imagine reaching for this nearly as much as my other perfumes. It still isn't the rose for me.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: Initially I fell in love with the powdery element of this perfume and loved it. How wrong I was. After wearing a few times I found it hung around like an unwanted ex boyfriend. It began to feel so sickly, heady and uncomfortable. It lingered on me and my clothes, and everything I touched long after scrubbing myself in the shower. No, I did not over spray this, I only used a little. I soon found it unbearable and sold it on to someone who would appreciate it. Another thing to mention is that the lovely silver part of the bottle went tarnished in the end, so it is not something you can leave out on your dresser. Way too heavy and smothering for me.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
1.Long lasting - whole day, not in your face but just right. Very femenin fragrance.
2.Powder(ish), smoky and elegand. Makes you feel like a rich lady :) Red bag from Michal Kors, red lipstick and a good manicure, along with this beautiful fragrance - it will make your day perfect!
3.I get complements on this one all the time :)

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: I love Chloe edp, edt but Chloe Intense it's my favorite one !❤ pitty I can't find it anymore in stores ☹ I don't buy fragrances on line bcz of the fakes so....i'll keep searching for it !

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
I don't have chloe edp,so I can't make a comparison between these two
Chloe intense is a must have for all lovers of classic rose fragrances,it doesn't have dozens of notes as most of classics do but it has a complexity and class that brings a classic to mind
It's a heavy,heady rose,not a fresh and delicate one,it's mature,bold,almost dark and kind of old-fashioned rose blended with great amount of pepper,it's so peppery that makes my nose tinkle..I can't detect too much sandal or Tonka but for sure this peppery rose,lays on a strong,bittersweet woodsy base..as time passes there is less pepper and more balmy rose,which dries down to a quiet,soapy rose at the end
I don't know what's my feeling about it,I find it seductive and I love it's classic elegance but I find it too mature for me..it's not something I wear often but rarely I reach for it and love it,it's very charming in cold temperature and is definitely a winter scent for me
Longevity and sillage are amazing on my skin..just two sprays and it's well projecting even after hours
❤❤❤

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
I have the original Chloe EDP (which I adore), and Chloe EDT. On me, there is very little that distinguishes those two; but for longevity (EDP lasts longer, as expected), you wouldn't even be able to tell which one I have on.

Chloe EDP intense, though, I find nearly nothing like the original. I love this one, too.

On me, its rose is neither bouquet nor fresh-cut smelling. More like potpourri. It evolves to sandalwood that smells like the expensive sandalwood soap we used to reserve for guests at home. Then there's that hint of incense that happens to linger in the background.

Strangely, nothing spicy ever comes around to me.

At one point, my husband said it reminds him of a particular baby cologne; my daughter (she's my nose) said another time it reminds her of baby powder on my skin, but not on the card.

So it's potpourri-incense-sandalwood that is easy and fresh enough to remind my family of baby cologne and baby powder. This complexity is what makes me love it.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: It is still on Chloe's website, but in shops can't be found in Hungary.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
A magnificent perfume. Just stunning. It´s got something SO right in its spiciness that never gets sharp or too peppery. I have and love the original Chloe and first time I tried this Intense version I had imagined it being boring because it lacks litchi, which I adore in the original. Well, if Intense lacks litchi then there is something in the way Chloe treats the rose itself that is absolutely wonderful. Because I smell the kinship to the original, but while that one is brighter, fruitier and colder, this is warmer- but not too much- and certainly balsamic.
Later: According to Chloe, Chloe Intense DOES have litchi! And also... Well these: pink peppercorn, freesia, litchi, pink peony / creamy sandalwood, magnolia, rose petals, lily of the valley / tonka bean, amber, honey, cedar wood. That makes SO much more sense than the few notes listed here! Anyway, its woodiness is lovely and smooth and it lasts and lasts. I actually think I like it even more than the original because it´s just more versatile- Chloe original is more... strict in a strange way. The original is certainly fruitier, but like I said, also colder. Intense is alluringly deep, but never cloying. The rose and cedar... Mmmmmm! Big love for me. (Meanwhile- why do Fragrantica keep on posting the wrong notes or way too FEW notes? What is going on lately?

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
One of the freshest fragrances I have ever smelled.
Amazingly clean, fresh, feminine and lovely silage and longevity. Glad Chloe finally got it right. They nailed it with this one.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: The most beautiful sillage ever! First I smelled this fragrance in the subway, I loved it so much, so I asked the girl what kind of perfume she is wearing today. She answered, and I bought my happy bottle immediately. This fragrance is unique, it plays on the skins of every woman differently. I can feel the bitter notes from the previous versions of Chloe, but only in the beginning. Afterwards I smell beautiful amber, deep and cozy, spicy cedar and some kind of flower bouquet. This Chloe with the grey bow is just beautiful. It warms you during the long winter evenings, it sparkles on a fur coat, it embraces you in the summer moon nights... I love it!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: I like it... spicy rose smells... not too strong that giving others head ache.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
Oh dear I am not sure !!!!!
I just want to know that it is discountinued or not ????
It can be found very hard

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: Why why why is this discontinued. I don't understand. Is it possible to bring it back??????? P L E A S E ! ! !

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
Is it discontinued?
I love it so much

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: What a beauty! A spicy but smooth and creamy rose on a soft base of sandalwood! Very smooth and seductive, resinous and so classy. This is a woman's scent, grown up, deep and slightly sweet. The rose is present throughout but not on its own. The pepper note adds up spiciness that the tonka and sandalwood tame sufficiently alongside the cloud of Beautiful rose! It a scent appropriate for both work and evenings out. This is a true gem for spicy rose lovers!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
I usually wait at least few days to write reviews of my new scents so I don't gibber nonsense, but right now I'm too excited not to for my newly obtained Chloe Intense decant!!!

Firstly I don't understand the funeral flower analogy. You wouldn't call a woody fragrance heavy on sandalwood "smells like coffin", then why would a floral with heavier Australian sandalwood base smell like funeral? Chloe intense is so beautiful. It's much more grounded than Chloe EDP, but still fizzy with the pink pepper (no table pepper on me at all). I have always been annoyed by the green fruity base other Chloe fragrances in this line have, but in Chloe Intense that is perfectly taken out. It's just warm, a tad bit sweet, a barely burnt kind of rose. Lasts long but doesn't overpower the wearer. I'm 26 and I can wear this perfectly.

How do I compare this to other rose scents I tried in similar fashion? It is less smoky and less sour than Tauer Phi Une Rose de Kandahar, not as jammy like Jo Malone Velvet Rose and Oud, deeper than Chloe EDP without the fruitiness, not as pure rosy (cause of the sandalwood and tonka) compared to SL La Fille de Berlin, and completely different from the dirty Rose Anonyme by Atelier. If you dream about getting a big time complicated rose scent then you really miss the point of Chloe Intense: this is designed to be a warm, clean, and cozy fragrance that follows you from day to night. Simple as that.

Fruity floral and rose lovers stray, but pepper and sandalwood lovers do stay!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: i don't know why i dislike this so much. it just, it's really odd on me. it clings to me & never settles down, while that's good with some fragrances it just isn't with this one. also, the bottle ends up tarnished & looks awful.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
It smells like Chloe laced with lots and lots of pepper. And it smells like ordinary pepper from the dinner table. I will leave it to dry and see what happens.

UPDATE: The pepper fades after about half an hour and you are left with a rose that reminds me of old school beauty products from the 80s (face cream). It's a juicy, jammy, almost edible rose that's a little bit spicy.

I personally like it now that the pepper has gone away. It smells very expensive and makes me feel affluent and glamorous. I will provide a further update once I have worn this all over for one day.

UPDATE: I have now worn it all over for one day and the sillage is moderate along with the lasting power.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
More Mature than Chloe EdP! Darker Roses, Darker Sandalwood, deepwarm Peppernote and a hint of Tonka. A Little bit less powdery than Chloe EdP in a good way. Longlasting on my skin. Unsweet flowernote - this is for a grown-up woman, who knows what she wants and used to be in the middle of everything, Chloe Eau de Parfum Intense is not shy =).

Mer vuxen än Chloe EdP. Mörkare Ros, Mörkare Sandeltränot, djupvarm Pepparnot och en aning om tonka. Lite mindre pudrig än Chloe EdP, vilket jag gillar. Hållbar på min hud. Osöt blomnot, detta är en doft för den vuxna kvinnan, som vet vad hon vill och är van att vara mittpunkten överallt. Chloe Eau de Parfun Intense är inte blyg =).

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
Just testing it today. Nothing similar to original Chloe edp.
Chloe Intense smells very strange, like (soory it's lovers)funeral flowers...

I don't find rose here, nothing sweet, nothing calming.
Nothing...

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
I’ve tried several Chloes in the past years and, even though most (if not all) of them were very pleasant, I never made my mind about committing to a bottle. When I was offered this in a swap, I thought “well, why not?” and I am really happy I got it.

Chloe Eau de Parfum Intense has, as listed notes: rose, pink pepper, sandalwood and tonka, all of them are notes I like, but in my opinion, the final result is better than the sum of its parts.

It opens with a full blast of rose, which is neither green nor crisp. To my nose, it smells like a rose potpourri. I like rose perfumes in all of its incarnations, but this is one form I had not found so far.

A few minutes into the drydown, the sandalwood and tonka come to play, giving it a slightly smoky and jammy aspect, not quite sweet. Sweet (not sugary) comes later in the drydown, once the pink pepper starts to disappear. From that point on, it remains linear, but in a good way.

The silage is moderate, at least in winter. I did easily 6 spritzes and my husband only commented (positively) on it when I stuck my wrist under his nose. The longevity, on the other hand, is outstanding… 12h +.

The bottle is pretty, classic, but I don’t care about the ribbon. I actually had it turned to the back of the bottle to avoid getting it soaked in perfume each time I spritz.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: I own both Chloe EDP and Chloe Intense and i love both. But I think i love this a little bit more. The Chloe rose with soft pepper and woody tones. It's very feminine, classy and warm. Good projection and longevity. Why is this discontinued? Have to stock up fast.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: Absolutely lovely. Blind buy but no regrets. Recognisable Chloe edp scent but somehow brighter, and almost citrusy tangy to my nose. Another winner for this Chloe girl!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: Deep sensual scent. Very feminine. I´m 25 and it was blind buy for me. I was affraid that it will be very "mature" scent, but it´s not :) perfect for evening.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
I have just blind bought based on the reviews here, and wow.
I cannot thank everyone enough!!! Straight to the top of my 'in love with' pile.
Beautiful balmy tea rose and feeling of sitting cosy in a church full of the most beautiful incense. Shame they didnt make a body lotion....
Willing to buy/swap with anyone who wants rid. Praying its never discontinued.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
I quite liked this one at first spray - different from the other two Chloé perfumes ! (EDT and EDP).

Well, this was the impression that I had when I tested it for the first time : I remember the Chloé rose, but it was somehow darker, the pepper was fizzy, and the backdrop was a smooth wood.

So I semi-blind bought just now, several months later. The first spray is true to my memory, a peppery woody rose, a cousin to La Fille de Berlin by Serge Lutens. But within the hour, the pepper and woods evaporate, and leaves the signature Chloé EDP smell for the next 12+ hours...(still counting)

Overall, I still like it - I've always liked the Chloé rose: bright, soapy, leaves a distinct trail. I just never got it because everyone and their teenage daughter has and wears it too. Disappointed that the first unique burst doesn't last, but this will be getting a lot of wear nonetheless - layering and lazy happy tea-and-a-book days.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: A soft powdery giddy peach-rose scent. For laid back romantic sunny days with a soft breeze.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
I wouldn't normally like any rose fragrances, but I got it ages ago at a time when I was becoming more interested with perfumes. Once a few years back, I sprayed it in a notebook and when you opened the pages (even from feet 6 away) the scent of this mixed with the notebook paper softly wafted through the air. For that reason specifically, this perfume is exceptionally memorable to me. I let the mist fall over all the notebooks I have now, and even the very first notebook I sprayed it in still smells just like Chloe.
The tenacity is ridiculous.
9/10

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
This one is very similar to the original Chloe, but for some reason I like the original better.
It's a little stronger and I seem to prefer lighter scents in general.
I can sense sandalwood and pepper in it, besides rose.
Nice, fashionable and modern perfume in a cute bottle.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: So much love for this scent. The reason I don't wear it too often is because of how well it stays on your garments. I like to change fragrances pretty much everyday and sometimes between day and night - so if I wore chloe intense... I would have to just keep wearing chloe intense, which isn't the worst thing XD definitely get a bottle.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: My husband calls this my "Cleopatra" scent. I guess I can see why- sexy and sophisticated. A true spicy rose, with more emphasis on the "spicy" than the "rose"

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
Absolutely gorgeous! Has the same foundation as Chloe EDP but it's grown up and more sophisticated. Where Chloe EDP hit me hard in the nose with it's white floral effervescence in the opening; Chloe Intense caressed and beckoned me. On paper, Chloe Intense initially is all pepper and Roses but these two just work with my skin and lose all the sharp edges quickly. Act 2 develops into resinous notes that are very, very sexy. This is where Chloe Intense shines. Sadly, it doesn't last long on my skin. 2 hours in and Chloe Intense has dried down to a light, close to the skin musk almost identical to Chloe EDP. Very soapy overall. Great, because 10 hours later I still smell fantastic but I want that initial burst of "Intense" to linger a bit longer.

I don't feel like Chloe Intense is rich enough to be solely a cooler weather scent. It's August in Texas and my nose is very particular depending on the weather. That said, Chloe Intense hasn't bothered me in the least. It's simply beautiful and I think it could work for most seasons and day or night.

Projection is not huge. Dies down pretty close within a few minutes. I can get away with 2-3 sprays and not be offensive.
Longevity: it definitely lasts and lasts. Just not the way I want it to.

In spite of a few flaws, I think Chloe Intense is quickly becoming one of my favorites. I can't wait until the weather cools to see how she develops. Also might work well layered with a longer lasting linear rose scent like Jo Malone's Red Roses or Perfumer's Workshop Tea Rose.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: Is it really being discoutinued? Somebody please tell me.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: So in love with this soapy scent, no much flowers and no fruits, pure warm.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: Hello everybody, i have to tell you that i don´t like chloe chloe edp at all. i told to mysel that this is only fragrance i dont want to wear. BUT ... i tried this one - chloe INTENSE and im totaly fell in love. Its another fragrance than chloe chloe, maybe similar in something but for me its more spicy than chloe chloe. For me its absolutely surprising and i got my new bottle few days ago and im satisfied. Silage is extremly good and smell is rich and elegant. God bless chloe chloe intense :-D

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: Hi Perfume collectors. Please note that this perfume is being discontinued. I could not find it in Melbourne at Myer or DJ's. Therefore, you may need to stock up on this one, if you love it. I think this a fantastic fragrance. I was told by the perfume ladies that Chloe has decided to discontinue this perfume and it will not longer be available soon. So if you find it online or at a Chemist, try to grab it. It has a lovely floral, retro smell which lingers for over 12 hours on clothes. When I wear this perfume I think of class, elegance and happiness. It is a masterpiece for all perfumistas who love, sweet, floral and strong fragrances.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: This reminds me of my grandmother and that's a good thing. When I was a little girl I remember her vanity with her perfumed body powder, her toilette water, the clean soapy scent of her skin. This is what Chloe Intense smells like to me. A powdery slightly woody rose that makes me nostalgic. I love this so much because of how it makes me feel and the memories it evokes. I would describe this as a romantic perfume. I would never call this (or any perfume) old lady because it's insulting to the perfume and women. Mature and romantic is a much better description.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: I must agree with the previous reviewers: This is indeed the elder and mature sister of Chloe. Also, smells like church rose incense. I regret getting this intense version, I think the former version is clean, elegant, bright and cozy, while this one is so heavy. I try to wear it in the winter and enjoy it 1-2 hours after spraying, when the heart notes are more similar to Chloe eau de parfum.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
I looooove the Chloe EDP (2008), I've made it my everyday scent as its such a clean fresh fragrance, I find it energising, with good staying power and its suitable for work. I had an idea this Intense version might be a sexier, more sultry interpretation of what I like about Chloe, maybe more suitable for evening. NO. I bought a sample, sprayed it on my wrist, allowing the liquid to dry so as to avoid alcohol-induced anosmia- and breathed it in. Holy resinous roses dying on the bush, Batman! I made my coworker take a whiff -"WHOA,' she said. "Put that in a cupboard and come back for it in thirty years." This is not my lovely Chloe's adventurous older sister, it's her great-aunt. Miss Havisham's place smelled like this stuff, I know it. I went back to the same coworker three hours later. "It's WORSE! It's even OLDER!"
Oh, well.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: I tried three perfumes in Takashima-ya this afternoon, and Chloe was by far the winner, again. Their line of perfumes are super feminine. I have always loved, loved everything about being a woman, so yes, this is what appeals to me. It reminds me strongly of Chloe eau de parfum, although the top notes here are rose and tonka beans, whereas the main notes in the eau de parfum to me are rose and lychee. Chloe has stolen my (womanly) heart.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
Intense indeed , but gets smooth and powdery dreamy dark rose after some time its a lovely rose , pepper and balmy spice
like a... - creation of God !
Sorry. - creation of Chloe. of course .
Lovely, spicy and a little boozy feeling but so subtle it placed itself right up on top shelf . in a second !
Thanks desireegascon for a splendid swap !
Update
I love this and are truly addicted !
It starts kind of raw smelling of pergament or carnation maybe.. . the rose is dusty and dry in an oldfashioned way but is oh soo trendy and has little or no sweetnes .It becomes a really lovely balmy spice and rose scent in the drydown. Must admit I don't fancy the other edp.edt or leau but looove the intense version !
Different and simply gorgeous !
If its not gonna be taken of market this will stay with me forever - that good
Best rose ever.not to strong spicey or sweet.♡♡♡
Update: One of my favorite scents ever , heard its discontinued - better start stocking up !!!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: You were nice and long lasting, but tooo balmy for me, bye-bye, have a new home and be nice to a new mommy, I hope your replacement will be nice to me.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: Ok, I'm a guy and I tried out this fragrance just for the fun of it and all I can say is it was a wow moment, simply gorgeous.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: Intensely Balmy, heavy,long lasting, reminded me church essence, can be night or day time frag, classy, very recommended. I have a bottle available for swap.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
This is a fragrance that I have previously reviewed back when I first purchased it. My nose was not good at picking up the complexity of this fragrance, but today I felt the need to write a new one. It has been such a long time since I have worn this fragrance, I think its been a few months now. Reaching for some familiar on certain days really works some magic. Chole Intense is a fragrance which I wear sparingly because I do not want to run out of it anytime soon.

It is still amazingly beautiful! It surprised me though because, I can smell a lot more in it now than I was ever able to before today. A distinct honey rose vibe is still there (which might be the soapiness that everyone else is smelling), but it no longer smells like rosewater to me like it used to. The pink pepper popped up and enhanced the rose without ever becoming overpowering. Chloe Intense is spicier now and a little more complex, but its still a simple fragrance. The dry down is a soft sandalwood rose blend that is a little balmy.

I might be a little crazy, but this is still a year around favorite of mine. It really matters on how you apply so it does not become too overwhelming. On me its a very soft fragrance it lasts forever on my skin and does not have a big sillage, more of an intimate scent.

Honestly, some of the simplest fragrances are some of the most beautiful. A nose does not always need to be challegd to make a scent interesting. I also did not realize before today that this is the fragrance that the people around me recognize as my scent. If they smell the bottle they think of me. This would make Chole Intense my signature scent and I finally am willing to acknowledge it though it had been hiding in my collection for over a year. Sometimes you just can no longer deny what makes you feel good. <3

I love my Chloe Intense and I am glad my nose appreciates it more now then it has ever before.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
It's very nice fragrance, for a long time on my wish list. Today I erased it, because altough is nice, lovely fresh rose, I've got a feeling it could be boring as soon I buy a full bottle.

After wearing it for a few hours I realized it's similar to Cabaret! Well, at least on me...

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: I'm so in love with this one, and finally have it in my collection. Few drops on my neck and I can smell it the whole day, the whole day of freshness and good mood. Increddible longlasting and not causing headache at the same time. Finally a longlasting scent with great silage and without vanilla!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: Pot-pourri with red rose petals with plastic undertone. Where is this balminess? All i get is soapy heavy rose.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: In my skin is really musky - comfy and soft musk. I love it. Surprised it doesn't have any musk notes...

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: Both Chloe edp and Chloe edp Intense are now on my wishlist... I have been spending quite some time today in the perfumery stores just to smell almost every perfume they had... And this one ended up being in my top 5 :) Chloe Intense appears to be a sweeter and warmer version of the original Chloe, I really like this one a lot!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: Intensely Balmy, heavy,long lasting, reminded me church essence, night time frag, classy, very recommended.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: Incredibly balmy and soapy fragrance. The best one of Chloe range I would say, but nothing sexy, nothing gripping, just an everyday clean smell, recognisable on every woman. Regretted buying it and sold it after a week.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: I bought this at Marshall's for a reasonable price. Not complaints here.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
Chloe intense is a wonderful soapy peppery rose scent with a very soapy-sandalwood dry down.I agree with Vie_Cafe about how stong this scent can be to the point of suffocation. I agree to try applying to your wrists and maybe lower on your chests before trying around the neck, so close to the face. It can be a bit overpowering.
It is a very very fresh soapy sent, I image lots of rosey peppery suds. I like this fragrace and think is is a wonderful interpretation of a rose fragrance.
This fragrance lasts and lasts!
Fresh, Feminine, Clean and Classy! ;)

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
This is a very nice perfume, rosy, balmy, calming.
I sprayed it on in the shop and loved it, but when i got home i just smelled a sandalwood bomb which gave me a headache. And when i tried it again yesterday, it was the same. I can still smell it on my jacket that i wore that day and it smells great, also on paper it smells great. Just not on me :( :( :( But i really recommend to try it, because when it fits you it's one of the most beautiful scents!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: I currently have this scent and I really like it. It's very long lasting, because it's still there with me the next day. I don't have to use much, which is good because here it's a pricey scent. The rose is prominent. To me it's a younger rose like Paul Smith's rose, which I like much. Also the powder comes with it, soft and comfortable. In the drydown at the end of the day I can smell something like a light Tova Signature. It's a little soapy, but not in the unpleasant way - and the rose still lingers. I really like this one :-)

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
My boyfriend picked this parfum for me and I bought it day after our marriage. And it became my signature scent. I love the sandalwood rose with a hint of pink pepper. It is so full and rich and expensive. Luxury in the bottle. I wish they would make a real parfum out of it. I would purchase in that very second.
For me it's 10/10.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: This fragrance is all about the classic beauty of the rose, so elegant and womanly and so French. I feel this perfume should be worn with a silk shirt, pencil skirt and high heels. It is for the woman who is demure on the outside, but a little bit naughty underneath.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: My signature perfume. lovely and elegant.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
The best thing I have ever owned in my life. If it is missing on me, I am not complete; I tend to be very aggressive when I am not wearing it. The strong yet delicate rose makes me calm. It makes me who I am.
A few spritzs last for 5-6 hours on me. For a few minutes the pink pepper overpowers the balmy rose, but when it is settled I feel like I'm home.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
A quite invigorating fresh floral, which is an older sister of Chloe EDP, which lasts on the skin and has most of the hallmarks of its predecessors...

I applied 6 heavy sprays

0 - 1 Hour. 1.25 foot of strong projection. I am so easily trapped by the comparison to Chloe EDP; this intense version replaces the over done soapiness of the EDP with little pink pepper tingling spice bombs which may persist longer or shorter for some.. it is more mature than the EDP, perhaps 42- 68, yet who cares about age..

1 Hours -2 hours - 8 inch projection. I realise that the soapiness of the EDP is what makes Chloe EDP that special, I realise now.. This intense version has replaced the soapiness with a more refined and noble spicy mix - with the soul of Chloe intertwined; yet taking away the soapiness removes the alluring magic of Chloe and the dualness of soapiness and fresh floral has gone... What a masterpiece Chloe EDP is...

2 hours - 6 hours. 3 inch projection. So similar now to Chloe EDP

6 hours - 9 hours - 2 inch projection. Linear, keeps going, some trails stretching 8 inches

9 hours - 12 hours. Close to the skin, that wonderful Chloe smell

I love both, but prefer Chloe EDP

Very good

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
I guess I've found the ONE. An amazing perfume, just has it all!
People compliment a lot and I often hear that it smells somehow... nostalgic.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
Every now and then even commercial perfumery launch highly meaningful perfumes on market not just ridicously expensive pinky fruity candy baskets. And not just overclean, polished florals.
Previous Chloe is just that: a well made, elegant-refined floral with a modern twist. Good job, but not enough for my wild tastes.
Original old Chloe was much wilder in its old-fashioned tuberose kick.
Now I happened to smell this Eau de Parfum Intense while exercising (shelf crawling) and immediately thought: "Wow! Now this is perfume!"
For reference think that I come from Idylle and L'Instant, Stella and Organza, Montale Ouds and original Poison and much before from long-term relationship with beloved Samsara (pre-reformulation) and Amarige (also old formula)...
So you might guess simple waters are not my style, even if I find them pleasant in summer, preferably old school colognes.
Chloe Eau de Parfum Intense gives me just the right impact I need to feel with perfume: ultra-feminine, strong and vaguely oriental. There is a thin line between intensity and suffocation. I guess that line changes for everyone and in the same person according to changes of life.
Yes, I smell rose here but not as the only core of the blend. I think that sandalwood is what intrigued me. The heart of this composition is about rose-sandalwood-sweet spice. I hardly believe that the listed notes are complete. It seems to me that they represent only the core of scents.
For me this scent is a solid chance of buying a perfume which is both new (too many memories in my old scents) and satisying at the same time.
I managed to have a sample. I see FB purchase...

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
I do love intense floral scents...but the original Chloe Chloe was somehow hard for me to love. The reformulation was just unbearable. I moved over to Chloe Narcisse and found it better. But it was never love. So when I saw all the positive reviews here for Chloe Eau de Parfum Intense that mentioned "rose" I was confused. I love rose scented perfumes! But I don't remember rose being prominent in Chloe.

Then I saw CEdP Intense at Marshall's for a semi-reasonalbe price. My most expensive blind buy...based totally on everyone's reviews. And I have not been steered wrong. This is a lovely scent. It starts with a waft of pink pepper and rose which seems like it will quickly dry down to nothing. But no! I am instead enveloped in a soft yet penetrating cloud of sweet pure rose and spicy pepper that gradually admits a shadowy but persistant sandalwood. And it lasts forever. I am in love.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: Amazing. On top of this, I got it for the bargain price of $50 at Marshalls, only to pick up another bottle on clearance for $20 at TJ Maxx... SCORE. I did not care much about the original Chloe Eau de Parfum-- it just smelt WAY too clean for me, if that makes sense. I know clean can be sexy too, but it was so clean that it wasn't very appealing to me. This one on the otherhand is such a joy. It starts with an almost unusually heavy blast of pepper paired with dewy rose in full bloom, at the height of its fragrance. And it continues until the familiar "soapy"-ness of the original Chloe appears. But because of the lingering pepper notes and balmy-ness of the base notes, it stays interesting. It is a very classic (but not in a grandma kinda way) and "put-together" kinda scent. But it has enough edge that you will believe this woman often spends her Saturdays at some private party where the walls are decorated with black velvet.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: Absolutely gorgeous, rich, elegant scent! I love it!! I feel very chic wearing it. Classy and feminine! Amazing staying power and quality! LOVE!!!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
True red rose,sharp smell, not sweet on me at all.
Could easily fit a man, plus for that.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
The intense version is a completely different thing from the EDP. Gone is the rose bush sprinkled with raindrops amid the green garden.
First, the sillage of Intense is a bit more reserved, or so it seems until it seamlessly deploys its balmy notes. The rose - a powdery deep dark old-fashioned one, enters the stage through a warm veil of pepper. As time goes, the rose becomes quiet and makes place for tonka and I can definitely smell the sandalwood. The pepper persists in a more delicate warm way. There is something very classic and mature about this scent, a bit gothic even. I like it but I prefer by far the freshness of the EDP. I also think they went wrong with the black ribbon - it makes me think of mourning. A dark red one would be much better and still adequate to this dramatic fragrance.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
Bought a bottle yesterday --thought sure I'd love it-- and returned it today feeling very disappointed indeed. Wish I'd tried a sample first as this is definitely a "try before you buy" fragrance.

Roses and damp wood, that's all my nose perceived. On my skin the rose was too musty & dusty... like a bouquet of dark, dark red roses that's been in the vase for a few days. I like my roses either fresh or sultry and unfortunately, this was neither. The woody notes were too similar to the smell of my garden shed that has a leaky roof so it always smells damp and vaguely moldy -- not a smell I want on my skin.

Reminds me very much of Cabaret by Gres, which didn't work on my skin either.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
On my skin this is a balmy, sweet, honeysuckle rose. I love all the chloes (edt, edp, intense) but this one is more sensual, at least for me, and puts me in a seductive mood. I find it unbearable to wear in the warmer weather due to its thick and balmy nature but it is suitable for me to wear occasionally in the fall, winter, and cool spring nights.

edit: I love wearing this in warm weather! Warms up nicely on the skin in the heat. Very intoxicating! Can be too heady if overly applied

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: has it been discountinued???! Cause no shops seem to have it anymore. What a disapointment - Chloe seems to kill off all good perfumes they make (like Innocence).

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: I love this one. It is marvellous, by far one of the best perfumes out there. You cannot compare it to the vast majority of the other so called perfumes selling these days. It is in a different league. This is a perfume and brings the concept back, reminding one of what a good perfume is like, apparently vastly forgotten. You sniff it together with practically any other perfume out there and see the difference. Beautiful scent, and on the top, classy and sophisticated. I do not think you get classier and morre sophisticated than this. Better on a mature woman. I like it much better than Chloe edt or edp. It is quite different, although a variation on the same theme. You can smell Chloe Edp (or edt) in the background, but there is more to it. Pink peppery harsh powdery airy rose scent rises from that background as the atmosphere overlays the ground. This is a piece of art, a really valuable addition to the world, something which surpasses what nature has to offer without the contribution of mankind. But at the same time it is constructed along the lines of classical perfumery and feels like part of it. There is no concession to current trend here, despite th pink pepper, because it does have in this perfume a different character, a much more subttle presence. It is too expensive, although this one is probably one of the few perfumes worth the price it sells for. I would like to know who is the perfumer. Amazing perfume.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: dreamy absolutle fantastik!!!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: It's fantastic

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: Amazingly delicious perfume. Stays the whole day on my skin wrapping me with its very elegant and chic vibe. Very glad I've bought it.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
My husband bought it for me as I was fed up with him to comment negatively on nearly every perfume I recently bought. He become so sensitive to nearly every fragrances finds them to strong and to offensive but I do love unique,brave and feminine at the same time. I spotted them on duty free as we both had a chance to choose something together.I gave him few options and he choose this one.
Well,I wanted to pleased him and I agreed to Intense. I like them but dont love them. I know if they will go I wont buy them again.
