This is very modern fragrance,strong and in my opinion not for winter.The rose has been covered with pepper to much and I can not figure it out what I dont like about it. My husband,I dont think is pleased with them any more but we found new beautiful fragrance together not from Chloe though.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: I expected something more from the version called "intense". Also I think it's rather average smelling and the price is too high.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: I feel sad this is not for me. It smell awful on my skin, like powder detergent.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
Chloe- Chloe Intense

This is the perfect kind of Rose fragrance and I have thoroughly enjoyed all the 4 Chloe scents that have been released in this gorgeous bottle however though Intense sits at the top of the ladder not only for its strength in character and staying power but the fact that for my nose and my tastes the Rose in this fragrance is not as mute as it is in the original Eau de Parfum. I dont think I'll go into the notes of this fragrance because it is pretty much just Rose and Sandalwood with a thin and warm layer of Pink Pepper in the drydown which gives it a linear sort of quality. However people may feel about this scent I think its a Triumph for the Chloe brand and I think that its unusual representation of the Rose scent is beautifully done. It is quite pricey here in Australia but it is worth every cent.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
Beautiful powdery rose, soft and smooth, with a pronounced sandalwood/tonka/powder drydown. It is very long lasting, but the projection is not very good; surely not as good as the edp, which has a longer trace. I have both versions, and I find this one to be actually smoother, while the edp is crispier and has better silage.
They are both beautiful and really, two different interpretation of a rose scent, as opposed to this one being the 'intense' version of the other one. I love them both equally. The rose in both is dominant, yet somehow the edp is more rosy and green, fresher. This is softer, more voluptuous, eluding less energy than the edp, but warmer. Simply put, the edp is a cold scent, the intense is a warm scent.
Slightly spicy, the pepper never comes strong on my skin, the oriental feel of this one comes more from the warmth is gives, probably the sandalwood with a slight vanillic tint.
The bottle is similar, with different color ribbon; the top part is supposed to be coated with real silver, which might explain why it turned really black, just like silver jewelry. It can be easily cleaned and brought back to shine with the same solution used to clean jewelry, diluted with some water. Personally I don't like the ribbon, which I find ugly and getting in the way of the sprayer mechanism.
Overall, for fans of roses like myself, I recommend trying all versions before deciding; the only version I didn't enjoy was the edt; the rose edition is pretty much a copy from the edp. And the intense is a soft powdery creamy rose scent. Excellent!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: Rose is about the only thing I can smell here. If you love a good rose scent, this would be perfect. The rose is very nicely done, creamy and sensuous. I don't find this perfume intense and I certainly don't detect any similarities with the original Chloe EDP which to me smells mostly like honey.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
This is my favorite winter perfum ever!! Its perfect!
I cant stop myself smelling it...really adictive.
And it lasts decades...;D

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: I've just tried this one. So far i am impressed, keep sniffing my wrist with pleasure ;-) I think i like it a lot. And the bottle was also very pretty by the way..

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: For me it is floral the rosy and the litchy note is quite obvious... not so much oriental...A romantic rosy feminine fragrance that is quite easy to wear.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: I smelled something herbal or like pine... each nose is different, but that is the impression I got. Perhaps it's the rose and tonka combined. If you mix certain notes in perfumery, you can mimic the scent of other things. It's been done for years, but with this it's a miss for me personally. Update: 8/1/12 I saw this in TJ Maxx today and almost bought it, until I remembered that I didn't care for it. They never get regular Chloe or Love Chloe, sadly.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
This is the perfume that everyone talks about. When I wear it I am inundated with compliments.So many
compliments received... well deserve it.

The smell is so personal and deep, I like it on me so much.It is so modernist, so much in vogue just made for this time- young, fresh,sexy and confident.

This is my signature smell, just shame that is on the high street and can be purchased by everyone.... just wanted it for me. Love Chloe Intense!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
OMG, this scent is incredible! I am completely addicted. I sprayed a bit on my wrist the other day thinking in a few hours I'd realize it was nothing special, but the opposite happened. I was sniffing my wrist well into the night and all of the next morning (longevity is outrageous!). I washed my hands very carefully in order to avoid washing the scent off. I finally realized that I needed to take a shower and could not avoid washing it off. I couldn't stand the thought of washing it away forever, so I went out and splurged on a bottle--now I will NEVER be without! Haha!

Imagine the scenario: You are walking home with a fresh, warm baguette on a cold, dark, rainy day. Through the foggy gray haze, a bright and colorful flower shop catches your eye. You walk in and admire the bouquets of freshly cut white roses, with the dew still on them. Later that night, after you and your date finish a romantic dinner, you go back to his place to get cozy by the fire, his nose gently brushing your bare neck....

This is the same scenario that goes through my mind every time I wear it. The strongest note is rose, but it's a fresh, crisp rose, not an old Victorian one. A light dusting of powder gives it a delicate nakedness that makes you want to bear your soul. It's romantic, intriguing, sensual, uninhibited, 100% woman. It's perfect for day and night--and especially for getting intimate!

Until I found Chloe, my favorite rose scent was Ce Soir ou Jamais by Annick Goutal, which is deeper and more traditional. They are both beautiful but very, very different. I think Chloe is a lot more unique, modern, and fresh.

UPDATE: Wore it on a date recently, and I've never had such an amazing reaction. As soon as he caught a whisper of my perfume, he looked like I'd hit him in the face and he could barely manage to ask what perfume I was wearing through his stuttering. There was no rain, no baguette, and no fire...but his nose was most definitely brushing my bare neck! ;)

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: I have not been so intrigued by a perfume since 1992 when I first smelt Red Door... Chloe Intense is one of those that has staying power! I tried some yesterday on my hand/wrist, and it just stayed on forever, its notes changing over the hours that went by! The lovely comments i received upon wearing this new perfume was great! Its awfully costly, but well worth the investment as i dont see it as the type of perfume to wear everyday to the office, but its perfect for evening wear or very special occassions. Will definately be getting a bottle soon! And the bottle is just the cutest thing ever!! :-)

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: I tried this in a duty free shop along with onther fragrances and I must say that is by far one of the best I have ever tried. I am a big fan of masculine fragrances, my favourite being Elixir de merveilles, therefore I was delighted to find another one that has quite a msculine smell. If at first is seems a bit outdated, later it develops into smth unique and outstanding. Rose? No way!!! Pink pepperish? Definately!! Strong and intense, with a great sillage, Chloe is for the bold, classic ones.Do give it a try!

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: I was really surprised to hear this is based on rose; having sprayed on a vast quantity in store and lived with it for a day, it has immense staying power and a unique fragrance I cannot describe but which is dry, potent, powdery-sweet-but it does not to me come across as particularly floral but as a warm dry intriguing, incensy invocation of something I cannot put my finger on.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
Smth to add,

It is really long lasting compared to 2 other Chloes EDP and EDT.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: This perfume makes you feel DONNA or FEMME, a sophisticated one and pure as white roses....I would classify it as very aristocratic kind of perfume...

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
My beloved Beau selected this fragrance for me. He was very decisive between Chloe new and intense, he loved the intense. It was one I never thought he'd go for but after a spritz on my wrist he wouldnt remove his nose which was quite amuzing since we were shopping inner city.
Recently I had another test of the intense and myself couldnt stop smelling myself, I ordered it yesterday :-)
Funnily enough, my neighbour had a similar story wth Chloe new... Her beau stole the scented paper off of her! she ordered it from me lastnight
Its lovely to smell good for your boy xx

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
Chloe Intense, is a stronger yet not so different version of the original Chloe.

If I had to describe the scent, Chloe Intense is an old-fashioned bar of rose scented soap or that refreshing and homely smell of freshly washed linen.

This is a rose scent that has been emulated and ultimately popular for many years. Despite its very feminine and somewhat classic appeal, Chloe Intense cannot seem to capture me or make me fall in love with it.

It has a strange fizzy quality in the opening that actually makes me sneeze. After that momentary allergy, I become almost anosmic to this fragrance. An hour later, once settled, I can smell the prominent soapy rose which doesn't develop much further from this.

Chloe Intense is a pretty, one-sided fragrance, that appears to be too conservative and too lady-like for my personal tastes. I did, however enjoy wearing this fragrance for the duration that it lasted, which was well over six hours. I don't think I'll be re-visiting this one again though.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: I absolutly love the Chloe Intense, yes def a rose smell, and i find the staying power super, have been asked so many times about it.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
Weird making Intense version of EDP imo. I thought it'll be the same, but more intense, but it's actually different.

It took time for me to admire Chloe EDP. Nice rose and litchi mix. Appealing color theme and bottle itself that I would place in my room even just as accessory.

EDP Intense greeted me with such a rose soap. Not very nice one, but it was gone fast and didn't spoil my impression. Later it develops into rose + pepper and tonka. Quite spicy and mature. Might appeal someone, but I still adore more fragile tenderness of just EDP.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: Hmm.... Quite disappointing...It smells like a Rosy Soap :(

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
I loved Chloe EDP, and now discovering Chloe EDP Intense is like be introduced to a much rounder, luxary and still have the original elegance version of the Chloe EDP.

It starts with a burst of clean rose, in a similar manner as the EDP, but the rose is much softer and powdery in a certain way, and reminds me of old luxary rose soap.

Soon I can detect a lot of red pepper, which works really well with the rose and makes the rose even more fresh and elegant. The pink pepper and rose are such a power couple! However, the pink pepper could be a little bit heavy for hot days. So cooler weather will be perfect for letting this perfume bloom.

The dry down is quite woody in a deeper and kinda intoxicating way due to the sandalwood.

It's worth trying if you like Chloe EDP but want more depth. However, be aware of the pink pepper, in this perfume pink pepper goes til the end and somehow personally I find it a little bit 'out' and harsh.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
Did not like this & to me it did not do the EDP or EDT any justice & i have both.
Save your nose from its sharp, acidic & sneeze-inducing initial blast.
IMO intense should have had more heady notes & more intense oriental flava to it.
Could hardly smell any rose, which is a disappointment.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: I had great expectations of the new Chloe. I am quite dissappointed. I can smell roses, but nothing happens there. I expected a glass of bubbly champagne and the champagne was already flat...

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content: I tested this today and I am not liking this at all. I smell honey sweetness from the initial blast as well, even more prominent than the rose which I can't stand. To my nose, it doesn't appear modern at all, seems very old fashioned, somebody who has failed to keep up with times, not in a good-classic sort of way. In the drydown I am only smelling rose and honey (or a very cloying sweet note) and nothing else. Sorry guys, I am sticking to the original Chloe EDP. Have yet to test EDT.

product_name: Chloé Eau de Parfum Intense Chloé
review_content:
I think that story describing latest three Chloe editions (EDT, EDP and Intense) can be named “meet the good, better and the best”. The order of them I leave to each of you to choose.

I have to mention that all three are utterly feminine, classy and tasteful. Basic difference between them is strength and silage, but apart from that their composition is based on same note of finest rose. Women wearing Chloe can be mother, friend, lover, worker, boss and diva. In my opinion they stand in must have section!

I bought this overpriced purse spray today. I had to try it as I have the other three as well. The powdery notes are missing in this one making it smell more like Pull & Bear Phyillis and Love Chloe Intense than regular LOVE Chole EDP.

Yes the body of Love EDP is there with the Orange Blossom and Pink pepper, BUT the powdery notes in the original is what ties the whole thing together giving it that classic, old school, feminine feel.

If you are a collector and have the urge to purchase this and don't want the powdery note, GO FOR IT. Otherwise don't waste your money.

Judging by the notes listed on Fragrantica, this one is less powdery. Notice that the powdery notes in the base have been removed? So maybe there is a slight difference between this and the original. The accords at the top are different too. This is allegedly fresher, spicier, and vanillic, which I know the original is not.

I wish I could get my hands on this!

same as the edp but in a special bottle, for women that want to retouch through the day. I love it. so sad it was discontinued. Hope someday the make a special edition...very feminine, very elegant and discrete.
i believe this is the same perfume only in a purse spray bottle, so why do we have it 2 times in the database?
Mmmm! Lovely dry mimosa scent with a strong woody base. I think it has some amberwood in the base which gives me a bit of headache but the floral part is amazing! Follow me on ig: scent.guide

Selling within the UK my 150ml bottle of Herba Mimosa with its original box and the receipt from Liberty. Please DM me if interested.

While I LOVE this creamy mimosa delicate masterpiece (see my previous raving review), I have learned the hard way that it does not compliment my acidic skin well. Looking to rehome this at a very affordable price. Thank you.

Soft sunlight in a bottle. This one feels like a warm, lazy afternoon in the countryside. Fluffy, powdery mimosa with a green edge that makes it feel fresh and airy not stuffy. It’s tender, calm, and comforting. Like wearing a yellow cashmere sweater under golden skies. Very soothing and sweetly nostalgic.

- Bhavna Darira Chesan
The scent itself is stunning. Absolutely adore it. But it lasts 2 hours max on my skin - are you kidding me? For that price tag?

I blind bought this one and didn’t know what to expect. I can’t say I know what Mimosa smells like, although I do recognise the scent, To me this smells of clean sheets hanging on a washing line, swaying in the summer breeze. This is gorgeous! It’s a clean, almost cotton fresh type of scent. I love it! I can’t fault this collection at all. I’ve been really impressed with most of the Atelier perfumes and have many from this line already. I love them all.

So pure and refined. A true pleasure for the senses. Almost whispy and airy like. Doesn't turn musty/dusty as many mimosa fragrances do for me. Has a beautifully discreet spiciness in the heart notes. Simple, sheer and subtle. Longevity is about 2-3 hours.

A whispering scent! This mimosa is especially delicate and airy as most other Atelier des Fleurs fragrances are, like brushing past a cluster of mimosa blossoms on a breezy day. The yellow powderiness is the star here, soft with just the faintest fruity sweetness weaving through. Leaning into a mellow, almost powdered-egg-yolk-like blurriness, this is like no other mimosa fragrance—take for example fresher, watery take of something like Amouage’s Love Mimosa. Chloe's is especially light, almost translucent, and you can just imagine the sensation of rubbing fine pollen between your fingertips—the soft texture, the subtle floral aroma, the bare butteriness. A truly gentle, nostalgic take on mimosa.

This perfume evoked an emotional reaction in me I rarely get from most fragrances. I do get an herbaceous, stemmy green and fresh quality that instantly gave me an image of walking through a forest path lined with flowers. It was beautiful and nostalgic. Because it's so photorealistic I'm not sure I'd wear this as a perfume. It's not a perfume so much as an olfactory experience.
Beautiful star whose lights dim too fast....

YES! She is the one and only!
Perfectly balanced powderiness and freshness, no cologne wateriness. And so long-lasting! Excellent performance. Very natural sounding - what's the catch? There is no catch, pure perfume magic.
I've been looking for real mimosa for a long time and gave up. And then I accidentally found it, the very one, these fluffy yellow balls) However, on my skin it is still more floral than green-herbaceous. I think it should also be good for layering.
And yes, I wear this right away in winter - it turns out great)

This was a rather pleasant surprise whilst browsing Chloè perfumes at Selfridges.

In the midst of the chaotic perfume entrance room (really, Selfridges, Xerzoff at the entrance?) this was instead a gentle greeting.

Soft, light, and creamy with commendable sillage. While this doesn't scream 'main character' it says 'let me take care of this for you'.

This is by far my favourite of this series following their Narcisus one. If you prefer a lactonic mimosa over green/acidic mimosa this is for you.

An easy gift option, as it is inoffensive and I would suggest to any age group. All in all a fancy clean body lotion effect that can be worn in all seasons. Chloè produce a 50ml and 150ml options and I will be investing soon.

To my nose, this is an upscale rendering of Mr. Bubble bubble bath liquid, from when I was a kid. If you know, you know. Bright pink bottle, goofy Mr. Bubble character in the front. So this comes across to me as nostalgic, bright, cheery; but ultimately a little simplistic to be top shelf.

I can't find where to try this perfume.
Could you tell me if it looks like Jo Malone's Mimosa? Is it very green? Is the drydown creamy or powdery?
I love Mimosa, but I'm afraid to buy blind.

Got this beauty at the airport in Amsterdam and I couldn’t be more pleased!!
Perfect for Spring and Summer with surprisingly good longevity for such a shy floral fragrance!
To me, the mimosa of my childhood is spot on and I am thrilled to finally have this in my collection 🌱💛✨✨

Very light scent that I assumed would be of short longevity and skin-scent level silage. The scent instead strongly project its light and beautiful scent. The longevity on clothing proved to last more that a day. Quite a surprise, really.

This perfume is a mimosa girl's dream! It is very realistic and floral, as well as herbaceous with a hint of powder. I can't smell the wood in this so much, which is great to me, since I'm not a fan of woody perfumes.

It smells like the early spring and just like a mimosa tree forest. It's a very feminine perfume and only slightly sweet, the floral notes taking over in a vigorous burst of yellow floral freshness. This could be worn in summer and fall, too!

It isn't too light or too strong and can be smelt an arm's length away. It also lasts about 4 hours and 45 minutes roughly on my skin. I don't find it too heady or overwhelming and I think you could wear this at work and at daytime events easily, but it isn't a boring scent at all.

It's unique for sure, since a lovely and true solifore mimosa is so rare in perfumery. This definitely has some oomph to it and no one else will smell like you. Certainly not your basic Good Girl or My Way perfume!

9/10 for sure!

Lovely light creamy floral. Jo Malone mimosa & cardamom had been on my list for a while, but I tried this in an airport recently and loved it. I’ve just bought it and can’t stop smelling, the sillage is lovely, not too light, not too strong. A great everyday floral perfume.

As a fan of mimosa I had to try this. I never found a place where I could sample it even in the biggest city in NA so I ordered online. I live dangerously. I blind buy perfumes. Somehow I'm lucky because most of the times I'm happy with the result. This one is straight realistic mimosa. A bit sharp and green. Not overly powdery as most mimosa perfumes. The staying power is spectacular for a delicate floral perfume. It's an all occasion, feminine and distinguished perfume. Simple but great. The quality is there and if you like mimosa this is a great perfume.

I like this green iteration of mimosa a lot. It is linear but refined and feminine, not overly powdery, a little bit oily and just right for every day wear IMO. Perfect for when I want to be polite and understated, and I think a natural scent like this stands out in an office or indoor setting even more. I suspect it will be best in cooler weather, but I don't think it will be as heavy as JM Mimosa & Cardamom feels in hot climate.

The flacon also feels very luxe, weighty and elegantly designed. There are no plastic stickers on this bottle; the information is engraved onto the glass which is a detail that contributes to the luxurious quality. I personally think the flacon design reflects the Herba Mimosa jus perfectly. It is display-worthy.

There is a transluscent and airy quality to the Atelier Des Fleurs series and so, in total Chloe fashion, much heavier or indolic florals are diluted and transformed into an enchanting and gossamer creation of their former selves. In Love Story a heady orange blossom was turned into a spritely and demure, ultra feminine creation while in Atelier Des Fleurs Lavanda a usually medicinal lavender was turned into a charming and ethereal scent. Here, Atelier Des Fleurs Herba Mimosa, is no different. Chloe takes a usually heady and polarizing mimosa note and folds it into this airy, feathery translucency, lightening what is usually a very bold floralcy. The result is a very frilly and petally (as mentioned) sensation, dancing and swirling in airy vibes of delicate femininity like that of the unfurling and whirling of a tulle tutu skirt. It is elegant, dainty and angelic.
Its discontinued 😭 I loved it so much...can anybody tell me it's alternative!! Thanks in advance
Super perfume'y, soapy & ambery. Reminds me of a freshly mopped sterile floor, it's ok but it's just too much

Chloe Absolue is the deeper, richer, amberier, more vanilla based version of the beloved Choe EDP launched in 2008.

Even though I always appreciate a longer lasting, more potent version of a fragrance, in this case I prefer the original Chloe over Absolue!

While this gains some contrast with the addition of patchouli leaves and vanilla to the rose heart, it loses the ethereal beauty, the addictive smell of fresh, aquatic, pink and white flowers. The Absolue is far more common smelling than the Chloe EDP. Until few years back when litchi become a very popular note in perfumes, Chloe DNA was quite special and different from other rose forward scents.

I love Chloe Absolue for cooler days or nights wear, but nothing will replace for me the magic that Chloe EDP creates every time I wear it. I will forever repurchase the original Chloe but can’t say the same for the Absolue version. Most likely when I finish my current bottle, I will stick to the original Chloe! For me nothing can compare with the way Chloe EDP makes me feel. Pretty, happy, carefree, expensive…
It was my go-to scent for university. I agree with the comment below! Safe choice for university, office etc. To me it's more like a rosy vanilla soap kinda scent.

I find it as very simple, pure and light fragrance. It's feminine and very comfortable for daily work life, also perfect for university life. This fragrance gave me the confidence that I have good taste in fragrances.

My mother bought this for me when I was 15 and I wore it consistently through high school - in hindsight I didn’t appreciate that enough. I stopped at about 3/4 of the way through my 50ml bottle, both because I didn’t want to use it up and because I felt I had grown past it. Wearing it today though I’m realising it’s maybe the most I’ve appreciated patchouli in a fragrance! I don’t get much vanilla, it’s mainly just rose and patch which I’m surprised how much I still like. Have I grown up too much for it, in the end? Not at all.

Chloé Absolu de Parfum was the first designer fragrance that I bought so it has a special place in my heart. But i advise anyone who is interested in the brand Chloé to start off with the original EDP. I loved the EDP from the very first day so I blind-bought the Absolu after reading the reviews, many said that they are very similar.

Now, I totally get the EDP DNA from this perfume. Sure, having both at the same time might be nonessential; however, even for an untrained nose like mine, they did not smell too similar. If you consider the original signature as a spring-summer perfume, you can think Absolu is the fall-spring version of it. The vanilla note might confuse some but it is definitely not sweet, on the contrary, it is still very fresh and much woodier than the EDP. Vanilla adds a deepness, a slight warmth to the perfume. If you don't like the patchouli note, I say stay away from this bottle, because the patchouli is prominent! The rose note is still the main character, though I think it gives off a more mature feel in Absolu.
If you like EDP for the soapy white florals of it, you may not find Absolu very charming. Absolu is still a fresh scent, minus the very-soapy-feel from those white flowers.
EDP is a safer blind buy and a safer gift, but I think Absolu is worth checking out, especially because everyone else also wears the original. Not that it is a bad thing, but if you want that tad of a difference, Absolu is the way to go.

As someone who loves rosey perfumes, I was impressed at the clean and sweet projection of rose. It didn't give that familiar scent of "an old lady's cardboard box of scented letters" dry down. However, the sweetness of Absolu is a little strong for me. Instead of Vanilla, I'm getting sweet, very ripe Lychee (probably the effect of creamy Vanilla layering with Patchouli). Some people might love that, but it may be a little too much for folks who lean towards black currants and sour berries as supporting notes for florals.

My impression on the transition: Sweet Lychee upon the first spray, and then something very powdery and soapy kicks in, and then BOOM. Blooming sweet roses take over, with Patchouli and a slight hint of creamy Vanilla dancing in the background. Overtime, the rose scent becomes bolder, but without the sweetness leaving. Upon dry down, Patchouli and that soapyness dances alongside the rose, almost as if competing with it now. The finale is a sweet, powdery, and soapy floral which can be overwhelming for some folks who are used to more mature or more simple floral scents... Long story short, try mixing ripe lychee, soap, and roses, but not exactly in a bad way.
I loveeee this rose patchouli vanilla fragrance.. the simple notes always facinate me.. it obviously has the DNA of edp original, but better in SPL..it's fresh, not sickeningly sweet & classy

Finally!
I've always had a bit of bad luck when it comes to rose dominant perfumes, yet I've always wanted a rose fragrance that was 'me'. I had such bad luck with Narciso Rodriguez for her edp..
and here she was all along. Simple, romantic and uncomplicated rose. Very fresh and pure, with the slightest hint of vanilla at the base - just ever so slightly. Just perfect! I'm very pleased.

This is a pretty and satisfying rose with adequate and reasonably unobtrusive support. My pithy summary of many reviews and I very much agree. I got it for a song and it's a nice alternative to Perfumer's Workshop Tea Rose and Paul Smith Rose.

It's a beautiful, long-lasting rose. On clothes it is permanent until washing. If I leave a shirt over a chair in a room I can smell it in the room for days.

I originally purchased this as a "work fragrance," and I think it can be useful in that context, but it's also more versatile than that.

This is, up front, a very simple but elegant rose. It doesn't feel like a particularly polarizing choice to me, nor is it overpowering in most cases (depending on how much you decide to spray and the size of the room you find yourself in, of course).

The patchouli and vanilla facets of this fragrance are, if anything, supportive elements meant to boost longevity and balance things out -- for the most part, all I perceive is rose. (At times, it can become a powdery rose, but it's more powdery in the sense of "fresh/clean" than it is "vanillic" or "patchouli" in nature.) At the time of purchase (when this first came out), I needed to choose between this version (the Absolu) and the standard Chloe EDP; I sampled both, and this one won, as it felt *slightly* more rose-forward to me (*and* it sounded as though this was going to be some sort of limited-edition scent at the time... obviously, it was not, as it's still around). It can become a *bit* soapy at times (as could the original Chloe EDP), but it never escalated into, "Oh, my, I can't handle wearing this!" territory for me.

Are there some people who don't like it? Sure... but there's always someone who doesn't like something, so... go with what suits your situation best.

Love it for work a feminine rose fragrance light but warm . Great for summer evening or a rainy day and day time in winter . I wear this if I want to feel clean and feminine and if I need a not in you’re face fragrance . I don’t know if I like it that my grandma love this sent . Because now I think it’s a little oldish . Stil a love . Reminds me of Mon Paris intensement and lazy Sunday morning and Burberry body , idole lintense

This definitely has the same DNA as the original Chloe EDP - it's predominately a soapy, feminine rose. The two are so similar that I'm not quite sure if it's worth owning both, but at the same time Absolu has a totally different character than Chloe EDP. It's missing the tart standoffishness of the original and has a warmer, more down-to-earth feeling. The vanilla is faint - it lends warmth to the fragrance but not much sweetness. I normally hate patchouli but it's SO smooth in this fragrance that even I enjoy it. Overall I think Absolu is less unique; has a little less personality than Chloe EDP. It's basically a toned-down Chloe that's better suited to evening wear and cooler weather.

I love this scent so much. It smells like roses (plural), almost like rose essential oil but more refined and elegant. I think I get some patchouli, and no vanilla, luckily for me. But it's just a background. All I feel is roses and butterflies in my stomach. It is so eternal, romantic and understated. I'm a very practical person but this is one of the few perfumes that induce real emotions in me. It feels very authentic - it is not concerned with trends yet it doesn't try to impress anyone with its novelty.

I like the original, but I couldn't have the same connection as with Absolu. I think Chloe Absolu de Parfum could be the only perfume one owns and it would be great for all occasions and seasons. The quality is very high and the scent is not offensive to general public. If you love true florals (especially roses!) and you don't want to be "too niche" with this choice, Absolu de Parfum is a very very nice perfume to have. It is quite intense though, so don't overspray if you are sensitive.

Edit: I agree with MissCee about the opening being intoxicating. I don't know how to explain my feeling other than vertigo, the sense of dizziness when you are in love and don't have much sense of reality. This is really weird, because it's just a smell! A clean, dry smell with nothing resembling food or booze.

Edit 2: After wearing for more than 6 months I understand the drydown more. It remains very rosy, but turns almost metallic. Now I believe that it can be safely worn by men as well because the basis of this scent is a clean bitter floral. I extend my recommendation to basically everybody who doesn't care about labels and marketing. It is a beauty.

Got this as an unfortunate mistake that I didn’t realize until it was too late. This smells just like patchouli like me. No rose, no vanilla, just patchouli. As someone whose chemistry doesn’t usually like patchouli, this is an ok patch, but it’s intense and I’m barely ever in the mood for it. I can appreciate it somewhat, even if it’s not very me.

Rose is one of my least favourite notes, but I was so surprised when it smelt nothing like it. It smells like those conversation candy hearts, very sweet and elegant. It's long lasting and it's good for wearing during both day and night. One of my favourite designer perfumes.

Received a sample of this today — I checked the notes here before my first spritz and I was thoroughly surprised that I did NOT get any of the above. Instead I was met with the sweet, juicy scent of this lychee jelly I used to eat as a kid. I did a quick keyword search of the other reviews and found only two people mentioning lychee/litchi so this is a bit strange to me (plus Chloé is popular for their lychee notes so I’m so curious why it’s not on the list). Fruity lychee is cute but would I go for a full bottle of it? No, not really. 😆
The original formula takes on some creamy vanilla touch

This was a blind buy and I'm just not too sure about it. I was hoping it would be like my original Chloe EDP with just warmth added from the patchouli and vanilla, but to my nose it's totally different, mostly on the dry down. The opening is similar. The dry down is still very spring like and fresh. I was hoping for something that smelled warm for fall. It also reminds me of Narisco Rodriguez just a little bit. I think that an autumn or warm version of Chloe EPD is the Chloe Sensualle, which I also own, so I think I am sending this Absolu back. I'll wear it again today and see how I feel about it. But I think I just love the original so much, it can't be beat. I may post a review update if I keep it.

Update: I returned it. The patchouli was starting to be an overkill.

Simple composition, linear - yet so beautiful. I cannot think of another perfume in which the patchouli fits better, than in this. Patch can be tricky for me, but in this fragrance I love it.

Very versatile and great longevity.
A gorgeous rose fragrance!

It smells very French. Very elegant. However the patch goes a bit bad on me, stale and sour like some food that was out in the sun too long :( it's a shame because this has the prettiest, deepest, longest smelling rose. I wish they made it with sandalwood instead of patch, it would be to die for. As it is, some whiffs are acceptable (the rosy ones) and some not (spoiled patch).

Used to have a bottle of original edp which I really loved, and decided to repurchase. Got this one instead as many people say it's very similar, and the addition of vanilla seemed interesting as I am a vanilla lover. I don't have any of the original left for a side by side, but from memory it is extremely similar, but maybe a little deeper with the patchouli in the background. Cant identify any vanilla, really, but it's a great fragrance, and lasts a long time with good sillage!

This is the only Chloe perfume I own. Initially I almost gave it away because the rose+patchouli combination smells a little bit old-fashioned to me. After trying it for a few times, I can appreciate the demure and feminine quality of this perfume. However, it is not very exciting to me and lacks a bit of character. It is long lasting but pretty linear on me. I use it when I just want to smell nice but am not in any particular mood for my other more exciting scents.

EDIT: the fresh sweet quality of the rose (which reminds me of lychee, but lychee is not listed in its ingredients) comes forward a lot more as the weather gets warmer. In the colder months this perfume smells a bit "stale" but it comes to life much better in spring and summer.

This parfum has same DNA with the edp. Absolu had more rose and i like it so much. It reminds me of MFK A la Rose but richer. I love wearing absolu for daily activities. It's clean, fresh, and give me romantic mood. I like it much more than the edp.

Chloe Absolu is gorgeous like the Chloe EDP, same DNA just a little bit of patchouli. Patchouli is my least favorite note, however in this fragrance its not dirty or earthy, its a soft and slightly sweet patchouli.
Original Chloe is one of my all time favorites because of how rosy it is. This one has less rose, still a very much rose perfume dont get me wrong, but not as in your face as the original.
Usually “absolu”, “intense”, “lextrait” versions are tend to be dirtier, but this fragrance is just as clean and soapy as the og. Also despite not being listed in the notes, litchi note is definitely present.
The reason i got a sample of this was because the original doesnt last on me at all, unfortunately same with Absolu. But sillage is better, i’ll give it that. I wont be using this one instead of Chloe EDP but glad im tried this.

I got a sample of this one, and as I expected is definitely not for me.. The listen ingredients are literally only rose and bit of patchouli that only intensify the fragrance. So this perfume is literally rose one, very strong and potent, project good but it has this super strong smell of roses which I very much dislike. If you like roses you wouldn't need more than one spray I feel like, this is how strong it is. But it has this retro roses smelling vibe, if you know what I mean. So this perfume is only for those of you, who like the smell of rose water and rose extract. DO NOT get it if you don't like roses, really. It's not sweet perfume, it's floral only. There is a bit of sweetness still, probably coming from the vanilla, but I can't distinguish vanilla scent per se. It's strong and longlasting one, no doubt. The patchouli I assume make it extra strong. The bottle looks nice. Sadly, not the perfume for me. I can see there is a trend with rose perfumes lately (let's not forget L'ancome Idole which is basically rose scent as well). I can't rate this one as particularly bad, considering roses aren't my thing, but it's too strong for the office imo, if someone around me wear it I might start coughing :D joke aside, but it's true.

I wanted to have a rose fragrance in my collection. I was close to blind purchasing this perfume and good thing I didn't!
I tried this at store today. I'm a fan of patchouli fragrances. But all I'm getting from Chloé Absolu is a waft of sweet rose. It reminds me of the rose jam we eat in Ramadan in Iran. Smells exactly like the jam. 🙄😐😬
The longevity and sillage is strong tho. If you wanna smell like rose go for it. But this is not for me.
گلاب دو آتیشه ی کاشان! دقیقا این بو رو میده.

Simple patchouli and rose. The patchouli is not earthy but a little sweet - which must be from the vanilla. The dry down is very reminiscent of Chloé ‘Love story’ than the original Chloé, probably because both Love story and absolu share a patchouli base. Still prefer the original edp as it’s much soapier and effervescent.

Chloé Absolu de Parfum is a beautiful, feminine, and elegant perfume. It smells chic and expensive. I am a sucker for patchouli and rose and if I was on a distant island and I could take only 2 things with me to make a perfume there, it would certainly be those two notes.

I agree with many of the commenters here, the opening is to die for. But I also love the heart of the perfume- Rose from Grass and Patchouli. This perfume is perfect for fall and winter and I must say, I had a lot of compliments coming from females.

It's a very pleasant scent and I can surely say, that I will buy this again :).

The opening is absolutely intoxicating! I actually crave it, like someone who needs their fix! I'm not usually a fan of patchouli, but this has a very unique smell, softer in a way and (to me) a unique combination. Love the dry-down too. This is a very safe perfume to wear at work and on a daily basis, as it's very soft. I wouldn't really wear this going out in the evenings as ,sadly, I can't really smell it after a short while, so I keep overspraying. I don't know if others can smell me, but I really wished this would last longer, it's quite expensive and if I can't smell it on myself after 30 mins, it means I'll be going through bottles like no tomorrow - which I have, as I find the opening SO incredible - used up several bottles already, I have gone through 50 ml bottles in 2 weeks on average, so I really have to spray a lot to even have a soft sillage and feel like I'm actually wearing a perfume. I really wish Chloè would make a few stronger perfumes from the Signature line, as they are the most gorgeous scents ever. I use the L'eau and the regular Chloè EDP, both have better performance than the Absolu. But since I love the opening so much, I sometimes splurge even though I know I'll go through the bottles quickly!

If I was to find myself in a parisian mansion that has been abandoned in the 1920s with nothing having been touched, and I found a 100 y.o. perfume bottle on the dressing table and opened it, I think it would smell like this!

PS: That wasn't a compliment.

Chloé Absolu de Parfum by Chloé was an instant yes for me because I love the original so finding out the made an absolu was exciting for me! I love the pop of the patchouli, it adds a nice spiciness! They keep the original rose DNA which is always gorgeous, it is such a fresh rose. I am forever grateful that the vanilla does not come through with her over-the-top sugary-foody sweetness, that would have killed it for me – I like to smell the roses and Chloé is queen! The vanilla kindly stays in the background rounding out the patchouli from over powering the rose! Beautiful fragrance!

On me, it resembles the insect repellent my children use. I was waiting for the scent to get better, then after an hour I realized even if it got better there was no way I was going to tolerate this smell ever again. I'm absolutely sure it's something to do with my chemistry, because it's truly terrible on me.

Exactly like a bouquet of roses resting in water after a day or two in the vase. Not at all offensive, but one-dimensional. I like it a lot in the morning, but I am tired of it by mid-afternoon. By evening, I am annoyed it's still relaying the same tired message.

In fairness, it's an honest rose.

This scent is L O V E L Y. It has that typical chloe vibe but with a subtle hint of sweetness from the vanilla and the patchouli gives it some depth and some staying power. It reminds me of a luxurious expensive soap in a way... but in a good way. Gorgeous and inoffensive, perfect for everyday wear. The dry down is beautiful.

For Perfume Reviews & Hauls: YouTube: The Simple Chic Life

I purchased a sample atomizer of Chloe Absolu after hearing about it on DemiRawling's channel (this was some time ago.) It is beautiful :)

Stunning upgrade on the original Chloe (which I do like.) Retains some freshness of the original, but this is a rose in deep niche style, not too sweet to start - but the sweetness emerges. First, it's fresh and even sour. It keeps deepening into luscious red roses. The vanilla and patchouli bolster the rose, but don't override it. Good pillar rose fragrance, if you need a pure rose. I could see this one becoming a favorite rose for me.

It sits closer to the skin, but when people come close to you, hug you, etc. they will smell it. Four of my girlfriends told me I smelled good when I wore this perfume to a lunch date. Perfect spring fragrance, fresh enough in the sun but sweet enough to withstand those chilly breezes.

Loving the original Chloé EDP I had to try this out.

I don't know if the tester had turned or if it was a very sharp and green patchouli I could smell, but underneath the Chloé DNA was an underlying bitterness that turned me off.

Now, 8 hours later, I can still detect the perfume - the bitterness is gone and all I smell is the well known rose DNA from the original EDP.

I don't get the point with this one.
This is all rose on me. I also get sharp patchouli too. The opening kinda remands me of Narciso Rodriguez fleur musc. Smells expensive but not for my taste.

Winter test
Two sprays to inner elbow

I had thought the tester was a bit off, but was told the rep had been in and that one was relatively new.
I got a bit of a tea smell initially, and a sort of clean and dryness.

After about an hour I was wondering what is that powdery make up-y rose ish ness...
Ooo mama, here it is. This scent has the dry cleanness that the original edp had from the middle to the dry down. The rose in this scent is nit fresh at all, it’s like a slightly clean ish soap without being soapy per patchouli is not dirty.

You need to let this one settle before you decide whether or not you like it. First impression isn’t great so let it sit on you
Idk I like the original more. This one is more old and boring.
I really liked it and will definitely buy a bottle. I am just wondering, who else noticed that this is how the interior of faceshop boutiques smell like??? It smells like an expensive soap or lotion.

I was a die hard fan of the original Chloe EdP for many years, but it's been a while since then and, while I still love the smell of the original, it's just so EVERYWHERE... I smell it on the street, in the train, in the grocery store. You get the idea. Chloe Absolu offers me everything I used to love about the original, with a little something different. It's still obviously Chloe, but toned-down, warmer, smoother, deeper.
I find the majority of Chloe scents sharp and overpowering, burning my nose. This one is the ”winner”- straight up freshly sprayed windex. I cannot imagine how people manage to find a rose in this.

I like this. Not as much as the original Chloé. The opening is delightful. However, the dry down is lacking cohesion on my skin. Its not as intense as the original on me. It’s a nice fragrance. After using my bottle, I don’t think I will repurchase another .

I don't know why Chloé ply the strange practice of not putting the name of the perfume on the bottle itself. I also have an unfortunate habit of sometimes not fully lodging the name of the perfume in my mind when it's a non-distinctive one such "Chloe Eau de Parfum" or "Chloé Absolu de Parfum" Now I've got these two bottles of Chloé perfume that are identical in every respect, except that one has a darker-coloured liquid than the other. I got them both within a few months of each other also, so aging ought not to be an issue (I have read that vanilla can darken). Obviously the ultimate test is to spray a sample of one on one hand and the other on the other. So I do this ... and I find very little difference. But then some difference ... I think: possibly most who read this might realise that when the difference is only slight, and you are switching from one hand to the other, your mind can start playing tricks. And then I look them up on here and find that many say there is in fact very little difference between them!

Well I'm fairly convinced that the lighter coloured one, which, judging by the pictures on here is Chloé Eau [dP] is sharper and crisper of aroma - in fact I thought it was actually a bit citrussy, and then a short while later slightly reminiscent of tea, which would actually be consistent with there being lily-of-the-valley in it and not in the other. The other - the darker-coloured one, which would be Chloe Absolu [dP] judging by the pictures on here has that greater warmth that would possibly be consistent with a patchouli note not present in the light-coloured one.

I'm fairly satisfied, then, that I have managed to separate them wider than the spread in my perception due to the noise and the wishfulness - wishing them not to be duplicates - of my imagination. It doesn't help my detective work that clearly they are innately not very different fragrances. But I'm fairly convinced now that the lighter one is Chloé Eau de Parfum and the darker Chloé Absolu de Parfum. The respective colours of the liquid itself match the pictures on here extremely well, and it seems unlikely that manufacturing variations would account for so marked a difference.

As for the fragrance itself: as has been stated often enough now, what can be said about both is about 90% of what can be said about either one separately. These are not my usual kind of fragrance - I tend to go for the heavier stonking kind - but I do like to rock one of these more breezy kinds of fragrance now-&-then. And these are fine examples of that genre: when I was taking deliberate deep draughts of them, they seemed not to have much body ... but the aroma kept intruding with really quite a deal of force as soon as my attention was elsewhere. I think some would say that that's what proper perfume does. And these have that Chloé signature to them: somehow it's the olfactory equivalent of polished marble ... can't say why in detail - they just do do that for me every time. Like in the railway-station lobby described near the beginning of Atlas Shrugged. And I think this would kind of suit Dagny Taggart ... if it were not of course for the fact that she would only wear something fabulously expensive!

I'm not sure what to think about this one. It's beautiful and expensive smelling. But it's not quite as good as Chloe edp. The vanilla here in the Absolu sort of clashes with the dewy sparkling roses. It's still a lovely scent but it just is missing that fresh brightness of the original. Bottle is beautiful and elegant, and the perfume has incredible longevity.

I want to say that it took me a year as purchasing and trying many different perfumes before I found my signature scent which was Chloe by Chloe. In my opinion that's the most beautiful smell on Earth. I just received this one today in the mail and it is very very close to Chloe by Chloe. It smells a little bit more floral and a little bit less soapy then Chloe by Chloe. If you have one of these you don't need the other really unless you want to have everything that Chloe puts out because he loved it so much like myself. Even a slight deviation from Chloe by Chloe is something I would definitely purchase because of my love for Chloe. This is not only a beautiful smell but it also last a very long time on the skin. I put it on this morning about 10 a.m. and its almost 5 and I can still smell it.

Been wearing Chloe Absolu for 3 days already and I like it. Very strong on the initial spray, it mellows after a few minutes, and the drydown is beautiful. For me, Absolu smells more sophisticated and mature vs its edp and edt version. It's perfect for the cold and rainy weather. I use the edt for hot, humid days.

This is just like the edp version. I would say that it is for collectors. I love the edp, and thie dry down is quite alike . I can smell a bit more woody note at the beginning, though. Then, it gets soapier, but it always reminds me of chloe edp (2008). I dont smell vanilla, nor patchouli. To me it is quite like the first version, and as I am a big fan, it was worth having this one. If you are a fan of the 2008 version, go for it. Always lovely, delicate and elegant. Not overpowering and suitable for work.


Edit: wore it again on a spring day.... first time it was very cold.
I can definitely smell a woody Chloe edp... ... more creamy and then, I smell a little bit of strawberries!! A tad of patchouli, but soooo discrete! No vanilla, again. But still dries down as the classic edp. I am so glad I bought it!

Got this for my girlfriend and she loved it.

She did point out that it reacts a lot to temperature and envirinment. Rose is dominant, it gets boozy at times, and incense-y when sweaty. I kinda like it on her and she does too. It may smell old fashioned, but she doesn’t care. Lasts the whole day.
A lovely rosefragance. I get a lot of pepper on my skin. I love peppernote in parfums and here its great. Strong, bold, flirty, elegant. A must-try-scent.
roses are covering over the juice, definitely rose based perfume, patchouli and vanilla are there in smooth and refine scent, love the scent, romantic and sexy floral, longevity is about 7 hours

Oh how I hoped that my love for Chloe would help me learn to wear patchouli again! Instead it was almost the other way around: I tried this once on my skin and thought "if I smell this any longer I might start to dislike the Chloe-rose scent". Washed it of, will happily stick to the signature edp and edt.
It lasts longer on my skin than i had initially expected (it's summer here). On me it's similar to Chloe Edp.. creamy with added bit of spice. Bought one! :)

For the second time, I fell in love with Chloe with this perfume. I first smelled the original Chloe Signature Eau de Parfum when I was sixteen, and this even rosier, more powdery, stronger version is even better. I got it for the tenth anniversary and I love the gold-plated bottle and the sparkly golden bow.

To compare, I think the original Chloe is more woody and peppery, and this one is more earthy with patchouli, like the green leaves are still attached to the roses.

I don't think the top of this one will tarnish because it has the gold plating to protect it.

This smells so much like the original EdP but the rose being amped up by a lot. Unfortunately it's a little too strong, almost harsh in a way. I think that must be the patchouli note, though honestly I do not smell actual patchouli in this, and I'm really sensitive to patchouli because I'm not that fond of it.

It's a rich scent, but not exactly warm. I find the original Chloe very warm and sweet and rosy and pretty. This one smells a bit unbalanced to my nose, too top heavy on the Chloe rose note; an overabundantly perfumey-ish floral and not much else to round it out. I honestly don't get any vanilla whatsoever.

Absolu is similar to Chloé EDP yet different if you know the two scents well. Absolu is creamy and rich, earthier and heavier. This perfume has the rose note like the original but stronger and more beautifully blended. The new bit is the patchouli and vanilla ... but I’m unable to detect these notes separately. It is not as sharp as the original at the beginning and has a heavy incense type note, then it dries down to a beautiful scent, similar to the original but lasts much longer. I love Chloé EDP and this being along similar lines, I got a bottle of Absolu too. If u love Chloe EDP, you will want to have this in your collection too as this is a limited edition to celebrate the 10th anniversary of Chloe edp. Even though it’s a very good quality perfume, if you are looking for an entirely new smell from the house of Chloé, this is not really it, it’s along the lines of the original Chloe EDP, a deeper richer version that is more lasting and has very good projection.

I agree with the former reviewer that it is very much like edp..this is all about rose, I expected more rounded, more creamy..it is a big classy scent, alluring with character...if you love edp, you will enjoy this version, it is heavier, good in winter..
Not my cup of tea though.
Similar to EDP, but overdone. Creamy and thick. Base notes are not that bad though.

I had a dream I smelled this.

In my dream it was an extract of the original Chloe edp.
Heavenly!

If this smells like the one in my dream......oh sweet lord.

I dreamt of another perfume as well but unfortunately dont remember which one.

Who has ever dreamt of a perfume never smelled before in ´reality´?

To me hands down this is the best Chloe perfume I have smelled, and I have smelled a handful of them. This is just better blended. This is the Chloe for fall, and winter. I see this as a daytime, and night time perfume, but I still want a Chloe De Nuit perfume. I posted in the forum about this a few days ago, but got no reply to it. To me Absolu is richer than the original which I have never owed a full bottle, because I thought it was too sharp, but now I am going to smell it again, I did have samples in the past. This perfume is buttery, the rose peeks out every now, and again. I really get the vanilla, and patchouli mix, but the patchouli isn't that dirty. I was going to blind buy this perfume, but I didn't I seen bottles pop up on ebay, but apart of me wanted to wait, because of me not liking the original, which that may change, because it's been awhile since I smelled it. I smelled this perfume from the November issue of Harper's Bazaar in the USA, for around two weeks before I decided to buy it. I kept smelling this perfume, and the more I did the more I wanted it, it became addictive. To me, and for me this is the perfect rose perfume, because of how well it's done, it's not too sharp it's just right. Rose perfumes haven't been my favorite, Chloe Absolu has changed my mind. This is also on the powdery side as well, I started thinking a slight cosmetic smell, it's not like the powdery soapy like how Love Story Eau Sensuelle is. I see this perfume as slightly earthy, to me it feels like a older Chloe, maybe on the Vintage side. Most Chloe perfumes I think are that way more from a past time which I like, because I feel like we don't get that enough these days. I will say this is one of my favorite perfumes of 2017.

Went to Sephora last night and tested this on the paper strip.

90% similarity to the Chloe Edp (Which Is My Love) but more earthy due to the patchouli and more warmer by the touch of vanilla.

There something about the rose + patchouli mix that bothers my nose. It turns into a little mild sharp and that never happen to Chloe Edp Which why I Love Chloe Edp more.

I was expecting this would have huge, gigantic projection but actually it's not. It's more intimate & sensual I must say.

Longevity was good though.

I will do further review after I buy the full bottle, because I think this review still not complete yet. I have to try it full spray on my chest, at the back of my neck & my lower back spine area.

I do 3 spray practise to all perfumes to achieve the full effect of the perfumes and at the same time to stay balance so that I won't overspray.

Edit On 20/12/2017
Okay i didnt manage to buy big bittle of this however i managed to have it tested on my skin twice from Sephora. I think i know already why im not going to buy this.

Absolu has this patchouli right ? Which means it brings the earthy scent to it, but another big why i dont proceed to get this in 75ml big bottle was because it has sort of herbals hint come along with it.

Unlike the Original EDP which has powdery fresh plus smooth hint of floral sweetness that I truly love and crazy about this absolu is more warm. It is smooth by the time it reach ths basenotes, but the herbal hint and a dash of bitterness is stopping me to get this.
I put this on last night-perhaps too strongly-and my husband hates it. It is floral and rich, however it's also very powerful. I'm sure my chemistry has something to do with it, but whoah.

Gosh,this stuff is INTOXICATING!!!!
PURE HEAVEN
I can only really say that cause that's what happens to me when I wear this one.
I just sniff, sniff, sniff the air allllll day!
Great in the fall and cold weather.
I received countless compliments on this also. Even my cousin had to go out right away and purchase this intoxicating liquid of uplifting joy in a bottle!!!
One of favorite Chloe fragrance...

Gosh, this stuff is INTOXICATING!!!! I can only really say that cause that's what happens to me when I wear this one.
I just sniff, sniff, sniff the air allllll day!
Great in the fall and cold weather.
I received countless compliments on this also. Even my cousin had to go out right away and purchase this intoxicating liquid of uplifting joy in a bottle!!!
One of favorite Chloe fragrance...

This is a very nice evening fragrance. It does have some Chloe EDP DNA, but it's heavier and, first of all, much more earthy. In fact, it's all about rose and patchouli; I don't get any vanilla at all. Associations? A bit of F.Kurkdjian Lumiere Noire pour Femme, a bit of JHAG Lady Vengeance. Nothing groundbreaking and new, but still very classy and beautiful.
Cant waittttt to try this!

My local Shoppers Drug Mart already carries this, and I had the pleasure of smelling this and trying it out the other day.

I'm not a huge fan of any of the other Chloe's, but this one is divine! To my nose, it's really not a true floral like the other flankers. This is rich, oh so smooth and buttery, and more of a heady vanilla, slightly leaning toward floral (the rose). It's really beautiful, and incredibly long lasting both on clothes and skin. I also sprayed it on a paper tester and left it on the windowsill in our top floor hallway, and 4 days later I can still smell this halfway up the stairs. Really packs a punch and will not disappoint in the longevity/projection department.

I can easily see this falling into my cart in the near future!

Dear all,

I have a bottle of this gem slightly used (approximately 13 ml) that I want to exchange or sell.
If anyone is interested please contact me.
Thank you.

My review for this perfume now. I classify it as bitter perfume. It is rose, rose and rose. A strong, very long lasting rose, accompanied by litchi as a second accord and a faint woody/ambery base for this almost pure essential oil.
You'll just need a pair of spays and it stays with you for 8 full hours!
If you are a rose lover, this is your perfume!
Does anyone know where to find this in sample sizes or if it is still available?

It is very similar to the Intense with its woodsy smell... but it's a cross between the Original EDP and Intense. The smell is not as dark as the intense but more powdery and sweet but a different kind of sweetness in comparison than the EDP.

The only thing is that I got this without the leather case. Maybe it's a refill for the set but I'm bummed I didn't get with the leather case because it does not have a cap so I don't trust it to put in my purse.

Most similar version to this is definately the Chloé intense. This is supposed to be not only a purse spray version of the perfume but an extrait (for anyone looking for something justifying that price-tag).
For me, this was a blind buy, and I was especially curious, just because all the other Chloé versions left me all very underwhelmed.... I found them all to be too weak and simple so as the perfume to be way to overrated and overpriced. But this version definately is "intense" especially compared to its weaker versions. It opens up with a strong burst of bulgarian Rose and this is the strongest note in the composition. Everything else is still there, and its still very Chloé for everyone who loves this scent... i just find it a tad more interesting, special and worth-to-be-worn than the rest of this line. all in all i am very happy with my purchase :)

It's fine, just "fine" if you like herbal citrus. I don't think it's special enough to warrant a full bottle purchase at those prices. There are much better scents from this line and much better citrus scents at more reasonable price points from other fragrance houses.
In general, I am not a fan of verbena, and this is no exception. Glad I got to try it though.
It was decent, a second attempt is needed — the scent profile is quite predictable.

The opening reminds me of mainstream cologne for men, which isn’t necessarily a bad thing. It’s very sharp cistrusy and lemony as advertised, nothing too ground breaking or complex. A little sour, a little grassy underneath. Will have to try again on a hot summer day.

Right now it’s leaning toward cleaning product in a similar way to Replica’s Under the Lemon Tree. I think it’s the herbal note here that’s getting to me.
Has anyone tried layering this on top of MH Tea Tonique? Amazing!

I absolutely love this fragrance! The scent is like an expensive and refreshing lemon sorbet. Sweet with some herbal notes. It's feminine and playful.
Perfect for the day and when you're on holiday. I've bought my second bottle. Though, it has increased in price substantially since my first purchase nearly 3 years ago. I luckily found a good discount on my new bottle.
Always get compliments from it.

I blind-bought a 50 ml bottle, hoping it would not be too much like my other verbena scents (all of which I love, but didn't want to duplicate.) Fortunately this is different from the others. It's categorized here as a Citrus, but the Chloé website describes it as an Aromatic, and I concur. There is a distinctly herbal quality especially as the lemony top notes quiet down. This smells like the great outdoors on a warm summer day. A bit lemony, a bit grassy/hay-like (coumarin). Fresh, even a little tart, rather than sweet. I smell a little LOTV in there. It is light -- definitely multiple sprays are called for, including getting some on ones clothes if one wishes to to prolong the lemony top notes. It is subtle and clean-smelling. I find it quite pleasant, and it drew compliments from both my husband and daughter.

I have never tried the OG Love Story. I really, really like this one. It is by no mean groundbreaking or extraordinary, but it is extremely well blended and classy. I often find fragrances with dominant orange flower note to be too screechy, but here it is softened by lovely heliotrope, which makes the scent soft and powdery, gentle, and as a lover of powdery scents, I find it very pleasing. And very delicate, barely noticeable pear in the background makes it slightly creamy too.

Update after wearing it for 24 hours straight: I updated this throughout the day and came to realize that there is one note there that is unpleasant and annoying, a barely noticeable plasticky smelling note. It is light, but once I smelled it, it was all I could focus on. I think it's synthetic musk, kinda vaguely similar to modern musks of Kirke and Erba Pura, just not as strong.

I found an interesting combination by accident. I wore Khamra Qahwa to work this morning. New bottle. I sprayed it several times before spraying myself. Smelled kind of like old tires. I didn’t like it. I had a bottle of Chloe Love Story Eau Sensuelle that i bought last summer in my desk. I decided to combine it with the dried down Khamra Qahwa. Old tire smell gone and now much lighter and yet more complex. Compliments like crazy. I think there was a note in the KQ that wasn’t agreeing with my body chemistry but the two together on me are “chef’s kiss” delicious smelling. Chloe perfumes are favs of mine. I have the original and a few flankers…go to scents in the warm summer months. Great alone or combined with other perfumes.

I decided to blind buy this due to the reviews. This is like Love Story’s daughter. More fresh, young, and easy to wear. This is a simple, everyday perfume that anyone can wear. I could smell the yuzu, and pear on the opening, and faint floral notes. The scent is close to CK eternity now but with less sweetness, and more floral. This has become one of my fave freshies.
Soft white flowers, powdery and somewhat soapy, but not mature. It’s fresh and a little citrusy, and lovely for spring/summer. Very feminine and pretty, moderate performance.
this is a gorgeous elegant floral scent, i have never smelled the OG but I absolutely adore it

A sweet and sophisticated floral scent that will captivate your senses. It reminds me of a love story that is sweeter the second time around. Better than the OG. My absolute fave and my signature scent.

This scent doesn't smell like OG lovestory to me at all. That one is all straight up musky orange blossom, this one is much more. It's more soft, sweet, smooth, silky powdery, and more complex without being complicated or stuffy. Sensuelle is correct! I smelled this for the first time in the Dallas Airport a few years ago. I got stuck there because a tornado interrupted my flight home. I was freaking out so I went to sooth myself in the perfume shop. I wandered around until I found this bottle and went straight for it.

This scent on my wrist was a little safety point that I returned to throughout the airport stress to ground myself. It was very comforting.

After I got home I eventually bought a bottle. Since then I've rediscovered it through passing seasons and last night was one of those rediscoveries. I wanted something sensual and comforting and soft, and I remembered this lovely little thing. I slept so well wearing this :)

It opens fresh and clean with sweet bergamot and flowers. It warms on the skin and reveals cozy heliotrope. On me, in the dry down I get mostly those notes and ambery sandalwood. It's all about fresh light warmth. A pink sundress with dappled golden sunlight on bare shoulders. Demure in a sexy but not too serious or try hard way. She's effortless.

This was a love at first sniff! As soon as I put it on, it reminded me of something I'd smelled before--Mugler Alien Eau Sublime! This is a stunning white floral that is slightly fruity with a soft musk. I prefer this to the Mugler, which I used to own, but found the jasmine to be too sweet. The Chloe is a softer, more subtle option, but you still get the solar white floral. This is so beautiful! I haven't tried the original Love Story- so I can't compare. I don't even know how I ended up with a sample of Eau Sensuelle, but I'm so glad I did! It's going on my wishlist.

I really like this, so much so I bought a full bottle after using my sample for a few days. I didn't expect to like it as when I tested it on paper I thought it was too sharply citric and a bit common, nothing special. But on my skin it is magic. It's a warm, powdery orange blossom with a beautiful soft drydown. The fruits here play only a supporting role and add lightness, they are not loud or individually detectable but keep the fragrance beautifully balanced. I am loving this for Autumn here in the UK and can see it being perfect for Spring too. I'm surprised this isn't more loved and talked about. I find Chloe in general is rather underrated for some reason and I don't understand why. The more I try from this house the more I like.
my favorite floral perfume! its fresh, sweet, classy, and feminine. work safe perfume, wont give anyone a headache. you really couldn’t go wrong with this one.

Such a beauty for spring! Wearing this today and I can smell it while I’m running errands. It’s definitely has a sillage and it does need to be sprayed again after 4 hours but this is so lite and fresh citrus florals. Heliotrope and pear come to the top after the perfume starts to settle. Really enjoying this and this is a very feminine scent but anyone can wear this! I’m so glad I have this in my collection. Highly recommended 10/10. Not sure if this is discontinued?

Starts out citrusy - waaay too much for my liking. Frankly, it’s off putting. Then about 45 minutes to an hour later, it has finally calmed a tad down. We’re talking just 🤏🏼😆 In the background I can detect some sweet creaminess whispering but unfortunately the citrus is just too loud and noisy. It’s strange, because it’s intimate in that sense of barely having any silage but when I smell my wrist up close it’s loud and pinching my nose.

After six hours I can smell the heliotrope mixed with some wooden notes and the citrus - those notes basically never leave. If it wasn’t for the fact that I wanted to see how this developed, I would’ve scrubbed it off after that first hour.

Yes, it’s a very clean scent but whoooh, it smacks you in the face. It’s a citrusy bomb😂 At least the longevity is great - six hours and still going strong.

A floral-fruity sweet delicate skin scent.
A creamy and soft composition of orange blossom and heliotrope with added freshness from a bit of citrus and pear. Dry-down is musky, woody and comforting.

This scent is not particularly demanding, in my opinion it suits younger women.

Projection and longevity - rather a skinscent, but even though it's an EDP, it lasts about 6-8 hours on me.
I used to love this but now it's too powdery for me. I rarely reach for it.

If you don't like lemon, you will not enjoy the opening of this fragrance. Upon first spray, the lemon and yuzu are so strong that I unfortunately develop a headache during the first hour of wear. However, this eventually dries down into a soft, powdery, plasticy, babydoll head-esque aroma that I find completely intoxicating. If it smelled like that from the beginning, it would undoubtedly be a spring staple for me. Sadly, enduring the lemon-induced headache while waiting for it to get to that point will likely keep me from reaching for this one. If you love lemon, feel free to give it a go. Otherwise, stay away if you wish to avoid a migraine.

This is very, very orange blossom-heavy to my nose. To the point that I smell no other notes. Maybe the heliotrope just a tiny, tiny bit. When it dries down the smell reminds me of hairspray lol. I kind of regret buying this because it is not complex at all. To me it smells so bland compared to the great big world out there as far as perfumes go lol. :(. I agree with the people saying it smells like Alien. It totally does! Even though that one has jasmine, to me in some perfumes orange blossom and jasmine smell similar.

I get the citrus and white floral accords more than the powder on my skin. The result is a light and airy floral scent that is not too strong or overwhelming, I'd say it's mostly discreet but it's classy. It doesn't have a sexiness vibe for me so I'd wear it more at office. It could be an excellent wedding day perfume as well and has very good duration.

Best out of the love story line. Smells like Coco Mademoiselle from $2 shop. Except it’s not for summer. It’s definitely a winter/autumn scent. This is a strong perfume with weak projection. Initial blast of citrus is very sharp, once the citrus dissipates it stays linear for the next 4-6 hours. Sandalwood and orange flower is prominent. I get comments that I smell like fresh linen just out from the washing machine. I’d describe the scent as creamy woody white floral. Simple, “generic”, inoffensive and feminine. Go easy on this because too much of it will suffocate yourself and everyone around you. Not for people who are sensitive to smell. If you like the discontinued Love Chloe you’ll like this. A final note, the EDT is less headache inducing. Better sillage too.
ES>EDT>EDP

Typically Chloe perfume range (except Nomade), it’s a powdery scent which i love. But this one has a fresh opening and a little bit of sweetness, just a little bit. Office friendly, inoffensive perfume, perfect for daily wear. Simply a love for Chloe Love Story Eau Sensuelle.

I saw the notes on here and immediately thought that this was the scent I have been looking for. This morning I received it in the mail. I just sprayed a couple of squirts and let it sit on my wrist for a few minutes now and it honestly smells just like My Way by Giorgio Armani. The opening is like a punch in the face of straight lemon juice which eventually settles and the orange blossom surfaces. Chloe Eau Sensuelle and My Way both share the orange blossom and citrus notes along with the woody base. I'm not getting much amber or vanilla (from the heliotrope). I think I prefer My Way and Chloe Eau de Parfum... So disappointing.

This is extremely similar to the original Love Story EDP, to the point where I feel owning both might be redundant. Like the original, this is very soapy especially in the opening, like a dryer sheet. But where the original is fruity, Eau Sensuelle is more powdery. And rather than being bright and sunny, it's musky. Love Story is like a crisp cotton sundress dried on the line and Eau Sensuelle is like a well-loved tee fresh out of the dryer. I'm a big lover of both and I don't know how I'd ever decide which one to buy; that said, I feel like Eau Sensuelle would be easier to wear year-round.
I like this a lot more than the original Chloe Love Story. It’s sweeter & creamier with a nice, woody dry down. It’s deeper, warmer & less rosy. Great perfume!

I really like this flanker, way more than the OG and EDT. In the beginning I would almost swear this was an Alien flanker as the Jasmine note is prominent, but dry down turns to a creamy beach like scent that could be a flanker of Tom Ford Soleil Blanc. The dry down makes me love this fragrance, just wish longevity was better. If you like tropical beachy scents that aren't like a big bottle of sunscreen definitely give this one a try.

Inoffensive powdery smell that makes you feel sweet and clean.The citruses stand out at first and then the orange blossom and the musc come in front and stay till the end but with a little bit synthetic way. Not so pure blended as the other chloes and not something special. I think its a good beditime scent .

I just got my purpl lux travel size of this and I swear I smell heavy jasmine very similar to Muglers Alien. Anyone else? Or did they give me Alien by mistake? The labels say Chloe Love Story eau sensuelle. This is the first encounter I've had with this perfume.
It's just...OK. The fragrance doesn't project at all, doesn't last particularly long, is light, floral, perfumey and indistinct. I don't hate it but it's very disappointing for the price.
