Really light, delicate, clean, citrusy floral. It didn't do much for me! Pretty unoffensive and mass appealing but not something good enough to purchase a full bottle of. It didn't perform well for me either.
This is the best of chloé. It has sweetness, freshness, clean, and romantic as it named love story.

This was a blind buy and I found it really disappointing.

It smells powdery and highly synthetic on my skin, and frankly my nose finds the smell offensive. I guess it's just a case of bad chemistry.

Blind buy! And I do not regret it! Oh my! This is a *beautiful*, very soft, delicately sensual fragrance! It reminds me of a softer, creamier, milky, sensual, feminine, & girlie version of Tom Ford's Soleil Blanc which I also own. This is pure heaven! This will work beautifully in warm or cool weather - but probably best in warm. This is mildly citrus-like, a little powdery, warm, cashmere-like. Think of a warm hug. The perfect cuddle scent! I wish this came in a large bottle, I would go ahead and get it! I recently purchased the 1.7. (Thought it was 1.0 originally) If you want a soft, and not in your face scent, perfect for any occasion, this is it.

Update: 2 years later I am still in love with this! I have the original Chloe, Love Story EDP, Love Story EDT, Roses De Chloé, and this beauty! I'd say this one is still my top fave of all. When I wear this MEN tell me I smell really good. I am a waitress and it's always complimented by men. There is just something so soft, sensual, cozy, and oh so creamy about this. Spray it and don't smell yourself for about 20 mins..then it's LOVE.
I love this scent, smells fresh, delicate and pristine.

YES YES YES!! When I went to the fragrance store to smell some of the Chloe fragrances, this was definitely love at first sniff. I am new with Chloe but this one stood out to me! It is so sensual and lovely, and it still has the Chloe DNA. It also reminded me of Black Opium by YSL... even though I don't own that fragrance. But this one is lovely and I saw that it had the note Yuzu in it.. And I think that's why I love it!! I love Yuzu I have it in my other favorite fragrance as well (Fuyu D'Or by rituals limited edition). It is very nice!

So I went to the local perfume store nearby to smell some new fragrances. I had a habit of blindbuying all of my fragrances based on the reviews because I recently got into fragrances and at that time it was the beginning of the pandemic. So I looked up some Chloë fragrances, wrote them down and went to smell some. I had a quick smell before I decided to buy a few. Now THIS ONE I immediately fell in love with!! Out of all the Chloë fragrances this one was for sure the love at first sniff. But it somehow reminded me of a fragrance... it reminds me of YSL - Black opium!! It has this kind of a candy scent to it. But it’s not too sweet. But yet it has that Chloë signature vibe: a bit soapy. Burnout of all the Chloë fragrances this was the least soapy scent + nomade. I liked this more than the love story edp.

Honestly, I think this is a beautiful fragrance. It’s not complicated, but it isn’t overly simplistic either. It’s like a light weight sundress blowing in a warm breeze. Comfortable and refreshing. On me, the orange blossom, pear, passionflower, heliotrope, and musk stand out the most. The citruses are only present in the beginning, leaving the others I listed to bloom and waft. I don’t get much amber or woody notes. Sillage is soft and longevity is a few hours, which exactly what I want on a warm day. It’s made for warm skin! If I were a summer bride, this would be a contender for my bridal fragrance. I would literally bathe myself in it, spray my undergarments, spray my hair and veil, and take this beauty with me down the aisle as I officially celebrated my love story.

I found this one quite interesting.. when I first smelled it I was like whowhowho... to much to much far to much! The the scene settled after 5-10minutes and it turned to a more tolerable version but still something just do not agree with me in this perfume..... reminds me of the amazing car scent we had in our first car but as an adult with not so tolerant nose I don’t really enjoy this type of sweet scents anymore. Would be a great addition to a young adult or a playful teen but I can more relate myself with the original Love Story.

This is a dupe for Beautiful Belle Love - though I'm sure this came first. Sadly, it is not at all a spritely, fresh, beautiful floral like the majority of the Chloe fragrances, especially Chloe Love Story. This is not my type of fragrance. For those who like scents like Beautiful Belle & Beautiful Belle Love this is for you! Not my cup of tea. Sad they did a whole 360 from the original Chloe Love Story.

The opening is very alcoholic and aggressively citrusy. A second later, i can smell something faintly sweet and it turns into a powdery cítrus fragrance with a hint of orange blossom. Not what i would really call “sensual”. To me, it smells like washing powder. Reminded me of Glow by Jlo. If you like this kind of fragrance, you will like Love Story Eau Sensuelle. To me, it’s unfortunately a dislike.
MY FAVORITE PERFUME EVER.

chloe love story eau sensuelle

first off i would like to tell this house off for being so silly and making so many of its bottles with flankers so damn alike.
s t o p i t.
keep bottles the same but use better labelling or colour them noticibly differently, not just notice with magnifying glass.


ok, eau sensuelle.

rounded
dry like the other chloes are
soap/clean
fruit
maybe woods
gentle scent but 'thick', not 'thin' and light.


i want to try this side by side with original love story, and chloe chloe edp to be sure if i would add this to my fragrances.

loads of the testers i find for this and love story, and the other chloes are more often gone off, so this might be made of more natural ingredients.... keep it in a dark place, more so than your other scents.


EDIT
its been several hours now, this scent changes alot, its quite dry now, with a cardboardy type or paper note. the top notes are gone. i prefer the original chloe edp over this one.

This is not a fragrance I would have ever given much notice if I were left to my own devices, but now that I've tested it because I got a sample by chance, I have to say I like it. It's a very feminine scent, floral in a way that is soft an fresh, and indeed sensual but not in your face about it. Very nice for spring!

At first it smells a bit synthetic in a way that I find quite pleasant, like expensive shampoo or maybe a slight hint of chlorine from someone's skin on a summer day. Then there's this phase in the early heart where it's almost one-note blossom to my nose, a little nutty, unsweet and super realistic, very much like a real blossom (and very unlike neroli is mostly done in perfumes!). This is my favourite part; after about an hour of this it starts to retreat closer to the skin and becomes more conventionally floral with the heliotrope, which is also nicely done, playing a bigger role in the composition.

All in all I'd say you could do a lot worse than this one if you're looking for a good, versatile spring scent at a reasonable price!

My all-time favorite perfume is Chloe Chloe (both EDT and EDP). I love them so much that my mouth starts watering when I smell them. They are perfect to my nose.

I blind bought this one and could not be more let down. I THINK it may be the heliotrope that I dislike because going through the other notes in this perfume, all of the rest of them are great, but I am not too familiar with Heliotrope. It gives this scent a powdery feel (which I deeply dislike). I like the tart freshness of regular Chloe. This is not what at all and now I have this HUGE bottle. Anyone want to swap?

Now on to try the other two Love Stories. They have to be better than this one.

I like it.
Reminds me of Piz Buin sunscreen lotion.
don't care for it at all-soapy and green on me-not my style-i think it is up for swap....

On first spray, this one doesn't impress me. It's loud, rubbery or burnt or something (same opening as D&G pour femme).

BUT - give it about an hour to settle in and it completely transforms into the most beautiful scent! A bit reminiscent of Gap Dream to my nose, but better. Chloe has yet to disappoint me.

I put this on before bed and woke up to it still going strong. That NEVER happens, so I'd say the longevity of this one is great!

Previously had Chloe eau de parfum and Love Story. This one is not as rosy and more orangey which I love. Just bought this today so the real test on longevity is how it lasts throughout tomorrow after morning shower and daily activities. I liked the opening scent and now going on 4 hours later and still smelling it on my wrist and shirt. I truly hope that the fragrance does have substantial longevity. The Chloe eau de parfum worked well for me but the original Love Story only lasted about 2 hours after application.
The fragrance will be perfect for me if it lasts longer than 2hours. I shall see tomorrow.
Love the scent

I was gifted Love Story Eau Sensuelle for Christmas. Trying it during the cold weather I found it sharp, screechy, and it just stung my nose. I tried it again during the cool Spring days of Paris: still screechy. I did not want to give up on this baby! I put it on this morning when the temperature outside was 80°F. There was no sharpness! I could smell it! And it bloomed beautifully. It smells soft and elegant. Almost regal to me, as I find the whole Chloé house to represent what I picture to be a well put together, elegant woman strolling in the sun with a pale pink or white flowy dress dancing in the light breeze.

Try this lovely lady out during the summer! She opens up the best in warmer weather. 8 hours after spraying, though it's been fading, I can still smell it on my wrist.
Its very nice citrusy, floral with little bit of soapiness on my skin. Perfect for spring. Very classy. Last about 4 hours. I enjoy wearing it.
Soft and sexy..... holy, i was originally going in for nomade, which i also really love but this one is sooo creamy and alluring.... I had to buy it first before nomade

This is the ONLY one of the "Love Story" perfumes I own. How bout you have to STUDY & get a degree to detect which one is which? They ALL look alike. I think I would have made the subtle differences a little more noticeable. THE SCENT THO! If you like the "Gain" the original throws, this one has More of that & I LOVE it! I sprayed this on my right arm, the original on my left. Let it rest a minute, took a whiff. Repeat. Gave it about 5 minutes. YES! That clean Gain detergent smell is better in this version, even on the dry down later, & did last longer on me. Happy for sure!

Lady Million with a couple of notches turned down AKA perfect!

Edit: That dreaded orange blossom note strikes again! We are just not friends and it ends making me feel sour smelling.

I don’t use this word often, but this one is stunning. Probably my favourite from Chloe, sometimes before bed I spray a bit on my pillow, maybe because I’m weird or I like the smell or if I ever invited a woman to sleep in my bed that’s what I’d want her to smell like, but that’s not going to happen because I hate the idea of sharing my bed haha

This is a lovely, creamy, cosy and sweet white floral with a touch of fruit and I think, a touch of Olympéa. As much as I like it the cost for Chloe fragrances baffles me. None are extraordinary and they are made by Coty (notorious for weak juices) so why this is the price it is (£47 for 30ml and £60 for 50ml) is beyond me.
Totally understated and pleasant, it's a slightly soapy soft floral. A very nice daytime perfume. Perfect for lounging at home or working in the office.

This is one that went from a sample to a full bottle on my table. I find it a unique, womanly sweet perfume that mixes beautifully with my skin, so I have a long lasting scent. I spray it on and am enveloped in a purple cloud. I take deep breaths-why does this fragrance remind me of purple? I can small the orange blossom and pear, but then the flowers, the heliotrope and passion flower instantly bloom which must account for it. Together, they make a rich, creamy, scent, joyous and bold, like the big booming flowers of tropical climes. There is no plum, but it reminds me of biting into a fresh-picked, sun-warmed plum on a hot day, juice dripping down your arm. As the fragrance dries down, the intense sweetness fades to something more luxe. The cedar and sandlewood peep out, adding depth, and it's rounded out by amber. At drydown it's just a nice blend, just a beautiful, feminine scent that can be worn most anywhere.

I adore this scent and can smell it on my skin all day. I like most Chloe perfumes, but this one is, so far, my favorite. And the bottles are so beautiful, they are fragrances worthy of those containers.

I've received this one as a present a few days ago, it's my first perfume from the Chloe line. I ADORE the package, cute, feminine and classic, easy to handle.
I think i might like this perfume very much 'cause it's not a scent that i smell every day.
It's a little bit intense but classic and wearable at the same time, i love the mix of lemon, orange blossoms (LOVE orange blossoms), floral and woody notes.
It makes me feel both sexy and comfortable and that's what i really like about it.
For example: when i wear any kind of Poison i feel like it's too intense and heavy for daytime or spring, even the new Edt.
Most of the times i have to choice between a sexy/intense perfume and a fresh perfume.
But i can wear Love story Eau Sensuelle in the morning and feel both sexy and clean.

Initially a mildly citrus floral quckly fading into heliotrope and a hint of amber. It only lasted about an hour on me and I found it boring. Chloe always disappoints me. At £55 for 50ml, the longevity and sillage are laughable.

I've said it before and I'll say it again, I feel like the antithesis of the Chloé woman. The notes in this one made me curious though, so I figured I'd ask for it as an extra in a swap since the person was willing to swap multiples.

Love Story EdT was the first perfume I reviewed on here just over a year ago. I had gotten a sample with a cosmetics purchase, and as the fragrance was brand new, I figured I'd share my impressions - maybe someone would benefit from them? Little did I know I'd find writing perfume "reviews" (more like blurbs/impressions) to be such a convenient and entertaining way to procrastinate that I have now done so 600+ times in the course of a year... I'm getting sidetracked, sorry.

Love Story Eau Sensuelle is indubitably very much Love Story, closer to the EdP than the EdT, but with the perfumeyness amped up. What do I mean by perfumeyness? It's one of those adjectives that pop up in reviews, usually with a slight negative connotation, and it is very hard to define. I mean, obviously perfume smells like perfume, right?

To me, when something smells perfumey, it is not effortless. It is overworked. It's just too much, but it doesn't have much to do with the strength/sillage - super sheer scents can be just as perfumey as heavy-hitting ones. Perfumeyness is what makes me crinkle my nostrils slightly, not because it's inherently unpleasant, but because it's overdesigned and there's just too much going on.

I can forgive perfumeyness in certain opulent, golden oldies of the 80's, you know, the scents that the ladies of the TV show Dynasty would wear, because they wear their perfumeyness as a badge of honor. D&G Red Cap is another super perfumey perfume in which I appreciate that aspect and it wouldn't be the same without it. In Love Story Eau Sensuelle, however, I find it hard to stomach. Your mileage may vary.

A sweetish soft soapy balmy drydown with the usual chloe undernote. A fresh floral scent blended very well with almond/vanilla notes. Balanced and feminine. Nothing overly sweet and not a plain floral. Sensual in a more delicate way, if we want to be accurate. The opening is indeed very citrusy but it reveals its sweet facets fast. Sweet done well. A lovely perfume for young ladies.

Doesn't project much and lasts a fair time on skin and clothes, well it's an EDT, you can expect it not long lasting.

This is lovely, both fresh and warm. The orange blossom is bright and sparkling, while the sandalwood adds warmth and depth. It's similar to Donna Karan's Liquid Cashmere in notes and overall impression. Very feminine and perfect for early spring!
Strange citrus & heliotrope & woody scent. It smells like a blend of notes that should not be blended together. Final effect is just awkward.

Third fragrance in Love Story line and I already know, I didn't like the other two.
Unfortunately I don't like this one either. It says orange flower in notes, but I think it's too bitter, smells more like neroli to me.
It's less bitter than the other two love stories though.
I also sense a strong soapy smell, quite soapy.
I feel like those Love stories are getting a little bit better each time, but this one is not enough for me.

Hats off to Chloe on this one!!!This is such a beautiful scent...pure orange blossom freshness exactly what I have be been searching for...no cloying sweetness unlike elie saab leau coture....sillage was amazing and longevity great,12 hours!!!...adding this to my collection asap

A definite departure from the original and I absolutely love it! This is a lovely perfume that wraps you up in cozy warmth surrounding you in a soft cloud of orange blossom and sandalwood goodness. The heliotrope adds a vanilla impression that is further suggested by the sandalwood. A great start to 2017 with this lovely scent!

Here is a very pretty, lovely scent! so perfectly balanced between the juicy orange blossom, a subtle woodsy undertone, and the soft and sweet heliotrophe..Chloe Sensuelle is rounded, warm, longlasting, and smells wonderful on a cold winter day! it has nothing out of place, very french in its simplicity yet quality..utterly feminine, I see myself wearing it lots,. as it is casual,yet noticeable...I can smell it around me...truly beautiful creation
Very much like the EDT, but a warmer version, more fun almost!!

Funny story. I smelled this on paper and immediately loved it. I kept the paper so I could smell the drydown. About 2 hours in, after the fragrance evolved a bit, I smelled something that I perceived as a bit screechy. I ran straight here and confirmed my suspicion: Quentin Bisch. His signature is very much on this creation. I can handle Cedrus, with its soft aldehydic nature, far better than I can handle any of his rose-scented fragrances, but Bisch's signature is so hard on my nose. It is strong, projects, and is unmistakable, so I prefer the less screechy intense version that he did in collaboration with Louise Turner.

my daily wear for close to three years and i am still as obsessed and mystified by this perfume as i was when i first sampled it.

perfect for every season, it is warm and comforting. it smells like coming home, like the feeling of a long hug from a friend. it evokes something golden to me, like sun-warmed skin in cotton bedsheets, a cosy cottage, inner peace. it is intriguing, inviting and settles into a subtle and elegant scent.

it is quite powdery and lingers beautifully on skin. i find it clings to clothes for days. echoing what others have said about the necessity of overspraying- as this line was made for layering, this requires a heavy hand to shine as a standalone. but there is no better feeling than wrapping yourself up in a mist of Cedrus before leaving the house. it never fails to make me smile when i catch it on myself.

I blind purchased this second-hand because I was almost out of both my 100ml Bal d’Afrique and Wood Sage and Sea Salt and thought this would be an easy reach in the same realm. I do like this, but it’s not a love. I mainly get florals, moss and vetiver. I do not get woody notes. It’s not airy. More densely powdery. TBH, I’m so confused. I get that this is part of the Atelier des Fleurs collection, so I should have expected floral notes, but I did not see any reviews mentioning that. What even are these florals? Wildflowers? I can’t put my finger on it. I don’t dislike it, this is just really not what I expected at all.
One of the most elegant and beautiful scents I own. Not too woody, just fresh, clean and sophisticated. Never too much. Absolutely signature scent worthy!

First what I get, is lemongrass. As if I just sat at Thai restaurant and sniffed Thom Yum. It develops a little later to more green, toilet refreshener alike needle tree scent. The aroma is weirdly divine, yet super weak, i had to spray at least 5 sprays to actually feel anything.
There is not much wood in my opinion. I feel like in a fresh forest, but it comes more from the cold green notes, not from the traditional woodiness.
And yet it is divine. Absolutely universal scent for everyday errands - not offensive, clean and well put together. Though, I hope the new Cedrus intense can offer a stronger presence than this one.

This smells AMAZING, love at first sniff! It’s a very fresh green scent that’s appropriate for any season IMO. The cardamom note in this just makes it more unique. I see people compare to this to Nomade but I don’t think they smell that similar, they’re in the same scent family but Cedrus is more unisex and green. There’s no citrus no in this but I see what people mean when they say they smell citrus, I think it must come from the vetiver note. When I smell this I imagine myself walking in a quiet forest
I get citrus from this, and whether that’s from vetiver, not sure. It’s very aromatic, herbal woody perfume. It’s not my preferred profile but I think it is pretty well made.

We all know that everyone has their own experience of each fragrance. I'm surprised by how little I get from this one. It's a barely-there whisp of clean citrus on me. that I can't smell unless my nose is right next to my wrist. I love woody scents, but nothing of that comes through.

On my body chemistry, this perfume doesn’t smell like Jo Malone Wood Sage & Sea Salt at all. But it’s super similar to Jo Malone Dark Amber & Ginger Lily. Still, Cedrus smells way better… this will always be in my collection. I always get compliments whenever I wear it.

Finally, Quentin Bisch is not copying himself! For me, this is the best perfume of the year. I enjoy every single second while wearing it—the freshness, the powdery touch. It feels very calming and classy to me. The sillage and longevity don’t quite live up to the high price of the perfume, but at the moment this is my signature scent. I truly love the cardamom in it.
Just yes. Clean, fresh, effortless and chic. I understand the comparison to Nomade but this is lighter, brighter and more airy. Love.

This is rich girl vibes. So efortless, so chic, woody, but has a clean quality about it ( not soapy by all means or laundry detergent vibes) clean as in put together. You smell fancy when you wear this, period. Getting a full bottle ASAP! Do not sleep on this!!!❣️❣️❣️

After almost three months, I tried again. On two different occasions.
Unfortunately, it's still the same. It doesn't work at all with my body chemistry. At one point, I even thought my shirts smelled like old moldy laundry, until I remembered that I was wearing Cedrus.
Something happens on my skin (and certain clothing materials) when I wear the perfume. I'm still sad because it smells sooo good on others and the
quality is excellent.
Sad but it is what it is.
I still have at least 8 mL in a black, air tight vaporizer.
If somebody in the EU is interested. Free of course.

Ordered a sample just to see what all the fuss was about and....I LOVE THIS FRAGRANCE!! It's so airy, fresh and woody, I can't stop sniffing myself. It exudes luxury spa vibes. Next purchase for sure!

Cedrus is a comforting earthy woody fragrance. The woody notes aren't harsh and the sandalwood may be contributing to the slight creaminess here. I admire how all these notes are blended so smoothly. When I first read the note breakdown I got worried this would be an overwhelmingly heavy woody earthy smell, especially when I saw the cardamom note, which scarred me in the BDK Gris Charnel for being too spicy. However, Cedrus is light and creamy for a woody fragrance. I even pick up on this soapiness clean to it. As others have mentioned, I agree that this is a great entry fragrance into the woody scent group. It does lean slightly feminine in my opinion, but men could easily wear this too.
Why is nobody talking about how similar this is to Wood Sage & Sea Salt? Smells amazing

On my skin, this is a very soft interpretation of wood. I get the oak moss and cardamom, and overall it smells rather feminine. It doesn’t make me think about beard shaving nor boxing 😀 it’s good to add depth to a floral perfume, but it can be worn on its own as well. Last for a few hours.

This is a very soft, woody, and slightly *citrus*? scent to my nose. It's a tiny bit powdery in the dry down, but young and fresh still. Very inoffensive, and could be worn by anyone. A perfect office scent. I DEFINITELY see the similarities to Orphéon (which is one of my favorite frags) and think it's 50/50 unisex. Soooo androgenous. The opening might be sliiiightly more masc - but the dry down is gorgeous.
It is a very nice parfume. Soft, woody, dreamy. However, it smells masculine to me. I can’t imagine a woman wearing this. I’m giving this to my boyfriend since I love the scent.

If you’re looking for a scent that feels like peace in a bottle, Cedrus might just be it. It’s a delicate, fresh, and effortlessly clean fragrance. It doesn’t shout for attention, but it lasts surprisingly long on the skin. While officially woody, I smell something subtly floral and softly powdery that rounds it out, adding a graceful, almost serene quality. A perfect scent for quiet mornings, linen shirts, and clear thoughts.

Warm and cold, shiny and earthy, light and deep. I have never met a perfume that became one with me like this one does. Soft woods, but not creamy. Graceful, botanical. Adore this scent forever and ever.
This smells like what Lily van der Woodsen would smell like
This is unisex to me. It smells like a luxurious spa amongst the woods on a cold frosty morning.

I love this scent. I went on a deep dive looking for a scent similar to She Wood (Daphné Bugey) and this was one of the recommended perfumes. I ordered samples of 13 different scents and this one stood out immediately as being a peaceful and earthy scent. It's fresh and clean and I may have to order a full bottle- I just need to test out the other samples.

Edit: It is quite weak and I don't smell it after an hour or so.

I normally prefer scents with low projection and am a fan of many fragrances that people complain are too weak, don’t last long enough, whatever. But this is the first fragrance I’ve bought that I feel is extremely weak and has so little projection that I’m wondering if it was worth it. Immediately after spraying I have to put my nose to my skin to smell it. So it doesn’t really contribute to any mood I’m trying to set for myself. My bottle is 9 months old by the batch code. I’ve experienced several fragrances becoming stronger a year or two after their first spray—if that happens with this fragrance, I’ll report back eventually..

I do like the smell on paper or when I put my nose to my arm. It’s creamy and lemony in the opening. The cedar is light and not in any way sharp. Very unisex. I think very few people would find this objectionable. I just wish I could smell it more!

Cedrus smells like peace. It’s fresh, woody, and quietly beautiful…like walking through a calm forest at dawn. Nothing loud, nothing flashy. Just a grounding, elegant scent that feels like home to my soul.

What touched me most is the story behind it .. Quentin Bisch, the perfumer, created Cedrus from a childhood memory of his father gifting his mother a bouquet… not of flowers, but of branches. That tenderness lives in this scent. You can feel it.

It also reminds me of my own trip to Banff… the stillness, the air, the sacred hush of nature. Cedrus holds that kind of memory, gentle and deep.

Side note: I noticed a rude comment below from someone who seems to monitor perfume reviews here. It’s sad that I had to delete my original post. Just because I wrote something emotional and heartfelt and used AI for a bit of edit and correction, it was flagged down. I will not tolerate bullying and I’ll keep sharing my scent journey in my voice. Always.

Also writing about perfumes is personal. I edit and polish my thoughts because I care. If that bothers anyone, kindly move along. Fragrantica is a community, not a courtroom.

– Bhavna Darira Chesan

One of the few hype-worthy scents I've tried. Cedrus deserves every breathless rec you've read. Any green, fresh, aqua-floral, light wood devotee should absolutely try this gorgeous perfume. It is so well-blended and ethereal, not overwhelmed by a single note. The opening is definitely a sheer bergamot and a very shimmery, floaty floral that develops rather than fades into a clean cardamom and sun-bleached wood. Scents like Cedrus are more than a list of notes, though. It's a feeling and a moment to me - summery, white linen caught in a breeze, dappled sunlight across a white tablecloth laid with sweet tea in crystal tumblers. Of course, all of these impressions are pretty much useless in terms of scent profiles, but here we are. Cedrus is worth the pretty words! Note - you will overspray and respray, not only because Cedrus is a light one, but because you want to wrap yourself in it over and over again. Something about it calls to mind OG White Linen (from the early '80s) minus the aldehydes. Also feels like Gris Charnel's boho little sister. Regardless, Cedrus is worth every penny.

Something classic and easy to wear. It’s understated and comfortable. The cardamom note is excellent here, giving a solid ground to its soapy freshness. Somehow reminds me of the pencil shavings, and on the next whiffs it’s vintage. It’s young, transparent and unassuming. An easy reach for every day use.
This oddly reminds me of Blue Talisman when it’s fully dried down. It’s nice!

Wow, this is a gentle, diaphonous veil of a lightweight scent. It is simply beautiful!

Weirdly, the opening on me took on quite a fresh grapefruit / bergamot type note (not listed), but then levels out as a light and slightly spicy (cardamom) cedar. It is a woody, but it is definitely not a linear one, it is infinitely wearable, and totally unisex!

What I will say is that if you want anyone else to smell it you're going to have to overspray! This one really is quiet and understated but, that said, it lasts as a gorgeous skin scent for hours and hours!

100% recommend at least a sample of this, it is totally worth it!

This reminds me of a rich lady in her 40s wearing belted high waisted jeans and a linen blouse. She's wearing all gold jewellery with a messy updo. She looks like money without trying too hard. She's classy and chic but relaxed and comfortable. I know the word 'chic' is thrown around a lot lately but to me, this fragrance IS chic. Effortlessly classy.

To me, Cedrus is all about cardamom, bergamot, and soft woody notes, gently wrapped in what I’d call ghost-like florals. The cardamom takes center stage—thankfully, I enjoy it, though I’m usually quite picky with this note.

It doesn’t strike me as a “wow” fragrance, but it’s undeniably pleasant, warm, and comforting. Perfect for everyday wear. While it’s marketed as woody, I personally don’t get much of a forest atmosphere from it; it leans more toward a clean and quietly spicy scent, rather than something green or earthy.

The composition feels cozy rather than cold, making it an easy all-season fragrance. The official note list seems incomplete, but Quentin Bisch offers more insight in the promotional video.

Overall, Cedrus is a subtle, cardamom-forward scent that stays close to the skin and radiates understated elegance.

Hmm. That's a tough one. It smells expensive. It definitely smells high quality. Unfortunately, it doesn't work with my skin. I don't know if it's the cardamom. Strangely enough, I get a lot of citrus. I'm wearing it right now. It also reminds me of Santal 33, not 1 to 1 but like a cousin. Santal also has cardamom in it. I don't like Santal 33. Maybe that's why. However, I have to say that I don't get a dill note with Cedrus. I hope it settles a bit towards creamy. Maybe I need to let it marinate for a few weeks? In any case, I now have a 10 ml test bottle of it which I hope I can still use. Not bad in any way, just not for me apparently, which is a shame because the quality is great.

Light, airy, cardamom, cedar. Bubble bath. Clean. Sauna. Pleasant scent. Absolutely unisex. Safe fragrance. A wooden house in the middle of the forest, with a sauna. A light wind blows through the trees. On a dewy morning with cardamom tea in your hand. :)
A beautiful cedar scent. Subtly sweet, woody, and smooth. Soothing and calming. Perfect in its simplicity of composition.

This is woody and fresh and there's a little spice there, but it doesn’t feel heavy. It still feels light and airy and fresh. I smell this and I imagine the smell of glamping - clean, luxury, but you still get the feeling of warm woods and fresh breezes. Perfect for every day and can be paired with so many other scents.
Damn this is nice! And I think pretty beast mode. The notes sound like they could be pretty masculine but this is feminine leaning unisex and oh so pretty and clean.

To me, Cedrus smells clean, fresh, and woody, with a creamy touch. There’s something soft and delicate about it. It’s a simple fragrance that you can wear every day. I do wish the scent had a stronger scenttrail, but maybe that’s also what makes it so easy to wear, it never feels too much.
I bought this during a road trip through Scotland and wore it every day. Now everytime I wear it, it brings back memories of a breathtaking scenery of mountains, lakes, and endless trees.
FFS we have got to do something about the users that are just spamming AI reviews on here, like bhavna darira chesan, down below. All of her reviews are AI garbage.

I am kind of new to predominantly woody fragrances, but this is so lovely. What isn't mentioned in the notes is an underlying slightly sweet creaminess that balances out the woody notes. I suppose that could be from the cardamom, but the sharp aspect of cardamom isn't present as I've experienced with other fragrances. This could easily be someone's signature scent, as it could be worn year round. For an evening out, it could be layered with something else --vanilla, floral, or even something deeper. I ordered the big bottle during the Mother's Day sale at Nordstrom and I am eagerly waiting for it to arrive. I have travel sizes of several of the Atelier des Fleurs fragrances, and the only one I didn't care for is the rose scent. Quentin Bisch certainly created another masterpiece.

Blind bought and was not disappointed! I really enjoy this fragrance. It fits really well in my collection. It’s very light clean soft wood.Easy wear. Classy elegant chic mature soft clean feminine.
It’s very pretty! Love it!
Intimate/moderate sillage but that’s expected in a freshie. One of the best freshie’s I’ve had the pleasure of experiencing.

I remember reading reviews describing this as rich aunt perfume and that’s exactly what this is. Subtle but stunning. classic scent but not too familiar. I love it for work or out with friends and have had so many compliments

This is a great offering from Chloe. Perfect perfume for a day when you want to smell classy and fresh . Nothing crisp or dry. It’s like an expensive lotion that smells more like skin than perfume. Lasts a long time if applied heavily and won’t bother anyone. Super pleasant and high quality. Want a bottle asap

Same DNA as in Chloe’s Nomade EDP. Not that fruity nor thick, less of a dusty moss note in the dry-down, feels like a calm, clean, airy, sour, woodsy, superior Nomade flanker with a very bright cardamom note in the opening.
I probably don’t need it cause I’ve already have Nomade EDT and Nomade Absolute but I do want to. It will be easier to wear in summer as it doesn’t need moderate in warmth and windy weather to pull it off.
I don’t see any resemblance to Ganymede nor to Bois Imperial though.

This is a more feminine woody perfume. Highly sophisticated and elegant. It does feel a bit better for an older woman, but I still feel comfortable wearing it. It lasts forever but isn't overpowering with silage. Worth a try if you love woody scents, but avoid it if you prefer very sweet/gourmand fragrances.

This wouldn't be out of the question for a man to wear, but it doesn't feel overly masculine.

One of the best woody floral perfumes ever, Very clean, airy, very molecular, A bit sharp citrus start is changed with deep woody notes that in few hours evolve into luxurious skin care like cream. Think, it is more feminine, very soft and pleasing. Very diffuse, It fills the entire space around you and lasts long in the air. I can feel my own sillage, but at the same time it is not stuffing me. The best on receiving compliments. 10 out of 10. Did not expect it to be soo exciting.

However the perfume is not unique. If you have Genium Painter, you will not be as excited, They are like twins as Ganymede and Bois Imperial. Can it be different as all of them are created by the same master...?
Unisex and fab

This was the only scent I was a bit unsure of. I already have Vanilla Planifolia, Ylang Cananga, Magnolia Alba, Jasmine Sambac and Herba Mimosa and actually love every single one of them! Cedrus needed a little time to recover from shipping to reveal its true quality. I spent ages reviewing this only to realise I’d mixed up my samples.

Cedrus is a really nice woody, versatile, all year round scent. Cardamom is a note I struggle with and find nauseating. While I can still detect the cardamom, it’s balanced well with the wood notes making it much easier for me to wear. I also find Cedrus lasts longer than Cedrus Inense.

Cedrus Intense has a gorgeous opening of citrus and woody notes. I love the opening and wish it stayed throughout. What a shame! It’s strange Cardamom listed because I can smell it strongly in the dry down, which makes the intense nauseating and unwearable for me.

So the winner for me is the OG Cedrus. Great on its own or layered with other scent. I’m still undecided if this is full bottle worthy for me personally though.
Smells exactly like Burberry Goddess and Amika hair products, especially the colourful hair mask. No sophistication or complexity. Crowd pleaser just like Burberry Goddess
Smells like Chloe Nomad, a little lighter.
this smells like your friend, but the rich one

I tried this at a duty free shop and was pleasantly surprised. It's lasted 12+ hours on me, and I kept getting whiffs of it during the flight (which was very welcomed since someone took off their shoes and the cabin smelled like feet). It smells really nice. It reminds me of wearing pale blue linen, cognac leather loafers, simple gold jewelry. It's very clean, woody, natural-smelling and high end for sure. I smell some of the OG Chloe DNA as well when it dries down--the sort of wet pavement note that is unique to the brand.

8/10, timeless, elegant and clean. Safe blind buy IMO; I can't see this offending anybody. I'd love a little citrus or salt notes to balance out all the woods but I like it enough as is (granted I LOVE woodsy perfume). This smells nothing like D&G Light Blue (which stinks of lysol) and much more refined than Wood Sage & Sea Salt (which smells like air freshener/room spray). If you like chypre or woody scents (Diptyque Orpheon comes to mind) this is an excellent daytime fragrance.

Worth a FB for me honestly. Blind-reach, easy and effortlessly elegant.

Edit: This is my easy "dumb reach" fragrance. I'm obsessed with this and I'm so glad I bought it.

A sunlit morning, a cold porcelain cup, the faint scent of tea mingling with the crisp air of your cedar cabin. This is the scene Cedrus opens with. Each inhale of the fragrance feels like a gentle sip, light and refreshing, the kind that quiets the soul. The clean aroma of outside santalum trees hums softly in the background, steady, while cozy moss bushes warm beneath dappled light. However, as the day stretches on, Cedrus' charm unmistakably begins to wane. It leaves behind a pleasant but unremarkable trace of musky wood — a conversation amongst nature that has faded into polite silence.

Quentin bisch never holds back his artistiry and creativity. This is one of the most complimented fragrances I have, basic ingredients yet so well balanced, so fresh and aromatic. This is my second 120ml bottle and this is in my top 10 fragrances. Some people are comparing this to santal 33 and I don’t think it’s a fair comparison as I have both. Santal leans more citrusy and I could smell metal in it while this is fresh and feels natural like you’re walking in a floral forest. 10/10

I bought a decant to play with before going with a full bottle. This really is nice. I am the only person apparently that gets major Bal D’Afrique vibes from this but boy do I. I get the same kind of vetiver here that I remember in Bd’A, but it goes in a soapy direction-or should I just say clean, because it’s not a specific soap but rather a sense of soap. Inoffensive, light and pleasant, clean, woody and soft. I never quite clicked with Bal d’Afrique but this I do. Very nice and worthy of the praise.
this really is like a brighter and lighter version of santal 33, i actually prefer it as someone who likes more fresh scents

The uber talented Mr. Bisch. Is there anything this man conjures that is not an instant hot bestseller?

This reads unisex and to my nose it leans more marine rather than earthy. It has an istant cooling metalic quality, like an iced cocktail blender close to your face.

Magnificent in all ways and for Londoners can be sampled at Liberty, Selfridges, and the Chloe boutique.

I’m writing this after I was complimented because of this perfume.

To be honest, I was going to write this off as something too light for my liking, but maybe I’m going nose blind to it after spraying it. It’s a very delicate woody fragrance that has a tea-like quality to it. Very fresh and gives a clean girl vibe. It also has the same moss that can be found in nomade, and might remind you of this fragrance but they are still different from each other.
It’s a beautiful scent and I remember when I bought it I fell in love with it, but was disappointed with how light it was and how quickly it seemed to disappear after the first spray (within 30 minutes)

However, a girl just stopped me to ask which perfume I was wearing and where she could find it (which is at an airport). I’m pleasantly surprised as it has been a few hours since I sprayed it last. So I guess it’s not as short lived as I thought.
I dont know if im crazy or not, but this just smells like a lighter version of imagination by louis vuitton. Its nice, but i already own something much stronger

This is such a nice woody freshie. It leans a tad sweet. The performance isn't great, it goes about 3-4 hours on me, but I don't mind, especially with a daytime freshie like this. Allows me to switch it up easily for evening. I honestly can see this being a year round scent. Great for work environments and airplanes because it sits close to skin. I really enjoy this perfume.

This fragrance is awesome. My wife has a bottle and indeed it is divine. It is a clean woody scent with staying power. The sillage is enormous as well. I am surprised the votes do not suggest that. The first time my wife sprayed this fragrance, it stayed in the room for close to 6 hours after she had left. This morning she picked up a dress she sprayed this fragrance on about a week ago and immediately, the whole room smelled like this. That is how good it is. I am thinking of getting a bottle for my self. She actually calls it her "Rich Auntie" fragrance.

I smelled this in a duty-free as well. They were sold out so I settled for a few sprays on my hoodie and a few more sprays on a Chloe card.

This is exceptionally clean. Aromatic, woody and soapy. It smells expensive and unique compared to my other fresh scents. I don’t think I have anything else with cedar in it but this makes me wish I did. Despite being a “clean” scent, it’s strong and lasts forever, similarly to PDM Valaya (though they don’t smell alike).

The Chloe card smelled for 10 days before my full bottle arrived from Chloe and I threw the card out.

I tried this at a duty free shop and was pleasantly surprised. It's lasted 12+ hours on me, and I kept getting whiffs of it during the flight (which was very welcomed since someone took off their shoes and the cabin smelled like feet). It smells really nice. It reminds me of wearing pale blue linen, cognac leather loafers, simple gold jewelry. It's very clean, woody, natural-smelling and high end for sure. I smell some of the OG Chloe DNA as well when it dries down--the sort of wet pavement note that is unique to the brand.

8/10, timeless, elegant and clean. Safe blind buy IMO; I can't see this offending anybody. I'd love a little citrus or salt notes to balance out all the woods but I like it enough as is (granted I LOVE woodsy perfume). This smells nothing like D&G Light Blue (which stinks of lysol) and much more refined than Wood Sage & Sea Salt (which smells like air freshener/room spray). If you like chypre or woody scents (Diptyque Orpheon comes to mind) this is an excellent daytime fragrance.

Worth a FB for me honestly. Blind-reach, easy and effortlessly elegant.

costco had a good price on this so I blind bought it knowing I like woody, oakmossy scents.
This is a welcome addition to my collection and I know I will wear this a lot. This is lightly citrusy in the opening, maybe bergamot and dried down on me to just a light powdery vetiver and woods skin scent. I think the oak moss gives it some lift, it feels very airy and sheer. It feels cozy and transparent at the same time.
This feels like it could be the scent of a super high end shower gel. it’s clean and light but still woody and earthy.
I would love to layer this with aesop tacit or gris dior to play with with profiles a bit or with wood sage and sea salt to see if we can create some lasting power:)
Cedar and citrus. Fresh, clean, soapy. Lasts for 30 minutes to 1 hour. Smells good on its own or layered. Unisex but leans more masculine. Waste of money.

Beautiful scent with many of my favorite notes. The oakmoss reminds me of the oakmoss in Nomade Absolu, which is another favorite of mine from Chloe. However, it’s much lighter than Nomade, which is a fall scent for me. To my nose, there’s a also a citrus green tea smell that reminds me of The Yulong and EA’s Green Tea. It’s woody, but the sandalwood doesn’t dominate. The vetiver keeps it fresh, but it isn’t earthy like the vetiver in Terre d'Hermès. The addition of cardamom adds a hint of spice, but it’s not as strong as in Gris Charnel. The dry down is my favorite part. It gets better and better as I wear it. I could even call it a hint soapy, but not like a Chanel fragrance.

Absolute love for me and my favorite Chloe Fragrance so far. It could easily be a signature scent for spring through fall and on warmer winter days.

(This is one of the fragrances I get compliments on, which is nice.)

I don’t think it’s similar enough to Light Blue or Wood Sage & Sea Salt in any way that would make it redundant to own. It’s really just in the same category as those scents (an airy, woody scent), but very different to my nose. I own all three and this one is my favorite.

This is full bottle worthy. It’s my go to scent in the warmer months.
thanks @wondervalley666 , you've probably saved my time and money if it's indeed like DG Light Blue :D
This perfume is fresh, woody, and really good, try it you won't be disappointed, no bs.
[6/10] A unique, unisex scent that I really wanted to like simply because of how interesting and unique it is - but it smells 25% like coca-cola from opening to dry-down.
Waiting to buy a bottle after sampling. Better version of Jo malone wood sage and sea salt. Beautiful.

Beautiful! Wow! Refreshing, out of the shower everyday scent. Love the amount of vetiver here. It does not overwhelm me like it does in Bal D’afrique. I once smelled someones sillage, and I could tell the fragrance had vetiver. I was absolutely blown away by what that note does in the summer air, in small doses. Although this is called Cedrus, I detect more citruses and vetiver than I do cedar in the opening, which is pretty harsh and masculine to my nose, but it starts to settle within 5 minutes. Within a half hour it almost sweetens up, ever so slightly. This works magically on the skin! The harsh citruses of the opening disappear, and a lovely woody, spicy, vetiver remains, with a very pronounced cardamom note. I decided against keeping this after all, because I just never reached for it!

This is very clean and airy citrus-woody scent. Great for vacation!
One of my favorite perfume.

Firstly, the note pyramid is incomplete. This has a very strong lemony citrus top note that dominates and persists throughout the life of the scent. It’s actually more of a dominant note than any of the other notes. I’m not a bit fan of lemon perfumes because my chemistry makes them smell like cleaning products. I don’t have this issue with bergamot, orange, lime or citrine, just lemon. This is a very clean fresh unisex type lemon cedar scent to me. I don’t get cardamom or anything spicy. It dries down very powdery. It overall reminds me of baby wipes, and smells exactly as such on my skin. From the first sniff I was instantly reminded of D&Gs Light Blue, and I’m still surprised this isn’t a flanker. I keep trying with this one. I love the perfumer and go nuts for his other creations. I was thrilled to score a 5oz for less than $130. This just isn’t a scent profile that works with my chemistry, unfortunately. I don’t really get sandalwood or moss in this, nor am I recognizing any florals. I’m a big fan of the Nomade line and there are no resemblances in Cedrus to the mossy forest vibes of Nomade. This is a lemon woods freshie. Probably best for summer heat.

I’d recommend this for people who enjoy the lemon cedar freshie scent profile of scents like D&G Light Blue, and who don’t want anything sweet/vanilla/amber or anything floral in their scent. Might be enjoyed by the woody molecule simple scent lovers as well. Doesn’t resemble any other QB scents IMO.

Good projection and exceptional longevity.

The scent is very woody and fresh. I love layering this with Oud and I always get compliments EVERYTIME I wear it. It smells very clean.

I also bought this as a gift for my brother in law and he fell in love immediately. I would say it is safe for a blind buy
loves it, a fresh and crispy take on woody scent; the freshness reminds me of the smell of citrus. sweet and cool

Very cool! To me, this actually smells more like vetiver than cedar (which is fine with me, cedar sometimes goes too screechy on my skin), with a bit of oakmoss. Kind of like... a cool, unisex chypre-style Terre d'Hermes. Nice, very classy, perfectly unisex.
Scent: 8.5/10
Polarity: Unisex
Longevity: Average
Projection: Average to soft

This is a nice and light, fresh woodsy scent. I was hoping for more cedar, instead I get more vetiver. When I initially sprayed it I thought it reminded me of Chloe and florabotanica, but sheer, stripped down, without the rose. On the dry down I can really smell the iso e super. Similar in vein to JHAG not a perfume, le labo another 13, or glossier you. I definitely prefer Cedrus out of all 3. Compared to JHAG it smells less harsh and astringent. Not as musky as another 13. And, doesn’t have the sharp pepper, powder or iris notes in Glossier you. If you like any of the scents I mentioned then I think this could be a safe blind buy. It’s definitely a scent that I could picture working well in the heat or in an office environment. My roommate says it reminds him of Jean Naté splash, but I don’t see the resemblance. Overall a good everyday scent for when you don’t want to wear something perfumey. Price wise, I got an excellent deal from Costco, $100 for 5oz. But, if it was full price I would skip it since there are so many similar scents out there.

The smell of Wood is very gentle and elegant. Cardamom makes it warmer, but very subtle, just enough to be the background for the Wood scent. I think it is a bright and soft unisex scent, more feminine, suitable for those with a gentle, minimalist style.

Rating: 7/10. The Wood scent is a bit classic, like the smell of the dolls I played with as a child
New signature scent for fall. Absolute woody, fairy dream. Costco website has huge bottle 😍😍

I am surprised to hear Cedrus was created by Quentin Bisch, as it is subtle, clean, soapy, and quite pleasant. I think user Vettivaer below is spot on.

It's nice!

I don't get the hype. I blind-bought this based on reviews and was disappointed. My grandfather was a perfume collector, I loved playing with his perfume when I was little, and this perfume reminds me A LOT of a scent from one of my grandfather's perfumes. That's why I have mixed feelings about this one.

I honestly don't get the appeal on this. I've had it for 2 months and still don't like it. But I'll try it perhaps 3/6 months after to see if I still feel the same. Will update. I would suggest you try this on the store before committing to a full bottle.

Cool, sparkling and uplifting blend of bergamot, LotV molecules, transparent cedar molecules and a hint of cardamom. Oakmoss replacer materials deliver a matte finish without the funk. This is a simple, no nonsense unisex freshie.
Combination of smooth-gentle and fresh with vibe of wood sage and sea salt from Jo Malone are absolutely stunning at first sniff. I really love it.

My partner who never comments on my fragrances said I smelled “nice and fresh” when he hugged me. I was mind-blown.
This isn’t a scent to make a strong impression. It’s soft, skin-like, with slight woodsy soapy touches. There’s a transparency to it, almost like a forest fairy glowing in the grey, damp woods. Fresh.
I like it a lot but it’s not my usual scent profile. It’s lovely if you’re into fresh, soapy, woody scents.
Longevity moderate. Sillage is closer to skin.

Don't be fooled by the name. Cedrus does not smell woody, mossy or spicy in the slightest. Instead, it's fresh to the point of being a soapy type of clean. I also get some florals in there but can't make out what I'm picking up. To me this has the DNA of Giulietta by Tocca, along with the same soft performance. I'd recommend anyone check that one out before blind buying this. It's near impossible to find samples of this line!

I have been a loyal fragrantica reader for many years, and have always longed to write a review for the scent of my dreams. I am thrilled to say I think I’ve found it in Cedrus.

Let me first say that I now have the pickiest nose on earth. Over the years I have come to not be able to tolerate synthetic scents. I wore Pucci Vivara for a decade, and it was the *only* smell for me. I couldn’t imagine anything more beautiful. Electric green and complex and spicy with a youthful zip. People would stop me on the street and ask what perfume I was wearing. It drove men crazy.

Maybe it was a hormone shift, or the bottle turned… no idea, but one day it started repulsing me. What was once my perfect scent now smelled like astringent old lady perfume. And I began my hunt for my new signature scent.

That was in 2017. I have been searching for 5 years! I seriously think I’ve smelled every perfume in hopes that one will stay, but nothing worked. If it smelled good at first, it was powdery in the dry down. If it had the right citrus, it was too immature and lacked complexity. Then I walked into Nordstrom and told my story to the natural fragrances associate. He walked me over to the Chloe Fleurs collection and sprayed me with Cedrus. I fell madly in love on the spot… and to my delight, 4 hours later it got even better. I couldn’t stop smelling myself. I found my scent!

Cedrus is so special. It is equally earthy and elegant. It’s a summer BBQ in Laurel canyon at twilight, and everyone is barefoot. It is unisex but leans slightly feminine… I’ve never smelled feminine woods done better than this. And the fresh, lightly spicy green finish. It is exquisite.

My another love from this house. Incredible work. They say devil is in the details and with this fragrance it is very accurate. It's like finest piece of lingerie, soft, hugging, and has enough beauty to embrace the skin. I always loved Chloe for what they create and this collection is truly worth it for me. I par this one with mimosa and neroli and end result is always great.

Just gorgeously fresh, extremely delicate.
It’s almost as-if some beautiful and slightly sweet boards and twigs and grasses and tender flowers were rained on, and this is the little glowy smell they are putting off.

But totally sheer. And that is after making a puddle on my skin.

You can hardly even shop at a current store with all these sheer trends, it’s really hunting for a needle in a haystack.

I wouldn’t buy this any more than I would walk at the grocery store in a sheer nightie with no underwear.

I am wearing it today and it is really potent. Projects a lot! To me, this scent is rather a yellow floral. Smells a lot like a very natural ylang, which I really love since it is one of my favorite flowers. Totally recommend if you're into yellow florals with a hint of soapiness to it!

NEROLI! NEROLI AND MORE NEROLI!!

More like a child of Neroli Portofino with a sweet jasmine note included. I don't get narcissus/Daffodil scent. No, it is not similar to Chloe Narcisse. Not at all.

Soapy and slightly sweet neroli scent.

It is pretty, if you can be happy with neroli.

Sample it first.
Can anyone tell me if this is similar to the 1990s Chloe Narcisse? I'd love to find something reminiscent.

A really beautiful, sophisticated scent! It opens a sweet floral and dries down very clean & soapy.
Not my fave scent profile at all but I can appreciate how well done this is.. I think if I loved the floral/clean vibe it would be a 10, but I don’t so it’s just a like.

If JLo's Glow and Prada's Infusion D'Iris had a baby, this will be it.
Very soapy. Not as sharp as glow and not as powdery as Infusion D'Iris. It has some yellow flowers and some kind of sweetness in a not vainillic way. It is not stunning, but as a lover of soapy scents, it is very lovely. Has more projection than the others perfumes from Atelier I own (Mimosa, Santalum and Cedrus).
It may not be the more unique fragrance, but is very well done.
This perfume has nothing to do with real daffodils. I was quite disappointed after trying it on a paper tester.

I tried this on at Duty Free after sampling the entire line. THIS is the soapy perfume of my DREAMS. I liked it at first sniff, because it's a beautiful mild, clean, subtly sweet scent...so I loved it but not enough to buy on the way home from travel.... However, a full 3 days after spraying about 6 times on the proper paper card I stashed in my travel purse, I noticed the most beautiful scent and assumed it was a new conditioner, but smelled my hair...no not it...I smelled my shirt...nope, not that gorgeous sweet flower smell.... then I remember my travel bag. The amazing scent was coming from this card. Gotta buy it now. Next time I travel.

This is a Le Labo style deception regarding the name. There is nothing in this to remind me of narcissus or spring florals in general.

Narcissus Poeticus is a white flower blend with jasmine, orange blossom, neroli. The brand somehow paints it out to be very natural but I get that raspy synthetic note in the late dry drown.

I would group this with Guerlain's Nerolia Vetiver and even Prada Paradoxe,

I swear I get jasmine or light tuberose in the opening then it dissipates. That's the opening. The mid-phase is all about soapy, clean, powdery white floral — close to Santa Maria Novella's style. I find the drydown to be very pleasant, and it reminds me of the drydown of Jo Malone's Tuberose and Angelica, although this one is greener, more powdery, and less sweet.

Smells chic and classy overall, with a nice twist!
the dry down is so soapy and pretty.

I’m still not 100% sure what narcissus smells like, as I’ve never smelt the flower in nature. From what I hear, narcissus can have a really complex scent profile that goes from the white floral heady to the animalic, green or even tobacco like notes. Looking at the variety poeticus, it is said to smell like a mixture of jasmine and hyacinth, and I think I agree. It’s lush floral and a bit green at once.

This is something I very much enjoy as an easy summer/ morning fresh from the shower floral which is indeed soapy but in a lovely way. Not scratchy-green like some roses, not indolic. In my own scent reference memory, this feels a bit vintage smelling, probably because it reminds me of the glorious vintage collection from Grossmith (Hasu no hana/ Phul nana?) which possibly contain a similar natural narcissus note.

Like the other 2 Atelier de Fleur scents I own, it’s very easy on my nose and does not hit me with unpleasant noticeable aroma chemicals, which I am thankful for. I love this!
This is far from the narcissus as I know it. It is subtle, soapy, high-pitched fragrance.

One word: gorgeous. Just magnificent in its simplicity. The opening is just that - a pure iris/orris, green, vegetal, slightly buttery. Iris is my all time favorite note by a mile, and I really wanted to smell it by itself, unmixed with anything, and this is exactly what I've been looking for. Unfortunately, this beautiful opening does not last long, maybe 10 minutes? And then you get a base that feels like mostly ambrette with faint hints of iris.

I fell in love with this scent in the spring and summer.
First of all, it’s alcohol-free, and when I spray it on my skin, it gives off a scent that reminds me of herbal roots soaked in liquor — almost like a medicinal root-based liqueur.
There’s an earthy undertone at first, followed by a soft powdery trail that lingers on the skin.
It doesn’t last very long on the skin, but there's a faint, pleasant trace that stays close.

On clothes, however, it lasts longer and doesn’t overwhelm in crowded places thanks to its light projection.
It feels clean, subtle, and distinct — yet hard to confuse with any other fragrance.

I just tested it on skin and while the opening is beautiful and intense, it turned into a nutty skin scent quite fast. It smelled familiar and couldn't put my finger on it. Then, Eureka! - it smells just like the CCC shops in Europe (they sell shoes and have their own shop scent, not for sale). 😅

I can't believe it's just 'IRIS'.

When I first sprayed it, it reminded me of green herbs like angelica, and then there was a complex scent of sweet iris, ambrette, sandalwood, and tonka.

It feels cool like cardamom, and it's quite unique. I think the complex of various kinds of scents makes up the identity of Chloe Iris.

Chloe's Iris has a unique sweetness that resembles other perfumes that graft iris onto figs or express it with amber.

But it doesn't 'develop', it lasts almost like a first impression. It's not complicated or heavy, it's clean and easy, so I think it can be used in summer too.

A similar image comes to mind to Frederic Malle's l'eau d'hiver (although not quite the same scent).

This is a 'flower iris' that does not smell like roots, dirt, dust, soap or powder.
It's not the ultimate iris I was looking for, but I think it'd be good to use when I'm tired of overpowering fragrances.
Warm and earthy iris - lovely gentleness
woody, light take on iris; very short-lived,

This is the Holy Grail of iris scents to me. The deepest and richest orris butter is used but it is also fresh. It’s a slightly waxy smell but if you like orris or iris you’ll like it. Other scents (Prada Infusion d’Iris, Diptyque Fleur de Peau, ELDO La Fin du Monde) pale in comparison.

I am surprised not to see any green notes. The green freshness of the opening hides Iris for an hour or so. Smells like flower stems. Then floral Iris comes out in all its beauty, without any baby powder or lotion kind of notes. It's dewy and airy Iris, not powdery or earthy.

Dina_France (YouTube perfume reviews)

Here is a lovely scent if you like a pure iris, don’t mind having to re-spray (or prefer discreet scents that don’t gas other people) and dislike many fixatives used to give iris lasting power. I adore the note of iris, but it’s often accompanied by other notes or aromachemicals I like less.

I would say this is just a clear iris note over a sweet slightly musky base that may be sandalwood with ambrette. Very uncomplicated and short lived, but I really like to spray it when feeling a bit down, unwell or just in need of a comfort undemanding scent. I’ve been using this a lot with my other Chloes, often at home or going to bed.

Really glad Chloe has this line, and hoping it sells as I’m very much in the market for it.

Cold. It’s early spring in the forest. Snow is still in patches but the green of new growing things peeks through. The rooty iris smell reminds me of the forest floor. I like it for what it is, not as an amazing ode to iris. Just a simple soliflore.

I dont know what to think… it opens with iris kind of scent like today many do… kind of paper suede iris… it seems quite sythetic and then there is Coconut… then it blends together and create very similar scent to Boise d’ farine from L’artisan Perfumer …
Longevity is maybe 2-3 h

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: I don’t know if something is going on with my nose but this one confuses me . Sometimes I feel like it smells like a citrusy slightly spicy soap and sometimes I feel like it smells a little too masculine. It’s not a bad fragrance though and it’s quite unique. The grapefruit and the moss predominates here . It’s a very spicy citrusy fragrance. I wish the rose was a little more detectable . For what it’s worth, I’ve received two compliments while wearing this so I’m going to keep using it to see if I warm up to it a little more . Oh and it lasts and projects very well for an EDT

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Way to sour with the hints of rose slightly powdery… nothing special! I like the og better and nomade..

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This feels too mossy for me, kind of heavy, but it still has something of the OG DNA. Its not for me, I was hoping for a more subtle and fresher version of Chloé eau de parfum, but it wasn't that. I could see how some others might really like it though. Selling a bottle of 50ml in Europe is anyone's interested.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Light, clean rose, with some effervescent slightly bitter citrus. Oakmoss nodding very slightly in the direction of nomade. Does not have the powdery quality of original chloe edp. Very clean girl, easy to wear, classy, a touch sportier and less stuffy than original edp (which I love for it's princess nature!)

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
I’m not fond of Chloe edp. It’s one of those scents my nose finds schreechy and gives me the headache.
So I knew by reading the reviews in here that this might be different from the edp.
And thank God it is!
I really like it.
It’s fresh and crisp in a good way.
Reminds me a bit of Valentino Rosa Verde which i also have and love.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Absolutely Beautiful I layer it with EOS Cashmere Vanilla lotion and it works together so well. Has become this years summer scent for me. ♥️♥️ With or without the EOS vanilla lotion base it’s a 10/10 for me. Makes me smell soooo Pretty!! Just feel better wearing it.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Wonderful scent-10/10! I love Chloe and Chloe de Roses. I also love this, but wish the performance was better. Eh, I see they discontinued it and stopped selling it at Macys. It's not a huge loss because I still have Chloe and Chloe de Roses. Actually, I really want them to bring it back!

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
Beautiful natural smelling fresh citrusy rose with woodsy undertones. Not too sweet, heavy or powdery. Ideal for those searching for fresh authentic rose scent for spring and summer.
Unfortunately, Chloé has recently discontinued this one, probably in order to produce more generic sweet synthetic powdery brews ...

Scent: 10/10
Sillage: 7/10
Longevity: 7/10

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: my signature smell for so long. lovely. but im not 18 anymore. would buy again if it didnt bring out the worst memories possible. works for everything.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: I must have bought a fake off ebay, really disappointing ! 😡 All I can smell is a very faint Rose that lasts .. 30 minutes. so sad! I am a Chloe fan through & through. Would have loved this I'm sure.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: A bright citrus rose. I get a lot more grapefruit than litchi. It pulls back just enough from going into laundry detergent quality which is a plus because Chloe as a whole has many fragrances that smell like detergent. Bright, citrus, clean rose. Youthful easy and charmingly feminine.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Damask Rose is very gentle, bright and feminine. There is a slight and fresh Grapefruit scent that makes the scent more natural and green. It's just a shame that its longevity is quite poor on my skin, like many of Chloe's other Rose scents.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Fruity flirty feminine floral. The grapefruit and litchi add a tartness that gives it a spunky little personality. There is a very smooth crisp clean undertone, like a freshly starched and dry cleaned white collar or scotch tape right out of the package, and I think that’s what could possibly read masculine to some, but the tart fruits and the big rose keep it all the way on the feminine side for me. Moderate performance all around. Office safe. An easy reach in spring and summer.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: I get more grapefruit than rose from this. The rose tempers and softens the sharpness of the grapefruit. A very nice fresh take on a floral.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: I tried mixing this with Missing Person by Phlur and it smells even better! It gives it just a bit of drama that I prefer.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: It's more like a fresh and young version of a rose. It's simple and elegant - a modern rose scent. Easy to wear for every day.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: LOVE this one! There’s something about the original Chloé that I don’t like, I find it sour and a little mature smelling on me. This is way more fresh and elegant imo. It kind of reminds me of a less tart and fresher Delina. Soo pretty

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
Smells nothing like the original Chloe edp.
This is a horrible tart & sour mess on my skin.
Chloe eau naturelle is my favorite from this line.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This one is soooo good! Citrusy opening, and has a pleasant sharpness. I would say it’s a great summer scent, super fresh and pretty!

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Fresh, sharp and tangy at first, then simmers down to a semi sweet fresh scent. Great for summer!

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
I received a sample spray vial with my cosmetics' order... and fell in instant love with this scent so much so that I've immediately ordered more from eBay (verified trusted sellers, of course).

This is my first Chloe fragrance, so I didn't know what to expect but, a sample size is meant to give one a general idea of how good/bad, compatible/incompatible with one's skin chemistry, and generally liked or disliked the scent will be. In this case, good, compatible and very much liked.
Feels young and refreshing, too, and seems to lift my spirits whenever I wear it. I normally steer clear from scents with cedar and oakmoss as they seem to get too masculine on me, but, in this case, they seem to be very mild - still there, just not coming through like the wrecking ball.

My daughter, who is not really into perfumes, asked me what I was wearing as it reminded her of something from Hermes line because of the prominent citrus. I do have Hermes Eau Delicate, which I love for spring and summer, and yes, there is a bit of resemblance, but Chloe's citrus does not last nearly as long as Hermes's.
Personally, I love fresh citrusy scents, and the addition of lychee was just what this fragrance needed to soften the citrus without over-sweetening the whole thing like many vanilla based scents seem to do. The rose is delicate and lovely, but definitely there, so this gravitates more to the feminine side.

Longevity and sillage moderate, turning into closer to the skin in about an hour, so perfectly safe for the office.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
Elegant and innocent.And he does so with ease. Tapping into the natural essence of fresh gapefruit, a tender and sweet rose, this scent also incorporates the freshness of litchi and notes of amber permeate the overall bouquet.
I am also in a spring mood. Wearing Chloé L'Eau Eau as of late–petally rose over a woody notes base. Fruity, but still fresh
Oh, yes….note least it can be worn throughout the whole day.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Really sharp citrus at first. Then the scent fades from the skin leaving a slightly rosy and powdery scent. It's a real shame when you spray it into the air, it smells rosy in a good way. The fragrance does not work on my own skin. The bottle is beautiful, stylish. If it had worked on my skin, the scent would have been elegant too.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Pretty, feminine rose. Lots of citrus and woody notes I pick up if I sniff it closer. I've almost used a full bottle because I keep reaching for this.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: I absolutely love Chloe EDP, but the added grapefruit note in this flanker shifts this scent from fresh floral to something that reminds me a bit of bug spray.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
To my nose, it's very similar to the "Very Good Girl", since both of them have Litchi+Rose notes. I'm surprised that in the section "This perfume reminds me of" there is no votes for VGG as they are so alike. Chloé is more rosy and fresh. Very Good Girl is more sweet.
I liked this one more than Chloé OG or Chloé Rose Tangerine.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This is a very pretty scent. When I first sprayed this, it gave me sophisticated/floral vibe. It's just a good perfume overall. It also gives me a sweet note that I keep picking up on.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This fragrance smells very soapy and “clean”. I don’t smell roses to be honest. I think it smells like fresh laundry. Although it’s not a bad smell, I really like this perfume. The sillage is moderate and the longevity is long lasting.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: On paper this smells like chloe EDP but with the soapy, "laundry" aspect amped up. It smells like the most luxurious dryer sheet ever. But on my skin all I get is oakmoss and citrus with a tinny synthetic floral in the background. So disappointing!

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
I am in the hunt for a rose perfume so I started trying out Chloé fragrances. So far, this is my favorite. The original Chloé and l'eau naturelle have a very distinctive note which I cannot point out which I don't enjoy that much on my skin. This one however does not. It's a light dewy mossy rose. I usually don't like litchi, but it blends very smoothly and complements the rose I can't even smell it unless I look for it.
It's not anything ground breaking, but it's youthful, pretty and non offensive (perfect for the office).

If it was a girl it would be a romantic, preppy and put together sociology student who plays classical piano or dances ballet as a hobby. She also takes pictures of flowers for instagram and speaks French.

Edit: I just finished my sample. I could never expect to love so much a scent with litchi, but I absolutely do. It is not sweet, it helps the rose project nicely on my skin. Last few drops of the sample and surprisingly (it's an EDT) still here 6h later. That's it, I'm purchasing.
Edit 2: I got my bottle and I couldn't be happier. After wearing it for 7 hours I realized what I love the most about it: the youthful and feminine combination of rose and magnolia which I find sexy in a romantic way.
Edit 3: it ended up becoming my new signature scent. My 30 ml is 3/4 empty and I just ordered the full bottle. I'd like to add something important. Comparing my first bottle with the sample that I got I realized that depending on the batch you're getting, you will have more of the litchi- rose accord or the magnolia-rose accord. More on this when I open my new 100 ml bottle.
Edit 4: Confirming edit 3. My 100 ml is clearly more rose forward than the sample and my first 30 ml.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: So in love with this scent. I had a mini vial of the original Chloe EDP when I was 18; I used it only on special occasions to make it last since I was still a student and working part time. Recently I found this L'eau version in my little bag of samples I've collected over the years, and I've fallen in love with Chloe all over again. Brings me back to when I felt like I could conquer the world. I haven't smelled the original Chloe in a long while, so I can't compare the two too precisely, but from what I remember, L'eau really is a softer version, very rose-y. I also get some fizzy grapefruit, and some magnolia is present too. But mostly what I get is rose. Such a pretty fragrance, light sillage and it lasts about 6 hours on my skin. Unfortunately all the Chloe perfumes I've tried don't like to stick around on my clothes or skin too long, which is what makes me hesitate buying a full bottle. If not, I would always have a full size of this on my shelf. Very versatile, can be worn day or night, any season. Particularly I love this in the winter, it smells so crisp and clean. She gives me a good boost of confidence, which to me is the mark of a very special perfume.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Managed to snag a 100ML bottle at TJ Maxx for $50. This is one of my all-time favorite florals and I was down to the last few drops in the bottle I already had. It's October, but still warm enough here to wear this.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
