I do not seem to have the same fragrance as all the others are writing about….yet, I have the same bottle, in the same box, with the same colored ribbon, and the same name. Most others use descriptors such as rose, delicate, airy, and feminine. These words to me bring to mind other fragrances in the Chloe lime for sure. That has been my experience with all the other scents from this house. However, this scent smells decidedly masculine. It smells like a man’s cologne and something I don’t like on me. It smells sharp, green, with a ton of oak moss and cedar. If this is rose, it is all stems and thorns. The roses in the other Chloe fragrances I have tried smell to me like what I think of when I think of rose. They smell fresh, airy, sweet (without being cloying). I feel like me in them. This feels like something I would smell like if I wore one of my husband’s shirts after he just dressed sprayed a woody mossy cologne and quickly decided to throw it in the laundry basket and I decided to pick it up and put it on.

I love Chloe EDP, Roses de Chloe, Love Story, Nomade, and Rose Tangerine. This one while not unpleasant is one I do not relate to. It isn’t unpleasant exactly, but it does not feel at all like me or the Chloes I know and love. It does not smell on me at all like most other people experience it on themselves. It just must be my chemistry. Don’t really know. It is a mystery to me.

Update 7/1/2024 well, this bottle sat around in a closet where my husband put it because I suggested it may be good on him. Maybe because he isn’t a fragrance guy, it just sat lonely. I pulled it out and put some on and it is like a whole new fragrance to my nose. This is Chloe. She is a full blooded sister of the others and has come into her own. The rose mixes well with the grapefruit and litchi and has a a sharpness still that is bracing, but no longer smacks me with a masculine punch. She smells pretty darn fresh, lively, with some gentleness if you give her a little time to unwind on your skin. Lovely little tart Rose! Very pretty and surprising.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: The beginning is really fresh - grapefruit and litchi. But I think, it can be called "the mossy rose" ❤️💚 The drydown is somehow mossy and woody 🪵 with the rose 🌹 as I said. I like it more than the classic Chloé.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: I like it - I just do not love it. It doesn't stand out to me. It might just be me having some trouble finding "the" rose perfume, it might just be me having to come to terms with the fact that I am not a "pretty perfume" person - it has to be a little more complex than this.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This would have been perfect for me without the oakmoss. Wish it wasn’t so prominent in my skin.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: One of the best mainstream fragrance in market! Beautiful❤️

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Sensuality,I have been searching for a fragrance that is fresh, floral, feminine and long lasting and “Finally It has happened to me” lol. This one is so Classy and dainty I don’t think I’ve ever owned a fragrance like this. It might sound funny but it reminds me of a tea party the scent itself smells like a sweet Rose tea with little pieces of lemon petit fours on the side. It does have the original Chloe DNA but this has more “umph” to it by far. I sprayed it just to test it out and took a shower about 15 minutes later well after I got out of the shower, I could still smell this little, pretty thing on my arm. I think I may have found my signature scent..I adore this one ooh do I wish it came with a lotion. I will be leaving a trail of sensual, femininity behind everywhere that I go thanks to Chloe L’eau.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: I own the original, naturelle, and this one. I have to say I prefer the original for me. I think the addition of the grapefruit adds a sharpness to it that I personally don't like/don't miss from the original, which I find is much smoother. I think the OG is softer and "fluffier" (if that makes any sense), this one has a slight citrus peel bitterness to it which makes it a bit more acidic. As for the comments on the slight masculine edge, I totally agree with that but I personally really love that (one of my favourite perfumes is nomad from this house which is very unisex). Overall this perfume is very inoffensive, feminine, and summery.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Immediately I could smell grapefruit and litchi, two of my least favorite notes. After those notes mellow out I can smell the soapy rose. This is actually kind of nice, the grapefruit and litchi aren't too bitter or powerful. I think I actually like this more than the original Chloe. I am also getting some Very Good Girl by Carolina Herrera vibes, mostly because of the Litchi and rose combo. This isn't a must have for me, but I'll enjoy my sample.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: I really like Chloe fragrances, so today I tried Chloé L’Eau on one hand and Chloé Naturelle on the other one. The green one is meh, but this one made me sniffing my wrist whole day, love it. It smelled so familiar, and suddenly I got it; smell so so similar as Un Jardin Sur Le Nil by Hermès. I thought it will be so many votes for Hermes in "This perfume reminds me of", but there is none?! Do I have a weird senses, or nobody had opportunity to try the both? As soon I empty the Hermes, will purchase this one and hope it performs better. I just adore this grapefruit fresh, yet elegant fragrance. Love, love

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: My fave Chloe…summery, citrusy, lasts forever on my clothes and hair. I can’t stop sniffing my hair when I’m wearing this.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This was a blind buy as I found a good deal. At first I really liked it, although I expected more rose dominant notes. On me it’s very bitter and the grapefruit-oakmoss side is more prominent. I’d prefer if it was the rose note. I would give it a chance and wear it an additional 2-3 times and then probably pass it on. You can definitely smell the OG’s Chloe base but with a lot of bitterness and this edt is not as strong as the OG. Longevity is quite poor on this one, maybe 3h.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
At first I did not like this at all, but I've grown to love it. When I first smelled it, I was rather taken aback by the oakmoss and cedar in it, which bring a more masculine edge to the scent than I expected from such a feminine bottle. Now I would describe it to smell like freshly cut roses. Accompanying the rose scent there is a sharpness of freshly cut rose stems in it. It is not sweet at all, which I like. The opening is also sharp with citruses, but I cannot really distinguish a grapefruit note from it. The drydown is my favourite part of this scent with its rosy, earthy muskiness.

The lasting power is not that great and the sillage is very moderate, so this is a good scent for work or casual daytime occasions.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: I have a 5ml bottle of this, and all I smell is grapefruit.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
It is a lovely scent! It has a distinct Chloe-feel in it but it is very light. Suitable for a young girl, for very hot days or for days you don't feel like pulling off "a perfume".
However if your preferred price point is somewhat lower I suggest getting Paul Smith Rose instead. I love this Chloe bottle but I feel that I mainly paid for the brand.
All in all it is really nice EDT but a bit too expensive for that light scent that needs to be reapplied rather often.

EDIT: After having worn it for a while I must admit this is more nuanced and delicate scent than it appeared at first. The oakmoss makes it more serious and adult. Also the quality of the ingredients is clear. Moreover I actually prefer to wear it during the colder months as the citrus is less overpowering this way.
All in all, it is a versatile fragrance worth the money.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
Cedar and pale pink dewy roses mingle beautifully. Dries down to a lovely musk with grapefruit dancing around the edges.

I'm not one for rose scents normally, but I find soft elegance within this feminine scent rather than the old-fashioned vibes I often get from rose scents.

A light, pretty counterpoint to my usual vanilla and tuberose leanings. My skin definitely brings out more cedar than the votes here reflect. Good for any time of the year, but particularly spring and summer.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
Much tolerable than the original
As the name implies (L'eau) notes have been watered down here, so it doesn't have that strong soapy powdery in your face scent u get from the original

While I am a fruity at summer & gourmand sweet at winter kinnda girl
I can still see this wearable at the office , as it has that clean fresh off the shower scent
Also its calming , so can be used at night before bed time

But the original has a more lasting power (I guess because this one is an eau de toilet)

Suitable all year round I would say

Bottle is gorgeous , still has the same classic chic vintage style , u imagne seeing in powder rooms of the olden days

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Easily my favorite from the Chloé range! This is so beautiful and well-balanced between the fruitiness/floral aspects and just an all-around pretty scent. The bottle is gorgeous as well... I think I’d definitely recommend this to someone over the OG alone based on how popular the original is. If you’re deciding between this and something similar, go with this!

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
I just got this pretty bottle of chloe leau, I love the scent, its very delicate.
The opening is roses de chloe mixed with chloe original, the dry down is a perfect combination between chloe roses and lovestory…
I am not super happy with the projection sillage or longevity. It performs poor overall.
I would love to get a parfum version of this same scent, but doesn’t exist yet.
Again, scent is beautiful, delicate and divine, performance not so much, specially for the high price I paid.
You would need to almost Shower in this fragrance, and still, you and only you will be able to smell the divine scent. No body around will capture the perfume you are wearing. A very expensive body splash.
I kinda disagree with the “season classification” in general. To me, all seasons and temperatures are right for a good perfume. I really dont understand why I should wear this or that in certain temperatures.
This is a floral, fresh scent, so I suppose people identify this with spring and summer. Its December and im wearing it…

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This is a soapy rose scent. Very close to the skin, weak projection & lasting power. The original Chloe is far better. This is not worth the price.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: i imagine a pretty bitch wearing this. its such a pretty floral!!

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Chloe L'eau is happy, light and bright. I love the combination of rose, grapefruit and litchi in the top notes, it's really quite refreshing and ever so slightly sweet. On drydown it gets a little powdery and it has such a cloud of softness that it is really cosy.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
This is such a beautiful and light floral scent! It doesn't give me headaches which is a huge win on my book.

The opening is straight up alcohol for the first few seconds and then you get the bright grapefruit scent mixed with rose and magnolia. It's such a soft and lovely and beautiful floral scent, but it has some complexity to it so it doesn't feel too boring or generic to my nose. I occasionally catch the sweetness of the litchi and it's so delicious, it is definitely more prominent the longer your wear.

The only downside is how light this it (but it is L'eau so I guess that makes sense haha!). After 30 mins it's pretty much fading and I really have to get my nose super close up to smell it. That being said it does stay on the skin pretty well but it doesn't project much after about an hour. This does linger well on clothes though so try that to boost the longevity & projectio ! I sprayed it before hopping into bed and every time I go to bed I still catch whiffs of this and it's so lovely. It has decent sillage for a scent that's so light and fresh, but the longer you wear this the closer it sits to the skin. So if want more scent trails, you probably will need to reapply.

This is a youthful, girly, innocent, fresh and clean scent that reminds me of warm spring nights and sundresses, lunch dates and picnics.

EDIT: After wearing this several times I noticed I still catch whiffs of this on clothing several days later surprisingly.

I also recently tested the original EDP. L'eau is more gentle & sweet whereas the EDP is louder. I much prefer this one as the EDP is a tad cloying

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This is a rather boring citrus rose perfume that leans into shower gel territory. Nothing unique or special but it is more affordable then many of the other so called niche companies doing the same thing.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
I tried this sample that came with my order. I feel in love with it instantly. Love the airy rosy scent and it stays long and well on me!
I can't stop sniffing this on myself when I tried. I went to the retail store to try it out in case samples are a little different.. they are the same so that's good. I usually try out a couple of times before committing...

Next trip to the store, I'm getting this!

Update: I got the big bottle and have been enjoying it since!

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
Hmmm, I searched my mental vocabulary, my mental library.....my mental dictionary to find the right description on how this perfume performs on MY skin.

Whether you believe me or not, but here it is:

A clean hospital floor. ( I think its the oakmoss)

Its not medicinal....its not a dentist praxis, its....... a clean hospital floor or even room ready to be taken over the next patient.
I might have scared away some people with these words, but.....I actually want this one.
Longevity, like the original Chloe Signature, is superb.

24 hours on my chest.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
Edit: I've realised what this scent reminds me of: my beloved Green Tea by Elizabeth Arden!!! Chloé L'Eau is like a sweeter Green Tea with LOTS of fresh roses added!
The combination is absolutely heavenly imo...
I think the strong similarity between this scent and Green Tea is mostly because of the similarity of the opening note: strong, zesty grapefruit. And additionally, the base is similar too: lots of green, cooling oakmoss (not too dry/powdery fortunately.)

Original review:
I received this perfume by accident, but I LOVE it!!!

Wow, I don't know the original Chloe but now I'm wondering if I should test it! I love this perfume: it's a very pleasant, light yet sweet, slightly powdery rose scent.

I'm usually wary of oakmoss but in this scent it doesn't bother me at all!

This is a very potent beautifully balanced rose soliflore which would be perfect to wear in spring or even summer temperatures (although not in stifling heat probably).

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: I was really disappointed with this one. I'm having a run of bad luck with new to me fragrances at the moment. The notes sounded divine. I really like Roses de Chloe and rose tangerine is nice enough too so I was so excited to try this one. But it just doesn't work for me. I don't even get any rose until it becomes a skin sent and then if I press my wrist to my nose I get a faint whiff. Instead I get hammered with sour grapefruit and either the oakmoss or cedar, I'm not sure which it is, which makes it rather manly to my nose. And not in a good way, in a boy who has sprayed on a tonne of aftershave instead of washing way. It feels vaguely dirty and unwashed. I get no sweet litchi or smooth amber either. Just gassed by the citrus. Skin chemistry fail and I'm gutted but glad it's not a full bottle.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
Rose, pink, simple, clean
Top note - 100% luxurious rose soap
Middle note - pink rose + red bonbon (sweet & tart)
Base note - rose mint ointment + tiget balm

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Absolutely stunning perfume! Absolutely no laundry feeling if compare to the first Chloe eau de perfume. Modern, fresh rose - litchi - grapefruit combination for affordable price tag. Magnolia is beautiful here too. Nice sillage and longevity, all year around scent that appropriate for summer and winter times. Champagne Rose', upscale spa hotel and rose garden outside:)

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
ok, but boring and generic...the ony thing that makes it slightly interesting is the grapefruit that makes it the rose fresher and the oakmoss that gives it a dusty-smokey vibe.Other than that, glad I only own a sample and haven't got an actual bottle.

edit:I totally agree with the laundry smelling vibe others have commented before me

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
My ride-or-die every day perfume. I got a sample of this from a magazine - I usually never like the ones being churned out like butter and can be found in every store, especially not from designer houses whose main concerns lie elsewhere, and perfumery just feels like an additional cash cow.
Lo and behold - there she was. Like at first sniff, love at first wear. It reeled me in before I even knew I had been hooked.
It is rural, yet cosmopolitan. A modern girl. Sharp and a little touchy, yet, at the same time fun and warm and sweet. And it stays. It feels like who I want to become in a bottle.

Try it.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
A nice, clean, modern, fresh rose with just a little something interesting.
I love it when a brand's perfume captures the spirit of the brand so well. You love the Chloe girl stile, but all those dreamy dresses are so far out of your budget? Get the Chloe perfume and you can get the Chloe essence even with a cheap pair of jeans and a white T-shirt. Lovely!

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
Bought a 5mL of this perfume. I must say that it is a great summer citrus-rose scent! I smell a fresh laundry with this scent and it feels so comforting. The sour note it prominent here because of the grapefruit which gives a fresh feel to the fragrance.

3.5/5

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This was a blind buy for me, it's lovely but not my cup of tea. I use to love love florals and fresh florals but I guess I grew out of those scents. The longevity is decent couple hours on the skin. I have a brand new 1.6 ml bottle I only sprayed about 2-3 sprays. If anyone would like to purchase it off me or swap? feel free to send me a message!

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
I am trying a 2ml sample.
It isn’t groundbreaking but for some reason, it’s oddly comforting. I use it after shower it smelled fresh, dewy rose with citrus on top.
This is beautiful rose, I will buy a full bottle soon.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This lasts great for an edt which the house of Chloe does very well, stays my clothes for about 5+ hours! This reminds me of being in a magnolia and rose covered garden after fresh rainfall wearing a white sundress carrying a basket bag. I can't imagine anyone possibly hating this and would work well in spring and summer.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This is my first ever chloe perfume that I purchase. It’s so fresh and inviting, I really get the grapefruit and litchi here but not the rose. Which is great since I’m not a floral time of girl. I prefer fruity, fresh and sweet scents. It does pretty last long too. Overall, I super like it!💯

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Something about this reminds me of a fancy hotel lobby or a luxe day at the spa. Even more than I like to wear it, I love to spray this in my bedroom & on my pillows/sheets. It’s such a beautiful, fresh, clean & crisp rose scent. Also, I think it performs really well despite the fact it’s an eau de toilette.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: 3 parts Delina 1 part Chloe original. This is very pretty, clean, fresh, rosy and is a bit sour. Very beautiful in my opinion.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
This one has a clean scent of roses and citrus. As it settled, I got some very delicate woody notes. It's not bad at all - actually it's well blended - but on me it smells very generic, kind of a typical floral fragance with no character at all. I'm glad I sampled this, so I can say with absolute certainty that it's not my thing.

You might want to check it out if you're looking for a safe feminine, delicate floral fragrance, though.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This rose is fresh, lifts you up. Grapefruit and litchi make it so addictive, magnolia and oakmoss add sophistication. I love chloe fragrances and this one is the winner, even in winter I fully enjoy it. I think this will be great in spring and summer, but I am affraid that my 100ml bottle will be empty before spring arrives.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
After mourning the discontinuation of the original Chloe L'eau (green juice) I decided to purchase the new pink juice, not totally blindly, however since last year I did actually sample it, but I can't really remember what it really smelt like. Cue the biggest bottle possible on order!

The new L'eau has the signature Chloe rose and cedar drydown, but where as the original L'eau was more green, soapy and a little bit like lemonade, this one is more sharp, fresh and crisp. Sharp, realistic grapefruit mixes with slightly sweet litchi and magnolia, once it dries down the rose and grapefruit stay put and oakmoss and cedar come forward to round the entire thing off.

Silage and longevity are great, as always with Chloe fragrances, gentle silage and 8 hours of longevity, this is also one of the few citrus based scents where the citrus notes don't vanish and actually stay anchored. Its an easy to wear scent, as I find with all Chloe scents, perfect for sping and summer, office safe and signature worthy, glad I got a 100ml bottle!

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
Chloe L'eau smells exactly like a bouquet of roses with the stems and the watery mist in the air from when you buy it from a florist, although rose is the most prominent note. It also smells fresher than the original. A very pleasant, pretty fragrance. Projection is excellent, and it lasts like an EDP without being weighed down.

ETA: I don't like green or soft floral fragrances and this is the ONLY fragrance on the market that can do grassy rose right.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: I was actually planning on buying chloe edp but i ended up getting this instead. It's fresh and clean and somehow reminds me of EA green tea. I think it's pretty good to use at home or at work. Im obsessed with it sadly, it doesnt last long. i sprayed 7x but to me it just sits close to my skin. :( i still yearn for chloe edp...

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: A very light and fresh combination of citrus and rose, it smells like you are fresh out of the shower in the best way possible, longevity is okay, but not the best, it lasts for a couple hours but then you only smell it if you put your nose close to the skin. Best Chloe perfume out of the ones I have smelled, would like to try the Chloe - Rose Tangerine next!

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Wow, this is a thousand times prettier than the original Chloe on me, which has a bitter green component I just can't jive with. Instead, this is a lovely, fresh citrus rose, with just enough of a slightly woody and oak moss base to give it some depth. It doesn't rock my world, but I can totally see people loving this and it being someone's signature. It would be appropriate for close quarters or a workplace where one has to be careful as to what one wears as far as fragrance. This is is a safe blind buy for citrus rose lovers, in my opinion.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
One of my favorite scents from Chloe- love how light and breezy it is on me. Very fresh with citrus top notes and a nice mix of roses, magnolia over amber and musk- not overpowering. Love magnolia with the citrus.

For me this is both a compliment-getter and an I-can't-stop-sniffing-my-wrists!

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: A very forgettable fresh scent. Not bad by any means, but nothing to write home about. It's a very safe fragrance for "no fragrance" environments, you're not going to smell like much wearing this, instead people will just assume you showered not too long ago.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Very nice. I get that citrus smell straight off and it is almost peppery for me with those other components. The dry down smells sweet and it smells like very sweet white musk and amber has come to the party. I don't get the cedar nor the other bits at all. Its "light" and fresh. Settles down a bit but still there after a while. Can't say about longevity as I've just tried it at the chemist (drug store), however I like it. I much prefer Chloe Love though.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: An absolutely stunning and fresh fragrance from Chloe, which has now become my favourite perfume house!This scent went from something I didn't like at all to becoming my signature scent. The L'eau is quite different from Chloe EDP and EDT. The top notes are of grapefruit, lychee and rose, which is the first impression you get, and some might be scared off by the tart grapefruit opening. But have patience, my friends! This is a fragrance I have become completely addicted to, I actually crave it, my mouth waters when I think about dousing myself! I love the fresh grapefruit when spraying! Perfect for summer and spring, although I will probably use it all year round. It is not particularly sweet and it's a rose perfume with a new twist. When the top notes dry, you notice the beautiful heart notes of magnolia and rose and the bottom notes of amber, oak moss and musk. Being an EDT, I think it lasts a very long time, although I love to spray it on myself often because I like the grapefruit top note so much! Feminine, fresh, summery and a "clean" smell that can be used at work as it is not polarizing or too strong. Although the opening may seem sharp, it dries down to a beautiful rose and magnolia scent. I have received compliments everywhere for this scent; the shop assistants, my students asking me what I am wearing, people serving me behind the till etc. It's absolutely mouth-watering gorgeous.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: I wrist test it at the drugstore thinking it was the 2009 EDT one (with watermelon, rose and iris notes), but it definitely was L'Eau EDT, rosey, grapefruit citrusy, then later more magnolia and woodier. It's softer after 4-5 hours, but I could still smell it closer to skin after 12 hours. I like it, the soft woodiness is pleasant, it's delicate, classic, but overall not my style, same for the Chloé EDP, I don't know if I need more sweet in my floral perfume or if there is too much grapefruit or something else, it just didn't find the right spot on me.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
This is a dupe for Jour d’hermes! It is slightly lighter and touch more floral version.
Hermes last a bit longer

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This is a lovely soapy luxury rose. It isn't so much similar to Chloe EDP (which I love as well). It really reminds me of Cartier Goutte de Rose but Chloe is my fave one. It lasts longer than I expected (a couple of hours for sure). My most complimented fragrance currently.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
After getting over the initial whiff, which was too much rose IMO, you start getting hint of the other scents and gets better over time. I especially liked the lemon and cedar combination.

Doesn't last as long as I hoped.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
I got this in a perfume sampler box (where you try a bunch then choose your favourite for a large size). I am a gourmand gal, so this probably wouldn't have been a fragrance I would have tried otherwise. One spray on my wrist, after a shower.

My first thought was that this is an this is an 'innocent' or 'peaceful' perfume. By that, I mean I felt like I was transported back to a simpler time--being a young girl in a small prairie town, laying on the grass with my best friend on a warm summer day, making necklaces out of the flowers we found, without a care in the world.

I could still smell it hours later when I went to bed, very (pleasantly) rosy and very clean smelling, like I had just washed with fancy soap at a fancy hotel. [My husband (who knows nothing about fragrance) thought at that point "it smells like Nivea lotion!" :) haha]

I personally wouldn't buy an entire bottle of this, but I will relish my sample, and definitely use the entire thing.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Currently wearing a sample of this fragrance that I received in a Sephora order. This is really quite lovely! Definitely has that Chloé DNA of a clean, soapy rose. It is light and airy, fruitier than the original with the addition of grapefruit. Perfect for spring! I already have a full bottle of Chloé EDP so I don't feel like I need this one in my collection, but I'll happily finish my sample.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: I must be the only one who absolutely hates this perfume. My husband asked when I sprayed it on, " what is that insect repellent smell". It was so strong that I had to wash it off. It is a shame because when I have first tried it in a shop smellt really nice. So agressive, loud, can not bear this smell. Maybe I have mistaken the tester with the chloe roses edition.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Love this very much. I also love most Chloe perfumes like Chloe EDP, Roses de Chloe. This one makes my top favourite perfume because how happy and pretty it makes me feel. Its fresh but not too fresh. Sweet but not too sweet. I love the smell beginning to end. It's long lasting too

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: I must be anosmic to this because I put some hefty sprays on the back of my right hand and on paper and I can barely detect it. I get a bit of woods, some tartness and a hint of soapy rose.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: I recently got a sample of this with a Sephora order and omg I’m so IN LOOOOOVE with this scent! I know the Rose note might scare people off but I promise you this isn’t your standard overpowering, powdery “old lady” rose. This is more subtle and mixed with the other notes is very fresh and sexy but still delicate. If I had to compare it to anything I would say it reminds me of OUAI hair products such as their Rose hair and body oil. Very feminine, very confident, very modern but still classic. The mood I get from it is like Glossier’s You. I can put it on and head to the office and smell like it hours later but it’s not overwhelming. At the moment I’m trying to desperately savor my sample but I will absolutely spend the money on a bottle of it (or aggressively leave hints for my husband that I want it for any upcoming gift giving holiday)

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This is really lovely and my favorite rose flanker from chloe. Very romantic, feminine , sheer...

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
The perfect fragrance for Valentine’s Day 2020!

Sheer romance in a bottle, Chloe L’eau truly smells, to my senses, like being all loved up. No doubt this can also be owed to the flirty pink packaging, juice and trademark fabric bow. Regardless, I am so glad I have decided upon wearing this fragrance on Valentine’s weekend, after deliberating over a couple of others in my collection, Gucci Bloom and Si Passione by Giorgio Armani. Alas, this will fit perfectly with my millennial pink vibe!

As for the scent, the main story, I adore the effervescent lightness that usually does not appeal to me as a lover of heavy duty sometimes aggressively feminine perfumes. Chloe L’eau achieves a definite femininity but in a relaxed, elegant and confident manner. How typically French, and on that topic, might I add this transports me to somewhere fragrant in the south of France with each wear.

At the opening I’m hit by a mouth-watering sharp grapefruit mellowed by sweet litchi. The duo of zesty rosewater eventually intensified with damask rose results in a youthful rose note that is often hard to come by. Of all the recent rose drenched flankers introduced, this has to be one of the strongest. The juicy drydown leaves subtle lingerings of amber and a coy patchouli note. To those who judge Chloe L’eau for wafting away too quickly I can only assume our noses detect a heady patchouli entirely differently. That or my skin clings onto this fragrance for dear life. Nevertheless, a solid 6 hours wear for an EDT is impressive.

I would say this is a go-to for the summer months. However, having discovered my taste for it in a bitterly chilly mid January; now venturing into springtime, Chloe L’eau has a dewy perennial nature about it that makes it wearable all year round.

Chloe is a brand that plays it cool. Yet I can’t help think they would do well to emphasise the romance element fragrances like this conjure, not to the point of marketing nausea, but just to give them an edge on the competition. Beautiful perfumes like this are owed a little more love.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: İlk yarım saat delina klasik gibi kokuyor. Sonrasında her zamanki chloe çizgisinde tene yakın devam ediyor.yayılımı çok güçlü değil kalıcılığı max 5-6 saat

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: I expected something that smelled rosy & girly but this is very, very sporty. It opened as a grapefruit floral. A similar grapefruit to the one in L’Imperatrice 3, which I own and love. But then it dried down into an Elizabeth Arden Green Tea. I think it could work well in warm or humid climates. It is still quite present on my sleeve 24 hours later so longevity is longer than I would have thought.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This. Is. Lovely! Adore the sweetness at first then ohhh the dry down. I can grasp the magnolia for a short time. As a Southern lady, I really appreciate it. The musk stays with you all day. Great scent to improve your mood if you need a lift.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: if you want a mix between the edp and roses edition, get this. smell very good. i will get the 100ml asap :)

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: So much mention about this fragrance from women around me. Like a fresh scent for day time. Which is something that I love. So interesting..

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
I got a free sample of this from Sephora. The first spray is incredibly light. You won't be knocking anyone out with this scent, it sticks very close to the skin. However, it's adorable!

It smells simply like rose water for the first couple minutes. After a few more minutes, a little bit of tartness comes through--but not an unpleasant tartness. It's the tartness of grapefruit without the actual citrus, if that makes sense. A little later, a few more floral and light fruity scents join the mix, without overpowering each other. Very fresh!

It reminds me of a late spring/early summer night out with friends, when the temperature hasn't gotten horribly balmy yet, but you definitely feel warm.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
Ah, Chloe. Some years ago, I would never go near such a Big Brand, but missing an old collegue long gone who used to wear Chloe as her signature scent, (and a tester of Chloe’s L’Eau and Nomade from a magazine) changed my somehow stuck up way.
L’Eau is so wearable, rosy without the fruityness, a little sweet but poudery, an aromatic florall, if that can be said. used it daytime through advent this year, swiching to Maria Candida Gentile’s Cinabre at night.

L’Eau works well with:
Reading Vogue UK
Binging the overly sweet american dramedy «This is Us»
Ballerina flats (nude or pink optional)
Going to the library
Morning meeting at office
As a cure for January grumpiness

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
I tried this today in a 'why the heck not' moment of distraction.
Sprayed it once, on my arm, at about 11:30 this morning and can still smell it almost 9 hours later!
I like it very much and I'm not usually a Chloe gal at all.
I love cedar and this scent is certainly heavy on that note.
However, the citrus + rose are also still discernible at this point, very late in the dry down.
My only reservation is that the grapefruit is very strong in the opening accord and takes a while to moderate and blend in with the rest of the scent. There is sort of a 'lemon pledge' impression in the beginning.
Still, I would love a full bottle of this if I can find it at a reasonable price. At the moment the price point seems a bit high.

Edit 4/7/21: So, it's finally mine after a year and a half. Just got it for my birthday. It has indeed come down in price and I've sampled it several more times and really enjoyed it each time. I'm very much looking forward to wearing it this summer. It's just gorgeous!

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This is clean smelling and yet it is simply not unique. Nomade was a unique scent from all of the Chloe flankers, but this does not have much personality . I would not buy it , though I think Chloe Nomade is an excellent perfume . Too generic for the price in my opinion .

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This is equal parts rose (slightly sweet) and citrus, both grapefruit and lemon to my nose. I smell a little bit of a salty accord in there too. It's fresh and easily unisex, despite the girly pink bottle.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Chloe never disappoints! I love this house. Based on other reviews I feel strange because the most intensive note I got from this beauty is rose. Sweet sweet rose mixed with some oakmoss. I didnt get much citrus but mostly rose. I tested alongside my mum, we absolutely adored it. So feminine, classy, lifts you up, makes you feel beautiful. Definitely going to buy this one day!

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
Mid November is not the right time for this scent.

It's so consummately summery that I would never think to wear it past August. Like outdoors, blue sky, sundress territory. Compared to the mothership Chloe, this one is "greener" without really having the legit green notes. That makes it a little bit more unisex, less "fashion", and more fun imo. I want to kick off my shoes and be barefoot outside. I suspect the notes also perform better together in 70F + weather. A must have for next summer!

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Chloe is at it again , I was in Macy’s 2 weeks ago and the woman chased me down to try this new perfume , I fell in love , it’s just so feminine. Exactly what I was looking for as for an everyday scent . The notes are pretty accurate .

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Try it today. First five minutes it’s real good. Like CHLOE EDP but brighter, lighter. Then it turns very synthetic and i scrub it. I love almost all of her collection but not that one.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: I agree with the review below. Very earthy, industrial cleaner, air freshner-y. I swear it reminds me of Pine Sol! Also gives a little bit of a citronella candle vibe (you know, like the ones used to repel mosquitoes lol). The original L'eau with the green bow/juice was way better. A juicy, clean, fresh citrusy patchouli that didn't smell like a cleaner. Sad because the packaging is so pink, girly and cute.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This kind of reminds me of those fresh woods people hang in their closets for the pleasant smell.. it’s very fresh and woody to my nose. Kind of like cedar wood

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This fragrance is sooo long lasting, I can smell it 24 hours later and don't need to reapply because I feel fresh and perfumed until the next shower. Amazing, this creamy and mossy flanker is for me the best Chloe hands down and the most complimented by hubby in years. IMHO the best performance regarding fragrances launched in 2019. Strong projection and sillage too. Looking forward to see its rating in the fragrantica's awards as the year comes to an end..

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
Absolutely IN LOVE with this!! I am so surprised by it. I was expecting something very similar to the other Chloe’s such as the edp, absolute, and roses Chloe, but it hardly resembles them.
First blast of spray you would know it was from the Chloe family but it quickly changes to fresh and different! Must be the grapefruit that makes it so different to me. When it’s been on the skin a while , it reminds me of the tea note that is around in various fragrances.
I can’t explain how much I love this one. I have been wearing it all week and that for me is unheard of! I would even say it could be back up bottle worthy! Wow!😃

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This came in an Ulta catalog as a scented paper strip and I really liked it. So I went to my local store to test it and WOW!! I've always been sort of lukewarm about Chloé perfumes; cute bottles but not in love with any of the scents. This one, however, is amazing! It's so fresh and rosy but with bite. When you smell it, you get a tingle of grapefruit bitterness on your tongue. The sillage is amazing for an EDT and an L'Eau at that. This is such a pretty everyday fragrance that could dress up even your favorite yoga pants.😉 10/10

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Grapefruit, grapefruit, grapefruit with some litchi and then some flowers and moss in the background. Really refreshing. I love it

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: Wow. This is beautiful. This starts true to its notes and doesnt smell too similar to its other flankers

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This is just absolute trash. Smells really cheap, and the packaging is very bad quality too.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
In short - the very first... unisex fragrance from Chloe.
It starts wonderfully, just like you'd expect from the absolutely beautiful bottle, delicate, fairylike rose,but after about an hour it changes into masculine smell (at least on my skin). I was testing it without checking the pyramid first and was surprised since it goes so totally against what it looks like. After seeing the pyramid now I know it must be the oakmoss responsible for that effect (grapefruit added may help in it) Now,the funny part is I normally do like oakmoss in perfumes, and don't mind unisex fragrances, but here the contrast between what I expected it to be and what I got worked sadly against the purchase. Well, I'm a huge fan of the house, own several bottles of Chloe myself, so I might change my mind eventually. But for now, it's no love. And I'm not very happy about that.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
I did not like it at first, when I sprayed on the paper. I love the original and each flanker I observe with criticism, however Chloe always excels in it's feminine and elegant fragrances portfolio and never lets me down.
A week later I decided to give it another try on my skin this time and I managed to find some similarity to Dior forever and ever combined with the original chloe edt, which I have to admit actually I liked.
On the other hand, I am not sure if it is the timing of my country or the real launching of the scent, but definitely would not buy it for fall/winter

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
oh!
I cant forget this scent!

Honestly speaking I was always fan of Chloe bottles I never liked any scent so much to buy the full size bottle. I wanted to like them but.. they were to me too agressive, too fresh .. just too harsh . .. .

This Saturday - 09.07.2019- I was in Lille, France in Euralille center -Sephora store.

I was checking which testers bottles are in this town the top empty.
...I was like what girls in Lille like the most...

One of almost empty... one was the bottle of leau of Chloe.

I said hmmm what French women like about it so much.

Then I have sprayed and I fall in Love!

A delicate, powdery rose... cover with oakmos and musky kiss adored with lichie pokes...
I am totally in LOVE in that fragrance.... I have sprayed twice on my skin- and I left.

I was walking and I felt I am in another planet... I am a princess lost in wrong time ... I missed my gardens near by my palace. . and my pretty, long,
roses... dress... My nature is romantic... so right away...when I have sprayed... I think I moved to my past life regression :) its hypnotizing.. for type of woman I am....

This scent is not for everyone but if you have a few percent of sensitivity and innocent ...personality... you will get... me as walking INFJ... I am in love ... perfume.... fro introverts.. to run away to world of fantasy from brutal near by ... world...


thank you Chloe.... whoever... done it... GREAT GREAT job!

In my opinion - Its the best of all new fragrances of 2019.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
The opening is fresh, a bit powdery and a bit sweet. Later, the freshness tones down and the flowery sweetness dominantes. I usually dislike Grapefruit and rose, but in this fragrance they’re pleasant.
It’s not really original, to me it smells very similar to all other Chloé scents, but it’s still nice. It’s feminine, invigorating and carefree.
I recommend to to a young, funny and romantic girl.
Sillage is soft.
Final note: 7/10

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content: This is a lovely perfume, I bought it in Paris, and it was flying off the shelves...it is softer and sweeter than your typical Chloe, it is a fresh juicy floral, not sharp, and the rose in it isnt too sharp or old fashioned..the litchi keeps it from being overly floral, it has a natural sweetness that makes it smell so good !! .it is simply delightful, I feel very classy and yet modern wearing it...it has nice longevity...this is one I will reach for very often...the scent is as pretty as the bottle.

product_name: Chloé L'Eau Eau de Toilette Chloé
review_content:
Begins like a fresh luminous rose. But after a few minute it smells lemony fruity magnolia. Very similar to Eclat de Vert by Aerin and Izia by Sisley, Mugler yellow cologne a bit.. remember me also some fresh fruity perfume of the 90s like Green Twist by Les Copains (not in this database) Really Parah (not in this database) and Roger & Gallet Pour l'Homme (guess: not in this database). Actually it smells a lot of blackcurrant.
Anyway nice fresh fragrance. Smell a bit like a dated deodorant and classic shampoo like Gabrielle does.
As many have said this one is very very very light. Perfect for maybe an interview. My initial thought about smelling it was clean laundry. It's very fresh.

This one is little too delicate for me. It's very soft and watery - as Dahlia says above, nothing like the other Chloe fragrances. Very light and clean with the pear just noticeable. Not my personal favourite; one for those who like 'just barely' scents.

This one is a very pretty fragrance, not flat, firstly come fruits, but then come floral notes and sweet and spicy woodsy notes. These 3 layers "play": appear and disappear, mix and divide into parts.

I love to wear this perfume for everyday and it really is a light scent but strong enough to last all day. It is kind of hard to find now but many perfume discounter stores and ebay still sell it for really cheap prices.
beautiful, airy fragrance, it lifts me up instatnly. it's gloomy february now, but when i sniff it, the sun shines and flowers bloom around me. cannot wait to use it in summer!
I stand with dahlia for the character of the fragrance. Very fresh and easy to wear. Reminds me a bit of DKNY Be delicious in the top notes.

Chloe Collection 2005 is very different from the other Chloe fragrances, and is definitely NOT the same as the latest Chloe. Actually it reminds me the Chloe Innocence, but as a les flowery, more watered version. Collection 2005 is very light, fresh, unoffensive, innocent fragrance. It is not at all impressive or original, but it is just perfect for a hot summer day, when you don´t want to smell like something in particular, just lovely and fresh, a bit air-watery and in general cool. I think that the main difference between Collection 2005 and the latest Chloe is that there is no rose in Collection 2005, while the rose is very prominent in the Chloe 2008. In short, Collection 2005 is a good summer fragrance, very casual and easy.

I finally tried this on myself today. I have been smelling it on a coworker. She just retired and sadly does not work with us anymore but when I asked what she was wearing she said this. I kind of can smell it the way it was on her but when Im wearing it is smelling sharply but also sort of waxy. It is definitely very classy. I dont think this is for me to be honest. I do not think I can stomach it on such close distance on me. I can enjoy this but on distance. I still really love it but it will not be entering my collection.

Chloe Nomade EDP is the underrated designer gem of the fragrance world. Gives off niche and luxury. I overlooked this fragrance for many years, because I am not a Chloe fragrance lover. They have all felt a bit "meh" to me. Too safe, too simple "rose water", tween, early college experience of a sheltered girl to me.
And to be quite honest, when there are multiple flankers of a fragrance, I get overwhelmed because the difference between each is almost always unremarkable, and I'm stuck making the most impossible choice: trying to decipher the tiny difference between them and pick the one I like the most. That is why i have avoided Chloe as a whole for so long (way too many Chloe flankers), much like the entire Miss Dior line. I felt this way about Nomade, because of the many flankers of it (8 total in the line including the original).
My SIL told me she enjoys wearing this, but I never really understood it, because from what I recalled it smelled sour and like dirt to me, but on her it smelled amazing! Clean, classy, has her sh*t together kind of scent. I decided to give it another sniff at a Sephora, and I was not fond of it, again! Looking back, it may have been "scent smelling fatigue" because my senses were overwhelmed and I was over all the smells I smelled that day.

I decided to take a risk and buy a full size bottle, and I am so happy I did. I wish we could post pictures with our review, because the dent I made in this fragrance within the first week should be studied. I have had it since May or June, and my bottle is more than half way done. It is such a unique scent, a modern chypre. She smells classy, clean, and woody. The dry down is quite woody and masculine leaning, but you don't get it as much on skin as opposed to clothes. I love to spray on skin and clothes, and the morning after when I come into contact with the top I wore with Nomade, it smells very woody, almost like a barbershop, but a nice relaxing woody aftershave. It is not offputting. I would hate if the fragrance was like that through and though. If I wanted that I'd wear Cedrus.

I think the mirabelle plum in the top notes and more gentle white floral with a delicate fruit in the middle really make this fragrance a feminine, tender, yet high performing modern chypre. You still get the mossy dry down and its heavenly. I loved it so much, I decanted a 5mL to take on my honeymoon when I only planned to wear my wedding day perfume for honeymoon related activities.

It also reminds me so much of my SIL. I love her so much, we have a great relationship, and it takes me back to the night we met her as a family for the first time. She came over for dinner, and she smelled soooo good. I don't wear fragrance for compliments, but this one I am always guaranteed a compliment when I have it on. Most recently, I was at a family dinner on my husbands side. His aunt hugged me and inhaled me so hard. She pulled away and said "omg you smell so heavenly". I also wore this to my now husbands work brunch they had to celebrate us getting married. The front desk receptionist kept telling me how amazing I smelled, so I gave her the decant of Nomade I had in my purse, and my husband said she still talks about how good I smelled that day in their office.

Nomade is such an easy reach, it is the first thing I want to grab when I am fresh and showered and clean, and the first thing I want to reach for when I go out for any reason (errands, shopping, dinner, hanging out with friends, etc). I have to actively make an effort to use my other fragrances. It smells so fruity, tart, yet earthy at the same time. The fruits, tartness and florals are grounded by the most amazing base of woods and moss. It is appropriate to wear in any situation: office, going out, family events, day to day, etc. It is well received by people around you when you wear it, without being the standard "department store" perfume DNA.
Suspect pradalover below has obtained an imposter - or simply cannot appreciate Nomade for its beauty. One of only a handful of modern scents that I can wear with confidence. Magic.
it stinks like bug repelent like raid
The scent of clean laundry wafting on a fresh forest breeze.
The sent profile reminds me of MFK A la Rose. A la rose is more sweet, nomads has some freshness or tartness. Very beautiful and very wearable.
Smells like Gillette shaving foam on my skin. The one that my dad used when I was younger.
original, and at somw point a bit like air refreshener and then again moss, wood. Citrus in opening but later not as much. A bit of white flower also. Very dense in a grounding sense

I have so many perfumes and out there are so many new releases that sometimes is easy to forget about the gems you already have.
This perfume is, without any doubt, one of the most prettiest and more special perfumes I've ever had. It is not strong or overpowering, just a sheer but noticeable woody-citrusy fragrance that smells casual and, at the same time, like no other designer perfume. It has a niche quality because of its uniqueness. Reminds me a bit of Byredo's profile, being subtle and so special at the same time.
It is a clean-woody scent, perfectly safe for office or everyday wear, signature perfume worth.
It is not loud, not girly, not too mature, not old fashioned, but ethereal, earthy, clean, chic, elegant, modern.
To me is perfection in a perfume. May not be suitable for going out or if you are looking for a loud perfume with crazy projection. But is soapy and warm, misterious and sheer. A must for every clean, woody chypre lovers.
Smells specifically like guava juice and cigarettes to me. Not in a bad way but I wouldn’t reach for this very often.

Sinto algo tão doce e marcante aqui, quase podia jurar que tinha baunilha ou fava tonka, doce resinoso, mas talvez seja o pêssego que está dando este peso. Musgoso, patchoulizudo, amadeirado mas equilibrado pelo dulçor, então para mim não soou masculino em nenhum momento, como vi algumas pessoas descrevendo. Ele é lindo, mas invernal, não ouse usar Nômade no calor, com certeza vai desandar e incomodar o próximo, poderá sufocar legal

I had this fragrance a while ago.BUT.Still remember the scent.This is very charming perfume, with lots of sweet notes.It also gives some baby powder or makeup powder -like smell.
For sure it is best to wear it at winter and only at a daylight.Winter means less heat so its going to give a beautiful smell but not choking.This perfume is really strong, you have to know that.And thats also why I stopped using it.At summer it will give you a headache.
And for sure this fragrance is not to wear nowadays, it lost its time.
Typical clean girl smell. Smells like a garnier shampoo. Yawn.
Too old fashioned for me. Strong, but plain. Pure sandalwood with a hint of lemon. Smells like my dad- a 70-years-old man, who doesn't use social media and still reads newspaper in print

So beautiful, interesting and unique perfume. For me, it smells like a mystical dryad who is talking a walk through the forest, while all the magical creatures hiding there look at her with admiration. 🌹🌲

I really like this fragrance. The only reason I haven't bought it yet is that I'm looking for something that would feel like my signature scent at the moment - something I can wear daily and very effortlessly. Nomade is close, it feels like something a cool, independent, effortlessly chic person would wear! It's a unisex fragrance which I love, I feel like it starts off more feminine and fades into a more masculine, Chypre-sque smell. It's strong but not overwhelming, very wearable and elegant, would suit every season. I think I'd love to use it some time!
Chloe ,,nomade"-- too old fashioned for me. Def mature smell 6/10

I have a sample of this perfume. It's a great office perfume, elegant, sophisticated and "grown-up", but it was also an instant headache for me, and on my skin it immediately turned stronger, more woody and leathery, the patchouli show up instantly. I'm a gourmand girlie, so it's not my cup of tea, and if I want a clean fragrance for work I usually reach for more ozonic/airy/soapy fragrances, but if you love chypre floreal perfumes, you could definitely try a sample.

I lean more toward niche these days but this is such a classy designer that sets itself apart from the rest. It is woody, citrusy, slightly sweet while never hinting at anything gourmand. I sampled it once years ago and it was an instant love but I didn't revisit it until now. It is a modern chypre that doesn't feel dated at all. It is unapologetically "perfumey" without being cloying and maintains a fresh quality. It really is a standout to me amidst the floral fruity gourmands still dominating the designer landscape. Absolutely signature worthy for the boho chic vibe and can be found at a great price. If you like diptyque or byredo style niche you might be pleasantly surprised by the value for this one. Now I'm on to trying the flankers.

Slightly strange: don't think I understand this composition very well. The particular combination of fruity top notes and chypre base notes doesn't sit well with me. Not awful, just needs a bit of time but ... strange.

On paper, Nomade opens with a bright and sparkling fruitiness — sweet yet a little tart. It’s fresh, uplifting, and clean in the beginning.

The heart shifts into a floral bouquet, where jasmine takes the lead with a touch of rose. The peach softens things slightly, adding a powdery, almost creamy sweetness, but overall the florals stay light and airy.

In the dry down, it turns into a musky, lightly woody scent with just a hint of green earthiness from the oakmoss. It’s smooth, a little sweet, and ultimately a clean musk-forward citrus scent.

I can see how this could be a safe, well-blended fragrance for everyday or office wear, but its not for me. I personally wouldn’t wear it. Rating: 3/10.

I love this! Mirabelle note smells so happy and the grassy earthy oakmoss makes me feel like I'm lying in the forest surrounded by mirabelle fruits
It's such a joyful perfume for someone who loves nature, and it's so different from those sugary sweet gourmands, I am absolutely in love

I used to wear the edt more but I found the EDP super magical when I wear this every time! Smells like a confidence booster very put together. Fruity fresh earthy mossy a bit dirty as well some may find the opening of the edp too strong but please let it sits on your skin and wait for the magical dry down.

This perfume lives up to it's name Nomade IMO

The main accords definitely reflect this perfume well. It opens up very citrus and moss forward and it’s softened by a fluffy woody perfumey vibe. I bought a travel size probably about three months ago and the first wear was offputting to me; almost screechy because the moss and patchouli was just too sharp. But for some reason, a few months later, it has softened up a ton and I almost find it wearable for my taste.

I think the part that makes it hard for me to truly like this is the amberwood and patchouli because it turns this into those basic “perfumey” scents you smell at department stores. There really isn’t anything wrong with that type of profile and I know that it is a staple for many, but it’s just not what I’m into. I can see how this would be otherworldly when it initially launched though.

I love this fragrance, especially the opening!!! But it is STRONG. So strong that I’ve sprayed (ONE SPRAY) on my feet to see if that would help. There is something harsh about it that makes it super hard for me to wear. Love the notes, though. This is a boss lady frag, for sure.

Initially, I thought of this sent as a just a safe, non-offensive perfume. That is until everyone around me comments on how lovely I smell, even tho those people who do not care for perfume, making it a great choice for the office. Some reviewer on here said it smells like a sophisticated wealthy lady. I agree. The problem with this perfume is it's longevity and sillage...fairly weak.

Nomade by Chloe is the fragrance you put on when you want to say to yourself :”you got this”.
The spirit of feminine bravery.

Chloé Nomade is a slow day spent wandering in a beautiful, old garden on the outskirts of town in late August. In the morning, the sun is lazily leaking through foliage, the scent of white flowers softly wades in. The meandering paths and dry and sandy, thet take you under old majestic oaks and you reach a secluded spot that overlooks the city from afar. In the afternoon, you roam deeper into the shaded part of the park. The florals become more distant and you are surrounded by the peaceful, warm and mossy air.

Chtěla jsem tuto mainstreamovou vůni vyzkoušet. V porovnání s ostatními nomady je nezajímavá, zastřeně citrusová, rychle se rozloží na lacinou pánskou vůni. Ne nestojí za ten humbuk. Verze Naturelle a Naturelle Jasmine a nová verze d´Egypt ji strčí do kapsy. I Lumiere je o mnoho lepší.

I started wearing Nomade in 2022 after quitting my job to focus on my mental health. The juicy mirabelle gives it this unique brightness, and the oakmoss makes me feel like I’m surrounded by nature, like standing on a quiet mountain somewhere. I wore it while traveling solo, figuring myself out, learning to feel ok again.

Now I associate Nomade as my healing era scent. I even wear it around Christmas time as it uplifts my mood and reminds me of time off and being surrounded by people I love.

I’ve got about 10ml left in my bottle, and once it’s gone, I think I’ll pick a new signature. Life feels more stable now, and that deserves something new. But Nomade will always remind me of choosing myself :)

I have such a soft spot for this one!

It was the first perfume I bought for myself after I got an office job in the city in my late twenties. I had spent my young adulthood travelling as much as possible and was still basking in the memories of my adventures.

It evokes for me a sense of elegant independence and the desire to explore the world gracefully, with an adventurous spirit.

I did not like Nomade at first. I found it too mossy, too old-fashioned, too vintage in a way that was not wearable for me personally. I was never a fan of chypre scents, so I thought this would never grow on me, but how wrong I was!

I ended up giving my sample to my mother and, as soon as she sprayed it on herself, the room was filled with one of the most beautiful scents ever. It is a bit hard to imagine unless you've tried it for yourself. It is light and airy, yet it is grounded by the woods and the earthy moss accord. The honey-like plum mellows out the composition and adds the right amount of sweetness, preventing the citrus notes from turning too sour. Smells more expensive than it is. Expect people to notice when you're wearing it.

I read a comment below that compared this fragrance to what a forest fairy would smell like. Very accurate in my opinion.

This one grew on me! At first the patchouli really overwhelmed me, but I've since come to love it. Nomade is classy and inviting with a bit of intrigue from its base notes. A beautiful chypre— and if it's old fashioned, it's in the same way pearls are. Elegant and beautiful!
I bought this on sale in a duty free store, had it for a few years. It’s a very elegant soft smell that’s sort of fruity but just nice and warm/woody.

This is such a cool girl fragrance to me. I love it, it was love at first smell when I tried it back in 2022 during my days of working at a certain orange beauty store.

The way the mirabelle plum and citrus interact with each other is something I have fallen deeply in love with. The plum sweetens up the citrus just a perfect amount to keep it from being far too sour. As it dries down, and the florals and peach start to come through, it blossoms even more and it kind of even warms up the tiniest bit. I'd say the freesia is really only to add depth to the oakmoss note in here as the oakmoss is SUPER dominant, you really smart to smell it *with* the freesia and peach.

I feel like I'm not doing this fragrance justice with my review. I just love love love this, it's SUPER unique. I NEVER thought I would ever like oakmoss in a fragrance. I judged it by the sound of it at first. But I just love it.
Beautiful and luxurious scent. I feel like I smell like money when I wear it. Sophisticated and mature without smelling like a senior citizen. Definitely a versatile scent, adaptable to most seasons.

This must be one of those perfumes that smell differnt on people's skin. At first all I smell is a lime toliet spray!
On the positive note, looking at the flankers, they don't have much citrus in. I do like some citrus perfume such as light blue and Libre. I will still try the other in the range, just not the eau de toilette.

I first bought this perfume back in 2020 — a 20 ml bottle on sale. It was love at first sniff. I was amazed by its longevity; it literally lasts all day (I could still smell it the next day), and on clothes it lingered for more than a week! I treasured that little precious bottle and used it only for special occasions because it was truly unique and special. Five years later, for our anniversary, my boyfriend surprised me with a gift set that included a 75 ml bottle. I couldn’t have been happier! I fell in love all over again with that familiar scent that evokes tenderness, freedom, and strength in me. Nomade has that distinctive blend of fruity and earthy notes — the scent of mirabelle plum, refreshing freesia, and elegant oak moss. It perfectly balances femininity and confidence. It’s not overpowering, yet it leaves a strong impression. This is a perfume I wear for a reason — to feel special. It has character, depth, and that unexplainable “something” that makes people remember it. A warm recommendation to anyone looking for a long-lasting and elegant fragrance. For me — the best perfume ever. ☺️

Nomade was the perfume I wore for my wedding. It was the perfect choice. The scent of course brings me very happy memories of a beautiful day, but I chose the fragrance because it smells like laying in a big patch of moss in the middle of a rainforest at dawn & I thought it would be a great fit for my wedding perfume since it was in a garden. The scent is sophisticated, yet delicate, and it has many layers to it. It starts of very fresh and citrusy and eventually dries down to a green and comforting scent. The perfume lasted all day and the people getting ready with me really enjoyed the perfume and asked what I was wearing. I cherish it now more than ever. :)

This fragrance irritates me
The base notes really shine through and it’s patchouli … I can sometimes do it but this one , I can’t .

Nomade means a lot to me. I bought a full bottle right after trying a sample when it first launched in 2018, which is very rare for me. Usually, it takes months or even years before I commit. But Nomade came into my life at the right time, and it stayed. It marked a period of real growth for me, and every time I smell it, I remember that. It carries a sense of pride and strength I’ll never forget.

The scent itself is something special. It’s woody, but in such a way you don’t even realize it. It's earthy, but also incredibly airy and light. It's a perfect balance between feminine and masculine. Strong, grounded and free, bold but not loud. It works, in a very honest way.

And maybe that’s why it speaks to me so much. I live a nomadic life - I travel constantly, changing countries and continents, and it’s not always easy. It takes real inner stability to keep going when nothing around you stays the same. Nomade captures that feeling for me completely. It smells like movement with roots.

I’ll always love this one.

This is such a great sophisticated scent to wear on a day when a lady needs to feel a bit bold, as if she has her $#i+ together. Those of us who love Chloe Nomade don't tend to care if others find it ordinary, or lacking in depth, or too masculine, because we are grown women who just don't bother to waste our time seeking the approval of others. We may wear what we like and enjoy it. Merci, monsieur Bisch, for this lovely gem of a fragrance. The earthy oakmoss dry-down is just so divine.

She is a nomad. She has travelled the world in linen pants, felt silk and furs through her fingers in artists' markets in Tangier, smelt intoxicating spices in Mumbai and drank pu'er tea in Xi'an. She has noted the bitter military encampment in Myanmar, noted life's injustices simply by being able to be a single woman travelling relatively undisturbed due to the power of her passport. She misses nothing, romantisizes nothing. That said, she loves hard, and has intense, passionate affairs. Men in Spain. Lovers in France. Even a fellow nomad traveller she'd met in Montevideo. She cannot be tied down, and she always travels alone. So I can better experience things, she says, without another person's perspectives skewing me. A self-assured, quietly powerful woman who is both at home in a pair of heels in a Ralph and Russo gown or Birkenstocks and a ratty tank top.
She is a witness. She is a traveller. She is a lover. She is Chloe Nomade.

I feel like this perfume, like the woman she is for, is quietly confident in itself as well. Woodsy, well balanced, and with a very well done plum note, she knows the people who will appreciate it, and doesn't mind the people who don't. She's not pretentious. She's just waiting for the right woman to discover her
At first, it’s very sweet with a hint of pepper, but once it settles, there’s nothing really interesting left. It fades into something quite plain.
I don't know what it is but it smells medicinal to me, or like jagermaister

I typically love Chloe perfumes, but I just don't get along with this one I guess. The plum is overwhelming, screechy and gives me a headache. I love woody and mossy fragrances, but Nomade is all synthetics. That's not necessarily a bad thing, but when you are used to smelling the natural ingredients, it can be rather confusing to refer to something as "oakmoss" when it is not.

Nomade really isn't woody or mossy to me at all. After the harsh fruit wears away, I pretty much just get a soapy Egyptian musk. I actually like that part, but the fragrance just doesn't match the pyramid or the concept to me at all. Lasts all day with a couple sprays.

Another signature scent of mine that I truly adore. Quentin Bisch has this genius way of making woody notes feel like fantasy spun into fragrance. Nomade is power, it’s elegance that doesn’t try too hard, a beauty that refuses to fade. For me, it’s the best from Chloé.

The opening? A sparkling burst of mirabelle, bergamot, lemon, and orange fresh, uplifting, like a sunbeam through treetops. The heart blooms with freesia, jasmine, rose, and peach, adding that soft feminine depth. But the real star? Oakmoss. It’s what lifts this blend into something magical. Patchouli adds that rich, earthy base, while amber, musk, and sandalwood wrap everything in warmth.

It’s the scent of a fearless spirit. I’m already on my second bottle and still in love.

– Bhavna Darira Chesan
Obsessed, well rounded. Pretty
On my skin all I get is the mirabelle and peach, very fruity, with some faint musky-powdery florals in the. background. Sad cause I was looking to get that strong oakmoss note.

Lovely, everyday perfume. Not a standout and not offensive. Just a nice, clean perfume. I pick up a touch of light aldehydes, making this safe to wear outside of the house for errands instead of just for bed. I tend to categorize aldehydic fragrances in the post-shower bedtime category, but this one has more range.

I quite like this perfume, it has a citrus burst and a tinge of floral fruity. Dries down to a very fresh, comforting woody smell. A very well done woody smell for those in their mid to late 30s would work well far into the 40/50s.

It reminds me of my grandma, her house always smelt floral woody because of her well kept garden and wooden kitchen utensils. This is the smell of when I stepped out freshly showered into her house.

it somehow feels crispy, like the forest. florals are really refreshing. there is definitely a masculine character but overall i'd still say that this is a woman's fragrance. performance is way better than other chloe's.
i love this!!!
valaya + miss dior cherie on a bed of oakmoss
Smells like pine trees. Literally.
I think I will forever have this in my collection the original Edp is my favorite from the collection ❤️
This reminds me a lot of afnans mystique bouquet AND rasasi jasmine wisp which are similar to valaya and erba pura

I got a decant of this and wasn’t expecting much
But im surprised i really do like it
It does smell very classy and elegant but also pretty unique at the same time
Its neither juvenile nor mature
When i smell it i imagine being in a slightly shadowy garden
Idk if i want to smell like this to others cus it would seem like a false advertisement (im not really outdoorsy type) but id love my home to smell like that as it’s a really pleasant scent
lovely and soft, it's not overly sweet fresh it gives classy scent and long lasting.
This is by far my most complimented perfume. I prefer wearing this in slightly warmer weather, like spring and early summer.

This is kind of experience fragrance that you have to wear properly, have to spray on yourself and feel how develops, is not a kind of fragrance you try on paper test or just a little on wrist, you will not feel all the experience in this way, because this perfume has a deep layers, something you will seem by the time goes by, it was a late discover for me, but I'm glad I have now🩷

After reading (way too many) reviews on this, I had to double check that I received the correct item from Sephora. I sprayed on my inner elbows and wrists and immediately got a sweet, juicy … something. Truly I cannot put my finger on the fruit scent I’m getting, but it’s fleshy and at the forefront for quite a while.

I DO like this fragrance, but I am simultaneously a little disappointed that it reads SO fruity and sweet on me. I was under the impression this was leaning into the 90’s chypre-floral realm and couldn’t wait to explore it.

This started off as a Christmas candle and evolved into shampoo. Maybe I have a skewed perception of what a genuine, vintage (I say for lack of a better term) chypre is. I did get some spice and warmth for a few minutes in the opening, it just didn’t last. Overall, I’m happy with it! It’s definitely better performing and more unique than the other Chloe’s I have tried. I also want to get up and move around just to get those sweet, magical little wafts of myself ☺️

I hardly recommend blind-buying, so definitely try before you buy.

I work at a souvenir shop and the other day a woman came in and filled the corridors of the store up with this beautiful scent that reminded of what I imagine a fairy smells like. It was green and fresh with a very delicate floral. As I am not shy, I went up to her and asked her what she was wearing. She told me it was this perfume. So that same day I went to the store to smell (and maybe buy it as I had loved it so much). When I sprayed it on paper and on my wrist I was so disappointed. It smelled nothing like her. There was a spiciness that made it smell like DIY coca cola. However when I went back home I kept getting that same smell I felt on the lady. The drydown on this is quite beautiful and unique. The scent trail is gorgeous. I still dont like it when I smell it directly on my wrist. But the scent trail is something different. Like a beautiful orange zest with a delicate floral.

Very interesting scent. The first 5 minutes it was too screechy but then it dried down to a very pleasant, unique floral/woody scent that somehow reminds me of midnight....I don't know how else to describe it lol...That is what come to mind for me: midnight. I like it! It is musky and dewy. Nothing like the original Chloe.
to me this smells like a christmassy pine candle in the best way.
I didn’t like how it started and it got worse. Like rotten tropical fruit over wood, also rotten. I don’t understand how people like this.

The opening is vibrant with fruity and floral notes, but as it settles, it becomes mossy and musky. While I liked the start, it develops into something that reminds me of scents I used to smell on my grandma. Decent, but not for me.
