Chloe Nomade is my BFF for life. I just wish she was more beast mode in her projection. I have no idea what Mirabelle smells like but I do get a hint of guava in the opening of this fragrance that is so unique.

The opening is interesting, with soft mirabelle and oakmoss adding a delightful nuance. The freesia is beautiful, and the musky drydown is nice. Overall, it's an enchanting and intriguing scent that makes me feel like a whimsical forest fairy. It's not what I'd expect from the usual Chloe line which I'm also a fan of, so I appreciate this uniqueness. I do wish the oakmoss were more prominent, as I love the earthy charm very much. Unfortunately, the performance could be stronger, as it's quite weak in terms of projection and longevity.

It’s just so gooooodd, so addicting perfume for some reason. So nice, unique and quite complex, but so beautifully feminine scent. Inoffensive, perfect level of sweetness.
For me, it’s mostly a powdery, woody and floral perfume. Very little citrus-y.

Sillage is good, longevity as well! Lasts for about 7-8 hours on me I’d say. On clothes it lasts til washing the piece, amazing!!!

9/10 from me

I still have my tiny 30mL bottle of this that I bought in 2018. I was in the hospital, and was advised that I shouldn't spend all my time in my room lying in bed. So a friend took me to a local shopping centre and we looked at perfumes. I ended up buying this and it kept me company for the remaining month I spent in hospital. It means a lot to me. It's such an uplifting scent. My bottle is seven years old. Astounding to me. I barely wear it anymore, but every time I do... beautiful.

Vibrant citruses, jasmine, freesia, rose, peach and mirabelle, oakmoss, and patchouli ... in that order. Someone below compared it to 90s aquatics and ... yes. 100%
Very classic clean floral scent. Definitely worth a try! And it’s not overpriced either for original house fragrance. If you want to smell like a fresh classic lady - this perfume has got it!
If you want to smell like a classy B, then this is for you! This is not like the other Chloé fragrances, this has an attitude and has good longevity

Juicy FRESH fruit -- I make that distinction as someone who typically steers clear of fruit-forward scents. Not syrup-y sweet, but a dose of juiciness atop dewy white florals. With a little mossy edge! The girl who wears this is cool. Laid-back, easy-going, fun, approachable, hip. She's effortlessly pretty, and doesn't need to try hard!
It’s a very lovely floral and clean perfume.
I was given a sample of this with my purchase at Sephora and I like it a lot! Very citrusy floral scent, smells very fresh! Definitely made for spring

I arrived late to the party.
Such a beautiful fragrance.Omg.
Someone told bellow that smell as hug, is just like that, such elegant and warm smell.
Is not loud but in its way get attention by the confort that brings.

Nomade is so well blended, so well put together, so perfumey.... Don't be fooled! It cannot invite you to adventure, but more like to a fancy picnic. Real nomads who seek the rawness of experience and tent accommodation under the stars won't find a partner in this one. It smells expensive and will make you look like a wannabe. It lacks the edge you would expect from the name.
On the other hand, it's safe as a blind buy / as a gift to someone who feels young, feminine and classy.
It's a very complex scent that definitely smells expensive. It's a more mature scent rather than youthful. I'm not a huge fan personally and I've never been complimented on this one.

Instantly brought to mind watery-florals of the 90s. I immediately got Calvin Klein Escape, some sense of Elizabeth Arden Sunflowers, even a little bit of L'eau D'Issey.

Now I understand the whipsaw here between "dated" and "stunning". My bet is that Millennials smelled this profile on grown women when they were children, so it feels dated to them. Gen X is loving it because it was our jam back in the day, and Gen Z are finding it interesting because they haven't smelled this profile before.

I didn't get any of the woody/mossy drydown described, it just went soapier and soapier on me, so I layered with The Maker Stag today and it's grounding it nicely.

I got a travel size of this and really wanted to like this based on some of the other reviews, but it just reads as dated to me. I'm not sure if it's because fragrance, like most other things, can be cyclical in fashion/style, but this too strongly reminds me of what older women were wearing (and probably over-spraying) in the 80s when I was a kid.
smells like the candle aisle at michael's during christmas time...and yet, i keep smelling it lol

OMG, I am late to trying this out! I am in awe of this scent. This is so well blended, and the perfect amount of woodiness and the oak moss gives it a very natural outdoorsy scent. So GOOD! It lasts too and is soft but still creates a very nice scent bubble. I love it! I want every Nomade flanker now.

I had Nomade for about a year and I really tried to feel comfortable wearing it.
No other perfume impressed me as much as this one did. The smell of freedom, peace, love and an enchanted forest.
It's different, easy going, with caracter, it makes you fall in love and smile. It smells airy, sparkling, creamy and something slightly caramelized.

But there's no escape from the aftershave scent of the drydown...and it's all I smell for hours.
A linear and intrusive oakmoss :(
But a good side is that every time I'd open my wardrobe, I'd smell Nomade on clothes and it smelled absolutely divine !

I wonder if I'd end up buying it again one day...

True to its name, this is perfect for a soul always on the move; for a wanderer in pursuit of the horizon. This lends a refreshing yet timeless new perspective on the classic chypre scent. Opens up as a clean floral meadow sprinkled with cinnamon and a sparkling touch of mirabelle zest, playfully earthy and light. As it sits, the florals become heavier with a very generic rose dominating the drydown. What saves this for me though is that mossy rootedness of the undertone that keeps the scent from fading into something too ordinary. A scent to remind free spirits of home no matter where they roam.

ughhh i hate how much i love this. i certainly didn't expect to after the letdown that was chloé edp, but nomade is an undeniably !!! gorgeous !!! perfume. like chloé it screetches on opening - astringent and citrusy, almost choke-hazard worthy. (i'm starting to think that's part of the brand's dna.) it's the kind of perfume you immediately want to hate. but once it starts drying down, there's no use. it turns into this beautiful, understated burst of soft jasmine, freesia and slightly fruity goodness, wrapped in what i can only describe as a powdery, musky hug. it's not overwhelmingly woody on me like i've seen other reviewers say, but the base notes certainly give the fragrance warmth and depth, tempering the citrus and white florals rather impressively. it's elegant, aromatic, and after a few hours of sitting on the skin it turns into this beautiful soapy, woody mix i can't get enough of. other reviewers say this is barely feminine; i'd like to disagree. this is a woman in her mid 20s with her shit just barely together: independent, stylish, with a vintage look and a modern attitude.

This one is definitely not something that I would personally like to smell on everyday basis. I am not even sure I could say that I actually ”like” how it smells as a scent - yet wearing it every once in awhile is an enjoyable olfactory journey nevertheless. It is obvious that it was created by someone with a really good nose and great sense about the power of scents in evoking emotion and memories.

When it comes to how it actually smells to me is a somewhat generic modern feminine perfumey opening that is quickly turned into an overwhelming and somewhat unpleasant men’s cologney (though more old timey one rather than contemporary favorites) scent with a slight hint of an elegant, if somewhat dated classical women’s perfume lingering in the background. After a while the “men’s cologne” overload wears off leaving you with an actually quite nice subtle aromatic woodsy, slightly spicy and slightly sweet base. I can see how this scent could be just the right one for someone and very addictive if it genuinely feels like “your” kind of scent, but it is mostly a no for me personally.

BUT - what I love about Nomade is that even if you are not particularly fond about the scent, it can still be a very uplifting experience when worn at the right moment. How I picture it, is a busy career woman in her late 20’s or 30’s in a bleak rainy autumn day, stopping at a cafe after workout, wearing expensive yoga pants, her head filled with e-mails to answer and errands to run, when suddenly a Simon&Garfunkel or Mamas and Papas song starts playing and she is temporarily transferred into another time and place. She pictures herself sitting by a late summer bonfire at a beach after a sunset, with guitar playing and some guy lending her his brown suede jacket when it starts getting chilly, his scent mixing with hers.
To me Nomade isn’t an actual old timey or bohemian perfume, but it definitely has elements that can create an idealized nostalgic image of a carefree flower child. It isn’t an authentic image of an era, but it is much more wearable than what a more photorealistic version could ever be.

Nomade isn’t a scent that I would love unconditionally, but it is a work of art that I respect. It often feels like every new release that has gained any hype during the past couple of years has either been a fairly one-dimensional gourmand vanilla bomb, a more “complex” scent which in this context means that it contains more notes but all of them are amped up to the max lacking balance OR an undoubtedly interesting, yet utterly unwearable niche creations. Nomade is a refreshing exception to that pattern as it is a well balanced, yet multi-dimensional scent that is still subtle enough not to offend the majority of people around you.
It is a feminine leaning scent, but could very well be worn by a guy as well. Sillage is moderate (which I consider as a pro instead of a con for this type of scent) but by no means weak and longevity is actually quite impressive though not eternal. Can be worn both day and evening and in all seasons, though I find it most suitable for transitional seasons (autumn or early spring). Not the safest blind buy for everyone, but if you love heavy vintage style chypres and are looking for more inoffensive and office appropriate daytime scent, Nomade could be a good bet - or conversely it could be a gateway drug into the world of chypres for a contemporary gourmand girl as well.

As a sidenote: I received miniature bottles of Nomade and Burberry Goddess at the same time and noticed that they actually pair quite beautifully when layered together. So if you have both and find Nomade “too masculine smelling” and/or Goddess too sweet or simple it is worth trying to layer them.

patchouli, sandalwood, rose, jasmine
Interesting smell, wild and sexual, with earthy vibes. Very intense, powerful vibe at the beginning, but such a gentle perfume afterwards with earthy and woody accords

I decluttered this one. Based on the reviews and notes, I wanted to love it, but it was too heavy with jasmine and freesia, reminding me of my grandmother's perfume from the 90's. I love my grandma to pieces, but as a 35-year-old, I don't want to smell like her(and neither does my husband). :)

After having tried (and not being "wowed" by") Chloe EDP, I was somewhat apprehensive about trying this fragrance, but it was on my list so I finally got around to it today. There was something about the opening, perhaps the mirabelle, that was incredibly off-putting, but once I got past that I began to really enjoy this. The only other problem, however, is that it is incredibly weak; even with multiple sprays on my arm I can hardly smell it anymore, after having applied it just an hour ago. Had this been a bit stronger I would have certainly considered adding this to my list, and perhaps if an intense version of this is released in the future I may consider a purchase.

Also, I must say that I was incredibly surprised by how good this smelled in the dry down, especially considering that moss notes don't tend to mix well with my chemistry. I am fairly certain that this is the first fragrance with oakmoss that I have actually enjoyed on me!
Absolutely adore this perfume. It’s such a unique pairing of scents that I can’t quite replicate in any other fragrance. I like that it’s not in-your-face feminine but still reads as a perfume.

I saw someone in the review says that this is a modern chypre and I blind bought it. It's weird but I love it so much. The patchouli and oakmoss combined with all those citrus notes make a guava-like scent. It's to my personal liking so it's a safe blind buy for me. Will not recommend this to random people.

So, i tested this when it was released, hated it with a passion...6 years later and i dont know what happened but i love it now! Maybe because i more used to niche fragrances and this one is truly a stand out in the designer world of perfums. Last a long time with great projection and many many compliments! I smell the signature touch of mr quintin bisch in this, it even remindes me a little bit of valaya, wich is also a love of mine. On if the best designer out there!

It's not bad. I actually really love the opening. It smells like a fresh forest with berries covered in dew drops... very unique. The drydown is more perfumey and harsh, very "designer". It loses its uniqueness in the drydown. Overall, really enjoy the opening but the drydown is a bit too much for me and I can see it potentially giving me a headache.
I don't mind it as a man's cologne, smells like your generic store in the mall that smells like cologne. But it's marketed as a women's perfume.. so I am not a fan. Very very masculine.

To me this smells like a mans cologne at first,then it turns into a generic shampoo like scent.
It's not complex unfortunately,nor long lasting on me.

Not a safe blind buy. I got this because of the good reviews and because I adore Chloe. I thought if I liked Chloe so much how can I go wrong with another of their creations. Boy I was wrong. I get no citrusy and no floral notes. I get nothing sweet. It’s just wood. Moss. Strong. I sprayed once on me in the am around 7:30. Still strong by 2 when I got home. I was also told I smelled like a Christmas tree. I don’t know if it was my skin chemistry or what. By the time I got home I was so intoxicated by the smell I was nauseous. And no I’m not pregnant. I got in the shower and scrubbed three times to get rid of the nasty smell. This reminds me of an old church lady. Just GROSS.

Not a safe blind buy. I wanted to like this.. I really like Chloe and thought perhaps I will like this one. Also reviews said it reminds people of miss dior Cherie. This is awful. Way too strong. I only sprayed once and tried to wash it up. I would see a church old lady wearing this and I like woody scents. Just NO.
When I was a kid (over 15 years ago), I used to play with play-doh (plastelína). This is the same smell! When I sniffed this, I was back in my kindergarten class playing with play-doh.
Smells like if Valaya and CoCo Mademoiselle had a baby🤌🏾

Someone I know bought several gift sets of Nomade EDP just in case the negative reviews from younger shoppers expecting to smell candy, cake, and sweet flowers who troll non-candy fragrances to leave bad reviews (and usually don’t buy decent designer perfume anyway) might get it cancelled. Very smart. But fortunately Nomade EDP has stood the test of time and found an audience of raving fans.

One of the best designer fragrances on the market. As a suede chypre, this perfume has an amazing tickling texture to the nose in its early stages, ingeniously mimicking the texture of suede through an olfactory sense of texture or tickle. It’s an amazing accomplishment, it’s beautiful, it’s chic, it’s high-end, and it’s unique. People keep saying Nomade smells masculine or they have some complaint along those lines, but perhaps they don’t realize that A) this is a suede chypre, therefore it’s not supposed to be anything like the sweet candy mass market messes that have been invading sinuses for decades since Angel was introduced and it’s not supposed to smell like a fruity floral bouquet, and that B) in the early part of the 20th century some of the legendary classic women’s perfumes were smoky leather chypres, which smell masculine by today’s standards (ever try vintage Bandit by Piguet?) because GUESS WHAT: the era starting with the launch of Mugler’s Angel through the present is the first time in the history of perfumery that there has been a trend of people actually wanting to smell like they have been rolled in caramel and chocolate and then covered in cotton candy and topped with funnel cakes. I like smelling Angel in moderation on someone else occasionally, but it’s the lengthy trend started by Angel that I’m citing. I don’t think that smelling like a state fair or a candy store or an ice cream shop is alluring. Why not just be exotic and introduce turkey and dressing perfume that you hose on with a turkey baster? Nomade EDP is an excellent contribution in the movement to return to some glorious perfumery traditions such as leather chypres, fougères, chic non-foody florals, sensuous woods, and warm spices that don’t cause migraines with yet another variety of cardamom and pink pepper overload.

In case I didn’t make it clear, that accord in Nomade that people can’t figure out is called SUEDE. Yeah, it’s something we had BACK IN THE 1900’s! Yeah, yep, yes, that’s right, suede has a smell, and no, they didn’t actually dip suede in the perfume to macerate. It’s an accord, and creating accords that smell like things that are altogether different from the individual components is called the art of perfumery. And those who haven’t heard of chypres… welcome to perfumery, young cherubs. There are some very good books on perfumery out there. There has been a chypre shortage since the introduction of Angel and the gourmand revolution that ensued, AND since the 2005 EU regulations struck down many of the classics. We finally got a good suede chypre that’s widely available, so let’s please not spoil it for the seasoned perfumistas (the ones who actually keep these companies in business) just because it doesn’t have 5,000 calories per spritz. Once upon a time throughout the entire world, perfumery didn’t smell like Willy Wonka’s factory. Some of us actually like what we consider to be “real” perfume, and women’s perfume used to be strong and sometimes rugged. Don’t hate it just because it doesn’t cause cavities. It takes an experienced nose to appreciate this.

Nomade EDP is a 10/10.

Beautiful, feminine patchouli-forward scent. I like this better than the Chanel patchouli scent profile. It's tart and fruity in the opening, with fresh florals and mossy, woody patchouli in the drydown. I agree it can remind one of the old school feminine chypres, but it feels definitely adjusted to the modern age - which is not a bad thing. It's pleasant and not overly strong. Honestly, one of the best designer fragrances as of recent.

Deeper than it first appears, holds beauty and mystery in equal measure. Does have that “designer perfume” note, but there’s a lot more going on, and it’s much softer than that sounds. Definite citrus on the opening, I get the freesia and jasmine too, white florals that, while marginally heady, are far from screechy in this iteration. A reviewer before me described it as the kind of scent that wakes you up in the morning, which is such an apt observation.

Warm, fresh, vivacious but sleek, romantic. More a scent for transition seasons than summer or winter. Nomade is really nice, but isn’t a particularly innovative or unique fragrance; to me, it’s a springtime citrus and white flower bouquet that’s one of a crowd of fragrances with a similar profile. It’s familiar in a way.

It is, however, done well, and avoids numerous pitfalls that threaten a scent this effervescent. A “that girl” type fragrance. The depth that emerges as it wears is so welcome: it matures, in a way, becomes more of a unique fragrance. The dry down is rich and lovely, woody with a touch of peach and freesia sweetness, and the longevity is strong all day.

This is the natural beauty of the girl next door, insouciant and carefree, who wears her hair down over jeans and a white t-shirt, who walks barefoot around the house and yard in the summer.

When you spray this fragrance, for a few seconds, it smells like lemon liquid soap.
After that, it smells 100% like moss.
As someone who like forest scents, this one is not on my list. That moss smells very cheap, and it is a bit spicy, like ginger.
Forest Ritual by Tesori d'Oriente smells similar to Nomade by Chloe, and it is only 8€.

Initially, the blast of white floral/citrus in the beginning was a little harsh for me. But this is like for 10 seconds. Afterwards, the brightness mellows down slightly, into a beautiful, juicy plum dusted with brown spice and woods. Very big fan of this one, especially the lightly sweet and smooth drydown. I like wearing this on overcast, warmer days. Bonus points if it's windy. I dunno, the vibe is just right for that.

Breaks my heart, but all I get is pure 1980s brown. A woman in a brown polkadot top and a brown skirtsuit wearing chunky sneakers to hurry to her corporate job, then changing into brown pumps. Brown cubicles, brown ring in the coffee pot. Brown curly perm. And those brown translucent ashtrays. That's what I see most of all--the brown ashtrays. The polar opposite of free-spirited.
I wish I got what everyone else gets, I really do. But this is the perfume that taught me that peach and oakmoss are very difficult notes for me. The comments below almost make me want to go out and try it just once more (I remember the dry down was tolerable). But nope...it's just not for me.

wow, this scent is intoxicating! such a deliciously zesty, citrusy floral. it’s quite fruity but backed by enough woodiness to keep it from becoming juvenile. the kind of scent that wakes you up in the morning with a zing and puts a pep in your step. a winner in my book for sure.

I don't know why but I get the notes in this scent in an order opposite from fragrantica.
I get a more powdery start, but a round scent like a balm or something, still warm but very fresh.
I dont think the citrus in this is prominent, nor the rose. I get a more white flower, balm, clean powdery scent that sits warm on the skin and that is beautiful ik itself but maybe not what you expect from reading the notes.

I LOVE this. It opens bright and citrusy with notes of mirabelle, lemon, bergamot and peach before the white florals quickly step in and take over; freesia, jasmine, maybe just a hint of rose. White florals aren’t usually my thing, but they’re not too loud or overdone here and they combine beautifully with the citrus top notes. The base is musky and woody, with a hint of herbal freshness from the patchouli and oakmoss.

I honestly feel like this is an anytime scent, but if it had a peak season it would probably be spring. I happily wear it year round anyway. I’d also say that, while it’s marketed towards women, I feel men could easily pull this off too should they wish to.

It both lasts and projects beautifully until it fades gradually and graciously away into a clean skin scent.

Beautiful.

I guess I have officially become a Quentin Bisch-fangirl because whatever this guy composes, I'm head over heels in love. First Delina Exclusif, then Amouage Guidance and now Nomade.

Chloé is not a house I'm fond of and this scent has nothing to do with my scent personality. Chpyres? Oh no. But I am hooked on Nomade. It is bright, but not overtly positive and girly bright. It has a clean, sleek charisma. It starts floral-fruity on my skin but settles into a warm, woodsier scent.

We can all sometimes break the rules, right? Because I'm adding this to my collection.

Fresh, bright, fruity, citrusy, warm, softly sweet, romantic, sensual, spicy, woody, floral, earthy, complex, unique

Surprisingly, I pick up on all of the notes that are listed for this one. This opens bright, fruity, citrusy, and floral with fruity bergamot, lemon, orange, mirabelle, and peach and floral jasmine, rose, and freesia. The more this dries down the more noticeable the warm, earthy, and spicy base notes become, the oakmoss, patchouli, amberwood, white musk, and sandalwood. The balance between bright, fruity, and citrusy, floral, and warm, spicy, and earthy notes is what makes this so pretty, romantic, and sensual.

I think this one is very fitting for spring, summer, and fall, but definitely works for winter too. I get great performance with Nomad. The longevity is really good, about 7-8 hours before becoming a skin scent. The projection is really nice too, it radiates out a few feet from me.

For reference, I only have 2 other Chloe fragrances Love Story and Chloe EDP. Some of my other favorite floral/romantic fragrances include Coach Love (original 2012 version), Coach Poppy Blossom, Coach Wild Flower, Flowerbomb, FB Ruby Orchid, FB Nectar

This perfume was recommended to me by someone else. I became curious and read the comments here. They described it as so different, enchanting, and extraordinary that I eagerly went to Sephora and smelled it. First, I sprayed it on a test strip and could barely detect any scent. Then I sprayed it on my wrists. I immediately felt a disappointment. The performance is very low, and the sillage is minimal. You have to press your nose close to smell it. As for the scent itself, it's one of the simplest I've encountered. The opening is dominated by bergamot and lemon, followed by oakmoss and patchouli. The plum is almost non-existent, and the flowers are very faintly present in the background. This scent reminds me a lot of Elizabeth Arden's Green Tea Summer. Actually, it resembles any $10 perfume in that Green Tea series. It's not unpleasant, but very simple and familiar. You could create this perfume by taking any green tea flanker and adding patchouli. It was so praised online that I wondered if I had tried the wrong perfume, so I went to another local store to smell it again. Unfortunately, it was the right one. I really believed I would love this perfume; it's disappointing.

Growing up in the late 90’s / early 2000’s, my parents wore Hugo Boss and Calvin Klein Obsession for women. Chloe Nomade makes me nostalgic for my childhood, watching my mom put on her makeup in the bathroom before going out with my dad. Smelling the intoxicating scent of their fragrances mix and linger in the air. It reminds me of family get-togethers, the holidays, and the feeling of wonder.
The oak moss accord (one of my favorite notes) is definitely what makes me compare this perfume to “older” style fragrances, and I mean this in the best way possible. It smells fresh and bright (almost sparkling), woody and slightly spicy.. it’s simple yet so unique compared to most modern scents. This is perfect for anytime of year IMO, but shines in the fall/winter.
This was a love at first snif and continues to be one of my most worn easy reach fragrances in my collection.
Starts citrus/floral and dries to a lovely woody scent. Elegant and sexy with good sillage and longevity. I can’t get enough of it.

From a guy's perspective: this juice smells delicious and borderline addictive.

It radiates in the air really nicely and creates a nice scent bubble. It is definitely stronger than a skin scent but still quite intimate in terms of its sillage. Personally, that actually works in its favor and suits the kind of fragrance it is. This isn't boisterous and fighting for attention like a Baccarat Rouge 540, instead this is understated and laid back. There's a calmness and a sense of "clarity" in this that I don't often see in modern day female fragrances. Really refreshing.

If I caught the scent trail of this on a woman who passed me by, yeah, I'd be immediately intrigued ;)

this is the first scent that has ever smelt addictive to me. I sprayed it on my wrist in the shop and kept coming back for sniffs because it was that good. i love that it has a slight masculine edge with the woody notes underneath the floral it’s so perfect i need a full size asap

Upon first spray I pick up very heavily the citrus and bergamot, but as it dries down on my skin and clothing I get the very distinct smell of freshly cut wood, like I'm in the lumber section of a Home Depot- with the tiniest hint of patchouli.

my new signature frag 😍😍 so so pretty smells like LUSH the store but with class and elegance like earthy hippies vibes but in a beautifully clean way, very free-spirited and fun and delish:)) ppl say i have youthful/pixie/whimsy vibes and i feel like this frag fits me so well so def reccommend if u can relate!!! got me a big one and a travel size after being OBSESSED with my sephora sample, very happy very much recommend🫶🫶

A really lovely, mysterious and complex scent. Smells like a magical forest. Something I Imagine an independent and strongwilled woman to wear.
Rating: 8/10

i’ve typed in a dissapointment review on this about 2-3 months ago, i was thinking it smellt like wine, sour, too mossy. Today i gave it another shot, and now i can see, it really is the smell of a fairy who lives in the woods. So elegant, so complex, sharp at first but soo rounded well. I’ve probably tested a bad sample, it mightve been exposed to light and oxygen a lot because i remember it being too sour. Actual nomade is whimsical, both mature and young. Great piece of art.

delishhh got a sample from Sephora and i love it smells like the store LUSH very fresh and clean def considering a full bottle for next spring/summer this is what i wanted the green chypre one by Chanel to be its feminine and fresh
Tonight's experience has been a luscious fruit bomb. Not jammy, but a cocktail made with good fruit liqueurs.
I just love this perfume. It is beautiful, delicately powerful, and classy. It’s also whimsical in a way. Just a gorgeous special fragrance to my nose.

I went traveling recently with a friend of mine and she wore this scent. Instantly I became obsessed with it. She smelled so classy, so fresh and sexy but never too cloying or too much. Just the perfect scent for the summer heat. So as soon as I got the name for the perfume, I got a small 10 ml bottle.

On my skin, this sprays on as a beautiful peach-plum citrus scent. I usually don't like citrus in perfumes as it can very easily turn too "cleaning product"-like but the citrus in this feels so classy, subtle and natural you can't help but get addicted to it. It's like a fresh glass of lemonade on a hot day. The plum feels juicy enough to bite into.

This dries down to a mossy-freesia-peach on my skin. The patchouli isn't too strong, it lends a subtly thick sweetness to the drydown almost alike to honey. The oakmoss and wood helps keep the fruitiness balanced without leaning masculine.

I'm actually obsessed with this scent. I've almost used up my 10 ml bottle in record time. I've already bought a full bottle of Vanilla 28 this month so I put a perfume buy-ban on myself but I'm strongly tempted to break that ban and buy this 😭

Whoever said that this is what you wear if you want to smell like a fairy that's frolicking through the woods?? Correct. Absolutely correct. This is the only perfume I've smelt that can truly be signature scent worthy. You can wear it all year round, day and night, and you won't smell like too many people. Can't wait to get my hands on a full size, it's soooo pretty.

Absolute year round day scent. This is my go to office scent. Whenever in doubt, I just spay this and head to the office. Beautiful, long lasting and not offensive at all if you limit yourself to 2-3 sprays per wear.
It feels like this perfume transforms into something completely different every few hours. The opening is very soft and fruity and it settles into a floral scent and finally it very earthy. I'm not saying it's unisex, but the masculine edge in this perfume is beyond elegantly done.

I don't have enough amazing words to say about perfume.

I slept on this for so long and shouldn’t have. It is such an easy grab, inoffensive, light and airy pretty girl scent. I could definitely see how this could easily become someone’s actual signature, like long after they’re gone, you happen to smell this in public and you will never not think of the person you once knew. I hope that made sense. Really pretty and worthy of a spot in any collection, right next to Chance eau Tendre edt, it’s that type of scent.

this is by far my most complimented fragrance and the most underrated. it is also one of my longer lasting fragrances too. i carry the travel bottle in my bag everywhere i go, my friends fiend for it like a vape. they want a dab any chance they get and rightfully so.

chloe was my introduction to perfumes and nomade is on the more mature feminine side compared to the other fragrances by chloe. lets speak about the notes for a bit, it is a really pretty floral that gives more musk than citrus in my opinion. she is girly but not in a chanel mademoiselle way, in a more forward and mellow-down way where the musk will linger on your skin and leave your clothes smelling delicious. it will LINGER. sniffing the bottle i don't smell that nauseating alcohol bufoonery from most brand name perfumes. instead, its a delicious rosey white floral that is actually so addicting. the little spritz of peach and lemon here and there is actually so nice. almost like a peach rose soda.

if i had to describe nomade in one word: addicting. elegant. i am enamored. i cannot cannot cannot get enough of her. she gets a 10/10. i am a jasmine girl and this combination of peach and jasmine with the wood and musk is exactly what i wanted. i loved nomade in college and i will forever cherish her. if you are in college i believe this is the perfect scent for interviews, meetings, first dates. you will absolutely leave that lasting "oh wow she smells good" impression that will have people wanting for more.

i feel as though she is the perfect ingenue, on the outside you get a super sweet girl full of joy but with that je ne sais quoi like you just have to unlock her unravel her piece by piece, and after sitting outside in a cafe after some runny eggs and sourdough and sodas you find you've met your soulmate in a best friend. thats what nomade feels like to me.

One of my favorite designer scents. I got a sample when it was first released and fell in love, and never fell out of love. Fresh, warm, spicy, woody, clean. It's sophistication in a bottle. Perfectly unisex and wearable for anyone, but I feel like it fits tanned summer me perfectly.

One of perks of working at a Costco is that once a year they sell designer perfumes for $60. I picked up Nomade by Chloe and as I remember it when I first smelled it 3 years ago, it smells amazing. I love how it smells unique with the woody and mossy notes with some sweetness from the mirabelle plum. Also smells unisex in my opinion.

Nomade is one of those fragrances that requires some time, at least that’s the case with me. When I first got this, I felt like it was way too chypre leaning for my taste. I came here to read up on it and try to dissect what was feeling off to me because on paper I should really like this. I came across a review that stated that this smelled like her boyfriend’s deodorant. That hit a chord with me. It didn’t smell like a modern deodorant like Axe, niche-like subscription required ones, or a revamped Old Spice that I am accustomed to smelling on a man now. No, it reminded me of my father’s deodorant. He differentiated between the blue and green Speed Stick deodorants in the 90’s. He always smelled of that, Icy Blast Irish Spring soap, and Joop cologne on special occasions. Essentially, it’s almost exactly what Nomade smells like on my skin. My father was also a flower child of the 1960’s which is incorporated with the patchouli. Trust me, I know it sounds strange and not a lot of women will be sold on the prospect of smelling like their dad but I lost my father going on seven years this month. I definitely appreciate having a tiny piece of him through this scent. This fragrance unlocks the memory of mornings when he would wake me up for school and we would get the opportunity to listen to the Beatles or watch Bozo together before heading off for the day. There’s also components of young me lingering in there with the sweetness of White Rain shampoo and traces of gold bar Dial soap. For me, this is sentimentally special but I do think it’s something a lot of people will connect to and enjoy. Conversely, I acknowledge how people will hate this but it’s something unique that at the very least is worth sampling.

There’s a depth that is acquired as Nomade macerates. The top notes are overtly feminine with the mirabelle, the citrus notes, freesia, jasmine, and rose which are perfectly superimposed over the more masculine notes like oakmoss, patchouli, and the woody bases. I love the androgyny of this scent. Nomade IS indeed a chypre but definitely a diet chypre that’s modernized with just the subtlest suggestion of oakmoss lingering. There is something resinous here but again it’s done with a light hand. After this settles for a few hours, the more masculine chokehold that’s apparent on first spray softens and veers off into typical Chloé territory. The sweet, soapy, and refreshing accords emerge while just the slightest bit spiciness can be detected. It truly is beautiful and a transformative, layered fragrance. Like people have said, this is a powerhouse scent in terms of sillage and longevity.

Side note: I eyed this on Sutton Stracke’s vanity in an episode of Real Housewives of Beverly Hills. I didn’t know what to think because I find Sutton to be annoying, obnoxious, overdramatic, and quite possibly the least redeemable of all the Housewives of any franchise. Having said that, I can compartmentalize my personal feelings and say that I do appreciate her Park Avenue meets antebellum aesthetic. It does make sense to me that this scent would appeal to her because it combines vintage and contemporary together as well as it combines genders. Sometimes when I spray this scent on I’m inadvertently hit with a mental callback to her “name ‘em” rant to Kyle which always makes me giggle a little bit. If you’re a fan of that show, you know how bat $hit crazy and unhinged that moment was. If not, Google it because it’s hilarious. It’s second only to Ken screaming, “Goodbye, Kyle” as he ascends the stairs 😂

It has a beautiful start full of orange and peach. If you will inspect it closely you can imagine notes of mirabelle, lemon, bergamot. Then freesia with its clear, dewy scent, rose, a drop of jasmine and sandalwood-musk frame. A very good scent. Like but maybe closer to love. A pity so many flankers appeared so soon - how to buy or love them all. Nomade Nuit d'Egypt should be the first flanker and only on its release day not to overcrowd this beautiful scent but to keep it as a main focus. It is sensational enough. And universal. First Chloe I truly like.

I love it to pieces, one of the best perfumes ever in my opinion. I feel it flies under the radar a lot if compared to other frangrances whose smells are way more generic and with less longevity. On my skin it lasts a lot of hours and you can detect clearly its evolution throughout the day. I love all the phases of it - top notes, middle notes and the dry down, which gives me hints of leather and I couldn't love it more!
This is sooooo good very elegant and beautiful fragrance very likeable and easy go fragrance
Cinnamon plum jam in the drydown

Classy and easy to wear. A chypre but nothing to be afraid of! It’s not flirty in a playful way but straightforward confident. I always struggle a lot with longevity - not with this one. I get an (for me ) amazing 12 hours out of it. In the drydown it’s still alive and kicking. Definitely a boss scent.

I love wearing this for summer when I’m tired of all the typical freshies and fruities. Very nice, earthy chypre with just a tinge of sweetness and zing from the citruses. The best and most versatile Chloe in my opinion.

Oh my goodness, this is so good! It's floral, a little sweet, and a little earthy, even dirty (like straight up soil!). It's complex and different from everything else out there, right now. I love it and definitely plan on purchasing it soon. I think those who are into classy and sophisticated scents that have a classic or timeless feel to it (but still modern) would enjoy a scent like this. But test it out first.

My newest acquisition

If you don’t like this on the paper tester strip then try it in skin, totally different!
Quite earthy but still very nice for daily wear
Pra mim: Depois que assenta na pele, vira um 212 menos genérico e mais bem elaborado, mais elegante, mas é bem moça que vai pra festa, não me agrada.

The let down is in the drydown. I am not one of those people who can love a fragrance for only one of its developmental stages. I need to love you from open to close. And I love Chloe EDP upon introduction. Then she begins to speak and I realize I don’t really love her personality. She’s a little loud and basic.

The opening is so… I can only think of the word “lovely”. But then that peach starts talking so loudly like she wants all the attention on her. And it throws the harmony off.

I've been exploring chypres lately--I'm tired of all the fruity musks offerings that seem so popular now. Now, I usually skip designer scents. Nomade is a good lesson for me to not be a perfume snob though--wow.

Quentin Bisch is an all star perfumer, and the first thing I noticed about Nomade is how much it reminds me of Hibiscus Mahajad. There's a minty opening, though, of course, a shifted heart. Two perfumes that might appear as distinct separate movements in the same symphony. I sold Mahajad--it was too loud, too fruity, too awkwardly leather-scented on my skin. Nomade is my girl. She's elegant, chic, complicated, distinct.

More literally, she opens minty and bright, a burst of sweet fruitchuli, lots of peaches with a sandalwood/powder element. It's nicely balanced and younger than Nomade absolu. For me, it's a daytime scent used sparingly in Texas heat. Downsides is this is a strong one--I'm using a half spray, and it projects like a beast.

It's a gorgeous perfume and sings on my skin--it doesn't skew masculine or mature. It's complex, mossy, minty and fruity by turns, changing and whispering at different volumes. For the price point, it's an incredible, new wave chypre.

Collega passed by and smelled amazing and elegant. Nothing like the super sweet cloying fragrances that have been released nowadays. This time I asked because she genuinely smells good but sometimes I ask when someone wears something I dislike too just to spare myself from trying it. I thought she would have been wearing something older or classic and I was seriously surprised when she said its Chloe Nomade. I had never tested Chloe Nomade because I have kind of lost my interest with new releases because they all seemed to smell the same. If this was a singing woman she would be someone with deeper voice and mature. I want to go and try this on my skin because it smells so good.

I have purchased all the flankers and none compare to the original Nomade EDP. Effortlessly elegant fragrance. Crisp and earthy with a chic vintage quality. For me, this is a rotation scent but not a signature. I have to be in the mood for it.
This turns into a legend not on sunny bright days, but rather on mild cloudy or rainy days. I even had applied lotus essence underneath. I felt like a forest fairy.

oh so lovely... great option year-round but it just sings in the summer. if you love the chloé look, you'll probably love this scent -- i love how perfectly it embodies the house's boho influences. the fresh citrus is my favorite note in the composition. it lingers on my skin for hours and never dips into cleaning-agent territory, which is something i'm always sensitive to in scents with citrus accords! good value for a distinctive fragrance.

Chloe Nomade is such a rich, warm yet fruity scent that I always get compliments on. It does have some masculine qualities, so I recommend this if you love more feminine scents that aren’t too sweet but still make you smell pretty. My favorite way to layer is with VS Honey lotion/oil as it compliments the sweetness and warmth, but this scent is such a beautiful scent all in its own. I definitely agree that this is a great scent for every day wear, no matter the season, and you definitely get your money’s worth with how well it performs. This perfume is so classy, yet sweet, yet comforting, and all around a beautiful scent!

when i first got it i regretted buying this because it smelled masculine at first. yes it is not completely a feminine scent but we cant say that it is masculine. i think this is a special scent and not basic. people compliment me when i wear it. it is fresh, sometimes sweet. not easy to describe but it is interesting and lovely. longevity and performance are high. also it can be suitable for any season in my opinion

I tend to be a Quentin Bische fan except when his fragrances include rose. This one isn't very rose-forward, but it's still not anything I like. I see a lot of reviews talking about the complexity and how it changes over time, but for me, it smells extremely simple and keeps the same simple note until it fades away. I can imagine it as a bathroom spray or maybe a body wash scent. It's really not something I want to smell like every day. There's a part of it that reminds me of what I don't like in Libre, too. It seems very jasmine- and freesia-forward. Overall, I'm just not a fan. Luckily, it faded down to almost nothing in about an hour. I tried wearing it again just to make sure I wasn't missing something after reading all these glowing reviews, but it's just not for me and it's not going to grow on me.

I am not a big chypre lover as oakmoss can so easily be too sour if not carefully balanced. Nomade, however, is! This is a very well balanced and blended, refined, elegant chypre and whereas the oakmoss is still the most prominent note, the rest of the blend with florals and mirabelle is keeping it in a lovely balance. Not sweet, not sour but just right - elegant and many faceted. A very elegant fragrance. Gorgeous bottle and presentation also.

Gorgeous, thoroughly modern chypre!

Aptly named - opens with a citrus like blast and a hint of soft pine which dries down to a fresh, fruity accord - I assume this is the mirabelle plum/peachy notes - it's not heavy or deep peach - more sparkly and transient - floats around, there's a lightness from perhaps the freesia - all circling the woods, patchouli and moss before combining into the most beautifully grounded dry down I've encountered for a long time in any new release.

It's elegant but welcoming. It's playful, indulgent & cheerful but also personable and steady at the same time.
Takes you on an olfactory journey of discovery before leading you into a sense of belonging - a homecoming if you will.

Stays present for a full 24hrs. Sillage is good for the first 3-4 hrs with a normal 4 spray application. After around 4 hrs, becomes slightly more intimate but still very noticeable within arms reach. Can still be noticed as skin scent after a full 24hrs.

This really is beautiful.
As others have noted - smells very different on test strip - if you do want to buy this - test on skin and give a full wear before making your mind up.

What the heck?? This perfume smells completely different to me than it does on paper. On the test strip I get rose, cinnamon, orange, amber and jasmine - divine! On my skin though, it's pure oakmoss and very masculine. My family couldn't believe it was the same scent either when I game them my wrist vs the test strip. My step daughter said (of my wrist) "it smells like a hairdresser". 🤣
This is definitely a Miss Dior Cherie dupe love it.

This the most unique chypre fragrance in my collection. This is what I reach for when I’m tired of vanillas and basic florals. She’s elegant, sexy and long lasting. This is sexy in an old money kind of way, it’s not something you would wear to go clubbing. It is spicy in the opening and I believe that’s due to the mirabelle, but it fades into the most luxurious peachy oakmoss scent. I can understand why people think this smells like a hippie, but I’ve always thought that it smells like a very expensive department store that’s impeccably clean and organized. It’s feminine to my nose, I wouldn’t want my husband to smell like this. I got in the car with my aunt after a few sprays and she asked why it smelled like cologne all the sudden (she wears Victoria Secret) so I wouldn’t overspray if you’re going to be within close proximity to others for a long period of time. I love the original Chloe fragrance but I highly recommend this if you want something a bit more unique.

I'm a man and I find this perfume is the most beautiful scent I ever smelled.
The way Musk and Jasmine goes through the Roses and Orange is just pure & perfection.

I use this perfume at summer nights when I'm out with friends as I'm a male I don't think I can wear it at day and work.
This perfume to me is a therapy, I just do two sprays whenever I'm not in the mood and it always finds a way to make me feel great.

This beautiful scent was a love at first sniff. I'm a sucker for plum notes and Chloe Nomade has such a bright, juicy plum heart that's elegant, flirty, and alluring. The opening of this fragrance is a gorgeous blend of all the citrus top notes which blend together to almost smell like a freshly-squeezed cup of citrus juices, more sweet than zesty. As the citrus notes fade, the heart of rose and jasmine really come forward—with the peach adding a juicy edge. The entire lifetime of the fragrance is supported by a smooth, creamy woods base accompanied with a soft musky facet, a tinge of greenness from a smooth and earthy patchouli, and a slightly scratchy distinct oakmoss.

If you're a femme who dislike oakmoss or think it automatically makes a fragrance masculine, Nomade is absolutely going to be a no for you. But personally, Nomade taught me how oakmoss could be used to add a confident, earthy, head-turning edge to a perfume. All of the notes come together to create a perfectly-sweet, juicy and fruity floral fragrance with an extremely long-lasting musky-woodsy moss base. Probably 1-2 hours of 1m projection, then another 2-3 of 1 foot projection, but lasts on your clothes 8+ hrs at intimate distances.

This would be a fantastic signature scent and is appropriate for just about every season but winter, where she would be better replaced by her older and richer sister, the now-discontinued Nomade Absolu de Parfum. Would be a head-turning but still safe daily reach which could fit the office just as well as running errands or a little cafe date. Probably a little bright and peppy to be a good nighttime scent as well.

This is a hidden gem from Chloe and deserves more love. I'll probably always keep a bottle of this or the Absolu in my collection.

What a beautiful rich scent, sweet mirabelle and fresh citrus delight, faint flowers and rich woody base, slightly unisex, distinguished, extremely long lasting, 10 hours+ and stays strong on my skin, can become cloying after a while, should not be oversprayed, especially in warmer weather. What a discovery! Better later than never as this one is a rare gem. I like it a lot, I will definitely repurchase a bigger bottle in the future.
woody fruity patchouli, 6.5/10

It’s very strange. On one hand, it has some “rich” notes that make you feel beautiful, on the other hand, though, smells like deodorant/air refresher.

Don’t feel it much throughout the day, feels like it doesn’t last long.
Also, don’t feel like it has very little trace. Have never been complemented for it.

Even though for other, I would get it at least noticed.

This perfume is unlike other Chloe fragrances; it's a unique scent. It combines woody and fresh notes simultaneously, making it very long-lasting and, in my opinion, one of the best designer perfumes to have come out in recent years. It's a scent that could suit anyone. Additionally, I always receive compliments whenever I wear it. I believe it's suitable for all ages.

For the first half-hour, it gives the impression of eating one of those peach candies with acidulated sugar on top (surely the citrus in the top note), but next to the toilet where your little sister would have sprayed on the air freshener (a smell that freesia usually evokes for me).

Then it becomes more distinguished, with the deodorant aspect fading and giving way to jasmine and a slightly powdery rose, with oakmoss making a timid appearance.

Finishes a few hours later on a very feminine rose and musky base that leaves you feeling clean and fresh.

Not as unisex as some comments suggest, I find it too feminine on me.


Useful details : english is not my mother tongue and my opinions are copied and pasted from my personal notes, written on the fly after several phases of testing (tracking changes for several hours on blotters, then on my skin for a day).
smells like woody citrus, i don't enjoy this it's very chemical

Rich, luxurious and beautiful scent! Couldn't be more happy about it, one could enjoy and be carefree about it. It's unique yet it gives that shower room kind of feels, it gives that soapy kind of feels after few minutes of the spray!

A complex, mossy, floral, woody perfume. If the taupe color has a scent, then this will be it. You won't appreciate it on paper, but you have to wear it to fall in love with the smell.

I sprayed it on my hair and I can still faintly smell the perfume even after I washed my hair the next day.
It's an interesting perfume. A lady-boss. It's like a woman who is wearing an expensive silk blouse, a flowy long skirt, and loafers. It can be a unisex scent.

I dislike fruitchouli scents and I couldn't unsmell what another reviewer described as a funeral home in the opening. However, the patchouli fades and in the drydown you are left with bright fruits. I cannot detect the florals.

This is a sweeter and more musky version of Coco Noir- I have samples of both right now and the similarities are obvious. That very gentle peach with musk combo feels like a throwback to 90's fragrances- reminds me of Ghost Myst by Coty- look at the notes. I might end up buying this one- I've been circling it like a shark for a year now haha.

I felt a deep resonance the very first time I sprayed ✨️Nomade✨️ in a store. It stood out completely amidst the sea of gourmands and fruity-florals. It instantly grabbed my attention, and I knew I had to have it. 🤎

Nomade stands out from the crowd, just like a non-conformist authentic woman who can't be contained in one box. 💫 Unique and empowering. Modern and vintage simultaneously. A mix of class and a little bit of "dirt." A walking contradiction that's earthy, yet elegant. Complex and androgynous. Confidently sexy and heavy with mood.

On my skin, it felt perfect for evenings and autumn vibes. Long-lasting and moderate sillage.

Somewhat masculine leaning. Could be unisex. Simple yet complex. Very fresh, elegant and sophisticated. Bright, citrusy, woody, floral and fruity. I'd say it's safe and mass apealing. It simply smells clean in a luxurious everything shower kind of way. Can be worn for any ocassion.

Smells like a bouquet of fresh flowers at first spray, which I absolutely adored. The freshness is insane. An hour later, the scent transforms into a sickly sweet aroma. Like you’ve been sitting in a funeral home surrounded by flower wreaths. It’s too much. If you like that, then go for it.

the perfect perfume if i needed to be perceived as a competent and gender-conforming Normal Adult Woman. job interview perfume. she is the eternally-polite coworker who skillfully evades any controversy with pleasantries and workplace-appropriate small talk. the only information you need to know about her is that she’s qualified and smells nice. better than nice—she smells positively hireable.

Chloe Nomade is a very interesting chypre perfume, in which I particularly enjoy the delicious fruity notes. However, on me it quickly becomes very soapy and the soapiness overwhelms the other aspects of the fragrance.

Wow, I dismissed this one when I first tried it in store. Years later, I smelt something a little like it and I retried it. I ended up buying a bottle. Fast forward a few years more and I am very close to finishing it. It's become one of my go to work fragrances.

This is citrussy, to me mainly bergamot and oakmoss fragrance, if you struggle with the almost soapy bitterness that oakmoss brings then you might not enjoy this. The slightly soapy feel is enhanced by the freesia, which is sensed as yet more soapiness, and there is certainly some peach, which is the warm peach skin kind rather than the juicy kind. In the drydown, this smells like all of the above but with a touch of fresh rose.

It's pretty and stands out because it's different. It's like a more modern Coco Mademoiselle in a way. Certainly one of the best designer fragrances of the 2010s for me. Long lasting and projects too, I know because I've had compliments on it. I'm tempted to repurchase this one, but I have a huge collection which I am trying to reduce, so perhaps not yet.
Its a unique scent Ill give it that but after while it smells like coming out of a shower after using a heavy smelling soap. It is very nice and the scent lasts but its not a wow smell
I absolutely fall in love with it on paper, but on me lately it started to be little bit masculine. Very beautiful, soft, clean interesting.

Chypre for beginners. Fruity chypre. You can still smell it in your clothes at end of the day.
Makes me happy. Great on a hot day
Complex Complex Complex!

Smells like a very pleasant and basic chypre ( my phone’s autocorrect changed that to coyote which made me laugh, now that would be an interesting perfume) on first spray. After about an hour though the notes kind of divided on me and I would get a fruity peach interspersed with occasional strong wafts of what I can only describe as pine tree. It was interesting, but overall although there’s nothing offensive about this it also doesn’t really merit a purchase.

This is my signature! I’ve never smelled anything like this before. A love for me. I’m not a fan of patchouli in any perfume, but I love everything about this one. I have found that it works well for me year round! There are only three perfumes that have me constantly sniffing the cap or my wrist and this is one of them!

Chloé Nomade has mass appeal written all over it. A lightweight, fresh floral-fruity with a barely-there chypre base, housed in a chic bottle that perfectly reflects the boho nonchalance of the brand, it is an easy, everyday feminine perfume.

Nomade opens with bright citrus, fresh but underscored by peachy sweetness, perhaps initially thanks to the mirabeau. It is sheer and lightweight, paving the way nicely to the sweet freesia-led floral heart. Sweet and aquatic initially, it becomes slightly powdery as it progresses and the clean jasmine emerges.

Powdery rose unfurls on my skin as it begins to dry down, fittingly coming to the fore as the patchouli emerges. The chypre base is mostly due to the patchouli, with some soft woods adding body. It becomes cleanly musky as it fades. Sillage and longevity are moderate.

A competently-composed scent, Nomade is a breezy spring/summer daytime scent, decidedly feminine in my opinion. It is noughties in style, and quite unmemorable, interchangeable with the myriad designer floral-fruities/fruitchoulis of that time despite its recent release date. Safe, versatile and pleasant, Nomade is ideal for gifting, but is ultimately unexciting. 3/5.

Revisiting: it is divine. Fall-like/hobby lobby spices, soft patchouli, sparkling fruits, and a bit of the OG Sunflowers perfume! Sharp woody base I just adore supported by a fresh, soapy sweetness. Excellent performance. Classy but still light-hearted. (Makes me think of holiday movies where the families are hardly dysfunctional)
smells like an old lady thats being mean and passing up backhanded compliments. doesnt work on me at all. best for cold days. smells kind of like warm linen sheets

Nomade is amazing. It’s what I would call a bright chypre. I understand the comparison to Coco Mademoiselle.
But, there is just something to this which blends perfectly with my chemistry. It starts out with a citrus mixed with a woody smell.
The dry down is warm and comforting, yet very classic. I don’t know how this doesn’t get more love. It suits me perfectly.
A 40-something, professional, who likes luxury, but it also pragmatic and slightly bohemian. I have never smelled this on another female ever and I hope it stays that way. When I wear this people ask me what it is.
It’s my favorite.
Bottle up for trade!! Please message me :)

Was gifted this mistakenly by my dad who thought he was buying me the Naturelle/Jasmin Naturel version which I love. Unfortunately he got it wrong, and this is so different to the natural version which I'm surprised they called Nomade at all really. I can't think of anything to say about this for now other than the fact this smells like a perfume. It is like the quintessential perfume smell. It smells like a stereotypical woman. Not in a bad way at all.

I don't know what it is that makes me so confused by these types of smells. I can only smell one thing and am incapable of discerning different notes. I wish I could work out which note/combination of notes does this to me. It just smells like a cloud of perfume that's not pretending to be anything other than that. My scent receptors get blasted and over saturated by one of the notes and they stop working. It's very sharp. I'm just not built to appreciate it I suppose. I get this with other perfumes like Chanel Chance original and Coco Mademoiselle, the og miss dior formulation and more. I don't understand how people sing their praise.

I don't dislike it particularly but it might as well not be there as far as I'm concerned, I don't get much enjoyment from it.

ps. if anyone has a theory of what could be the cause of this analysis from me, I'd love to hear it via pm!
Mix this with Lorenzo Villoresi Tent de Neige perfume oil and just - wow. No words.

My kind of warm weather scent (works in the cold too)! I dislike freshies that are just citruses or musky or florals, so when I tried Nomade I was pleasantly suprised. It had a different vibe :) Bright, fruity, slightly sweet opening and a nice grounding oakmossy drydown. Light and crisp but last on my skin for a good while. I also tried the absolu version and liked it, but ended up going with this one because its a little it more sparkly-juicy-feeling.

I love. An immersion in the imagery of the Seventies that suspends the perception of time and space. It is androgynous, enveloping and very sexy. A fragrance that deviates from the polite Chloé matrix to follow the hyperbole of non-conformism.

After smelling niche perfumes for a while, I really wanted to go back in time and smell those kind of perfumes my Mom used to use when I was younger. Those tender smells, though mature, where you could smell the sweet maturity of citric and sweet, but with that background of sweet make up at the back waiting for you in a Mom's hug. I missed it so much I was imagining this kind of smell and something in my everyday thought brought me to Nomade which I once smelled in a store. I have it now and I cant stop being back in those days when there where so many beautiful and original smells in the market, not overly sweet like this one (catch me, noah, amour amour, flower, etc....) this is a modern vintage perfectly equilibrated perfume that you can wear everyday, and has that mature but sexy, very elegant sense to it. In addittion the name cannot be more perfect, "Nomade" I can easily imagine a woman that moves and grow from place to place being just her beautiful self. I am in love.

i found the patchouli note quite strong at first and that threw me a bit off since i don't like it at all, but it isn't very prominent later on. smells a bit old in my opinion but it's nice and elegant.

Love the moss and dank floral, but something about the hyper-sweet fruit makes this feel like boss-bitch-cosplay to me. I have a sample that came with a set and won't be purchasing a full size. My husband does tend to complement this, which is rare. Beautiful little bottle too.

This fragrance is beautiful. It smells clean and sweet, in a mature way. I only used two sprays of this perfume and it filled the room. This was a blind buy for me and I love it. I Usually wear gucci rush or paco robanne olympia and it is a similar style. I sprayed the purfume at 7am before leaving for work and could still smell it on my wrists at 9pm.

Definitely my new favourite!! Gets me lots of compliments and people asking me what fragrance I'm wearing <3 When I was first gifted this fragrance it was very harsh and I wasn't too fond of it but on clothing and skin I found that it was sweeter than my first impressions from spraying into the air/on a tester paper. I can really smell more white florals, woodsy and peachy notes once it dries down - I don't notice too much citrus and generally I'm not fond of citrusy/lemony smells but thankfully on me it dries down beautifully.

Staying power is quite long lasting (after a full day it still lingers on my clothing) and can be smelled from an arm's length away which I enjoy - I want it to be noticeable but not overwhelming, I like a more intimate sillage. All in all so gorgeous, makes me feel sophisticated lol

I thought this would be exquisite, but it just wasn't my experience. I believe this one is very sensitive to body chemistry, because on some people, it smells absolutely angelic: blooming into a fresh and airy bouquet of flowers and citrus fruit. I stopped a woman to ask her what she was wearing, because she smelled like heaven. I recognized the bergamot note. She said that this was her signature frag. I went to test immediately. When tested on paper and my skin, it smells like Calgon Freesia body spray. It's borderline air freshener. Harsh, synthetic, astringent and screechy. Spraying it on my clothing did not change anything. It just never bloomed for me. For the price, you could just buy Calgon Freesia and get the same smell for much cheaper.

I tried this from a sample. It starts as a strong fruity floral, and I can't identify which fruits (maybe the mirabelle and bergamot). They're well-combined with the floral, mostly the freesia and jasmine. It quickly became a bit powdery, while still maintaining the strength of the previous fruits and florals. At 1.5 hours, it had changed to include more oakmoss and a little sandalwood and was more intimate (i.e., fading. I never got any patchouli, musk, or amber wood. By 2 hours, it was almost completely gone.

Overall, it's pretty and inoffensive and light. It's not a FB buy for me due to the lack of performance. It didn't seem innovative or original, although it was really well-blended and a good daily wear. Disappointed.
I find Nomade quite fruity and sweet, even compared to other standard department store offerings. It's powdery, stodgy, and artificial on me. Quite loud, a bit of a cacophony.

If I was reviewing this based on just the notes, it would be an epic win. It opens with a citrus burst that is somehow not too fruity, then transforms into a softer but not delicate floral before settling into the most exotic and lovely woody, musky scent. It's feminine without being girly and something about it just screams female empowerment. I imagine it's how Charlize Theron's character in Mad Max: Fury Road would smell. Yes, she is gorgeous but she'll also kick your ass. The scent itself is truly to die for. But sadly, I have to consider longevity and, on me at least, this was gone far too quickly. It settled into a skin scent within the hour and I can barely find it on my clothes. At a different price point I would just reapply and call it a win, but for the money, I would expect it to last. It saddens me to my core that this didn't have the staying power to match the glory of the juice.

Very happy with it. On me, compared to the EDT, I find it a little less sweet, more woody, more powdery, citrus is a bit louder, and plum a bit quieter. I'd say it is more mature, slightly less feminine, less linear, and has a more intimate sillage. They are still both very mossy/patchouli and similar.

I like them both. The EDT smells like a sweet Christmas tree/moss bomb to me, but this is more like walking through a fancy house that has a big Christmas tree in it somewhere.

chloe nomade has a weird scent
other fragrances you should let it to dry down and after that you smell notes
but in this one when you spray ;first notes are more better and when it dry down it’s like a male perfume
idk i’m so confuse

I’ve worn Nomade EDP for years. Every time I go to spray it I’m excited to wear it still.

I despise patchouli, I can detect its presence even after the person wearing it has left the room. But praise be, the alleged patchouli note is nowhere to be found when I wear it. Nomade tends to quickly settle into an amber-y/musky (with a TINY squeeze of citrus on top that cuts thru the musk just enough to add a freshness and femininity), projecting and LASTING scent on me. The obvious citrusy freshness and mild florals that come with the initial moment of application is not at all what it’s like for the rest of the day. Also I can smell it still on a scarf that’s been in the closet since last year. Potent!

Those citrusy-earthy-fresh notes are ALL that come thru on my coworker who also wears it, none of the amber or musk or patchouli. So highly advise to try before buying as mileage varies.
Smells like coffee to me?? I'm confused. Kind of basic and inoffensive, but still stands out. It's nice.

Most of the other Chloe fragrances are so soft and faint on me I have a hard time reviewing them. This one I can definitely smell! I’d describe it as a beachy summery clean white floral. Not necessarily my favorite but not offensive, safe for public wear in summer

The only white floral perfume that I like. I don't like jasmine but like citrusy openings and this is one of the rare perfumes that has that. I like this in Summer or when I want to reach for an every day scent. I still haven't repurchased it but soon I will.
Purchased at Costco in Michigan last week. It’s a nice scent, you can tell it’s in the Chloe family or fragrances. Happy to have this in my collection
very nice feminine scent, feel like such a girlie when wearing it! floral, fresh, fruity and i loveee that it's sweet, but not too sweet. definitely a spring/summer scent

On a quest to find the best and most interesting neroli/orange blossoms fragrance (decently priced), I have decided recently to purchase a bottle of 2014’s Chloe Love Story. Some people say in the comments that it’s been discontinued, but from my experience seems to be available to purchase, in some countries at least.

I am not going to lie, it’s not what I’d expect from seeing the notes. My bottle offers a fairly strong rose and blackcurrant dominant white floral perfume. Also, with a note like stephanotis, which I have not encountered in any perfume so far, I expected something more unique smelling. It delivers that!

And it’s not your typical fresh, green, soapy neroli/ orange blossoms perfume. It’s that but it’s also lots of blackcurrants, rose, peach, pear, grapefruit and some woods. It’s smooth, very fruity, slightly powdery and a tad spicy.

Smells more syrupy sweet than fresh or citrusy to me, not sickly sweet though, and almost in equal parts, fruity and floral. It’s definitely not like any of my other white floral centric perfumes, but smells very good and seems pretty long lasting, which I love in any perfume!

I have blind bought it but I wouldn’t recommend to any lady blind buying it if they want your standard neroli, orange blossom perfume. Love Story is more nuanced, complex and sweet than that! And if you’re not a fan of blackcurrants, I’d say stay away from Love Story…

But I am happy to own a bottle of this! It’s something else.

Edit: very long lasting on clothing. It’s next day late in the afternoon and I still can smell it on my sweatshirt.

Light. Sweet. Inoffensive. Floral. Refreshing. Uplifting. Lasts. During the day I went nose blind on a cool summer day. I wore to bed and woke up still catching whiffs of the scent. Very pleased by this fragrance. Not overpowering. Would like to try in winter.

Perfume frutado floral, mas sinto mais o frutado, sinto a toranja misturada com o pessego e flor de laranjeira muito forte, não sinto amadeirado,, foi um pouco decepcionante pq não sinto a groselha preta, um perfume bem verão, fixação e péssima, ele proteja 2 poucas horas Também, a marca chloe não tem boa fixação comigo eu tenho 4 unidades e apenas 1 fixa bem q é o chloe intense, então para fixar melhor coloco na roupa também, o Love story é agradável mas não compraria de novo.
Wore this when I got married and loved it. Such delicate fragrance - gutted it has been discontinued

This is delightful. Fresh, bright, a little soapy, a little sweet, like a floral-y shampoo. Perfect for daytime, but it doesn’t last long so you’ll need to reapply or pick something else for later in the day (not always a bad thing, imo). I got mine secondhand on Mercari and I’m not sure I’d pay full retail price, but for the pretty smell and adorable bottle, I’m definitely happy with my purchase!

Beautiful white floral fragrance, albeit a little overpriced for its longevity. This one doesn't seem to last longer than a few hours. I also don't think this one projects too well, either-- I've yet to receive any comments when I wear it, and I often find I'm burying my nose into my pulse to trace any scent of it not long after applying.

Still, there's a timelessness to this one-- probably one of my newest favorites for spring and summer, and maybe even early autumn, when it's still warm out. The bottle is also adorable.

As others have mentioned, this one is very safe. Clean. Modest. Elevated. I instantly understood why others were saying it's a wedding perfume. A long-wear absolu version of this EDP would perfect the concept.

This version is a classic for everyday or casual use, if you're willing to splurge for one reason or another.
This is such a happy fragrance to me. Great for spring and summer. Refreshing, kind of fizzy, citrus white floral.

Wonderful date fragrance. It's light, floral and just incredibly girly. It feels like sitting in the field of flowers with a love of your life. Though I would say it's definitely a day choice! Really safe and you just can't really go wrong with it.

A safe, classic floral. Nothing groundbreaking, but there’s a soft charm in its simplicity. It doesn’t demand attention it’s just simple and pretty.

The bottle? Elegant as always with Chloé. I added it to my collection quite late, and honestly, it fits best as a gentle daytime scent. Warm, feminine, and easy to wear. Familiar… but still lovely.

– Bhavna Darira Chesan
I wore this on my wedding day!

I've had this for a really long time because I basically only wear it for special occasions. That being said, it's perfectly suited for something like a wedding. It smells a bit like champagne to me mixed with clean laundry and a bit of citrus. I don't normally like white florals but in this fragrance they're subtle and complement the other notes nicely.

It is a romantic, dewy and clean floral with intimate sillage. Sure, someone hugging you will feel it, but with this intimate sillage I cannot really feel the edp on myself, only with my wrist close, it does not carry on the air. The deodorant has better sillage. It is beautiful though.
As a scent it is perfectly balanced, not too floral, not too watery, the fruits only enhance the neroli and orange blossom, but both are in low volume. The scent is perfect for spring and summer and very bridal, if the lady does not want to be the centre of attention because of her scent. I like it a lot, I must try to overspray this, maybe I will feel it around me.
2-3 hours and it is pretty much gone, making me miss it and I am spraying it again. So pretty and so fleeting.
Going to sleep I felt subtle floral scent on me, I think I was not imagining it :) If so, then the longevity would not be so bad, the sillage however close to no existent. It might be better for summer, it is so crisp.

Personal association:
with the aroma: the bitterness of regrets, and memories of a love story. I perceived the aroma with so many "bitter" flowers exactly like that.

Yes, at the bottom of the "memory" there are roses and the softness of cashmere... and the deliciousness of fruits... but all this is just shadows of the past

p.s.: those who have not yet inhaled "Synthetic jungle" by Anna Flipo for Frederic Malle: inhale

I don't know.. I really love Love Story for its airy, almost wedding-ish vibe, infused with sweet fruit notes. It doesn't last very long, but it makes you feel a special way. Perhaps like a lady with perfect curls, dressed in a white fluffy dress with silk and neutral-colored buttons. Thankfully, the patchouli note is kept to a minimum.

Beautiful, girly, innocent, bouquet of flowers. I imagine a bride wearing this perfume the day of her wedding. A beautiful spring sunny day and the bride comes with a light long and sutil white dress. The wedding is outside on plane grass. This is how i picture this perfume. Its perfect for any occasion. Its a bouquet of white flowers with a hint of musk.

Its amazing how this perfume can make you feel like happy and fresh and a good sunny day ahead is waiting for you. I love it but i wis it will last longer (max. 7 hours on clothes) and the projection after 4 hours is intime. But is definitively a beautiful perfume that its easy, classy, uncomplicated, romantic and very tender.
母性を感じるたおやかな香り。寝るときに着けると熟睡できる。専ら睡眠用の香水。

I don't get the opportunity to test a lot of Chloé fragrances, but the few that I have experienced begin with simplicity and end with femininity. Love story is no different. If you were to call her a white floral, cedar and cashmeran combo, you wouldn't be wrong. To the opening there is the freshness of amalfi lemon and neroli, other subtle white florals make their appearance - adding to the pure freshness rather than detracting. Cashmeran and cedar introduce a feeling of luxury to this fragrance, but then again, everything is subtle, soft, and lovely. Although this is not my preferred scent profile and I am yet to find a Chloé fragrance I would personally wear, I know I'd enjoy smelling someone else smell this way. A like for the books.

I have received this perfume as a gift and while I initially didn't like it that much, it has really grown on me.
