It smells like an everything shower after a yoga session, tulips in a crystal vase on a sunlit marble countertop, stolen glances and soft laughter on romantic dates, chiffon curtains billowing in the afternoon light, the delicate sweetness of dewdrops on fresh petals, the weightless embrace of a lace dress twirling in a field of wildflowers.

I used to wear this in high school so it has such a nostalgic scent for me. Its bright, sweet, and very youthful. Superrrr feminine and, though i'm not sure I would wear it as a now adult, I still love it. Definitely a fun year-round perfume.

Love Story blooms on skin first with this golden sweetness, like brown pears left to ripen just a little too long, their sticky yet refreshing juice golden and sun-warmed. There’s honeysuckle too, lazy and soft, curling around the edges, giving the opening this dreamy, overripe feel. Then, out of nowhere, the neroli peeks through—not shy, but not abrupt either—clean and a little bitter-sweet, like stepping into the shade for a quick soap-down after basking in warmth. It starts to feel a tad sharper, fresher, reminiscent of VCA's Neroli Amara, but with that musky, cashmere softness still clinging to it, grounding everything in something intimate and comforting. This is sweet, sunlit skin slowly cooling in the evening breeze.
Woody but not woody masculine. Its a very feminine fragrance. I have read somewhere that it smells like a wedding bouquet of flowers and I totally agree. Its a real love story.

Something about that white floral and citrus is so perfect

A very sour perfume that gives it a great level of sophistication

Although it is very fresh I would not categorise this as a summer perfume, i thinks is too sharp, however its perfect for the spring

I’m not sure what it is about it but i think this fragrance would be perfect in a work setting

Wow, this girl is an enigma. She starts with such a burst of white florals that you think maybe she is outdated and mature. Then she surprises you with citrus so that you realize she is youthful, but maybe a little sharp. After a bit, a soapy freshness emerges and you think you have landed on an answer, she’s a clean girl. But more time passes and this woodiness comes through that makes you think she’s unisex and earthy at the end of the day. Finally, her energy gives out and she’s a little generic but still lovely in an uptown girl kind of way.

Still not sure if I like her, if she’s my style, but I appreciate her journey. I will come back to this one in Springtime to see if that’s her happy place.

I normally identify this as the "clean girl' perfume of my collection.

It's white florals with musk. It almost leans unissex but I find it more feminine.

It's casual chic, it's clean and pretty and you can't go wrong with it.

Might not be for those who seek strong emotions in their perfume but it's a wonderful bet for office wear and if you want to smell clean and elegant on daily life.

this is a nice sweet floral, but maybe it’s a little too woody and spicy. i don’t really think that the notes fully work together, because when i smell it it smells like floral rootbeer or something. not my cup of tea, but it smells so much better on other people. it might be my body chemistry, gourmands just perform way better on me. the great thing about this is it’s definitely strong and it definitely lasts. other people can smell it and even i can still smell it after hours. i think this one isn’t one ill be wearing a whole lot, as people seem to like this less than the other perfumes i wear, but i think something about this doesn’t work for me.
it is a lovely perfume. very elegant and clean. almost too elegant like you won't be able to smell it on yourself after 20 minutes. it just goes away...

I love all the Chloe fragrances and really wanted to like this. The initial citrus/ neroil burst is pleasant but this Love Story soon settles into a pretty generic floral which on my skin takes on an unpleasant rotting bouquet note like the smell of flower stems left too long in the vase. I'm not sure what causes this, maybe the stephanotis, but it does not make me want to keep spritzing! Thankfully its longevity is not that of Chloe EDP or Nomade EDP

I had high hopes for this fragrance because people said it's the smell of first love and I don't quite see it. It's not a bad smell, it's just a little blank in my opinion. Nothing too special, nothing that someone would notice. It reminded me a little bit of Dior J'adore when it starts to evaporate. I don't know if the sample in the store was rotten or something, but I only got the white florals and the sour notes. I didn't smell any orange blossom (which I love so much in scents), neither rose, pear or blackcurrant. I usually pick up perfumes that I'm obsessed with and for the first time that's not the case. I think it's missing a little vanilla and that would automatically make it a BOMB smell. And this is ironic coming from me because I never choose vanilla or caramel as a note on my fragrances, but I think it would be needed here to break the sourness and white florals with a little sweetness. Maybe it's the sample though.. I also find it to be a very winter and a summer scent but not a in between seasons fragrance. But that's just me.

This has Chloe DNA but toned down the softer Chloe let's the white florals come out and there is addition of citrus.
Initially it's strong and a bit fuzzy to the nose so don't over do it. After 30 minutes it's a citrus jasmine wrapped in something cashmere like..comforting yet fresh. It's very feminine and brings to mind a natural beauty, minimal makeup, ponytail and she wears pretty cardigans or jean shorts, crisp white t-shirt, sandals and she somehow looks sophisticated. It's appropriate for many occasions...just don't overspray. I use a spray to each wrist, one on the chest and it's plenty.

Stephanotis! Nooo this note bothers me! Its harshly sharp gets in my eyes , nose and mouth very unpleasant to me. I'll retry in a few yrs could be a bad batch.very perfumy loud old school white floral. Wish I liked it. Y'all may love it. Try a sample.

such a youthful fragrance, sunshine in a bottle! opens with a sweet grapefruit nectar in my skin that quickly is embraced by neroli with a tint of greenery, this creates a balanced citrus-sweet opening which is quite summery and joyful to me. in the drydown i get the orange blossom, its whiteness complemented by a honeyed tint. that all falls into a musk and cashmere cocoon, so you get that kinda soapy clean and soft orange blossom beautiful aura. it is polite in its performance, lasting a lot on my skin and those who actually get closer to you will experience this pristine halo of summery bliss.

A nice, clean, fresh and green citrus-floral. Sophisticated and inoffensive. I wish that the fruity burst that it opens with stayed but that’s just personal preference and the musky, woody dry down is nice in its own way.

For me it’s perfect for a rainy spring day (but not exclusively!) and these days at a decent price.

*EDIT* …after a while it settles into a very soapy scent. A lovely, luxurious soap but soapy nonetheless! But hey, it’s nice to smell clean! I’d say it’s a pretty safe work fragrance.

It is hard to find summer fragrances that smell mysterious without being headache-inducing, and Chloe absolutely nailed it with this one. It smells fresh, sexy, summery, and feminine, and it has an addicting and mysterious appeal to it. Usually when summer fragrances try to be sexy and mysterious, I get the vibe that they don't know what they want to be when I smell them. Love Story knows what it is and it is a perfect fragrance for a summer date night.

A flower bomb that smells lovely on first snif, but dries as an overpowering black currant musky rose hell on me after a few a few hours. Completely headache inducing for me, unfortunately. I exclusively spray it on my clothes. It’s too feminine for my liking.

If “romantic” was a perfume, this would be it. I picked this up in Paris when it was first released and I fell in love with it. Needless to say I will always have the association of Paris every time I smell this perfume

I put this on last night before bedtime and wow I love it so much! It was unexpected because I tried this YEARS ago, liked it, bought a bottle, and promptly forgot about it. For some reason, I remembered it as kind of boring?? Either my nose has developed more since then, or I was just wrong, because this is NOT boring! It is clean white florals with a little bit of sweetness. My husband immediately said it reminded him of laundry detergent and I get that comparison too! It reminds me of laying on clean white sheets with the windows open, on vacation in Santorini, with the sunshine streaming in, seeing the cloudless blue sky and hearing the water outside.

My Favourite fragrance till now,

What makes it special for me, the mixing of orange, neroli, mesk, white flowers and cedar woods, mix of feelings with clean, fresh, Classy, Gentleness, romance, calm, Dreamer and fiminine lady.

I adore how it can change my hole mood and I didn't smell any dupe of it before. this perfume suitable for any time and any season, Your wedding, after shower or during the day. 5 star to it and I recommended to own it even if you think to buy it blind buy or like the clean fresh calm perfumes. It lasts 12 hours on the leather and one day on the clothes. Note: from Shower to shower I was smelling the perfume on my skin again.


عطري المفضل حتى الآن،

ما يجعله مميزًا بالنسبة لي، مزيج البرتقال، زهر البرتقال، المسك، الزهور البيضاء وأخشاب الأرز، مزيج من المشاعر بالنظافة،
الانتعاش، الأناقة، اللطافة، الرومانسية، الهدوء، المرأة الأنثوية والحالمة.

أعشق كيف يمكن أن يغير مزاجي ولم أشم رائحة مطابقة أو مماثلة له من قبل. هذا العطر مناسب لأي وقت وأي موسم، ولحفلة زفافك، بعد الاستحمام أو خلال النهار. 5 نجوم كتقييم له وأوصي بامتلاكه إذا كنت تفكر في شرائه شراء أعمى أو تميل لاقتناء مثله من العطور الزهرية الهادئة المنعشة النظيفة. يدوم 12 ساعة على الجلد ويوم واحد على الملابس. ملاحظة: من الاستحمام إلى الاستحمام كنت أشم رائحة العطر تتجدد من تلقاء نفسها على بشرتي مرة أخرى.

This has to be my holy grail during my summer time in America, the citrusy opening with floral notes was absolute joy I got a lot of compliments on this perfume. The patchouli on the dry down was not that strong and the combination of musk and cedar is superb. Overall, I treat this perfume as my nostalgia days in the US!

I absolutely adore this EDP. It reminds me sooo much of a fresh shirt washed with original gain! For the ones that think this is disgusting &screechy white floral, or glue w/ flowers, check to make sure it isn't the EDT. That $hi! STINKS! One spray & It was all I could do to try to let it dry down to change. 20 mins in, it did not & I was nauseous, EDT is a scrubber. I cannot believe they are both "Love Story" perfumes, actually. Night & day. Get the EDP.
Like glue with some flowers 😞
I think the love story line is going to be discontinued soon??
Beautiful like a spring day with the first rays of gently warming sun after the winter. So fresh, uplifting and comforting.

Oh I really wanted to like this. But when sprayed on my skin, it wasn't to my liking. Overall a very fresh/green scent.

Its been a while since I wore perfume and I've been trying to see what suits me.

This is not one of them.

Quite pretty and demure....Quintessential Spring!
Would have a difficult time believing someone would find this scent off putting. The neroli and citrus help keep this super bright and light (a bit too light for my liking) but the longevity and sillage are abysmal. This might be a good starter perfume for a younger person...like in their tweens.
Overall...
Scent- 7/10
Longevity - 4/10 (got about 3-4 hours of wear)
Sillage - 3/10

This is one of my favourite fragrances. Opens with a beautiful burst of orange blossom. Has the DNA of the original Chloe, however the orange blossom softens the fragrance and brings a touch of freshness and femininity.

I wear this throughout the year as I love this so much. Though the fragrance will wear beautifully in warmer months.
I can see this being a perfect scent for a bride on her wedding day.

To me this is a soft and understated perfume. Maybe a good signature scent for someone who wants a discreet scent. The citrus is beautiful and light, the white flowers are beautiful and light. Under that I pick up a faint rose. Not a love for me, but I am using it up when I am craving citrus. If you want this but more, juicier and with a wow-factor: the Versaces ”Eros Femme Eau de Toilette” or ”Yellow Diamond Intense”, thank me later.

A gorgeous, elegant, feminine, romantic, fresh floral. On me it’s a beautiful, soft, white floral scent that’s lightly sweet, and has a touch of bright, clean, fresh citrus. The florals are delicate, as if they just freshly opened. The base notes of musk, fresh cedar, warm cashmirwood, and patchouli become more prominent, but still subtle during the dry down. The cedar adds a lovely, slightly sweet, fresh woody scent. I don’t typically overly like patchouli, but in this I do. There’s just a touch of it, so it’s not too spicy, and it really accentuates the other base notes well.

Love Story really is the perfect name for this fragrance. This is one of the most romantic and elegant freshly floral fragrances that I own. I especially enjoy wearing this in the springtime. I’m not typically overly drawn to florals, but I do really love this one. For reference, some of the other ones I love are Coach Love (2012 version), Coach Poppy Blossom, Coach Poppy Wild Flower, Chloe, Flowerbomb, FB Ruby Orchid, FB Nectar, and FB Midnight.

I typically get great longevity with my fragrances, and Love Story is no exception… it lasts the entire day. The projection is nice too, it radiates out about an arm’s length from me.

Clean, Powdery & Delicate Floral...

The opening comes on strong with a clean, powdery & citrus-y neroli, but already the Chloe DNA is swelling through. As it transitions to the heart, it softens with white-florals & orange-blossom that help to continue the clean vibe that gets fluffier, while the Chloe DNA remains in the background with rose, peach & patchouli. The base notes, especially musk, help to continue the powdery, clean & fluffy effect. I currently just have a sample of this, although I had a bottle back in 2014 which I regrettably gave away. When I first got this, I found it too powdery & clean, but now as I'm testing it from the sample I'm appreciating it's delicate beauty. Projects a lot at first, but then settles into a delicate clean floral vibe that sweetens the longer it's on the skin. This one has won me over. It's a love for me. Enjoy!

I got this for Christmas, I can't believe I slept on this for so long! It's absolutely stunning! An extremely clean, fresh laundry, clean girl vibe. Extremely feminine. Perfect for weddings or work or just a day out shopping. Love at first sniff! However......🤔 The performance is not good on me at all. Within a half hour I could barely smell it. Within a hour it had completely gone from my clothes. This was one of those rare times the fragrance lasted on my skin longer than it did on my clothes. By the hour it was a skin scent only and by 90 mins it had completely gone! Which is a shame because this could have been a signature worthy scent for me. It is truly beautiful, sadly I have EDTs that last longer.

i love that the patchouli notes in this aren't super overwhelming, it's actually a super nice and sweet touch. the opening notes of orange blossom and neroli seem to linger around for a pretty long time, but once it dries down it gives a soft sweetness, almost vanilla-ey powder vibe. i really like this perfume, i heard the sensuelle version is supposed to be an overall softer version of love story, so i'd really love to try that some time.

Fresh, delicate, sweet florals with a citrus punch, perfectly inoffensive, not terribly original, but a beautiful, crisp, elegant fragrance nonetheless. It's a safe blind buy. As it develops, I smell some kind of pepopery, spiced rose. It's very pretty.

It's not super deep or seductive, it's more light, femenine, and airy.

Sillage and lasting power aren't terribly impressive, unfortunately. Usually lasts about 2 hours on me.

I like it, it's lovely. Sometimes fragrances don't need to be earth-shattering or super original to be good.

This is such a beautiful and elegant scent , at the same time it has this floral fresh and clean vibe to it ,I think it’s a very uplifting scent.The composition of the notes is so beautiful ,I loved wearing this perfume in my college years and it’s pretty safe for a blind buy in my opinion.If you like fresh floral scents go for this ,this scent is very suitable for younger women even teenagers , very lovely scent 8.5/10
It smells like a generic sweet scent. It’s not bad but it’s very light and would go well with other perfume oils.

I bought this perfume back in 2014 when I used to work for Sephora and it was just a new release. It was a love story what can I say. It was a love at first sniff. This is definitely going to be a scent for a woman getting married or just someone who enjoys that classy, crisp, not in your face kinda scent. You can smell the rose, jasmin and the perfect hint of citrus to make it fresh. I am envisioning a woman walking on a garden in white robe and just embracing the goodness that starts her day!

love story chloeThis is a nice white floral, I can see why it's a popular scent, but I think it's just okay, *i like it better after a few hours, a spiciness develops and some more rose). I cant really distinguish the notes, but luckily i don't get the gross peach scent that other perfumes have.  it's not a white floral like Curious Britney Spears, it smells more like a yellow floral, but it does smell very fresh like a real flower. It kind of reminds me of the Dior Rose n Roses, bc it has a real flower smell, but I actually don't like it as much as I thought I would. I think it would be worn any time of year, bc it's floral it'd probably be better during the day. arm's length to 6 feet, but fades some. Femme and good for women 25-100+ years old. I think the bottle is beautiful, but it is WAYYYY overpriced at $220 for a 75ml!!!! Those are some Tom Ford prices! On discount sites, it is still $115 for 75ml! This perfume could easily be replicated for much much cheaper. I wouldn't but or keep it if gifted. A perfume like Miss Dior Absolutely Blooming (although they don't smell alike) has more longevity and sillage. more pepper/sweetness/rose floral.

I’m a 20y boy however I enjoy this so much lately! This is my current favorite perfume I was using ysl y but now only chloe love story that I use most of the time. Fragrance have no gender so wear any scent u love. By the was this scent fit my character well Elegant Graceful Clean Good looking confident!
crisp clean fresh. i wouldnt usually go for citrus so this is a pleasant surprise. trying this also made me realize how pure chloe jasminum sambac truly is
It is the most generic perfume that I've ever had. 10 min after its applying I wonder did I put any perfume at all. Clean, simple and less than an hour lasting power.

This is the first perfume I bought for myself with the salary of my first job. It is also the first designer fragrance I own. Inevitably it has special meaning for me and I will love it always. I think it is beautiful, elegant, sweet, classy and a bit mysterious - and it has the magic to boost your confidence. It is quiet, but not to be unheard.

I finished a 75ml bottle and have bought two more bottles.
clean, simple and beautiful. if it was a piece of clothing it would be a delicate white satin gown.

Most of all, the fragrance reminds me of a lot of cut juicy greenery of a bouquet of white roses.

Clean. Cold. A little harsh at first.

I think it can be chosen as a wedding, for its similarity with "comme une evidence" yves rocher. There are no "overflows and games" of different rose petals in it, it is straightforward.

I usually HATE patchouli with the burning passion of 1000 suns, but it blends very well here. This fragrance is extremely clean smelling! Very soapy and fresh. Perfect for everyday wear, and definitely safe for the office.

I was the most excited to wear this considering how gorgeous the packaging is, but unfortunately, the lasting power completely killed all my excitement. It barely lasts an hour, and it doesn't help that it's such a light scent. That being said, it's a gorgeous crisp scent that suits all occasions. I personally loved the jasmine notes!

Very late to this party but happy I got here. I love this. It's really feminine and yet tailored. So you could be at a wedding or a formal luncheon but you could also just be wearing jeans and your favorite tailored white shirt. Crisp citruses and juicy pear, a bit sharp - the florals moving in with neroli as the star and settling in to a lovely clean musk - but not the overpowering laundry musk of some of the more recent releases. No vanilla, no syrup, no patchouli. Because it does not have the notes I just listed it smells "newer" than a lot of the latest releases. Can I already be tired of rose? Well yes I am. And it's not here, so again this makes it smell more original than most of the new releases I just tested. This perfume is not "challenging" but it is definitely pretty. Perfect for work this spring and summer and that is exactly how I plan to use it.

This perfume opens up so vibrant, fresh and inviting with the citrus and pear. I'm beginning to realize that I'm very inclined to like perfumes that open up with pear in the top notes. It's perfumey but in the best way possible to me. It gives a level of sharpness that I love. I'm usually not a fan of patchouli unless it's done right and not overwhelming, which it is not in this fragrance. While wearing this, I envision myself somewhere in Paris during summer vacation with the windows open as the breeze from the citrus garden lightly flows through the drapes. I absolutely love this fragrance and It will always remain in my collection 😍

Very similar to Yellow Diamonds Intense by Versace. Chloe Love Story is beautiful and I can't imagine many would say it doesn't smell good even if it wasn't their type of scent. It has that ever so slightly metallic synthetic element you get from all Chloe scents. I love the blend of pear, white flowers and fruity musk. Yellow Diamond Intense has almost identical notes but it is less sharp with a softer ambery base. Regretfully both don't project on me at all. No one can smell me even with multiple sprays on both wrists and sides of the neck. I only owned one bottle and never repurchased because I don't need anymore skin scents.

A love story in Paris! This is a bright and clean fruityfloral. I absolutely love it :) It smells like sunshine, its perfect for spring and summer. This scent is so uplifting, it makes me happy :) I think its good for any occasion. If you like citrusy fruityflorals with a clean jasmine, I suggest you try it :)

This is developing into a Love Story for me (Husband Himself aside...).

- Chloe perfumes have historically been a miss for me. For years, I couldn't even *smell* the OG "Chloe" EdP. The scent simply didn't register to my nose. So, I did my Trash Person thing and bought a bottle anyway. Only when I owned it (suspicious in itself... but moving on) could I smell something. And I loved it. A sharp, green, musky, kinda-soapy rose. Also, long-lasting and strong. What a win.
- The vast majority of Chloe flankers overwhelm me. Not their scent, simply their vastness. Enough already.
- "Nomade" is great, but just not *me*. I feel a bit like an imposter when I wear it despite my enjoyment of it. It smells awesome on a friend on mine, though.

This, though? Love at first sniff. As such, my favourite Chloe fragrance!

I adore the sharp, citrus, tangy opening notes! Neroli is also always a bomb scent, so that helps. I usually struggle with grapefruit, but it's epic here. Or just nicely blended.
The middle notes? Pure bliss. Orange blossom is fresh, sexy, and romantic. I have stephanotis in my garden and it's such an underrated flower. A strong jasmine that isn't...typical? I also get that juicy, fruity peach, and sexy black (under)currant.
When I die, send me home with a woody, floral musk! Fortunately, that's what I get here. A warm, cozy, intoxicating musk with cashmirwood/cashmeran. It would be a crime to not allow cashmeran to shine. It's woody, warm, slightly-vanillic, delightfully musky with hints of nostalgia (for me). Similar to Burberry "Body", the cashmeran invites hugs from your favourite person.

"Love Story" resonates as a gorgeous, romantic, feminine, citrus floral that projects nicely (somewhat surprisingly) and lasts well - not forever, but enough to satisfy. I honestly think the perfume I've smelled that it most closely resembles is Jo Malone's "Honeysuckle & Davana". Do with that what you will.

I feel girly AND womanly. Like I can oscillate between the two all my days.

Repurchase-worthy!

***

Kitty rating: 9/10!

I wore this perfume at my spring wedding. I love the smell, and thought it was perfect for the day. However, it does not last long on me at all, and I fail to smell it after just 20 minutes of wear. Bummed because it's such a pretty smell, but this seems to be the trend with all Chloe perfumes.

There's always something in Chloé fragrances that doesn't captivate me and this one is the same. It feels like it's missing something, but for the price range, it's not so bad. May be a good fit for weddings because of the white florals... I tried it as everyday wear, but it made me sneeze. After a week of trying to love it, I ended up giving it away. Shame since the bottle's so pretty!
Very soft and basic scent. If you want more cheaper one check out Avon's Incandessence perfume. They are the same

Perfume in the same spirit as Joy (by Dior), the only difference is that Love Story is more dosed in white flowers, and the other one is more woody. Frankly, I prefer this perfume to Joy but it didn't captivate my heart as well.
The opening of the perfume is very nice, very fresh, we smell directly the citrus and white flowers. But it becomes a bit boring moments later and the evolution linear.
Despite the fact that it is very heavy in citrus and white flowers, I managed to distinguish the cashmere wood (which I love), and it is perhaps this note that distinguishes it from other floral, fresh and musky perfumes.

Nice scent but not extraordinary!

6.5/10

The longer I’ve been using this, the more I love it.
For me it’s true love with this one! I will continue to re-purchase. It’s an everyday scent. I’ve been wearing it through the entire winter now, and it works just as good as in summer. It’s a clean, fresh, feminine, non-intrusive, elegant scent. It’s sexy in a clean way.
Longevity is good on me, it lasts a whole workday.
This fragrance is lovely when first sprayed ,but unfortunately an hour later and I’m struggling to smell anything. I’m so disappointed.

Went from a neglected bottle in the back of my collection to everyday wear. An uncomplicated, pretty, and very subtle romantic floral that has been lifting my spirits in this Midwestern winter drear. A very complimentary blend of citrus and rose with a touch of pepper-ish cedar which sells this fragrance for me. The patchouli and black currant are hardly noticeable to my nose. Shockingly long-wearing on my skin, around seven hours. My partner's thoughts: "I would like to be stuck on an elevator with someone wearing that."

I absolutely love this scent. I live in a tropical country & whenever i wear this scent, i feel so fresh ! The elements of rosé really shine through & its so good !
It lasts almost 7-8 hours on my skin & I absolutely love how it smells.
One of my favorite for sure !

I'm rating from a travel size dabber. Very subtle and pretty scent. It's so gentle and freshly floral with a hint of clean citrus. The peach and pear add a nice sweetness as it dries down. The musk and woody base notes are definitely detectable but very light, on my skin the patchouli carries it, though that does work for this scent.

The little lock shaped bottle is so cute and fits the romantic scent very nicely, it would be an ideal scent for an afternoon date. It has a very intimate sillage, almost too intimate, I found myself wanting to top it off again right away. Longevity is not great at only 4-5 hours. It's a lovely scent while it lasts though.
Boys love this very much. They said it’s the sexiest scent
Super clean but peachy at the same time, the peach comes through a lot. It's so cute and very simple/subtle
The review below from @Melis.t is exactly how I feel! Disappointing, synthetic, and more patchouli than I anticipated.

This perfume is BEAUTIFUL. It's clean, fresh, with a hint of sweetness to not smell as sharp as the original Chloe. This smells much more feminine and pretty than the OG. Original is more soapy, this one smells like a very expensive , feminine, Parisian classy perfume. If I smelled this on someone I would think they have their life together. This perfume is extremely classy and perfect for any occasion. It instantly puts me in a good mood, don't sleep on this!

I am really disappointed with this scent. Reading the comments I thought this could be my summer wedding fragrance but I found it very synthetic smelling. The opening is very sharp. I usually enjoy citrus opening in fragrances but I can't tolerate this one, it gives me instant headache. And way too powdery for my liking unfortunately.
Very sweet orange blossom-y floral light airy (in a bad way that it doesn’t settle in). Doesn’t smell bad but nothing special.

Chloé Love Story is fresh and light with a beautiful woody dry down. Very feminine and ethereal, angelical almost. It also has a light oldschool vibe, but oldschool in a good way. Very classic smelling. The bottle design is perfect for its content. I somehow feel like, a ghost could wear this. I envision Marilyn Monroe with her natural hair color and a white linen dress, lounging under a tree and smiling. It’s a sunny day and she’s at peace with herself. One moment she’s there, then she’s gone again, but her scent lingers. The name ‘Love Story’ is fitting. Love yourself.
This is beautiful white floral citrusy scent, perfect for spring and summer for the floral lovers out there, it lasts a couple of hours, I love this scent profile, it is addictive to me!

I was given thie perfume and lotion as a set. I'm not the biggest fan as I have had it for some years now and I haven't used it. I'm not moved by this fragrance as it is nothing exciting. It's mainly just floral with some fruity notes thrown in.

I think when this was being developed the mindset was “what is the perfect wedding scent?”
It is a beautiful, classic, feminine floral nothing outrageous or groundbreaking.
I can picture this being Grace Kelly’s wedding scent. Just so elegant. I think the orange blossom really shines here.
It is very faint and light. I would use 2 to 3 sprays with the regular Chloe but this is a 5 spray kinda scent and still very light.

This smells like something a teenager would wear. I blind bought this because I love the bottle design and I got a really cheap find. But it literally smells exactly like ever other above average priced perfume out today. They all blend into one. Maybe it’s me but it reminds me of Voce Viva which I also have (due to being a huge gaga fan). They’re just so generic. Is this what the generation of today wants?!? Give me no 5, Giorgio Beverly Hills, Ysatis, white musk and shalimar anyway. Jeez, I’d even prefer Charlie !

On the tester paper, i loved this! On my skin, very much sweeter, white florals on first spritz. Smells very luxe and feminine, reminiscent of ferragamo type florals but more refined and luxurious. Longevity was about 2.5-3 hours for me, after which sits very close to skin, in a soapy floral manner - still luxe and feminine. Love this, wish it lasted longer. After 5-6 hours, it's gone - it's but a memory...
as much as I love the Chloe by Chloe perfume, I love this Love Story more, it's more fruity and slightly sweeter compared to the Chloe and the longevity is quite strong on my skin
It’s a mature,elegant heavy white florals perfume. I don’t get much of the citrus notes,just white florals. The opening is a little heavy tbh, i like the dry down better.

The epitome of Parisian chic. Smells like an expensive French orange blossom soap. Beautifully clean and sophisticated. The opening can be a little soapy for some, but the dry-down is divine. I feel so feminine and elegant when I wear this fragrance.
This is probably the safest blind buy I've ever smelled. It's a fresh white floral, nothing too special but I do love it. It also makes a great birthday gift!

The opening is beautiful! So feminine and a very good representation of a successful love story. The drydown seems similar to Bal d’Afrique but way better. Is it because they’re both citrus and soapy?

I went through a 1.2ml tester. Lovely fresh floral with some Chloe elegancy. However it misses all woody and powdery that is so present in other Chloe fragrances (I am a proud owner and a fan of Chloe edp and Naturelle). A bit generic, quite synthetic. Great for warm weather. However it is a bit sharp and headache inducing when over sprayed. The latter is a deal-breaker for me sadly.

I love orange blossom and neroli, and I remember liking this when I first smelled it years ago, but now I found it too "perfumey" in the opening, but the drydown is better. I prefer the more natural Jo Malone Orange Blossom, the fresh qualities of TF Neroli Portofino, the exotic notes in JPG Classique amd PdM Safanad. It is pleasant enough, but not what I am looking for in my quest for the perfect orange blossom fragrance. I think I like the EDT more, even though I usually prefer EDPs.

A lighter white floral with a bit of citrus. The lightness gives it a more modern flair than some of the big white floral classics. Smells good quality, but it also smells like a lot of other perfumes. An easy reach. Office safe. For orange blossom and neroli (both famously fleeting) it has good power and endurance. Base notes are in their softest imaginable forms.

retains some of the laundry fresh powdery thing the OG has but without the rose, a touch of fruit- like shampoo, but this is all class. Not cheap at all.

So nice for any occasion. Mellow, inoffensive, clean and a touch warm overall
Extremely feminine and romantic white floral scent, which is exactly what I like.I would like it to last a bit longer, though.

Perfect wedding day perfume. Beautiful traditional orange flower, notes of jasmine baby's breath (stephanotis is a jasmine), and a light muskiness to help make it a little sexy. Lots of grapefruit and lemon and a touch of bergamot up front to keep you fresh. Altogether a very pretty fragrance. Lots to like, nothing to dislike here. Sadly, no cashmirwood or patchouli detectable to my nose. This doesn't really need it, anyway. Although it might last longer if those notes were more pronounced. You'll probably need to top it off again after about five hours.
I think it’s alright. The opening kind of gives me a headache, but the dry down is nice. It’s a simple citrusy scent with white florals imo, nothing special
To me this is just a clean scent, warmer and sweeter than the edt. Probably for the "clean girl" aesthetic, but not really unique or a huge compliment getter.

This actually is my first white floral fragrance in my collection, and it is my favorite for this season of Spring going to Summer. It just smells so beautiful, its as if you are a carefree lady who just beams with grace, freedom, and happiness. The opening when I sprayed it on my skin were fresh, citrus notes, they tingled my sense of smell in the most non-annoying or non-painful way that other perfumes with citrus notes did. It smells clean, soapy, and fresh. The drydown after a few minutes where the white florals that smelled elegant, musky, beautiful. I love the musk here, it does seem to be a mature, and somewhat classic scent, but it is really beautiful, and it justifies its name Love Story. The age preference for this would be young adults to adults.

My favorite of all Chloé fragrances. I decluttered it from my collection several months back because I no longer reached for it, but there was a time it was my most reached for perfume. Especially in the summer. It's really lovely and romantic. I miss it.

I had a sample of this and I loved the initial smell. It really does smell like romance in a bottle! However, because of my warm body chemistry it smells heavy and musky on me. I ended up with the perfumed lotion (which is less intense) because there really is something about this scent that does remind me of a love story. The musk is still prominent in the lotion so at times I smell like a sexy grandma but if you don't mind musk or mature scents, this is a beautiful one to have :)

I got a sentimental thing to this perfume because this is the very first perfume I bought for myself. I got it with my first salary from my internship in my collage years. It was the only perfume that I had for a long time. I'd wear it day and night, summer and winter. I finished 3 full 75 ml bottles of this. I got my 4th now. Right now it's definitely a summer perfume for me. It's citrusy, white floral and musky. I like the pear in this a lot. A very fresh scent. It lasts about 6-8 hours on me.

I love to layer and this is a delightful blend with versace yellow diamond intense. Both can worn on their own but just to make it ever so slightly personalized and longer lasting, I combine the two. You'll recognize the Chloe signature but without the litchi from the original which to me is headache inducing.

Paris, may 2011. You just got asked out on a date! You carry a bouquet of flowers, and a cold, crisps breeze waves past you. Romantic, but in a really fresh way. Smells like real flowers, with the “bitter” notes. You can smell the bergamot clearly.

It is an alright fragrance. That's all I can say about this, maybe it is the Chloe DNA that isn't up my alley, but I don't think it smells as great as the notes conjure it to be. It's not a bad scent, it is just very mediocre. If I smelled this on someone, I would say, yes they smell nice, but in a generic, synthetic floral-y kind of way. This is one of my few blind buys, but since it was on sale for $40 I thought it may be worth a shot, because I am a fiend for fresh citrus/bright floral scents. It's just not for me, especially when there are other better fragrances in my collection... it's a very ALRIGHT perfume.

I love it! I initially love Chloe but then I got to smell this and I realized I prefer this. It's light, floral and sweet. I'd wear this everyday. It's very feminine. Excited to buy the full bottle. The bottle is very lovely and elegant too.

This is a Love Story from the past, there is nothing modern about this perfume. It’s a classic floral and fruity scent that I imagine a young woman in the ‘50s would have worn. Perfectly coiffed, wearing big lucite flower clip earrings, a pastel color cardigan and one of those A shaped skirts, in a color coordinated flower pattern. I like the somehow soapy dry down of this perfume and the woody base notes but it’s too classic and floral for me.

I loved several other Chloe perfumes so I thought I would love this one.

The opening is very heavy citrus & floral, almost headache inducing for me. The dry down tones down on these notes a bit but they're still the dominant notes. I was really disappointed! I was thinking this would be a sweet and deliver floral to match the name "Love Story" but it feels like your typical citrus floral. I washed this one right off.

The times I wore this perfume, I get comments that it smells like a men's perfume instead of a women's. It didn't last long on me and I didn't favour the smell. Although floral, it smells a little bit too musky for me.
its not smell like a love story , it smells like a sweet, delicate, calm , caring , pretty , middle aged mother ;)

Not my taste but I can see someone who can match with this perfume, girls who dress elegantly and in white and floral dresses, exactly like my cousin and this is one of her signatures. Someone who more on casual side like me wearing this is a big confuse.
Opening is incredibly stunning. Fresh jasmine with soft sweet fruity notes. But the dry down turned me off. It smells identical to loccitane’s neroli & orchidee
A clean but so comforting floral. Reminds me of my Nana but this isn't old smelling. Likeable even though I'm not a floral fan.
Boring. It seems no energy was put into this fragrance so I won't put much energy into a review..

i really love this perfume.. it smells feminine and not childish, i really smell the white floral. i dont really like pure floral scent but i like this perfume cuz it smells fresh kinda fruity floral, if you r feminine and prefer not that mature n old scent u might love this one.. it's suitable for day and night, formal and daily so this is worth the money

Unfortunately it reminds me of a perfume I bought in college (Estee Lauder’s Sheer Beautiful), which I never ended up wearing. Something about this one is overly shrill, and the sweet florals are a little too much. On me. I wish it smelled the way I assumed it would after reading reviews, I just didn’t get that when I wore it. It’s not awful. I imagine it would be a good perfume for someone preppy-chic, out and about on a cool morning.
This is beautiful. You can definitely smell the Chloe dna. Very classy and sophisticated. A clean citrus with white florals which i think is great for the work environment. Very pretty scent.
Light, clean, fresh, & rosy. Smells like a lighter version of the original Chloe EDP to me. Wore it after a shower at night & could still smell it on my skin the next morning.
fresh citrus floral, light youthful

Just got my 5ml for testing and turned out great, already put my order for 75ml.
It's smell so good, a light and soft floral. Not regretting trying this smell

Soft, light floral, clean. It feels like a safe choice. It's not attention grabbing - I had to remind myself to keep checking on it. It's a very mellow scent. I'd probably wear this on days where I don't want to think too hard and don't want to stand out too much.
One word, Beautiful. The Love Story is one between you and this perfume. Love the pear that lingers on.

A very light & soft floral that’s safe for the office or even church. That being said, although pretty & fresh and very inoffensive, for me, it’s a little boring. However, it’s important I add that I currently own approximately 100 fragrances and tend to love the eternal longevity & strong silliage fragrances. Love Story is neither. This is great for a shy introvert that doesn’t want to draw attention to themselves. I’ve owned it a few weeks now and this evening is my second wear and I reached to it for a bedtime scent. I highly doubt I’ll repurchase this one, especially since it’s not worth the price tag, in my opinion. It’s OK.

Despite the name I don't see this as a particularly romantic fragrance; it almost smells - for lack of a better word - virginal. It's a very clean and feminine white floral, best for daytime and smells very elegant and prim. There are similarities to the original Chloe but I feel like Love Story has less personality. It's fresher and just a hint sweeter. It smells EXACTLY like a dryer sheet for several hours after spraying, super detergent-y floral with hints of citrus. When it dries down more, the florals shine through the soapiness a little better and I get more of the fruity notes (mostly peach) which lends a hint of sweetness and creaminess. I couldn't figure out what this reminds me of until I read another review saying this smells like Caress Daily Silk - it totally does!! I like Love Story a lot but I'm not sure if it's worth buying because I already have the original Chloe.

Love Story is such a pretty floral fragrance that screams Spring to me. Very feminine. Clean, floral, slightly sweet with a hint of fruit. Inoffensive. A great daytime, cool to warm weather scent in my opinion.

I came to love this fragrance over time. At first it felt to elegant and mature for me. Now I really like it. Directly after applying, the pear is strong and a lot of fruity accords come through. On the drydown mostly the white florals and a delicious hint of the cedar come through for me.

My 2nd bottle from the Chloe perfume line. the first one I have was Chloe EDP which is soooooo amazing. so i decided to blind buy Chloe Love Story which i soooooo love tooo.

Chloe perfumes are not giving me headaches.

I have Chloe Love Story EDP 50ML.

Instantly stunned by the beautiful design of the bottle itself. gold handle topped off with a white ribbon, you couldn't get any more feminine and classy than that.

I love most things that Chloe brings out. I feel its a well put together, classy brand. Owning the bags and glasses, I had to start a Chloe perfume collection going. I own other well reviewed perfumes such as Chanel No. 5 and J'adore Dior, so I was interested to see how a Chloe perfume would live up to standard.

I was pleasantly surprised. It is an extremely classy perfume. Has a slight hint of J'adore Dior resemblance, but different in it's own right. Firstly hit with a slow scent of white floral scents slowly merging into rose powdery blend. It is extremely floral. But for all the right reasons. It is light, bounces off the senses and hits classy in every sense of the word.

It could be worn as a daytime classy fragrance, maybe if you are attending something of importance-or if you just want to feel that extra bit of class, this is the perfume you would go for. It is not powerful and overbearing, just enough to give your senses some pleasure. The longevity is average, it doesn't dissipate quickly, you get a fair bit of time from it, however it does not last forever like some perfumes do. Overall I would reccomend purchasing this if you love a classy, floral scent.
10/10.

Polite and pretty, Love Story is a good office perfume as long as it isn't over-sprayed. It's citrus, white flowers, and warm dryer sheet musk -- very similar to Chloe EDP but more approachable and less hoity-toity Aunt at the family reunion. Sorry, but my fancy seventy year old Auntie loves Chloe. It doesn't get more old-lady approved than that.

Love Story is a less soapy and more subdued alternative to Chloe. The synthetic white musk is way toned down, but still present, and much more wearable. If you can't smell the particular molecule(s) being used as the "white musk" additive, and I know a few people who can't, this perfume may smell very bland...like a bit of citrus and neroli. But trust me, you smell (nice). Haha!
Love it my new perfume 💓💓💓
Pretty scent. Kind of generic white floral, kinda sweet. Smells classy and expensive. Quite inoffensive, in my opinion. I do like it and would wear it, especially on a casual spring day.

Generic white floral. Pleasant, inoffensive, but I wouldn't be able to pick this out of a crowd.

Bad longevity - gone in an hour.
I know J’adore very well and this smells just like that to me.. very unoriginal.

This is probably one of the most GENERIC and BORING perfumes I’ve ever owned. If you already have any floral, mildy sweet and clean perfume you don’t need this one. Trust me.
It smells okay, it’s just a dime a dozen. Also, it doesn’t have that much longevity or sillage so there’s no reason to have this in your collection of you have fragrances with similar notes.

This was a blind buy for me, I needed a replacement for my go-to day perfume (For Her by Karl Lagerfeld) and I thought this one could be a bit similar in a nice fresh floral way. And it was! A perfect feminine everyday scent, very easy to wear. However-- the longevity is quite weak on the skin. I can't smell it on me at all, which is super disappointing. Although it does stay on your clothes for a really long time. I think that it might be one of those perfumes where others can feel the scent but you can't. Would def recommend it if you want a casual floral scent or just want to wear a nice scent at home.

It works really well in combination with other perfumes! I used this one mixed with a vanilla scent the other day (loved it!) and it would probably also be nice mixed with a clean fresh scent to really bring out the crisp citrus if you want.

Too me it's name is true for over time I fell in love with this perfume. It is a soft delicate scent which is quite lovely, appealing to men, my husband loves the scent on my skin. From the opening of soft grapefruit light lemon with pear it's is very pretty, pleasing to the senses, I enjoyed as it developed to the orange and rose, the scents I noticed the most, then to a powdery light musk, with a touch of floral , I was very pleased. It has a 6 hour longevity and if you use the body lotion it will last until the next morning. It has a moderate sillage which I really liked alot. for times you want to be noticed but not make a bold statement.

I tried this because the original Chloe is one of my all-time favorite scents. I also like Chloe Le Fleur and Roses de Chloe. I'm not crazy about Nomade. So-- my first thought on this one was, "wow, that's a lot of jasmine." I love citrus and white floral and roses, so this should be perfect for me. However, I'm not getting much other than the jasmine and orange blossom. It turns a little powdery on the dry down. It's definitely classy and mature, although it doesn't lean "grandma" in my opinion. That said, for me it's just an okay fragrance, which is a surprise, because I expected to be in love with it based on the notes. It's smooth and not cloying or cheap smelling, but it's a little to straight classic on me with not much else going on, so I find it a bit boring. I miss the citrus and rose from the original Chloe that make the floral so watery and fresh smelling in that one. This is more heavy white floral and powder, so I won't be buying this one. I got an 8 ml decant of this, so it has given me several chances to try it, and although I'll use it up, I'm not in love.

Not a fan personally - I got an overpowering rose note immediately to the point I had to scrub it off. This is a sophisticated and mature fragrance, but I don't think it veers into the dreaded Grandma category so many fragrance reviewers label perfumes they hate with. For me, this is not a win because I am not really a huge classic floral, but especially not a huge rose, fan, but if you love a strong rose perfume, this might be a major love for you.

Clean, casual, well put together white floral scent. It starts off quite energetic with the citrus and neroli mix. Calms down to a pleasant and easygoing floral scent that lasts a good 6+ hours on me. On the dry down, it smells quite soapy on me, I'm surprised I don't see lily-of-the-valley listed as a note.

I can see a respectable young lady wearing this effortlessly during the day.

Personally, I've gone through 2+ bottles of this during my university days.

Of the modern Chloe fragrances I have tried, this is the one I like the least. It isn't bad, it just is not nearly as good as any of the others. Love Story is pretty in a slightly generic kind of way, and it does not last very well at all. I had to double check to see if the decant I had was EDT, because I rarely experience such bad longevity from EDP. Chloe fragrances tend to be slightly aloof, but Love Story is so aloof that it just flutters away before you can really fully enjoy it. This would be a fabulous scent in a candle or a body wash where you expect it to be slightly fleeting, but as a perfume, for me, it is not special enough to warrant more than just a decant.

Love Story by Chloé is a decent white floral scent. Moderate sillage, longevity not very good. It smells pretty, but too much like a bunch of other things I already have. I’m starting to understand what the frag snobs mean when they say all of these soft white florals start to run together after a while. There’s nothing particularly unique or remarkable about this one. It’s good, but not great. I would buy it if there weren’t other things in my collection that already smell this way. A safe choice if you’re just looking for an everyday, wear-to-work scent.

I agree with ohmichelle below.
Smells clean to me but a typical Chloe scent, I used these in my twenties and won’t be going back to them any time soon.

Smells similar to the original Chloe, except this one is less sharp, more 'round', dusty, soft, a little less elegant but still elegant.
the person I picture wearing this is the super feminine but low-key classy young lady who stays to herself for the most part. she gets attention because she has a friendly and gentle vibe to her.

it smells pleasant and clean.. but a little uninteresting in my opinion. a good every day scent for the office.

this is nice go-to to have in your collection.
it's definitely not one i would wear on a night out or a date or for brunch mimosas even.

another reviewer said this smells like a pastors daughter... there ya go!

It’s an okay perfume. I wouldn’t remember it as it really blends in with all the rest and I cannot find any element which would stand out (for me at least). It’s nice floral scent tho, and as I’ve got it on a big sale I didn’t mind paying for it but put it this way: I wouldn’t spend the full price on this perfume. However if we get over the price value part, it’s and elegant, light scent, not so powerful but can be felt on the skin quite clearly, wouldn’t be a scent anybody could feel unless they are close close close to you. Nice for spring but can imagine for a perfume all year around due to its softness.

As Love Story dries down and the neroli fades, you get the powdery Chloe DNA. I imagine a corsage tucked in a love letter, pressed between the pages of a favorite book. Love Chloe, also powdery dry, is a little more interesting “read.”

This to me smells like a wealthy (and classy!) woman's perfume that she wears for running errands. I imagine Love Story on someone wearing sunglasses, white linen trousers, a blazer and a handbag that costs more than my monthly salary.

I am not the biggest fan of Chloe perfumes (used to love the one called Love but that's now discontinued), bought a 10 ml rollerball version of this on clearance.

Quite different from most of the perfumes I own, but I do really like it.

Edit: longevity and sillage are no good. If they were better, I would have purchased the full size perfume.

When I first sprayed this I could sense that this one is very very similar to Issey-Miyake pure. Exactly the same for me. Sadly I have bought 75ml and I have Issey-Miyake as well😂 that one stays for long this one does not. Anyway but I like the smell. Very white floraly and fresh.
An okay scent. Nothing spectecular, magnificent but a safe just general office morning scent. Better with layering.

I like it a lot but I particularly love the opening (that is quite long lasting for an opening) when the neroli is the star of the show 😍

If you like Aqua Allegoria Nerolia Bianca from Guerlain, try Love Story.
Long-lasting elegant everyday scent. Not too over powering

The opening is fresh, powdery and floral. Smells a bit like laundry detergent, to be honest, but the drydown is a pleasant soft and slightly sweet floral. Like a nice shower gel.
Lovers of Chloe fragrances will also like this one.
Final note: 6/10

I got this perfume by mistake, i ordered the original love, chloe which is now discontinued and received this instead. Then, i planned on wearing it as my office perfume as i could not return. I tested it out for a couple of days and all i can keep smelling is heavy sweet citrus citrus citrus which i did not like at all ( My taste leans more towards powdery, clean, fresh, woody scents). I did not smell any of the floral/rose/clean/jasmine notes mentioned above nothing. Not one time and i went through an entire bottle. IRONICALLY everyone and literally everyone at work complemented me everyday on this perfume and asked what i was wearing. A guy once said please stop wearing it or else ill follow u all day long. I went through a whole 75ml bottle just because how much people liked it on me yet i did NOT. do i reccomend this ? Mayeb. Will i buy it again? Nope 😂😂 i just dont know how this perfume projected on me in a way people loved it but my nostrils hated.
too citric for my stomach..but.. a nice romantic..french floral scent ...

A beautiful scent that can stand on its own even if it is compared to other perfumes. It’s actually an underdog because it’s floral, fresh and nice for the summer. A good perfume for women in their 20’s.

White floral, yes, but I do catch the rose quite clearly. Citrus as well. I don't find it as sweet as some have mentioned despite the many fruit notes. It certainly is not sweet compared to some of the gourmands and sugary-sweet perfumes out on the market. After several hours wearing it, it doesn't really develop or evolve into anything different. It is what it is when you spray it on and I still smell it clearly the next morning. The bottle is very nice. I like the padlock design as a nod to the bridge in France where people put the locks.

My review will certainly not add anything new here, because there is not much to say about this composition. Romantic? For me, romanticism does not smell trivial, and this is how it is and if I did not know that it is a respected Chloe brand, I would bet on Avon, which already says everything in itself. This fragrance is simply weak and not worth the price. Everything here is so pretty, subtle, charming, girlish, but at the same time yawning boring and forgettable. There is the freshness of white flowers with the lightness of cedar and musk, but that in my opinion does not smell love. None. Well, possibly such a youthful infatuation, not very serious, which passes very quickly, just like the whole smell. My biggest complaint is that nothing is happening here, nothing attracts attention, because there is no time, the parameters are poor. Scent, which was created for unknown reason.

Clean, fresh, nothing offensive. Something you can wear when you want to offend nobody with your perverse tastes :D I get no neroli (thankfully) nor the soapy feel (also good in my books) just lots of white florals and touch of fresh juicy fruits (none of which are really discernible) This would make a great gift for someone feminine and conservative about their daily wear.

I enjoyed my samples of Love Story. Its so clean and fresh and soapy to me. Ive read comparisons to laundry detergent and I agree. Its inoffensive. Sometimes I steer away from wearing because it is very sweet and girly. I pick up neroli pear and musk. I reached for this most at the end of the day after showering and putting on pajamas.

I could not for the life of me figure out what this perfume reminded me of. I finally figured it out. It’s Caress Daily Daily Silk, fancied up. That must mean to my nose this perfume is predominantly orange blossom and peach. The drydown is a sweet, clean musky orange blossom. I’m somewhere in the middle on this perfume - I adore the drydown, and am somewhat less enthusiastic about the top notes. I highly recommend for women who love soapy clean scents with an intimate level of silage. This is not a powerhouse, but does have its own gentle tenacity that hugs the skin for the majority of the day. The name and beautiful bottle convinced me to take this perfume home, so we will see if she has a permanent place in my collection.

Very sweet and very flowery, perfect for daily use, for school, office, etc. It's not like super long lasting, but it definitely lasts longer than the usual perfumes. I loved it from the second I smelled a sample

This is a very dainty, ladylike, demure scent. Not the most distinctive or the craziest, but there is nothing wrong with that. This isn't meant for tweens or a younger demographic either, the way Marc Jacobs Daisy + all of its flankers are (no disrespect meant, either, because I get the appeal of sweet, fresh scents that don't pose too much of a mature, grown up aura for the wearer to have to live up to).

It's not as sharp or cloying as the original revamped Chloe (while it is pretty and very clean and soapy smelling, the strong carnation overwhelms the scent at one point, and seems to take over and invade my nostrils). Admittedly, I really like white florals, but I am aware that this is not the most popular sentiment. A lot of complaints I seem to hear about a lot of perfumes is about the headiness of the white florals, or how cloying or heavy they are. I always loved white florals because of how romantic and sweet they smell, while evoking the scent of summer.

This is a very clean, soapy, floral, inoffensive scent. When it is sharp when first sprayed, it is not too sharp, but just crisp. During the drydown, it becomes softer. This would make a lovely bridal scent--very sweet, romantic, and gentle but not overbearing or overwhelming at all.

It might be worth noting that I don't have a very sophisticated nose. I try to keep an open mind and my poorly concealed guilty pleasure is cheap celebrity scents. But this is nothing to turn your nose up at (no pun intended). Clean, pretty, not too showy or ostentatious, while having a bit of soapy sophistication that others may consider bland fodder for department store counters. To each their own, I suppose. I understand why others would see this as boring, but I see it more as being "classic". This is something you could wear when you want to be taken seriously--first thing I thought of was that this was something the wife of a well to do businessman would wear to a work function. It's not controversial and doesn't cause tongues and fingers to wag disapprovingly--of course, if that's what you want in a perfume, you probably already know that Chloe Love Story isn't for you. I think it's perfect for the workplace if you spray very sparingly (on me personally, Chloe scents tend to get very strong, so I just go with one spritz).
Love in a bottle <3

ooooh i Love this CHLOE Love story, why i didn't buy it before. i love it since very first spray. i am huge fan of CHLOE EDP and i love it also..if you love clean, soapy and not too overpowering perfume you must give a try this
Love this perfume. It’s a perfect combination of citrus and floral notes. It has some sweetness to it but not overwhelming. Smells very fresh and clean.

Starts off smelling very similar to Chloe EDP with the loud sparkling white florals and then turns sugary with the exact same sharp sugary sweetness that's in Armani Acqua Di Gioia. I knew I recognized that smell from somewhere!! And I racked my brains trying to figure it out. The florals continue and have an almost realistic quality to them like the lily in Cartier Bassier vole.

I love this perfume! I’m a huge Chloe fan and this one does not disappoint. It’s a soft, sweet, sparkling, clean scent. I get hints of green tea, florals, and a bit of sweetness. It’s soft, but long lasting. The beginning is a bit generic, but once it settles into your skin, it’s total bliss!

When I test it for the first time, I smell it so good on me. I can recognize the flower scent but after some moments using it I don't smell it on me any more. The perfume smells so good but I think it does not last for longtime.
I dont really love the cedar but i will try again in cool weather.

I just bought a 50ml bottle, and I'm in love! I do agree that it's kind of generic, but it still has that Chloé DNA. It's slightly more soapy than the other Chloés, though. It has a ton of white flowers and kind of has an expensive lotion scent (maybe because of the peach note). The sillage is so soft; it's very intimate—only people close to you will smell it. The longevity is good; it lasts 5-6 hours and even lingers after I've washed my hands or taken a shower. I can't wait to give it a proper wear!

I CAN'T GET ENOUGH OF CHLOE LOVE STORY!!!!! It smells so good. I know that I sometimes over spray because, I want to smell myself - always. Sillage and longevity are very good. My assistant once told me that, even when I'm minutes gone from the office, she can still feel my presence, because my scent lingers in the room.

The scent is ladylike, sweet, and I love the flowers in it. This is love at first smell. It's a little bit expensive, but so worth it.

Probably my favorite spring/summer perfume for everyday wear. I reviewed this over a year ago rather unfavorably, but have since changed my mind and ended up purchasing a bottle about a month ago. I have quite a few fragrances in my collection that I designate for this time of year - Chloe EDP, Gucci Bamboo, Marc Jacobs Daisy, Miss Dior Blooming Bouquet, and more. Love Story is the one I find myself reaching for most. Simply put, it is a very pretty, very feminine floral fragrance.

The initial citrusy blast didn't make a large impression on me, but you really have to *wear* this perfume to get the whole gorgeous picture. Once the sharpness of the initial spray passes, you get a beautiful, fresh floral bouquet sweetened subtly with fruity notes. The drydown is my favorite part - a warm, comforting, and sexy mix of woods and musk.

I do wish it had the performance of Chloe EDP. I wouldn't say it's weak in sillage or longevity, but I think it could be better. I usually have to reapply once or twice during the day, unlike Chloe EDP which goes strong for 12+ hours.

Many retail websites that sell this (Macy's, French Sephora, etc.) are reporting that this perfume has a physalis/cape gooseberry note. I tracked down the original Fragrantica article for this from 2014 and the notes list is significantly shorter. On the Chloe website the notes are:

"A fresh floral fragrance
Top: neroli
Heart: orange blossom, stephanotis jasmine
Base: cedar wood"

(Stephanotis being a type of jasmine)

Anyway has anyone noticed the physalis/cape gooseberry note? I just bought it but I'm covered in all sorts of other perfume fro the store so I'm not really going to be able to truly sit down and test it until tomorrow... (at which point I'll probably delete this and write a proper review...)

I'm very surprised to read descriptions here to the effect that this is a 'fierce' white floral, or that it contains 'overwhelming' musk. To me it is a gentle unobtrusive fragrance having an effect on the surrounding persons at most a sweetening ambience. I think I am just not acutely sensitive to any of it's constituents; but I'll leave a discussion of the nature of that sensitivity to the forum, or I run the risk of repeating myself. No-one I have come across has complained about it, but I think even if any of them are sensitive to the ingredients I don't think they are likely to perceive it as at all actually shocking or any such thing. And I've been enjoying it all day for what I perceive it to be: a sharpish (yes I do get the orange-blossomy-ness of it) floral, not at all sweet, except insofar as it is sweetened and enriched by the musk, which I do indeed perceive as an 'enricher', but by no means as an overwhelming aroma in its own right. I could even say it comes across as a little aqueous at times. And woodiness - yes, some of that there ... everything moderate and balanced, to my perception anyway.

Love Story is a green, woody, musky, white floral. It is a delight. I was captivated at first whiff. It reminds me of a fireflies at dusk, walled gardens with ivy, and the heady, humid days between spring and summer. It has a bit of grassy green to balance out the white floral. Projection is strong, too. It is a staple in my wardobe and I hope it never gets discontinued.

A beautiful orange blossom fragrance...wow! I really adore Chloe perfumes.. from the heady older Lagerfeld ones to the new fresh florals. I just could not believe it when I tried this.. utterly gorgeous. My new favorite orange blossom for sure, pushing aside Armani Code. The ginger ended up ruining that one for me.

This is luscious orange blossom haze blooming on a warm summer afternoon. For me that's always been a romantic and sensual scent, so I find this fragrance aptly named. And what is more beautiful than a love story? Even the bottle is gorgeous in its simplicity with the little handle and ribbon on top!

My new go-to sunny summer day scent.. what a fabulous blind buy!!

I am not a fan of floral bouquet perfumes, preferring those that focus on one or two floral notes. I am also not a fan of most anything soapy. I must admit that I didn't have high expectations for this, but I am searching for a perfect summer neroli/orange blossom and had to give it a try.

This is much better than I expected. The orange blossom is clear and stands out from the Rose and jasmine. The fruit noes are subtle and with the cedar and musk give depth and keep the scent from becoming prissy. There are some clean soapy notes as it settles, but noting that overtakes it and makes it unpleasant.

I'll be revisiting this in warmer weather.
It disappeared from my skin practically after a few minutes. Not for me.

Reminds me of Y.Rocher's Muguet des Bois (1998), that was oddly foggy / kind of musky.

Resembles also not-so-goodsmelling (or old) deodorants, or basics of liquid-soaps.
(The EdT, for one, is much better - clean.)

Quite citrus, bergamot, musk with some white floral. Somewhat bitter. I don't perceive this perfume as related to love or romantic. Rather it's just fun, on movement, lightweight perfume. Almost sport type. Would be great for hot summer.

I have this, and was going to offload it but then thought twice about it.

Neroli and Orange Blossom are two notes that immediately evoke SUMMER to me, even if they aren't trying, and there's no reason that shouldn't be the case here. Upon further wearing, this brings to mind gentle linen laundry hanging on a line to dry in the French country side. It makes me think of that pink clay and the California-like natural scenery. I'm sure other perfume do this image much better, but there are no actual identifiable flaws in Lovestory. Quaint fun for when you need it.

I was given this as a Sephora sample and didn't think much of it until we were going on a summer vacation and I packed the teensy trial bottle in my makeup case as an afterthought. by the time I got back home I was shopping in Sephora for the rollerball size. Just a lovely, light, yet romantic fragrance to wear while dining on a hot summer evening.
It's not that this necessarily smells bad-it's just something that, on me, smells like something my grandmother would wear. If I ever buy a bottle it would be for her and not me.

This perfume is very feminine, romantic and floral. It has an exquisite beauty. It gives a feeling of cleanliness and optimism.

Sillage: 7/10
Longevity: 8/10

*****

Este perfume es muy femenino, romántico y floral. tiene una belleza exquisita. Da sensación de limpieza y optimismo.

Sillage: 7/10
Longevidad: 8/10
The drydown of this smells just like a cashmere sweater, and the opening is all powdery orange to me. It comes together to be a velvety, sunny golden color.

Another blind buy ( I just couldn't resist a gamble) after reading favourable fragrantica reviews.... Reminiscent of Chloe eau de Fleurs Neroli but much much softer, creamier and well rounded. Really nice once the pungent floral (jasmine/white flower) opening settles and you get beautiful fresh clean citrus. I don't find it sweet at all. Very easy to wear. Another great Chloe fragrance.

Sweet, romantic, very very feminine, this kind of fragrances I find men are so fond of!!
for my taste its super sweet, but even though I have to admit I was back and forth deciding whether to buy it or not!!

performance: 8/10
sillage & longevity: good
uniqueness: 6.5/10

This is one of those "oh wow" surprise fragrances that drives my desire to collect and try. The Neroli and orange blossom are pleasantly floral atop the fruitier notes and it just works. I have some perfumes I love because they are complex and deep and they come out occasionally as the mood strikes. Then I have perfumes like this that make me happy all the time. I can't stop sniffing my wrist!!! And it's ok for work, workout etc. Someone mentioned this as a wedding fragrance. I can see that. It's truly beautiful.

I really don't like this fragrance I get laundry detergent then the dry down of the cedar and patchouli makes me sick.I can see why many love it as its soapy clean, classy and safe.The bottle and the ad are all lovely.I was given this as a gift its a shame I just can't wear it as it gives me a headache.

I LOVE this perfume. It's very light and oh so pretty. If I see that a scent is described with neroli and orange blossom I know I've found my scent. I'm typically not a fan of Chloe perfumes but THIS one is the best thus far. It's such beautiful,light and feminine scent.

Very feminine merge of fruits and florals. Just intense enough without being overwhelming. Beautiful neroli dominates. This one is for daytime-- out shopping and stopping at an elegant spot for afternoon tea.

This is such a pretty and romantic fragrance. The opening is citrusy neroli, the middle notes are white florals and rose, and the base is a soft musk. I find it intoxicating and fresh at the same time. Very feminine. Very beautiful.

I’ve had this for a very long time, and I think the scent has changed a little. The sweet top notes like orange have nearly gone, and the sour herbal notes have intensified, like clary sage and rosemary. The neroli is still STRONG, and it is a very pleasing, beautiful fragrance. Kinda smells sad, like tears of a maiden.

I had this YEARS ago (2015 and I THINK it was discontinued way back THEN! ) Shortly after -- I got rid of it because I recall it being "too perfume-y". Over a period of time I realized that , I now LOVE "too perfume-y" ! So I lamented over this and even ROMANTICIZED it (possibly a bit too much now).
I spotted an unused TESTER on ebay for a very reasonable price (more reasonably than people who are selling the discontinued Chloe Narcisse ! That's for SURE!) . I just opened this up from the mail a half hour ago. The one thing I totally forgot was how SWEET & SOAPY this was. Not a bad thing , I had just remembered this wrongly. Once this dries down - things get MUCH better and the neroli part , although NOT the star of the show - trickles enough to remember why I bought this. I am happy with my re-purchase and she shall never leave me again. This is a nice composition by a very stable house. And you do get the vibe that this is "cousin" to Chloe Narcisse as well . Safe blind buy BUT only if you like smelling the big jumbo Neroli soap bars from Marshalls & T.J. Maxx (and I mean that in a GOOD way for a change). Longevity is very good / above average and this perfume has a nice "body": to it. All plusses. It's discontinued - but you can still get a fair deal on it . The cap is very heavy !

It's gonna be summer soon, and I was craving my summery scents. Reached for Chloe Eau de Fleurs Neroli yesterday and could not stop sniffing myself with glee for this beautiful eau.

Neroli always reminds me of the old 80s Coppertone, which has really positive memories for me, playing on the beach in the summer. My other favorite neroli scents are simplistic ones; the Jo Malone Neroli, and 4711 Original Eau de Cologne. I don't like to layer it with anything; I take my neroli "neat," like my whiskey.

I get some of the other notes in this scent. Orange, yes. Maybe a little Tonka and Amber, but the Peony is very subtle if I do smell it. And the others, I'll take their word for it, but they lost in the mix as far as my nose can tell. Regardless, it's just lovely to me, and I adore it! It's a feminine scent to me, so I think the other notes in this blend are definitely doing their work to support that femme vibe. I have definitely experienced neroli on the masculine side, like the TF version, and even 4711 I mentioned above, leans masculine to me. But Chloe's is definitely feminine.

All that said, while it's a sweet and beautiful scent, it's not outlaw sexy, but it definitely CAN be sexy, if the wearer feels and acts sexy. For example, I feel happy and pretty when I put this on, and that positivity/confidence lends itself to sexy. But do I feel turned on by it, and ready to pounce on man meat like I do when I wear my TF Tobacco Vanille or F-Fab? No. If I wear my Chloe Neroli and have a drink, or put on sexy clothes and lipgloss, will I feel just as sexy as the TF scents? Hell yes. So it's what you do with it.

If you're looking for a classic pretty scent, this works on that level too. And it is long lasting in my experience, which is a great bonus!

Enjoy!

What a wonderful discovery this Eau de Fleurs Neroli da Chloé, my Father in heaven! I was able to have a dejavú added as soon as it touched my skin, because I associated it in an identical way to two fragrances that I used a lot in my childhood and I have no problem, related to shame, in revealing them, they are: Mithus Colony Morning and Colony Contouré. Daydream, chimera, love!

A scene came to mind right at the opening ... A 7-year-old girl, sitting on a swing on a spring morning, with a fabric ribbon tied in her hair, cradling herself near a garden that drinks from a stream that it runs smoothly. In other words, Neroli's innocent and clean touch is capable of causing feelings that we don't even know how to deal with.

I felt Rosemary in the dry down, along with Neroli and the power of Peony, which beside Camellia, are my flowers of life. The scent of a clean woman, of a secret place, of peace, zero problems and a perennial paradise is transmitted in the middle of this perfume. There are times when using it we find ourselves silly standing in time idealizing infinite things related to the practice of good! LOL

In the base notes it has musk of light and a subtle resinous touch, with more the presence of Neroli in stalk, leaves and core, and none other than Peony in lush petals, sublime this aroma! I am surprised because even the fragrance after drying is somewhat intimate, in me Eau de Fleurs Neroli fixed for more than 10 h, bravely resisting an intense bath with Phebo soaps!

I adore neroli, it’s definitely one of my favourite notes. I love the smell of an orange orchard after a rainfall when the air feels HEAVY with the haunting notes of mock orange blossom. Since falling in love with Narcisse Noir about 35 years ago, I haven’t found anything that comes close to that intense abundance of a field with flowering murraya.

Oh...this sounds like a segue into a confirmation that Chloe’s Eau de Fleurs Neroli is the long lost holy grail. No it isn’t, but it’s still a very acceptable Neroli, especially when it dries down a tad, and it lingers pretty well. It’s a sweet mock orange happening here, fresh and vibrant, makes you feel zesty enough to take on the day.

Bought this blind because I love neroli and generally enjoy Chloe fragrances. Very fresh but slightly sharp citrus blast at first. Longevity and silage are both below average for me. Even though I like it I find it a bit one dimensional. I like to spray it over Bodyshop Shea body whip. The two smells complement each other nicely. Smells more rounded and creamier that way.
